review.title: Historic Hotel Not Well Maintained
review.reviewText:
The overall experience was less than desirable. If I would have known how bad the location was before I booked, I would have chosen a different one. But, that is not on the hotel.

The parking for the hotel was located in the back where they do not have enough room for anything. We had to wait several times just to be able to drive out. The hotel smelled very musky as we walked in. The furniture was extremely dirty along with the walls and carpet. As we checked in, we were notified there was a $38 a night fee for parking our rental car. When we check out we noticed there was another $5 on top of that for taxes. I could have gotten a much better hotel had I known I was going to be paying an additional $126. 

After we checked in, we went up to our room on the 5th floor. We exited the elevator and really taken aback from the condition of the hotel. The carpet was rippled (bad) and it was really dark. We walked down to our room, almost tripping over the carpet and having a very hard time getting our heavy luggage to roll over it. We opened the door and it was basically what you would expect from a historic hotel. The additional problems started after.

The shower barely put out any water, the internet was nonexistent (but advertised), limited plugs in the room. There was typically only one or two elevators running, The day we checked out, we had to wait for 20 minutes for one to come to our floor. 

I will never go back.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything. Cleaning the carpets, update the showers, fix the elevators, warn people about the location.
review.locationRemarks: It is horrible. We walked two blocks to eat breakfast and saw a guy shoot up, a guy smoking crack or meth, & a dealer. The homeless are out of control

review.title: A grand hotel in decline
review.reviewText:
This was my third time staying at the Whitcomb in six years, after a three or four year gap. In those three or four years there has been a notable decline: the front desk was under staffed, carpeting in the hallways has come loose in large wrinkles and folds (a tripping hazard that interferes with rolling luggage too), a layer of dust and grime had built up for weeks in our bathroom (which had a strangely antique toilet like something from a 19th century prison), and on our second to last night we saw a mouse. The elevators also seemed to be overtaxed and slow; I don't know if any were out of service at the time, but on more than one occassion we (and other guests staying on our floor) found it faster to take the stairs than to continue waiting for another full elevator to arrive.

The area immediately around the Whitcomb has also worsened: homeless people living in tents, getting in fights, and doing hard drugs, all within steps of the door. During our stay the exterior glass door to the Starbucks in the lobby was shattered in an incident with a drunk homeless person. There isn't anything the hotel can do about the economic hardship facing the city, but security could be stepped up.

Interesting atmosphere inside the hotel lobby....ate in the bar restaurant off lobby and will admit the food was very good.  Try Sam's Diner across the street for best breakfast/brunch around!   Good location in the town, but noisy at night.  Once done, no return!

review.title: Historic hotel, poorly maintained!
review.reviewText: Location is not great except for the nearby new Twitter building where you have a convenient market. Overall, the building needs serious remodeling. It was depressing at times. The size of the rooms and especially the bathroom was ridiculously small. The shower was horrible. The water temperature kept shifting from either burning hot to ice cold. At night, it was very noisy. Out of four elevators, only two were working, and they were always full. Only two bath sized towels per room. Cleanliness was also an issue. Although, the sheets and towels were clean, the carpets and drapes looked very dusty.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of rooms and bathrooms, shower water temp, noise reduction windows, elevators, more towels, new carpets and drapes.
review.locationRemarks: The Market in the Twitter building, Basil Thai Restaurant nearby.

review.title: Older Hotel w/out the frills.
review.reviewText: Convenient location off of the BART line. Comfortable bed but construction going  on next door so the noise started about 5 am. Only 2 of the 4 elevator cars working so the waits were up to ten minutes. No coffee pot in the room so you are forced to go to Starbucks in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator fixed

review.title: It could be a great hotel if it upgraded
review.reviewText:
No Load and unload in front of the hotel (or for that fact anywhere)

Information about valet parking not clear.

Valet parking hidden, not present at the front of the hotel.

First night was horrible, Air Conditioner horrifically noisy(extremely loud, we had a neighbor complain to us about it) loose outside stairs creating constant metal against building banging.  No power outlets other than bathroom to charge devices, toilet not even water saver. I was shocked at that - especially in a drought condition space.

No ramp from valet parking to hotel back entrance.  No hotel staff to help carry luggage up from valet parking service.

Even after moving us to another room, bathroom window did not close, door couldn't close all the way.

Check-in staff was awesome.  When we went to request our air conditioner to be looked out or new room, hotel desk clerk was very rude, instead of helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Closeness to the Moscone, closeness to cool resturaunts, in and out privs for parking.  Parking price - awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: The Hotel facilities.  Invest in some energy efficient air conditioners, water saving toilets,  outlets in the rooms for recharging devices.

review.title: It was from disappointing to horrifying experience
review.reviewText:
Hotel is old and outdated. It is definately not worth the money to stay in this dump.  The reasons are: 
1. Old, smelly, and dark rooms, hallways, and bathrooms.
2. There are many homeless people hang out in front and around the hotel who can be aggressive and intrusive toward guests of the hotel.
3. The Burger King across the street in front of the hotel is more like a "danger zone" - enter Burger King at you own risk to be harassed by some homeless people doing obscene gestures and filthy language.
4. The doormen/guards may ask you for tips when just assisting you with small things - as they are supposed to do.
5. Over all, this was one of the worst hotel experience that I ever had; next to the experience that I was rubbed in Guanacaste, Costa Rica once.
review.positiveRemarks: The location in downtown San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything practically could be and needs to be improved if they want to stay in hotel business.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location in downtown San Francisco and convenient distance to transportation and attractions.  However, watch out for the homeless people.

review.reviewText: This was a nice old hotel in a reasonably good spot. the only negative really was that the shower was terrible.

review.title: Good Location -Victorian Ambiance
review.reviewText: If you like Victorian style hotels the Whitcomb fits the bill.  Very convenient to BART and the downtown trolley line. Rooms are large. We had a great view of city hall lit up at night.  The pillows were not good but the rest of the bedding was good.

review.title: Nice hotel but not without issues
review.reviewText: The best things about this hotel are the location (Market Street), the price, and the friendly staff. The hotel restaurant is also quite good. The BIGGEST downer was the shower which literally trickled. I had a better wash using the bathroom sink. The toilet paper dispenser was falling off of the wall, and the noisy bathroom vent smelled bad. It was VERY noisy when I was there because of very loud, early-morning construction next door. There were also not many electrical outlets in the room, and the ones that were there were inconveniently located. The wifi is weak, and their 4 elevators are VERY slow. While Market Street is a great "jumping-off" location for tourists, there are a LOT of homeless people in the area, many of whom seem to have severe mental health issues as they go up and down the street. I am VERY sympathetic to their plight, but at times at night the area felt a little dangerous. All things considered, the hotel is popular, and there were a lot of guests staying there during my visit. I would think carefully before staying there again (but I'm not saying "no").
review.positiveRemarks: The location (Market Street), the price, and the friendly staff. I had 3 great breakfasts at the hotel restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower water pressure was substandard. Also needs MUCH better wifi, better electrical plugs, lower noise level, and faster elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Market Street is a great place to be as a tourist since it's right in the middle of things. Watch for a LOT of homeless people in the area though.

review.title: Ok hotel ,good location
review.reviewText: We stayed for three nights we leave in early moning and came so late the romm beside us people are so noisy talk so loud seems too many males taking in same time

review.title: Wayyyyy Overpriced!
review.reviewText: Plain Hotel, no fridge or microwave.  All sockets in room were ruined and plugs would just fall out.  Beds uncomfortable and rooms were cramped.   Will not stay there ever again.  One of the people at the service desk was very rude.

review.title: Good Hotel Bad Circumstance
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is quite nice. It's a historic hotel so you're going to be surrounded by an old school vibe. The rooms are cute and the bed (while it didn't LOOK cozy) was very comfortable. I liked the hotel overall, my only complaint is out of the hotel's control. The area that this hotel is in is not only uncomfortable, but dangerous. I used to live in San Francisco so I understand you'll have a more city vibe no matter where you go but this place was bad. We stayed in this hotel because we were going to a comedy show at the Civic Auditorium down the street and wanted to be able to walk but if we weren't going somewhere so close, I would not stay here. The day after the comedy show my husband and I decided to walk to breakfast and after walking barely a block and a half down the street we ended up on a street littered with actual needles along the sidewalk and groups of homeless people doing drugs in the open and yelling at us. We continued down the street until one of the men broke off from the group and started following us yelling at us about being there. I don't particularly want to stay in a hotel where I feel uncomfortable stepping out the front door.
review.negativeRemarks: See Review
review.locationRemarks: See Review

review.title: Well located Hotel.
review.reviewText:
We decided to stay in that location so we could ride the bus to most of the touristic places that San Francisco has to offer. It was a great choice. But, the room smells really bad. I was looking for my earring on the floor, and I found a plastic nail... 
The worst part is when you try to shower, you barely have water pressure in that shower! 
I don't think that I would be staying at this hotel again. Like I said great location,not so good rooms.

review.title: Historic, elegant hotel in the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText: Our family very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Whitcomb!
review.positiveRemarks: The elegant, historic feel of the hotel was great!
review.negativeRemarks: Our internet connection (on the 4th floor) wasn't working in the room.  We had to go out in the hallway to make it work.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located a convenient distance from most anything you'd want to do or see in San Francisco.

review.title: Bed bugs and poor service
review.reviewText:
At 2:00 am on July 3, 2016 my 15-year old son woke me up saying he had found a bug in his bed and showed me pictures he had taken with his phone. 

I got out of my bed, pulled back the pillow and found an adult bed bug on the back side of my pillow as well as what appeared to be rust-colored “crumbs” surrounding the pillow area.  When I went to brush the “crumbs” away, the sheets became smeared with blood.  At that time, I called the front desk about the bed bugs and the response was “Well, ma’am, I’m not a bug expert.”  I replied that I wanted another room immediately and a key to room 675 was promptly brought up and silently handed to me at the door.  No one apologized for our inconvenience nor were we even offered help to move our things to the other room.  
The following morning we checked out two days early from our 3-day reservation.  The clerk didn’t inquire about our stay or why we were departing early.  When I told him we were leaving early because of our problem with bed begs he simply replied “oh”.  When I asked for at least a discount on the room, I was told that only management could make that sort of change and no one was there who could help me.  I paid $183.00 and we left.  

Now both my son and myself have literally hundreds of bites and have been to seek medical help because the bites are so severe, impacting sleep and causing fever and allergic reactions. 

I've stayed in hundreds of hotels throughout my career and have never had such an atrocious experienc
review.locationRemarks: The location looks great online, but it is actually super sketchy with limited restaurants nearby.

review.title: Wrong room
review.reviewText: We reserved a two bed room and they changed it even though we told them not to...then from 2:30 to 3:15 a.m. there were people talking loudly outside our room. Overall it was a dank disappointing experience in a beautiful setting.

review.locationRemarks: We were there for the Hasting Law school graduation at the Bill Graham center so it was perfect.  No need to rent a car, Bart was close.

managementResponses.response: Elaine, thank you for your feedback! We are happy to hear you had a wonderful stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Warm and friendly.
review.reviewText: This beautiful vintage hotel was on Market street with trolley, bus, and cab at the front door.  The taxies were very affordable. We are seniors and rode the trolley to fisherman's wharf and the ferry terminal for $1 and got transfers that made it possible to get on and off all day.  It was marvelous.  The staff at the hotel was wonderful and the Market Grill, in the hotel, is some of the best food ever with white table clothes, music from the '30s, and a gracious staff.  The hotel furnishings are a bit warn but comfortable.  Hopefully they don't try to modernize that but keep the atmosphere authentic.  The building is marble, old woods and crystal chandeliers. We loved the hotel and San Francisco.  Mild temperatures, fog in the a.m. and spectacular sun in the afternoon.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps reupholster some of the furniture in the lobby and newer beds.  The beds were very comfortable but obviously old.
review.locationRemarks: We had accessibility inexpensively to everything we needed to reach.

managementResponses.response:
Jonny,

Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear you were able to get around the city conveniently.

review.title: Don't ever stay here
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights. It was so horrible. We considered leaving the first night but they wouldn't let us out of our reservation. The neighborhood was sketchy, homeless people everywhere, there was no parking unless you wanted to pay the hotel $40 per night. Seriously? They basically force you because they know there aren't any options in the area. The person checking us in was in robot mode, clearly he had heard all the complaints a million times, he didn't even try to sound sympathetic. If I wanted to pay an extra $80 for my stay I would have gotten a better hotel. The room itself was dated and borderline dingy. The carpets looked original, I didn't want to take off my socks. One plus was that the sheets seemed clean. As if that isn't an expectation... My poor husband didn't get any sleep, there was construction that started at 2 am and didn't stop. It was miserable. Oh and the toilet tool like six flushes to completely drain, gross. Just get ready to pay a fee for everything, want to park- pay, want a fridge- pay, want to get out of your reservation because of 2 AM construction-pay, oh and don't forget to pay the tourism tax. Ugh.

managementResponses.response:
Valued Guest,

review.title: Staff will go above and beyond for you
review.reviewText:
I stayed here with my parents between May 5 and May 9. My mom booked the hotel, but I'm writing this review on behalf of the family. We had a wonderful experience. In particular, we had an issue with the room, and management was extremely attentive to our concern. The staff was just as responsive. Every time I had a question, someone at the front desk was able to answer, or to research an answer if one wasn't immediately available, and I always felt welcome with every interaction I had. 

In fact, when I mentioned that my parents were in town for my college graduation, the staff was authentically congratulatory, as if they were extended family. Kevin, one of the management personnel, even knocked on our door to relay well wishes. When I apologized for the messy condition of our room -- we had just checked in, and our suitcases were open and our clothes were strewn about -- he said with a chuckle, "You're just being a family." I really appreciated this warm detail.

One of my concerns about staying at a San Francisco hotel was bedbugs. Management went out of its way to assure us that their hotel takes great care in keeping their rooms bedbug-free. In fact, Kevin and one of the housekeeping leads took us on an inspection of the room before we settled in. I really appreciated and felt humbled by this extra effort. It just goes to show you that if you have a concern and that you are able to establish reasonable dialogue, management and staff will do everything they can for you.
review.positiveRemarks: There's a Starbucks on site. It is open early and closes late. If you have an early day of sightseeing, you don't have to go far for a quick bite.
review.negativeRemarks: This is hotel is designated as a historic property.. That said, I do wish there were some upgrades, like actual switches instead of chains for lights.
review.locationRemarks: The area is gritty but not dangerous. Just be aware. Dining options are paltry, but Union Square is not far -- one metro stop, or a few blocks walk.

review.title: Did not get what we were promised
review.reviewText: This is my second review because I had two rooms reserved. Prior complaint was long check-in lines and staff that did not respond to our needs. Room key did not work for my mom's room twice when we returned after a long day. Called the main desk 8 times and let the phone ring over and over again, but no one would answer. Finally had to go down to the desk to report that we could not get into our room and we were told that they were too busy checking in the long, long line of new guests. We were livid -- we were paid guests that needed access to our room and were told they were too busy helping the check-ins???  Inexcusable. But here's the biggest issue and one I still have to address -- our rate was not what was quoted on Expedia. Since one of our rooms was not ready, they changed our room and, although they promised we'd pay the same rate, they charged me $50 more per room!!   Unfortunately I did not discover this until I returned home and reviewed my confirmation emails and hotel bills.  I plan to contact the hotel to resolve this, but my updated review has to include this additional information.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable beds, quiet.  Security was exceptional.
review.negativeRemarks: More check-in staff to cut down on the long lines. Water pressure too low. Answer the main desk phone EVERY SINGLE TIME.
review.locationRemarks: Area outside of hotel seems a little scary, although hotel security was great. Convenient to different transportation.

managementResponses.response:

review.reviewText: Room was clean, pleasantly decorated, and comfortable.  Check-in was very slow with only one person at the desk and a long line of guests trying to check in.  I had two rooms reserved for our party and both days we were there we had problems getting into one of the rooms because the room key did not work.  The second time we reported that our room was inaccessible and we needed someone to help us we were told that the main desk was "very busy checking in arriving guests".  This was very frustrating and we had to go down to the main desk and demand immediate assistance -- checking in new guests is no excuse to ignore those current guests who'd already paid for their stay and couldn't get into their room!  Security helped us and was very friendly, but we had to cause a scene before we got anyone to listen.  This is unacceptable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was convenient but area was very "seedy" at night.  Security did a good job though.
review.negativeRemarks: Better check-in and staffing adequate to cover the number of expected guests.
review.locationRemarks: Location was accessible by various means of transportation.  Walking at night was a little scary because there were very unseemly people in the area.

review.title: Classic charm at great location

If you want a treat, try the stairs instead of the elevator once and see the inner workings of the building.  We ended up in the kitchen and the worker area.  The hotel is a great value for SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Its proximity to BART and Metro bus/trolley system for easy movement around the City.
review.locationRemarks: With the use of the bus/trolley system, you are within 30 minutes of everything in SF.  The Powell Street cable cars are within 5-10 minutes.

Be warned! The neighborhood is crawling with homeless and twacked out individuals.

review.title: Very disappointing
review.reviewText: Well we first drove up to our hotel the cab driver warned us that the hotel was surrounded by "homeless crackheads" so we had to be careful. Being from another city and never visiting San Francisco before, we had no clue what we were getting into, however the pictures of the place looked nice online. crackheads were everywhere sitting outside the hotel doors. Starbucks, which was located in the hotel, also had bums that asked my husband and I to buy him coffee and he was clearly drunk/high. We refused and felt unsafe and never returned to that starbucks. Our room was OK but definitely wasnt picture status. The carpet on the 3rd floor hallway to our room was coming up and caused me to trip during my stay as well. Day 2 of our stay our toilet no longer flushed. We called for maintenance and when the guy came he said he had to replace a part and will be back. 30 min later never came, we had to call the front desk again and tell them we were going to at least shower so we could start our day. Finally an hour later 2 guys came in and were in the bathroom for an hour, causing a delay for my husband and i get ready. Then the next morning at 6:30am we are rudely woken up by a FIRE ALARM!!! we open our door and just see other guests running towards the stairwell! We run out in our PJ's and make it down to the lobby to hear 15 min later that it was a false alarm. We go back to our room and get back in bed and just before falling asleep AGAIN the loud alarm!! NEVER WILL RETURN!!!

review.title: It could be an awesome hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is well located and bearing a decadent upscale style.  It lacks maintenance in the sense of furniture with old worn out upholstery and equipment.
The beautiful wide corridors that give access to bedrooms don't make justice to the small old fashioned and underequiped rooms.
My bedroom had no available outlet to plug my computer; I had to pull the bed, disconnect one of the lamps to use an outlet.
No USB outlets either.  The room lacks of enough lighting, so if you drop anything other than white in the very dark carpet will be difficult to retrieve.
The bathroom, although clean and with basic appliances, carries a torned out roof. The upper parts on the wall are covered with loose wallpaper roughly fixed.
No amenities in the bedroom at all, except a TV, but don't expect to find at least a bottle of water.

There was also trash left in the room from previous occupants. In the end, the hotel room was fairly inexpensive, just remember cheap is dear.

review.title: centrally located - close to transportation
review.reviewText:
Nice staff but not enough to make up for the old and worn out hotel rooms and furnishings.
As usual, Expedia clients get relegated to the lowest standard room available. It was tiny, dingy and had a dirty window that looked into the side of the building. The mattress was sunken in the middle. 
The front desk staff happily upgraded me to a larger, cleaner, lighter room. Vey appreciated. Still the accommodations were so dated it felt a little creepy.
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk staff. Starbucks located adjacent to the lobby. Central location.
review.negativeRemarks: Refurbish. Add premium TV channels.
review.locationRemarks: Central. Transitional neighborhood. I know San Francisco so it was great for me. Others might be put off?

review.title: Oh Dear !!!!
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Whitcomb for 3 night last week. Staff on entry booked us in but you got the feeling they didn't really enjoy their work. We got the same feeling from the guest services girl the following day....didn't go out of their way. From the pictures it looked quite nice but it wasn't anything like it. I read some negative feedback about it before we went but wanted to remain open about it. The location is out of the centre of town, in an area habited by a lot of homeless people. The same people use the Starbucks cafe shared on the hotel premises which is disappointing and the security in the hotel don't do anything about them. Some of them appear to be genuine people with problems, others are high on drugs and the police seem to spend a lot of time turning them over or stopping fights. Rooms were dark and in desperate need of an overall, like the whole hotel. The corridors are really wide and the rooms seem small and the bed sagged in the middle. Our room backed onto the rear of the hotel where all night you could hear banging from the service yards behind despite our windows being shut. It needs completely gutting and modernising.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing. Definitely not a hotel to bring children due to the intimidating himself people in the immediate area.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs completely gutting and modernising
review.locationRemarks: A bit of a seedy location , away from the town centre.

review.title: Ok for the price
review.reviewText:
the hotel looks very pretty and it has charm but the rooms and hallways definitely need some touching up. - Let me start with what I did like:
* the bed was amazingly comfortable! Including the pillows.
* the customer service was fabulous and super friendly. 
* it has a nice rustic / vintage charm when you walk in the entrance. 
Now comes the disappointments:
-The ac made A LOT of noise (when you got it to work.)
- the bathroom is ok, definitely needs remodeling but the shower it self had little to no water pressure so you basically have to be right under the shower head to wash off.
- the walls are practically paper thin so I could hear people in the room behind me at 3am throwing up and yelling.
- the hallway carpet on the 4th floor is lifting so I almost tripped twice.

Other than that it's ok for a night if all you're doing is sleeping there.

review.reviewText: Simply put, he rooms were fine, the parking was impossible and the staff was indifferent and bordered on rude.  My wife asked the desk person about a parking accomedation and the woman was brusque and dismissive.  We expressed our dismay via the expedia 'how was your checkin' email and said that it wasn't pleasant.  The next morning, at around 8AM (we could have been sleeping, to which the manager replied he just wanted to leave a message...but the phone still rings so we would have ben woken up anyway).  We explained to him the time and nature of our issue.  He asked who the offending party was to which I responded in was the lady there at five oclock.  Since there were only two people at the desk, a male and female, that should have been sufficient. But he pressed as if I was supposed to remember the woman's name tag.   We also waited for some time at the bell desk to retrieve our bags but no one was there.  Finally someone came and asked us what we wanted, we said our luggage, and he lead us off the floor to the storage room where it was pretty clear we were supposed to take it up ourselves.  He acted like he wanted a tip for releasing our luggage and followed us back to the elevator (though we were carrying the bags, he made no offer to do so).  The room was adequate and the price was fine but the location had a number of quirks (though it was handily near the Bart station)  and the staff was not not particularly service oriented.  We will not stay again

review.locationRemarks: It was a solid walk to a couple of good restaurants but the area had very large pockets of homeless folks on most of the streets around the hotel.

review.title: Not a good hotel at all
review.reviewText:
First of all, we received a room for disabled people. I don't know why. We didn't ask for one. In the bathroom there was a chair you could sit on ehile showering if you are disabled. We arrived at 12 pm. The room was cold. There were about 12 degrees C outside. There was a heater near the window that wasn't on. when it was on, even for a low temperature, it made an incredible noise that we barely could sleep. After we used the toilet and flushed, the tank was constantly refilling itself making noise of course. So it was broken. The next morning we called housekeeping. Someone came and repaired it. After we used the toilet again, it was broken again! So we had to put our hand in the water in the tank to stop the refilling noise every time. 
That day I dared to wash my hair. I saw there wasn't a hairdryer. I called house keeping again to ask for one and went in the shower. After 20 minutes, someone called and asked if the dryer wasn't in the bathroom. I said no. They said they eould send one shortly. I waited. After another 20 minutes, I called again. They said it s on its way. After another 20 min, I called and asked to speak to the manager. After one hour, when my hair already was dry because I used the room heater, the dryer arrived. After a few minutes, housekeeping came again with working tools to find a place on the wall for the hairdryer. The man barely could speak english.The wifi wasn't working at all. We called tHe manager. We left after 2 nights.It still didin't work

review.title: Very old and deceiving
review.reviewText: The hotel looked beautiful from the lobby, but that was the most positive thing about our stay. There was no bell hop to bring up our bags, the room was dirty, ( dust all over the vents, stains on the sheets) they do not offer room service, the cords to the lamps and our tv were all tangled up in a mangled up mess, and the light bulbs were burned out. We had to call maintenance to fix them. There are no modern amenities except for a hair blow dryer. We were charged an extra $40 for parking, and much more for other taxes and fees, so the Expedia price isn't close to what we actually paid. All in all, I don't recommend.

review.title: Room with a view and a mouse to spare
review.reviewText: We had a different room every night. Our first room had a decent view but it was a handicap room which I agreed to not stare at an alley but the water pressure in the bathroom was horrible and the nozzle came to my chest. The second room that we were moved to was a little better but the lighting still needed a lot of work. There is no overhead lighting what so ever only floor lamps which made it near impossible to see what you looked like before leaving your room. Our air conditioner leaked and made our carpet floor wet and smell of musk. But this was not the worst part. We had a mouse in our room and had to change rooms in the middle of the night. Needless to say having to frantically pack up everything in my pj's was not how I wanted to spend my last night there. They did comp our breakfast the next day but the damage was already done. I was so scared that the mouse had family members living in other arrears of the hotel that I did not get much sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness, and lighting. Update floors with wood or tile.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText:
I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. The hotel lobby looks amazing - it's so artistic. I love the traditional style. My room has a king bed. Room is reasonably clean, spacious, and the bed is comfortable. To my surprise there's a huge walk-in closet where I can store my luggage, shoes and hang my clothes. The bathroom is clean, but the temperature at the sink is inconsistent -- it often gets very hot suddenly, and I burned myself many times during my stay. 

There isn't a foyer in the room, and the bed is a little too close to the door. Almost every night I heard some inconsiderate guests laughing and shouting in the hallway while walking back to their rooms. 

There was a dance event in the hotel's function room next to the lobby, every night during my stay the lobby was filled with people and was very loud - My room was on the 5th floor, but I imagine guests on the 2nd floor might be bothered by the noise. 

I didn't know the hotel has a gym until I saw the picture online today. Would have been nice to work out a little there. 

The hotel is 5 min. walk to the civic center. The train station is right outside the hotel, and bus stops are nearby. There are MANY homeless people in the area -- every 10 steps or so you'd see a group of them -- even though city workers washed the street with water in day time and at night, there was still a urine odor in the air in that whole area.
review.positiveRemarks: The design/artwork in the lobby and hallway -- they make the hotel look fancy -- far better than a 3-star.  Location is convenient. Friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom sink temperature inconsistent in room on the 5th floor. Better sound proof.
review.locationRemarks: There's an international art museum just a few min. walk down the street, and admission is always free. Uber and Tweeter headquarter are next block

photos.caption: The shooting at 4:00 am. Good luck going back to sleep after witnessing that.

review.title: Bad Area
review.reviewText:
The historic component and view of City Hall are wonderful, but unfortunately that's where the compliments end. I paid roughly $500 for one night with parking. In walking to lunch and dinner, I couldn't help but notice the droves of homeless. I walk past a dozen or so daily in my home town, but I was accosted by dozens of them in this area, some jumping in front of me just to scream profanities. I didn't feel safe on some nearby blocks, and that's coming from someone who grew up in the murder capital of America. Speaking of murders, I awoke at 4:00 am to 3 gun shots in close range. Sure enough, a man had been shot right outside my window - the area I had just been walking hours prior. 
I hate to blame a historic hotel for what happens outside of it, but this is not the area I expect for $500/night. Unfortunately SF's poverty has become an epidemic, and this hotel is a victim of it. I highly recommend staying closer to the Embarcadero, even if you have to pay $1000/night. If you can't afford that, commute from the East Bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Historic construction, view of City Hall
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms - they need both an upgrade and a more thorough cleaning. The underside of the toilet clearly hadn't been cleaned in a while.
review.locationRemarks: Take a car if you're leaving at night and stay to the main streets during the day.

review.title: Convenient but too noisy
review.reviewText: The room was very clean, it was an older hotel so didn't expect it to look modern. The room smelled a little musty but clean and bathrrom was clean. Very noisy, you can hear people in the hallways at night and people outside in the street.  Staff was helpful, friendly and fast.

The front desks acts as if they annoyed to check you in. I'm sorry am I nothing you spending my money here?? Then old hotel but it has not been updated well- also beds were smelly and bowed into the middle like pull out sofas basically. Horrible on comfort. The rooms are also dark with two dim lamps to light the way. WORST PART - two loud pops in the middle of the night and a crime scene the next morning outside our window

The hotel is quite nice, but is a bit run down. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The food in the dining room was good, and it was convenient to have a Starbucks in the lobby. the neighborhood was less than desireable with many homeless people hanging around outside the hotel. I probably won't stay there again because of this even though the interior of the hotel is quite pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: Not a good location. Too many homeless people hanging around and sleeping outside the hotel.

review.reviewText: It was a great location in terms of accessibility. However, it was an old building so the facilities are pretty old and worn out. Overall a nice place to stay if you were looking for a walkable distance to San Francisco downtown and rave parties.

review.title: Hotel needs a bit more help
review.reviewText:
I normally don't post experiences, however I will today.   The hotel overall is beautiful with it's old world charm and proximity to government buildings and getting in/out of San Francisco easily.   

However, the plumbing throughout is a major issue.   The toilet is broken and the shower didn't work properly.   There was a trickle down affect when showering.   

Also, the homeless are a major issue outside the hotel.  Very sad and while I know it's beyond the hotel's control they hotel staff needs better training on how to deal with them.

Unfortunately there was an incident where a homeless woman lie bleeding on the floor of the foyer of the hotel.   The security guard stood very far away and didn't assist the woman.   She was bleeding and her rear end was exposed.  No one would go near her and it was quite disturbing that she was being treated so poorly.    

Someone could have simple put a blanket over her as part of your policy.    Also, her blood (spots) remained on the floor for the rest of the day.  Not a very good clean up job :-(

Sorry but it wasn't a very nice experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve your overallstaffingpolicies
review.locationRemarks: Okay but wouldn't stay again.

review.title: Convenient and accessible to public transportation
review.reviewText: First room we were given smelled so bad but the Front desk clerk was awesome and gave us a replacement and even upgraded it. Bathroom was small though, and no spaces or counter to place your toiletries..

review.title: SF Market St Hotel
review.reviewText:
I came to SF for the Chinese New Year Parade. I took the bart and it let me off at 8th st, right next to the hotel. The building was a historic gem with the original look of the era. 
Check in was easy, staff friendly and helpful. I asked the Manager for some assistance and he was very kind. I asked where I could buy a copy of a book that they had in the room and he was so generous, he gave me a brand new complimentary copy.  Great hotel, lots of class, fun town. Stay at the Hotel Whitcomb !

WORST VACATION EXPERIENCE EVER. FALSE ADVERTISEMENT.
TERRIBLE LOCATION - DRUNG ADDICTS AND HOMESLESS PEOPLE, MY DAUGHTER WAS MUGGED THE FIRST NIGHT NEFORE WE GOT INTO HOTEL ROOM. THE ROOM WAS GLOOMY AND DARK, DID NOT SLEEP ALL NIGHT DUE TO A HUGE BANK ON MY ROOM, WE LEFT IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE BANGING OF OUR ROOM. review.title: Horrible hotel

review.title: Grand Old Hotel
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is a grand old hotel, built over 100 years ago.  The lobby still shows the grandeur of bygone days.  My room showed signs of quick and dirty repairs, but that doesn't bother me.  My only two complaints were the fact that the shower head came up to shoulder height (yes, I'm tall, but I'm not that tall) and the electrical outlet under the desk was so loose that plugs would easily slip out.  The matress was firm and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: The nearest BART stop is 1/2 block away and the Moscone Center is about 0.6 miles (1km).

review.title: Great location perfect for public transportation.
review.reviewText: The staff of the hotel was very nice and we really enjoyed our stay. We will definitely be back again!
review.locationRemarks: The location was excellent. We decided not to rent a car in the city and take public transportation. We are so glad we did.

review.title: with a car you have problems
review.reviewText: It is very confusing to find the hotel if you have a car. You can drop off a passenger in front of the hotel but can not leave the car. There are no signs or directions of where to park. Lots of one way streets to keep you confused. Once you find hotel parking, your are charged a high 38 dollars a day for parking. The rooms are very small, the ice machine down the hall did not work. The chain on the door lock was pulled out of the door frame. The window was very dirty.
review.positiveRemarks:
It is conveniently located 
Has WIFI and computers available in a convenient room on the main floor.

review.title: Worst hotel ever :(
review.reviewText: Bad location, the hotel staff are always in bad mood, its not clean, bed and pillows horrible, REALLY expensive for what is offering! DO NOT stay at this hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel design and architecture, too bad thats its being taken care...
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!
review.locationRemarks: Im from Brazil, where when you walk on the streer you need to be alert. And at this hotel location I didnt feel safe, specialy at night.

review.title: Past its prime, but OK...
review.reviewText: Old hotel OK until I saw tiny bugs dancing out of the tile of the shower floor.  Faucets dripped - in drought-stricken California.  Housekeeping staff pleasant and friendly.  Check-in staff OK.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location (except for may homeless street people in neighborhood. (Not the hotel's fault)
Room was quiet.
review.negativeRemarks:
Exterminate bugs in shower tile grout.  I hope they weren't fleas, probably weren't bedbugs.
Fix water leaks in faucets, toilet.

review.title: Close to theatres
review.reviewText: The check-in was great, the hotel was cute and clean.  We had a great stay and would definitely stay there again.  Only one elevator worked during our second day, which was inconvenient.

review.title: Then and now...
review.reviewText: This is a great old hotel with warm and skilled staff. The historical detail would be greatly enhanced if more attention was given to common area upkeep on the hotel side (lobby, elevators, hallways, windows). The restaurant presents well and the food is very good. The rooms need to be equipped with modern-day light fixtures that allow guests to plug in phones, etc. Still a pleasant experience overall.
No where near a 3 star rating! Was very disappointed.

review.title: Sufficient for one night, but...
review.reviewText:
... I'd never go back. The best I can say about the staff is that they were "cordial"; they didn't quite make it all the way to polite but they weren't rude either. They just didn't seem very happy to be there.

When I got in, I wanted a hot shower. No hot water. I have worked in hotels so I know the boiler is typically located in the basement or at one end of the property. I let the water run for several minutes and it never got hot but it certainly wasted A LOT of water in the process. I called the front desk and they sent a maintenance person. He arrived within 5 minutes; by this, I was impressed. The water continued to run while I waited for his arrival. So, I'd judge the water had run for, at very least, 15 minutes at this point. He took the shower head apart and put it back together then let it run more. Am I clearly illustrating how much water was wasted in this process? He let it run. It finally got hot. He said the boiler is in the basement and it serves the upper floors first so I had to wait for it to make its way all the way back down to the second floor where my room was. With the current drought in CA, you'd think they'd be more concerned. 

I don't like fluffy pillows and that's what they have. I feel I paid way too much money for the property overall. Finally, the WiFi is so slow as to be useless to me.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you very much for your review of your recent stay at our hotel. Your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we strive to improve with each and every stay. We take pride in taking care of our hotel. Our main priority is to be able to offer a very well maintained and comfortable atmosphere. 
Thank you again for letting us know your concern.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Overall its a nice hotel and has great access to public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Please looking into updating bathroom.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your recent review. We are glad to hear that you had a wonderful stay and our staff worked very hard to provide an excellent service and it is nice to hear about it when we did a good job. We look forward in welcoming you again at the Hotel Whitcomb.

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: The manager of the hotel Mr. Ahmed was wonderful.  Greeted us daily and asked about our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, restaurant and a Starbucks in the lobby.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for your recent review. We are please to know that you have enjoyed your overall stay with us. We strive our best to give the possible service to our guest and it is great to hear an excellent feedback from you. We are looking forward for the opportunity to be of service to you again.

review.title: Amazing hotel near the Bill Graham Civiv Center
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because it was only a 5 minute walk to my event at the Bill Graham Civic Center. Easy check in & very friendly staff! Excellent room and comfy bed!  Will definitely recommend to anyone staying in the city !

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your recent review. We are glad to hear that you had a comfortable stay.  Our staff works very hard to provide excellent service and it is nice to hear about it when we did a good job. We look forward in welcoming you again at the Hotel Whitcomb.

review.title: What a night at the Whitcomb
review.reviewText: This was a classy hotel I would totally recommend it to anyone I know. The room was big as was the bathroom and the closet. The only negative thing I could say about the hotel was the service was slow. But that is ok when everything else was great. Friendly staff!

review.title: More Hostel then Hotel.
review.reviewText:
Not in a great part of town. Although it's on Market street it's at the very rough end at the top of the Mission district. The hotel seems to trade on it's heritage, and by that I mean it's stuck in the 1940's decor-wise. As other reviewers have commented, it's very dark, oppressively so. I didn't use the restaurant, couldn't wait to get out of the place, to be honest.

The room itself was very basic, the heating system (not sure it had A/C, maybe just an evaporator) was at least 30 years old and made a terrible racket when turned on but nothing like as loud as the extractor fan in the toilet.

The other guests were extremely loud, it sounded as though they were playing soccer in the hallway at night and frequently shouted to each other through the open doors of their rooms. As per the title of the review, it felt like a hostel rather then a hotel.

I did have a laugh at the note in the room, "what one thing we could do to make your stay more enjoyable", uh, tear the place down?
review.negativeRemarks: See above :)
review.locationRemarks: It is fairly central but i'd be wary of walking to far in some directions at night. Not the fault of the hotel but downtown SF is pretty risky.

review.title: Clean hotel by shopping
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is very old but that's because it's been around forever, very clean regardless of age showing. Valet was quick, check in was fast as well, check out was a little slow but that was fine. I have to say this place was fine but my only complaints are that parking ended up being $43 dollars. So you think you're paying less for the hotel but calculate that, plus the room tax and you're paying easily 65 dollars more a night. The bed was not comfortable, and the toilet was on a pedestal which was weird but again, that's part of the charm of the building I suppose. I was fine with my stay and it was quiet but I won't be back unless I have no other option. Staff was fine, hotel was fine, just not worth the price.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your recent review. we are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the hotel. We look forward in welcoming you again at the Hotel Whitcomb.

review.reviewText: Right off the BART Civic center stop. Close walking to Civic Center and Union Square. Taxi's were the best option. The hotel itself was fun, historic, and beautiful in an old, charming way. It is far from new, but we enjoyed the hotel BECAUSE of that. It is right off Market and the street was pretty dirty and has a lot of people sleeping on the sidewalks around this area. The hotel was great but the surrounding area outside was intense at times. Starbucks was attached, Sam's diner across the street was delish and there's a bar in the hotel.

review.title: Old hotel
review.reviewText: An old hotel that is not being up kept very well. The room was small, it had a window but an air conditioner sat in it and was sealed to the window via packing and duct tape. There is a desk with a newer chair that doesn't fit into the older desk so one can't quite walk around the bed. The first night I had a neighbor that liked the tv loud and watched late into the night beginning again early in the morning. The second night it was the sound of trucks backing up all night from behind the building - either the trucks were dumping something or something was being dumped into the trucks. Something loud, like recycling. The bed was comfortable and the staff was as helpful as they could be with limited resources.

review.title: Choose a different hotel
review.reviewText: Old air conditional ..old rooms ....bums hangout ...Resturant cummy and expensive ...far away from anything ..kinda a dangerous area ...parking a joke for price ...
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms
review.locationRemarks: Nothing bums hangout ..kinda scared

review.title: I checked in and out within 20 minutes.
review.reviewText: I did not stay long enough to have an experience beyond my initial disgust.
review.negativeRemarks: Major renovations and soap/water.

review.title: Historic hotel
review.reviewText: I was having my bathroom remodeled and the management company put me up in the hotel for seven nights while they completed the work.  Hotel Whitcomb is a nice historic hotel.  No room service.  Not in a great part of the city.  Great access to public transportation.  Walls are very thin.  Room was large for San Francisco standards.

Nice Place with lots to do. Very convenient to shopping. Did not like there was no coffee maker or refrigerator in my room. Would stay again.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
                                               Not a fan of this making me write a book.

review.title: Across the street from the Orpheum Theatre.
review.reviewText: Nice clean room comfortable bed and it was quiet. Never heard any noise in the hallway or doors closing. I would definitely stay here again and price was good for San Francisco. the only thing is no coffee maker, fridge or microwave. There's a Starbucks right next door. Very central location for the city.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Good value, but the neighborhood would be uncomfortable for a single woman.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the staff were excellent.  The room was ample and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Windows dirty, smell of mold in the bathroom.  The room was a large enough to fit a comfortable chair but there wasn't one.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to metro, opera, concert hall, and Ferry.  Unfortunately, the neighborhood is a congregation place for homeless.

review.title: Close to public transportation.
review.reviewText: We were able to get to a surprise party the night we arrived using the Bart system which took us directly to our hotel. The hotel is beautiful if a little old. The only minor problem we had was with scarcity of electrical outlets. The staff was very friendly and obtained taxis for us when asked.
review.negativeRemarks: Updating the outlets in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Because the hotel is on the Bart line and the Muni line there is not a sight in San Francisco you can not get to.

review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful.  I liked the atmosphere of the hotel main areas.  With public transportation the hotel is close enough to everything yet still removed.  The little restaurants around the hotel made for an enjoyable stay.

review.title: Poor service. Unsafe, lack of security.
review.reviewText: There was blood on my bed sheets when I first came in. Also, late nigh took a stroll down the hallways to find homeless sleeping within.
review.positiveRemarks: It looks nice inside and with better housekeeping and security could be a nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping, security, water pressure and temperature.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of the homeless in San Francisco.

review.title: lovely old look and feel
review.reviewText: I found the food in the hotel restaurant exceptionally good.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the old look--all the brass, tiles, finishing, etc.  Staff and rooms very nice too.
review.locationRemarks: I did not feel safe leaving the hotel.  The area seemed rather seedy.

review.title: A bit tired, but great price
review.reviewText: The hotel room was announced at 40% off, so the price was good for the central location. But it is definitely an old hotel. The corridors smell old, with old carpet. But the room was comfortable. Bathroom was very small.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have loved a coffee maker in the room, and possibly a little fridge.

review.title: Don't stay here
review.reviewText: Front desk staff was uninterested and seemed put out by any questions. Furniture in lobby was grimy, hallways literally smelled. The room was no better. Mold growing on the wallpaper in the bathroom, dirty grout in the shower. Mattress needed to be replaced, carpets cleaned or replaced. The tv signal was fuzzy, no room service guides or hotel information in the room. I stayed one of my three nights because I was jet lagged and exhausted. Ate the rest of my cost because I really could not stay there. When I checked out early and stated room condition they just said ok and would ask the unavailable manager if any refund was available. They never called. Not only would I not recommend this hotel but I want to try and save anyone else from staying here too!

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Nice and friendly staff, tavern bar was nice and good bar tender. Location of hotel is excellent, but clearly the hotel itself can use some TLC.  Quite dated and in need of improvements.  Seemed clean however, and the old style character is cool. All in all, decent experience.
review.negativeRemarks: see comments above....needs updating.
review.locationRemarks: excellent location...walking distance to Union Square, Financial District, etc

review.title: Neighborhood is problem with hotel
review.reviewText: Difficult neighborhood, particularly at night.  I would not stay there again because of the number of approaches from vagrants in the area around hotel.  Starbucks next door to hotel was robbed at 5:30 am when I was getting coffee.  Not convenient to Moscone.  Difficult to get cabs.  Older hotel, but clean and comfortable.  Hotel guests during stay were noisy and boisterous in hallway.

review.title: Good for getting about
review.reviewText: Market St is a good transport hub for trams and buses to get around SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Having the Starbucks by the lobby was handy. Pretty efficient check in and out. Room was clean and tidy.
review.negativeRemarks: TV remote was broken and room was a little gloomy but overall decent value for money compared to more expensive hotels.

review.title: Nice place other than the blood on the curtains...
review.reviewText:
This was a great hotel in a great location. They let us check in early, which was nice, however when we got to our room we noticed blood on our curtains which was totally disgusting. We also did not have a shower curtain in our room but we assumed it was because we checked in early. Even if it wasn't blood (which is definitely looked like), they could have at least cleaned or swapped them out for clean ones. 

They charge a lot for parking at their hotel which I felt was a rip off.
review.negativeRemarks: Not charging an arm and a leg for parking at the hotel.

review.title: Excellent central location!
review.reviewText: We stayed in order to attend a class.  As of this review 1/16; the neighborhood is going through transitions and some rough characters were out on the street during the early evening.  The location is great - near the civic center; public transportation.
review.locationRemarks: Bill Graham Auditorium, Sams Diner, Asian Art Museum, Castro District, Orpheum

review.reviewText: Some good staff, some not so good. Be careful of $50 deposit that is held for 3 to 5 business days. Walls VERY thin.

review.title: Great hotel good location
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly my room was great the bed was comfortable. The location was close to shopping right on Market Street
May have been a nice hotel in it's day, but it has not been kept up and today is no longer it's day. Very dark and dingy and not in the best neighborhood.

I stayed for three nights on a business/pleasure trip.  Walking through the hotel felt like a throwback to another era.  The hotel was well situated for seeing north or south SF, and pickup for tours was not a problem.

review.title: A decent hotel
review.reviewText: I had to get a hotel at the last minute as I was attending a conference in San Francisco and everything was booked.    The hotel Whitcomb was fine. It is a cool historic hotel but with that comes the quirks of age.   The staff was great, the bed was comfortable.  There is a nice bar in the lobby where you can order food.   There is also a starbucks in the lobby which is very convenient.  overall a good stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the bar, the bed was comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: The plumbing is old and there could be more lighting and plugs
review.locationRemarks: The location is ok.   The neighborhoods is not great.  There are a lot of homeless people on the street.

review.title: Great location!!
review.reviewText: I booked a standard room that promised free wifi.  The connection was super weak and drifted in and out.  When I called to complain they were very agreeable about moving me to a room with better wifi.  The new room was a step up and the wifi connectivity was awesome!  Thanks for the great customer service.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is awesome.  In the center of the city and close to the trolley and Muni station!!
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need an upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: Castro, civic center, union square are all fairly close

review.title: Location is the only reason to stay here
review.reviewText:
This place is like a busted version of the Hotel Cortez in American Horror Story Hotel. By no means is this a cool or hip place to stay, it's dreary, like where people come to OD. The halls reek of bleach as if they're trying to mask the smell of decaying bodies. The staff is creepy, the place is dusty, and there's no charm whatsoever. Nothing on Expedia shows the real Hotel Whitcomb, it's a 100% sham. 
I'm not a snobby traveler, I stay in hotels all over the world, from road side no star motels to Five Diamond resorts. 
Stay at your own risk. If youre seeing a show at the Bill Graham and one of the other dozens of hotels in the area are sold out, well you've read the review.

review.title: Dirty sheets
review.reviewText: Blood stains on the sheets. The halls were dirty, buildung is old and smelly

review.title: Nice antique hotel at the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: My stay was very pleasant! I'll definitely stay there again. Highly recommended. The Starbucks there is very convenient!

review.title: Great Hotel, super nice staff, clean and nice room
review.reviewText: I loved this place!  the staff were nice, the room was cozy, and they brought us extra blankets and pillows quickly.  the only drawback of driving to the city was a the parking bill.  oh well!  Loved it!

review.title: Smells rooms
review.reviewText: Uncomfortable bathrooms , but nice people working there

review.title: Old World comfort
review.reviewText: I booked a room for one night at the last minute. Reasonably priced and right around the corner from the show we were going to, I figured it was worth it to not have to hassle with getting back to Sunnyvale late at night. We arrived and found the valet parking around the back. Between dropping off the car and checking in, we were in our room in less than 20 minutes. Rooms are spacious with very high ceilings, old world bedding (very comfy), large windows, older plumbing fixtures but suited to the ambience of the place and a large closet. We had no view- faced into a shaft that looked out at other rooms- but we were staying just the one night so that wasn't important. I am sure there are rooms with city views. Overall very pleasant, great value and location. We will definitely book here again if our wanderings take us to SF again.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel lobby is gorgeous! Staff were friendly and efficient. Excellent location and value.
review.negativeRemarks: Only drawback I can think of is no coffee/ tea maker in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of downtown- easy access to transportation for anything you might want to do or see in SF.

review.reviewText: now that i know to turn right not left when leaving the hotel, it was great
review.positiveRemarks:
great housekeeping staff
very quick response to request for coffee
Jennifer at the lobby desk
review.negativeRemarks: understandably, most staff at front desk are less than excited to help, they deal with a lot of transients coming in and out

review.title: Worst hotel I ever stayed at!
review.reviewText: The Hotel Lobby had no heat.  It was 30 degrees at night 50 in the daytime. The room heater was so old it took 2 days for it to warm the room. The rooms have not been updated in 100 years. The restaurant was closed for the 2 weeks. The vending machines were empty. Homeless people were in the lobby & hallways. The neighborhood was so bad there were no decent restaurants or stores. I had to take cabs across town to go to a good restaurant.Staff didn't care.  Their were great hotels in good neighborhoods that were only $200 a night, I paid that with the Expedia discount.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: The worst neighborhood in SF All Homeless people outside.

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old and antique looking, kinda spooky, but really cool.  The rooms are really small, but we didn't spend a lot of time there.  The location was pretty good, but could be better.  Walking distance from union square but  there were pretty much no good restaurants nearby.  It was rainy when we were here so we ubered everwhere.
Time has caught up with the hotel. Needs upgrading and better amenities.

review.title: Easy access to trolly
review.reviewText: Room were very small. Bed was horrible. Shower water pressure was unbelievably horrible. Restroom was so small you could literally was ur hands while on toilet. Would never stay there again ever.
Pleasant, within walking distance to food and theater. The staff was very helpful with recommendations and directions. Overall a good nights sleep.

review.title: Historic Elegance
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel, but very nice.  Staff was very friendly and it has a great location.
Great location, safe and affordable. Clean rooms and friendly staff. May be a little outdated, which is perfectly understandable for a hotel built about hundred years ago.
Centrally located in theater district and close to public transportation and union square / SOMA area.

review.title: Good hotel great location for transportation
review.reviewText:
When I arrived the service desk people were complaining about the person they just helped saying this is America some people have no manners etc. the room was clean but the carpets were so dingy they looked gross. There were gnats that flew around in the shower and in the room but mainly in the shower which was gross. They sprayed but there were still several gnats everywhere more then 10 so that's gross 
Overall it was good but I wouldn't say it's 3.5 it's more like 2.5 stars 
The convenience to the Bart system is great literally u are dropped off at the front door. There is a lot of homeless around many 10 or more which makes it uncomfortable at night

review.title: Close to the shopping
review.reviewText: A short distance to the Exploratorium and pier 39. Convenient valet parking. Beautiful lobby entrance!

review.title: showing its age, unappealing neighborhood
review.reviewText:
Inside the hotel, the grandness of the old days is pretty faded.   Rugs are dirty, the limited number of outlets in the room are so overused that they no longer hold the prongs of devices, my bathroom was tiny.
but the most problematic issue was the large number of homeless people in the neighborhood around the hotel.   Although none were aggressive to me, their presence made a walk through the neighborhood uncomfortable and unpleasant.

review.title: If that was "upgraded " room in this hotel ...?!
review.reviewText: Sadness. We stayed 2 nights and never saw any housekeepers to ask for more towels and shampoo etc, your free Wifi hardly work with week signal.  Always empty restaurant overpriced and creepy dark.. And, again, these homeless people outside of hotel aggressively asking for money..
review.negativeRemarks: Normal bathrooms for a start...
review.locationRemarks: Homeless people are sleeping outside of hotel...unbearable sadness

review.title: Ok stay
review.reviewText: Overall average stay. It was nice that the woman at the front desk upgraded us to a bigger room for no extra charge. There was some kind of strange creepy homeless man that was on our upper floor (not on the ground floor, but inside upstairs!) who apparently chased my little sister and she had to run away from him. Security was apparently aware of the man being inside of the building and apologized but did not do anything else about it, which was disappointing. Convenient starbucks on the first floor lobby. Overall nice clean room with high ceilings. If you're more into modern hip hotels then this is not the place you want to go to. We liked that it was and old historic hotel. I just did not appreciate the random homeless man and security not really doing anything about it.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice view out the window. Nice high ceilings and walk in closet. Soft beds and pillows and clean bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Security with the homeless man that appeared out of nowhere on our floor.
review.locationRemarks: We were able to walk to union square, painted ladies, and the uber and lyft rides were cheap to other places like fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Good hotel, friendly staff, but sketchy area.
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Whitcomb is a nice looking historic hotel. The building is very old, so don't expect the quality of the building to be on par with brand new hotels. That being said, the rooms were spacious enough, and being someone who enjoys historic buildings, I enjoyed the atmosphere. The staff was pretty friendly, and the housekeeping did a good job keeping our room clean. 

  My only complaint about the hotel is the area that its located. There is a huge homeless population that seems to stick to the area right outside the hotel, and all down market Street. It made my girlfriend and I very uncomfortable to even step foot out of the hotel without calling an Uber first. The BART station stairs , which are right outside the hotel, is very intimidating, as it is not light up at all and there is always someone sleeping on the stairs or begging for money. Lastly, there's a small park right across the street next to a Burger King that has approximately 20 or so homeless people loitering around along with all of their belongings. Obviously this is absolutely no fault of the hotel. In fact, hotel has security officers at night to prevent those who aren't guests from coming in, so I was never worried about safety within the hotel.

Overall, I was quite happy with my stay at Hotel Whitcomb. Especially for being San Francisco, it is really hard to find a decent hotel at a cheap price, so If you're on a budget and don't mind the area outside the hotel, then this place is a great deal!
Great stay, clean rooms, although the room was quite small and promised a view. A view to other hotel Windows...

review.title: Hotel is in the bad area of town
review.reviewText: Staff was pleasant but the hotel is too old. We could feel the springs on the bed when we slept. There is no air ventilation in the room or bathroom. Had to heat up the bathroom by with steam from bathtub.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed and air ventilation.
review.locationRemarks: A lot of homeless people sleep outside the hotel. Hotel is on Market street near by government building and retail stores.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is 100 years old, really!!!
Everything is old and has probsbly never been changed since its opening. The location was excellent, on Market street, and the bus stop and the subway station are just in front on the hotel.

review.title: The hotel that couldn't be silenced
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb was a pleasant experience; with good staff, nice rooms, and a generally good atmosphere. This was undone, however, as every morning between the hours of 3 and 7 the entire building's fire alarm system would be activated. Now the world-ending sound that ensued from such an activation may put you at ease as it would be able to wake coma patients from their slumber to evacuate, but as this was three nights of false alarms we did not take solace in its effectiveness. To be honest this was not the Whitcomb's fault but the actions of some renegade who eventually got caught, or so we were told after the second night...

review.title: An OK stay -- wouldn't stay again
review.reviewText: The hotel is not located in the best area of Market Street -- a lot of seedy characters nearby.  Also, while hotel condition was OK, not something to write home about.  If you're looking for an inexpensive room in San Francisco near a lot of great neighborhoods and you don't mind average accommodations, this should work for you.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby entrance very nice.  Starbuck right in front of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Hallways were unkept.  Rooms OK, but could be better.
review.locationRemarks: A lot of seedy characters nearby, but also near a lot of great neighborhoods

review.title: Scary previous reviews.
review.reviewText: Though not in the "best part of the city" and there were some street people we never did feel threatened. We were two women on a getaway form the kids and husbands. City transportation was literally outside the entrance and the BART was less than a block away. The hotel is definitely older but with much character. Do not expect a modern room. We had two double beds and still had room to move. Bathroom was not large but had everything needed. There is a great Piano Bar off the lobby that serves food and drink if you don't feel like venturing out at night. We truly felt it was a great deal.

review.title: Major Construction Noise at 7am
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Hotel Whitcomb for 4 nights and the construction next door woke me up at 7am every morning. The rooms were smaller than pictured, old, and not particularly clean. There are old pipes in the shower which meant no water pressure. One night, someone had puked all over the elevator and the surrounding area and I almost stopped in it. There was no caution sign and no sense of urgency to clean it up. When I notified the front desk, there was no apology. The staff never once asked how I was enjoying my stay probably because I assume almost every guest would complain about the construction noise. Outside the hotel, there are homeless people everywhere and while it is close to a BART station, it isn't close to anything a tourist would want to see/experience.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to a BART station and I could easily get to it from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness and construction noise
review.locationRemarks: It's in the financial district so it's good for business but not for tourism.

review.title: Classic central hotel
review.reviewText: Absolutely gorgeous decor - very turn of the century. Lovely rooms and great central location on the F tram line and close to BART trains for airport. Few idiosyncracies including odd (and weak) heating system and lack of ceiling lighting - it's all lamps, which is kind of keeping in theme.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor and design were amazing. Great location
review.negativeRemarks: Proper lighting and a better heating system.
review.locationRemarks: Very very close to BART (from airport) and MUNI trains. On the Market street F line tram to Castro or Wharf.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Aside from the odor in the bathroom the room was ok. After it was resolved our stay was better. The staff was nice and attentive
The condition of room are not that good. But the staff is really nice.
Hotel hallways looked run down and dirty and not enough light. Carpeting was worn and the bathroom door was non functional!

review.title: Horrible Hotel
review.reviewText:
When I checked in they tried to raise the price of the room for both nights of my reservation.  When I showed the confirmation they told me to take it up with you.  
The hotel's pictures on your web site are a fraud.  The hotel is dark, the rooms are small, outdated and dingy.
I checked out a few hours later as I could not spend any more time there and defiantly not even one night!
The entrance was dirty the lobby required a guard and the homeless people in front of the hotel made it probably the worst hotel I have every stayed in.  Well It was so bad I could not stay. 
I want my money back as Expedia should stand behind the rate and quality of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText: I would not recommend any one staying here. The hotel is old and needs major renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Too many homeless people nearby, would not recommend any one staying here. Its scary at times during night.

review.title: Historical Hotel
review.reviewText: Checked in expecting a 3 star hotel experience, as posted.  Hotel has old historical charm but is dimly lit tipping it into a somewhat creepy feel.  Room was nicely decorated with minimal furnishings.  No hotel literature in room describing any amenities etc.  Guest feedback from previous guest was still on nightstand.  Mattress was old and sunken, was difficult to get out of.  Strange smell in hallway that was mildly disturbing.  Fire alarm went off 2nd night at 2am.  Following evacuation directions from back of room door, found myself in the basement with no outside access.  Had to go back up one flight into the kitchen and find my way out into the lobby.  Thank goodness no fire was actually present or this could have turned into a bad situation.
review.positiveRemarks: The restaurant was good.  Only was able to have dinner.  Breakfast began too late, and I'm not aware of any room service option.
review.negativeRemarks: If the hotel wants to advertise as a 3 star facility, it is going to need to upgrade and improve.  Rates for this hotel are way too high for quality.

review.reviewText: Good room with a bad view makes for a decent business hotel if in the area.

review.title: Many places to walk to.
review.reviewText: It was a great place to stay at, but the construction Goin on made it noisy, especially on monday mornin at 7:00am, couldn't sleep in.

review.title: Nice historic hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel rooms are small, bathroom smaller.  But I would expect that with a historic hotel.  The only bad thing is that it is on the edge of the worst area in San Francisco.  It is on the edge of the tenderloin area.  Dangerous to walk at certain times.  Would not recommend a female by herself stay here.  Once they clean the neighborhood up costs per room will rise also.

review.title: Old , dirty and over priced
review.reviewText: Old , dirty room . Never will stay here again . Charge you for everything . Horrible !

review.title: 2-star hotel close to most things
review.reviewText: This hotel is conviently located, but that's about it. Needs complete overhaul.
