review.title: Historical and close to BART
review.reviewText: Very pretty hotel. Very classic vintage vibe. Staff was very friendly and a Bart station was right outside the door. Will stay here again for any future trips to the city.

review.title: Not the best choice for Downtown SF
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old and patched up. The room that they gave be had a very strong urine smell in it! When I told them about it, the only came and sprayed fabreeze around the room and within minutes the smell came right back. The hotel is on Market street which is close to many things, however, there are plenty of other hotels in the area that would be a better choice.

review.title: Great ending to the day
review.reviewText: I accidentally booked the hotel for the wrong day. The manager accommodated us at no extra charge and was so kind. Staff friendly. Wonderful breakfast. Excellent value for an historic property. Would come again

review.title: Old and dingy .  hair in bedding, dirty carpet.
review.reviewText: Not comfortable at all, not three and a half stars, couldn't wait to leave in the morning. Expedia shouldn't advertise this one.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Terrible location . Hundreds of homeless at night.

review.reviewText: Bed bugs. They have bed bugs. And the bed wasn't comfortable. And the room was poorly ventilated.

review.title: Awesome.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in a great part of town. The hotel was built in the early 1900's and has a cool historic look to it. It was also very clean and well maintained. Room was quiet and the high ceilings are a nice touch. I will stay here anytime I return to SF.

review.title: Nice hotel close to down town
review.reviewText: I would rate the hotel 2 stars. The rooms a small and beds uncomfortable,
review.negativeRemarks: I had to wait 30 min for the elevator in the morning

review.title: Where do you hang your hand towel in the bathroom.
review.reviewText: We were given an early check in which at the time I thought was great!  Then the reality of the room set in.  I'm not overly large person, there was no way you could dry yourself in the bathroom after taking a shower without opening the bathroom door.  After you wash your hands in the bathroom there was no place to hang the towel you used to dry your hands.  You literally could not turn around in this bathroom.  I could see this room being marginally OK for 1 guest, not 2 adults.  Construction going on in building across alley, construction/garbage debris removal began at 5 AM on Monday.  We have stayed at this hotel many times in the past, am afraid this October 2015 visit will be our last.  I know this is San Francisco and things are expensive, but no place to hang your hand towel?  Will try another hotel in Civic Center next time we visit SF.
review.positiveRemarks: The location can not be beat.  If you are up for adventure and trying public transportation, MUNI and BART literally outside entrance to hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure, I certainly would not have offered this room to 2 adults even with bonus of early check in.  1920's charm with some unfortunate decrepitude.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect, public transportation literally outside front door can get you to anything that San Francisco has to offer.

review.title: Close to Bill Graham center
review.reviewText: In town for the Janet Jackson concert on 10/24/25. Very convenient to walk to and from the event. Walking distance to shopping and restaurants.  I appreciate the convenice of public transportation like Bart.

review.title: Good hotel for the price but few amenities
review.reviewText: It is convenient and the price was good for SF. The room was OK but quite small, especially the bath room and the shower. No coffee maker was a nuisance. The service at breakfast in the hotel restaurant was terrible - and the food quality did not match the price tab. Overall OK but not great.

review.title: Ok Hotel, Bad Area
review.reviewText: My wife got sick few hours after we checked in. We were booked for 2 nights. They wouldn't reimburse us for the second night.
review.negativeRemarks: Location. Cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty to do in downtown San Francisco

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText:
I did like the location and I like the weird woody feel you get due to the old furniture around the place.
The negatives. Parking was $38/night. The carpet was old and it made me worried about the state of the utilises. but they were on par.

I would talk about the beggars but I dont think its unique to the hotel. I think there are alot of beggars overall in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and it was a comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: The place needs an update. The people supporting it are wonderful but the place needs reguvination
review.locationRemarks: Go to Sam's diner across the street. Looks weird from the outside but once you step in, you wont regret the food. I enjoyed their breakfast.

review.title: Nice hotel and area. Very close to union square
review.reviewText: This hotel was amazing. Great service and clean rooms. The staffs were very helpful. The hotel is in a nice area, very close to union square and transportation. Overall this hotel two 👍🏽👍🏽 up.

review.title: Nice historic hotel, friendly staff!!
review.reviewText: Super clean. Staff very courteous and friendly. Love the historic feel of the older hotel. Understand preserving older style, but would be nice to be retrofitted to accommodate today's people traveling with multiple electronics. Also, more attention to detail in rooms where trims has been painted and is messy or needs painting. Also beautiful CLEAN carpets, but need to be restretched as they're wrinkled and loose. Those things take away from the beauty, but still a charming old hotel. Again super clean and great service!!
It's was ok room is a little tiny but other then that not bad!

review.title: location was great
review.reviewText:
We really enjoyed our stay at your hotel.
The location was great and the staff were very helpful

review.title: Nice environment and staff
review.reviewText: The staff were really nice and helpful. The bed was so comfortable. I had a nice stay. The walls are thin you can hear your neighbors snoring, that's the only downfall.

review.title: Once grand hotel is a good value
review.reviewText: Small rooms but centrally located in the SoMa area. Dicey neighborhood--especially at night. Staff was surly and not helpful at all upon check-in; there was an issue with the Expedia reservation--and tried to deny me a PREPAID room. Not cool! Hotel was clean, Starbucks in the lobby, and former grandeur is still evident. But front desk staff needs a lesson in courtesy.

review.title: Edgy Part of Town
review.reviewText: Loved the grandeur and nostalgia of this old hotel. Could use a little loving though. Staff was super nice and helpful (except the night manager who would not let us use the lobby washroom). BART entrance right outside door — very convenient. But hotel located near Tenderloin district which gets seedy at night (during the day fine!) Otherwise, central location great for excursions to different parts of the city.

review.title: No electric outlet except on floor
review.reviewText:
No electric outlet except on floor 
19 th century is over!

Not very clean

review.title: Don't check out early
review.reviewText: I was not able to check in til after 3pm  Not a problem they would hold my bags but I had somewhere to be the next morning at 8am.  I was not sure if I would be able to be back by  noon.  I asked if I would be able to store my bags.  You would have thought I was asking for money.  The man was rude and was quite hesitant about it but did agree.  I asked if I would be able to use the restrooms in the lobby (needs a key) when I came back to pick up my bags.  He was very rude and said "once you check out  no you can't"  I hadn't been in that room for 24 hours.  All I wanted to do was use a clean restroom before I got on the train.  If I had been some homeless person I could understand but I had been a hotel guest and I had just checked out early.  The security guards were very pleasant and helpful.  The hallways did look like something out of "The Shining" but it was a cool hotel.  I will never stay there because of the staff.  Other hotels in that city will do that for you.  Maybe it was just that one guy but sticks in my mind.  He was rude.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was comfortable.  It's an old hotel but it was cool.
review.negativeRemarks: Be more accommodating to people that are just trying to get along
review.locationRemarks: Many things

review.title: Around the corner from Orpheum Theatre
review.reviewText: This hotel has convenient parking. You do have to pay for the parking. Close walk to the Orpheum Theatre. Starbucks inside and no other breakfast options close by. Staff is very helpful and considerate. I enjoy having room service but this was not an option at this hotel. This is an excellent choice.
review.negativeRemarks: Vaccumn to hallway more often. Ask garbage truck drivers to wait until a decent hour as their noise at 6 AM on Saturday is disturbing.
review.locationRemarks: Orpheum Theatre

review.title: Good location for all things
review.reviewText: Bathroom was very small,  water pressure was poor

review.title: Old and Dingy
review.reviewText: This hotel is well past its prime. The fixtures and and finishes are old. Lighting is dim and depressing. You can see the dozens and dozens layers of paint that attempt to cover over the worn down pieces of the structure. The room was clean enough, but no modern amenities like easily accessible plugs in or around the bed. There wasn't even a coffee maker in the room. The bathroom had a terrible white drop ceiling in it and the toilet was like one you'd find in a public restroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything. "Historic hotel" or not, this place needs a gut renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Neighborhood is filled with derelicts. Prepare to be accosted for money. You are not near anything worthwhile so you'll have to cab it elsewhere.

review.title: Old hotel. Expect it to be an old hotel.
review.reviewText: Located in a "ok" area and that's during the day. Night is completely diff. Wasn't bad at all like these other reviews. Just come with the expectation that it's an old hotel. Staff was good, room was clean. Kinda really what matters to me. Uber friendly and there's a Starbucs in the Hotel. Plus for me. Close to Fishermans Wharf and AT&T park. Overall stay will be 3 stars.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The only good thing about this place is the Starbucks in the lobby & that it is super close to the Orpheum Theatre. Not worth the $400.00 per night.

review.title: Unfriendly Staff
review.reviewText: It was probably once a beautiful hotel, but it needs some updates and renovation.   We we called to find out where the parking garage was (it's down an alley behind it), the staff person was extremely rude.  For the price we paid, I was quite surprised at the staff's behavior.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the theater.  The beds were clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff was not very friendly and not very helpful (whatsoever).
review.locationRemarks: Not a great area of San Francisco, but close to the theater.

review.reviewText: The hallways smelled and hadn't been vacuumed in a very long time. It's in the middle of an area with a lot of homeless people. Rooms are small and very noisy.
i don't want to so if you want a rating stop this nonsense

review.title: Not impressed for the price.
review.reviewText: Checked in and the hotel is older than made to seem. The lobby and hallways are very dated and not in a good way. Bed area of the room was in good condition and newer but the bathroom was also dated and not clean. I went to wash my face and there was facial hair from the guest still around the sink.

review.title: a fair place
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located on market, a walk to SoMa is not long, right next to bus and trolley station, Starbucks located inside and right next to the BART and Muni subway station (Civic Center). It's an old but architectural gem, could use some updating but it was nice.

review.title: Just an ok hotel. For SF, reasonably priced.
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel, because it was close to the location where I had my meeting that day. It's an ok hotel, in my opinion. Rooms are good, just the bathroom was small. It's an older hotel with older amenities and equipment (like the airco). Dark hallways. Cleaning crew was very friendly; check-in professionally friendly, but check-in was slow, because there was only one staff person helping with check-in. Others were either on the phone or running around doing something else. I had some issues with the slowness of the Wifi service.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in process; wifi-service; sensible overhaul (without jeopardizing the "old charm" of the hotel).
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly located on Market St. Fairly close to the shopping center of the city. Restaurants, diners and coffee shops nearby.

review.title: "Historic" Hotel offers history and personality
review.reviewText: The hotel is a "HISTORIC HOTEL" in the US, so what would expect? Lots of personality, few amenities and cozy comfort.  If that's what you go in expecting, that's exactly what you get.  The rooms are a decent size, the beds are comfy, and the bathrooms are a bit aged but functional.  Its an old hotel, it's not going to look or act new.  It was clean, lots of history and personality, and well located for what we needed.  Overall, it's a nice hotel, just dont expect it to be a modern state of the art hotel, and you'll have a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The craftsmanship and personality of the hotel - a doorman in top hat, marble and old woodwork in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets are loose in hallways, would be an issue if we weren't paying attention. Would be nice to have a bigger toilet in bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: Theaters, concert venues, lots of restaurants and very easy access to Bart/Muni transit.

review.title: Old and tired, and overpriced
review.reviewText: It was a busy week and I  expected higher prices, but nothing about the suite I had could explain the price I paid. The furniture was worn and sparse, and not very comfortable; the room was dark and the lighting was inadequate; the overall feel was stuffy and dank.

Stayed in this hotel before also.  Great location and convenient for public transport links.
Very comfortable and clean rooms

review.title: Close to the Bart station
review.reviewText: The hotel is older and musty smell in the room. The lobby was great. The bathroom did not have counter space and lay out was weird. On the high side on cost for room. Location came in handy since right off the Bart station which we took from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs renovating and some room freshener plug ins to get rid of musty small.  Can offer better toilet paper too.
review.locationRemarks: Right close to Powell Station and walking distance to some restaurants. It just depends on how much you want to walk.

review.title: So expensive!
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and needs some remodeling. I can't believe I paid almost 300$ for a night. The only thing I liked about the hotel is the location cause it's literally in front of the Bart station.

review.title: Hole in wall
review.reviewText: Literally there was a hole in wall. First thought..bullet hole?? Second thought.. Camera???  Stained sheets. Noisy AC unit. Saw two drug deals happen right outside the front door of the hotel.

review.title: Old Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is old. This makes it beautiful, but it also needs a lot of updates because of that. No shower water pressure and the A/C did not work. The area is NOT great.

review.title: Needs updating
review.reviewText: the bathroom is in need of updating. The carpet and walls as well. The wallpaper had water damage that was dried and the carpet was not in good shape. Very nice lobby and staff.

review.title: Very scary hote
review.reviewText: We were going to stay at hotel Whitcomb for 8 days and checkedout after the 2nd day. The hotel is in a horrible area full of homeless people. We even got harassed by one of them. The air conditioner and the blow dryer was not working. We were afraid to go out at night. A scene from the Shinning. I wish we would get a refund. Vacation shouldn't be harassment. It was not cheap.

review.title: Terrible experirnve
review.reviewText: Valet car given to wring person with no ticket, very rude staff who lied and became defensive. No hot water, throw up in elevator that took a long time to clean up. Elevator kept coming down and at least 20 people where standing in lobby waiting and none of other 4 elevators came. when discussing issues with guests coming in I was told not to harass other guests. Though guests denied being bothered. Was promised a call from manager which never happened. When I called him he again denied every thing and said he would call back but didn't. I have stayed in hotels around the world and never given one bad review. So this is meaningful. I live in SF so I am used to culture here but this was ridiculous!

review.title: Affordable hotel with good public transportation
review.reviewText: The area this hotel is located seem too scary to walk around especially at night.  Too many homeless  people. The room was clean but air conditioner was  just too old and noisy.

review.title: Perfect for visiting the Orpheum
review.reviewText:
Pros: BART stop literally outside lobby. Starbucks in lobby. Mini shop in lobby for incidentals. Old sturdy building with all its charms. Orpheum theatre across the street.

Cons: small rooms. Uncomfortable beds. Not the cleanest of rooms (hair, mystery stains, what looked like a gnat buzzing around) but not so unclean you'd refuse outright to stay. No coffeemaker, microwave, fridge in room (fridge is a bonus $25/night). Parking is safe but pricey.

review.title: Best place to stay in San Francisco!!
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the hotel for four nights. From the minute we walked in to the minute we checked out the service was perfect- the staff was very attentive, friendly and were very quick and responsive when needed! 
I recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in a central area, walking distance to everything! Hayes Street (lots of restaurants and Cafes) was to be reached within 5-10 minutes by foot! 
The price of the hotel was great and fitted our budget. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the hotel offers free Wifi. 
A great historic hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, breakfast, the room, the area, Starbucks in hotel, great atmosphere amongst the staff, free Wifi

review.title: Overall it was a good stay but...
review.reviewText: The neighborhood on the next block was not the greatest. Valet was expensive for the service, we had to constantly be looking for the attendant every time we were either leaving or coming in. It was only "valet" because they don't have a garage but the service was not "valet" at all! When you pulled up to the hotel there is no signage that valet parking is in the rear of the building. There are however signs that there is no parking anytime...my husband had to stay in the car while I went to find out. The AC in our room did not work, however we never complained so I don't know what would have been had we complained. When we would walk through the lobby nobody would ever greet you or smile at least. The only people that greeted you were the housekeepers. The bathroom is extremely small, no where to lay your clothes on but the room was very clean.

review.title: City hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to the Muni and BART stations.  It is walking distance to the Civic Center and other attractions.  The hotel is beautiful and the room was comfortable.  There are a quite a few homeless people that are in the streets at all times near the hotel and at night we did not feel safe venturing out.  The Starbucks in the lobby was very convenient.

review.title: Old, probably great hotel back in the day
review.reviewText: Needs updating, everything is old and not the charming kind :( Shower was terrible, one little stream of water, no pressure. Closet door was scary, the handle was jankey, thought it would fall off. Floors are creaky and carpet needs stretching everywhere. Not a great part of town either and totally overpriced.

review.title: Historic hotel with great location
review.reviewText: Historic hotel with a beautiful lobby; rooms are a bit out dated; Initially we were in a standard king room which was a bit small and outlets did not work, but we were promptly moved to a superior king which was much more comfortable.  Our check-in was quick, staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Love having a Starbucks right downstairs; also very convenient to BART, cable cars, etc.

review.reviewText: no warring abot not having airconditioner, bum area, people who work at the hotel are excellent, from the valet guys, the receptionists, the bartenders, very sadisfyed by them.

review.title: Not bad - more like, ehhh
review.reviewText: Everything is known by comparison. Although not as posh as the Internet would suggest, it seemed a much better choice than the hotels near us. Great location, but be ready for a lot of homeless people by the enterance. The hotel is very old, and it shows. The front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. The other staff not so much. You can hearing everything though the walls. Remember, Uber can only pick you up a couple blocks down from the hotel. But scenery is nice. For the value and location, I would recommend the hotel.
It wasn't great. I feel like I greatly overpaid to stay here.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel could be demolished and then a new hotel could appear in its place.
review.locationRemarks: Watch sketchy people.

review.title: Nice old hotel
review.reviewText:
Nice place but it needs a big update.  The love and some items are fantastic examples of an age gone by with stained glass and marble all over.  But the room layout was awkward, the bathroom was functional only. 

The beds were nice.  Staff were attentive. 

There is a Starbucks in the lobby.  A real one.  The street car and BART are right in front.  Quite nice to have. There are tons of homeless across the street.  That's just to be expected in SF but Market street is a bit run down from eighth to 5th or so where the shopping district begins.  If you want to pay a lot more, you can get a hotel a few blocks closer to that area. That might be worth it if you are a single female to be honest.

review.title: Nice older hotel for the price but out of the way.
review.reviewText: We got a great deal on this hotel so it was good for the money.  It was not very close to restaurants or shopping.  The restaurant across the street was great for breakfast.  The concierge was not very helpful or enthusiastic.
review.positiveRemarks: Older but well maintained and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The walls are very thin so we heard our noisy neighbours returning at 4am from their night out.  The concierge was unenthusiastic.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is not very close to restaurants or shopping.

review.title: Not what I expected.
review.reviewText: The location was good but I did not realize just a block away the area was not the best. The AC was old and made noises all night and the shower leaked. It was not what I expected would not stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the AC units.
review.locationRemarks: Alot of shopping and restaurants nearby. Tourists need to be careful this location is close to mass transient so there are many transients in the area

review.title: Convenience in Transportation
review.reviewText: The hotel is right in front of the Bart station,the Muni, and the F bus that goes all the way to the Fisherman Wharf. It's an easy walk to shopping malls, Union Square and a block away from tour bus routes. The diner across the street serves good food. Starbucks is right on the hotels first floor. The only negative that would really bother you would be that Market St is not well protected by the city that it smells urine from 4th street to 9th street . They need to hose it down or something.Otherwise it's all very good
review.negativeRemarks: Change air conditioner to a quieter one.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping , Union square, landmarks like the Civil Court bldg, Opera House, Asian Art Museum,Chinatown,Mikkeler the bar .

review.reviewText:
Smells really bad, dirty
The bathroom was very small. 
Ac made a lot of noise

review.title: Dont stay here
review.reviewText: Dirty carpet, smells of urine, dangerous part of town, wifi is horrible, bathroom on the first floor is locked due to homeless going in, no fridge, elevators dont work, overall a bad experience.

review.title: Only good thing was Hotel was  close to my events
review.reviewText: Couldn't take a shower..Plumbing was clogged...Will not go there again
review.negativeRemarks: NA
review.locationRemarks: NA

review.title: RODENTS
review.reviewText:
Don't stay here. You've been warned. You can stay at a well known name brand hotel for just a few more dollars. 

Hallways
Reminds me of horror movies. Felt death around the corner. The shining.

Room 421 
Upon entering you're underwhelmed with how small the room is compared to the pictures. The shower is smaller than the showers you'd find in Europe. The bathroom has nowhere to put your toiletries except on the top of the toilet water tank. The sink looks like it's about to fall off the wall. The pipes are exposed and you can see the dust and rust buildup. The closet light is a lightbulb affixed to the wall with a dangled string to turn it on and it didn't even work.

I was laying on my stomach scrolling through Instagram when from the corner of my eye I saw something move across the floor from out under my bed. I thought it was a spider. So I kept looking. It might have crawled under the chair. I moved the chair. And it scrambled back under the bed. It was a mouse. 

They weren't very shocked when I called the front desk. They changed us to a "superior" room that looked exactly like the room we were in, albeit two floors up. 

Room 622
The toilet tank was leaky and made noises every so often. The shower water pressure was dismal. There were flies in the room. Got bit by a mosquito. 

Our booking was supposed to be for three nights. Left after the first. And they still charged us over two ben franks. At least we got out of there alive.
review.positiveRemarks: I did not like anything about this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: It need to be thoroughly inspected.
review.locationRemarks: The only thing to do nearby is to go on the bart and get the hell away from the hotel.

review.title: Wasn't that great
review.reviewText: Historic in every sense.  Some things need updated, like plumbing
review.negativeRemarks: Smell. Water pressure. Cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping

review.title: Not as good as it was
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at this hotel on and off for the last 10 years. It's a cheap, no frills, wonderfully located, basic, but comfortable hotel.

This wasn't my favorite time though and I might be ready to reconsider my choice. I stayed on the third floor, a little noisy, sure, but you get what you paid for. The problem was the bugs. Little flying things that seemed to concentrate around the shower drain (each time I washed them down, I was probably killing 20-30 of the things). But they kept coming back. Really yucky! I'm sure things like this are hard to stop in a hotel, but honestly, it was a little much. I filled in the complaint card when I left, but nobody contacted me.

So if you have no bugs, a good and basic place to stay. If they still have the bugs ... maybe reconsider :-(

review.title: in the city center near transportation
review.reviewText: nice staff in the front desk, clean room, walking to union square and the market
review.negativeRemarks: there is only one person in the front desk
review.locationRemarks: in the downtown, close to transportation, market is on block away

review.title: Safe Haven from the homeless traffic
review.reviewText: Besides being situated in the unfortunate homeless hornet nest, the closet was broken, the sink was dirty, and the water pressure was low.  The room was slightly dank and I wouldn't recommend staying here.

review.title: Use as a last resort
review.reviewText:
Hotel is considered "Historical", but they have not kept up the maintenance on the place.  My bathroom door would not stay closed, the shower head was only as tall as my forehead (I'm 5'10"), and the bathroom sink felt like it was going to fall over every time I touched it.  My kids could barely turn the sink facet on because it was so hard to pull the handle up.  The place is just really run down.

As for the surrounding area, this hotel is located in the Civic Center area of San Francisco.  Which, like most major cities, means there a tons of homeless people meandering about.  They were camped out directly across the street from the hotel, and I bypassed the rear / only parking entrance twice when I got there because a homeless guy decided to stop and block the entrance with his multiple carts.
review.positiveRemarks: There is an entrance to Starbucks adjacent to the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.  Plus the young Asian female that was working Conceirge seemed put out that we actually asked her about trolly schedules.

review.title: Nice Classic Hotel
review.reviewText: We arrived at the hotel at night and parking was not easy to find.  It was actually at the back of the hotel (right at the next corner and right at the alley).  It is valet parking.  At the front desk, check-in is easy and they automatically gives you the wifi access.  Wifi was very good at night but quite slow at day time.  We got a 2-bed room.  It looks old but clean.  The showerhead is so small that water coming out of it is so restricted, not to mention low pressured.  Overall, it was good for overnight stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Directions to parking and showerheads.
review.locationRemarks: There are a lot of places to eat but when we came at night, the only thing open is Burger King across the street.

review.title: Nice hotel located in center of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was right on Market street which was near a bunch of different restaurants, night clubs, and right down the street from the pier. Staff was friendly and accommodating, only issue was the valet parking price but besides that the two double bed room my friends and I booked was great everything looked clean and neat. Room came with TV, two small tables, sitting chairs, ice bucket, iron, ironing board, closet with hangers and a safe. Along with lamps and curtains which made the whole room look elegant. Will definitely book here again next time I'm in San Francsisco
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, look of the hotel, location of hotel
review.negativeRemarks: More gym equipment
review.locationRemarks: Hotel located in center of the city on Market St. There are many restaurants to choose from for all the meals of the day, night clubs, and all banks.

review.title: Not Quite worth it
review.reviewText:
A clean hotel with good size rooms and nice sheets/towels and bath products.
However the bathrooms are far from elegant and are dark and gloomily lit plus there was mouldy shower tiles and a vent fan that sounded like a plane engine. The shower water pressure was horrible. The area is up and coming but felt a bit on the edge and not safe. 
Definitely not a 300 dollar a night or more hotel, more like 250 and less.
review.positiveRemarks: A clean hotel with good size rooms and nice sheets/towels and bath products.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure, decor in bathrooms (kind of felt like a public toilet)
review.locationRemarks: The Market at the Twitter building was a nice place to get take out.

review.title: Not a 3 star hotel
review.reviewText: We wanted a 3 star hotel near the Orpheum theater. We recently had a baby and we wanted to be within walking distance in case our baby sitter needed us to leave early. Hotel staff did not help us get the stroller up the stairs after parking, which is an additional $38 plus tax! The hotel is historic and very pretty in the lobby. Our room had nice linens but did not have a coffee maker or mini fridge. The bathroom was not updated in anyway. The sink had large cracks in it and the toilet had a lever, like you see in public restrooms. There was poor water temp. There was no connectivity to the wifi. There was a homeless woman making a scene and who ran out of the lobby when we got back from the theater. Also, there were young girls running and yelling in the hallway between 3 and 4 am, while my wife was nursing the baby. It was not the kind of room I was happy to pay $189 plus tax for.

review.title: Pretty hotel but that's it....
review.reviewText: Worst service I have ever had. The hotel is pretty and historic but the service was terrible. They ruined the whole experience of staying in a nice hotel from the valet to the reception and even room serivice, these people have almost 0 etiquette. For the price your paying the hotel is nice but the service is not worth it.

review.title: Clean this place up
review.reviewText: The hallways looked they hadn't been vacuumed in years and the room smelled like stale cigarette. Not even a coffee maker in the room. Horrible value, seedy hotel

review.title: Rooms on Market St
review.reviewText: I got stuck on the 2nd floor facing Market St. I slept 3 hrs per night. Way too much noise. I'm a light sleeper so I disliked my room location.

review.title: Historic but disappointing
review.reviewText: The building itself is really cool and location is right on the F bus to take you to the Warf and the City Center metro. The staff was cold and unfriendly. My questions about things to do, where the bus runs, if there was any fishing recommendations, and where the pharmacy was were all answered with sarcasm or no answer at all. The room was slightly small and the bed was not a queen, but a double. The room was adequately clean and there were many extension cords for all our electronics. The biggest drawback is that the building surrounds the valet parking lot and there is noise all night long with cars being parked. Our final morning we were woke at 7:45 to jack hammering in that area. Then at 8:30 we had the maid knocking on the door. Cool building, but with the multitudes of places to stay in SF, I would not return.
review.positiveRemarks: Really cool architecture and historic elements throughout. Nice location near several forms of public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to hire people who like assisting the public. And please try to begin construction after 9am.

review.reviewText: Old, worn, musty, small room, not clean. Noisy rooms and did not like the area. I won't stay there again

review.title: Good hotel, interesting neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, the only flaw was that where they had the continental breakfast was so hard to find. Otherwise, the hotel was wonderful. The worst part of the stay was the neighborhood. I would not walk alone or at night in the neighborhood. Per family and friends that live around the area, the neighborhood is considered a very high crime area as well as a huge homeless population. Overall the stay was fine.

review.title: OMG!!!!  The Lobby is Great.  The Room terrible!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very outdated and our room had mold clearly visible on the walls.
review.negativeRemarks: The knobs on the air conditioner were removed so we could not adjust the temperature.  Once you left the lobby, the upper floors were really bad.
review.locationRemarks: Homeless everywhere

review.title: Nice old hotel in a sketchy area
review.reviewText: The hotel is old but has nice architecture. I got a discount with Expedia, but I wonder if it's worth taking this discounted rooms. It was located in the back of the hotel, no view. The room was small, the bathroom couldn't be locked. The internet was very slow, couldn't connect a tablet or a phone to the wireless internet. The room didn't have curtains that could be closed, only thin, transparent ones.
review.negativeRemarks: Better Internet, fix the bathroom lock, more TV channels
review.locationRemarks: The area around the hotel is very sketchy. Lots of homeless people begging for money, and some people that look very threatening.

review.title: Horrible Customer Service
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a business trip. The hotels and rooms are outdated, but manageable. What made our visit terrible was the discourteous and neglectful staff. They tried to charge us fees for services that we did not request, such as an extra cot and car rental. When we disputed the charges they were extremely rude and insisted that there was no error. They also signed for, and lost a very valuable package that was shipped to the hotel. When addressing this issue, the manager, Kevin, made no attempt at offering consolation or reimbursement for the lost items.

review.title: Never Again!
review.reviewText: Aside from the historical status of this hotel, there is nothing inviting about it. I was placed in a room that had a view of the air conditioning units, and was very small and basic. The carpeting was old and tired, and smelled as old as the building itself. The hotel is located in an area that is heavily populated by homeless people, and this was the first time ever that I felt unsafe around any hotel. As a solo traveler, this was definitely a deal-breaker.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping needs to pay attention to the "do not disturb" sign - someone from housekeeping knocked on my door when the sign was up.

review.title: Whitcomb Hotel, SF.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location.  I don''t want to add anything else here.
review.negativeRemarks: Include breakfast with hotel stay.
review.locationRemarks: Market Street and Civic Center activities.  Farmers' Market, Asian Art Museum, etc.

review.reviewText: Just okay. Lighting could be improved and walls are very thin.

review.title: Nice hotel convenient to ATT Park
review.reviewText: Would return again when in town. Proximate at all transportation
Overall excellent stay. Friendly and helpful staff, comfortable and clean room. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel for the price in such an expensive city.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We stayed In San Franciisco for two nights and three days. The Hotel Whitcomb is in a good location, staff was nice, friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel is a historic hotel and is over 100 years old. Our room was small, but clean, and well furnished, bathroom was also small, but had everything we needed. The bed was comfortable, towels were large and soft. We are from a rural area and the city seems noisy to us, but with the window closed it was quiet. The only negative is that the hallways (at least on the second floor) smell a little smokey.
review.positiveRemarks: Very charming, lobby is lovely. Employees were very friendly and knowledgeable.
review.negativeRemarks: There is a Starbucks right off the lobby, but I would rather have coffee and tea available in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location on Market Street easy walking to Union Square, transportation and restaurants.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great spot. Very old place so basic rooms are small but have what you need.  Didn't use restaruant or bar but looked nice. Check out Asian Art Museum if you go.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe some attention to some little things in room  but not bad for its age

review.title: Beautiful to look at but one of the worst exper...
review.reviewText: Very rude staff. Every step of the way they just got wrong. They did finally comp one day and parking fees however.

review.title: Night clerk very accommodating
review.reviewText: I arrived after midnight & night clerk upgraded me to a beautiful suite - vintage, but very clean & king bed comfortable. The clerk also found out it was my bday so he had 2 security guards & himself serenade happy bday to me.

review.title: Downtown Access to Different Places
review.reviewText: Don't let the other reviews keep you from staying in this lovely hotel. Yes it was built in the 1900's, it has history, character &  has been kept up very well. As far as homeless people, hello? It's located in downtown...what city doesn't have homeless people? They don't bother you as much as any other homeless person does at your hometown. If you prefer not to see the truth about homelessness then stay is a 5 star, cater to your every need over priced hotel elsewhere. If you can look past the environment it is located on you can enjoy your stay & have easy access to shopping, tours, trolleys historical buildings & much more at walking distance. You can use Uber to get to further areas or get familiar w/public transportation it's cheaper & you can have your own tour of San Fran in your own personalized way. Keep an open mind & you will enjoy your visit.

review.title: hotel can use a deep cleaning, has a muggy smell
review.reviewText: It was a nice place other than the old muggy smell down the hallway. Parking prices are horrible.

it is too expensive comared to the quaility 
it is like less than 2 star hotel

review.title: Great location, next to Bart and other rail.
review.reviewText: Grand Old Hotel that has life yet.  Easy to travel the city from transportation provided.
review.locationRemarks: The location was within walking distance to the San Francisco Market.

review.title: Dirty old, historical hotel in a BAD neighborhood
review.reviewText:
When you enter the lobby, you can tell it is an older, historical building, which may seem impressive to some. The staff is pleasant.  The queen room suite is a joke.  It was a tiny musty room, with a mattress with unfitted sheets.  There was hair stuck on the bathroom walls upon arrival, which was never cleaned.  The bathroom had no counter space. the toilet’s a really old “school” bathroom with a handle bar to flush. The towels had stains on it. Overall the place was gross!  
The worst part was that this hotel is located in a dangerous part of San Francisco.  All the tour guides were telling us to be careful and that people have gotten jumped.  There were so many homeless people who appeared to have severe metal illnesses.  For example, while waiting at a bus stop, there was a guy jumping up and down who was eating an orange, peel and all then through it up while he continued to jump up and down. I feel bad for these people, but at the same time, being surrounded by so many of them just roaming the streets felt like a horror movie.
So with the dirty hotel and its poor location, I would advice people to stay away from this hotel and area.
review.negativeRemarks: Move it's location and update the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is in a bad neighborhood.  I would stay away!

review.reviewText: Terrible location. Terrible hotel. Will not be coming back

review.title: Marginal part of town.
review.reviewText: Bathroom tube was not clean. I was there 4 nights and they only changed sheets twice. Easy acces to public transportation.

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel in the wrong part of town
review.reviewText: When I booked it said that there was self parking for a fee. We had no idea the parking was 38 US. The price for this hotel might be ok if it was in a nice area. As it turns out it is in the worst part of the city with homeless people and not comfortable to walk around. The back room we were placed at was in a stairwell. We wanted to leave but would have to pay for one of the two nights left. We were given a better room when we complained and a free dinner but it still did not make up for the fact that the location spoiled our trip. Stay away from this hotel.

review.title: good stay. calm room
review.reviewText: overall good. it was nice good room. safe. and friendly staff.. generally would recommend. price is little above than actual worth.that is my feeling

review.title: I guess its chick is how old is the hotel
review.reviewText: The room was too small, however it had everything we needed. It's a beautiful place in downtown, which also makes it very attractive. The biggest problem was the amount of homeless people surrounding the hotel. Everywhere stank of human pee.

review.title: worst hotel I have ever been to:
review.reviewText: First of all, very bad access from parking area and no help and you need to lift your bags from stairs. At reception, rude staff. I was with family and booked two rooms which were prepaid and they gave me very far apart rooms. We needed an extra roll away bed that took 3 hours to come after yelling at staff multiple times at night. They brought a bed and did not bother to set it in the room and left it inside the room as it was folded and broken. Bed rooms have very poor lighting like you are having candle light dinner there. Bed rooms and Bathrooms looked like at least 120 years old. The next day you go to shower and found out ..NO Shampoo and conditioner. No Hook in the room to hang clothes. They say WiFi is available but it does not even work. No Trash can in bed rooms. No one cleaned the room the next day. very bad Insulation. Whole night was disturbed with noises from outside. DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. Will never go there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is fine but poor access if you are driving
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Ok hotel.
review.reviewText: Safe in the closet was broken so the safe door was hanging out and ahrd to always close the closet door. Hot Water in the wash basin cannont be controlled and I got lightly burnt several times. there will be streams of hot water all of a sudden. I did runt it for a while before using.

review.title: WiFi does not work
review.reviewText:
The wifi did not work - occasionally it would connect enough for a page to SLOWLY load... but overall there was no actual internet connection.  Other people were having the same problem based on the number of iPhone hot spots I saw popping up in the network list.

The staff was also extremely rude and unprofessional handling a complaint from another guest while I was checking in.

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: The lobby is the highlight. It's ok all around: staff, rooms, location. The "gym" has a few treadmills, stationary bikes and ellipticals, no weights or other machines.
review.negativeRemarks:
The hotel can use a refresh and renovation based upgrades to the rooms. Get rid of the carpets. 
More variety for resistance training in the gym.
review.locationRemarks:
The location is fairly central in the city. Many homeless in the area.
Walk to Union Square, AT&T Park, many shops and restaurants.

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice I loved the hallways to the rooms and the walkways but the room was too basic for the price paid. It was a nice hotel, just expected better.

review.title: It was old
review.reviewText: It was pleasant and served its purpose.  Not alot of amenities.  This hotel caters to German speaking tourists.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee in the room would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Warf is within a 20. minute trolly ride

review.title: Very convenient to go to the tourist places
review.reviewText: My stay in the hotel was good, the hotel has an excellent location but they need to improve the internet service (wifi) it was so bad.

review.title: May be historic, but not a great place.
review.reviewText: Very small room, not proper placing of furniture. Too small a toilet/bathroom. Wifi is horrible. It got connected only once in my entire stay 16 hours. If you want to work using study desk, you have to squeeze yourself in and I bet, you will struggle to get out of your chair. Restaurant for breakfast seems to be better and overall the saving grace, is the only staff. They are very courteous and friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is good. BART station is just 3 minutes away.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything, from positioning of bed, desk to Wifi connectivity.

review.reviewText: Bad neiborhood and slow internet, but really nice staff and very clean room

review.title: Great Location, so-so facitlies
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the location of this hotel as it is centrally located to where you can walk to theaters, Union Square and other  sites in SF. The staff was great, the facilities need a bit of updating, especially the air conditioners/window units in the room.  Overall it was a pleasant experience at a reasonable price.

review.title: Think twice about paying $300+ to stay here
review.reviewText: Inadequate a/c, even after we changed rooms.  WiFi didn't work well; concierge was there to sell trips, not answer questions.  Nobs fell of furniture and bathroom fixtures.  Hotel staff made me look dumb because I didn't know mujch about the city: God figure...I was a guest in town.  Dark halls.  This antique hotel has the potential to be a great spot; all the raw ingredients are there.  They're just too raw right now to spend several hun dred dollars a night there for a room when there is so much competition so nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: see my experience, above
review.locationRemarks: Opera, ballet, symphony, shopping, businesses, fast & fine restaurants, safe neighborhood, tourist attractions and sites.  Just a $$7 Uber to anywhere

review.title: Everything about Lobby, nothing about room
review.reviewText:
we just stayed there for 2 nights on July 26 and 27th. Everything and all efforts on Lobby. How much you canstay in lobby, for me you can only enjoy lobby about 10-15 minutes of your stay. Room should been given preference too, that's where you sleep and take rest. Rooms are too crowded, shower was terrible, you literally had to stand there for 20 minutes to take shower. Bed had hair, so that means sheets were not changed, phone was not working.
No refrigerator. No coffee Maker. No microwave. Only thing is location, that's about it. Staff was nice and pleasant, no complaint about staff. Rooms and hallway are dirty and old.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be cleaned and add ammenities

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Station.
review.reviewText:
There was some rumbling in the pipes of the shower. But it wasn't a problem. Close to Union Station and the Bart was right outside the door and was a 30 minute ride to the airport. 
Overall a good experience.

review.title: Beatufil and historical
review.reviewText: Well located in the city.Valet  Parking available but a 38 dls per day but very convenient. Starbucks access through the lobby. Beatiful hotel because it is old and charming.

review.title: Good location. Never stay on2nd floor.
review.reviewText: Our room was located on the 2nd Floor facing Market Street. The room was so noisy! The flag outside the room was banging all night, the homeless people who live directly outside hotel were loud and disruptive throughout the night. The light and fan in bathroom was so loud we often left it off and kept door open. The hotel was clean and had great access to city.

review.title: Don't!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: We booked because it was so close to The Orpheum Theatre, but that is its only plus. The bed practically fell apart when we sat down, the mattress was so old. There was a swarm of small insects in the shower (they jumped so I didn't want to get to close to identify them). Overall you could tell that the hotel was magnificent at one time, but now it's just run down and sad. Spend the extra few bucks and stay somewhere else.

review.title: meh Hotel, just inside bad neighborhood
review.reviewText: It met the need of having somewhere to sleep.  I am heading back to SF next month and will not be staying here.

review.title: Charming and cute
review.reviewText:
The lobby was cute and I loved the elevators. On every floor the elevators had lovely mirrors. The room was small but clean. The closest and bathroom were large for such a small room. The bathroom was very simple and old fashioned and the shower area was poorly lit. 
 
I was disappointed that they didn't have room service. The bar and restaurant were cute like the lobby but not worth visiting. When we briefly stopped at the tavern for a drink we heard a table complaining that no one had come to take their order for half an hour. And the bartender didn't seem to find it that important.
Parking was expensive but hey its SF and it was valet. Overall decent.

review.title: Convenient to my business.
review.reviewText: Bart Station exit is right in front of hotel so the trip from San Francisco airport to hotel was quick and easy.  Many guest were European, especially Germans on holiday.
review.positiveRemarks: Old world charm and historic role in SF history.
review.locationRemarks: Good shopping and close to fine dining.

review.title: Worked in a pinch
review.reviewText:
Check in was smooth other than the fact the clerk neglected to tell us there was a 50 dollar early check in fee. We arrived early and asked to check bags.. He advised us room was ready so we said great. Git a test notification of a 5O dollar charge on credit card an hour alter..Still disputing it w hotel.
The room itself was not too bad untill we found hair on our washclothes and large amounts stuck to tile floor and walls too.. Disgusting

review.title: 3 nights stay with family
review.reviewText: You could tell that this has been a classy hotel once. It has become a little bit outdated. We didnt like the fact that there are a lot of homeless people in the street in front of the hotel. The roll away bed we had in our room was not so good.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean. Nice entrance. Starbucks located close to the reception.
review.negativeRemarks: Better roll away beds.
review.locationRemarks: A lot of homeless people on Market Street, walk on the same side as the hotel. OK distance to walk to Union square.

review.title: Nice hotel with plenty of character
review.reviewText: Hotel in a good location if you don't mind the Vagrants.  Reception staff not friendly but were efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: The friendliness of the reception staff.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location with plenty of tram and metro stops along the street.

review.reviewText: Nice place to stay in the civic center area.  Lots of attractions in the area, loved the Market Place just down the street.

review.title: Former Grand Hotel beyond its prime but charming
review.reviewText:
Booked on short notice a short trip to SF and Whitcomb was the only affordable option in central SF. Prices are crazy in that city. This is a hotel that is listed as a historical landmark and it feels like it used to be one of the greatest hotels on the West Coast. The lobby is especially spectacular, large rooms, large hallways, perfect location on Market close to downtown.
I understand that the owners don't feel like turning the whole place into a first rate gem of a hotel which is what the Whitcomb could be. But a couple of things need to be done immediately: GET FASTER INTERNET! Improve the kitchen and the menu. Renovate at least the public area, mainly the restrooms.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the historic charme.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet, Food, Public area
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is walking distance to most attraction in downtown SF. Also a subway station is right outside the door.

review.title: Right in the middle of everything. Good access.
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at this hotel several times. In town for the Grateful Dead shows, and enjoyed the pride parade.
Excellent San Francisco experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the location and the beds in  the rooms. Sleep well.
review.negativeRemarks: They do a fine job.
review.locationRemarks: At the epicenter of everything.

review.title: Very close to union square
review.reviewText: Staff was really good some rooms are a bit smaller than others but very comfortable. Easy access to public transport

review.title: Old hotel needs updates.
review.reviewText: Bathroom: fruit flies, light bulb is broken, shelf above sink is broken, shower very weak.  Internet wi fi connection is awful.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom, internet
review.locationRemarks: Close to City hall

review.title: Good hotel for the area.
review.reviewText: Thia area is filled with transients and homeless.  The hotel is nice but in an area with a lot going on so you nights rest is dependent upon your room.  You can hear everything on the street.  Nice room very eclectic.

review.title: Smelly and dirty
review.reviewText: The hotel is outdated and gloomy. We got to our room and letft after 10 minutes. It was small, cramped, smelly and dirty. We did get the full refund thanks to the intervention by Expedia.

review.title: Historic high ceilings
review.reviewText: Had beautiful high ceilings with really comfortable beds. However, light in the bathroom seeped into the bedrooms and the doors needed to be closed in order to get a darkened room.  Bathrooms need to be updated.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was right off the BART which was convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Increase power outlet availability, the only one we could find was in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to a lot of shopping stores and restaurants.

review.reviewText: Very very old hotel and everything inside is very very old but staff is nice

review.title: Great location for symphony, opera.
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb is a 10 minute walk to the War Memorial Opera House and the Davies Symphony Hall, and across the street from the Orpheum Theatre. It is also just up the escalator from a subway (BART) stop.  Very convenient if you are coming to town to see performances at those venues.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.  Restaurant in hotel, also a Starbucks.
review.negativeRemarks: Market Street and the area around city Hall has it share of homeless people.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Nice and clean hotel just next to bus/cable bus stop. Very nice historical building. Great for a few days city visit.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, next to public transportation stop

review.reviewText: Very noisy at night inside hotel and outside hotel. phone did not work, and no tp in bathroom?

review.title: Great price and great location.
review.reviewText:
We had a great experience  at the Whitcomb.  The staff was so nice and so finally the entire time of our stay. 

Pros: Location, Price and Starbucks downstairs!
Cons: A little outdated water pressure in shower.

review.title: Great Hub
review.reviewText: Historic hotel in the heart of SF. Close to everything! I love it! Lobby is beautiful especially the large columns and elegant looking chandeliers! Besides logistics, The carpet stinks and the ac does not work.

review.title: Gloomy
review.reviewText: Hotel has a gloomy tower of terror look to it. Sketch neighborhood and valet parking is ridiculous.

review.title: Tentative Neighborhood
review.reviewText: This is an old historic hotel. Lots of rooms but nothing extra special. Few perks, if any, except maybe if you're with a tour group. Large lobby and there's fee parking available behind the building. The adjoining restaurant and bar can be pricey. Starbucks anchors the east end front. Opera, Symphony, the Orpheum, the Civic, and City Hall are very close. Rooms are fine; ceilings are high. Housekeeping is good and efficient. If you plan on sleeping in, hang the do not disturb sign on the door. No fridge, microwave, or coffee maker in my room. But there was an ice bucket. Vending was by the elevator. Wi-Fi worked O.K. but the business center computer and printer come with a charge. Biggest downside is the neighborhood. During the day an open air drug market runs unfettered across the way. Because of this, many guests seemed to take a cab out of the area rather than walk. Even for nearby venues. But the metro stops at the door. Find exit B1 for the best access. Also, you can use this metro entry to cross Market Street without dodging the city traffic. If you return late night, don't forget your room key. Security guards block the elevators to non-guests.
review.positiveRemarks: The Starbucks may come in handy.
review.negativeRemarks: Security outside the hotel's main entrance needs to be enhanced.
review.locationRemarks: The world famous San Francisco Symphony and Opera play just two blocks away.

review.title: Not recommended
review.reviewText: It's overcharged! Not so good as expected！ room is small without refrigerator . No free wifi , no free parking, no breakfast. And the traffic round the hotel is complicated!

review.title: Convenient but not comfortable
review.reviewText:
The hotel building is quite old but they have made efforts to update things including desks with additional three prong outlets. The air in the room was musty and the bed overly saggy in the middle. The blackout curtains were much appreciated and although everything was old, all the plumbing and electrical seemed to work just fine. Overall not a bad hotel but not a great one either. 

The location is very close to the BART Civic Center stop and conveniently located along the F train line. Overall there is a large homeless population in the downtown area so it's hard to avoid being approached constantly.
review.negativeRemarks: Better beds
review.locationRemarks: Close to the public library, city hall, opera house

review.title: Lots of character
review.reviewText: Loved the ornate finishes in the lobby!  Great location near the theater, downtown, easy access to the trolley to get to the wharf.  Unfortunately downtown SF has a huge homeless population and they tend to clog up Market street in the evening, making it feel less safe to walk around.  We were not bothered for the most part, but some disturbing behavior cannot be unseen.

Ok. This is an old hotel, decorated mainly in shades of brown.  Dark halls and rooms make for a gloomy experience. It is close to Civic Center, theater, symphony, opera, and therefore practical, although the sidewalks in the area are dirty and teeming with homeless people in various stages of drugs, alcohol, sickness, mental illness, and desperation.  This area, and the restaurants and hotels in it, could be greatly improved.
review.negativeRemarks: decor, plumbing
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.reviewText:
Quiet, clean, and comfortable.
The staff was friendly and very attentive/helpful.

review.title: Not so nice
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was horrible and rude. Do not stay here unless you like getting ripped off. They charged me for a night I did not even stay and refused to give me a refund. They are thieves and I will never give them my money again.

review.title: Nice vintage archetecture and  grand lobby
review.reviewText: Nice Heritage Hotel in a very convenient spot for the Orpheum Theater where a lot of the touring Broadway musicals play.  The decor in the rooms is a bit bland and the VOD didn't work until a technician came to the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The room decor could be spruced up a bit and the infrastucture of the rooms could work better. In addition to the faulty VOD we had a dripping faucet.
review.locationRemarks: Right across the street from the Orpheum Theater. Close to City Hall.

review.reviewText: Prime location for pride. The only thing  was the parking. It's around $40 for parking.

review.title: Whitcomb lavish stlye
review.reviewText:
The Bart lets you off right in front easy accesses to trains, trollys. 
Pancakes are a bit steep. Love the lobby. And the bed was comfy.

review.title: Excellent location. Perfect for the the pride even
review.reviewText: Love staying in this Hotel. Had a great view to Market street and the parade. The only little problem is that the bathroom door would not lock. A little pricey for one night.
Power outlets didn't work. The size was so small it was ridiculous.

review.title: Meh
review.reviewText: Situated in a sketchy part of town the hotel is really dated and not that clean. Everything is worn and old.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: I would stay in the area with Children. Fine during the day but a bit sketchy at night

review.title: a bed to sleep in for an overnight stay in the cit
review.reviewText: Parking was inconvenient and expensive.  Parking should be included in the price of the room
review.negativeRemarks: Parking

review.reviewText: The room is okay but it is a little bit small. The restroom is really small, it's hard to fit just 1 person. The room is pretty old, we can hear people talking from outside. The beds and pillows are definitely a cons because they are too hard, I cannot feel any comfort on the bed after a long day outside. However, the staff are friendly and they clean the room pretty well, I give that as a pros. Overall, I rate it 4/5 for the location and the staff.

review.title: Old but beautiful lobby.
review.reviewText: Clean, old but served our purpose for two nights. Close to everything. Yes, there are homeless around but not really bothersome to anyone who lives in a city. Staff nice and efficient.

review.title: Yikes!
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the lobby. A lot of vintage charm. Very old world San Francisco. Has a Starbucks in the lobby which was nice for breakfast. The yikes comes from the bed bug bites my son woke up with!!  His back was covered with bites. The bathroom was also very run down and the water pressure was horrible. Will not be staying here ever again.

The double beds were full beds too small for two people.  The shower was not good because the water pressure was terrible.  The hotel is very old but covienantely located near the ferry building for our tour of San Francisco.
Although the location is good the lack of amenities takes away from the overall experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Disappointing that the room had no clock, coffee option in the room or lobby, no notepad or pen.

review.title: Very nice hotel, and the rooms are very spacious
review.reviewText:
The hotel is conveniently located along many transportation stops, and in Market street which is very central in San Francisco. The two bed room we stayed was very spacious and perfectly accommodated three people. Our room, however, was right by the elevators and therefore we had a lot of noise of people chatting waiting for the elevators, which was not so good. One day we got out of the room at about 11:30 am and when we got back at night our rooms was not cleaned, which was not so good as well. I had to ask the next day for someone to clean up the room.
It has a starbucks below, great to have something in the morning/night, and close to several eating spots (like SAM's which was very nice).
review.negativeRemarks: The room cleaning
review.locationRemarks: Very central location, close to public transport

review.title: I love this hotel!
review.reviewText: I have nothing to complain about. To all the motorcyclists out there. If you ride your bike valet parking is a lot cheaper.

review.title: Good location and hotel for the price
review.reviewText: parking was a bit confusing, as you can't pull up to the front and have to find your own way to the alley in the back of the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants and lounges within walking distance from the hotel, and if you want to go someplace further away, the bellhop was very helpful in hailing us a taxi.
review.positiveRemarks: The historic architecture and decor is great

review.title: Close to everythig we needed.
review.reviewText: Convenient location , easy to get around. Curious vale attends. Noisy room,facing the street from traffic.

review.title: Good location and charming historic hotel
review.reviewText: My room was very comfortable, although small. But I saw that there are larger rooms facing the exterior of the property. I would request that in the future. It was quiet and the staff was very helpful. The walk to the water is a direct one but longer than it appears on a map. 8 VERY long blocks!
Dirty place. There was blood stains and yellow stains on the bed.  Bathroom is dirty. Parking entrance is hard to find.

review.title: Nice hotel, but look for sale prices
review.reviewText: It's a nice hotel but their "superior queen bed on a superior floor" is a bit miss leading.. The bed was a little bigger then a full and the view was of the wall of the next wing of rooms.. Rooms were clean but they DON'T have refridgerator's.. The maid staff was very accommodating and polite... (Except for the knock at the door at 11:30pm to give towels, which would have been nice if it were the right room)... I haven't stayed InThe Bay Area in a while and I know you have to pay for parking but an additional $15.00 on top of the price is a little excessive in my opinion for a "oversize" vehicle.. I have a full size pickup so any SUV or fullsize will be considered a "oversize"...  It was a short taxi ride to ATT park or the wharf... It was a nice hotel but I will look elsewhere before booking there again...
Looks like the reception staff were hired from military- where is the smile? Doesn't cost a thing!

review.title: value for money in SF
review.reviewText: it looks like this place belongs to the 70s but it is a nice atmosphere and it is so very central. If you want to save some money, stay in a clean room very close to the financial district and main attractions in SF this is the place. My room was a bit noisy due to the constructions next door, maybe ask for a room not facing the main road.
review.negativeRemarks:
quality of furnitures
it was a bit cold in the room
review.locationRemarks: close to the city centre, financial district and many restaurants

review.title: Great historic hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel had historic charm. However it does need some updating (which it looks like they doing), but the price and location were great! I would stay there again

review.title: Lovely
review.reviewText: Small rooms, but clean. Friendly staff, great location, easy check-in.

review.title: Great location and hotel!
review.reviewText: I loved my two nights in The City!  I came up for the Giants game and wanted to stay a couple nights and found this gem of a hotel.  Friendly staff and a nice size room, I also loved the historic feel and architecture of the hotel. I highly recommend staying at Hotel Witcomb, it was a pleasure!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Central to everything

review.title: Decent hotel, poor location
review.reviewText: I stayed for one night at the Whitcomb Hotel. The rooms are OK and they have Starbucks inside the hotel, which is good. But its location is awful. Even if you have access to all kinds of transportation in Market Street, the surroundings are scary. We saw bunches of homeless around, as well as many drug addicts. The scenario gets better a few blocks East.

review.title: Uncomfortable beds and inconvenient rooms.
review.reviewText:
There were very old beds and no bath tub.
Rooms was clean but bed was really old and uncomfortable. Many homeless near by this hotel makes degerus night time.
No recommend!

review.title: Not recommended despite good hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel is decent, not much to expect from. 
Its branded as one of the historic hotels but still wouldn't recommend as its far away from many city attractions.
A few blocks from hotel to City square is so shady where you would see a lot many drunkards and beggars.
review.locationRemarks:
Shady, not at all recommended for family and those traveling with small children.
Really bad neighborhood also far from city attractions.

review.reviewText: The Hotel Whitcomb is decent place to stay if you aren't staying for a long period of time and plan not be in your room for a long time and plan to be out and about more than staying in your room.  The accommodations were okay, it was certainly clean, but the hotel felt a bit dated in the rooms (even though the architecture was amazing) and the neighborhood during the day, and especially at night, is a bit sketchy.  Not probably a hotel we'd bring our kids to, but was fine for my husband and I for a one-nighter when we were out for most of the day/evening and had a safe place to sleep (they had inside security guard monitoring the lobby).  We liked that there was a Starbucks right next door/connected to the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good in terms of what are plans were for the one night we stayed in SF.  Not a lot of frill, but for the price, it was a very good find.
review.negativeRemarks: The issues mentioned in terms of no frills or neighborhood are really not the hotel's issue per se.  So for our stay, it was just what we needed.
review.locationRemarks: Market St and to Civic Center are good reasons to stay, but the neighborhood has a 'harder' element to it.  It is okay for couples, but not for kids.

review.reviewText: the room was not clean throughly. My room was very noisy because of construction on the next block, the free WiFi was terrible(low speed, not reliable,..) The matters was kinda curvy and like over-used.
review.locationRemarks: A huge construction going on the next block. Noisy rooms on that side.

review.title: Read the Reviews
review.reviewText:
First mistake - I didn't read the reviews of which I now support. I chose the hotel due to location to my business meeting. Right from the start a surly front desk clerk who must have thought that he was a waiter in an expensive restaurant.

In retrospect, I would pay out of pocket the $200 the decent hotels in San Francisco garner at $500. This hotel is dirty, dated and smells. I paid extra for the preferred floor. I feel for the guests on the regular floors. 

This hotel needs to be gutted and completely refurbished. It reminds me of similar properties I have stayed at in central China. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. I now have taken the time and read the other reviews and totally agree. I was looking for Danny and his Hot Wheel trike to motor down the corridor.
review.positiveRemarks: The guys in the valet were polite while taking my $35 plus tip.
review.negativeRemarks: Level it.
review.locationRemarks: It appears thAt there are some theaters nearby. The Market is a good place to get a couple of sandwiches and a cookie for $35 like I did.

review.title: Vintage hotel, close to BART and trolley cars
review.reviewText: Hotel was vintage but very nice. Restaurant was very good. We took the BART from the airport and walked about one block to hotel. Room was small but had everything we needed. Bathroom was spotless. We bought the day pass for cable cars and buses. Bus route was very close to hotel. Four elevators were pretty fast. Starbucks in lobby  was convenient for breakfast. It is colder than you would expect, about 55 degrees in May.
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART. Bus stop was close. Cable car ride was exciting.

review.title: Not the Ritz, not a tragedy either. Adjust rating!
review.reviewText: I guess the main problem with this hotel is the 3.5 stars it has. Comparable 3.5 star hotels are simply better. This expectation is not met. The hotel is a historic building and the efforts to keep it going seem to be kept at the minimum required, like the carpets or the creaking elevator doors. Having said that, it's not a tragedy like some reviews state. Wifi was fine, shower was too small but fine, room was OK and I asked for a quite one so I got a room in the back (not market street) which allowed me to sleep. I had packages delivered and they were handled with care. Staff was OK. The area is filled with homeless people but then again that goes on all over Market street. So the message is, adjust your expectations to a 3 or 2.5 star hotel and you'll be fine.
review.negativeRemarks: the rating. adjust to 3 stars
review.locationRemarks: Good location but the street is a little rough.

review.reviewText: I was there on business and it was a great hotel. I would recommend this hotel for business travelers or others who want to feel that old SF charm.

review.title: Great location but definitely needs a lot of work
review.reviewText:
Great location but they need to renovate many parts of this hotel. 
 One night I didn't even have any towels. 
 They left a note on my bed saying that if I needed to tell please contact the front desk, only problem was when I contacted them they still had no towels.  There is no legitimate excuse for this!

review.title: Decent hotel near everything including Bart
review.reviewText: Decent hotel for the money. Rooms and bathrooms are small but clean. Beds are very comfortable though! I would stay there again.

review.title: Lovely historic hotel!
review.reviewText:
Ignore any negative reviews that talk about the neighborhood.  The Hotel Whitcomb is on Market Street, in the heart of the Theatre district and a block from the Civic Center.  Yes, at night this part of Market can be, er, interesting - but the Hotel goes to great pains to maintain the safety and security of its guests, and I never had a single moment that I felt uneasy or unprotected.  As for the facility itself, well, it's one of the grand hotels from a century ago when things were more gracious and elegant, and it's lost none of its stately beauty with the passage of time.  The lobby is astonishing in its patrician beauty, the elevators and hallways were impeccable, and the Market Street Grille (which serves excellent food) manages to be uniquely elegant and welcoming to the casual guest at the same time.

Our room was spacious and comfortable, with two closets, a writing desk and wonderfully inviting beds and pillows.  The weakest aspect of the whole thing was the bathroom - but its only drawback is that it could use a little updating.  It was impeccably clean, with excellent plumbing, water pressure and counter area for toiletries.  And the white tea bath soaps are the best I've ever had, at any hotel, anywhere.  

The hotel staff was professional, gracious and efficient and seemed genuinely dedicated to making us welcome and comfortable.  In short, there's nothing not to love here.  It will be my pleasure to stay at the Hotel Whitcomb on my next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Historical hotel but not practical
review.reviewText: The rooms are small, the table is small not practical to work. The electrical  plugs do not work so difficult to connect the laptop. The internet is not continuous.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is well connected by Bart, Trolley/ bus and subway.
review.negativeRemarks: Better internet connection and a coffee machine in the room would make the hotel more attractive.
review.locationRemarks: Many restaurants around and easy access to transportation.

review.reviewText: The staff is not helpful and the condition of rooms is not good

review.title: Ok close to main tram line
