review.reviewText: Only one towel for 2 people. No hot water at night for shower. Very noisey could here other folks shower water. No information or maps. Had to work out ourselves where everything was located including the dinning room

My room was very small, and somewhat old. While they tried to update it a bit, I still felt like I was staying at the YMCA or something. I had a view of the back of the hotel (through my very small window) and sounded like there was an alley or a street below i.e. lots of noise. Overall, not a very nice experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to all public transportation i.e. the bus, BART, etc.

review.title: Had to movie rooms
review.reviewText: Tiny nicely decorated. Hardly staff to help you. Heater was broken so we had to move to a different room. Area had a lot of homeless scary to walk around after dark must be inside.

review.title: Good Value, Spooky Hotel
review.reviewText: Check-in and check-out were a breeze.  Housekeeping tended to my room very well, replacing sheets, towels and toiletries every day.  The decor is quite dated.  The wide, grand, gloomy corridors seem like something out of the Shining.
review.positiveRemarks: The spooky aspect of it.  The grand scale of the corridors.  Hotel staff were pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: The decor could be updated.  Hot water pressure was not good in my room.
review.locationRemarks: There are a lot of homeless people on the streets in this area.

review.title: No Curtains??
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hotel Whitcomb for one night. There were no curtains on the windows so when the morning sun came in at 7 am, it was not the way I was hoping to wake up on a Sunday morning. There were these sheer curtains that obviously did nothing to keep out the light.
review.negativeRemarks: Get blackout curtains like every other hotel.

review.title: Hotel in the city
review.reviewText: Everything was above average EXCEPT the water pressure. Poor at best
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure

review.reviewText: Good experience, transportation around city was easy to use because train station was located on the street corner by the hotel, on site bar and restaurant.  Hotel water pressure was bad though, shower time doubled because of low water pressure
review.positiveRemarks: the history of it, the old time feel with, on site bar and restaurant
review.negativeRemarks: the water pressure and drainage is bad. shower time easily doubled because water pressure was so low
review.locationRemarks: easy access to the train transportation system we were able to go almost anywhere we needed by the train entrance that was located on the corner

review.title: Shady Neighborhood
review.reviewText: The neighborhood this hotel is located in is not good.  Lots of homeless people handing around.  There's no good restaurants around.  You have to walk atleast 20 minutes to get to good part of the town.
review.locationRemarks: Located in bad neighborhood

review.title: Decent value with good access to transportation
review.reviewText: I was in town on business and this was one of the few hotels under $300/nite with a 3+ star rating.  Easy access to BART and AT&T park.  Friendly staff.  Room was clean though the bath was very dated. Starbucks off of the lobby was a plus as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: All things downtown were a short cab or bus ride away

review.title: I enjoy the Whitconb
review.reviewText: I stay at the Whitcomb when I in sf for a wknd get away or an event. The hotel is beautiful great location and great rates.
The bathroom was very old and dirty. The room was dirty as well.

review.title: Classic hotel to live
review.reviewText: It looks a little bit old, but I like the style. Can be kind of scary with those empty halls. The room is good, and the staffs clean it everyday. The location of this hotel is perfect, lots of great food near it, and also a big market (2 minutes walking distance) with really fresh food.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet is too old.
review.locationRemarks: It really close to the city hall. The theater across the street is really really good!

review.title: Close to Bart. Close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Valet tried to charge us double, for our truck, we spoke with management, and the promptly took care of the situation. Other than that, it was a very nice historic Hotel. They have a great bar too.
review.negativeRemarks: If parking is double for larger vehicles, it should be posted. So it won't be a surprise.
review.locationRemarks: Public transport very close, made it easy to get around.

review.title: Nice hotel, but not up to par with supplies expect
review.reviewText: I had a late arrival 11:00 PM & tey saved a room for me.  They were completely booked so this impressed me.  Upon arriving in my room there were no glasss. I called room service & shortlay they arrived with wine glasses.  The next morning I wanted to get room service.  I called every couple of minuted between 10:00 & 10:30 AM & constantly got a busy signal.  I wanted to check out the rectaurant down stairs, but there was no booklet outlining the hotels amenities.  I ae breakfast at thier restaurant but it was greatly overpriced.
review.positiveRemarks: the room was clean, the batroom had been semi remodeled.  The hotel maintained some of it's charm from it's haydays.
review.negativeRemarks: More attention to the small details.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great for transportation.  BART & MUNI at the doorstep.

review.title: Beyond ridiculous
review.reviewText: I'm told to park my car in their garage via the attendant (apparently the ONLY way to park at the hotel). Arrive at 11am to check-in only to be told to come back at 3pm because no rooms are ready. Then was told AFTER my car was parked it would be about $38 (plus tax) to park overnight. It was appalling! Once I finally got my room, there were ZERO towels, soaps, shampoos, etc. It wasn't until I called the front desk to complain did I receive the necessary toiletries. During all hours of the night, the water pipes would slam and clang in the walls, startling me out of a sound sleep. Upon checkout I told them about my terrible service and no one even attempted to rectify the issue and provide some service or discount to have me leaving happy. WORST HOTEL EVER! I'LL NEVER BOOK AGAIN!

review.title: Over charged  and there is no fridge in the room.
review.reviewText: Super noisey, having a hard time fall asleep, over charged me for room change, the staff told me that is gonna be the same price. But the bill came up $200 more then my origin price

review.title: Dangerous neighborhood
review.reviewText: Hotel is less than adequate in dangerous neighborhood.

Very convenient location on market street. Close to shopping malls and restaurants.
Room was kinda too small for us and the drain didn't work very well.

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: No hot water the first night and last morning I stayed here
review.locationRemarks: Good Location but that's about it

review.title: Decent mid-range hotel
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a less-expensive option to high-end hotels, but don't want to stay in a low-end place, Hotel Whitcomb is a great alternative. Has many of the amenities of high-end,  but not quite up to par with them. Location is better than it seems at first glance, just out of range of the tenderloin. The building is also designated historic, and is quite beautiful, if a bit worn. Room in back of hotel quite quiet for a city  hotel on a  main street. I would go back for sure.
Nice room. Everything else rather dated and needing some work

review.title: I may recommend (not strongly though) but depends
review.reviewText: It is an OK hotel to crash at night. But, hey... remember to bring your own water bottle.

review.title: Next to the Orpheum theatre
review.reviewText: $40 to park.....but great location & dinning options. It is a historic hotel

review.title: Adequate at best.
review.reviewText: Very old hotel, looked very dated. Had asked for a Double bed but only twin available. Wifi was terrible.

review.title: Hotel was ok
review.reviewText: Hotel was ok, room was small. The staff was excellent, got in very early and they checked us in with no problem. Convenient location near a Bart stop.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are small.

review.title: Great hotel if you're going to the Orpheim Theathe
review.reviewText:
We decided to stay here because it was close to the Orpheim Theather, right across the street.  Easy access to and from I8o, we live in West Sacramento.  The resturant in the hotel was completely booked for dinner, we went to a very neat diner across the street, excellent food.
The older gentleman that checked us in and out was quite knowledgeable.  Only thing is paying 
$39 for parking.  If I ever go to the Theather again in the city I will stay here.
review.negativeRemarks: I know we're going thru a drought but the shower heads need to release enough water to wash off soap.
review.locationRemarks: Diners, museums, Theathers, Bart, cable cars, local transit.

review.title: Good value for San Francisco
review.reviewText:
overall good experience
friendly staff except for 1 grumpy person at front desk

review.title: Not Impressed

review.positiveRemarks: convenient location for where i was going.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintanance

review.title: Nice hotel close to Bart.
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, quiet, no smoking, restaurant ($$$), and a great vegetarian restaurant near by!

review.title: Great hotel ideal location for public transportion
review.reviewText: We spent five lovely day in San Francisco took in all of the sites. Had a great time.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, a great location clean rooms
review.locationRemarks: The theater in just across the way shopping, city hall is in close walking distance, catch a bus and see all of the site the city has to offer

review.title: Not what I expected.
review.reviewText: When I checked in they charged me double the parking because I have a pick up truck. They said it was an over sized vehicle . That is BS. I would have took BART or that price. If you walk out on market it smells of urine. Homeless living all around the area.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean. and close to BART and light rail.

review.title: Convenient to theater district and union square
review.reviewText: Perfect for a quick overnight stay if going to the theater - across the street from the Orpheum. Easy access to Bart, Union Square, shopping, Civic Center. Historic hotel so amenities are limited, but price is better than many of the surrounding hotels.
The room was cramped noisy and old as in not well maintained

review.title: Old and grimy hotel. Well past its prime
review.reviewText: Old dirty and grimy hotel. Very unclean and a definite miss

It was a nice hotel, and the housekeeping staff was wonderful. Wifi signal was a little weak and slow from the room we were staying in, though. Great location. We went to attend a concert at The Warfield Theater and it was only a ten min walk from the hotel. Perfect for avoiding the hassle of finding a parking area for your car.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi
review.locationRemarks: Shopping mall located within a 10 minute walking distance. Restaurants and pharmacies located all around. Bus and trolley stop in front of hotel.

review.reviewText: average hotel, nice lobby, small cramped rooms.  Old, could be nice, if detail is attended to.
review.negativeRemarks: attention to maintenance details
review.locationRemarks: shopping, cable car

review.title: Rude Staff
review.reviewText: Check I. Took forever. Manager on Duty was incompetent and very rude
Good overall experience. The Starbucks next door get's a little seedy with all the homeless people. Hotel staff very nice. Close to Bart station or a 20 min walk to Union Square.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText: This is a grand old hotel. It's pricey but, par for the location. My major complaint is that they charge an additional $35 per day to park in their garage. That's a rip-off, considering their very high room rates. They should have free parking or, give guests a waiver to park in the garage. The parking fee wasn't mentioned until check-in! I just felt it was a slap in the face!
review.positiveRemarks: The location and service are excellent. Being an old hotel the rooms (at least ours were) are "cozy". For the room rate, a larger room was expected.
review.negativeRemarks: Do NOT charge for parking! Not all of guests are rich!
review.locationRemarks: Too many homeless people and addicts all around the entrance to the hotel! Very disturbing to female and senior guests.

review.title: Really?  Crappy Wi-fi in 2015?
review.reviewText: It's amazing to me that any hotel -- tourist, business, or otherwise -- has such crappy wi-fi.  It was unusable the entire time.  Tech support was friendly, but unhelpful.
review.positiveRemarks: It looks great from the outside, and the location is great.  Bart and Muni stop right outside the door.
review.negativeRemarks: Better wi-fi throughout.  This is 2015!!
review.locationRemarks: Great proximity to the burgeoning Mid-Market scene.  Twitter, Yammer, Uber, and other companies are walking distance.

review.title: Not worth the hassle
review.reviewText: They didn't even have our reservation on file. They thought we were supposed to be there three months earlier as a no show. Took over an hour to get a room and there was no compensation for the mistake. The room itself was TINY. The bed was super uncomfortable and the bathroom light created a loud hum. Horrible neirborhood, lots of homeless people outside with numerous drug deals going on. Pay a little more and get out of the area.
Horrible, horrible experience. Rooms were filthy, bad area of San Fran. Very scary.

review.title: Nearby where we were to meet-up with friends
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent, as well as cleanliness.  Easy access to bus and taxi service.
review.negativeRemarks: Toilet bowl in need of repair.  A "Do not disturb sign" would be nice.

review.title: Bland hotel
review.reviewText: Nothing to write about. For the price in SF perhaps a good deal. No passion In service... Not friendly. Ultimately everything was just below par to par... A two star.

review.title: A hotel that I'm sure was nice in its day.
review.reviewText:
This was a last minute booking during a conference week. This was nearly four bills. Room was small, hard to find usable outlets. The bathroom was tiny with a rocking toilet. The area around the hotel isn't the best. The lobby is dimly lit and the hallways as well. Reminds me a little of a horror movie waiting to happen.

The upsides were plenty of guests, the Starbucks adjoining it and Sam's Diner across the street.
review.negativeRemarks: See my experience. Most everything.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Staff is rude. The condition of the hotel needs to be improved. Rooms are kept clean. The best thing about the hotel is the location.

review.title: The worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life.
review.reviewText: Worst ever, very misrepresented on line. It said there were room amenities and there were none - exposed wires noisy bathroom, small dirty little room. Smelly.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was why I picked it - close to Bart - but the area is awful!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Move and tear down the building
review.locationRemarks: NA

review.title: Nice ... historic hotel
review.reviewText: After some issues at check (which were resolved quickly and to my satisfaction by the hotel staff) we had a pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The location ... both in general and to the BART were very convenient.  The ambiance of the hotel was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The A/C in our room was too loud to really use.  Fortunately ... the weather was nice and it wasn't necessary.  The wi-fi was spotty at best.
review.locationRemarks: Co-located with a Starbucks and a BART stop right in front ... made for a very convenient hotel.

review.title: Tired hotel in need of makeover
review.reviewText: This hotel is worn out, from the elevators to the bathrooms.  The color scheme in the rooms is a palid yellow that just looks dingy.  The lighting, especially in the bathrooms, is terrible. The neighborhood is, in my opinion, less than safe.

review.title: Location and quality both very good.
review.reviewText: Liked the location on Market, near the theater we went to. The restaurant in the lobby was quite good, as was the breakfast place across the street, which one of the hotel staff recommended. I found the room very comfortable, but my wife didn't find the bed to her liking. Plan to stay there again sometime soon.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking good not great.

review.title: Not what it used to be...
review.reviewText: I had stayed at the Whitcomb a few years ago and I had enjoyed everything. However, it did not meet my expectations this time. Internet service was average and when I reported the problem I was told to contact the provider. Room was clean but the common areas no so. There was a cockroach for a whole day on the corridor which I also reported to the maintenance staff who laughed about it and simply told me to contact the manager.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are nice and the hotel is 15 min. walk from Union Square.

review.title: Great staff, horrible facilities
review.reviewText:
Woke up to about 20 bite marks from some type of bug. Called and spoke with management they are looking into this. Hairdryer fell off the wall whIle sleeping and shower had minimal water pressure.

Do not recommend.

review.title: Lovely old style hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is excellent, Sam's Diner right across the street was a great find. The area itself is lacking. San Fran has a very large homeless problem and this area is right next to that. We were not approached by anyone or had any problems, but was tough to walk through everyday on a holiday.
review.positiveRemarks: the atmosphere was lovely in this grand hotel.

review.title: Do not stay here
review.reviewText: Hotel in is filthy. Do not stay here. Simply the worst hotel in North America.

The only good thing about my room was the very comfortable bed. Terribly dark room, tiny size, poor lighting, awful internet connection, extremely poor electrical outlet placement. No light in the closet, so it was completely black and I just hope I didn't leave anything in there by mistake.

I usually love historic hotels but this was gloomy--kind of interesting in a weird way and felt like The Shining.
The enormous downside for me was the location--shocking homeless street scene right outside and in the immediate vicinity--not just homeless men and women on the street but active drug dealing and serious mental illness--unpredictable behavior and squalid conditions. This area of Market Street is overrun.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfortable. The Starbucks off the lobby was useful.

review.title: An average experience
review.reviewText: Beside the location I wouldn't have anything special to say about this hotel. There are so many options around SF that you might want to think twice to choose this one.

review.title: Star below expectation
review.reviewText:
Not a good area to hang out after hours, everything closes after 11. Have to walk a few blocks to find food/bar. 

Hotel itself was very average at best. Picked it for the price and the conditions reflected. I advise to spend a bit more money for a better hotel in a better area.

review.title: Beautiful old hotel!
review.reviewText: The staff was terrible, the room freezing and extremely loud! You can hear the pipes every time someone turns on the faucet.

review.title: Okay room for a short stay
review.reviewText: Room is too small and the bathroom is tiny. The water pressure in the shower is real weak. The advantage of this hotel is that it is close to everything: restaurant, mall, etc

review.title: Nice staff, but not well maintained
review.reviewText:
There was gunk built up around the faucets on the sinks, in the closet there was a lot of dirt and chunks of Idon'twannaknowwhat everywhere. There were no shelves of any kind in or near the shower. The toilet didn't work well, you couldn't just flush it... you had to stand there and hold the handle for an extended period of time for it to work. I had friends staying in another room who had all the same issues.

Also, the internet was a complete joke. Most the time it would not work at all, it would just timeout. It was completely unusable.

review.title: Elegant historic hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is charming and really quite beautiful. Clean and comfortable, but since it's historic, it may not be to everyone's taste.  The rooms are a bit pokey and old-fashioned, but if that doesn't bither you, then this is a nice place to stay.
review.locationRemarks: Near city hall, museums, public library. New restaurants. Feels like an up and coming neighborhood, used to be a bit sketchy.

review.title: Hotel is not good guys.
review.reviewText:
Hotel is one of the historic hotel in Usa but its not worth it.My room was very weird styled. Bathroom was designed like one of the prison in Alcatraz.Shower was working very loud.I didnt have Wi-Fi signal in my room.
Hotel location is not safe.Maybe its 20min away to Union Square but its covered by homeless people.You cant feel safe when you walking back to your hotel.They dont have parking.So if you have a car Hotel is using one of the car park and they are charging you 35$ per night.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is very close to Civic center and 20 min. walking distance to Union Square.That area is covered by homeless people so you might scare.

review.title: donr bother
review.reviewText: Bad area, noisy, rude staff, broken toilet and shower, parking isn't an amenity if you pay extra for it and the restaurant screwed up both my husband and my order but wouldn't comp the meal
Overall the hotel was fine, definitely was nice about 30 years ago. The rooms are small and the walls are thin. Cleaning staff may or may not fully clean your room each day.

review.title: Room
review.reviewText: Room was taller than it was wide . Had to go outside to change my mind.no coffee in room. Surrounded by homeless, like night of the living dead. No room service offered.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service and night time availability of snacks.
review.locationRemarks: Loved San Francisco

review.title: Great location, bad everything else.
review.reviewText: The staff at the front desk were not personable at all during both the check in and out process. The man assisting us to check in was particularly rude. We are a family of 5 and reserved 2 rooms. I asked if the rooms would be connected so we could walk through each one without going through the hallway. The man snapped and said I'm looking. He walked back and forth to the printer and ignored me for the next few minutes without one hint of a smile. He then handed me my keys and said parking is $35 here are your room numbers. He never answered my question and called the next person. Our rooms were not connected. The room had a view of garbage piled up outside the window in one room and had a disgusting smell in the other. The lights worked on and off. When they did work, it wasn't enough light. The bathrooms are cramped and the water pressure was horrible. The bed had a dent in the middle. It obviously hasn't been replaced or even flipped in years. We took the stairs 98% of our stay because the elevators were slow or not working. Location wasn't bad. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

review.title: Celebrated my birthday!
review.reviewText: We stayed here many of times and the stay is always pleasant. Would stay there every time. Very clean, historic and beautiful.

review.title: Ilovesf
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to many things walking or take the F-line. The room did not have a tub however the room was very comfortable. I will come back...
worst experience ever! Wrist front desk stuff ever! It took me about 2hr to check in

review.title: Constant city noises but good room.
review.reviewText: our initial room had a view of a generator so they gave us a city street view. So loud at night and the windows had slight openings which made the room very cold because a storm was expected. My daughter put Kleenex in the cracks then we were fine. Clean big room, great staff but probably stay near the wharf next time. We so love San Francisco!

review.title: Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
It was horrible!!! I wanted to leave the minute I saw my room. And didn't even care if I didn't get my refund. The hotel lobby is nice and vintage. But the rooms are so small...dirty and I even saw mold.Not a nice place when you have a kid. And I tried to charge my cell phone and didn't have enough plugs. The rooms had a weird smell. And its super horrible trying to go outside and get some food with all the homeless right in front of the hotel asking for money or trying to go into the hotel. I was so glad I was there only 2,nights I couldn't stay any longer that I had to leave at 1am. 
I wouldn't recommended this hotel to anybody

review.title: Resting on historical laurels
review.reviewText: I had toured this hotel before for its historical significance when I was staying at another hotel nearby.  I was excited to finally stay there in person, but the hotel room itself was disappointing.  The room was small and cramped, the fixtures were old, and the bathroom was like a boarding house.  Go to the grill for a drink or a meal and check out its history, but don't stay there unless the location suits you perfectly.  BTW, the staff were all very attentive.  If it had not been for them, this would have been a much more negative review.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are depressing and the bathrooms are institutional
review.locationRemarks: Great location for anything you want to do at or near the civic center

review.title: Hotel on Market St.
review.reviewText: The F bus right in front of the hotel, takes you around many neighborhoods and right to Fishermans Wharf. Very noisy and our room did not have hot water in the shower in the mornings,  but did at night.

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: This is a really nice hotel made even better by the friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Dated hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to city center but is in a sketchy area and the property is old and not kept well.

review.title: Nice hotel close to public transport
review.reviewText: Old hotel with charm of of old San Francisco. Staff is very accommodating and friendly. The guests can be noisy in the hallways. Walls are paper thin so every noise in the hallways can be heard, but for the most part it's a clean, nice place to stay.  BART and MUNI are right outside the door, and you can walk to downtown shopping areas.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and ease to get to other areas of SF

review.title: good for business
review.reviewText: Central location and helpful staff.  Rooms are comfortable.  Cost effective option.  Skip the restaurant if you are in a hurry.... though the food is palatable, slow service.

review.title: Old building, but had San Francisco appeal.
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to all attractions via cab ride or public transportation. No coffee in rooms, but Starbucks is located downstairs.

review.title: Comfortable bed
review.reviewText: I'm going to start with the great parts of our visit.  The staff was very friendly and helpful during check-in and check-out.  We ate at the in-house restaurant for breakfast and were very pleased with the service, the food, and the ambiance.  We got to sit by a comfortable fire, and our waiter was very attentive.  There is also a Starbucks, but there were about 20 people in line.  The bed was comfortable, and the towels and linens were clean.  The down-side of our visit:  The hotel is upscale, but a little dated and in need of some attention.  The neighborhood was a little "sketchy", but conveniently close to a BART station, and right on Market street just a few blocks from all the upscale shopping.

review.title: It was scary
review.reviewText: Short and comfortable but the nice old hotel is beat up

review.title: Over priced, even on Sale
review.reviewText: Was super excited to stay here, based on other reviews and location in SF. What I got was a hotel that has clearly seen better days, a very hard, uncomfortable bed, very low water pressure and the toilet had toilet paper in it when I checked in. Not only that, the toilet seat itself was cracked and chipped. I have stayed in San Francisco before but I will not return to this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Starbucks in lobby is a huge plus. Check-in and check-out were very fast.
review.negativeRemarks: The upkeep of the hotel needs to be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of stuff nearby. Great food, Union Square, shopping, Pier 39, Ocean Beach, Golden Gate Bridge, take a drive down to Pacifica.

review.title: Close to downtown
review.reviewText: Excellent staff, reasonable price, it is an old hotel with quirks.  Great location...

First we had a room with some issues like the bathroom wasn't quite as clean and repaired and the room was smaller than we thought but the staff took quickly action and gave us another room. Overall the staff was really patient and nice. The hotel is in the center of SF; therefore, it has a great location.

review.title: European feel at a reasonable price
review.reviewText: Last minute booking that cost 149 for a Jr. Suite. Upon arriving we were treated to a 1 bedroom upgrade. Internet service was poor because the sending unit was not on out floor. Breakfast is unique; outdoors KNA rooftop(you can be inside if you like), however the selection was especially uninspiring continental.

review.title: Nice Hotel but Room was a little small
review.reviewText:
Hotel is located near the Civic Centre, Opera House and several government buildings. Not an ideal location for tourists, but it was about a 15 minute walk to Union Square for Shopping and the start of the Cable Car route. Also about a 10 minute walk to another district where there were a few nice eating places.

There were also a few fast food restaurants across the road as well as a drug store and general store nearby.

The hotel had a very beautiful foyer - but the room was small and basic. It was however adequate for our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting in the room could be improved
review.locationRemarks: Located right at the Civic Centre BART Station at 8th Ave. Access from the airport was easy and took about 30 minutes using the BART train for $6.80

review.title: Ok hotel. Historic so needs some updates
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was nice. It was musty smelling but that was to be expected. Room seemed clean. Only 1 towel in room, but called for more and was promptly delivered.

review.title: Nice hotel w convenient transit
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay here and would stay again. Hotel is very easy to find and close to Hwy 101. Less driving in the city the better! Valet was expensive but to be expected in city. Hotel is old, but historic and felt very "SF" so it was a fun, different experience than a chain hotel.  Rooms were small but had everything you need. Tall ceilings w lots of wood molding and charm. City transit (Bart, bus, F line) was right out the front door so it was very convenient to get around. Not the nicest area on Market St. But very central to get around so it didn't bother us.
TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE. The sound-proof effect of the room is terrible! The condition of the room is pretty old.
Not the best part of town, but if you need a bed to sleep on, this place will suffice.

review.title: Older hotel but at least in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The check in time was early and easy.  The staff was very good.  The price was outrageous!  Replace ALL air conditioners.  These are loud.  The bearings and refrigeration are noisy and pulsating.  The sound carries to all rooms nearby and are constantly going on and off all night.  Only a very sound sleeper could really get a good nights sleep.  Maintenance did respond rapidly and we changed rooms.  Lower quality but no adjustment on price. The new room had a bad loud pulsating AC but we just left it off.  Rooms next door were either not using theirs or were in good repair. Finally got some sleep.  Many of the room are adjoining with double doors and the noise transfer is unacceptable at the price they are getting. Try to get a room on the top floor.
review.positiveRemarks: Antique quality woodwork, wall paper, furniture.  Good staff. Convenient bar and restaurant.....and Starbucks!
review.negativeRemarks: Replace ALL air conditioners.  These are loud.  The bearings and refrigeration are noisy and pulsating.  Better price considering the quality.
review.locationRemarks: Not a lot with taking a taxi or BART.  Lots of bums and street people. Urine smell, begging etc. Not a good part of Market St.

review.reviewText: Outdated hotel, bad neighborhood, way too expensive for what you get
Elevators stopped working. Got another key from the reception without asking for my name or ID. Unsafe hotel

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText:
overall the hotel is good for the price I paid for. Shower spray power is weak. Have to wait a long time to approach the concierge. The restaurant in the hotel sucks, the worst I have ever been, thank god there's a diner across the street.
The neighborhood is a little scary during the night time, a lot of homeless on the street.
Cool, historic place. A bit pricy, especially the parking rate to park at the hotel. Nice staff and great location, though.

review.title: Over-priced in bad area
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was beautiful, clean, and comfortable. However, my price was raised $50 between booking and checking in, and parking was $40. I paid $250 for one night for a one bed room. Definitely better hotels in better areas of town.

review.title: Worst experience at a hotel in my life
review.reviewText: I flew in on a red eye from New York to SFO arriving around 1 am with my best friend for spring break. After our six hour flight all we wanted was our bed . When we arrived at the hotel I quickly notice the lobby did NOT look like the website and it was completely outdated . The stargazer lilies in the vase when you first walked in made the entire lobby smell like a funeral home. We checked in and got into the elevator to proceed to our room. As soon as the elevator doors opened I honestly did not want to get out the floor looked like it belonged in a scooby do haunted house episode where they're all running in and out of the rooms chasing each other. We got out and hoped for the best  . Once we got to our room I opened the door and I was floored .. The room was a complete disaster. The bed was not made, garbage, used towels on the floor, the bath room was filthy and it was clear that the room had not been cleaned. The most upsetting part about all of this is I called hours before to confirm my 4 night stay and my arrival time for check in.. This was completely unacceptable . I complained at the front desk and asked for my money back (which I got back 4 days later) , the man at the front desk didn't seem to care about the reluctance of his staff.  Now 2 am I had to look for a hotel in San Fransisco after a 6 hour flight !! .. We ended up staying at the hilton union square  for about 70 bucks more, but at least I had a clean room and top notch service

review.title: HISTORICALLY Tired
review.reviewText:
This hotel was new in 1906 and survived the Great Earthquake becoming City Hall which was destroyed.  Traces of the City Hall sign can be seen above the main entry on Market St.  The neighborhood is being renewed with all new and remodeled large private buildings.  The hotel needs a total restoration to bring back her beauty and grandeur.     

For now. do not walk east on Market St due to the street trash people and boarded up stores for two long blocks. Take the subway at the hotel doorstep for only one stop to Powell St the City shopping area and cable car..
review.negativeRemarks: Restoration of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Market Street historic streetcars at the doorstep to Castro, Downtown, & Fisherman's Wharf.  City Hall, Orpheum Theater

review.title: hotel close to bart station
review.reviewText: room was very small, easy to hear others in their rooms... front desk person was anything but hospitable.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: over all the hotel is good for the price I paid for, except it's kind of old and run down.  The concierge receptionist is very slow, and give incorrect information about directions. The shower power is very weak, and sometimes I don't get the towel.

review.title: Right in the middle of town
review.reviewText:
My favorite thing about the Hotel Whitcomb was its location with the green-laned bike-friendly part of Market street right out the front door. I rented a bike for the week at CityRide (also recommended) and had an incredibly easy time getting to and from the office every day on it.

The only thing I didn't care for was the amount of light coming in the windows at night. I didn't see a way to close any light-blocking blinds or curtains over the windows.

review.title: Hotel with good historical value but...
review.reviewText: Overall our stay was alright.  The room was decent.  The help was alright.  There is no room service, however.  Also, there is an additional nightly fee to park you vehicle at a hotel that has no parking (it's in the financial district).  The saving grace to this hotel is Larry the bellhop.  HE IS OUTSTANDING!!!  The hotel is lucky to have him.  He is the quintessential bellhop.  He is knowledgeable about not only the hotel history but the surrounding restaurants and attractions as well.  He is personable, friendly and entertaining.  He MADE our stay!!
review.positiveRemarks: I love the historical preservation of this hotel.  The lobby and halls are exquisite!!
review.negativeRemarks: There is no room service.  So for people who are on vacation and want to sleep in are unable to dine in the room
review.locationRemarks: It's San Francisco...there is never a loss for things to do nearby.

review.title: Close to bill graham, Bart, and the Warfield
review.reviewText: It's a older hotel. It's something I've come to expect for places in the city. I like the Starbucks downstairs

review.title: Two nights in SF with Uncle Alvin from Canada.
review.reviewText: We really had only one complete day to do all the tourist stuff in San Francisco and wanted to stay at a hotel we could walk out of to pick up the different kinds of transportation (Bart, Street Cars, Buses and Trolley Cars). All were either right in front of the hotel or a short walk. We had a great time and the hotel served us well. We even found cheap 24 hour parking right behind the hotel and a very reasonable diner across the street.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and transportation available along with dinning options.
review.negativeRemarks: Very small Bathroom and lots of homeless around hotel. Hotel overnight parking was too expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. All the tourist stuff was a Buss, Streetcar, Bart or Trolley away.

review.title: Not a nice hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is old, creepy, dirty and in a horrible location.
Very nice location, easy valet parking, and room was clean and quiet.  Could walk to lots of great places!!

review.title: Not what we expected
review.reviewText: While the reviews online were good enough, the experience was not up to par. We were disappointed in the room itself. The hallway smelled quite badly, the carpet was wrinkling to the point that I could not roll my suitcase down the hallway, and once we entered the bedroom, things only got worse. The room was tiny, the closet was half of the room, and the bathroom was equivalent to that of a public restroom The lighting was horrible, and finding a plug that would function was well nigh a miracle.
review.positiveRemarks:
Staff was phenomenal
Lobby was beautiful
review.negativeRemarks:
Electrical
Carpet
Beds
review.locationRemarks: Heart of San Francisco - this was nice

review.reviewText: right above BART station, very convenient for traffic, quite old hotel, need renovation.

review.title: Good location but bad experience
review.reviewText: While the hotel is very nice, it is very old and the rooms and appliances are outdated. The first night I had BED BUGS in my bed which was gross but the staff was nice and moved me to another room and offered free dry cleaning.

review.title: Don't Stay here, unless U need to!
review.reviewText:
Edge of Market street and it is in downtown---this is the only positive of this hotel

Room smells, everything is old and outdated. Shower flow is minimal and other nice hotels near by. Reason why I stayed was because all else was booked due to Conferences.

review.title: Everything is very OLD!!
review.reviewText: Very old hotel. Internet is very slow probably belongs last century. Expedia said it offers free breakfast but hotel said NO!

Very basic hotel. 
Faded beauty. 
A bit ramshackle. 
Wifi Spotty.
Few electrical outlets. 
Convenient to BART.

review.title: Too expensive, too old, too small
review.reviewText: The room is so expensive. After 40 percent off, it still costs 280 dollars a night. Though it is located in the downtown area, it does not worth its price. This historical hotel is too old. Tiny room with old facilities. The double bed is even smaller than a single one. I regret booking this hotel for three nights.

review.title: Historical Gem
review.reviewText: The Grand old finishes remanicent of an Era Gone Bye. A trip back in Time; warm welcoming & appreciation for the finer craftsmanship of our ancestors. Clean & charming.

review.title: Would expect more for 300$ /night....
review.reviewText:
Location across the Bart station but feel unsafe at night - lots of homeless around! 
No breakfast, weak water flow in the shower and Internet problems makes it really not worth $300 per night!
review.negativeRemarks: Add breakfast and bathrooms renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Bart station which is good

review.title: Location is all that's good
review.reviewText: Bad bathroom. Moldy shower. Bugs in shower. Lost a package delivery

review.title: Nice old hotel but could use a updating.
review.reviewText: Once we checked in and got to our room I had to call the front desk and complain.   I paid for a king size bed and the room had a queen.  They swapped our room for us but he wasn't very nice about it.  Also it could use a updating and good deep cleaning.   The glass elevator doors were never cleaned it looked like.  The lobby is very impressive and clean compared to the rooms.  It is convenient for down town San Francisco and catching the trolley to the waterfront.  I don't recommend parking  at the hotel it ends up being $40.00 a night for parking.  We ate in the restaurant once and it was ok.  They have a limited menu but the food was good.  Overall a nice historical hotel that could use a update To the rooms.

review.title: Old haunted hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel looks really nice on websites, but is actually horribly creepy inside. When you look them up on google, there are also rumors that it's haunted. I don't know if it is actually haunted, but it most certainly FEELS haunted between the long eerie hallways, the red ceiling, slightly crooked chandeliers, and of course who can ever forget those elevator doors. The tiny dark rooms also have paper thin walls, and you can hear full conversations. I was woken up at 4am, because my neighbor's alarm went off. You'll also know when your neighbor uses the bathroom or shower, because it vibrates throughout the room... Which is annoying because showers also barely work.

Service was okay.
review.negativeRemarks: It is in need of an upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: Kind of sketchy, but it is near the bart train.

review.title: Nice hotel overall.
review.reviewText: It's a little far from shopping centers. Market Street is not necessarily the cleanest place and "safest" place to walk on.  Poverty abounds.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattress was a bit lumpy.
review.locationRemarks: Aside from walking to the opera, the symphony, the Asian Art Museum, the Civic Center and the Orpheum Theater, there is very little else to do.

review.title: not good choiced room. old facility.
review.reviewText: not good choiced room. old facility. very noisy. bed sheets are not comfotable. and staff are not friendly.

review.title: Elegant, Beautiful Hotel With Oddities
review.reviewText: This hotel is absolutely beautiful from the lobby to the hallways to it's location in the heart of San Francisco.  But the hotel is not without it's oddities.  The bathroom is incredibly small, the shower's water pressure limited, and curiously no draw-able curtains in my room.  The bathroom is almost like being in a closet, with the toilet being inches away from the sink.  It took about 3 minutes to get hot water in the shower due to the low pressure.  I had a corner room with windows on 2 sides but there were no curtains.  This meant for a sun-filled room early in the morning and cautious changing of clothes.  I understand the age of the hotel and appreciate it's character, but the limited spaced and operating condition were a worrisome surprise.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel's historic look is incredibly well maintained. Downtown location is great for public trans.  Street parking was ample (on my Sunday stay.)
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure can be improved (it's an old hotel but freezing cold water is unpleasant.) The rooms need some sort of closable curtains.
review.locationRemarks: Easy public trans access. Within walking distance to Cellarmaker Brewing Co. & City Beer Store.  Good street parking.

review.title: Bad Hotel, Is not what you expect
review.reviewText: The staff is very bad, they seem that don't care about your stay and they are not interested in making you feel good at the hotel. They are not kind and a little rude. The worst thing of all is that you have to pay almost $40 per night for the parking lot. With that money you can go and look for a better hotel with parking lot included in the same area or better. What kind of hotel doesn't include the parking lot as part of the rate for you stay?

review.title: Neat Hotel at a Great Price
review.reviewText:
As others have noted, the Hotel Whitcomb is in the old City Hall building.  The lobby is very elaborate and the restaurant is nice.  There is a Starbucks connected.  Upstairs, the hallways are cavernous and dark.  The rooms are simple, clean, and decent.

The staff was friendly and courteous; the manager called and offered me breakfast on the house, simply because I gave my check-in experience good marks on Expedia.

It is located on Market Street near the new City Hall building--I had a great view of the dome from my window--which is a major thoroughfare in San Francisco with readily available transportation.  The BART station is literally right out front the hotel.  You can be at the Moscone Center in 1 stop or the Embarcadero in two.  Walking two blocks orthogonal to Market Street will put you in a pretty ghetto place though.

review.title: This is not a 3 star hotel. Room is substandart.
review.reviewText: This is not a 3 star hotel. Room is substandart. Very small. Showers terrible
Hotel is decent, rooms are cramped, nothing special.

review.title: Good place for stay
review.reviewText: It was pleasing experience during the stay. The location of the Hotel is at good point which Bart Station & public transport easily available.
review.negativeRemarks: Bit high at pricing.

review.reviewText: Very poor area of town.  Staff was not hospitable but not rude.  Bathroom very small.  Would have been ok if the price had been less per night.  I don not feel that I received what I paid for.

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: Hotel is well located for transport (BART is 50 feet away, buses and trams stop almost in front), and for cultural activities (1 block from Civic Center, for SF Symphony, Asian Arts Museum -a great place!). Market Street and a good bit of other streets in downtown however are home to many homeless, which may impact visitors, but we found it safe if not pretty.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and a good service and restaurant
review.negativeRemarks: Lights in the rooms, it seems hotels think people no longer read!
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Reasonable price
review.reviewText: I've stayed for 7, spending nights there. The beds with sagging mattress appeared too soft for me. My back was hurting in the morning. The hotel is old, but rather clean. Electric heater brought some smell of cigarettes or smth.. So I had to open the window and to use the heater at the same time..
review.positiveRemarks: Location, it was close to the Moscone center, the place the conference was held
review.negativeRemarks: Door lockers: bathroom door didn't have a locker and it even did not close tight enough. That might puzzle you if you travel with somebody
review.locationRemarks: Homeless are everywhere in the street, but you might use a parallel street to avoid meeting them.

review.reviewText: This is an old hotel, condition is fair, Worth the money

review.title: Very disappointing.  Not what I expected at all!!
review.reviewText: Horrible.  Terrible check in.  Terrible clientele.  WiFi didn't work.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Right on Market St.  Noisy and hard to access.

review.title: Location of the hotel is overall convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was nice, the room was dark and cold.. It felt very old.  The bed was a little small there was no room to walk it was just the bed , I didn't find the hotel warm and inviting I found it cold and I really didn't want to be there. The location was convenient but there's just so many homeless people and crazy people walking around I did feel very safe. At night there's security before you get to the elevators , so that's really good. The hotel is a block away from a very ugly neighborhood .. When we first got there were a little lost and walked through people walking barefoot and yelling people talking to themselves... It just didn't feel very pleasant . The hotel wasn't bad, it was just not very inviting .. The lighting was awful the bed was uncomfortable and small, there was no room to walk around. The room I didn't enjoy it very much. Staff was nice

review.title: Historic = Old and Tired
review.reviewText: I hesitate to be harsh, but everything is old and in need of replacement in the rooms, from the carpet to the bathrooms. It is not a 3 star hotel, but it likely was a some point very grand.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: The internet was bad and the bath room in my room had mold growing in it.
review.negativeRemarks: The internet. clean the the bath rooms better, and put refrigerators in all the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good with good eating places

review.title: Hard pillows.  Shower did not give much pressure.
review.reviewText: Location okay for me.  Some might not like being next to the homeless in the UN square.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix shower.  Nicer pillows.
review.locationRemarks: Central.  A walk to Moscone center, but doable.

review.reviewText:
On a positive note, the hotel was conveniently located a few steps away from BART which made it an easy trip to SFO.  
I was very disappointed with the rooms especially the restrooms.  Mold penetrated through the touch up caulking in the tub.
Staff was friendly with a great attitude. Room was pleasant.

review.title: Check in was quick the rest - meh.
review.reviewText:
The check in was fast, that said, the front desk staff can do a little better making the guest feel welcome. They did not engage or connect with me. Such a disappointment. 

The room smelled, it is bothersome, especially if you're trying to sleep. The room's heater and water closet were also noisy. I get it, this is not The Ritz, but at least open the windows, so the stale air can circulate out. 

Also for the price I paid, I could have done better in another hotel. 

Never again.
review.negativeRemarks: Guest service is foremost; Air out the room so it didn't smell; possibly do something about the heater and water closet so it's quiet.
review.locationRemarks: it's in SF.

review.title: Credit card fraud
review.reviewText:
Within 24 hours of my original reservation, I canceled my reservation by phone the day after I made it because San Francisco friends warned me about credit card fraud at the Whitcomb. I am hearing-impaired, but spent 25 minutes talking to two people on the phone to be assured they reservation was cancelled. While walking Market Street, I stopped at the Hotel to be sure it was canceled and was informed they had no record or reservation in my name. 

They billed my credit card a $194 for a  no-show. Now, I have to correct their mistakes and mess. 

I will never do business with this hotel and would warn others away from it.
review.negativeRemarks: Service and billing. Stop fraudulent charges.
review.locationRemarks: About 2 miles from the wharf. Walkable.

review.title: Old world charm
review.reviewText: Nice to stay at this hotel with such a rich history, but now lacking the popularity of the past, maybe due to the location and street life about. .
review.negativeRemarks: A light in the closet would be good as bagage placed there in the dark.
review.locationRemarks: Some theatres near by, very close to the Bart system. Many homeless people about, but this didn't bother me.

review.title: Okey
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very good location for it's price. Not directly in the heart of downtown but still close enough to get everywhere. It has a direct connection to the bart transit - the station to tram, bus, metro and bart is right in front of the hotel which makes it ideal to get everywhere easily. The room was clean and comfortable, it is a little bit older, though and it's sold as a "traditional" hotel, which gives it a special flair. It's worth the money.

review.title: Not worth it
review.reviewText: Wouldn't reccommend this hotel. The area is really shady, and our room overlooked a trash lot. The room was very small and the bathroom was tiny. The shower barely worked with the water pressure so poor. Also the walls were very thin, we could hear everything outside and in the neighbouring rooms. You can most definitely find something better for the price.

review.title: I LOVED this historic hotel.
review.reviewText: If you like being a part of history, stay here.  The interior is amazing, all original marble, stained glass, etc.  Beautiful craftsmanship.  The hotel was built in 1906, so it's worn in a few sections, but it's something that just goes with the place when you're staying in a historical monument.  I highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: The history and the beautiful furnishings.  Also, every employee we encountered was professional and very courteous.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathtub in my room really should be replaced (room 241).  It's got that old charm, but it's really time to replace.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect for racing ambulance/firetrucks so it can be noisy. That's what I love about the city. Turn on the bathroom fan for white noise.

review.title: Very old hotel
review.reviewText: Not good location. A many homeless close. Very-very old rooms.

We had a terrible time trying to get to the parking of the hotel on Market Street. But we walked into the hotel to check in and the staff was immediately warm and welcoming. Olga checked us in and upgraded our room at no request. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.
I have stayed in many hotels in San Francisco, I visit atleast twice a year for pleasure . I enjoyed my stay at the witcomb, and will stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed the historical feel of the hotel , charming! very clean and the bed was pretty decent .
review.negativeRemarks: coffee maker in room would be nice , also parking fee could be a little lower
review.locationRemarks: across from the orphium, famers market within walking distance, small restaurant across the street munch haven had a wonderful breakfast!

review.title: It was perfect in the heart of downtown san franci
review.reviewText: It was a decent hotel i liked that the room was very clean abd tge employees were  attentive

review.title: The whitcomb hotel.   Our stay was great.
review.reviewText: Great HUGE room.   Our issue was the noise outside.  Which can't be helped. It's a huge CITY ! No complaints about hotel    It was lovely and staff was very friendly
It's a nice old hotel that at one time celebrities might have stayed at but it's dark, carpet ripped at places and a string to turn on lights in the closet.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade rooms, you have to put your bathroom items on the top of the toilet.
review.locationRemarks: Toruist traps.

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of sf buisyness
review.reviewText: Overall pretty good. One big problemhad to use the valet parking. I had to leave for work at 0415 in the morning. They reassured me that the valet is 24hrs. It took me 30 minutes to find the valet to get my car out. He was sleeping in one of the cars. I was late for work.

review.title: Double charged
review.reviewText:
I was charged for parking I didn't receive and charged twice for my room stay! The gentleman that checked me out was supposed to credit the parking fee but I didn't realize I was charged for the room twice until I checked my bank account.  When I noticed these charges I immediately called the hotel and spoke to an arrogant young male who told me I wasn't charged twice or for parking. He claimed since I used a debit card to pay for my room there was a hold placed equivalent to the cost of the room. He then told me if I did see it as a charge to ccontact my bank. I checked my account today and didn't see any credits so when I called my bank they confirmed I was double charged  for the room and charged for the parking. I had to file a claim in with my bank to get my funds back :-/ 

Besides the excessive charges, the hotel and room was nice.  I would stay at the hotel again. I just think the staff needs additional training.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff training
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Francisco, bay bridge, Westfield mall, union square, fisherman's wharf, trolley, Bart, restaurants, cvs, Chase bank

review.title: Close to Bill Grahm auditorium
review.reviewText: Very disappointed the bar was closed at 10:00 pm other than that seemed clean.

review.title: Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: was hoping to experience the feeling of a 5 star hotel.  Staff, conditions, and cleanliness good, but bed was too soft and the location was very noisy ( heard rescue vehicles, buses, people talking) all night

review.title: Beautiful ambiance
review.reviewText: Gorgeous lobby.  Friendly staff. Easy valet parking.  Close to downtown and the metreon.  Very reasonable rates.  Cozy room

review.title: Needs remodeling
review.reviewText: On the internet it looks great but after checking in the rooms are small and and the only ncie thing about it was the bed. It needs a major remodel I wont be going back nor will tell others about it
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel

review.title: Great location, great price
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, aged but nice. The walls are a little too thin and you can hear your neighbors. The first night I barely slept due to the constant talking of my neighbor. The staff is extremely helpful and the restaurant has excellent food. I would stay again. Excellent location for Orpheum Theatre!!!

review.title: Scary Stay
review.reviewText: I should have read the reviews more closely. The hotel is in despearate need of a make over. Its very historic which isnt a problem but it appears that there has been no effort to bring the facility up to date. As soon as you walk into the lobby - the chairs are so dirty and stained that you wonder why they dont just throw them away. The receptionist was nice enough but the hotel operater was horrible. Very curt and matter of fact. Once you go up the elevator you arrive at a very dimly lit hallway that made me think of the movie "the Shining" There was an eerie feeling about the place and the carpet in the hallway was incrediably dirty. The room's carpet was just as bad and I was apprehensive to walk arouund barefoot. The bed was comfortable and the linens appear to be clean. The bathroom while clean was very dated and the tub and sink were stained. This was definately not a 3.5 start hotel as rated by expedia.
review.negativeRemarks: hotel needs a full rennovation and an entirely new staff. not a place for familes.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised at the overall condition of the stately historic hotel.  It was very clean, well staffed and I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking to find a great facility at a great price.  It was easy to get around San Fran with the cable cars running right by the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful woodworking with a turn of the century feel, friendly staff and comfortable rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: More outlets in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Close proximity to the cable cars and close enough to all the attractions, where you didn't have to take a cab.

review.title: Aging hotel in the tenderloin district
review.reviewText: Did not appreciate how close the hotel was to the unsavory area of the city; moderate numbers of homeless congregate in the area during the day and early evening. Google search suggests crime rate high here. We never felt threatened but we're careful not to walk the streets late at night. Hotel itself is tired but well serviced with obliging staff.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to multiple food choices.
review.reviewText: It was like a step back in time with the decor. I thought it was very glamorous.

review.title: It's just OK.
review.reviewText: Elevators did not work to our floor  upon arrival.  Appears was fixed during stay
review.positiveRemarks: It was accommodating despite other hotels were sold out or too expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure was terrible.
review.locationRemarks: taxi to south beach and SOMA

review.reviewText: In a shady area of town. Zero water pressure in shower.  Broke my bag when it was in storage.

review.title: Horrible experience!
review.reviewText: This Hotel is in horrible condition. Everything is so outdated it's even hard to describe. Yeah, they caught me on that too - "historical hotel". It is, but the problem is it never saw a renovatin from that "historical time." I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Old hotel, feels it.
review.reviewText:
This hotel was built in 1912. It most likely got refurbished in the 60's or 70's, and outside of the flat screen TV, not much else has changed.
Floors that creek, carpet that is in desperate need of a update, lighting that flickers. Walking to your room at the end of a long hall late at night makes you feel like Jack Nicholson may jump out with an ax at any point re:The Shining.

It's a creepy hotel. Lots of homeless in the area just outside too. Made me sad, but coming home after hours also made me have to be all that much more alert. Not a great area.

The sheets were clean, (i hope), the shower kind of worked (more like a trickle of water). And they did have a nice TV which kept my eyes on that rather then the random holes in the walls around the room. 

Look, I've stayed in a lot worse, and it was good enough if the price works for you. But you aren't going to be wanting to kick your shoes off and relax, you aren't going to want to hang in the lobby or have friends come meet you, you aren't going to want to do anything but drop your bags and get outside. 
My advice: skip this hotel. If money is tight, Stay at a holiday inn express  (not the fanciest of places but clean and feels it). If money isn't an issue, there are dozens of other options in the city.

Let me tell you one other part of my trip: I had some downtime between meetings, I ended up walking over to the JW Marriott to hang out and read in their lobby, just so I didn't have to go back to the whitcomb.

review.title: 2 hotels in one
review.reviewText: Suites are fine , you must request a renovated room.. Only choose this place at last resort... If your looking for a 100% enjoyable exp .. not the place ..all the money was put into the lobby ..do not let the pictures fool ya
review.negativeRemarks: its run down old and dirty area
review.locationRemarks: great location in the heart of city

review.title: Business Trip
review.reviewText: Was at an industry event at the Moscone Center and needed someplace nearby. The Whitcomb is an old hotel but they've kept up reasonably well. A mile from the events translated to about a 20 minute walk or $12 Uber fare. It was convenient, had an attached Starbucks and cost about half as much as a larger, closer chain.
review.positiveRemarks: I personally like older hotels and their historic significance.
review.negativeRemarks: In room coffee would have been nice. Better lit hallways. Housekeeping needs to knock before walking in (happened twice to me).

review.title: Very nice hotel - no help for item left in room
review.reviewText:
This hotel is nice and is well restored however it is not anywhere near good restaurants, neighborhood on this part of Market Street is at best scary. 

I have been unable to get any help  retrieving a watch left in the bathroom early checkout Friday morning. It was in a glass on the sink.  I started calling the afternoon (12:15 the hotel time  when I landed in NY )  of my checkout and after several calls got to lost and found and was told they would check and have been calling over the weekend and into Monday. 

There are no safes in the room. The watch was a gift from my children.
review.negativeRemarks: A responsive housekeeping and lost and found that return phone calls
review.locationRemarks: Not a nice area.

review.reviewText: The bathroom was as nice as the bathroom/shower in a Georgia truck stop.
Built in 1916 was at one time one of the coolest hotels in SF
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom fixtures
review.locationRemarks: In civic center

review.reviewText: Hotel was old, room was awkward in a corner, bathroom was small. The valet parking is in the ally behind the building.   It's a reasonable hotel, but I wouldn't recommend it due to its location.  While it is central, I did not feel safe in the neighborhood, a few blocks away felt more safe.

review.title: Low cost choice when you have no other options
review.reviewText: No hot water in the room. Staff did nothing, did not care. Management was apathetic.
review.negativeRemarks: pretty much everything

review.reviewText: The Hotel is fine, classy, the elevators can use an upgrade. The restaurant could be open for breakfast instead of camping out next door. The services concierge, valet and desk personnel are excellent.

review.title: If budget permits go elsewhere
review.reviewText: Forced to stay here when 5 conferences sold out almost every hotel in the City.  Staff and maids were nice and competent, bed was decent, hotel old, frayed, very dark in halls and in the room; kept thinking there had to be another light that I couldn't find.  This part of Market Street is marginal, particularly at night, even though close to Civic Center.  Had a gentlemen stop in the middle of the sidewalk in front of me and relieve himself, at 4 in the afternoon!  I generally go wherever I feel like in a city, but I took a cab back a couple of times at night rather than run the gauntlet.  To add insult to injury I paid almost 500/night, because they could get it.  If you can go elsewhere, particulary because of the seediness of the immediate environment.
review.negativeRemarks: Pretty much everything else
review.locationRemarks: The immediate environs are marginal, lots of unsavory street folk, which would be a big downer particulary if you were on vacation.

review.title: Interesting
review.reviewText: This beautiful old building needs some pride and love injected into it. The building itsself was also a little run down. The first room I had had a flooded bathroom. The second I could hardly fit into the bathroom, and finally the third room was nice, if a little noisy, but that could be ascribed to the area. The marble panels in the elevator were separating from the wall, and in the one room, the poweroints did not all work. I do understand that this is a very old building, but one feels like it is much like a neglected child that would really thrive with a little love and attention. There was no information in the rooms about the hotel or it's history, which is amazing as it is one of Americas historical buildings. Also no information about the facilities in the hotel. There was nobody to help people with luggage or even tell you where to park when you arrived. There were no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. The reception staff were overworked and harried, and showed it. The cleaning staff were friendly, and we had a wonderful waitress in the Market Grill when we went for breakfast the morning we left. The only reason that I stayed was because of the beautiful historic building that was once the town hall, and because it was close to public transport to anywhere you wished to go.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a beautiful historic building. Close to all types of public tranort.
review.negativeRemarks: More welcoming staff when you first arrive. Coffe or tea making facilities in the rooms. Information about the history and facilities of the hotel.

review.title: Satisfactory.
review.reviewText: The only complaint I have is the parking situation. To park at the hotel it cost me $35 a night. I feel that parking should be complimentary when you are already having to pay to stay there.

review.title: Old, happend to be nice, hotel
review.reviewText: Old hotel, that probably happend to be nice 40 years ago. It's direly in need of renovation work. Out of 4 electrical sockets, only one in the bathroom was working. The Wifi in the room was almost non existend, the Bathroom fittings were loose, ...
review.negativeRemarks: Renovation, renovation, renovation!
review.locationRemarks: Lot's of homeless people in the area, didn't feel comfortable at night.

review.title: super convenient location
review.reviewText: Super convenient location, great place to be in the middle of SF and right off Market St. to catch the trolley down to the warf. Starbucks in the lobby

We only had one day in San Francisco, and the concierge helped us tremendously!  She instructed us on the best way to see everything we wanted to, and our trip was highly successful.  The room was clean and comfortable, and the amenities were convenient.

review.title: Whitcomb
review.reviewText: The rooms were nice, hotel lobby beautiful, and the staff was very nice.  The neighborhood and noise was less than good.
review.positiveRemarks: Accessibility to shops and public systems
review.negativeRemarks: Noise proof windows.
review.locationRemarks: Close to plenty of shopping

review.title: Great price for good location
review.reviewText: No, it's not.5 stars, but can't beat location and price.  Room was a little small, but normal for SF. Staff were great, even checked me in earlier than check in time because my room was available.

review.title: Decent hotel with excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was great, and the staff are excellent. It's one step outside of the hotel where everything is different. Street is FULL of homeless, peddlers, beggars, and unlicensed street vendors selling random crap.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable, classic old-school feel and design.
review.negativeRemarks: The shower head strength was so weak, I couldn't get a good shower.
review.locationRemarks: As said above, location is great but what is close by to the street is downright dirty and scary. Blocks to the North get much better.

review.title: just ok hotel due to location
review.reviewText: Just satisfied due to convenient location otherwise will not stay next time
review.negativeRemarks: comfort and additional modern facilities expected from such expensive hotel
review.locationRemarks: Very central location and all major attractions within quick reach

review.title: Older glories
review.reviewText:
This hotel used to be glorious. The experience of stay in an older than 100 years hotel contrasts with the current status of the entire building, poor maintenance, small rooms, mangy furniture and poor meeting space in he lobby. 
The room rates, reastaurant prices and parking charges are absolutely disconnected with the reality. This hotel is operating thanks  to his hystory.
The neighbohood is not the best for a good hotel
Definitely, less than expected
review.negativeRemarks: The managing

review.title: Location a bit sketchy
review.reviewText: I thought that the surrounding area is a little bit sketchy, especially at night.  I wouldn't recommend staying if you head out at night.  Also, there aren't great restaurants nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet too slow.

review.title: Large older hotel
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel that needs repairs and some updates. I had to wait almost 10 minutes for the valley to come Park my car. The room was fairly clean, but needed extra caulking for the tile and there was a 1/8" gap you could see through in the bathroom window to the outside. The beds had body inventions in them, so they were due for new mattresses. Am OK experience, but not great.

review.title: Ok for a day or two
review.reviewText: Not great for business travelers due to essentially no outlets in the rooms and very small bathrooms.  The staff was very nice!  Not in the best part of town.
review.negativeRemarks: Room decor and outlets
review.locationRemarks: Not a great part of town

review.title: Nice hotel wish I had a microwave and refrigerator
review.reviewText: Walked to nearby restaurants water etc convenience store nearby

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText:
No ghost in our room, but beautiful landmark hotel! Wonderful room, high ceilings, comfy clean bed, clean room! Interior of Hotel has been redone  but w/ vintage style! Upstairs hallways a little spooky, reminds me of "the Shining"! I understand this is a 100 year old Hotel! A one of a kind stay! We can stay at a Marriott anywhere, anytime. why not be make it an adventure? Upstairs Elevators trimmed in wall size mirrors & Brass, vintage beautiful & all up to date!
Get this.... there is a Starbucks in the lobby & a BART station less than 50 feet from the lobby entrance! BART is a great way to get around SF!
Friendly, helpful staff
I give it a 4.2 A coffee maker and bigger HDTV would have rated 4-5
review.positiveRemarks:
Updated vintage style, clean room, clean & comfy bed. Very good breakfast diner directly across the street!
BART access!
Starbucks in the lobby !
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger HDTV, 32" flatscreen was ok, put a  coffee maker in room. I did mention there is a Starbucks in the lobby right?
review.locationRemarks: C'mon, we are talking about downtown San Francisco! Anything goes!

review.title: Not a good Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a rather sketchy area of the city with many vagrants living on the street nearby who constantly harass visitors coming and going from the hotel. It is not safe at night to be in front of this hotel. The hotel itself is uncomfortable and my room was rather small and old. While the hotel tries to present itself as a 100 year old historical landmark, with the exception of the lobby area, the interior of the hotel appears old and run down and my room was uncomfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: I would never consider staying at this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: The BART transit stop is near the hotel making it convenient to get out of the area and visit other parts of the city that are more safe.

review.title: Makes you feel like your going back in time.
review.reviewText:
Beautiful comfortable hotel near shopping, restaurants. I didn't feel unsafe. Lots of homeless around but they don't bother you. Room was small/dark. The staff was very helpful and polite. There is a Starbucks that connects to the hotel.
Excellent lounge.

review.title: Potential, but needs work
review.reviewText:
The lobby architecture was beautiful, however the rooms left a little to be desired.  The rooms were like a European hotel -- the largest dimension was the height and a small shower.  I liked that there was a Starbucks in the lobby.  The staff was good.

I enjoy walking and the hotel was not in the greatest place to do that.  SFO is such a disgusting place to walk around in generally, but getting to the hotel was not ideal.  The liberal view of panhandlers and street people does not lend to a good street experience.
review.locationRemarks: I would not recommend this hotel because of the location.  Not easily walkable and poor taxi service.

review.title: Below expectations
review.reviewText: Dark lobby. Slow check in, check out and luggage collection. Staff ok but a little stuck up.

review.title: I would avoid this one
review.reviewText:
Overall, quite disappointing. I wanted a hotel close to Davies Symphony Hall, which this is. In that respect, the location is convenient, but the area is absolutely filled with homeless people, and it makes one uncomfortable.

The room was quite disappointing – very, very dim at night, with some completely inadequate energy saving bulbs in the room, and one could hardly see. Not even a desk at which to work, just a tiny little table, low to the ground. The window did not even have blinds which could close out the light, in order to have a dark room to sleep in the morning. One of the least adequate rooms in which I have ever stayed, and not worth even the relatively modest price for downtown San Francisco, in my opinion.

review.title: A quick trip
review.reviewText:
Finding the driveway to get into the hotel was the first problem.  It's not well marked.  A trip around the huge block and I pulled in to the only obvious place and sure enough, that was it.  The Hotel is nice considering it's age.  The room was accommodating but very old.  Many layers of paint.
     I ate in the restaurant bar inside the hotel and the food was good, service was minimal.  I ate at the bar so that may have been the reason for lack luster service.
     Outside is really an eye opener for those that have not been to that area.  Kinda seedy and dark.  My biggest surprise was seeing a security guard in the Burger King!
     Not a bad experience but I would try something different next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much without a total remodel of the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: It's a short drive to Pier 39 and the bay bridge area.

review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently close to the BART station. Very clean.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Only need DVD player and other best heater.
