And is better if charge parking in the room account.

review.title: Great location but loud
review.reviewText: Stayed twice within a week. Beautiful lobby. First night was in a large, well appointed room facing Market Street.  The street noise was considerable and lasted most of the night. Our second stay was a week a later. I requested a quieter room and was given one considerably smaller and well worn for the same price. Both could have used a thorough cleaning, especially the bathrooms.  Overall, I'd stay here again, mostly for the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness

review.title: Decent hotel for price
review.reviewText: The hotel is older and not as restored as others but it was well priced. We only went to our hotel to sleep so that didnt bother us on our trip. Bathroom was clean. The neighborhood is not so good however. That didnt bother us either but may be disconcerting to some tourists. Overall, suited us for what we needed.

review.title: Located in a bad homeless area do not feel safe
review.reviewText:
well the Hotel is just ok, back in its days must a been a 5 stars ,but not now I give a 1 here is why  there is no hot water cold showers , very poor heating, and  mosquitoes flying in the room called front desk and spoke with manager , send an "ENGINEER" WITH A TOWEL AND WAS RUNNING ALL OVER THE ROOM AND BATHROOM MIRRORS TRYING TO CLEAN OR KILL THEM  ,,, LOL I ended up using the glass cups to cover the drains from the sink and shower to be able to sleep !!  outside the hotel is not that safe but that's not the hotels fault ...
  well I will definitively will consider another place next time I read the reviews before I booked but  and they do not seen to reveal what I experience here I been at other Hotels and honestly I am not picky I am just an ordinary person.
review.positiveRemarks: some of the staff was nice .
review.negativeRemarks: fix the hot water and heating and the  mosquitoes situation is not to forget that may be a health issue !!
review.locationRemarks: it was near the subway station

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Old hotel, friendly and helpful staff. Needs better soudproving

review.title: Classic hotel and  beauty but maintenance needed.
review.reviewText: The lobby is beautiful and the staff was wonderful but there was a lot of maintenance and updating that needed done in our room. Cosmetically, The carpet was frayed and pulled up between the bathroom and bedroom. And the bathroom tile was badly cracked. The only annoyance in the room was the bathroom fan was VERY loud.  The bed was very comfortable and the decor and old style high ceiling was very charming.

review.title: Great access to city poor comfort though.
review.reviewText: Hard bed, room was freezing heat didn't work well. Shower pressure was soo bad. The hotel is beautiful if you like old buildings and big grand halls. Access to trains and busses was amazing to get around. Staff was great.  Parking for my truck was 70$ which was insane for one night.

In disrepair.

Toilet handle stuck and water would run if you didn't jiggle it.
Four people to a room and only gave us two towels the first two nights. 
Closet light didn't work.
Room light didn't work.
In a seedy side of town. Be prepared

review.title: Much to be desired
review.reviewText:
First off, the lobby check in was not welcoming at all, no smile and very short with us.

Secondly, our room was in a stairwell!!! It was cold,the heating did not work, and there was no water pressure.

Not to mention the place fellike we stepped in to a horror film...needless to say it was a sleepless night.

review.title: Historic hotel with great staff!
review.reviewText: The lobby is stunning, the rooms have extra tall ceilings, vintage-feel decor and overall great appearance. Our room wasn't entirely spacious but it was fine for 3 people. Closet space is great. There are 3 things that were off putting.. Valet/the hotel chafes $35+ tax per night to have your car stored. This should be filtered into the room price and not a serperate charge. I was very displeased with the additional $80 charge I had to pay. Secondly, the shower took 15 minutes to even warm up. Complete waste of water and very frustrating. Lastly - the location. While not entirely terrible it's rather close proximity to The Tenderloin district is scary especially if you're walking at night.

review.title: Very nice and close to everything local.
review.reviewText: It was last minute but it was a great choice. I will definitely choose the witcomb  again
Ok hotel for the price and location...close to the bart and buses..

review.title: Minus one star for almost loss my package.
review.reviewText: It's a good hotel. The reception is friendly and the room is clean. The hotel is very old, but well maintained. I scheduled a delivery from amazon to this hotel, and it was supposed to be delivered by the day I arrived, but when we got here, the front desk just say they will be looking for the package, and dismiss us. I got my package a day after the delivery. It turns out that the hotel has forgotten to register the package when it arrived, so they have to wait an employee who has the key to the warehouse. If without this incident I will be glad to give five star.
Very nice hotel, quiet area, away from doormen blowing whistles all night for taxis!!
review.negativeRemarks: Please make sure the lights are plugged in and functioning when preparing the room. Many people unplug lamps, etc. to use outlets for charging phones.

review.title: Loved this vintage hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the vintage style of this hotel. It was a quick walk to union square. Also with many transportation options nearby if needed. The valet parking was an extra plus.

review.title: Ok for the price
review.reviewText:
Extremely convenient public transportation.
The room is clean and the bed is comfortable, but the corridor is creepy. Please consider change some lighter lights.

We have stayed at this  hotel for the last 5 years at the time of the American Geophysical Meeting in San Francisco.  The hotel is within comfortable walking distance of the meeting and the price is right if reservations are made early.

review.title: Very nice hotel!  Staff was nice, and helpful.
review.reviewText: Parking was very affordable ($35.00).  Enjoyed the stay.

review.title: Poor location
review.reviewText: Nice enough hotel, but it is located in an unpleastant area.

review.title: The shower is really uncormfortable
review.reviewText: The washroom is very small and the shower head is about 1.5 m high. It is hhard to stand straight to have a shower. The water is small.

review.title:
More or less ok. 
But the mice in vending too.
review.reviewText: I saw two mice by the vending room. And that was nasty.
Rollaway bed was free, but didn't fit in the double room!  Had to put the mattress on the floor.

review.title: Underwhelmed and disappointed
review.reviewText: Original room was on a dirty floor with twin beds when we booked a queen superior room. Corrected by manager only after he reviewed my paperwork. Bed uncomfortable. Rooms are out of date and even power outlets are so worn out you cannot charge your electronics. WIFI slow, if you can login. Despite asking staff on multiple occasions to look for a package they turned it away. Never coming back. The nastiest hotel I have ever stayed in. The street in front is full of drug dealers and drug takers. Not the best part of SF to be in.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs to be completely refurbished.
review.locationRemarks: Bad part of town. Drug users on streets, expect to be harassed by panhandlers and hear colorful language.

review.title: Nice hotel, sketchy neighborhood
review.reviewText: My second stay there in a year.  I'm a fan of older hotels and this place fits the bill.  Not the best neighborhood, but the hotel is nice.  Suggest they put a guide to the TV channels in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and those nice touches you find in older hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger bathrooms?
review.locationRemarks: A sketchy part of town, but it is slowly changing.  Close to the BART station stop, which is convenient.

review.reviewText: Would not recommend. Long line at check-in, rooms need updating, issues with my bill I had to resolved after for wrong charges.

This must have been a beautiful grand hotel at one time.  Halls are quite large with high ceilings and wood paneling but they now feel old and dark.  Room was clean with nice bedding but light switches were grimy and the shower's water pressure was a joke.  Hotel staff at desk were not helpful. Hopefully there are better hotels for the money in San Francisco.

review.title: Historic hotel in theater district
review.reviewText: Nice enough for a one night stay after going to the theater. Not by to many restraunts. The rooms were cold.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was cold and the electrical outlets would not work with out the lights being left on so we could not charge our cell phone.
review.locationRemarks: Nice restraunts are about a 10 min walk. No nice reatraunts or bars right by the hotel. The hotel restraunt is close between lunch and dinner hours.

review.title: Great hotel at a great price in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with Hotel Whitcomb's rooms and staff. I was able to book for way less then surrounding hotels. Hotel Whitcomb is about a mile away from where I needed to be for my conference, and due to the wet weather, I opted to take cabs. I never had a problem having the bellhop hail me a cab. The room I was in was very clean and comfortable. The one thing I would have liked is a more fully equipped workout room, but I was at least happy there was one available to keep up with daily workouts. I would recommend this hotel as a great option for the amount you will spend to stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: Super comfortable beds, great price for a San Francisco hotel and very helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The workout room could have an elliptical and bike and free weights.
review.locationRemarks: I was here for work, so not much time to explore the nearby areas.

review.title: Nice hotel right next to the event We Are NRG
review.reviewText: Liked it a lot :) worth the $. Will def stay there next time cause it's beautiful hotel.

review.title: Nice looking hotel, okay room
review.reviewText: The hotel was fairly nice and had a fancy lobby, however the room was lackluster. We found bed bugs in our bed and the lock on the bathroom door was broken.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Ok stay, but overall disappointing due to the horrible wifi(had to use my phone as a hotspot) and the uncomfortable bed. My standards for a good hotel stay when I travel for work are pretty basic - comfy bed and good wifi and unfortunately this hotel didn't do well on either. I won't be staying there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve wifi

review.title: Old hotel with creepy corridors
review.reviewText: Not much staff. No bell hops or valets to greet you. Just two front desk people. Hotel looks old. Was once charming I'm sure but the location is not good as you don't feel safe walking in the neighborhood. No cabs here either. Used uber to go everywhere   Also hall corridors were dark and dreary. Couldn't find the light switch once in room and finally it smelled damp and mildewy in my room. Would stay again.

review.title: Hotel was average for the price.
review.reviewText: The room was clean and comfortable but it took to long to get hot water in the shower and the tub did not drain correctly. The hotel only has valet parking but allowes guests to leave their car until 6:00 PM after check out.
It was good, clean and nice, little bit chilly in the room. Just need more water pressure for the shower. But if you can enjoy a historical building, there wouldn't be a big problem.

review.title: A moment in time
review.reviewText:
Stylish old world charm, quiet and comfortable with a range of interiors in which to relax. Enjoying a drink at the bar or lounge at days end was a treat. 
fabulous location and terrific staff,courteous and helpful.
Market place side of the hotel was Too noisy, could not sleep at night.

review.title: First and last...
review.reviewText: Thought we would try a new place this visit and were very disappointed. No a great area, too far from Union Square (which is where we spend most of our time). 2:am party in the room next to ours and it took 2 complaint calls and an hour later for the hotel to get them to knock it off.
review.negativeRemarks: water pressure, location
review.locationRemarks: Bad area, not much to do w/in a few blocks

review.reviewText: It was ok for the price. Rooms are a little dark and very dated.

review.title: Bad location at night
review.reviewText: Lots of shady stuff happening in the streets at night. I don't scare easily, but I felt at risk walking at night. A few blocks down and it's nice.

review.title: Close to SF City Hall
review.reviewText:
For our purposes, (getting married at SF City Hall) it was a great location and we walked to City Hall, The Symphony Hall, the Asian Museum. It was also easy to take the streetcar to other parts of town.  The Guest Services staff were very helpful in places to eat and tips on the boat cruise, (which was great) and how to get places.

When we first checked in, having reserved a "superior" room, it seemed anything but superior. The queen bed filled the whole room, no where to put anything. An ample closet with no light made it impossible to see to use it.  The fan didn't work and the room was stuffy, so I called the front desk to confirm that it was actually a "superior" room and they said yes, but would see about anothe room for us, we were shown to a bigger room with king size bed, and allowed to move there, no charge for the upgrade. That was much better.

As many have already said, its old and funky and there are beggars outside and smelly people down the street, but that's the part of town its in.  You go 5 blocks down Market and you get into the fancy part of town, and hotels there cost double.  Seemed like the trade off was worth it.
review.positiveRemarks: quiet at night. good mirrors. good staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Lots of little maintenance things that just arent updated and it seems that they could/should be without a big expense.
review.locationRemarks: For our purposes, (getting married at SF City Hall) it was a great location and we walked to City Hall, The Symphony Hall, the Asian Museum. It was al

review.title: bearly ane water flow in the shower
review.reviewText: bearly ane water flow in the shower                                                  .                                                                                                                               .

review.title: Recommended!
review.reviewText:
My likes: classy hotel, has lots of chandeliers, mirror and wood. VeRyan pretty. The location is unbeatable. The BARTwo train is right outside the hotel.  The staff is amazingly friendly and dress for the part. Beds were comfy and shower was clean with lots of hot water. Als9, the room cling was over 13 ft! It made the room seem huge! 

Dislikes: finding the valet is creepy. You have to drive down a dark alley. They could put some lights up. There are very few outlets in the room. Granted it's old, but that is pretty inconvenient. Since there are few outlets there isn't much light. Not easy for make up and the batgroom counter was tiny. Again, it's a very old building. The bellman was really busy and it was very hard getting help out to my car. They should probably prepare betterm around checkout time.

The room had no window. There was a bathroom window but unfortunately it led to a roof air duct atea that was that was riddled with ciggy-butts. Besides that the bedroom and bathroom were pretty clean. The bedroom was very large which was nice. The hotel location is in the outskirts of the tenderloin which has a large homeless population.

review.title: Historical Hotel with an Emphasis on OLD.
review.reviewText: This hotel was disappointing. Granted that it is a historical hotel, I expected that it would be old. I did not expect that it would be...OLD. As if the last time this hotel had any updates or renovations was after the 1906 earthquake. The entire hotel was musky, dirty, dingy. The walls are so thin that I heard the wake up phone call and his responsive, "hello?" for the guy next door as if he was sleeping right next to me! There were nooks and crannies that hadn't been cleaned in what looked like forever. The lobby is beautiful but if you look closely, the seating areas all consist of historical chairs that have stains and have grayed over time. Even the ballroom that once must have been grand just looked old and tired and dark. I wish the management and/or ownership would use some of the funds to maintain the place--the history of the hotel befits better treatment!
review.positiveRemarks: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. This is about the best thing about the hotel. And the fact that the Starbucks is located inside the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness. Updates. For the 3-4 star price, the hotel delivers 2 star or below quality.
review.locationRemarks: BART and MUNI trains, right outside the front door - take you anywhere. Nearby are the theaters, symphony and museums. It's very convenient!

review.title: Water and lights
review.reviewText:
The shower water is too litter to wash the body.
If the light on desk is adjustable that will be better.

review.title: Nice Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: The historic character of the hotel was very interesting.  Some areas were a little rough around the edges but overall was a nice place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The overall historic feel.  The bedding
review.negativeRemarks: More plugs in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Market, close to both the Civic Center and the Market District

review.title: Great location. Well maintained older building
review.reviewText: Friendly staff upon arrival and helpful during stay. Well kept for an older building. Elevators seemed slow but hey, they're 100 who wouldn't be a bit slow.

review.title: accommodation was tired and needed upgrading.
review.reviewText: The lobby needed upgrading, food in restaurant was hot and as expected.

review.title: Old world charm
review.reviewText: This antique is located near enough to the freeways n airport to make it a lovely place to stay for a night. The room had 12 foot ceilings ,comfy beds, luxurious linens, friendly staff , and a delicious restaurant .

review.title: surprised to see no tea / coffee or manual air con
review.reviewText:
didn't understand why there was no tea or coffee available within the room.
Bathroom was a bit tatty really.
review.negativeRemarks:
tea or coffee needs to be made available in the room. people expect it so it should be there.
Bath wasn't great, just ok.
No air con control in room
review.locationRemarks: slightly sketchy part of town but there was a lot going on near by.

review.title: Close to the concert I was visiting.
review.reviewText: They gave me a free $50 VIP credit for breakfast because it was my birthday. Didn't have to. Classy move.
review.negativeRemarks: It's an old building.
review.locationRemarks: BASSNECTAR :-D

review.title: Gorgeous old building but very spooky
review.reviewText:
At check-in the receptionist and I hardly understood each others accents, the instructions for valet parking were very unclear, someone running for the lift knocked over my husband and his suitcase without apologising. 
The room was fine, if a bit dark, thankfully quiet for city centre, with a comfortable bed and decent bathroom.
The food and service in the dining area at the front of the hotel were excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: The stunning Art Nouveau décor and the good dinner.
review.negativeRemarks: Brighter lights and a kettle to make tea rather than just a coffee maker in the room.
review.locationRemarks: City centre, trolley bus outside the door, Starbucks next door, exit from valet parking has easy access to freeway to Oakland or San Jose.

review.title: Not a great experience
review.reviewText: This was not a positive experience.  We wanted to get out of the room as soon as we could and did not want to return until we needed to sleep.  Walking in the area was an experience in of itself in that there were many homeless people in the area
review.positiveRemarks: Really Nothing other than there was a Starbucks right next door
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel is very old, lighting, space, the view was very poor
review.locationRemarks: The location of this hotel is in a very poor neighborhood.  Shopping within a couple of blocks

review.reviewText: This is the worst hotel I have stayed ever.This is the worst hotel I have stayed ever.This is the worst hotel I have stayed ever.This is the worst hotel I have stayed ever.This is the worst hotel I have stayed ever.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to the Bill Gram Civic Center!
review.reviewText: Had a pleasant stay here at this hotel, the service staff was very friendly and the hotel was clean. The bathroom in our room was a bit small, and it could have used a bit more water pressure, but other than that no real complaints. The parking is an extra $35 but the attendee was very nice, and you have in / out privileges. I would stay here again for sure.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are comfortable and the bed was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Right by Bill Gram Civic Center, so if you're going to a show this is the place to stay!

review.title: Old building
review.reviewText: great location, not cheap, too old... good if you are nostalgic of a classical hotel turned into old.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are too old, particularly bathroom

review.reviewText: Seems like a former factory building converted to a hotel. Spacious corridors and big, boxy rooms. Not enough light for reading or general room illumination. Borderlining the Tenderloin District which is still going through transitions. Market Street is fine but surrounding side streets still show underside of SF city - getting cleaned up. In for 2 days of business around the city, so convenient for walking and all modes of transport including parking car which was cheaper for whole day until 6pm than garages further downtown. Concierges are very knowledgeable about local, hip restaurants. Got turned on to Triptych on Folsom which was a little gem.
review.negativeRemarks: One parking lot attendant and garage is in back alley of hotel. No way of contacting any door-person to help with luggage and boxes.

review.title: Bad neighborhood and surroundings.
review.reviewText: Hard to find anything to eat, no room service, horrible environment, did not fulfill request (e.g. Higher floor). Staff not friendly.

review.title: Affordable place, little off beaten path
review.reviewText:
Was totally pampered by the staff, & love that there is a Starbucks in lobby.  Room was great, altho wi-fi very spotty & the water pressure in shower too light.

Would recommend Whitcomb to couples & friends travelling.  It's a few blocks off the beaten path on Market, but only 15-20 mins walk or a quick subway trip to everything you might want downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi strength & water pressure

review.title: Old charming and overpriced
review.reviewText: Stayed here for SF Giants 2014 parade. Had a great time. Hotel location was good for this purpose but not the greatest area of town. SF is homeless friendly and they abound very close by. Very old hotel elevators slow but they worked. Staff different but friendly. Room small but clean, love the historical aspects but probably wouldn't stay here again. Starbucks one door away for coffee junkies.

review.title: Whitcomb.
review.reviewText: I almost didn't stay at the Whitcomb this week due to the bad reviews I ha been reading, and in my experience, everyone of them were wrong! What a great stay my wife and I had. Great staff, clean rooms, and nice and quiet. We look forward to staying again.
review.locationRemarks: concerts, theater, fisherman's wharf, and thats just to name a few.

review.title: Nice Hotel... Perfect location for sight-seeing!
review.reviewText: The hotel is great for sight-seeing with a touch of luxury. We went to San Fran for our honeymoon and this hotel was the best priced hotel for its location and condition. The next step up would be paying an additional $200 per night for the Marriott or something like that and we weren't about to do that since we are only using the hotel to sleep and store our stuff. Like I said its the perfect location for sight-seeing. Union Square is about 4 blocks away and from there we would catch our hop-on, hop-off tour bus which would take us to all the best sights(another must when sight-seeing). The room was a little small but it looks like it was recently renovated for a more modern look so that was good. Very comfortable bed and room. Only thing to complain about would be the staff.  They weren't bad just don't expect early check-in and some of them reek of marijuana and don't really convey professionalism. It's not a huge issue but if you were in need of assistance in the hotel it may be hot or miss. Overall it was perfect for what we were using it for, sight-seeing and a little romance for the honeymoon.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and a little bit of luxury.  Of course price!
review.negativeRemarks: The staffs professionalism.  Some of them seemed like they didn't want to be there and that we were in inconveniencing them.
review.locationRemarks: 4 blocks from Union Square. Perfect place for shopping and catching tour buses to take you to all the great sights and 1 block from the Civic Center.

review.title: Ok for business, just
review.reviewText: The reviews and photos looked OK but not really what i had hoped. Everything is old and "fixed", no renovations. Clean, but old. Reception understaffed for 450+ rooms. Elevators insufficient when groups are moving in and out. Water pressure in shower was weak. The door to the room did not really fit the doorframe, it was quite noisy when other guests talked in the hall at night, luckily I was near the end of the hall.
review.positiveRemarks: Wireless internet was OK. Breakfast in the restaurant was excellent and good value. BART is right there, very convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Complete renovation.
review.locationRemarks: The location of the hotel means it has a lot of homeless people right outside and camped out on adjacent blocks, but so does Union Square it seems.

review.title: Decent Hotel, Bad Neighbourhood
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice enough, but it was a sketchy area. I wouldn't go back.
Horrible attitude of all staff except cleaning ladies. Rooms are very small and cramped. Extremely bad neighborhood.
review.negativeRemarks: Horrible attitude of all staff except cleaning ladies. Rooms are very small and cramped.

review.title: Nice Hotel but lots of Homeless in the street
review.reviewText:
Room was fine for the money
Staff was friendly
San Fran needs to address their homeless problems!!

review.title: Nice hotel but ignorant staff
review.reviewText: When anyone decides to keep knocking at 8am to clean your room until you yell at them to go away is just pure ignorance. Besides that, it's a great hotel in a convenient location.

review.title: Nice eclectic hotel close to public transportation
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel several times and never been disappointed. Great prices and comfortable rooms. Bart is right outside the door. Starbucks is in the lobby. We walked to the baseball park and into other points of interest in the city. The immediate neighborhood can be a bit sketchy but all good if you stick to Market until you are off the edge of the "Tenderloin".

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay and were treated warmly.  The valet parking was excellent which was important because we were in and out often for wedding related errands.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.  Bed was comfy.  View was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Found a great breakfast spot but can't recall the name.  On 6th street.  Fantastic.

review.title: Great Hotel Staff
review.reviewText: The staff is very friendly and more than willing to serve and help their customers.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators are very slow.
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel it self is beautiful and historic. The streets near the hotel do have a number of homeless people.

review.title: Arriving to the Hotel
review.reviewText: Once in the Hotel facilities are clean and tidy, arriving to the Hotel, outside is a little scary due to the amount of Homeless people around this area. Recommend taking a Cab to and from the main Hotel lobby and not walking around outside the hotel after dark!

review.title: Near Financial Center
review.reviewText: Location is ok and right near the BART train station. Room was clean and size was good, very quite.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size and everything was quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby decor could be updated and cleaned.
review.locationRemarks: There are theaters close by and the BART station. If you want down you will easily reach the Financial Center.

review.title: Crappy part of town
review.reviewText: Lots of bums, little pricey but cool city with lots of great places to eat.
Good. They were very accommodating. I found everyone polite and the hotel itself had a charm.

review.title: Just go to a newer hotel
review.reviewText: I keep forgetting that "historic hotel" means "old & crappy w/ no electrical outlets in your room & a bathroom as big as a standard bathtub." The sink fixture was installed improperly. Also hundreds of tiny little moths fly out of the shower drain while you're in the shower. Pretty gross.

review.title: Just the basics.....
review.reviewText:
I came to SF for Dreamforce conference. The location of the hotel in reference to Moscone was awesome. BUT, the room was just the basics. I wanted a fridge (even a tiny one). Most hotels I've gone to have one as a basic amenity so I don't even ask anymore. Also, the bathroom was TINY. I could barely turn around in there. And the worst part, was the flying gnat-like bugs that were in the bathroom. They were on the walls, in the shower.....everywhere. Didn't like that at all but dealt with it. At least it wasn't a bedbug (which I checked for thoroughly). 
The staff was nice..... This is an old hotel, so you'll get that feel....some folks like that. The plumbing is old.....toilet didn't really flush that well and the sink water pressure was odd. Not my best stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Get those darn bugs out of the bathroom. Update the plumbing fixures and bathrooms.

review.title: Over priced
review.reviewText:
I had to pay 600.00 for this room . Tech show in town. But I was in town with my daughter did they really need to charge us that much?
I would never recommend this place. I am in the travel business.

review.title: Nice staff. One block west...don't go . staff were
review.reviewText: One block west was gross but not hotels fault. Scary part of town and smelled like a bathroom. Pretty hotel. Small room and bathroom but had ac.

review.title: Good Location. You pay for location strictly
review.reviewText:
Got this room last minute. And the location is fantastic. Walking distance to everything including BART.

The Check In Process took forever! I don't know if its a slow computer or what---I prepaid too, so I thought it'd be snappy. You HAVE to do Valet, so prepare for that charge and also it's time consuming to wait for your car. Room was cool. Just needed a bed. The A/C is very LOUD. Thin walls, but I'm a simple person.
review.negativeRemarks:
Check In Process
Price per night

review.title: It's ok
review.reviewText: First I checked in and though I bought a queen room through Expedia they didn't have one. The rooms are very very small. They though are very clean rooms the hotel for the most part is clean. Location is good I walked everywhere at all times and never felt unsafe. It was the best rate I could find for the hotel class and would say that it met that criteria for the most part

No one to great you when we arrived, check in went well. Never gave info about hotel and surroundings, nothing in the room either. Bathroom very small and exhaust fan very loud, could not leave bathroom door open. No coffee in room or  Refrigerater. Elevators very very slow.
It was a comfortable experience. The check in was friendly and the room was clean the beds were comfortable.

review.title: Clean and safe, but not in the nicest neighborhood
review.reviewText: Room and facilities were fine is a bit dated/dingy. Location is a real issue as it's surrounded by a bit of an unseemly neighborhood in every direction. Only plus is that it's right off the BART.
review.negativeRemarks: check in and check out took forever due to shortage or staff at work
review.locationRemarks: Not in the nicest part of town; would be hard-pressed to recommend it because of the neighborhood.

review.title: Out dated
review.reviewText: Small rooms, very out dated, not in a great neighborhood

review.title: OLD HOTEL in a Bad Neighbourhood
review.reviewText:
Stay away from this place. Old run down. They sell it as quaint - but it aint!
They have buffet breakfast, but its OFF Limits if you book on Expedia..
review.negativeRemarks: Clean it up, modernize, put some money into it
review.locationRemarks: run for safety from the street people.

review.title: Frankenstein mansions
review.reviewText:
The hotel is the worst building I have ever stayed in. Made even worse by the street alive with homeless drug users and gangland wars. It was like zombie dawn of the dead.

The hotel is very old and feels like the Disney ride tower of terror. Do not stay here !

I have never completed a review but I had to do this.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is a great city , but this is the wrong part of town

review.title: Nice location, disappointing facilities!
review.reviewText: Made the reservation to what appear an older, very centrally located hotel. The location was excellent but the facilities, very disappointing. Despite an electronic confirmation, reserving a room with a nice view, we got an interior room! Small, out dated, pretty bad bathroom with lots of empty, unused space. Low sink, pitiful shower without any water pressure. The entire hotel, who undoubtedly had better days, has not been updated. The general decor is very antiquated with worn out carpets and colors.
review.positiveRemarks: The location by the Civic center, right at the entrance of BART and in central Market Street.
review.negativeRemarks: Big remodeling necessary
review.locationRemarks: With a stop of the F street car in front of the hotel and both, subway and BART, the hotel is very nicely located, close to all major tourist destinat

review.title: not at all how the hotel is presented online.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in horrible condition and is in a really scary area. Whenever I turned on the bathroom light a vet would come on which sounded like a plain was going to take off. The air ventilation in the room was an air conditioning box that sounded like a car motor. So I had to sleep in a heated room and not turn on my bathroom light in the morning as I could not hear my music. It was a really bad room - the whole hotel is really bad condition.
review.negativeRemarks: the whole hotel should be closed down and remodeled.
review.locationRemarks: There are homeless people, druggies and essence of pot in the air. I saw two needles on the ground outside the hotel.

review.title: Fawlty Towers by another name
review.reviewText:
We arrived just after mid-night following a 14 hour train ride to be faced by possibly the rudest receptionist I have ever met. This was a pattern - with one exception (a young lady) the entire reception staff, including the front desk manager, were disinterested, impolite and painfully slow. Apparently many of them have been there for well over 20 years - probably because they couldn't get a job anywhere else. On one occasion a receptionist answered the phone whilst in mid-conversation with us, another time another refused to let a colleague use 'his' printer because the other was broken and asked us go to the back of the line (we said no). When we went to check-out, one of the two duty receptionists announced that he was going on his lunch break - leaving the young lady mentioned above to work her way through the long line of guests waiting in line. She was very patient, and clearly under a lot of pressure.

Our room was ok - although there were a couple of socks that didn't belong to us under the bed, and I'm fairly sure the sheets had been used for a previous guest. We asked for an extra pillow, but apparently the hotel had run out. The window didn't fit the frame, and the air conditioning unit was so loud it sounded like a jet engine taking off every time it came on. There was no plug in the bathroom sink, and nowhere to put toiletries except the window sill, which wasn't very clean. This was a shame because the housekeeping and maintenance staff were really friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very pretty from the outside, and in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Replace the entire front desk staff (except the young lady).
review.locationRemarks: It's not particularly close to anything - although if you like walking (we do) it's a good base.

review.title: Terrible neighborhood
review.reviewText: The neighborhood was terrible and the rooms could use some attention. I had peeling wallpaper. Also the "exercise" room was awful. The equipment did not function properly and it was extremely warm in there.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is beautiful and the concierge was very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Add mini fridges and repair peeling wallpaper.

review.title: Nice lobby but rooms are average
review.reviewText: The shower water pressure in my room was so low it was difficult to have a shower. The rooms are clean but dated.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby and staff were friendly
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom and shower
review.locationRemarks: Good location between Mission and Union square

review.title: Good location, but slow front desk
review.reviewText: In SF, everything is spaced out a bit. This hotel is in a decent location, but still, getting anywhere interesting is a 10 minute walk at least. The rooms were fine, but my biggest complaint is the 1-2 front desk people having to handle a large volume of customers. I had to get my room key replaced because it stopped working, and I had to wait in line nearly a half hour while they slowly went through the people in front of me. They ought to get a 3rd front desk terminal working, especially during peak times. The neighborhood is also somewhat sketchy, but the locals say that the crack addicts are harmless.

review.title: Nice hotel.  Convenience. Bart Line
review.reviewText: Hotel and rooms are very nice.  Next time I would request an interior room as the street noise is abundant in the front right on Market
review.locationRemarks: convenient being on the Bart.  Within walking distance to Powell Street and the Mission and Castro districts

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText:
The rooms are nice and clean and staff are helpful.Good transport links with buses, Bart and mini station right outside.

The hotel is quite old and you can see it. No fridge in room and shady area of town, lots of beggars and homeless people outside.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is amazing, great service and good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Lots to see and do.

review.title: nice hotel close to the opera
review.reviewText: a very comfortable hotel . an expensive parking garage
review.negativeRemarks: parking

review.title: Nice, older hotel.
review.reviewText:
I felt very safe and secure in this hotel. Location was convenient to shopping, trains, and the piers. Hotel room was clean, spacious and very bright. Downside, construction of a building happening next door. Jackhammers going by 7am during the week. 
Prices were very reasonable. $149 a night.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was very soft and needed to be replaced. Sunk in the middle.
review.locationRemarks: Trains nearby. Shopping. Piers.

review.title: Awesome hotel close to all the bars !! :  )
review.reviewText: Great room the staff  were very helpful !! Wish I could have stayed longer !

review.title: Old fashioned hotel - average facilities.
review.reviewText: Room was small. No coffee facilities. Poor restaurant and small bar. Staff did not seem to want to help. When I tried to check out early it was difficult to find any staff. The car parking attendant thought his breakfast a higher priority than collecting my car! I wouldn't stay here again.
Bad area of town. Hotel needs work. Very expensive for what you get.

review.title: Older hotel in a bad neighborhood.
review.reviewText: First thing was my wife used the lobby restroom and it was terrible. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very small for the money. OK hotel in a bad part of the City. Would not stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Had a starbucks in the lobby
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel needs improving.
review.locationRemarks: Would not walk around the area. Not the best part of San Fransisco.

review.title: Pleasant surprise on Market
review.reviewText: The room was small as is the case with older hotels.  It was meticulously clean.  The linens were beautiful.  I wish I had been there a bit longer to enjoy the beautiful stained glass in the bar and the chandeliers in the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: The historical character and cleanliness. The internet was free.  Beautiful appointments--drapes, sheets, decor.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was equipped with one of the old hotel style heater/air conditioners and it was a bit noisy, but effective.
review.locationRemarks: I was in only for a very quick business stay so didn't get to enjoy the area much.  Next time.

review.reviewText: From the moment I arrived...every single employes I came in contact was rude and dismissive. Everyone seemed to have a different agenda and other busy things to do besides wait on the customers. From the bellman to the front desk clerk to the staff inside the lobby they were all rude and I was completely taken back because Inqasbteying so hard to be nice and even tried to engage them in happy banter.  The accommodations were very sad and dreary, small and confusing. The carpets in the halls were disgustingly dirty and rolling up all over the place--especially in high traffic areas. This is an easy fix...so ateange that it is allowed to be this run down. But then there were new decorative pillows and curtains in the room that really matched nothing else in the room--especially the ugly blue painted trim that was all around the room and matched absolutely nothing. To say it was atrocious would be an understatement. I will never return to this hotel and will NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone that I've ever speak with. For close to $200 a night I could've stayed somewhere much nicer with more charm and less grotesque decor and horrible customer service.

review.title: TV & desk electrical plugs did not work
review.reviewText: The property location was very bad. All the homeless people frightened my granddaughter
review.negativeRemarks: Major remodeling

review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very nice. However, I had a severe case of bed bug bites all over my body. Over 200 bites I received on my first night. Could not enjoy my trip due to extreme itchiness

review.title: Nice, older hotel in downtown.
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the comfort of this hotel.  I was a little worried by the other reviews, but at the same time, we all have differing opinions.  The room was very roomy, and had everything I would expect from a hotel room.  The bed was very soft and comfortable.  The cleaning service did a great job, and the staff was alway happy to help with anything I needed.  The Bart/MUNI terminal is just outside the front door, no need to cross any street at all.  The only complaint I would have is that you can hear everything that goes on in the hallway.  Not much going on my week there, so that wasn't much of a problem for me.
review.positiveRemarks:
* Convenience to Bart/MUNI
* Nice rooms
* Friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: More door insulation possibly, not sure how that would work.
review.locationRemarks: Again, convenience to Bart/MUNI terminal.  A good diner across the street.  Starbucks inside.  One terminal stop away from the Moscone center.

review.title: Decent hotel, poor location
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay, the hotel is close to a BART station, but the area is very unsafe, tons of homeless people loitering around.   On the website it says the hotel is one mile from AT& T park, it's at least two miles.
review.locationRemarks: It was very close to government buildings, a theatre, and museums, BART.

review.title: family vacation
review.reviewText: Hotel outdated.  Walking at night within the nearest blocks to the hotel was a bit concerning.Staff very nice, however, not always the most knowledgeable of destinations and the transit system.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We were easily able to use public transportation to get around the city. The staff were helpful in directing us and responding to our needs. The onsite restaurant was both convenient and reasonably priced for excellent meals. Starbucks, off the hotel lobby, was busy in the mornings. The room was clean and comfortable but a tad small. I would have liked coffee service in the room. The blackout curtains didn't close all the way which wasn't helpful. Overall, though, we enjoyed our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Old world charm, cleanliness and comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer option to re-use towels and sheets; offer coffee maker and fixings in the room.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located right next to a subway station and walking distance to City Hall, Opera, Orpheum Theater and symphony halls.

review.title: waste of money.
review.reviewText: simply put, do not stay in this hotel. it is a bad hotel.

review.title: Not so great
review.reviewText: Paper thin walls in this old hotel. I could hear everything and could not sleep as a result. The bed was concaved and was as old as the hotel itself.
review.negativeRemarks: Updated bathrooms and beds for $300  per night is a good start.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location, close to many San Franciso attractions.

review.title: BEDBUGS, BEWARE.
review.reviewText:
Stayed at this hotel from August 19 and checked out on August 21.  Overall, the staff is courteous and the ambiance in the hotel is nice.  

When I checked in, I thought I was in to have a great stay.  But that was short-lived until I woke the next morning, itching myself to the washroom to see what was going on.

I noticed a rash-like redness all over the right side of my body.  

At first, I didn't think much about it.  I thought I might have been allergic to the detergent used on the sheets - so I took an antihistamine and started my day.

After the second night, I realized there was something going on in my room.  The rash on my body had turned into clearly identifiable red circles - bed bug bites.

I counted 26 bites all over the right side of my body - the side on which I slept - and 7 on the left side.  I couldn't stop itching myself even after taking an antihistamine.  

When I got home the next morning (red-eye flight), I threw away my 2 bags, did my laundry and sent all my shirts to the drycleaners.

I understand SF has a big problem with bed bugs.  But, I wasn't expecting it from a hotel of this stature.  I'm honestly regret staying here and am truly disappointed.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was courteous, lobby was nice - didn't eat the restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness/hygiene.  Highly recommend getting rooms inspected for bed bugs - fumigation.
review.locationRemarks: Good food, great thai restaurants in the area

review.reviewText: Hotel is at the corner of Market and 8th. The only thing I hated was the kind of crowd that got attracted around Market and 6th and market and 8th. I felt unsafe walking that stretch after 7 pm with family. We used muni (2 dollars / person) to bypass that area after first 2 nights.

review.title: A couple blocks away from safety.
review.reviewText: The Hotel Whitcomb was a decent place to stay. It's fairly close to a lot of good shopping and right on the bart station which was convenient. The rooms are quaint to say the least. Very small but clean. The hotel overall is in need of renovation. The biggest problem is that is is just too far down market street. In order to get to shopping and a better area you have to walk through three uncomfortably seedy blocks. My wife and I were followed up to the doors by some vagrant twice in the week that we stayed there. As nice as the hotel was inside, stepping outside the doors was a little too scary for my taste.
review.negativeRemarks: renovate more than just the lobby, clean up the outside
review.locationRemarks: the farmers market was glorious, shoppping was close

review.reviewText: Bathroom is too small and primitive. Wifi is weak and net is very slow. Room door is old and does not close well unless you pull it.  Safe boxes are few and not available

review.title: Might be overrated
review.reviewText:
Paid for a room with double beds but none available when checking in.  Ended up being placed in a suite at the end of the hall.  Noise (external and from adjacent room) was excessive.  Water pressure very low.  Lighting too dim.  AC unit was noisy.

One positive:  Staff was very accommodating and friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very accommodating and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure, sound proofing, HVAC system, lighting.
review.locationRemarks: Was in San Francisco to work.  Didn't do much else but did notice it's a little risky to walk around at night.

review.title: Close to BART and business district
review.reviewText: Night check in staff acted arrogant when presented with a debit card rather than credit card despite the fact that the stay was prepaid. The room wasn't cleaned during the stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve night front desk staff attitude

review.title: Close to union square
review.reviewText: Trolly F was never on time to get us back to hotel or not running at all

review.title: So So...
review.reviewText: Expecting more for the price I got. Looks like very old hotel. Sharped. The main problem is Internet connection. On 7th floor it's very poor. Unstable. Hotel staff can only reset the router which is not really helping. Helped few times but I have to call two times to fix the issue. I gave up at the end.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connection. Renovation.
review.locationRemarks: A little bit down on the market street.

review.reviewText: Unfortunately nothing special about this hotel. Front desk manager could care less.

review.title: The Negative Side of Historic Hotels
review.reviewText:
I love staying in historic hostels....when the bathrooms have been updated of course. The one in my room had not. It was one step better than having to walk down the hall. I can't remember when I have paid so much for so little. 

Live and learn.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was convenient for my needs. Valet parking was pretty efficient for what they had to work with. Linens on the bed were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Up date the bathroom in room 799.
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: OK hotel close to BART and MUNI
review.reviewText: 4 Night visit to San Francisco and selected Hotel Whitcombe for its proximity to the BART train connection to/from SFO.  BART makes an easy and painless connection to the Civic Center Station where MUNI is also available for travel around SF.  Puurchesded a 7 Day visitor Passport Nad surpirsed to have to pay $3 for the a clipper Card on top of the 7 Day cost - the one off card fee was nt mentioned on the MUNIwebsite, well we didn't see it, but still good value.  riding the bridge by bike is a good experience, go early to avoid some of the crowds!  Likewise if intending to ride the cable car, an early start is suggested or face a long wait in the queue.
review.positiveRemarks: Its location close to Civic Center.  Easy weak down Market to the shopping areas and waterfront.
review.negativeRemarks: Better wifi, the signal kept dropping out.  Coffee in the room- only hotel in 7 weeks with no coffee machine in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Civic Center and Market Street.  Lots of transportation options, bus, street car, train outside the door.  Starbucks off the lobby.  Safeway 12 blocks

review.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! And watch your money
review.reviewText:
Please do not stay here.  They are running a scam operation.  We had over $400 stolen out of our room.  We addressed this issue with the management and she did not seem surprised nor did she follow up with us after she promised to check the cameras.  
Also - We had checked in late and the atmosphere of the hotel was dangerous.  Drunk and homeless everywhere.  There was a drunk person passed out in the hallway!!!  The staff was beyond rude and they messed up our room reservation forcing us to switch rooms the next day.  
The rooms are old to say the least.  Will never stay here again

review.title: Historic hotel, wrong side of town.
review.reviewText: The area around the hotel was horrible.  The burger king across the street had a full time San Francisco police man stationed at it.  This made everything outside of the hotel unpleasant, and made us feel unsafe.  There also was a 35 dollar a night fee to park your car, that was not mentioned until arrival.  Overall the hotel is nice, but not worth the scary surroundings.
review.locationRemarks: The best thing about this hotel is its location to At&t park.

review.title: super cool old hotel rooms small but very clean- t
review.reviewText: the hotel is in a great location close to bus line to anywhere and everywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: the doorman in tall hat was very helpful, the rooms are very clean
review.negativeRemarks: the toilet ran and a/c was loud

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Good Feeling , It is good parking service, but a little bit expanse, good free internet

review.title: Nice room, staff rude
review.reviewText:
My stay was fine. 
Would suggest investing in the staff, they are pretty unpleasant. Particularly the front desk team. 

This excludes the bel hops who were really lovely. 

Also would suggest fixing the plumbing there is no pressure in the shower

Other than that rhe room is quite nice.

review.title: Not as it appears
review.reviewText:
This hotel lobby is amazing. Nicely dressed staff, building inside is beautiful, and attached is a Starbucks!!!! Not to mention the amazing chandelier in the front main lobby. I had very high expectations for our room.
Once we arrived in our room it was very disappointing. Room was very vintage.No... more like OLD. Small. Nothing modern nor updated in room. Felt like the door could be knocked down easily. Older hotel equals LOUD noises at all times. You can hear everything around you. Restrooms are very outdated. Rooms being clean was a plus.
Another plus to this hotel is homeless is very minimal. Very close to Muni and Bart. 
This hotel is very over priced and not at all as it appeared to be.
review.positiveRemarks: Fairly clean. Close to public transit
review.negativeRemarks: Needs updating. BADLY!
review.locationRemarks: Good location. Close to downtown, public transit.

review.title: Mission District under major renovation.
review.reviewText: The Hotel Whitcomb needs to keep with the major rentovations on market st.. staff was excellent.. room needed a deep cleaning to bring it back to life.. great location
Hotel was nice enough, area seems to be not so great after dark.

review.title: Nice hotel close to public transit
review.reviewText: When we read other reviews, we were admittedly worried about staying at this hotel for 7 days. To our great relief, our room was quite clean and the bed was bed bug free. The hotel itself is quite old and lovely, and I felt inspired jusr to be there. Having said that, I think they could benefit from changing the carpets throughout or cleaning the stains off the furniture in the lobby. The area was fine. Really. Yes, there are a few homeless people but they never bothered us and we never felt unsafe (however, we were usually back in our room by 10:30 so we never wandered around at night). For breakfast, we went to Munch Haven and Sam's across the street, both of which were nice. Overall, I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Close to transit but an old hotel with noisy air conditioning.  The neighborhood is a little sketchy after dark.

review.title: One word, Awful
review.reviewText:
First experience was stinking toilets also being used by the more unfortunate of the city. 
We were lied to by receptionist and told we had superior rooms when we hasn't. Very dingy reception are and corridors. Rooms were not too bad but had no fridge or safe. 
Bar closed at 10pm, most suprising in a big city.

review.title: An Impressive Stay
review.reviewText: I was on a business trip, and wanted a comfortable, clean hotel to stay. I got all of that at Hotel Whitcomb. The staff at registration was very nice and welcoming, especially Ms. Manisha. The hotel location is great, about 4 blocks from Westfield Mall and Powell street. It's an historical hotel. Only thing that would make it perfect is refresh the carpet so the room can smell fresher. Valet parking is limited.

review.title: terrible experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and out of maintenance.  daily 40 dollars hidden charge per parking.  The worst is the rudeness of the night shift first of all  the porto rican manager.  Choose an hotel near the airport.

review.title: Nice hotel - Excellent staff
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel convenient to public transportation. Very friendly and helpful staff. Concierge gave great recommendations for restaurants in the wharf area.

review.title: High rise hotel
review.reviewText: The area around the hotel was not so nice.  Lots of homeless people although I found this to be typical of San Francisco in general.  The hotel restaraunt had excellent food.  The hotel seemed more suitable for older people just because of the decor and ambiance. I would probably stay at the Sheroton by the Fisherman's Warf next time.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText:
It was convenient to Bart but on a bad part of Market street. There was no coffee, breakfast, or microwave-not even a general microwave in the hotel. It was a nice decor, but for the rate I paid I could have paid a few more dollars
For more amenities. Everyone on our floor was European or from forgien countries.

review.title: Best over all Hotel I have stayed in!
review.reviewText:
Location was convenient to points of interest.  Food choices nearby were wonderful!  Hotel was clean.  Beds and pillows were comfortable.  Staff were courteous and available.  Price was unbeatable for the quality.
Lobby was comfortable and attractive.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing....don't change a thing!
review.locationRemarks: Talk to the Travel Desk in the lobby.  They have maps and ideas.  Tours can be scheduled there.  Bus line and cabs are nearby.  Tours pick up there.

review.title: Free wouldn't be cheap enough to stay here
review.reviewText: Staff were terrible from the beginning, so unreasonably rude. They also had to check to see if they even had a room available, you know after i already paid in full, they were able to squeeze us in after a bit of time. The hotel room is incredibly small. The curtains won't close so you'll spend all night in a room brightly lit with city lights. The walls, both exterior and interior are paper thin so you'll hear your neighbors clearly and the noises of trafic, sirens, and car alarms will keep you up all night. The elevators are tiny and barely work as well. You couldn't pay me to stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything, it should probably just be demolished and rebuilt.
review.locationRemarks: Scary neighborhood. You have to walk about half a mile to feel even a bit safe in the city.

review.title: Old crappy hotel
review.reviewText: Dripping faucets, beeping smoke alarms, broken air conditioning, terrible customer service, horrible breakfast. I can't warn people enough to stay away from this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel/Good location
review.reviewText: We only stayed for one night, so weren't looking for anything special. This hotel is in a very central location with easy access to BART and you get a little bit of old San Francisco with the boutique style. The rooms are small, and bathrooms are pretty tiny, but no complaints overall.
review.locationRemarks: Easy BART to Embarcadero and AT&T park

review.title: Do not stay here
review.reviewText: This was hands down the worst hotel I have ever stayed at and at almost $700US for two nights, borderline criminal.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything. Smug front desk staff, no room cleaning between nights, horrible neighbourhood, awful shower etc
review.locationRemarks: Be careful returning to hotel late at night. Sketchy area.

review.title: Be prepared for the homeless but ok hotel
review.reviewText: The location is good, but a lot of homeless people outside and they are a little crazy; be prepared for this!
review.positiveRemarks: I had a problem with the room they fixed it straight away by moving me into a better room. It was much better and had all what I needed and the coffee
review.negativeRemarks: The homeless people need to be moved off market street... It's really bad !
review.locationRemarks: Great to pick up the F or Bart and coffee ;)

review.title: High price for tiny rooms
review.reviewText: Rooms were small, people were rude, electricity went out. Definitely not worth the price
Not a good experience.  Small room with no view.  Poor service. Closet smelled like cigarettes.  I would not recommend.
Nice old grand hotel. Good location for transit. Had fun.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: Too many homeless people around. Hotel needs some paint

review.title: Good value at $120 < Union Square per night
review.reviewText: This is a nearly 100 year old hotel that's in remarkable condition. The lobby is clean marble. You'll know it's old, a classic. The windows open. The view is interesting. The plumbing's a little below grade A, but it all works; the rooms are on the small end, but not tiny.  The staff is helpful and professional. For what you'll save from the cost of a Union Square hotel, you can pay for a pretty nice San Francisco dinner for two. My only complaint is that the hotel seems to attract large groups arriving in buses. Everyone was courteous, but the comings and goings of these groups clogs up check-in, check-out, the elevators, etc. You could work around it. On balance, a good value and a classic old San Francisco hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: This is a nearly 100 year old hotel that's in remarkable condition. You'll know it's old, a classic -the windows open. The staff is professional.
review.negativeRemarks: The comings and goings of large groups clogs up parking, elevators, check-in, check-out, etc.
review.locationRemarks: The Bart and Muni stations are right out the front door. The library, City Hall and the Asia Museum are very close. Union Square is a short walk.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Overall, just okay. I got it on the cheap and it served its purpose. The rooms were soo dusty it was off putting.

review.title: Nice hotel, slow staff
review.reviewText: Good location close to a station and the civic centre, only 15 minute walk from union Square. Staff were very slow to respond to any requests. WI FI didnt work in the rooms.

review.title: Sight seeing in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Classic old world hotel with lots of charm but old in too many other ways. Mattress on the bed had dips where people had been lying. Shower was luke warm at best and did not improve.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds and showers
review.locationRemarks: All that is San Francisco is within easy access - if need be by walking

review.title: Bad hotel in bad part of town.
review.reviewText: I got this through the express deals and I am never playing this game again.  The hotel is rundown. Most, though certainly not all, of the staff is pretty abrupt.  I don't think the hotel deserves 3 stars, maybe two on a good day.  Oh and the location is awesul. Every other person on the street is a homeless bagger ( the other one is a drug addict).

Nice hotel overall, my room was comfortable and clean and the staff was friendly and courteous. Some things in the room (mostly bathroom related) were a bit outdated and worn, as others have mentioned, kind of like they remodeled in the 80's and they are still there. But seriously, it was no big deal and if you are looking for the Four Seasons, then stay at the Four Seasons. As far as reasonably priced, nice places to stay, a definite thumbs up!
review.locationRemarks: The BART is literally outside the front door, that was fantastic and made getting to the airport a breeze.

review.title: I would never ever stay here again!!!!!
review.reviewText:
This place was awful!  First of all the pictures they show are not evident of what the rooms, especially the bathrooms are like!
There was NO BATHTUB in our room, even though the picture shows a tub w/shower combo.  The view was awful!  There was no coffee in the room (as advertised) and they didn't even have coffee in the lobby :(

I was beyond disappointed :(

Besides the fact that it is way too far from anything downtown that I was interested in doing/seeing.  Bad bonus ~ it's kind of in a bad part of town........

I give this place a big fat zero!!!!!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!
review.locationRemarks: It is located near the Theatre District, sorta........too far from everything else to make it worth the money.

review.title: Small, Old, and Broken...
review.reviewText: This hotel looks nice in the pictures, but it is very old and outdated.  The rooms and bathrooms were very small.  When using the toilet, your legs are actually under the sink because of how small everything is.  Only one of the few outlets in the room had 3 prongs, so if you need to plug in anything other than a phone charger you are out of luck.  The elevators were slow and you could spend several minutes waiting for it to stop (less than 10 floors, it should be fast).  To top off the horrible night the moist San Francisco air condensed on the outside of the bathroom fan and ran into the room.  There was a constant dripping that left half the bathroom covered in water by the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: It was next to a Bart station so moving around the city is easy.  Free internet.
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything.  Honestly the place could use a complete remodel down to the frames.

review.title: Nice Hotel Centrally Located
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel for its charm, but found out it offered quite a bit more.  The Hotel Whitcomb is centrally located, has easy access to BART, and every taxi driver knows this hotel by name - I never had to tell them the address!  Housekeeping bent over backwards to have our room ready for us and fixed a slight problem very quickly.  Concierge service was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the old world charm of this hotel.  They have a singing doorman who is a local hero award winner!
review.negativeRemarks: Only one person was checking in guests, even though there were 3 people behind the desk.  The line was getting a bit long.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located.  Great shopping and dining very close by.  Easy access to public transportation and the Freeway is not too far away.

review.title: In a sketch area
review.reviewText: The hotel is kinda hard to get to but everything is in san fran. Easy to catch public transportation from hotel and walking distance from a few shops and bars. The hotel was ok but they told us at night they didnt let anyone in without a key card and when I got back to my room at 2am no one was at the door to check our key cards. I felt like I paid way to much to stay here is they lowered their prices I would say there again maybe. But outside the hotel were alot of beggers and homeless sleeping on the street. Oh and if you smoke their smoking area looks like a mass murder happened there many years ago. Very creepy I could not even go in that room!
Was an ok experience. Hotel staff wasn't very hospitable.
Not what I expected we checked in and out the same day.

review.title: Front desk
review.reviewText: We asked to be changed to anothet room because the old ac in the room had some very annoying and loud sound patterns it was impossible to sleep. Also because the toilet wouldn't stop flushing. It continuously flushed like 8 times and then stopped. The front desk lady Cristina was very rude and sarcastic. Thumbs up to the concierge -don't know his name - he was a middle age African American  gentlemen who worked so hard to get us tickets.

review.title: Hotel On Market St.
review.reviewText: To be quite honest My family and I could NOT stay in this hotel, we booked it for two days and ended up checking in, showering, and checking out. We honestly didn't care about how much money we were going to loose because the place was just outrageous. The lobby was beautiful and the entrance to the hotel but as soon as we got in the elevator to our room it seemed like we were walking into Dracula's House. Very dark and the rooms and hallway had a musty smell to it. The room was clean but the beds seemed like they were waterbeds from how old they were and the bathroom was tiny. Along with the tiny bathroom the shower had very low water pressure and took a while for everyone to shower. Other than that the Staff was really nice and professional.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell, beds, water pressure in showers, cleanliness in bathroom
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was on Market St which is the main street of downtown San Fransisco. Union Square was right there also fishermanns warf was near

review.reviewText: Hotel is unclean. There is no electrical outlet. Lamps doesn't work. Poor customer service

review.title: Very messy and rude staff!!! Be aware!
review.reviewText:
The staff are very rude and not professional. Rooms are super small and not comfortable at all. If you have 2 or people, you won't fit. Bathroom door knob was broken, you might get stuck inside. Front desk won't answer when you need them. Wow! You have to actually go downstairs to reach them. Shower handle and the lamps were broken, too. You have to continuously hurt your hand to shower!! Overall the hotel and rooms were smelly and not clean. Not talking about the wifi connections and the outlets. No point. Don't touch the curtains your hand might get dirty. And the bed sheets had stains which they didn't seem to care enough to change after pointing out. What an experience right?? 
The only best part was that the location is great. It's right in the center of the city, close to union square. 
Double, triple think about it before booking.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText:
I was happy that they hold your bags for you before check in, so I didn't have to carry them with me all day. Larry was wonderful, he was very friendly and helpful. The
Room was small, and the bathroom super outdated, but overall it was comfy. After a long day out, it was a nice hotel to come back to

They didn't have correct information when check in, then the room the had no hot water and when they did move us to another room it was clean on the walls and it glowed in the dark and wifi didn't work and if u did you  had to got outside near the elevtor!
review.negativeRemarks: Staff to do a course of customer service because no one apologies for anything that when wrong until the very end when I talk to the manger

review.title: Historic hotel
review.reviewText: Very accommodating and safe.  If you're on vacation and want a more local authentic experience this can be a great stay.  It can get a little busy with people traveling so take the stairs if you have to.

review.title: Excellent location...in need of updating
review.reviewText: This hotel is full of beautiful chandeliers and amazing marble.  It is also full of bunched up carpeting that could cause anyone to trip/fall, chipping paint, and the tiniest bathrooms with moldy showers.  Is it a hardship to stay here?  Not at all.  Is it a luxurious experience?  Not even close.  I will consider staying here again only because of the location.  It's a brisk walk to the wharfs (through China Town), or a 20 minute public transportation ride away.  The civic center is a 5 minute walk away, as are main concert venues.  Starbucks in the lobby is awesome.  No room service sucks.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: We were able to walk to a bunch of places. Parking was hard to find, it's a hidden street behind the hotel and costs $35 but not being from San Fran, driving the streets can be pretty intimidating. The room had high vaulted ceilings and was nice and clean and had plenty of info for places to go, eat, and visit.

review.title: Bad location - be careful
review.reviewText: The hotel is ok. It is very old, but historic hotel. Some of you may like it. Location of the hotel is a problem. It is close to the civic center, which sounds nice, but it is very sketchy area. They may not be offensive, but there are so many homeless people around the hotel. Seriously, "many". I stayed there on the Fourth of July holiday and arrived there at 2:00 pm. There are like 40-50 homeless people within two blocks from the hotel.  We took a cab back to the hotel after the fireworks and there are way too many of them around 11:00 pm.  Just be careful. It is not very comfortable place.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Very bad location.

review.title: Don't bring a car.
review.reviewText: While the hotel was quite nice, the room was small and the valet parking (mandatory) was very badly run and took us almost an hour to park and get inside.

review.title: Nice hotel, not the best area
review.reviewText: Hotel was good value for the money. Small rooms but clean and comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
We really liked this hotel eventhought is a 3 Star hotel it feels Like 4.5 stars. The hotel was built like 100 years ago, it is a historic building, you feel Like you went back in time, amazing.
Bed is super comfy, and they have different suites with different styles (old, fancy styles), room is clean, the only thing is that our room was facing the street so it was noisy, but you can choose rooms not facing the street, up to you. The view was nice too.
Another plus is that the metro entrance was right there in the same block, unión square is 3 blocks from the hotel and the bus stop in front of the hotel so it is a good location.
Something else, they have a starbucks coffee place inside, how convenient is that!.
We didnt walk around the neighborhood at Night, lot of people on the streets, but the hotel has 24hours security so we felt Safe.
It is only vallet parking what was convenient too.

review.title: the hotel suck... the location suck... it smelling
review.reviewText: I pay them  one day more off rent.. just check out early.... $40 dollars parking day suck... fly every here..them did have toilet paper for me that suck.... the bathroom too small no hot water on shower for 5 minute... really the bathroom door donot luck... the lamp donot work.. I have to call room service three time the first night...

Staff very nice and helpful.  Lobby beautiful.  Room was not that clean - tile missing - window sills dirty.  Need a fresh coat of paint on the doors and sills.  Toilet leaked when flushed.  I stayed there as a child when it was really something.  Wanted to return to stay again.  Disappointed in rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Need rooms cleaned and updated.
review.locationRemarks: Good access to public transportation.   Not so good - abundance of homeless people near hotel.

review.title: nice hotel close to public transportation
review.reviewText: Went to San Francisco to see baseball game. The room was clean. this historic hotel is in a good location for the central city.   We were bothered by the homeless people in the front of the hotel they were at time aggressive.  The staff did very little to handle the issues.
review.negativeRemarks: Need bellman at the rear entrance to help with the luggage.  You have to use the valet parking and there is no one back there to help with the luggage
review.locationRemarks: On market in the tenderloin district. metro right in the front of the hotel. Had a great farmers market 1 block over.

review.title: My stay was alright, nothing to memorable.
review.reviewText: It was extremely noisy at the hotel, also parking in general was just terrible.
Great Location and not much else.  The hotel looked old but not historic.  Needs an update and more care from staff in general. One lobby bathroom stall was missing a toilet paper dispenser.

review.title: Nice hotel right on Market Street
review.reviewText: Great hotel, nice staff, good location, easy checking in and out
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to get and let us store our luggage.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators were really slow so we just took the stairs. Bathroom was really small
review.locationRemarks: Right next to BART, bus stops, and Chase bank.

review.title: Horrible Customer Service
review.reviewText: Staff has very bad horrible customer service! Valet is absolutely disorganized and lost my car! Just an overall bad experience!

review.title: Could have been great 80 years ago. Now avoid.
review.reviewText:
I have made a mistake of staying in Whitcomb twice in my life and wow not to do that again.

This hotel was probably great almost 100 years ago, today it's a hotel corpse.

Apart from general look and feel:
- internet is probably 300kbs
- no cell phone coverage in my room
- I waited 40 min to get my car from the valet parking and got yelled at in the process.

Avoid Market St facing roomsa at any cost as the street noise is overwhelming.

review.title: Historical hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Great location near Civic Center in the city.  Great location for PRIDE weekend.  The room was clean, and the staff was friendly.  However, there weren't nearly enough staff or elevators to accomodate the crowds.  Elevator waits were often ~5 minutes just to find one with room.  Sometimes you had to travel the opposite direction in the elevator just to reserve space.  We had to wait a really long time for a bellman to store our bags too.
