When we picked up our "valet," he walked us about 3 blocks away to a parking garage instead of driving the car to us.  He said it would be easier to access the freeway this way.  However, walking 3 blocks with our bags through the throngs of people was not fun.  The valet man also walked really fast (since he wasn't carrying ANY bags) without consideration for the fact that we were.  This was a big disappointment considering the hotel was so nice.  I expected better of this quality of hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Historic atmosphere.  Great location in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Faster elevators.  More staff on busy weekends.

review.reviewText: Had a great stay. Room was perfect size, and the bed was super comfy.

review.title: a lot of homeless around
review.reviewText: I travel with my wife and kids, for the most part it was fine but at times homeless around the hotel a bit bothersome
review.positiveRemarks: is clean and I would give him good 3 stars, nothing spectacular
review.negativeRemarks: it has certain smell in the room, tobacco like

review.title: Time travel back to the 1920's
review.reviewText: Just overall wasn't impressed with the hotel, especially for the price we paid. The hotel is very dated and in need of a SERIOUS update; the lighting is very poor, paint finish on doors and what not are tacky and poorly done, bathroom amenities are sub par, and the room is very small. I'm from Canada so i'm more accustomed to larger rooms, but I can understand the smaller room for a similar price being in a bigger city like San Francisco. OK. But, the price we paid for the service, the bathroom amenities, and everything else was not worth it. Not to mention, there were a lot of sketchy characters that both stayed at the hotel, as well as loiter around the front entrance to the hotel. I also understand that this may be beyond the control of the hotel, as with any big cities sketchy people tend to frequent the downtown core. Regardless, If your looking for a weekend away with your girlfriend, don't pick downtown. Lesson learned. Pick Fisherman's wharf.

Old sub-par hotel at expensive rates, with rude employees and bad internet!

Location is the only good thing

review.title: Hotel near the Civic Center
review.reviewText: This is a questionable area of SF for walking at night.  The bathroom was way too small in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Larger bathrooms would help.

review.title: Hotel double rooms too small for two people
review.reviewText: Had booked room for 2 people. There was hardly any space to move around or keep our bags. Bathroom seemed to be added just for the sake it. Wash basin had no room to keep toiletries.

review.title: Double charged
review.reviewText: I paid in full through Expedia.  The hotel charged me again when I checked out telling me Expedia only made the reservation for me.  Called Expedia once and hotel three times to resolve.  The hotel made an error in charging me at checkout.  Still waiting for refund after a week.  Poor staff training and bad experience overall.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff should have much better understanding of on line reservation procedure.
review.locationRemarks:
Pier 39
Golden Gate Bridge cruise

review.title: Not a great experience
review.reviewText: The room we were given keys to wasn't prepared, the wifi didn't work in the room, the shower pressure wasn't good. The historic aspect of the hotel is cool, but it doesn't deserve a 3.5 star rating. The staff were nice, but not often very helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price in San Fran
review.reviewText:
My husband and I enjoyed the four days we spent there. We really liked our hotel room. The high ceilings made the room feel a lot bigger than it was. 
We only took the elevator when we had our luggage because we never had the time or the patience to wait. We were on the six floor but taking the steps wasn't too bad. 
Over all we were very pleased with the price and the location.

Needed a one night stay to watch the Giants games.  Nice hotel but far from the stadium. BART was very close and easy to use, but there were many homeless people loitering around which made the area feel unsafe.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice accommodations for a one night trip.
review.negativeRemarks: The one check-in clerk was rude and disrespectful with a number of customers.
review.locationRemarks: Location was further away from Union Square than expected. The farmers market across the street and access to BART was excellent.

review.title: Decent hotel bad location.
review.reviewText: Although location was central to things to do in San Francisco with public transportation at your doorstep, walking around the hotel reminded me of New York 30 years ago with homeless people as soon as you step out. Suitable for a place to crash if you are 20 something.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk seemed cluttered and a few front desk people were surly.
review.locationRemarks: I would recommend taking a taxi to the different areas and there are many but don't walk around especially late.

review.title: Poor Customer Service
review.reviewText: Never had enough towels or wash cloths even after calling and asking for them they weren't brought.  Had to call again next morning.  Bartender was rude and seemed put off by having to serve me a glass of wine. Overpriced.

review.title: A standard hotel.
review.reviewText:
The staff, especially the concierge, Toby, was super helpful. The shuttle to the airport was also a good deal.

The hotel was fine, but compared to other hotels there was some drawbacks:

The water pressure could have been a little stronger for my taste. The TV didn't have many channels and a lot were fuzzy or had no audio. The elevator was really slow it seemed so I often took the stairs.

The location isn't great, kind of scummy.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure, TV channels, faster elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Market St is kind of dirty in the area of the hotel, but there is plenty to do. The subway is right out the door.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
The Lobby was impressing with lots of giant Art Deco mirrors around
BUT the Jockey Scratched my car.
Lots of Stains on my Comforter. Disgusting.
review.negativeRemarks:
Cleanliness and Water for guests. 
Jockey Scratched my Car . REally disappointing.
review.locationRemarks: Easy Accessible Bart.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The hotel had a bit of a musty / old smell to it.  There were parts of my room that were not clean and you could tell there was not a great deal of attention spent on keeping the room looking it's best.  I did find the bed to be very comfortable and did sleep well.
review.locationRemarks: I'm not very familiar with SF but I don't believe this was a very desirable part of the city.

review.reviewText: Not enough people working the front desk, EVER.  I've never seen a hotel more understaffed.  The water pressure in my room was so low, and there was only a sheet on the bed, no blanket!! Worse, more than half the outlets didn't work, and the ones that did were too big that the plugs wouldn't stay.  Makes it difficult to charge things up, a major pain when you're on business.

review.title: Needs some TLC
review.reviewText: Based on a friends review, we chose to stay at the Whitcomb.It is a grand older hotel in need of some serious TLC. We arrived from SFO via taxi but Bart and Muni right out the front door.Entering the hotel is like stepping back in time.The public rooms and hallways are nice just very dark. Loved the tall ceilings and the wood moldings. Staff was okay, but did not go out of their way with greetings nor opening doors. We booked a room with 2 double beds and bath. The beds were comfortable although the pillows could be refurbished. The bath was small but doable- shower only. I know we are in a drought but the water restricted shower heads are like standing under a watering can- it was really hard trying to wash my shoulder length hair. Ate in the hotel restaurant one morning for breakfast but it was not great. Walk up Hayes to The Grove or Stacks instead. Starbucks in the lobby really handy. The area around the hotel is a bit seedy but certainly safe for walking around ;I would be careful late at night. We will consider returning to the Whitcomb for it's old bones and afforadibility.
review.positiveRemarks: Historical feel, comfortable bed and quiet, easy accessibility to public transportation,close to Hayes Vallley restaurants and Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: The Whitcomb needs brightening and a really deep cleaning. We had some little black insects in our shower and nats were flying in room off the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: access to theater and civic center. Hayes Valley restaurants and shopping up the street; Market to Union Square. BART and MUNI out front door

review.title: Older Hotel but room was clean and fresh
review.reviewText: parking additional and pricy - staff friendly and helpful
review.locationRemarks: Sad area of town with lots of homeless on the streets near hotel

review.title: Very disapointed
review.reviewText: Had to switch rooms 3 times, 1st time they tried to put me and another person in a very small room with a double bed, next room I did get a king as requested, however, the bath tub leaked all night and did not get a good nights sleep, they had to switch my room again because they could not fix the leak. 3rd room King bed was very hard and not comfortable! I just dealt with it because I did not want to change rooms again. I ask for a refrigerator and never got one. No coffee in room. I would not ever stay at this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be upgraded and well maintained for the price they are charging for this room.

review.title: A night in crazy town!!!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in the scariest neighborhood riddled with freaks and weirdos! I stepped outside the front in the morning to immediately be accosted by two separate freaks, one threatening to kill me and the other (wearing a stocking cap over his face) screaming in my face. I've never felt so unsafe in my life. The staff doesn't seem to do anything to stop these degenerates from harassing the guests. After dark, they check your room key before they let you in but they do nothing for you as you attempt to make it safely to the front of the hotel.

The hotel itself is fine, although you will die of old age waiting for the elevator. None of the staff speak english and housekeeping walked right into our room 3 hours before check out time. I was disgusted by the whole thing. I would never stay there ever again.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Frighteningly horrific neighborhood. I feel thankful I made it out alive.

review.title: Historic hotel on the edge of downtown.
review.reviewText: Found it on-line. Very convenient to BART. Check-in went smoothly.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy walk to heart of downtown (Powell Street, e.g.). Streetcars stop in front of hotel for downtown, Ferry Building, and Fisherman's Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattress was old and uncomfortable. Furnishings could use an upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: Streets in immediate vicinity a bit seedy, but area is being upscaled.

review.title: Bad hotel with a huge price
review.reviewText: Price for this kind of hotel is very high. Rooms are old and dirty.

review.title: This is a great central location.
review.reviewText:
We were in the City to attend two Giant night games. Muni transportation and Bart were at our doorstep, could not be more convienent and resonable. This is a typical Market Street property, there are the homeless people present but certainly not a problem. Security at the hotel makes you feel very comfortable. My wife and I are in our 80's
and over the past 15 years have spent more than 30 nights a year in Hotels and Motels.
review.positiveRemarks: This is definately an older style but comfortable hotel and one that we enjoyed. Our queen sized superior room was very clean and well appointed.
review.negativeRemarks: Bath room fixtures, such as grab bars at the bathtub and surface areas for setting items on.
review.locationRemarks: good transsportation for anywhere in the city

review.title: Historic hotel in the heart of San Francisco 's
review.reviewText: Beautiful and historic hotel near the SF symphony ,opera and theatre. Comfortable and elegant room. Very accommodating staff.

review.title: Would not recommend to stay here.
review.reviewText: It was 100% not the best hotel I stayed at. Need remodeling and some other work done to it. Located not in the best part of the town. Kinda old place and needs to be fixed. Hotel staff was friendly but not really organized. Very many homeless people in that area. Will not stay and spend $ on this one again.......

review.title: Much better location than condition
review.reviewText: The room is very small. So is the bathroom. The hotel needs to be upgraded immediately.
review.positiveRemarks: It's an old hotel and the location is good. It's just near the city hall.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade.

review.title: Easy access from I-80
review.reviewText: Hotel was a little more worn than pictures depict and the area nearby was a rough. We were glad the hotel restaurant was so good... no need to venture out at night. Very accessible to and from Muni, BART or bus... and a longish but pleasant walk back from UCSF. Overall it met our needs but the upstairs hallways were depressing.
Generally good. There was some construction work that was audible at 3:40a. That was not the good part

review.title: June at the Whitcomb
review.reviewText: Everything went well. Just wish the $35 parking fee was more explicit and upfront in the reservation process.

review.title: Nice traditional hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly and supportive. I felt well taken care of from the minute I was walking through the hotel entrance.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful classical design also in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Public transportation is close by with good connection to the main tourist attractions, theaters, shopping and financial area of SFO.

review.title: DO NOT BOOK
review.reviewText:
This Hotel was not what I was expecting at all. The rating doesn't reflect the Whitcomb. All the ads for the rooms forgot to mention the horrible quality of service and facilities, not to mention all the additional charges for things like a refrigerator or a couch or parking. The ad for our room (a 4 person, 2 queen bed suite) did not mention that we would be finding a broken shower head, no lock on the bathroom door, windows that don't open, a drain that is broken, a running toilet, a broken latch on the main door, no refrigerator or any kind of kitchen appliance, no seating, no drawers and the entire room was covered in dust. Inside the retro light switches was a type of goo that resembled feces. The employees working at the desk are very rude and aggressive. Also, the hotel let us know ahead of time that there was valet parking. However, they didn't specify that it was the ONLY parking for the hotel (unless you want to park on the streets of central San Francisco). By the way, this hotel is in a horrible neighborhood and all the furniture in the lobby looks like it hasn't been cleaned since it opened. There were tons of surprising extra fees. We experienced a few of these fees. You will be charged additionally (per night) for: a fridge, a microwave, a pull-out couch, a couch in general, parking, a hold on your card and an extra fee for using a debit card.
In general, this hotel is outdated, very dirty, in a horrible area and not a great experience. DO NOT BOOK
review.negativeRemarks: Most everything
review.locationRemarks: The only things surrounding this hotel is Market and Union Square. Other than that, you have to pay to take a bus or cable car. BAD NEIGHBORHOOD

review.title: Room Just needs a little work
review.reviewText: When we plug in charger for lap top or for phones, the plugs fall out of their outlet. The outlets are loose and probably unsafe. This is an easy maintenance fix that is being overlooked. The air conditioner was NOISY. The light in bathroom only worked with fan on...Fan was NOISY. There are just many simple functional fixes that are needed. I'm not expecting the Ritz Carlton for the budget price that we got. But I would like a Functional room. The lobby and check in area are very cool and historic looking. The hallways leading to rooms are dreary...also low cost fixes could make the hallways look less jail like. But if the room just functioned well, i'd give this hotel a passing grade.
review.negativeRemarks: Room functionality .... Electrical Outlets are unsafe.....Bathroom Fan runs when you just want light and fan is NOISY. AC is NOISY...can't sleep
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping ...Close to Fishermans Wharf..

review.title: Great Location, Quaint Hotel, But...
review.reviewText:
This is a beautiful and charming old hotel. Pretty much what I expected for the area. I'm no stranger to San Francisco, so I knew what to expect. It's not a great area, but for the price, it's what I expected. It reflects the city -- charming, old and unique. I read a lot of the reviews before I picked it, and noticed a lot of "homeless people!" reviews. Homeless people don't scare me, so I went for it.

The amenities were somewhat lacking. No liners in the trash cans, no coffee maker (I could have sworn I saw that in the description), the freebie shampoo and conditioner were only enough for one person, no toothpaste (the ONE TIME I don't pack it!).

The room was tiny; the bathroom more the size of a closet. Very little water pressure in the shower, and the glass shelf above the sink was inconveniently located.

My daughter swears it's haunted. Well, I don't know, it could just be the age. We found the creaks and groans and odd thumps charming.

The elevators were agonizingly slow and tiny. There's like four of them, and every one of them takes forever!

The staff was quite formal and somewhat stiff, considering it's not an uptown, swanky place, but they were nice enough.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the age and the charm.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators could be revamped to be a little speedier. They could be a little more generous with guest amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of downtown San Francisco -- you can get just about anywhere from here on a cable car or on foot.

review.title: Lovely older hotel, great staff, ok location
review.reviewText:
Front desk staff were very helpful, friendly, and efficient. Phone staff I talked to prior to arrival, to adjust my reservation, were also very helpful.

During my stay, the onlh problem I had was a burned out lightbulb, which they sent someone up to replace right away. The architecture and rooms have a beautiful classic design -- high ceilings, brass doorknobs, wood panelling, painted accents on the trim -- which have clearly stood the test of time.

One thing to be aware of is the location -- just on the edge of the Tenderloin, so the first block or two along Market is a bit dodgy to walk through at night.

review.title: A convenient place but old and poor facilities
review.reviewText:
Can't store water in the bath!
Noisy bath fun.
Smile-less clerk.
Great but old lobby.

But hotel restaurant is good for breakfast.

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel has great character but a bit rundown. Love the ornate lobby and the hall way, high ceilings in rooms. With the discount price from Expedia, we stayed in a corner room without much view but the room is comfortable enough. The restaurant downstairs has great breakfast. Overall it is a pleasant stay.
staff was good overall a very good experience for a nice hotel

review.title: Nice hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: Cozy, small room, but had all I needed. The closet was unusually large. I loved that there was a Starbucks in the building. I don't recommend using the airport shuttle service that the hotel offers. The neighborhood is a little shady at night. I did like that there are 2 pharmacies on each corner of the block to get snacks and any toiletries that you may have forgotten to pack.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is in need of a little painting/ TLC, but the price is right.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Unfortunately the room we had on 2 nd floor was very noisy
review.negativeRemarks: Just the noise .
review.locationRemarks: We attended a wedding at city hall so it was perfect for us also having the Bart outside the door was good too.

review.reviewText:
The overall experience was pleasant. B.A.R.T. station is right next to the hotel. Also, the hotel is attached to the Starbucks, which makes for a quick an convenient breakfast before you hit the town.

There were very large groups of tourists checking in when we arrived, so it was about a 20 minute wait to check in. I noticed the same when we were leaving.

The room was nice, but small; this was not an issue for us though since we mostly were just out and about.

The view out our window was of the another building and a dirty rooftop. Again, this wasnt an issue for us. If you're visiting the area from afar, you may want to request a view.

The staff seems friendly based on the interactions I had; I only faulted them for not handling the group checkin situation more quickly.

The overall experience was nice and I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

review.title: Do not stay here!
review.reviewText: Hotel desk staff were very rude and not willing to help. Environment was very noisy. Outside street noise kept us up, there is a lot of homeless around the hotel. Hotel guests could be heard running up and down the hallways at night making a lot of noise very late at night. We travel a lot and this is the first bad review we have ever written.

review.title: Okay.
review.reviewText: The staff was rude. They charged us an extra card when we only showed them two tickets. I would rather stay at a motel than to go back here. They charged taxes for everything!

review.title: Sigh...
review.reviewText:
This hotel is sadly long past its "best before" date. When your check in experience starts with the lady (at 11.30 am) telling you to "go away, come back at 3pm" you know it's not going to be a great stay, Elevators were slow, room was shabby, area is run-down (beggars abound outside the hotel), the clock radio alarm in my room went off at 6am (shouldn't housekeeping check that?). Oh and because SF was busy that week, they charged me $390/night. Unreal.

Good point: there's a Starbucks in the lobby.

review.title: Okay but certainly not 4-star
review.reviewText:
Hotel was offered as a 4-star which lead to all the disappointment.
I knew it was old, and in hotel's defense they did make some good amount of effort to keep the rooms in decent condition.
The good stuff:
Good location! Plenty of public-transport options, within walking distance fro major tourist spots, decent for business travelers too.
Also - bed was nice and comfortable, nice and clean sheets, towels, etc, room was rather big (or as per US standards - standard size), flat-screen TV, FREE INTERNET (yes!), all the usual and expected amenities for a 3-star hotel.

The not so good stuff:
There was 1 (yes - one!) 3-prong outlet in the room in which was the TV. So I had to pick between charging my phone, using my computer or watching TV. The other 3-prong outlet was in the bathroom. Luckily I had a short extension cord with me. Maintenance is not all up to date, some stuff in the room and bathroom was somewhat neglected (in two instances a screw just needed some tightening), those power-saving lights give the room a bit oldish and cheap feel.
Price was also way too high for a 3-star hotel (even though it was advertised as a 4-star)

And yes, hotel is borderline next to a not so perfect neighborhood, some bums around (but that was expected).
review.positiveRemarks: Good location - literally right next to the BART stairs! Clean and decent size room, all the expected and usual amenities for a 3-star hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Add more outlets!!! Basic maintenance stuff, tighten screws here and there.
review.locationRemarks: Literally right next to BART and MUNI station! Lots of transportation options. (limited parking is available but is expensive!)

review.title: Affordable price for the city.
review.reviewText:
For a quick 1 night stay in the city, this is a decent affordable option for someone on the budget. My friend and I were just looking for a cheap, but decent hotel in the downtown area that was convenient for a day and night in the city.

This hotel was clean overall and was sufficient for our needs. Definitely not somewhere I would stay again as the it was a 10-15minute walk to union square but if budget is the sole need, then this place will do.

Main complaint was the lack of attendants to help us with our bags, being an older hotel, the walls were pretty thin and we heard doors slamming all night. Plus, the check-in staff didn't seem too friendly.

The cleaning staff did greet us every time we saw them.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Needs updates, friendlier staff. The hotel was at a convenient location to get around the city.

review.title: Fabulous sized room close to the SF centre
review.reviewText:
Apart from the reception staff who appeared slow and dis-organised I found the hotel to be good. Very well located within walking distance of Union Sq and other tourist spots. The bedroom size was beyond expectations and I'd certainly stay there again.

Parking was also a factor.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff attitude
review.locationRemarks: Everything you'd want to in the centre of San Francisco!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable and the historic value was very pleasant and interesting to read. We spent too little time there to really get to know the area but it looks like a nice area to stay in.

review.title: Not worth it!
review.reviewText: Checking in was a nightmare. They had us down for the wrong day, so the first night we had check into other hotel. They also wouldn't refund us. They charged us for parking which no one told me until after they charged us, especially there's cheaper garage parking next door. Room was old, rusty and ugly. There's no room service...how can you have a hotel WITH NO room service. Let's just say I'll never book here again.

review.title: Hotel in a scary location.
review.reviewText: Huge number of homeless people around the location, which creates a lot of nose at night and is scary to walk specially at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of repairs.
review.locationRemarks: See comments.

review.title: Clean & comfortable
review.reviewText: Comfortable bed & pillows. Clean room & well staffed with security at the hotel entry after hours.

review.title: Beautiful Accessible Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, awesome staff, really close to all forms of public transportation. Great in and out privlages with parking (extra charge) and can leave vehicle in lot after checkout. Beautiful vintage details. Bit of low water pressure...that would be the only complaint. Stay here!

review.title: Terrible place to stay!
review.reviewText: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. At the time of booking the hotel was rated 3.5 stars. It is terrible, because we booked through a 3rd party such as expedia we both received the worst rooms I believe they had, tile in the bathroom was badly cracked and broken, the tub was very gross, the vent in the bathroom has never been cleaned, the room was old and not renovated like all the others. My co-worker booked directly with the hotel and had a clean new room, with updates and a clean vent! A complete 360 from the rooms we stayed in. I actually tried to cancel 2 hours after I arrived and they wouldn't allow me to or to at least cancel the next night. I explained how disgusted I was of the room. I also requested a fridge in my room they, bring me an old taped up one, that I had to pay $20 each night to have in my room. I ended up staying with my co-worker instead, I had to leave that room. The next day I went to check on the room and the key lock was loose. I thought I'm glad to not stay in this room. The hotel manager that night told me I would have to come the next morning to see if the morning manager would cancel my stay since, he did not allow me too and he did not want to move me to another room. Also, if you are in a hurry don't stay here. The wait for the elevators is 5 mins every time, this place is so old and stinky. You will have to pay for parking your car in the nasty lot or the garage that seconds as a furniture storage and trash area for the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The room quality and the staff - Night manager was rude and cares less about the hotel guests.

review.title: Perfectly sevicable hotel but sketchy location
review.reviewText: fine hotel. Don't let pictures of lobby fool you. it is nothing fancy but nice and reasonably priced

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Business area and Court
review.reviewText: My experience was ok just the area because full of homeless at night ok and you real cant go out and walk at night
review.positiveRemarks: it has a safe lock chain from the inside beside the key
review.negativeRemarks: more security in the area and belle boy at the door
review.locationRemarks: it more of a homeless area which take away from just a nice Hotel

review.reviewText: I didn't like the hotel as their rooms are quite secluded . They don't have complimentary bottle of water not hot water kettle . As the price they charging these are the basic things they should provide..

review.title: Total Crap
review.reviewText: I could write a novel about this hotel. This is the second time I have tried one of these Expedia super deals and both times I was disappointed. No more. This Hotel is old and it shows. The pictures are misleading. Let's start off with having to deal with the never ending amount of tourists that are in huge groups and basically run you over at every turn. Walking outside of the hotel you are continually harassed by the never ending bum population. The plumbing is from the 40's and features an advertisement in the toilet from the local plumber. The shower forget it if you are over 5'8" tall unless you have a thing for bending over in the shower. Could not figure out why the TV would not turn on until I flipped a light switch and the alarm clock was on the same switch so I guess time is not important. Another thing that they don't tell you about is the parking fee they charge that is enough to stay a night in the motel six. The room reminded me of Europe where they think that the size of a closet is a superior room. Run be scared!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Get harassed by bums walking the street. Fine dinning the burger king is across the street.

review.title: What the heck is that smell??
review.reviewText: Hotel seems like it was a grand hotel in the past. However, there's a pervasive odor of urine or fungus in the hallway and the room. I couldn't really tell the difference. It really would be an ok place to stay if not for that smell. Literally had to spray cologne in the room to get rid of the terrible smell every night I slept.

review.title: older amenities...convenient to downtown
review.reviewText: details aren't there, but classy older hotel. Certainly convenient to downtown SF, price-wise okay for the city.

review.title: Nice Older Hotel with Quiet Rooms
review.reviewText:
I booked this hotel because it was the least expensive in the very expensive San Francisco market. It is located on Market street. This part of Market street is not where you want to hang out, but it is a short walk to shopping and a short bus ride to the ferry building where you can walk to Giants games.

The room was decent size. It is an older hotel so the bathrooms are very basic. My room was situated in the back and was very quiet. I slept great which is what I wanted. Hotel staff were friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet room and comfortable bed. Starbucks in hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms especially the bathrooms could be remodeled
review.locationRemarks: This is not far from union square which is popular shopping area. Where the cable cars tourists like to ride are located. About 5 blocks.

review.title: Old, outdated hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel definitely needs an upgrade. If you're stuck in time that might be your choice if not I would rather recommend to look for a different hotel.

review.title: front desk - poor time/line mgmt
review.reviewText: often there would be a line or a crowd at the front desk. one staff member would be handling the line while 1-2 other front desk staff were there but engaged in other tasks. makes one wonder what could be more important then the growing storm of paying customers in line. . .
review.positiveRemarks: beautiful old school stained glass, chandeliers, marble, tile and wood.
review.negativeRemarks: its an attention to the customer they lack, i have stayed here several times and its always the same. the front desk gives lip service - no action
review.locationRemarks: awesome location easy to union square, matron, convention center city hall, a little dicey but if you walk with confidence there are no issues.

review.title: Good price, but not the most ideal area
review.reviewText: Booked through the Expedia unpublished rate, price was much lower than any other hotels in the city. The area is full of homeless, and about 10-20min walk to be out of the area and hit union square (the nicer part of downtown). Washroom is very dated and shower pressure was very low. Staff and cleanliness was above expectation compared to the condition of hotel. Not likely to return as we felt somewhat unsafe walking in the area...

review.title: Historic building with modern conveniences
review.reviewText: We chose this place because it was centered between our afternoon, evening and morning destinations. It was pleasant and comfortable, with the bonus of being an historic building. This stretch of Market is still a little down-scale, but it's coming back.
review.positiveRemarks: Historic building, well–furnished, comfortable room, friendly bar looking out on the sidewalk.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much: in-room safe and refrigerator would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: An easy walk to the up-and-coming Hayes Valley. Not far from The Mission, with its lively restaurant and bar scene.

review.title: Really old hotel.
review.reviewText:
Staff not friendly at old and they know nothing about customer service. When i was checking in i asked the reception if im able to smoke in the room. He start shouting as if "he was paying my room and he will be for the fine" this was my first impression.
Also, the hotel equipments and bathrooms are old.

review.title: A decent business hotel if booked at a discount
review.reviewText:
Another reviewer invoked The Shining when describing the hallways, and it's an apt description. This place feels its age. With a complete renovation, it could be an architectural showpiece; as it is, it's teetering on the border between being seriously overdue for renovation, and absolutely needing it to continue doing business.

I found the room spacious, with magnificently high ceilings. It's their best feature, unfortunately. The mattress was like sleeping in pudding, and the sheets were thin and insufficient for the climate. The towels were actually of above-average quality, but the water pressure in the shower is so weak you won't have much call for them. The ceiling was leaking in my bathroom, to the degree that the carpet outside the bathroom was damp.

I appreciated the fact that the windows open all the way; if I've a mind to jump out of a hotel window, I don't want some nannying window sash telling me I can't do it.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent breakfast in the hotel restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: The best thing to do nearby is to avoid getting stabbed. I did find an excellent Ethiopian restaurant down the street, though.

review.title: something was off
review.reviewText:
It is suppose to be a historic hotel, but its just old and in need of make over.
the rooms it self was very neatly done, small but had the making of a very expensive hotel 20 year ago.
I cancelled by second night couldn't really put my finger on what was off.
Parking is expensive but in line with san Francisco, I am still not sure if you got breakfast with the room and where the cafeteria is.

review.title: Good enough room to sleep in
review.reviewText:
My girlfriend and I stayed here for four nights, and while the hotel was satisfactory regarding the comfort and cleanliness of the room, there were a few issues with the bathroom door (it did not shut properly and had no lock) and the rooms were a little dated with regards to the decoration. Also, the staff were a little apathetic most of the time. Good points are the Starbucks next door, and the proximity of the hotel to downtown San Francisco. There are a lot of homeless people in the area, but really they are harmless if you just ignore them . . .
Overall, it was comfy enough room to sleep in.

review.title: Really nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel. Be careful of location as there's a lot of homeless people outside and it's about a 10 min walk to union square. Gets a little creepy after dark.

review.title: Location is the only good thing about this hotel.
review.reviewText:
Don't expect to sleep ---- garbage trucks come by at 5AM and clang around dumpsters for 20 minutes.

Carpet is nasty.

Bathroom is slum-like.

This place needs a major, major upgrade.

review.title: Average hotel. It was a bit far from tourist strip
review.reviewText: It was ok. Bed and pillows were uncomfortable. Smelt in the hall ways. Breakfast in restaurant average.
review.negativeRemarks: Better bedding
review.locationRemarks: Close to transport.

review.title: Cheap, get what you pay for.
review.reviewText:
Got a room and a bed. I got this hotel while doing a bid on expedia, so I didn't pick it. The bathroom sucked, the door wasn't hung properly or was warped or didn't fit due to 50 layers of paint. The door wouldn't latch either, so it would pop open. The toilet must be close to original. I know the plumbing is old but you think they could install a modern stool. Had to flush about 5 times to even get toilet paper down.

The staff was nice enough, but multiple times I came to the front desk and they would be doing something on the computer, and tell you just a moment. And then proceed to click-clack away for 5 minutes. I would understand if they were on the phone with a customer or something, but they weren't.

Not the hotel's fault but this area is a lot more full of homeless people than the more upscale area of Market St. We got sick of them pretty quickly and just started hopping on the cable cars as soon as we could in front of the hotel. That was convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: The toilet needed to be flushed about 5 times to get anything down. The door in the bathroom wouldn't latch all the way and would pop open.

review.title: Historic Hotel...
review.reviewText:
Starbucks in the lobby! Yeah.....but, not coffee in the room. The lobby furniture was tired looking, which made me nervous. However, the staff was friendly, efficient, and helpful. We arrived early in the morning and were allowed to store our luggage. When showed to our room it was small but quaint. There was dust/dirt around the edges of the carpet at the wall, and a lot inside the vents of the airconditioner/heater. The toilet was cracked and had been repaired. It needed new caulk around the tub.
The bed was very comfortable and the bedding top notch.
Housekeeping replaced towels and made up the bed daily and everything looked great. A deep cleaning is what is needed.
The concierge, well really all the staff were great. Overall I would rate this hotel a 4.
Security in the lobby at night. If you can't prove you have a room, you won't be getting on the elevator.
review.positiveRemarks:
The bed.
Starbucks in the lobby.
The location. We took Bart in from the airport and it was just a quick block walk to the Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: New lobby furniture. Deep cleaning in the rooms. Fix the cracked toilet.
review.locationRemarks: We did it all. Chinatown, Japantown, Wharf, Cable Car, bus, taxi, Golden Gate Park, Haight, Hayes, Union Square, Market St, Mission. Perfect location

review.title: Central
review.reviewText: Bed shocker, lifts broken down frequently, no coffee machine, no help with luggage, staff very busy

review.title: Ok for the price
review.reviewText: When we arrived had to wait 15 mins just to have a attendant take our car. Fyi 35 dollar parking fee everyday!! Got in a little late and front desk lady acted like we were putting her out just by checking in. The room was ok but we were with our 1 year old daughter and they put us right by the ice machine so constantly throughout the night people would be talking and geting ice and it would wake my daughter up. Just request a room away from ice machine and then you should be fine. The rooms are actually kind of neat just need a update really badly. All in all it was good for the price as all of the other hotels were well over the 200 mark.

review.title: Easy access to BART
review.reviewText:
Literally in front of 8th/market BART exit made it nice to come from airport and be right there.
Got checked in and upgraded to king bed with no extra fees. Staff was very nice.
Starbucks in Lobby was convenient. Great breakfast sandwiches in farmers market on Sunday. Try lillia Thai food just up the street. Excellent! East access to all locations. The room however smelled like a mix of cat pee and mildew. It was raining when we were there but we opened up our windows and it was better after a few hours.

review.title: No frills basic hotel
review.reviewText: Best is the vintage look. Worse is i slept on the most uncomfortable mattress ever. Felt like the original mattress from when the place opened.

review.title: Hotel A Okay!
review.reviewText: Stayed in #320 small clean room, quiet and had a ghost visit last night around 2am. Ghost was not malevolent just curious I guess. Right on Market, bus and Bart lines. Water pressure in shower was lower than I'd like. Overall I will stay there again!!!

review.title: Good location, reasonable price
review.reviewText: The location is excellent. The hotel is old and is historic but well maintained.

review.title: public transportation very handy
review.reviewText: hotel very nice and accomadating. Use of public transportation very easy to use close by. Would haave liked to have someplace to eat & have a glass of wine during the day. Restauant closed most of the time.
review.locationRemarks: close to theatres and place to sightsee.

review.title: Fair, but wouldn't pay full price
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a decent and convenient location, staff was friendly and rooms were good. For the price, I would have hoped for an in-room refrigerator, coffee maker, a truly clean bathroom (without random hairs left behind and a mold/mildew free shower) and FREE parking. For the cut rate, I didn't complain, but wouldn't pay full price.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness in bathrooms, to have in room refrigerator and coffee maker, and FREE parking.
review.locationRemarks: Close to AT&T Park, on Market with the Orpheum across the street, local bars and restaurants nearby. Quick drive to the Wharf.

review.title: Old but comfortable
review.reviewText: Historic hotel in San Francisco. Noisy hallways but overall the beds were comfortable and staff was friendly. No coffee maker or safe in the room but there is a Starbucks right the lobby. We ate in the hotel restaurant and it was good food but seemed a bit overpriced ($5 for an orange juice). Rooms were small but nice and had tall ceilings making it seem larger.

review.title: They tricked us
review.reviewText: We prepaid for a room with a king bed when we showed up they said they sold out of rooms with king beds and offered us two small beds. We had to take the room. We are mad and will never use Expedia again and certainly not ever stay at this hotel.

review.title: 2 to 3 hours to check in for New Year's Eve
review.reviewText:
Parking line was not too bad compared to the previous year, great so far, but the shock was finding at 4 pm, a long snaking line that took up the whole of the hotel lobby. We talked to people in front of us in the line and they had been there for 2 hours already.

What is this hotel thinking about. They had 3 or 4 people at the check in desk on NYE and about 200 waiting to check in at 4 pm.
review.positiveRemarks: It's comfortable, the beds are comfy, nice sheets. Location is great. Price is OK for what you get in the middle of the city
review.negativeRemarks: A lot more competent staff on the front desk would be a real bonus. The car parking situation could be better.

review.title: Nice hotel but scary district!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is a nice and historical building in a very central location.
Unfortunately the area is populated by an incredibile number of homeless people!
Don't get me wrong with that!
The only problem is that some of them could be dangerous as they scream and fight among themselves even at night hours.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are nice but a renovation would be nice. Location is ok to reach Piers and north part of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Restroom is quite antique

review.title: Avoid
review.reviewText: The area is full of homeless people. It was unsettling to be outside even during the evening. Completely avoid it.

review.title: Very nice hotel close to downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Stayed here for two nights. Loved the atmosphere and the staff was very friendly. The hotel is very clean and is in a very nice location in San Francisco. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Tired in need of renovation
review.reviewText: very tired hotel but bed sheets clean. Mattress was sagging and had terrible sleep. Grubby hotel but to be fair the bed sheets were clean. Invest some money and renovate.
review.negativeRemarks: renovation, decoration

review.title: Decent hotel for price. Not the best location.
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb had a very kind and accommodating staff. The location was not terrific; we had to pass many groups of vagabonds and quiet, unkempt blocks on our walk to the more popular tourist area. The hotel is however a short walk, about ten minutes from the popular Union Square area. The hotel room itself was a bit musty smelling, the sheets were not the cleanest (they appeared to have a pink highlighter mark on them, not anything seriously repulsive), the shower floor was a bit worn, and the phone did not work, but the hotel does have a nice historic feel. High ceilings and appealing architecture are the other side to its appearance. All in all, a good hotel for the money, and the BART and many other lines of transportation stop just outside the hotel making it a convenient spot in the end.

review.title: Disappointed in hotel
review.reviewText:
Two bedside lights didn't work, bellman said he would send someone,no one came to repair....
Vending machine on 5th floor took money no drink came out, lost money.
Crab salad for companions was rancid they couldn't eat, verified by waiter.. terrible experience they didn't want to try anything else.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to theater we were attending. Clean bathroom, clean beds/sheets
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure all lights etc work in room Improve menu and quality of food served.
review.locationRemarks: close to theater, one museum, shopping several blocks away

review.title: Staff party was more important than my reservation
review.reviewText:
The Hotel had no record of my Expedia reservation when I arrived. The receptionist working with me left the front desk area to speak with the manager. She told me to sit in the lobby over my objections that I was running late for an event. After 5-10 minutes, I became curious as to what was taking so long. I peaked into the manager's office only to find the hotel staff throwing a party while I was waiting to be checked in. There was a cake, punch, and the receptionist was sitting on another person's lap. This probably wouldn't have bothered me had I not been in such a rush. The manager and receptionist, clearly embarrassed, only then took steps to get me into my room.

As for the room, every time another room turns on water it sounds like a bomb going off; jackhammers from neighboring buildings woke me up Saturday morning; and there is no place to set toiletries in the bathroom.

review.title: It was an ok stay.
review.reviewText: The room and bathroom were to small plus some of the staff were very rude. I will not be staying there again.

review.title: Really nice hôtel but around is not a pretty place
review.reviewText:
It was a good experience , the elevator is not modern.
We always use stairs.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet doesn't wok well in the room half time.
review.locationRemarks: Homeless are so presents and ugly but the location is near métro

review.title: Great price Market St.
review.reviewText: Our room was tiny, and the toilet in the bathroom was missing a piece. The staff did offer another room, but, the wait time for check-in and the inability if the staff to answer the phone when we called with above complaint signaled that we stay at another hotel.

review.title: Do Not Stay Here!
review.reviewText: This hotel has an eerieness to it from the minute you walk in and feels haunted. It hasn't been updated in what looks like over 40 years. I chose this hotel because it looked like it had charm from the photos and had decent reviews. The 2nd floor is definitely haunted and the temperature continued to drop as I walked down a long dreary hallway. My room was just has scary. The bathroom door was swung open and it had dim, cold lighting with an aweful chill in the room. I felt like I just entered a horror movie. Needless to say as the night hours crept in I felt increasingly uncomfortable with the heavy energy of spirits. I moved rooms to the 6th floor which I was appreciative of. It had better energy, since it had been more recently updated, but there was still something very off, like if you went to the bathroom, the door would shut on you. I dont know what went down in this hotel, and I didnt even know it was haunted until I asked the front desk if there had been any reports and he said yes. The amount of dust and stuffiness made it difficult to breathe and by midnight I was so freaked out I checked out and moved to another hotel. This in my opinion should not be a running hotel, but a destination for paranormal researchers. If the owner cared at all he would reupholster the lobby furniture removing the cigarette stains and warped lumpy stuffing that looks like a camels back. It should be completely gutted, saged, and updated. Do not stay here.

review.title: did not like
review.reviewText: The toilet was not clean when we arrived, we had to have maid service come in to scrub it. Staff at the Lobby were as cold as fish. connoisseurs was very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Help with your luggage when you arrive.and the Staff in the Lobby.
review.locationRemarks: The Muni is just right out front door, that makes it nice to get to and from places.

review.title: yes this is the one!
review.reviewText: very happy hree. the staff conceierge front desk housekeeping everyone very nice . beatufitul decor and old hotel in the middle of town

review.title: Nice Hotel off Market Street.
review.reviewText: The hotel has a wood paneled lobby which first attracted me while browsing online. A mix up in the reservation placed me in a room at the far end with little view to another building and a wall. The hotel is obviously old and while clean, it is showing its age. Other rooms overlooking Market St might be charming. Since I was there for a meeting, I did not spend time in the tiny room except to sleep. The neighborhood at night is a bit empty and this might make some folks nervous. This is a downtown hotel and on busy Market St within walking distance of most things. Overall it was satisfactory for what the pictures and review stated. I could have had a better experience at the front desk, but this was one woman having a bad day. Otherwise everyone else was pleasant and courteous.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was right for me to attend a meeting at the Moscone Center. It is a walk to get there. But it is not unpleasant even in the early morning
review.negativeRemarks: You would need to modernize - unlikely. And the room lighting is pretty poor due to the new bulbs.
review.locationRemarks: There are parks and a farmers' market. The cablecar is close. And there is always Union Square. Lots to do. This hotel in not central, but close enoug

review.title: Good location, not so much space
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located, so getting to any place in the city is relatively easy. The staff was great, but the rooms were smaller than the photos show. We had to request a new room to accommodate our group of four. Rooms need to be remodeled / upgraded as well as cleaned a bit more thoroughly. Overall it was an average stay, but the trip was amazing!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was helpful, helped get us a larger room. Also the history and character.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be upgraded and cleanliness needs to improve.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants and bars around the area, as well as close to the ball park

review.title: Nice hotel great public transportation
review.reviewText: A nice hotel on the historic registry .... older but clean very nice staff... small bathroom if that matters to you ... The local muni and bart are within 200 feet of the hotel under ground of course.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds comfortable , and a historic hotel nice harm....
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom ...
review.locationRemarks: The availability of the muni and bart system make everything close ... AT & T it only took 15 minutes to get to it ....

review.title: Great location, good price.
review.reviewText: We were happy in general. Beds a little soft for him, fine for me. No mini fridge and slow elevators were the main irritants. Lobby is beautiful, hotel restaurant is over priced, food is ok. Sam's dinner across market st is excellent.

review.title: Comfortable and clean hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel has a beautiful historic feeling, rooms were clean and comfortable however there was no room safe to secure valuables. Had dinner at the downstairs restaurant one night, steak and lamb dishes were very well prepared and tasted

Safe to walk around area during the day, however at night it gets a bit seedy with all the homeless that base themselves on Market St. Recommend Cable car F which stops out the front or a cab after sun set!

review.title: Old hotel in Tenderloin
review.reviewText: Very good staff. Very convenient to public transportation. Problematic musty smell in dark hallways. Loud street noise as hotel is on the main thourough fare. Seems to cater well to European visitors. Neighborhood can be very rough after dark. Room was small and dated but clean and private. Even with heavy construction in area ,the rough neighborhood and antiquated accommodations it is still a very good $ value for a SF visitor. It is steps away from MUNI and BART which can rapidly transport you to almost anywhere in the city. Very nice staff make you not worry so much about the lack of modernity.

review.title: OLD AND RUN DOWN
review.reviewText: BUILDING IS VERY OLD. ROOMS ARE NOT WORTH THE PRICE. I WAS BIT ON MY ARM AND HEAD WHILE SLEEPING - DISGUSTING.
review.negativeRemarks: TEAR IT DOWN OR REMODEL

review.title: Okay hotel not good area
review.reviewText: Staff really need to develop some form of professionalism and the noise from the bins at 4am is awful.

review.title: Old hotel, run down.
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb hotel is located in a not so nice area of town. Whenever getting out of the hotel, I seemed to be surrounded by beggeres st and homeless people. The hotel itself is old building. They have done some renovations to the rooms, but the main hallways still look like old run down hotel. Although a nonsmoking room, my room was filled with the smell of tobacco. The staff seemed to be nice.

review.title: "The Shining"
review.reviewText: Historic 19th century hotels are not for me. I can't argue that they are preserving the history of the hotel but let me tell you this was like entering a haunted hotel. The wall paper, all hallways lead to a huge mirror, the creaky elevator with mirrors, the rooms have mirrors all over, dark wood trim, the lighting was too dim everywhere. Trust me it's not romantic type of dim.

review.title: Old hotel in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice. Everything was old. It was quiet. Parking a car was expensive and hard to get to. Couldn't walk to any attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Found mouse in room. Was a bit too worn arorund the edges. Too far from eateries and didn't feel safe to walk around and explore.
review.locationRemarks: Seemed like it was close to stuff but we found it inconvenient.

review.title: Quaint Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was quaint and clean. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Check in process is a little slow, but the employees make up for it by being very personable. A lot of reviewers mention the homeless, being a local I know this is just a fact in this part of the SF, but of no fault of the hotel. In walking distance of many attractions and activities.

review.title: Great hotel, just had a few issues.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is very nice and we liked to location. The beds were very comfortable and the decor was great. We had problems with no towels in the room when we arrived. They did bring some up when we called down to request them, but they were just thrown on the bed while we were out of the room. There was also some old worn pantyhose in one of the drawers, yuck. I was glad to hear that they had Valet parking, but accessing it was hard. You had to drive around the back to an alley to drop off your car. When trying to retrieve the car, you were unable to call down to the front desk to have it brought around. They stated that they had nothing to do with the valet parking. It was hard to find an attendant to get the car for you once you went down.

review.title: Lots of history in this beautiful hotel
review.reviewText:
Our first thought was that it was not in a great location but the more we got to know the area we realized that it was good walking distance to some great areas.
The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We got a quick tour of the mezzanine level and learned about the incredible history of the hotel. The hand carved woodwork and marble were beautiful!
It may not the the newest hotel but I'm so glad we stayed here.

review.title: Very poor service!!
review.reviewText: I expected much more from this hotel since the price I've paid was a bit high.. Starting from the valet to the reception very very poor services. Only one person to help all guests with luggage, staff are not polite and they don't care about your stay. Worst hotel ever

review.title: Our stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: 1 of our beds was sagged in the middle, we had mold in the bathroom, no washcloths were available. I booked for 4 people, but were only supplied 3 towels. We asked for another towel, but didn't receive it and had to request a second time the next day. We drove to the hotel with our truck. It's a big truck and they charged us for 2 spots (70.00/night). I called the hotel before we left to let them know we had a big truck and did they have parking for us, they didn't mention we would be charged for 2 spots. We ended up finding parking for our last 2 nights and we had cancelled parking with the hotel and yet, they tried to charge us for 1 extra night. I had to speak with the manager. The area outside was really rough. We were in the middle of "skid row". We had to be back at our hotel by night. The entrance of the hotel is absolutely beautiful, but I definitely would not stay in the hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: The entrance way was beautiful. Chandeliers, marble and beautiful woodwork.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is in a bad area. That was the main disappointment. When you are on holidays, its nice to feel safe - even at night.
review.locationRemarks: Across the street, there is a place we went for breakfast. Munch Haven. Good food, fantastic staff, clean and very friendly.

review.title: Old, but well kept and clean.
review.reviewText: The hallways and the elevators are old, and naturally a bit run down. But the rooms are very well maintained and clean just like any other A class hotel. Service was great, and the room sizes are big. This was a great bargain in the SF area, and I've stayed in over 20 hotels around, having visited often.

review.title: Mission District: As Elvis sang: "In the Ghetto"
review.reviewText: Road construction across the street and sirens all night made sleeping something to be hoped for. Heater didn't work in room, place was very dated and homeless people everywhere so bad that the hotel staff had to escort you to the lobby bathrooms to let you in 'for your safety' There was no bar or even a convenience store to get a drink or snacks, and according to the staff: 'you didn't want to go out past dark' the only thing it had going for it was it was over 100 years old with vintage/historical appeal. Needless to say I turned my three night stay into one night and got the heck out of there.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING
review.locationRemarks: About five blocks or so from Union square, but again, you do NOT want to be out walking past dark.

review.title: The worst hotel I have ever been to.
review.reviewText: This is the worst hotel I have ever been to. Old, dirty and very unfriendly stuff. Don't go there!!!

review.title: Historic hotel. Staff was amazing
review.reviewText: Being from a small town and not knowing the location of this hotel it was quite the culture shock. Definitely need something on their website.

review.title: Great location, excellent staff!
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb was a great place to stay during our first visit to San Francisco. Since it is an older hotel, the slightly worn condition is to be expected. The front desk, housekeeping and concierge staff were absolutely wonderful! The only issue we had was the price of parking on site. I did a little research, and found a much more affordable option just a few blocks away. Public transportation was super easy and cheap! When we return, we will definitely be booking our next stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: The attentiveness of the housekeeping staff, and the expertise of Toby, the concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: Air coming from vent into closet from perhaps above room...we choose not to partake in smoking festivities, however, we were subjected to their party.
review.locationRemarks: Right across the street, SAM's Diner is a must! The trolley stops right in front of the hotel, so catching the F line was a piece of cake.

review.title: Close to the tenderloin, not a great neighborhood
review.reviewText: I came for a work conference, walked to the convention center everyday and was ok. My wife walked back from the stores in the financial district (4 or 5 blocks away) and was accosted several times. Not a bad hotel, just located in a less than desirable neighborhood.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was friendly, the lobby looks like a movie from the 30's. Very close to a BART station.
review.negativeRemarks: WATER PRESSURE! I know it's an old building, but that was the most disappointing shower I've taken in a long time.
review.locationRemarks: Be careful walking around not a great neighborhood. You aren't likely to be attacked, just mugged. Once you get a few blocks North East it gets better

review.title: A lovely old hotel. Decor great,
review.reviewText: Not been to San Fransico before the hotel was good. However was not expecting the homleless to be right outside
review.locationRemarks: Location good

review.title: Sad, old hotel in bad neighborhood
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb has the potential to be a beautiful, historic hotel. Unfortunately, the rooms are cheaply updated. They painted over the tile in the bathroom and the toilet seat is a generic that does not fit the antique bowl.
review.positiveRemarks: It is a historic hotel with lots of potential if a little time and money were invested.
review.negativeRemarks: Stained glass in lobby falling down. Shower tile was mildewed.
review.locationRemarks: Now, the location is absolutely SCARY!!! It is in the middle of an area with lots of drug deals openly happening. Within the first few hours we saw

review.title: Shining
review.reviewText: Desperate need of a remodel. Dont be surprised if a spirit joins you for a night cap... Lot of history... Used to be the old jail.

review.title: Rough Conditions
review.reviewText: The hotel was in pretty rough shape. The area is surrounded by boarded up buildings and homeless people.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was competent and friendly. It was literally steps from the BART exit.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovations. It is described as "historic" but out of date and damaged is more accurate. The showers tiles didn't even have grout left around them.
review.locationRemarks: It is downtown but it appeared to be in an isolated area of abandoned buildings and homeless/pan handlers.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very professional and friendly. The property was clean and pleasant with a Starbucks attached. The room was great! Not the best part of town but not the worse either. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat, it was a very good value.

review.title: Somewhat central but rundown
review.reviewText: This place has charm but that is about it. It was very warn down, isn't the nicest area on Market St and it just felt dirty. The worst part was little bugs/worms in the shower, pretty nasty, I won't be going back here anytime soon...
review.positiveRemarks: Liked the charm and old school style of the place.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs repairs and needs cleaning, especially the showers.
review.locationRemarks: Sketchy area.

review.title: Located right above Civic Center Metro/Bart Stop
review.reviewText: The location is convenient for BART travel in and out of the city, but located on Market Street adjacent to the Tenderloin area, it is a bit dodgy. Lots of homeless people make Market Street home, and this was surprising to me as a first time visitor to San Francisco. The hotel rooms were fine, and it is good value for the money in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean and well appointed.
review.negativeRemarks: As an old hotel, the escape stairways are odd, two separate stairways behind the elevators, and this could be confusing in an evacuation.
review.locationRemarks: Subway / BART access to the rest of the city is good.

review.title: very old buildings
review.reviewText: not good at all. smell no good , shower water tiny

review.title: Best Hotel in the Area
review.reviewText: A little bit of a wait checking in. Room was small with queen size bed but we got to upgrade to larger room with king bed and a very quiet, clean room. Staff was accommodating and friendly. We would recommend this hotel to friends going to SF Ballet like we did and it is only a 10 minute walk to Opera House and Symphony and Asia Art Museum. Great place to stay for cultural events around Civic Center. Lot of homeless people outside but, this is the Tenderloin district and we didn't feel too uncomfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location…..clean room, historic decorated hotel. Valet parking. Starbuck's Coffee shop near lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Faster desk service
review.locationRemarks: Ballet; Symphony…Asia Art Museum

review.title: Nice historic hotel with easy access
review.reviewText: The hotel is historic but not dated. The rooms are spacious and well kept with a historic feel. The hotel is immediately adjacent to Starbucks and has a restaurant inside but little other amenities. It is convenient walking to downtown and Bart and other public transportation is right outside the door. The staff is cordial and efficient.
review.positiveRemarks: We enjoyed the ease of access to the city.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if there was a shop and a lounge.
review.locationRemarks: It is easy access to shopping on Market as well as downtown. There is ease of access to all modes of transportation to easily get anywhere in the city

review.title: a place in walking distance
review.reviewText: Beautiful place but the bed was saggy so one person might be fine, but two people roll toward the middle. Had lukewarm expensive soup at the retaurant and although the place was empty, they wouldn't let us sit at the bar and order food too.

review.title: disappointment stay
review.reviewText: the staff are not friendly. the bathroom is not equiped with the basic needs. the bathroom door making noise when open or close. generally I will never recommend such hotel to a friend
review.negativeRemarks: no comment

review.title: Keep looking
review.reviewText:
I've stayed here twice but have decided not to make this my regular hotel when I visit in the future. The building is old with chipped and peeling paint and strange room configurations. The bathroom looked like something from a men's prison, with sullen yellow tiles and a shower that faced about 2 feet away from the wall.

The wakeup service didn't work when you dialed the appointed phone number. There was no blanket on the bed and the memory of the unsmiling desk clerk didn't make me feel encouraged to ask for one (I later discovered the blanket inside the closet - why wasn't it on the bed?)

For pros, the hotel is close to the BART line. And it has free internet, ice machines, vending machines and on the main floor is a Starbucks. But there's really nothing to recommend this hotel and I'll try something different on my next SFO visit.
review.positiveRemarks: Free internet, close to BART, walking distance to restaurants, good prices
review.negativeRemarks: Update the building and room interiors
review.locationRemarks: Lots of homeless people on the streets outside. BART is half block away. Lots of affordable (if ordinary) restaurants within walking distance

review.title: Great lobby but that's all
review.reviewText: Just a tolerable older hotel down from it's former glory. Neighborhood "iffy" especially at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Electrical in adequate and noisy bathroom fan will wake up your roommate
review.locationRemarks: Near civic center and Bart and bus lines to get to more interesting locations

review.title: Not sure if i would come back here.
review.reviewText: I went out to clubs and came back late. The staff was very noisy at 730am.. tried to enter my room (didnt think i would need the sign out at that early of a time)... and then the construction started with a saw going for the rest of the time i was there. I left earlier then I would have because of all the noise.. Be prepared to pay 35 bucks a night for parking!

review.title: Worst experience.
review.reviewText: Room smelled liked it had water damage. Asked the staff to change the room they said all the rooms are booked did bother to look into the issue and few days later rained and water leaked from bathroom and they finally moved me to another antique room.

review.title: Beautiful old hotel with charm and excellent staff
review.reviewText:
Many people on travel sites complain about the Hotel Whitcomb's location -- because it is located in an area where many disadvantaged people live. But the hotel staff and security are very protective of their guests, and the people who live around the hotel, while poor and unwell, mostly are too busy surviving to bother with tourists.

This is a grand old hotel and should not be overlooked because of the neighbourhood. Besides, if you are lucky enough to be able to travel and stay in a nice hotel, maybe you could give out some change to the unlucky people who live in the area year round.
review.positiveRemarks: The early 20th Century décor and the friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the night security men are a bit stern, but I guess that comes from seeing too much on the streets around the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to shopping, the Folsom Street club district, Union Square and its markets, and right next to all the public transit systems.

review.title: Ok hotel, but not something I would do again.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is conveniently located next to the BART which is the reason I chose it in the first place. However, the neighborhood around it is undergoing a lot of redevelopment and is quite trashy.

The 50% discounted room I recieved was ok for the price given the cost of other hotels in the area. The shower did not have a lot of water pressure and the wifi never worked, and I could barely get a 3G or 4G signal inside. Kind of a bummer because the tv choices were awful. However that is good incentive to get outside and explore the city.

review.title: Hotel was centrally located and had easy access.
review.reviewText: Had a good experience at the hotel. Everyone was friendly and helpfully.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access to buses and cable car system
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms were small. Some of room fixtures could be updated.
review.locationRemarks: Access to all facilities and cable cars

review.title: Great hotel in a great spot for tourists.
review.reviewText: Not knowing what to expect the hotel was in an excellent spot for the transit system to get you to all the great sites like the pier and fashion district. The hotel was great such as Leroy the doorman who brought fun to our trip. Although it was an older hotel, it was elegant and made us feel as if we were back in the thirties and forties. We highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: 2 nights in San Francisco to ease Korean Jet Lag
review.reviewText:
Spent Sunday and Monday nights. BART ride from SFO was great. Go to exit 2B and the top of the escalator drops you right at the revolving door of the hotel. Arrived early after a 20 day trip around Korean. I was able to get into my corner room, 492, well before the 3:00pm checkin.
Room and bath provided a perfect place to relax and decompress. Was disappointed in the TV channel select. Mostly a local broadcast. I spent most of my time down around fishermen wharf area. Getting there was quite easy. A short walk over to the Hyde street cable car station and for a few bucks your up and over the hill. The walk down Market to the waterfront is pretty level sand start off with a lot of "city people" but improves as you go. The BART is also a quick ride as the whole rainbow of lines going between Civic Center and Embarcadero stations.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to BART exit that made handling of multiple pieces of heavy luggage the #1 reason for picking this hotel. Next was price and city location.
review.negativeRemarks: Cable TV selection.
review.locationRemarks: Near Hyde street cable car station of get ride up over hill to Fishermen's whalf area. Easy walk down market to water.

review.title: Rude staff and disappointing accommodations.
review.reviewText: From the moment of check-in, we encountered rude staff. Our rooms were uncomfortable and dingy. There are few modern conveniences in this old hotel. It felt like we were staying in the movie The Shining. We were assigned a room facing Market Street and barely got a wink of sleep from the constant noise of traffic. I was most disappointed with the staff. I was in town visiting my nephew, who had bandages on his head from a previous bicycle crash. Hotel staff approached us in the lobby saying it wasn't appropriate for him to be sitting in the lobby with bandages. This was the most rude and insensitive experience I've had in a hotel! I would never stay here again and would never recommend it to a friend!
review.positiveRemarks: The only good thing about this hotel is proximity to the BART.

review.title: Impressive looking right downtown medium price
review.reviewText: Good old "bait & switch". Room was not as advertised. Web stated superior room with deck(that's partly why we chose Hotel Whitcomb). NONE of the rooms have a deck- not even a balcony. Queen bedroom offered was far from superior with a view of only the other hotel wall. They moved us to a room with a view of town but only double beds. Toilet was soiled.-(gross) It wasn't a nightmare though. Nice looking place, older, fancy and grand lobby and halls, but we would have rather saved money with Best Western and got what we expected.

review.title: Last minute reservation
review.reviewText: We didn't realize all of the hotels would be selling out on a weeknight (Wednesday) so we booked this hotel 3 days before our trip as a last resort. Overall, this was a nice hotel. The one major complaint for me was that the water pressure in the shower was very weak. We had a crummy view, but that was expected as we waited to reserve our room. The beds were very comfortable and room was clean. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which was convenient and the hotel was within walking distance to shops and restaurants. It was also very nice to have the street cars available for riding right outside of the front of the hotel (only $2 for 2-3 hours of hopping on/off). We valet parked at the hotel since parking is so limited and it was about $80 for 2 days. Hallways could be a bit noisy as the walls are quite thin but you have to keep in mind that this hotel was built in the early 1900's.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds, close to public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Increase the water pressure in the showers.
review.locationRemarks: Off Market street with a few shops and restaurants nearby. Also VERY close to public transportation.

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: Nice classy place. Small rooms (old hotel). Near mall and restaurants and everything. $35 per night valet parking

review.title: Nice historic hotel
review.reviewText: Nice historic hotel but unfortunately well past it's prime. Stayed here during a conference as it was cheaper and the BART station entrance is 30 feet from the door. Pleasant stay but probably won't be the first choice next time.

review.title: Grand dame
review.reviewText: Great bones in this large but tired hotel. Pull chain light in the closet illustrates its outmoded condition. But wifi is fee.

review.title: Close to San Fran for a quick visit
review.reviewText: The hotel has tons of charm -it is from another era so the rooms might be a bit tight. The location is good for checking out the city in a few days. There are a lot of homeless in the area although that seems to be a feature of the city. All in all, we really liked it!

review.title: Old Hotel that needs some desperate maintenance
review.reviewText:
1) 2 of the 4 lifts worked. Waits for over 15 minutes were standard.
