2) Breakfast buffet had no knifes, no forks, no hot water, and 1/2 the food was all gone.
3) Stairs were impossible with luggage.
4) Check-in staff were incredible slow at their job. The wait in line to check into the hotel was over 30 minutes.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in service speed can be improved 1 million percent.
review.locationRemarks: Location is in what the locals call the "Ghetto" There was a train service out the front though.

review.title: Love historic hotels
review.reviewText: The building is a great throwback and pretty well maintained. It is a little rough around the edges in that the neighborhood is not the most upscale, and the look of the place is a little dark, but overall we really enjoyed our stay. The wood and mirrored hallways, the classic rooms, the light fixtures and the overall atmosphere made it seem like 1940 not 2014. Coolest elevator doors I have ever seen.
review.positiveRemarks: Historical look and feel. Classic beauty.
review.negativeRemarks: some of the furniture was a bit dinged up and other small things like that that.
review.locationRemarks: Location was not bad but not great either. This is a city so there are going to be city issues like homeless people, but. the hotel felt safe inside

review.title: SF weekend
review.reviewText: Came in Feb 21 for one night but decided to stay another , the front desk staff was excellent to arrange us in the same room for the extra night and at the rate I booked the first night. Valet parking staff also very willing to assist. Will make this my place to stay when in San Fanscisco,CA.

review.title: Don't get the room I paid for
review.reviewText: I got there Saturday night just to find out the room I pre paid for wasn't available anymore. I wasn't comped for the diffrence in rooms. Parking was also $35 a night.

review.title: Staff :(
review.reviewText:
Staff when we arrived totally dismissed us, same as the restaurent staff.
I had paid for a 3 day stay and they couldn't find our reservation so they treated us like teanagers, like we weren't even there and asked us to step aside...???
I travel monthly and I never encountered such bad services.
The director made up for it and took the time to find our reservation and offer us a free night stay for the inconvenient but our vacation had already a bitter taste to it because of the welcome we got when we arrive to that hotel.
This is just one of the incident that we had to deal with to not name the other ones...
I will never go back.
It's unfortunate because the location is perfect and the hotel is nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The service from the staff!!!

review.title: Classic, stately friendly.
review.reviewText: What a friendly and funny concierge who was most helpful and very funny.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful, close to train and subway stops.
review.locationRemarks: Bart train to airport right out the door.

review.title: Comfortable, decent price, central location
review.reviewText: Nice corner room so it was very quiet. In a poorer area of sf but right by Bart station if you are going out for night. Bed was soooooo comfy. Good price for quality. Historic hotel, loved the decorations and old feeling. Overall very pleased with my experience and wallet!

review.title: Large old hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Hotel has lots of character room was clean and warm. shower curtain was broken, cleaning staff came at 830 am but other than that all good I would stay here again.

review.title: Old refurbished hotel with a lot of charm
review.reviewText: Very nice old hotel very well renovated. Rooms are rather small but clean. It was raining and drops of water were falling in our bathtub from the ceiling tiles. It's location is average at best - due to the rain homeless people were sleeping everywhere in the entrance of the BART station near the hotel.

review.title: Not worth it
review.reviewText: When I checked in I was given a room that did not match the description of the one I reserved. When I arrived the room was next to the elevator. The staff was not pleasant about my request for a different room and took a long time to get me a room. Although there are four small elevators only two worked so lots of people were standing around waiting for several groups to get a chance to go on the elevator. When I got to the room the heat was broken. When I called for service I waited on the line for 20 minutes and then was transferred. The shower had low flow and the toilet was extremely loud and running constantly.
review.positiveRemarks: It had a Starbucks in the lobby but although it was supposed to open at 5:30am it didn't open until 7am when I was there.
review.negativeRemarks: It would help if the staff were more friendly, knowledgable or helpful. The elevators need to be fixed. The plumbing should be updated.

review.title: Terrible Customer Service
review.reviewText: There was a scheduling error with this hotel, and they basically took my money and never worked with Expedia to get a refund or even credit. Will never stay at this hotel. Very bad customer service.

review.title: Old hotel, creepy, but nice staff
review.reviewText: I was creeped out by this hotel. It's so old and you can feel energy from how old it is. The staff is really nice and helpful. It's right in the heart of San Francisco which is cool. Was definitely afraid of bedbugs but didn't experience any biting. I wouldn't pay more than 100 for a room.

review.title: Historic Hotel Well Priced and a Bit Worn
review.reviewText:
The area of town where the hotel was located was not safe at night.
There were only 2 elevators working the morning we were checking out...very inconvenient.
The roof outside our room was littered with trash.
The hotel bar was not open enough hours.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast in the dining room was delicious. The beds were very comfortable. Ralph, the bell captain, was very helpful. T
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel must have once been elegant. Now she seems a bit worn and needs some TLC.
review.locationRemarks: Art museum. We took cabs everywhere to avoid the sidewalks.

review.title: Comfortable hotel, good location, poor maintenance
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location on Market. Nice old hotel with ambience. Comfortable room with most services. But maintenance is lacking in several respects. A few minor faults with the room which I reported but which were not fixed. The lifts were very poor and slow with two out of four out of action for several parts of my stay. Nonetheless overall a nice hotel in good location for a reasonable price by San Francisco standards.

review.title: Nice hotel, slow elevators.
review.reviewText:
Nice restoration of an old property.
Good:
Nice lobby
Friendly staff
Comfy bed
Nice TV

Bad:
SLOW ELEVATORS
Noisy on the Market Street side.
review.negativeRemarks: Put other elevators back in service
review.locationRemarks: On the BART line. Everything in Dowtown SF.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Room cleanliness was the issue. I found hair on sink, toilet, and shower. Also, TV did not work so I had to call for assistance.TV eventually was fixed.
review.negativeRemarks: Focus on housekeeping
review.locationRemarks: Close to Moscone Center for business.

review.title: Basics okay, but only the basics
review.reviewText:
The hotel is centrally located and the rooms are comfortable and clean. But that's all, really. There was no wifi, and the staff explained that only the manager could fix it and he wasn't coming in till later in the day. The machines in the fitness room were so old and creaky that they swayed when used -- it really seemed like the ellipticals were going to collapse.

The Starbucks in the lobby -- the only place for coffee -- for some reason also didn't open until two or three hours after its posted time. Not affiliated with the hotel, but seemed to have caught some of it's lethargy.

review.title: Average Hotel in Poor Location
review.reviewText: While this is on Market Street, the area around UN plaza may be intimidating for some, as it is home to many homeless and challenged folks. I had no negative experiences and access to BART is great, but there is not much in the way of culture or amenity nearby other than burgers and strip bars. The hotel itself has definitely had better days. Bathrooms were clean but run down. Beds and main room was nice. Common space from lobby to hallways was, at best, average.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds were modern and comfortable. Starbucks off the lobby for morning coffee.
review.negativeRemarks: Poor overall condition and repair of lobby, elevators, and bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: Very little immediately nearby but central to BART and only a couple stops to Union Square area and Embarcadero. Some may be uncomfortable nearby.

review.title: disappointment
review.reviewText: I booked for king size bed without confirmation by the time I check in out of king size instead got 2 small size bed my husband didn't even fit in the bed.
review.negativeRemarks: no comment
review.locationRemarks: site seeing

review.title: Nice hotel close to financial district
review.reviewText:
Very good location close to the downtown of financial district, and very traditional good interior decoration of the lobby and the room, the only concern is that no breakfast and need surcharge valet parking.
p.s.: This stay I forgot a bag of clothes inside the room but after I came back to Toronto I called the hotel house keeping lady, they were very nice and helped me to find the Lost&Found, and even deliver the items to my address. Really nice stay with Hotel Whitcomb SF.

Oliver@Toronto
The room was very clean, the staff friendly and helpful. Was very pleased with the room and service.
review.positiveRemarks: The old vintage feel and the bed was amazingly comfortable.

review.title: Beautiful historic lobby; dated interior
review.reviewText:
During Dreamforce event every hotel and AirBNB in town was booked and prices were inflated. This hotel was available...

Front desk staff was friendly and professional.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb Review
review.reviewText: An upscale hotel facilities & staff located in a seedy area.
review.negativeRemarks: More electrical outlets in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: A seedy location on Market St, but easy access to public transportation

review.title: I wont stay there again.
review.reviewText:
They didnt have a room with a King bed as I booked,. and the neighborhood is realllllllly sketchy,,, lots of homeless and mentally cases all around the area...

Also, lots of construction noise all hours of the night

review.title: Convenient to Orpheum Theatre
review.reviewText: This was a good hotel to choose to see a show at the Orpheum Theatre. The hotel is right across the street, within easy walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, proximity to theater and diners, pleasant staff
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel decor was old and could be updated
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Orpheum Theatre, SF Public Library, City Hall

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel is very good for the price we paid for 2 nights. My wife and I thought it was clean and had some nice character, and a very comfy and large king size bed. The only flaws I would point out is that it was a little loud on the first night (some "WOOOO!" girls walking down the hallway yelling woke us up, not the hotel's fault by any means) and that since the walls were a little on the thin side, we definitely heard the couple in the room next to us having some adult relations the second night, haha. Overall it was good for the money and a nice location off of Market for public transport.
review.negativeRemarks: Some reinforced walls so we don't have to hear the couple next to us getting it on.
review.locationRemarks: Great access to BART and MUNI lines, but not a ton of touristy things RIGHT by the hotel.

review.title: Homeless central
review.reviewText: I didn't know San Francisco had such a large population of homeless people and for some reason they all choose to hang out by and around this hotel.

review.title: Good location & easy access on transport, food,etc
review.reviewText:
Felt warm welcome. Friendly Staff at Check In counter with good service.
I have very limited time in San Francisco. I love and missed this place and
California of the sight seeing.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff and Convenience location. Good service.
review.negativeRemarks: Lift speed.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants and Shopping Mall.

review.title: Charming hotel with excellent staff!
review.reviewText: We made a last-minute reservation over the Internet, and wasn't sure what we were going to get. What a pleasant surprise! The staff is the key to the way this hotel is enjoyed. We showed up with an eight month-old boy in our arms and we were welcomed with open arms. We paid for a single room and they ended up putting us in a suite for no charge. If you're looking for the old charm of San Francisco, this is the place!

review.title: Old hotel in a bad neighborhood
review.reviewText: The elevators were a disaster. 2 out of 4 working elevators. No view. Old and musty room. Basic cable TV. No mini bar. No room service. Expensive for what you receive.
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: The location is central but seedy. If you stand in front of the hotel you will get hit up for cigarettes, money and food from people loitering there.

review.title: scary neighborhood, no hot water, gross bathroom
A place to stay.
review.reviewText: Rooms small for the price, bathroom fixtures from the 50's, HVAC loud, no sleep from all the noise from carbage being dumped and picked up
review.negativeRemarks: Invest in upgrading rooms for the price charged.
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText:
-nice hotel. Antique decors. centrally located so close to all amenities. Staff was kind to store my luggage for the entire day of check-out at no extra cost.

- No one at the reception when I checked in ... i had to yell "hello" 5 times before a lady finally came. check out was slow as only one guy for help. Other than that this hotel is awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: every thing is so central

review.title: In need of massive upgrade or razing
review.reviewText: The Hotel Whitcomb is an historic building and probably at one point, decades ago, was a beautiful hotel. Indeed, the lobby areas are beautiful. Unfortunately the rooms, and the mechanics of the hotel do not match the quality of the lobby. The elevators sort of work, they take forever and floor numbers you press just disappear and therefore the elevator doesn't stop on the floor you had requested. The rooms are cramped and in need of upgrading. the water pressure is ridiculous, luckily didn't have to wash my hair or I'd still be in the shower trying to get the shampoo out. The neighborhood is definitely a bit rough, but one should expect that. At a price of over $300/night, I was certainly expecting better.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much, other than the pretty lobby areas.
review.negativeRemarks: Lots, please see above.

review.title: not up to business hotel standards
review.reviewText: Surrounded by a sea of homeless, this hotel has promise but a long ways to go before getting to the standards that business or leisure travelers expect. My room was lit only by the bedside lights, the staff failed to clean the room on my first night and then did not deliver the clean towels I requested. If you like the 1960s, then you will love the bathrooms.

review.title: Historic and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: I came for a conference in San Francisco. Was lucky enough to find Hotel Whitcomb on Expedia. My room was clean and comfortable. Centrally located. Easy walk to attractions. Friendly staff. Wifi a little slow but acceptable. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: good location but the hotel...
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a really good location. Right outside the Muni/Bart station!. Starbucks is downstairs open at 5AM! The environment is not too shabby compared to the TL, but still have homeless hanging around. The lobby is gorgeous, just like other historical hotels in SF. But the downside is, the shower in the bathroom is terrible. We have to screwed off the shower head then can have enough water to have shower and ....one more thing, the drains was stuck all the time.

If you just need a place to have a sleep, this place is good. But if you want to relax in your vacation, then NO!

review.title: Is it just me? ---->Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText:
I was a bit worried about staying in this hotel due to lots of the negative reviews about dirty/small room, etc.
But I don't have a car and its at the bart entrance, plus I like "the shinning", so I give it a try.
I stay in a queen room for two nights in the fifth floor, and it turns out to be very clean and spacious, with good view, and a nice TV. The onl y drawback might be the water pressure for the shower is a bit low, so you won't get a super relaxing hot shower, but I still had an environmental friendly, decent shower.

The inner decor is super cool as everyone mentions, and the room is pretty standard 3 star room in my opinion. Consider the location and friendly frontdesk, it is a good deal to me.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower
review.locationRemarks: Shopping Theatre Union Square China Town Japan Town

review.title: the bed is not comfortable
review.reviewText: the beds were not very comfortable, you could feel the springs in the mattress, soft and poor quality mattress and I'm comfortable pillows, difficult to sleep

review.title: Old style centered around the heart of the city
review.reviewText: I've been here before. I like it a lot. It's old, really old, historically old, but it has a wonderful charm. It is right off of southern market street so it is a great central location in San Francisco. The rooms have adequate anemneties. The beds and bedding are comfortable and the bathrooms are OK. The place is old though, including the design and constructs. Walls are thinner and a lot taller than modern architecture. Ohh well, the character the place has is lovely. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and I'll be sure to be back again some day.

review.title: The location is horrible
review.reviewText: The television signal is horrible, the internet did not work in my room, the hotel's location is ugly, a lot of homeless on the street, smelly and parking is very expensive
review.positiveRemarks: The bed is comfortable and the hotel design is very retro
review.negativeRemarks: The video quality of TV and the internet
review.locationRemarks: The neighborhood is not the best of San Francisco

review.title: Vintage hotel with easy access to all sites.
review.reviewText:
The rooms were small without some of the conveniences of modern hotels - no refrigerator in room; shower head is low; minimal area around sink to place personal items. Some rooms are connected by a door.

There was quick response to complaints - the fan in our bathroom was not functioning; it was quickly fixed.

The two concierges were very knowledgeable and helpful in our planning and travel via public transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: The ambiance of the hotel with its lighting and decorations took you back in time making the hotel inviting to us. The on sight restaurant was great.
review.negativeRemarks: The wall paper in our bathroom was peeling and was poorly installed. Future renovations should use the best materials and workmanship.
review.locationRemarks: The location is in the middle of an area that is being rebuilt. As such, the area appears to be questionable for night walks, etc.

review.title: Not good area but perfect location for transport
review.reviewText: It's a Very old style Hotel, not to bad though, the only bad thing is the homeless that surround the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Each room should have fridge and a Coffee maker.
review.locationRemarks: Good but a lot of homeless and sketchy people

review.title: Good Hotel, convenient location.
review.reviewText: Spent 3 nights at the Whitcomb. Interesting place. Able to move about the city easily and always end up back at civic center. Great base for exploring the city, SOMA, Tenderloin etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Staff were pleasant. Decor great beds comfy not too noisy
review.negativeRemarks: WiFI was terrible and very frustrating. lobby bar? more grounded outlets
review.locationRemarks: Smack dab on Market street near civic center. Walking or bus distance from just about everything downtown and points outbound. easy BART accesss

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hall ways were dirty and it took a long time to check in. The bell hoop was slow with our luggage.

review.title: Great, convenient to visit and tour SF.
review.reviewText:
While I was expecting the worst as I read about all the talk about homeless in the area. But as someone from a big city, I doubt a few homeless could be that bad. The hotel is old, but it is a historic. So given that status, the rooms are as clean as they can be. Also, I was surprised to see an HDTV in my room, since the other reviews stated they still were using old TVs. It is so close that you can travel to many of the top SF destinations. And if you are athletic/energetic enough, you could plan and walk to all the sites in the heart of SF, and not spend a penny on transportation. Overall, it was convenient and good for the price. If you are from a big city and/or have seen your share of homeless people, nothing to worry. Just use the 8th and Market Street Bart's entrance that comes right up to this hotel, or have a taxi drop you off at the door. Those that have never seen a homeless in their lives should probably stay elsewhere.

From this hotel I walked in this order: UN Plaza, Asian Art Museum, Cartoon Museum, Ferry Building, Cable Car Museum, Coit Tower, Lombard Street, and finally Japan Town.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to public transportation to visit all of SF, even on foot. Extremely friendly staff, who could sympathize with a bad flight, ride, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, since the hotel is not responsible for the homeless. I doubt you could modernize a historic hotel, and still call it historic.
review.locationRemarks: SF city hall, Asia Art, Cartoon Art, ferry bldg, Coit tower, etc.

review.title: Skip this hotel
review.reviewText: It took over an hour to check in. The staff could care less that there was a line out the door waiting to check in. 1 attendant actually took a smoke break leaving 1 poor guy to take care of everyone. Dirty room, even dirtier lobby, bad part of town. Never going back

review.title: 1st stay great, 2nd stay dissapointing
review.reviewText: It took an hour to get checked in. 3 employees working the desk and they didn't speed up service they went about it like a normal day. They gave us a room that was already occupied so we had to add another 20 minutes on top of the hour check in time. When we finally got the correct room it was clean and comfy. When we went to pick up our car the next morning it took them 20 minutes to find they keys. My first visit to this hotel was flawless however my second visit was disappointing.

review.title: Hotel close to City Hall and public transportation
review.reviewText: Room was suitable to sleep in, it was clean and the sheets looked clean. The bathroom needed fixing up, looked outdated. The area surrounding the hotel did not appear to be the safest once the sun went down. Aside from paying for the room you will have to pay for parking. There are no parking spots nearby, and it will be best if you pay their parking fee. Parking fee was $40 to $50 each night.

review.title: Convenient to many SF sites
review.reviewText: NYE was packed, and the wait to check in was about 30 minutes....but the staff served free cookies, champagne, juice to persons waiting in line. Room was way nicer than I imagined it would be....not real large but clean, historic, and comfortable beds. Check out was swift and professional.

review.title: Old, Run Down, Slow Service
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb refers to itself as an "Historic Hotel" which must be code for run down. The check-in process took forever and there was a huge line because "the system is slow". The room included a super-noisy in-window air conditioner and a bathroom from fixtures that looked the like a 1940s era prison. The shower had stains, the flusher for the toilet had peeling paint and the toilet seat was about 12" off the ground. The bed was OK< but I shudder to think about it's cleanliness after looking at the bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Service and cleanliness. Redo the baths.
review.locationRemarks: It's San Francisco, so everything is nearby.

review.title: Nice staff but terrible Facilities
review.reviewText: Small rooms, tincy wincy bathrooms, nice staff and terrible facilities. The staff was pleasant and friendly which makes me really want to like this place. However, the facilities are old, run down and extremely inefficient. Elevators are tiny and slow. Bring a snack because check-in will take forever. The end.

Very slow check in process. Hotel is very old. Rooms are small. Bathroom tiny. Valet parking was very expensive. Area is sketchy. Hotel was advertised as being 6 blocks away from Union Square but it is not a safe walk from the hotel to the shopping mall. Hotel was too expensive for the condition it was in and the location.
review.locationRemarks: Location doesn't feel safe.

review.title: Good deal for the price.
review.reviewText: Although not in the best part of town, I wasn't there for the neighborhood. The hotel is clean, the staff excellent. I love the fact that we were a very short walk to the Bart/Muni underground which enabled us to explore the city easily. Some of the local "characters" that frequented the area around the hotel were questionable but no one harassed or threatened us in any way and besides we were there the enjoy San Francisco not the locals. I highly recommend the Whitcomb as an economical and easily accessible place to stay. If the locals scare you then you should probably be paying more and staying on Nob Hill.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access to public transportation and the first floor restaurant and starbucks.
Old classic hotel with lots of unique architecture.
review.negativeRemarks: More staff at checkin counter.
review.locationRemarks: market street area is sketchy and not recommended for wary travelers / people who want to carry a map in front of their face.

review.title: Disappointing.
review.reviewText:
Problems with their equipment and personnel ensured it took more than 30 minutes waiting in line to simply check in, and 20 minutes to check out, during the busiest time of the year, when it was simply apparent that it wasn't because of being busy, but because of being understaffed.

Also, the hotel charged 35$ for parking, when many (maybe half) hotels include parking in the deal for free in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The Bed and bedsheets were very comfortable. The central location helps in moving around.
review.negativeRemarks: Waiting times at the front desk are terrible. The shower heads are too narrow to allow for a comfortable shower stream. Inform guests where to park.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good vis public transportation, since cars are not welcome in San Francisco. However, the sheer number of homeless around is terrifying.

review.title: Bad choice to stay their.
review.reviewText: Checking in waited for too long because the hotel's computer system was too slow. The room was too small and the smell was bad. Fan make big noise. Bad experience.

review.title: Not the best place
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel as it was close to the Staples Centre and we were staying there over night after a Lakers game. I am relieved we only stayed a night because it wasn't the best hotel. It was fairly run down and the bathroom was extremely small.

Coming home from the hotel we tried to get into the car park as we were driving and the gentleman running it was extremely rude and interrogating. We did not feel very welcome.

Next time I would just pay a little extra to stay at a nicer place.
The hotel is too old.
review.positiveRemarks: Good business center even though you have to pay for it.
review.negativeRemarks: Building could have been a beautiful hotel in the past but it needs to be renovated. It is very old. And the toilet is too small
review.locationRemarks: There's nothing right next to you but if you move with your car, every hot spots are nearby

review.title: I should not repeat visiting this hotel!!!
review.reviewText: People who working in parking area should learn who to deal with guests. With parking not free is with charge with not low rate + tax. Too much for guests.

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: It was nice room. Disappointed in 2 things 1) shower did not work properly & 2) the room was much to small for the 2 beds, making it feel cramped. Other than that everything else was good.

review.title: Overpriced Rooms
review.reviewText: I know San Francisco hotels are costly, but I have to say the prices at Hotel Whitcomb were an unpleasant surprise. The location of the hotel on Market is not great. That of course is no fault of the hotel. The intersection of Market and the United Nations plaza is unfortunate as it is a magnet for an aggressive and unpleasant homeless population. Truly, the only reason to stay at this hotel is its access to the Orpheum Theater (currently hosting The Book of Mormon) and its proximity to the Civic Center. Otherwise, save your money for a better location and a better value. The rooms are mostly small, and dark - this is standard when talking about pre-1920s construction; however, the rooms are priced like that of a standard hotel chain, and these are definitely NOT hotel chain room standards.
review.locationRemarks: Proximity to the Orpheum Theater and Civic Center.

review.title: Traditional Sophisticated Comfort
review.reviewText: Great. Clean, Quiet & Comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The clean and quiet atmosphere is perfect to rest your head after a long day in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom door did not close.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great to walk a few blocks to food, entertainment and San Francisco tourist attractions.

review.title: Elegant, historic hotel in a perfect location!
review.reviewText:
Hotel Whitcomb greets you with an elegance that takes you back to the early 1900's. The staff at the front desk were all so helpful and also entertaining!! One of the bell boys, an older gentleman, sang his welcome to us and then proceeded to fill us in on some historical facts about the hotel, such as .40 cents to dance on the rooftop back in 1915!! The architecture and the chandeliers were so beautiful and so grand, you really feel like you go back in time!!
The only complaint we had was the bartender was alone, overwhelmed, and VERY grouchy!! We waited almost 30 minutes, sitting at the bar, to order our drinks. We vote for more staff behind the bar!!
Oh, and the beds were like hammocks....not the most comfy.
But we will definitely come back!!! Soon!!
review.positiveRemarks: Easy parking, welcoming desk staff, beautiful lobby, historical, very unique, Starbucks and bar on site, great location.
review.negativeRemarks: More staff behind the bar. Bartender not nice at all. Better beds
review.locationRemarks: Triptych is AMAZING for breakfast!!! Right around the corner from Bill Graham Civic Auditorium. Orphium right across the street. Starbucks in lobby

review.title: Awesome location, super Friendly
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and i were in the city for the black crows concert and booked a rm 2 blocks from Bill Graham Civic. Perfect location, nice rooms, historic hotel with super nice staff. The only negative was trying to get a drink at the attached bar - restaurant where the entire place was packed with Concert goers and 1 bartender. He did his best but it took 20 min to get a drink and we were sitting at the bar. Understaffed for sure.
review.negativeRemarks: Add another bartender at the attached bar for pre concert goers. Took 20 min to get a glass of wine.
review.locationRemarks: Bill Graham center for black crows concert, china town, Union square shopping

review.title: Old place
review.reviewText: This hotel is old. Stuff not good
review.locationRemarks: next to a main street.

review.reviewText: Don't believe the write up and not in a good part of town
review.negativeRemarks: Dingy furniture No water pressure

review.title: Close to War Memorial Opera House
review.reviewText: Engaging, beautiful lobby bit very "tired" hallways and rooms.

review.title: Nice historic hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had a Christmas event in the city so decided to stay the night. the only tricky thing here is the parking.. lot is not obvious at all, we had to circle the block 3 times then found the little alley we pulled in to.. the line was long at the front desk and took forever.. they were very nice but long check in..so left us short timed getting ready..
review.positiveRemarks: The decor is beautiful, marble and wood all around. the rooms are simple but comfy. If we had more time we would walk around the hotel, go to the
review.negativeRemarks: info re: tricky parking and where it is.. we had to call.

review.title: needs upgrades
review.reviewText: A room right across from the Orpheum theater for a special night out. It would appear that the hotel is in the process of some maintenance. hallways were clear and clean. looks like some painting done recently. the room was clean, however the bathroom plumbing was a problem. toilet wouldn't flush. maint. called. paul showed up with a bucket and plunger. O.K. he said all good. these old pipes sometimes have problems. water in the faucet alternates hot and cold. didn't take a chance on the shower. Bed was most uncomfortable. huge valley in the middle of the queen bed rough night sleep. kept trying to hold on to the edge so as not to roll into the pit and wake the misses. looked under bed in morning and you could see where the mattress was falling through. back to the bathroom. toilet pugged again. not worth a call at this point, checking out. guess they'll figure it out on their own.
review.negativeRemarks: plumbing!! needs new beds.

review.title: Old but charming
review.reviewText: Stayed with my husband and two children for one night. Selected this hotel because it was a three minute walk to the civic center where I took my son to his first concert! The hotel has a lot of old charm and locals vibe. Staff was friendly. The beds are super comfy. My one complaint is the fragrance that hit us when we walked in our room. I'm guessing it was an air freshener or the soap. Although, it seemed to dissipate within a few hours - when we returned from our concert I didn't smell it like I had earlier in the evening. I would recommend this hotel but you have to be able to appreciate the old charm.
I am a fan of older hotels and this one fit the bill. The neighborhood might make some folks nervous, but I had no problem. Close to all the things I needed to get to.
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART and walking distance to plenty of things to do.

review.reviewText:
The description of the hotel was deceiving. The hotel is located in an area not too safe nor nice. There are a lot of homeless people right in front of the hotel. You cannot walk to the hotel after 8pm, as it is dangerous, especially during winter months when it gets dark so early.
The closet of the room is almost the same size as the bathroom - tiny.
For the price I pay, I could have gone to a better hotel near Union Square.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
We arrived at the Hotel on a holiday, but the kitchen was closed because it was a holiday. I CANNOT understand how a kitchen of a hotel closes during holidays?!?!

I have no complaints about the cleanliness of the rooms, but the hotel seems to not make a good maintenance. The rooms are old, the beds seem worn (are not comfortable) and the heater was very noisy at night. Generally I do not bother with noises, but the problem was that the noise of heater was not constant and I woke up when I started listening to a few and sequential noises.
review.positiveRemarks: The internet was good. The hotel location is really good, close to all public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel installations (too old)
review.locationRemarks: The hotel location is really good, close to all public transportation.

review.title: Okay hotel with horrible staff and no Internet Wi-
review.reviewText: Although there were only two people in line ahead of me it took approximately 45 minutes to be checked in. Room is located on the seventh floor had no Internet reception at all despite numerous calls to the front desk and promises of correcting the problem nothing was ever corrected

review.title: Acceptable for the Right Price
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel when Cloud Force was in SF and hotel rates were astronomical all over the city. The Whitcomb was literally one of four hotels that was offering rates for under $700. The hotel is a bit out of date, the gym was a mess, but the room was adequate. If you need a place to stay in a jam this should suffice.
review.negativeRemarks: Gym, room, bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located on Market.

review.title: Decent place for the money.
review.reviewText: Room was fine for a place to sleep, it was clean and had basic comforts. My bathroom had no water pressure so I had to brush my teeth from the shower head - really annoying! That was the only negative I had about this place though.

review.title: Cool location
review.reviewText: You could get lucky with parking on the street overnight to avoid the parking fee.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really.
review.locationRemarks: Food.

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: Finding parking sucks. I had to pay an extra 35 dollars.

YOU DO NOT HAVE To POST ...
but just want you all to know.
OMG! I was shocked when I arrived late at night to the hotel from the airport. Homeless and indigent people were hanging out in front of the hotel. I couldn't believe it!
When I entered the hotel, I couldn't believe what I was seeing. The furniture was old, worn with holes in parts of the upholstry, and the lobby was a bit dark. I didn't mind so much that the hotel was old, but the furniture should have been better kept.

The air quality in my room was not good. My breathing became compromised. All of the rooms were booked, so I couldn't get assigned to another room. In addition to that, there was mold in the bathroom walls in the corners! OMG! I have allergy problems, so I was shocked by that! The toilet didn't work well, but that got fixed.

I am sure that if Expedia know how bad the hotel is they wouldn't have booked customers in such not nice conditions. Even the restrooms in the lobby area were not desirable. The floor was wet and the stalls were not kept well.
Later that day, it got cleaned up.
There are stories, I later learned, that the hotel is haunted.
I really should be given a REFUND or a LOWER ROOM RATE CHARGE for having to experience those conditions.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs some renovation touch-ups, right away!
review.locationRemarks: The location was great! Further down on Market Street is fantastic San Fran!

review.title: Nice hotel, I recomend mty friends.
Great experience, from room to service was great !
review.reviewText: From the moment I called to request an early check in, to the time I arrived at the front desk to get our room, the staff was extremely courteous and friendly, I even remember the hotel check in person, His name was Burnie, and I will never forget how helpful and pleasant he was. The room was very nice, obviously not super large, but by SF standards it was a very good size, and the bed was very comfortable, TV was a big flat screen, and the bathroom had plenty of space ... I did enjoy the bath/shower combo, as apposed to the shower only that you find in some hotels - good to have the option. I can honestly say I will stay there again, and I had no complaints what so ever - this is a great deal for the price as well :)
review.positiveRemarks: Everythoing, bot most impressive was Burnie at the hotel check in/front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Honestly, I can't really think of anything, at least not for the price the room was provided at - I did not expect total luxory haha.
review.locationRemarks: The location was in a little bit of a seedy area, but not too bad, and right next to BART entrance, so that made it ideal.

review.title: Nice hotel close to public transportation
review.reviewText: Great room very clean.. bathroom needs to be updated other then that very comfortable n clean would stay again

review.title: Hotel full of Character
review.reviewText: Definitely an old Hotel, full of character and updated to have all the modern amenities. The staff was wonderful.

review.title: At least it is close to public transportation
review.reviewText:
When they say this is a historic hotel, they aren't kidding. While there are some lovely features, unfortunately the elevators aren't included in that. They were incredibly slow, when they were functioning. During the four days we were there, I don't believe all four worked at the same time. Given that this hotel was packed with tourists, all of whom had lots of luggage, we spent a lot of time waiting on the elevator. The stairs were steep and narrow, so undoable. When asked for a recommendation for a bar to have a drink in, we were sent to a horrifying dive. It was so nasty, we didn't even go in.
There were two things that made this stay bearable: it was relatively clean and Harvey at the front desk. While the other front desk employees were either rude or lackadaisical, Harvey really went out of his way to make us feel welcome.
review.positiveRemarks: It was definitely easy to use public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators and the front desk staff ( with exception of Harvey who was wonderful)

review.title: OK considering the room price
review.reviewText:
Very convenient to reach the public transportation.
Hotel is Old but the staffs are very friendly.
However, I smell the bleach when I got into the room and never could use wifi in the room. (have to go to the lobby for the wifi)
Maid was great. Rom was clean and pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator was slow and water pressure was very weak in the shower.
review.locationRemarks: The walk to Moscone was a little further than I thought. If Civic Center is your destination this is a great choice.

review.title: You can't carry enough coins!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is on the edge of a very bad area. Encounters with hi, intoxicated, mentally ill and homeless are unavoidable as you walk any direction from the hotel.

There was yelling and loud sirens all night long. Drapes wouldn't close so light from the street streamed in all night.

I was travelling alone and was too uncomfortable to leave the hotel after dark on foot.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure, requires a larger social solution for San Francisco's homeless problems.
review.locationRemarks: The high end shopping area is an easy walk but you are a few miles from North Beach, China Town, and pier 39. Transit is easy to use.

review.title: I would never stay there ever again. And would not
review.reviewText: Very Unpleasant from the time that I'd checked in even worse when I checked out...

review.title: Hotel conveniently located
review.reviewText: Rooms are clean.. though a bit dated.. very conveniently located. Comfortable and easy to access BART and Tram.. Confortable stay.. but found it a bit overpriced.

review.title: Lobby was very elegant. Room was tiny.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, staff was very friendly. It was centraly located in the civic center. Room was extremely small, not comfortable to sit in, no room to sit other than on the bed. Bathroom was incredibly small. I'd rate it as a fine 2-3 star hotel. It was very clean & as I said above, the staff was very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Old style elegance. This hotel had character.

review.title: Historic hotel in a convince my location
review.reviewText: The hotel had a glorious PDF and it can still be seen especially in the main lobby. The room are specious and the big digital TV supplied a nice re lacing option after a full meeting day. I especially enjoyed the full size bathtub which becam a eatery in many more moderne hotels. The only minus in my front room was the noise of the public transportation and the inability to close the window curtains completely.

review.title: Not good
review.reviewText: Did not get what they advertised
review.negativeRemarks: Room
review.locationRemarks: Poor

review.positiveRemarks: the rates were sensible and the location was convenient
review.negativeRemarks: the state of the lifts--far too slow--and why doesn't the management either build a lift for the staff or dedicate one lift for them?

review.title: Decent "vintage" hotel for the price
review.reviewText:
The hotel as a whole was nice... Definitely old, but kept up well. Elevators had issues the whole time so we took the stairs mostly. Not the end of the world, but annoying. The hallways smelled a little musty but the rooms felt clean and were comfortable. The outside/hallway noises were loud through thin walls.. Glad I had my "white noise" app on "floor fan" to help drown it out a little.

All in all it was decent for the price... Which was one of the least expensive I found in SF area... Could've been less but SF is just expensive.

review.title: Old but not quite charming
review.reviewText: The hotel reminds you of another era but not in a charming way. It needs some updating. The common areas need the most help (dim hallways) but the rooms themselves were fairly nice and clean, just small and a little outdated. The staff was very friendly though which made up for a lot. The location was my biggest issue. While just blocks from the fashionable Union Square area, the city's homeless problem hits you square in the face outside the hotel. I was not comfortable walking alone at night and there is little within sight in terms of nice places to eat or shop. So, while in my room, it was fine. Step outside, and it falls short. Very nice staff though and a Starbucks in the lobby!

review.title: Nice hotel, sketchy part of town
review.reviewText:
Being a historical hotel, the facilities were gorgeous but obviously old. The place was well kept in general but in need of some upgrades in the rooms (stained carpets, peeling wallpaper in the room, furniture was quaint but in need of restoration). We wished we had known the hotel was a good four very long blocks to the shopping district. On the map it looked a lot closer. The neighborhood was filled with homeless people sleeping on the street, making us very nervous walking around after dark. The hotel restaurant and bar closed at 9pm because of problems they had been having with locals coming in an bothering (stealing from) the hotel patrons.

The hotel staff were friendly enough, but not really helpful in terms of specific advise. The concierge had told us to catch the train to San Jose airport instead of a shuttle, but neglected to tell us if we missed the connection, we would have to wait a full hour to catch the next one. Once we figured this out, we had already bought tickets that we couldn't use and had to catch a very expensive cab ride instead to make our flight.

If you enjoy historical buildings, this one is really nice, but the neighborhood not great. Makes sense why the price was so low. Next time we would get a hotel closer to Fisherman's Warf. It is a very tourist friendly area.
review.positiveRemarks: Historical features like original stained glass and marble everywhere. Bartender Albert was fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Could have been cleaner. The bed skirt looked like it had never been washed.
review.locationRemarks: Very sketchy neighborhood. We had to walk past homeless, crazy people every day and witnessed drug deals going down in broad daylight!

review.title: Great location for all public transportation.
review.reviewText: Friendly, helpful staff. Starbucks in the lobby. Sam's across the street makes a great breakfast. Bart station is just out the front door. Bus and surface rail right there, also. We used the valet parking.

review.title: Nice location if visiting San Francisco

review.reviewText: Nice vintage hotel. A lot of local construction going on around hotel. Ask for "quite" room. Would highly recommend as a good value hotel with old style charm.

review.title: You pay for nothing
review.reviewText: You pay for a hotel that it is not really worth this price.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms are very old fashion and smell bad
review.locationRemarks: it is in good area

review.title: Historic hotel, fewer amenities
review.reviewText: We thought we'd be fine because we were right near a BART station, but BART was on strike, so we had to drive everywhere. Thankfully, the valet was GREAT!!! Cheaper to pay for parking through the hotel. Construction right outside our window made for a lousy view. Tiniest bathroom of our trip and funky outlets to plug in chargers. (But that's to be expected in a hotel of this age.)
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was greatly missed. The Starbucks in the lobby was fine, but the line was long.
review.locationRemarks: Homeless people all over, carry change.

review.reviewText:
The only drawback, and I probably would not fault the hotel, was that the security people have to check room keys for people coming into the hotel lobby from the front door at night for security purposes. There were large numbers of people coming in when I did the same, so the key fellows were under pressure. They both were curt...I guess because of the pressure. Perhaps having a roped line to form, as opposed to people coming through the entire width of the lobby, would alleviate this.

The superior double-queen room was beautifully appointed. As in old hotels, it was smaller than desired.

But I give it a big plus in making my stay there fun.

review.title: 3 night business trip
review.reviewText: Hotel is historic, so keep that in mind. Rooms were clean, but facilities are dated, due to it being a historic landmark. Great price for SF area. Quiet rooms, heard no noise from other rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Some updates
review.locationRemarks: Great location, get out and explore!

review.title: Chaos
review.reviewText: Too expensive, bad location, incredulous staff, room.... poorly decorated. The bathroom was nice. The towels were nice. Nice view. Quiet.

review.title: Weekend in San Fran - Hotel was good value!
review.reviewText:
We got off to a rough start with the check in - but otherwise the rooms were clean, comfortable and great value.
we were well situated on Market for the subway and buses - not a problem to get everywhere. Lots of homeless people on the streets - but we really can't have anything but compassion. The hotel is a wonderful example of old glamour - the cellings in the lobby are amazing, along with the marble foyer. Starbucks right next door and their bar with the roaring fireplace is a perfect spot to end the day after walking up and down the hills. We were a group of four - and our room was quiet - theirs was on the fifth floor was over the delivery area and was very noisy at night. We all agreed that overall the hotel was a perfect place to stay and we would go back again.
review.positiveRemarks: clean comfortable rooms, gorgeous old history
review.negativeRemarks: front desk needs more help, safety deposit boxes in rooms
review.locationRemarks: we were a street car ride away from Coit Tower, Cable car Museum, North Beach, China Town, Shopping, Wharf, Jump on jump off buses, and so much more

review.title: Really small and old hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was really tiny. It has a very creepy feeling when walking to our room bc the hotel is historic. This was my first and last time there. Some of the staff were pleasant... It was too pricey for a small room.

review.title: The hotel is close to shopping and transportation.
review.reviewText: My second visit and it went well. There was construction going on and we were waiting for a cab for over 30 minutes without knowing that the street was closed. The concierge came to us and helped us find a cab and was very helpful with our questions and concerns.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was definitely our main concern. Every type of transportation is close by and the staff is helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need a touch up.
review.locationRemarks: So many stores, transportation, restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Beautiful lobby & architecture. Rooms need TLC
review.reviewText:
Gorgeous lobby - beautifully restored. Rooms didn't live up to the lobby. The bed and furniture were very nice but the bathroom was not good. The bathtub was grubby and needed re-tiling. There was a moldy smell to the bathroom that I couldn't figure out.
I wish there was some food available past 9pm or even room service. The area was not great to be out in as a female on her own and so I relied on the Starbucks next door.
The proximity to BART was very convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: architecture, proximity to BART stop, Starbucks
review.negativeRemarks: food availability, renovations to washrooms
review.locationRemarks: BART station is right there. I walked everywhere so it was a good location to head out from. The area itself felt a little seedy.

review.title: Not the best experience
review.reviewText:
Did not get the room that I paid for. I had paid extra for a larger room and when we checked in we were told that the room was only available the first night and we would have to change rooms after that. I didn't want to have to change rooms so they told me they were going to give me a room that would be the same as what I paid for, but we didn'tget that. Plus I was told the parking fee lower when I booked the hotel then what I was actually charged.

Then at 1:00am in the morning, another couple was trying to get into our room. We had the deadbolt on and the chain lock so they were unable to enter; however they continued to try to get in until I finally got up and tole them the room was occupied.

Then the next day our room keys didn't work. I believe it had to do with the other couple trying to get into the room that they changed it so our room keys no longer worked. So I had to go down to the front desk to get new keys.

Then the front desk couldn't find my paperwork but after showing them proper identification they finally gave me new keys to the room. Then later that day there was a message on our phone to go down to the front desk and resign new paperwork. Needless to say, I was very dissappointed in this whole mess up.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. It was near Union Square where we had to be.
review.negativeRemarks: The whole mix up in rooms and fees!
review.locationRemarks: Location was central.

review.title: Bad place people not very nice.
What ever happened Quality?
review.reviewText: Unfriendly registration staff; dirty (and wrinkled) sheets and pillowcases, and difficulty obtaining clean ones. Lobby looked nice at first, but sit down on the sofas with minimal cushioning and even less support, also stained and smelling dirty sofas; dirt in corners and don't even look at the floors in the restaurant... Doorman (apparently) kicked someone out of the restroom in the lobby, creating a loud and unnecessary scene on the lobby, so not very family friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Actually, the breakfast was surprisingly good; the waffle with extra fresh fruit (was so tired, hungry & frustrated, just wanted to eat).
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I can say would make a difference. Maybe start on something easy, simple, yet oh-so important: Customer Service!
review.locationRemarks: Was a business trip?

review.title: Too expensive for what was provided
review.reviewText: Check in process slow and tedious, Room simply o.k, but for the over $300.00 dollars paid. Not a good value. Neighborhood as expected - simply dreadful.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators slow, restaurant hours limited, price not a value for what was offered.
review.locationRemarks: Get out of the neighborhood as soon as possible. Surrounding area is awful

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: I wouldn't pay this much for a room but then again, it's San Francisco. Location is good -close enough to Union Square. Lots of homeless people around though they are everywhere in the city. There is a Starbucks in the premises - a plus for me!

review.title: Ok hotel in an atrocious neighborhood. Not safe.
review.reviewText: This hotel was not good, there was a rude gentleman at the front desk (however he was the only unfriendly person) and the water pressure was not very good in the shower. On the day of departure 2 elevators were broken so I waited 25 minutes for an elevator because my suitcase was too heavy for the stairs. Believe it or not I could have lived with all of that had it not have been for the neighborhood. This is not a safe place to stay. The streets are filled with homeless drug addicts, so bad that I nearly vomited from the smell of urine.
review.positiveRemarks: It was historic and the staff was generally friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The water pressure.
review.locationRemarks: Terrible location.

review.title: a bit tired but a good deal
review.reviewText:
the hotel itself is one of those grand old ladies. lots of wood paneling, lots of mirrors, long hallways...
it's a bit tired and they seem to be trying to reno it. our room was really nice and the bed was super comfy. the staff was great - especially the bellman and the doorman. starbucks in the lobby is pretty handy and how can you beat the access to the bart outside the front door!
yeah, the area is really pretty sketch. there's a LOT of homeless people in the area, which is just really sad. be brave, there are lots of other tourists walking about and the homeless were not aggressive. if you leave the hotel and turn left, walk to valencia and turn left again. valencia is covered in cool little shops and restaurants. lots to explore.
review.positiveRemarks: the old school cool, the rumours of a ghost, the history, the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: it could use an overhaul. the room was great, really nice, but the hotel is a bit beaten up.
review.locationRemarks: close to shopping, transit, the mission district to the left, the downtown to the right. city hall is worth a visit, sam's diner, good food.

review.title: Wouldn't stay there again...
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very old and needs renovating. There are no free power outlets in the room, so to charge my three devices (phone, iPad, PC) I had to unplug the TV and the lights (!)

There is no light in the closet, so I had to keep the bathroom door open in order to have a bit of light and be able to see where my clothes were. Service was mixed: a few friendly concierges with several people at the front desk who clearly have been in their jobs for far too long.

The WiFi service was extremely slow and worked only half the time... I ended firing up my personal hotspot as I gave up on it.

Creepy people surrounding the hotel made it difficult to enjoy walking in the neighborhood.
review.positiveRemarks: There is a Starbucks right by the entrance which is a nice way to start the day.

review.title: Beautiful hotel design but the rooms are old
review.reviewText: I checked and haven't paid about $320 a night, the appearance was appalling… I felt as if I walk into a motel. The bathroom still had mold residue on the wall. I went downstairs and quickly brought the attention of the agent at the desk. She was very nice, and changed my room to what I believe she mentioned as an upgrade. The new room was better much better than the prior room but it was still very old but at least clean. It certainly was not what I was useful used to for price of about $320 a night. If you are one for history and beauty and design in the lobby and hotel region at large, then this is a hotel for you because, in that regard, it was beautiful. However when it comes to the rooms, I believe it is subpar.

review.title: Older hotel with charm but little space.
review.reviewText: The front desk is slooooooow as molasses. Check in should never take that long but slow as they were, the thousand year old elevators were still faster.
review.positiveRemarks: It's charming and close to a lot of great sights. There is a Starbucks and a restaurant/bar in the lobby. VERY pretty.
review.negativeRemarks: The whole places moves in slow motion. People are in a hurry these days even on vaca. The restaurant/bar closes early and does NOT offer room service.
review.locationRemarks: We stayed there to go to a show in the Castro. Quick taxi ride. The location is good for exploring.

review.title: Need management attention
review.reviewText: 1.5 hr to do check in, kept us waiting while processing big groups. Internet very slow. Booked thru expedia. Hotel in a unsafe zone, almost all shops around the hotel recommended us not to be in the street past 6:30 pm. You need to consider additional $35+ tax per day if you have your car. ( not obvious to us untill we were there).
review.negativeRemarks: Need to be better prepared.
review.locationRemarks: Around the hotel, not recommended, but if move to other areas, very nice and safe

review.title: Historic hotel in SOMA
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable. The hotel itself was very ornate and nice. Water pressure in the shower could be better. Nice little breakfast place across the street.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: It had the valet parking through an alley behind the hotel. Very inconvenient.

review.title: Nice hotel close to civic centr in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Good location if you have to appear in state or federal courts.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to State and Federal Courts.

review.title: Older hotel, but very nice.
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is an old SF landmark near the Civic Center. Although not as large as those in newer, more expensive hotels, they're perfectly adequate, nicely decorated, and quiet. Excellent location if you're doing business at the Civic Center or with Twitter (a block away). Like at most hotels up and down Market Street, you'll be exposed to homelessness and generally lost souls, but there isn't pervasive panhandling. If you're adventurous, a few blocks away in SOMA are a bunch of hot new restaurants. SOMA is rapidly gentrifying, but parts of it are still pretty seedy.

review.title: ASA CONFERENCE
review.reviewText:
I always stay at boutique hotels when attending conferences.
I was told that this hotel would be in close proximity (walking) to
the Convention Center (it really wasn't).

For today's modern traveler, access to electrical outlets is essential.
NONE would hold an electrical plug.
They would just 'fall' out.
Tub was dirty and toilet would not completely flush.

Never good when you get off the elevator and get a 'musty' smell.

BTW ... the Starbucks in your lobby.
They had flies in their pastry cabinet.

Not a positive stay.

review.title: It looks old and it certainly felt it.
review.reviewText: Didn't like parking at all. Valet was mandatory and costs 35 dollars a night. We had in and out privileges, but more often we left it there because of the hassle of getting it out. There was limited and cramped parking. But at least the valets were nice. Overall the staff was courteous. The hotel' sage was the problem. The whole look was certainly full of character. I'm often reminded by the shining ( and that's actually a compliment ). I could do without the slow and small elevators. But I guess it comes with age. The rooms were comfy. It had modern elements mixed in with older architecture. So San Francisco! Wi-fi was supposed to be available in our floors, but through the weekend, I was never able to use the internet. Starbucks and restaurant on the lobby was a convenient plus. Even with its faults is stay here again. But they'd have to reduce the price significantly.
review.positiveRemarks: It has a lot of character
review.negativeRemarks: Parking. Elevators were sooooooo slow. Wi-fi was nonexistent in rooms. Parking was expensive with little options.
review.locationRemarks: Union square. Lots of restaurants.

review.title: Haunted place
review.reviewText: It is a historic place but in the bad way of meaning. It has not been renovated for some time. Bathroom are super small. Room has very basic amenities. I was unable to close the curtain because something was blocking rail. It takes forever for hot water to run. Elevator worked erratically. Staff is very inconsiderate. I had to wait for the bell boy for 20+ minutes until somebody from desk staff finally helped me out. Meanwhile they were chatting on the other side of the counter. Location is disappointing. A lot of homeless people and strange characters at night makes the place very dangerous. The only benefit is the location close to BART.

review.title: Very pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText: This hotel is amazing. ..every bit as elegant as the Fairmont, St. Francis, etc.

review.title: It will do.
review.reviewText: This is an old, historic hotel in a neighborhood that will be gentrifying in the next several years. It's a bit run down, but has basic amenities
review.negativeRemarks: Desk staff were slow and not particularly friendly to international guests.
review.locationRemarks: Symphony, Opera, Farmer's Market, City Hall. On trolley, bus, and BART lines

review.title: Next to Bart but not clean
review.reviewText: I was on the 7th floor the first night, looking at t another window 18 feet or so away (room 730). The room and corridor smelled like mildew. But I was given a room on the second floor the next day and it was fine. No view, but no smell. Hotel staff were responsive if you talked to them face to face, but they did not pick up the phone if you tried to call from the room.
review.positiveRemarks: The BART is 100 feet away from the door and Starbucks is right off the lobby. Internet was fast.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could be cleaner and less smelly.

review.title: We really enjoyed our stay here!
review.reviewText: Very convenient location, the room and hotel lobby was beautiful with amazing architecture, marble and chandeliers. The hotel is a little tired in places and the bathrooms could probably use an upgrade as could the fitness centre but overall it's a lovely place to stay.

review.title: In the city.
review.reviewText: Can't wait for the area to be more up and coming. Get the Gym new equipment. Nothing worked.

review.title: Overnight in SF
review.reviewText: This hotel has such vintage architectural furnishings. It is awesome to see it from the tiffany glass to the wood moldings. The room I stayed in was nice but could use some serious updating. The wall paper was peeling and the paint chipped. I understand it is an old building but I feel the rooms could use some serious updating. i felt like it needed to be brought up to the 2000's!
review.negativeRemarks: The exercise room was awful, it stunk and the equipment needed refreshing.
review.locationRemarks: It was a good location central to transportation.

review.title: Historical Hotel, centrally located,
review.reviewText: comfortable, convenient, walking distance to most things including Folsom Street Fair

review.title: not safe part of town
review.reviewText: the hotel itself is simply old, tired, worn and really not clean. the worst part may be the area of market street where the hotel is located. i realize its not the fault of the hotel, but more of a social issue for the city of san francisco. there are so many homeless people in this area it just doesn't feel safe and is littered with garbage from the people who reside there. there is the constant police activity in the area as well. the whitcomb is 5 -6 blocks away from anything worth experiencing. in conclusion, do not consider this hotel

review.title: Convenient and friendly
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and proactive even hotel was fully booked and very busy. Room was clean, but missing safe box. Easy access to metro, Line 15 tram to city, and BART line to airport and direction to Stanford. A safe and pleasant experience.

review.title: Nice old hotel but not in the perfect area of town
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed my stay in the hotel. Staff was friendly. Prices were a little too high.
Loved the Starbucks in the building.
Internet connection was not good.
The view from the window was not good either.
Wish they have a lock box in the room.
Lots of homeless and panhandlers around the hotel, so maybe if going in a group will be good but not by yourself.
review.negativeRemarks: As above.
review.locationRemarks: Transportation with the MUNI was easy. Market is a great street to be, but where the hotel is not a good one.

review.title: Clean accommodation. Convenient location.
review.reviewText:
The Whitcomb is right on Market street. Close to BART, Muni and lots of buses.

The hotel is 'historic'. The rooms and public areas are clean but no frills.

It feels a bit like the Overlook Hotel from The Shining though.

Still not a bad value. Nothing to write home about, nothing to run from.

review.title: Late arrival....
review.reviewText: Overall clean and safe. The area around the hotel leaves a lot to be desired. The staff was friendly.

review.title: Ok for a night as a stop gap
review.reviewText: This hotel is ok for 1 night. I was here for 4 nights. The staff are friendly. Beds are comfortable. That's about it. There is no room service, no mini bar. My only saving grace was a Starbucks in the lobby. The staff were lovely - they held my room for me as I was 24hrs delayed. Check in was quick. When I got to my room the window was broken and wouldn't close. I called down and they switched my room - eventually.

review.title: Pleasant staff and convenient location
review.reviewText: Before booking we went to hotel for our inquiry. So polite and to the point, and we booked 1 night to check the room, but already at check in we extended two more nights online. Only minus is the lack if safety box in room, and fridge is not complementary, plus no microwave. Great location next to BART, subway and tram line. Overall a hotel I would consider return to.

review.title: Ok hotel at the heart of the City
review.reviewText: It is undeniably an old hotel. Overall it is ok but they would need a major updating to make it really nice. A real plus is the Starbucks downstairs which was convenient for a quick bite in the morning and they must've told the homeless people to leave because we really didn't see any of them right outside the hotel. 3 stars at best.

review.title: Whitcolm hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms are shabby and dated. Check in took 45 minutes which I was told was normal.

review.title: Perfect hotel to explore SF city
review.reviewText: it's very convenient and close to Bart/Muni station. The hotel looks very clean and its historic architecture makes you feel like you are in a palace :) I would totally recommend this hotel if you want to explore SF or if you are a local who wants to explore areas like SoMa, downtown or Union Square areas. Also, staff is very friendly.

review.title: Hotel downtown San Fran.
review.reviewText: We were supposed to have a delux roon with a view?? The room was small, only view was the back and sides of other bldgs. AC only worked part of the time. Overpriced and then you have to pay for parking!! If you want a refrigerator or coffee maker, it would cost extra. Beds were nice.. The staff that helped with luggage were nice and friendly, the desk help not so much.
review.negativeRemarks: The cost. Room could use some hooks in bathroon for clothing.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown location. Hard to find.

review.title: Hotel with character in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: Had an initial scare upon checking in when it appeared that my room had not been reserved but after some diligent investigation from the helpful desk staff the matter was resolved. Also had a problem with the light switch in my room but that was quickly repaired. Overall had a fairly pleasant stay that week.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the somewhat "faded glamour" appearance about the hotel which gave it a lot of character but might not be to everyone's taste.
review.negativeRemarks: There were no coffee making facilities or a refrigerator in the room.
review.locationRemarks: It was a good central location with a BART/Muni station right outside the front door. The streetcar which ran outside takes you directly to Fishermans

review.title: Really pretty awful, particularly given the price
review.reviewText:
Maybe this was once a nice hotel, but it's been years since anyone with a can of paint or bucket of Lysol has been inside. Spooky lighting, a decrepit "fitness center"-- just cant' find much to like about the place. The staff are fine, but give off a tired, resigned vibe. Even the expired elevator certificates tell a story of neglect. The neighborhood is, well, sketchy is a kind way to put it. And oh, one more thing: given all this, the pricing (at least during busy weeks) is absurdly high.

I will say two positive things: the views from the rooms that face Market are delightful, and the WiFi is reliable. OK, great. But it doesn't make up for the condition of the place, and when you add the price... well, run, don't walk, elsewhere.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in shady part of the town. You will meet stange people outside. However hotel itself is quite OK, if you get a good room. I slept well :)
review.locationRemarks: Do not go outside on the evening or night. You have been warned.

review.title: Poor Hotel Service
review.reviewText: We have stayed in numerous hotel's in the area every year. We arrived at our hotel at noon, which is early as check in is at 3pm. I asked the desk clerk who seemed pre occupied and uninterested in us, if there was any chance we could get our room early, he said yes and said come back at 1:30. We returned shortly after that and we were told to wait a little longer, at 3:00 pm still waiting quietly I approached the desk. The clerk snapped at me and said the room was not ready, we left and returned at 5 pm. A different clerk said our queen deluxe room was not ready, we were given a double instead. When I called the desk to en-quire why we had the wrong room he again was rude and said it was a queen bed, hmmm like I could not tell the difference. There was several other things over the three nights but minor except for the homeless lady having a bath in the women's wash room in the lobby when my wife attempted to use it. Our last day we picked up our car from the hotel car service the attendant never said hello or anything he took the tag from hand and got our car. When he drove the car around the first corner he squealed the tires, my wife thought it was maybe a mistake, but as he pulled up to us he did it again. He never offered to put our bags in the car he just said keys in the car and walked away. The worst part was we had a new large dent in the door.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is near many shops and union square, however it is not safe at night.
review.negativeRemarks: The service was terrible.
review.locationRemarks: Located about 6 blocks from the trendy down town

review.title: normal hotel in the downtown
review.reviewText: i can't complain it because it's on the market street and only 130 per night. however, the room is very small and lack of facilities.

review.title: Bad Location but was O.K.
review.reviewText:
Hotel Whitcomb could not have been in a worse location on Market street. I had to wonder about the safety of hotel guests as the area itself was less than to be desired. The rooms were just O.K. and the bathrooms could have used upgrading. The hostess at the breakfast restaurant was quite rude. When we finally got to sit down though, the hot breakfast was very good.
Needs updating.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby, rooms and bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Bad location

review.title: It was fine.
review.reviewText: This hotel was fine for what it was but I honestly only stayed there because all the hotels in the neighborhood I needed to be in that weekend were booked (America's Cup!)
review.locationRemarks: The neighborhood isn't so great so just consider that before booking.

review.title: Centrally located, beautiful and historic hotel
review.reviewText: Century-old gem of a hotel, gorgeous lobby, handsome room, good restaurant, terrific central location.

review.title: New old hotel in San francisco
review.reviewText: Service oriented, beautiful hotel, original ceilings, Starbucks next to lobby, and attention to detail, near public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing! Excellent bed, towels, sheets. Table rather than desk but with accessible outlets.
review.locationRemarks: Walked up from the waterfront. Near huge shopping mall.

review.title: Dont stay here.
review.reviewText: The hotel is not in the best part of town and the people working there are so rude. It is 35 a night to park and the only nice thing about the hotel is the starbucks next to the hotel.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: A little disappointed on the condition. The hotel is pretty old.

review.title: Don't go out after dark
review.reviewText: Great Staff, beautiful old historic hotel. But what a dangerous place to be at night. It is a shame to see the city make zero attempt to keep the aggressive homeless off the sidewalks, in the "metro" station (subway). Also, the ice machine was broken for several days, internet only worked in the lobby (even after we switched rooms for "better reception")
review.negativeRemarks: security, internet & ice machine.

review.title: Old Hotel Whitecomb
review.reviewText: This hotel is so creepy. Its like an old government building. Would you sleep at your local post office? Plus, there are a lot of homeless people on that block. Then to pay over 300 dollars for one night for this experience is crazy.

review.title: Old and outdated
review.reviewText: Shower was full of little insects, dark and small room, creepy and dark corridors. Not great area if you want to walk around.
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything
review.locationRemarks: Try to avoid walking down Market street. If possible, get a cab or drive

review.title: Terrible
review.reviewText: This was an aweful experience. My floor had a terrible smell. The Hotel charged me even though I had already paid through Expedia. When I tried to speak to the front desk they were rude and unhelpful. the elevators were so crowded I had to take the stairs every time. The hotel room was dirty the toilet seat was stained. Overall it was terrible!!! The Expedia reviews were inaccurate

review.title: disappointed
