review.reviewText: A beautiful historical hotel is kept clean and fairly comfortable, but disappointingly neglected by the staff's arrogance and unprofessional behavior. The phone in the room was not working, most likely completely disconnected. There is no accessible public bathroom in the hotel lobby and very few sitting areas for the guests. The information desk is almost always empty, bellboys are inaccessible and only on call and wait. There is no a quick check out even if the stay was already paid. The hotel's restaurant is open only for a limited times during the days, the Starbucks on the site is an only place to get refreshments, since the nearby coffee shops are shabby and have a very little to offer. The area is fairly safe but occupied by many transients day and night. Hotel's elevators are slow and the hallways empty and a bit creepy if one has to walk on the long narrow hallway to the room located on the back. In general, he hotel plus is the central location, the taxicabs parking on the front of the hotel, the easy access to the Bart and its well cleaned rooms. Its rating as a four stars hotel and its room prices are far too high comparing to other four stars hotels in the area that offer much more. Here, one pays for the sentiment to its historical past. If this is enough for the host to charge for, it is not enough for the guest.
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: The only thing we did not liked
review.reviewText:
The only thing we did not liked was that they do not let us know when we registered at the hotel that the parking was $40 per night.
That was unbelievable, because it is more than the amount we paid for rental of the car. I think they should let the customers know ahead of time so clients could be prepared for that big charge.
review.positiveRemarks: Good situation, nice antique style, good size and confortable rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Only the enormous and unexpected charge for the parking.
review.locationRemarks: If we knew about the parking ahead of time, we would not matter about renting a car, because the hotel is walking distance from public transportation

review.title: Bad location and expensive.
review.reviewText: The hotel is ok, but expensive for the location and accommodations.
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurant has good food. Comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms are to small and cramped. I setup a wake up call and it was not made. Good thing I set my phone alarm as well.
review.locationRemarks: The location does not have quality dinning within walking distant. The hotel is in a rough part of town.

review.title: Nice historic hotel with bad attitude.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, beautiful inside but unfortunately the hotel staff had a bad attitude and not very nice, made us feel like we were bothering them. Very disappointing!
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and very nice inside.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff needs to be more pleasant and with a customer service attitude to make you feel welcome.
review.locationRemarks: Very good location, close to shopping, taxis, carts and next to the Bart.

review.title: You pay for history
review.reviewText:
I stayed for 2 nights. Hotel has a good location, right next to BART ( subway), however the area around did not look very safe or clean. The hotel itself has an awesome historical lobby but feels old and used, elevators took forever to come up or down. The room had old house smell, although it tried to look clean, carpet was very used, air condition was so loud I had to switch it off, the bathroom was very small with no place to put toiletries.
Right next to the hotel is Starbucks and the grill serving breakfast, Lunch or dinner, kind of pricier food. The Internet was not included.
You pay for a view of old history what does not necessary mean a comfort. I will not be returning to the same hotel. In my opinion it was overpriced.

review.title: Homeless Row
review.reviewText: Room was very small. I had to crawl under the bed and behind the TV to find a power source which meant unplugging something else. The hotel was located near a BART stop which was nice but beyond that you had to walk through a shady area filled with homeless to get through to downtown. I still smell the urine.
review.negativeRemarks: I thought the hotel was nice despite the age. The city needs to address the homeless.
review.locationRemarks: You are within a mile of a great part of town. Taking the Civic Center BART station to Powell Street (One stop) gets you there.

review.title: good Hotel, very good location re Bart, etc
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the Hotel. Lobby and hallways look impressive with all the big shiny mirrors. Spacious room with very high ceiling and pleasant decor. Internet did not work in room. But Starbucks was conveniently located on ground floor. Staff was was nice and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Also we appreciated that public transportation was so easy accessible. (Bart, F-Line, etc.)
review.negativeRemarks: A couple of extra plugs to charge I-pad, phone, camera batteries
review.locationRemarks: Bart is right up front. Hotel is between Walgreen and CVS.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText:
We had booked a queen bed but since the hotel was really packed, we got 2 double beds instead, and got upgraded to the "superior" room. Now, I would have rather had my queen bed instead of the 2 double beds, and the superior room was nothing special. It was supposed to have a nice view, but instead we couldnt even open the windows since they were cleaning the windows, and the view was a construction site.

Overall the stay wasnt bad. It was close to Fishermans wharf and other touristy locations and its satisfactory.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Bart and other touristy locations
review.negativeRemarks: Staff. I would have really liked a mini fridge and a coffee maker in my room
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf, Valencia ave, golden gate bridge

review.title: Shabby Old Hotel
review.reviewText: Don't go with exterior looks. Myself and my wife stayed for 6 nights and it was a disappointing stay. The very first day when checked in, we found that the bathroom door has no locks and was always open! We informed the manager and a maintenance guy came and put locks in 1 hour time. This happened at 11 PM at night as we checked in late due to late arrival if our flight from Vancouver. Then we turned on the AC and found after 15 minutes that rattling sound came. We had to push a chair in a specific area of AC to reduce the sound! The electrical power switch was loose and whenever we removed our chargers, spark was coming. The bathroom pipe has to be pushed very tight else water will continue to leak! Overall, the Hotel badly needs a full maintenance. The reported all these to the manager. Hope they will take corrective action.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the BART station and we found it easy to come and leave to/ from Airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs overall overhauling of interior, relay electrical circuits and fitting s as well as proper maintenance of doors and bathroom fittings.
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel was located in the prime Market Street and one will get the famous F-Line cable train to all the main attractions directly.

review.title: Better to sleep under a roof than on the streets.
review.reviewText: It was nice enough. Pretty convenient location, professional staff. I might stay somewhere else next time I visit but just to switch it up.

review.title: Staff unfriendly, not the right type of room!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Terrible customer service. I booked a king since I was by myself and they gave me a double. I had 40% less bed and just used the other bed to put my luggage on.

review.title: Hotel was close to a lot of shopping area but ....
review.reviewText: Automated checkout was not working so we went downto the fromt desk about 30 mins before we were required to check out. Apparently eveeyone else was having trouble withtw automated system as well because there was a long line. Despite it being check out time there was inly one person working the front desk. Other than that it was a charming hotel, clean and convienant at a fair price.
review.negativeRemarks: More staff.
review.locationRemarks: Good walkimg distance to food and entertainment.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText:
Good:
- Relatively cheap for San Francisco
- Well connected via public transport, especially with regards to the airport.
- Rooms are spacious

Bad:
- The neighborhood was not very welcoming
- My room had a certain odor for the first 1-2 minutes each time I entered it.
- Wi-Fi performance was inconsistent
- Shower water pressure was low and the hottest setting was not hot enough to my liking.

review.title: Highly NOT recommended
review.reviewText:
Overall, this was a bad hotel in a terrible area of the city. As far as the hotel, it is old (not in a charming way) and seems to be run on a limited budget. My air conditioner sounded like a gas generator when running,there was torn carpet in my room, scratched bathroom tiles, dirty caulking around the tub and shower. Even the desk lamp was literally falling apart as I turned it on and off.

To top it off, there are MANY homeless folks as well as what looks to be various drug addicts in the area. We were growled at, screamed at, and cursed as the Devil's children. (no joke) I have compassion for mentally ill people, but at some point, shouldn't the hotel, or city work out a solution so that the patrons aren't confronted like this? Yikes. The low point of the trip was the dirty needle, pools of urine as well as a pile of human poop that we found on the sidewalk during our daily walking commute. I just can't express how unsafe and gross this area of the city is.

I live in Chicago and I also have travelled a lot, and this was one of the worst travel experiences of my entire life. I will never visit San Francisco again.

If you have children, please book a room in anywhere north of Market and East/ NE of about 3rd street. Your kids don't need to see what life is really like yet especially in the "Tenderloin".
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel can't do much about its location, but it certainly could work to improve its rooms by remodeling, cleaning, and fixing the obvious.
review.locationRemarks: Stay away from this area at all costs unless you want to see what homelessness, untreated mental illness,despair, and drugs look like.

review.title: I cannot recommend this Hotel to anyone.
review.reviewText: My room was off of the fire escape stairwell. Every time someone would walk up or down these stairs it would echo and wake me up, I think the average wake up per night was close to 5 or 6 times. The bathroom was old and dirty, the shampoo & conditioner were refills, very disgusting. The Wifi didn't even make it out to my room with any strength to use. I regret staying here, I was here for a tech conference and this had a significantly negative impact on my visit.
review.negativeRemarks: 150 characters isn't enough to detail this.
review.locationRemarks: Bums, Hobos, crack addicts, dirty needles, human waste on every corner.

review.title: Not in a great part of town and very old.
review.reviewText: Small rooms (very small bathroom), very old inside, hot water didn't work in my sink, and didn't feel safe walking around outside. The restaurant messed up my breakfast order two days in a row.
review.locationRemarks: I would not walk around outside. Drug addicts, homeless, and gangs hanging around.

review.title: Dirty hotel in bad area
review.reviewText:
Hotel located in an unsafe area. Surprised because it is pretty close to union square but the few blocks made a huge difference!

Room was dark, cold and smelled horribly of mold/ mildew(?)

Yes, it's cheaper but we spent more $$$ on cab fare because you can't walk through the area at night. Worth paying a little extra for better location.

Would never go back.
review.positiveRemarks: Absolutely nothing... There's a Starbucks attached...
review.negativeRemarks: Room light fixtures Shower water pressure Mold/ mildew smell in room Desk people (reminds you of cast from murder mystery

review.title: Crusty Crumbles
review.reviewText:
Still trying hard, but well past it's best. A crustier, old, small roomed, hotel would be hard to find...
If I were about five foot tall I might have found the rooms spacious and the showers adequate. The delicate aroma from the very polite bums surrounding the hotel in all directions was an added bonus.
Pay more you tight wad and get a better hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: I think it's needs to own up and agree that it's best days are well past...this should really be a $60/night hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Just a little too far down Market street for comfort. (It's where the bums live)

review.title: Historic Hotel across Market St from Orpheum
review.reviewText: Convenient to Orpheum,Market St Grill is in the hotel with very nicely presented dinners. Hotel is very old with small rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Very slow check-in. Update computer system.

review.title: Too close to The Tenderloin..
review.reviewText: My first issue with this hotel was the check-in process. We waited 2 hours to check-in. This seems to be common from the reviews I read today. While the front desk looks frantic, the hotel was generally empty and I was surprised that so many rooms had not been cleaned yet. We were one of maybe 4 parties waiting for clean rooms at 3:30pm on a Monday afternoon. Thank God some man joined the front desk staff and helped the line move. I could tell he was the most efficient person there while an older man with glasses mumbled in the corner and some crazed Spanish woman acted like everything was falling apart (even excusing herself to go get a sip of water mid-check-in). My second issue with this hotel is the location. Obviously they are not in control of this, but families should know that it's on the edge of The Tenderloin section (aka full of druggies/homeless people). I was very concerned walking home at night after 8pm. Homeless people are constantly hanging out in the lobby and the attached Starbucks. I understand that the hotel cannot control the 2nd issue I mentioned but I thought others looking to make reservations should be aware of its proximity to this crappy section of SF.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was very nice once we finally got into it.
review.negativeRemarks: The check-in process! They need more people on staff in the afternoon if you are a hotel that says 'check-in after 3pm.'
review.locationRemarks: We loved walking to The Ferry Building and around the wharf area. We covered 7 miles on foot while staying here and enjoyed the exercise.

review.title: Good location but fix the WiFi
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel that is showing its age in places, but the local is pretty good ( literally steps from a MUNI/BART station). I saw some complaints about the area's large homeless population but you can easily avoid that by just walking down the steps into the Muni station and traveling from there. I had no street noise problems during my stay. My biggest complaint is with the "free" WiFi which may be the worst I have ever experienced in a hotel. Calling it "slow" would be an understatement. I've had much faster WiFi at a Super 8 motel. I would rather pay extra for good WiFi than be forced to use really awful WiFi. WiFi that works is now just as essential as a hot shower and a comfortable bed IMHO so they need to fix this.
review.negativeRemarks: The WiFi
review.locationRemarks: Steps front the BART/MUNI station which takes you almost everywhere you would need to go.

review.title: Ok hotel but dodgy area
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was ok. The staff however did not seem to want to be there. The guy at the front desk was rather unfriendly and unhelpful with resolving a booking issue we had upon arrival. The area was also a bit dodgy. We didn't feel too comfortable going out the front door, especially in the evenings. I suppose that cannot be helped but the attitude of the staff certainly can. The restaurant was also rather disappointing. I don't think the hotel''s website accurately reflects what has become of the place.
review.positiveRemarks: I guess you could say it was historical.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff attitudes and facilities. Considering its location if things inside were better perhaps people would be more willing to forgive these conditions

review.title: Decent tourist hotel; very close to BART
review.reviewText: Our room was nicely appointed and clean. The staff were very friendly and competent. It is a good hotel for the price. The only downside was that we had a second floor room facing the street, so there were two of the country flags right outside our window. These flags made a lot of noise when it was windy, making it hard to fall asleep. The wireless internet was good enough for my business needs, including skyping.

review.title: nice stay
review.reviewText: grand old hotel nice beds,clean, very central location on a street without hills and very central to mass transportation
review.locationRemarks: subway at door Sam's diner right across street. You can get anywhere from here as quickly as from any location I know

review.title: Classic old hotel, good value
review.reviewText:
The good: good location on transit lines, walking distance to City Hall, Symphony/Opera, great Wednesday and Friday open market in UN Plaza. Price was reasonable for San Francisco. Classic design, with ornate high ceilings, wide hallways, old world charm. Good restaurants nearby. Had some very hardy breakfasts at a few different restaurants across the street.

The so-so: As an old hotel, the electrical system is not so modern, so you have to scout out available plugs to recharge phones, laptop, cameras, etc. Bathroom had an oddball layout, with underpowered and too-low shower, sealed and resealed tiles, and the sink barricaded into a recessed area only accessible by one person at a time, yet having large, unusable empty space there and in the closet.
Also, there are a lot of vagrants in the area, which gives it a bit of a sketchy feel. But I must say that we never felt threatened, even when returning in the nighttime hours.

Overall: we found this to be a good value, and despite any criticisms mentioned above, would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Cost, location, beautiful classic ornate design. Helpful Concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: Let's just say that the fellow at the front desk was not "customer focused." Had to wait for him to finish a conversation before helping us.
review.locationRemarks: Right in front of the hotel is the BART, Muni Bus, and trolley to Fisherman's Wharf. Symphony, Opera, City Hall, and UN Plaza open market nearby.

review.title: really bad! i would not recommend it to no one.
review.reviewText: worst hotel ever. never ever again would i go to this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: nothing

review.title: Great location, close to major streets.
review.reviewText: The hotel and the hotel rooms had this off putting odor. It smelt like mildew.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location. As soon as you walk out, you walk out to the bustling streets of Downtown San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: The quality of the hotel seemed too outdated.
review.locationRemarks: As soon as you walk out there are plenty of restaurants to try out. You get the downtown experience here. There is Westfield Mall couple blocks away.

review.title: Market Street San Francisco
review.reviewText: Location is great for getting around SF. It is not in the best part of town so it's all about location. Food in the restaurant is good although the wait staff could use some grooming.
review.locationRemarks: All stated above.

review.title: Bad beds
review.reviewText: Its very old, therefore it feels dirty. Seemed to be in a sketchy part of town at night atleast. We got scared and went back to our hotel. Of course the most important thing about the hotel stay are the beds, and this was horrible. Could feel springs in my back, but the pillows were great. Would not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds
review.locationRemarks: Sketchy at night

review.title: Convenient and reasonably priced
review.reviewText: This is a nice old hotel with a lobby in the grand style. It's fairly well maintained, rooms are small but adequate. Convenient to public transit (Bart, MUNI, trollies) and reasonably priced. The area around the Civic Center can be a "little sketch" (as my friend put it), but this is typical for less expensive hotels.

review.title: Bad Neighborhood
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Well kept. Clean but older rooms. Bathroom was outdated and in need of repair and/or remodel. It can also be a bit loud being right on Market St. Lots of homeless persons in the immediate neighborhood.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, attractive interior. Easy access to public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: Right by BART station. Sketchy neighborhood.

review.title: Well priced, & worth the price.
review.reviewText: This hotel is not "The Ritz", but the price is great for what you get and the location. If you are looking to keep it under $200 and still be in a good location, you'll do fine at this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Hard to explain, but it just felt kind of "old". If they focused on cleaning up and repairing some of the details, this old hotel could be amazing.

review.title: They know their job!
review.reviewText:
In general we liked a lot our stay, but especially because of the people running the hotel.
The front desk manager (from Uruguay) is an excellent person who helped us with all our concerns and difficulties, he knows everything about the zone.

You will arrive to a historic place from which you can move with great ease. Arriving in a car is not recommendable, parking is way to expensive. Consider to get around by bike...

review.title: Wonderful location.
review.reviewText: Everything within reach. I stayed 3 nights to visit my kids. The experience of location is excellent. Staff are cordial. The guest rooms need a bit more cheerful decoration and general lighting could be improved to make the place a bit cherry.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in procedure, too long waiting. General lighting, bathroom condition.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, everything within comfortable walking.

review.title: Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a very hard time getting to the hotel though it was within site due to the road in front. It is on Market street, one of the most congested streets we were on during our stay. We did not have a fridge in our room which we needed, thus we had things spoil. We went for a walk around the block to be confronted by homeless people who were begging and sleeping on the sidewalk. Very scary for me.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and the bellhop was very helpful. Lots of different languages spoken which would be wonderful for foreign guests.
review.negativeRemarks: Fridges in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: As I said, I was very unhappy with the location. We took a cab everywhere.

review.title: Traditional. Showing its age a little.
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival we received the grumpiest reception of our entire holiday from a woman on reception whose first words were NOT "Hello and Welcome to The Hotel Whitcomb"... but, without looking up said "ID?.."

Having said this, pretty much everyone else was super helpful, especially the bell hop and the Customer Relations Manager Manisha who was most helpful trying to sort out an issue with our flight and taking care of our bags. Even declining a gratuity!

Rooms were quite old fashioned and smaller than others we'd stayed in. But this is a very old hotel. Decor was ok and reflected the age of the hotel, but was in good condition and clean. Room was comfortable but just a little smaller than others.

Location handy for travel up and down Market St on frequent street cars (fun) but immediate vicinity has some homeless and pan-handlers on Market St. They don't bother you, it's safe, but it's not the nicest part of SF.

Overall - it's OK.
review.positiveRemarks: Old styling is quite cool especially in bathrooms.
review.negativeRemarks: The first welcome at reception.
review.locationRemarks: Good position for exploring further afield, but the city needs to move on the homeless from immediate Market St area.

review.title: So-so
review.reviewText:
Arrived early, about 9am, and asked about early check-in, which they don't offer. They said you could try coming at 12, but a room may or not be available. The best bet would be to come back at 3, when check-in starts. The guy at the front desk was a little gruff, but efficient. They did allow us to to store our luggage in a storage room; we didn't have any problems picking them up a little before midnight.
The room was okay. Unfortunately next to the ice machine, which you can hear, because the walls aren't very thick. We couldn't hear our neighboring room, but definitely heard people in the hallway. The room didn't have a "do not disturb" sign so we got woken up by housekeeping at 9am. The next day we just made our own and stuck in on the door and no one bothered us. The hook in the bathroom had a weeeeird pink waxy substance on it so we didn't hang our towels, kinda weirded out by the mystery goo. Aside from that, the room was clean, smelled like bleach so that was a good sign. Check-out was easy, no problems there.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness, personable staff

review.title: Nice Hotel. Little over priced but it is San Fran.
review.reviewText: The weather was a great break from the summer. City Bous tours made it easy to get around the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the Hotel was a good starting point for any place that we visited.
review.negativeRemarks: No lights in the closets. Needed upgrade for electrical plug ins.
review.locationRemarks: Around the corner from the Hotel you can catch a touring bus for the day.

review.title: Cramped dusty room.
review.reviewText: Room was very dusty. Bathroom was cramped and claustrophobic. Surrounding area was a little unsafe.
review.negativeRemarks: They could dust the rooms and vacuum more thoroughly. Wifi was extremely slow.

review.title: Great economy hotel
review.reviewText:
The only draw back to this hotel is the neighborhood. Luckily it is right
next to the BART station so you don't have to walk on Market street.
The room was really comfortable and clean, and there wasn't any noise from
Other rooms. This was also the most affordable hotel closest in to the main attractions.
I had to wait in a really long check in line, but the staff was really fun and friendly and answered all
my questions.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our trip for the most part. Plenty of things to do and see in the area. The area around the hotel was a disappointment and would prevent me from staying at this particular hotel. Within a block of the hotel I witnessed a drug deal and drug use. Homeless are begging outside the hotel and sleeping in the subway station located outside the hotel. Sam's Diner located across from the hotel was a bright spot in the stay at the hotel. It was easy to catch the subway with a station outside the hotel. We took the 2 day tour bus around the city which was nice except they said the area we were staying in was an unsafe area and tourist should be careful when going out at night do to the homeless and crime rate.
review.positiveRemarks: The wood work in the lobby was beautiful. There was a Starbucks in the lobby. The Staff was helpful. Beds were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was small, the bathroom was real small, better room cleaning, needs updating.
review.locationRemarks: The area really took away from hotel.

review.title: Bad Cleaniness and security in the Hotel
review.reviewText: I had 2 beds in my room, just one of them used to be dressed... You need to leave your car with Valet Parking, one night I went to the parking and found my car opened with the keys inside and with all my luggages and personal things exposed...

review.title: Civic Center Gem
review.reviewText: If you like the charm of a historic building, this place is great. Beautiful woodwork in the lobby and throughout. Comfortable rooms, great beds and close to the Bill Graham, Davies Hall and museums.
review.positiveRemarks: The architecture and style; room comfort
review.locationRemarks: This is a great place to stay if your attending shows at the Bill Graham or Davies. Walking distance to so many activities.

review.title: Cool old hotel
review.reviewText: Cute hotel. Small rooms are clean and comfortable. I don't think the bad reviews I read we're warranted.

review.title: ok room with a few problems
review.reviewText: The worst part was the bathroom. No towels would dry overnight. Also, the bathroom fan (which provided the only light in the bathroom) was the noisiest fan we'd ever heard--very bad. The beds were ok, the dining room had decent food, typical price for SF I expect. The location is marvelous, net to a Muni/Bart stop that takes you everywhere. No other nearby decent options for a cheaper breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom (see above).
review.locationRemarks: Near Muni/Bart stop, few restaurants nearby or anything else.

review.title: Tiny and outdated room.
review.reviewText: For the price we paid we did not feel we got value for money compared to other hotels in SanFrancisco for similar price/location. The lobby is impressive however the rooms are very outdated and tiny. This hotel is in desperate need of a massive refurbishment. I recommend choosing a different hotel for your stay in SF
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room and how old the fixtures and fittings were
review.locationRemarks: Not the best part of the city

review.title: Overall a good place to stay.
review.reviewText:
It was in a fairly good location, about 1 mile from Union Square.
Price per night for valet anytime was somewhat reasonable @ $35 a night.
Hotel was in good condition and felt like a safe environment...after hours checked all entering front door for room key.

Overall a good place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been very nice to have a mini refrigerator in the room.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Looks like a cool building, but the room was dirty (hair on the bed and in the bathroom). The hotel needs a serious update! It is in a very impoverished area. There are homeless people every where which makes it very uncomfortable to walk around. I barely left my hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of the rooms and the homeless problems outside.

review.title: Fine
review.reviewText: The bellhop was missing for more than 15 minutes when I needed to claim my bags before departing. But everything else was fine.

review.title: Great location near hayes
review.reviewText: Had a great experience here, would def book with them again, and the neighborhood ain't bad for san .

review.title: Hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: Good hotel. We had a few issues with noisy neighbors. The hotel was fairly quick to address the problem, although it was 3am. In the morning after speaking with the manager we had our room upgraded free of charge and slept much better the second night. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

review.title: Good qaulity hotel in a central location
review.reviewText: Rooms were comfortable, reasonable prices, easy checkin. Clearly defined and explained prices and add-ons (parking).
review.positiveRemarks: Turn of the century style of the hotel. Updated rooms. Pleasant staff. Good location for walking.

review.title: Kind of icky
review.reviewText: wifi didn't work in our room. The foldout cot was like an instrument of torture. Very colourful neighbourhood -- perfect for supporting one's crack habit.
review.locationRemarks: Sketchers!

review.title: Nice pub. Very historic. Great lobby.
review.reviewText: Location a bit dodgy. Hotel nice though. Rooms OK. Starbucks in lobby good.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff at reception average.
review.locationRemarks: Close to F line which was great.

review.title: Vintage San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Real old time San Francisco feel in aged, but well kept and elegant hotel. Larry, the doorman in full uniform there to greet you and the classic bellhop in uniform and pill box hat to take your bags. Floor to ceiling mirrors, polished brass, and dark wood harks back to a day when the economy was good and money flowed freely. Feels like the Astor's would want to linger awhile here on the way to Fisherman's Wharf.

The hotel is clean, the staff is efficient, the rooms (at least mine) was quite small with high ceilings but certainly more than adequate for me to visit long enough to catch a nice quiet nights sleep. I will have to say the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in in quite some time!

On the serious side, the Whitcomb lies in the heart of the Tenderloin district - which as a Texan I thought I should be able to relate to. Quite the contrary, it was more of a culture shock just outside the revolving door for this cowboy. There were quite a few street people and many whose gender was indiscernible. While a bit out of the ordinary for me, it did not stop me from saddlin' up and wading out amongst 'em. The last day was especially notable when I got to meet the street guy with tourette syndrome in the Starbucks........
review.positiveRemarks: Old world feel. Clean, quite rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps offer a breakfast like many of the chains do, but otherwise it was as expected.
review.locationRemarks: Not far from the Wharf. Tube trains and trolley's near. Convention/civic center within blocks.

review.title: Great downtown location - close to shopping!
review.reviewText: I really appreciated the location - took the BART from SFO International Airport straight to the hotel. The hotel had character - a very convenient Starbucks attached for your morning coffee. Would have liked to have a coffee machine in my room. My only complaint is that I was not able to close the window drapes fully to shut out the morning light. The bed was very confortable.

review.title: Gorgeous lobby, wonderful old character
review.reviewText: Great comfortable beds, quaint old charm. Rooms were laid out a bit awkwardly, and the bathroom was old, but every effort was made to keep them clean. You have a choice to use their parking lot for $35. a night or park a few blocks away and walk. Not ideal, but we are city folk and it was fine for us. Doors and walls are thin and you can hear noise from the other rooms. Overall, we liked it and it was a pretty place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Move the smokers out of the front of the hotel. The smoke drifts into the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Pretty average for the price.
review.reviewText: Room is reasonable size and clean. I would stay here again if it was cheaper but not otherwise.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff could be a little more helpful and friendly.

review.title: Disappointing staff and bathrooms
review.reviewText:
The attending person behind the desk claimed that not all rooms which I booked via Expedia were available.

After I read out the details of the confirmation he complied and "found" our rooms..

During the whole conversation he was smacking his chewing gum.

Disappointing, while the hotel itself was clean and the beds confortable; however to be eligible for the claimed 4-star rating I would suggest to renovate the bathrooms as they are very tiny and looked more like an extended toilet than an actual bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms, they do not qualify for a 4 star (or even a 3 star) rating

review.title: Sketchy Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a sketchy location, we didn't feel safe going outside after dark.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators were extremely slow and unpredictable. No coffee maker in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Not a very good location for tourists. We had to take car to get anywhere.

review.title: Nice hotel in the center of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: I was particularly impressed during this stay by the excellent breakfast in the dining room, which provided a great start for a busy day in the city!
review.locationRemarks: One of the best features about the Whitcomb is its location near a BART/Muni station on Market Street. It's easy to get back from late-night events!

review.title: Nice convenient hotel with an old charm.
review.reviewText:
I always prefer staying in apartments or B n B when travelling overseas for a more 'local' experience. Because of time constraints, the Whitcomb appeared to be a decent choice instead of the other chain hotels available. My local friends warned me about safety of the environ. After 3 nights' stay, I found it's not bad at all as the muni and Bart station are right in front of the hotel- just refrain from going to the side streets after dark.
The hotel has a certain old charm feel and my room is quite elegant.

review.title: Historic hotel spacious lobby with excellent decor
review.reviewText: valet parking only $35.00 daily - consearge extremely helpful and knowledgeable - rooms are small but beds are very nice. Bathroom is outdated - we had drainage issues but they were corrected. No coffee in room and no room service. Easy Muni/BART and rail travel to all locations - no need for a car for day trips.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were very courteous/helpful. Most patrons were non american. Decor/history was fantastic
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms need to be upgraded
review.locationRemarks: easy access to all city destinations - MUNI/BART station on same block as hotel. NO breakfast without extra fee.

review.title: Aging facilities
review.reviewText:
Good location but facility is showing it's age.
My wife jokes that the hotel "harbored ghosts."
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade facilities
review.locationRemarks: Excellent access to public transportation

review.title: Homeless and cleanness
review.reviewText:
The hotel is cute and homey but it needs better cleaning, under beds need to be vacuum and sofas in the lobby area are very dirty, I didn't even seat on it. The worst of all is the homeless outside of the hotel they are overwhelming the way the "live", dirty, depressive and dangerous.,

Thank you.
review.positiveRemarks: Deco and cosines and must of the staff are nice.
review.negativeRemarks: cleaning and keep away the homeless outside of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: we took taxi to get away from the area only because of homeless

review.title: Whitcomb is OK Things can be improved
review.reviewText: On our trip to San Francisco we experienced a few hicups with our stay. On check-in the entire hotel computer system was offline, causing longer process to sign in. However our keycards were experiencing problems because without the servers, they could not be repaired. For 2 days we had to do multiple trips via elevator to see if they worked or not. It was terrible, only once did a maintenance worker let us into our room. I asked if there would be compensation for this, they said It's BEYOND our control. The breakfast wait staff service was slow and unresponsive. There was only 4 families during the breakfast service, and 2 servers :( Shower in bathroom water would splash out of the curtain and land on tile floor, very slippery and dangerous. Had to waste a towel every morning as a floor mat. The walls are painted concrete so be careful. Wifi was working for a day or so, afterwards it was spotty connections. Also note we were worried with the BART strike we called ahead to see if shuttle service was offered by hotel: NOPE. It's a good location due to proximity to the UN Plaza BART station, however homeless people is rampant. Actually all of downtown SF it's like 10-15 homeless people per block, just overall sad. They don't panhandle aggressively in front of the hotel, just be cautious at night. The Starbucks connected to the hotel is always packed early morning. Crowds usally die down around 10:30am until lunch.
review.positiveRemarks: The amount of pillows you get
review.negativeRemarks: Keycard issues, waiting staff during breakfast service. Go to Little Griddle instead :)
review.locationRemarks: OK in morning. Be cautious at night. Lot of homeless people in the area. I recommend using the Uber taxi app and service, its amazing to get around SF

review.title: Old and funky, in a good way.
review.reviewText: If you look closely, you can tell that this is a very old hotel, but my room was clean (not just "clean enough", but clean) and the bed was comfortable. The lobby is something to behold, with lots of marble, crystal, and stained glass. Don't go wandering around that neighborhood though, especially after dark.
review.locationRemarks: Sam's Diner, right across the street, is a good place for breakfast.

review.title: Had a great time.
review.reviewText: Everyone was very nice. Staff was very helpful. i was there to participate in the Aids walk.

review.title: Good Downtown Hotel,Access to all of SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel maintenance of appliance
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Warf

review.title: Not a great location for sight seeing.
review.reviewText: Beautiful old hotel and very popular with European travelers who are use to smaller rooms and older hotels. The location on Market street is on the cusp of one of the worst areas in San Fransisco - either drive around back to valet or have cab drop you off at front door.

review.title: How much per night??
review.reviewText: Never mind the neighborhood - no biggie! However over $200 a night for a 10 x 10 room is unacceptable. Very disappointing -so we left.

review.title: 1910 Style and courtesy
review.reviewText:
This the second time I've stayed at Hotel Whitcomb. I'd go back. Pricing was good for the area. The grand old interior are fun to look at. Rooms are not large and antiquated in design but well maintained. No coffee machines or mini fridges here. My work required that I bring equipment in a small trailer. They are nearly impossible to park in SF, ad most lots and garages will no take them. While partinng is $35 for 24 hour with in and out privileges at the Whitecomb (not bad for the area) parking staff were very accommodating.
Coffee shop and restaurant are nice. This stretch of market street has seen better days, so use care walking nearby, but busses and tolly stop are right out front and very convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, cleanliness, helpful, friendly staff, amazing vintage interiors.
review.negativeRemarks: Add some ammendities like coffee maker in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Central locaion is easy top get to and a good launching point for most of SF. Orpheum theatre is across the street. Nearby area has it's rough spots

review.title: Beautiful old Hotel that needs a facelift
review.reviewText: I have never been to a place with such lackluster service...
review.positiveRemarks: It is very charming or was at one time
review.negativeRemarks: The staff including restaurant. They need to take a course in friendly efficient customer service!
review.locationRemarks: Terrible location. a block from skid row

review.title: Hotel rooms very small
review.reviewText: The Hotel rooms are very small and you are charged for parking 35 dollars a night and the worst part was when we where leaving and the attendant brought our car out he crashed into a pole while we watched than said it was nothing and that our car already had dent. I was very disappointed with the way it was handled
review.positiveRemarks: It was on Market street which is close to shopping
review.negativeRemarks: customer service

review.title: Good Price, older hotel.
review.reviewText: This Hotel is pretty central and the staff were really helpful and great to deal with. The hotel is old and a bit tired. The rooms do not really have all the amenities of a modern hotel, i.e. coffee maker. The area is a little gritty, but the price is right and the BART is right outside the main entrance and the streetcar stops very close as well. There is an excellent Vegetarian Restaurant just a block away.
review.negativeRemarks: Old. Location.

review.title: Hotel stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel although outside was a rough neighborhood. We took public transit to and from the door of the hotel so no worries about safety really. I think a security guard outside the door at nights would be a good addition.
review.positiveRemarks: tall ceilings, nice doorma/bell hop, nice rooms
review.negativeRemarks: the bathroom could have been a little nicer. security out front after dark.
review.locationRemarks: we took public transit everywhere. the bart was right there as well which made it easy when getting back to the airport.

review.title: Cheap downtown stay
review.reviewText: Restaurant sucks, place just felt dingy.. Will not stay there again. No particular horrible experiences just overall unsatisfactory.

review.title: decent historical hotel,
review.reviewText: lots of history and a fantastic lobby. the starbucks is conveniently attached. The location is a bit on the sour side and you might as well get used to taking the stairs down.

review.title: Bizarre experience
review.reviewText: We stayed here on June 29th, and walked into a circus atmosphere in the lobby. Lots of people in very strange outfits throughout the building, including people dressed only in their underwear (!!!) walking around the hotel. This place should come with a warning.
review.positiveRemarks: The only thing I enjoyed about the hotel was leaving it
review.negativeRemarks: How about a dress code, this is a hotel, not a locker room

review.title: Okay but overpriced
review.reviewText: The place was safe and clean enough. the halls were dark, the public areas a bit rundown, and the rooms dreary. There were not enough outlets, in order to plug in a fridge, they had to unplug the TV.

review.title: STAY AWAY
review.reviewText: This Hotel was basically a museum; it seems to have the original bed and furniture that it was built with. Also there is no parking room and there is a $50+ charge daily for parking. Will not be returning to this hotel even if I get paid to stay.... Staff members are rude and condescending except the cleaning crew, they seem to be more educated that the people at the front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: Very easy to walk around
review.reviewText: I had a good time in this hotel. The staffs are very helpful and nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to walk to a lot places
review.locationRemarks: If u like coffee, it just next to the hotel. And the union square only few blocks away.

review.title: nice but small
review.reviewText: gorgeous hotel but beware the rooms are really tiny. Barely had enough room for our suitcases. Would also be nice to have coffee makers in the room, but starbucks on the first floor was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms a little larger and more lighting
review.locationRemarks: near the civic center. kind of sketchy area at night. fine by day. close to public transport.

review.title: Over priced hotel for the provided accommodations.
review.reviewText: The hotel was over priced for accommodation, parking should be included, the room itself was okay. The restroom on the other hand was terrible water did not shut off and it had an awful sewer stench. I would not recommend this hotel to a friend or family. On the plus side the staff was excellent!!
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel itself

review.title: Descent
review.reviewText: Staff were pleasant, although difficult to get a hold of in the evening/early morning. Location not ideal as there were a lot of homeless people and beggers nearby, however it was super easy to get around with the bus super close by. Beautiful old architecture, but the bathroom plumbing was really loud and made random noises in the night waking us up. Overall it was a decent place but I likely wouldn't stay again unless there was another wicked deal.
review.negativeRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Dingy area with lots of homeless people (who were harmless).

review.title: Mold in the bath tiles - unacceptable for price.
review.reviewText: The room was historic. You felt like you were living in the earlier 1900's. Large walk-in closest suggested workers lived in the rooms a long time ago. Shared door to next room offered little auditory privacy. And the mold in the bath tiles was unacceptable for high price range. We were expecting a more romantic and charming room.
review.negativeRemarks: cleaner bath.
review.locationRemarks: Dicey part of town ( near the tenderloin district), but a quick walk to museum, theatres, and shopping.

review.title: Centrally located, easy access to BART
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay. Staff was very accommodating and friendly. Rooms were clean, breakfast was very good quality and inexpensive for a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Small fridge in the room.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText: this is a nice historic hotel right in downtown San Francisco, close to shopping and restaurants, and the bus system is available right outside the door, and subway very close too. Our room was comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient to piers by bus or subway. Have parking available in back for hotel customers, and cost $35, .
review.locationRemarks: right across from civic center, close to shopping stores, restaurants.

review.title: Probably OK for a 3 star hotel
review.reviewText: The lobby of this hotel is quite nice. Rooms are small and a bit dated. Beds were comfortable and front desk service was good. Bathrooms could use a renovation. I typically only stay at hotels that are at least 4 stars but decided to try this one (I think it's 3 or 3.5) to save money. If this is a standard 3 star hotel, then I would say the gap is pretty big between 3 and 4 stars. I think I will stick to 4 stars and just pay the extra money and a modern bathroom is important to me.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The man at the front desk was not very friendly, helpful or welcoming. He made me feel like he was doing me a favor, very rude. No one ever answered at the front desk. Left messages, still haven't heard from them. Other than that, the experience was great. Maybe the hotel should look into hiring people who aren't bothered by work?
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk employee.

review.title: Old hotel with a bit of charm and decent location.
review.reviewText: Upon arrival there is not a valet service or check in area. You must pull around the block into an alley for parking. The staff was friendly but did not go out of there way to make it a great experience. Front desk did not have change for a ten dollar bill and sent us into Starbucks instead to ask for change. The lobby area of the hotel is small but has beautiful Tiffany glass. The hallways are musty smelling and the elevators are quite old. Although this is a historic hotel it needs some updating. The rooms and doors are small. Our view looked out to the inside of the rusted building, not pleasing at all. The bathroom fixtures are very generic and worn. The beds were comfortable. The location is decent with lots of available cabs and the cable car line stop is right across the street. Overall, an average experience. The high price tag is surely because of the history of the building, not anything else special.

review.title: Nice historic place.Problems were outside of hotel
review.reviewText:
This is a really cool hotel and very well kept. It is authentic and has very true decor that has been restored and kept up for years. The only downside would be the things that took place outside of the hotel, which is not their fault. The staff was tremendous! The room was clean and when we had a problem with a leaking faucet they replaced it quickly.

I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Close to Pride celebration.
review.reviewText: One desk clerk at check in time - long line - terrible service. Couldn't get ahold of room service, no way to leave message. I know it was a very busy weekend, but they were woefully unprepared. Paid extra for a "premium room" which turned out to be on a higher floor but overlooking the dumpsters.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable room, close the where I wanted to be.
review.negativeRemarks: service service service

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText: Room was way too small for the $$. Beds had a crater in the middle so you slept in a hole.....mattresses need to be replaced for sure!!! AC was super loud.

review.title: Old, small rooms, sketchy area after dark.
review.reviewText: Old hotel. Rooms are small. Bathroom was ridiculously small. Neighborhood is not real safe after dark. I'd pass on this one.

review.title: Tiny rooms in the worst part of town
review.reviewText: This hotel is 2 stars at best. The staff isn't very friendly and the rooms are beyond small. The paint was chipping off the ceiling in our room and the bathroom was straight out if a hostel. I understand that the hotel is in an old historic building, but it just had a dirty feel to it. Beware that Hotel Whitcomb is in the Tenderloin district, which is the worst part of town. Not safe to walk anywhere at night because of all the crackheads and bums.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, front desk personnel, room amenities.

review.title: Nice close to shopping
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Very clean. Close to shopping. Very cool historic hotel with lots of charm.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators are slow.
review.locationRemarks: Next to lots of shopping in downtown SF

review.title: Needs updates
review.reviewText: overall okay, hotel needs updating, room was clean and comfortable, housekeeping didn't replenish all towels that they took, so we were missing many, neighborhood where hotel is has lots of homeless and other undesirables. During day, busy with people going to work, evenings took cab to/from hotel, very close to BART stop, convenient
review.positiveRemarks: historic building with great architectural qualities
review.negativeRemarks: housekeeping attention to detail and updates/maintenance (our toliet was leaking after first day)
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART stop and Civic Center

review.title: Taste of "old San Francisco"
review.reviewText:
Charming and quaint early 20th century style, good location and price. Elevators were a bit slow and rickety, but you can take the stairs if you're not hauling suitcases. If you love modern conveniences this is not the spot for you, but if you enjoy Edwardian charm, you'll appreciate the atmosphere.

You do get WiFi, but I had trouble finding a grounded outlet to plug in my laptop (the bathroom was the only one that worked). The restaurant and room service were closed Sunday night, but there's a Starbuck's in the building and plenty of diners and bars across the street.

Overall I enjoyed my stay and would stay there again.

review.title: Had some doubts
review.reviewText:
We booked the Whitcomb in a hurry within 24 hours.
Then we read the reviews. We thought we may have made a mistake and were ready to burn the bookings and find another hotel.
When we booked in the service was good, no problems.
The room was clean, a bit small with 2 x Queen beds but acceptable for a hotel built in the 1900s.
Wifi connection good.
The whole hotel experience was one to happily remember and recommend.
They may have had some issues in the past which are gradually being fixed.
review.negativeRemarks: The area around the hotel needs a lift with some up market stores and eaters. A bit outside the hotels influence.
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to the union shops, cable cars, trains and buses

review.title: Fading glory
review.reviewText: The Hotel Whitcomb was obviously a grand place back in the day and is conveniently situated. But it is now past its prime and has developed some irritating quirks. The most important of these is the time wasted doing things that should be easy - checking in (25 minutes), waiting for an elevator (5-10 minutes every single time), collecting the car (15 minutes).
review.negativeRemarks: Checking in should be more efficient. And they have to do something about the elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly located between the Mission district and downtown

review.title: Beautiful old hotel
review.reviewText: The beds were extremely comfortable. Walls were thin and bathroom was so small you could barely turn around.

review.title: The hotel used to be a landmark, but No More
review.reviewText: The man behind the desk had a sour look on his face and but not friendly????
review.negativeRemarks: Bus loads with overnight grests were noises and running up and down the halls
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was on 9th.Market and attached Bums and Seedy pople

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
the location of the hotel was great. we checked in late (almost midnight) . the staff was friendly and helpful. the lobby was very pretty . then we arrived at our room right next to the vending machines, ice machine and elevators. BAD location when we called down to change rooms we were told no other king or queen bed rooms were available. i bought ear plugs the next day which helped,. we had breakfast in the restaurant twice it was good, but i would have to think twice before staying here again because of the location of our room.

L Harrison Sonoma County

review.title: Old Market St. hotel near civic center
review.reviewText:
Although the hotel was probably quite grand in it's day with many huge chandeliers, marbled columns and beautifully carved coffer ceilings in the lobby, the place was run down. Check in required a lengthy wait, about 1/2 hour, even though we
arrived shortly after 3 p.m. When we left the hotel for the evening at about 5 p.m., there was a huge crowd waiting to check
in. Our room was quite small, though clean and the carpeting appeared new. The bathroom had no window and no ventilation, but the bed and bedding were comfortable. The elevators were slow and you couldn't tell from the indicator lights whether the car was going up or down. The valet parking around back for $35 worked well and was not over priced for San Francisco. The neighborhood is not great (vacant buildings and construction), but it is within walking distance of Davies Hall and restaurants in the Civic Center area. A plus, we didn't feel unsafe walking back to the hotel at 10 p.m. There is also a BART station right in front of the hotel. In general, we just didn't feel comfortable with the neighborhood or the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable bad and bedding and close to Civic Center.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the chandeliers and hire more staff for checking in and out

review.title: Very old hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very old with extremely small bathroom! All the amenities are old! Service is so-so. Parking is very expensive. We parked our cars in near by garage for $10 instead of $35 charged by the hotel.

review.title: dont stay here
review.reviewText: terrible. when we got there, the manager did not understand how prepaid reservations works, so she wanted to charge us again for the prepaid room ... she gave us a lower rate, so we asked why we were being overcharged ... after 5 phone calls between expedia, myself, and her (the "manager") we found out she was telling us the rate that expedia gets, and she was not supposed to tell us that ... anyway, that was sorted out .. then to save costs, the rooms have no coffee makers, so we had to order one ... they brought us a broken one ... to save costs, the rooms have no do not disturb signs, so we had to order one .. annoying ... the hotel is dirty and old, and there are basically no amenities .. the bar and restaurant had only 2 people inside but we were told it was rented out totally so we had to find another place to eat ... the place is overrun by transients who wander around looking for showers ... gross ... will never stay there again, pay more and stay at a real hotel

review.title: GOOD
review.reviewText:
IT IS VERY NEAR TO METRO STATION.GOOD INTERNET CONNECTIVITY.
WE GET GOOD DETAILS REG CITY AND TICKET BOOKING HELP FROM HOTEL PEOPLE MAINLY M/S MANISHA AND GIFT SHOP STAFF.OUR REGARDS TO THEM.

NEGATIVE: NO COFFEE MAKER,NO LCD TV AND NO FREE SHUTTLE SERVICE TO AIRPORT.

review.title: Haunted House Like Hotel
review.reviewText:
A very historical hotel; a little bit scary with the interior design especially walking on the hallways at night.
Breakfast service and food are very good with great atmosphere
Internet connection is poor and not handy
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast at the 1st floor gorgeous dining room
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connection
review.locationRemarks: Market street is convenient in taking public transportation

review.title: Affordable downtown location.
review.reviewText: It was an affordable, downtown location. Maintenance left something to be desired and the room was very musty smelling but I was lucky the windows opened so could air it out. Was not happy when the linen delivery came at 5 in the morning on a Saturday and was clanging truck doors right below my window. With a little more attention to detail this could be a good downtown property. I was impressed by how many foreign guests were lodged there.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was near some of my downtown/south of market destinations, affordable.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of maintenance. Bad room location.

review.title: Exquisite hotel within homeless encampment
review.reviewText: Hotel is great but neighborhood is unsafe. Sadly, more homelessness than I have ever seen in my life anywhere. So this hotel is fine if you don't want to go anywhere at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Severe homeless problem in the neighborhood.
review.locationRemarks: Noisy construction next door.

review.title: Elegant but tired
review.reviewText:
A very elegant, but tired hotel. Popular with budget minded European tourist who come in with tours by the hundreds. The elevators are extremely slow, as this is a very very large hotel with only four elevators (including the service ones) that cleaning staff use as well.

Our room was clean and spacious, but you could tell that the hey days of the hotel was probably 45-50 years ago. That block of Market Street is probably not the better part of town. Rather seedy, especially after dark.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators, infrastructure
review.locationRemarks: Seedy, lots of homeless within this block of Market St.

review.title: Great Value for the Price
review.reviewText: The historical atmosphere of this hotel is really lovely, although the property is in some need of upgrading in the bathrooms. Since most travelers aren't spending all that much time in a hotel room, this place is an outstanding value. For breakfast the restaurant was great, reasonably priced for San Francisco, and the service was outstanding.
review.locationRemarks: Right in between Union Square and the Civic Center--great for symphony, opera, and theater-goers.

review.title: Could do better.!!
review.reviewText: Expensive to park, we had to move rooms twice due to noise. The elevators are so slow. The hotel does have some nice character, but in need of updating.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms too small
review.locationRemarks: Reasonable location to most tourist spots

review.title: Only in despair!
review.reviewText: Staff at Whitcomb is really very unfriendly. Plus they never tell the truth indeed. I wantedto print something and contacted them in advance. Once there they wanted to charge me 5 dollars and it was only one page! Plus, although the building is nice it its not very well kept and cleanliness was quite bellow my expectations. Don't be misled by the prices: restaurant is just average. In fact, way more expensive than the average in town. Furthermore, the area around the hotel is disgusting to say the least with dozens of homeless asking for money and food. I did not feel quite safe there... So basically, find something else. If you book in advance you can find many better options.

review.title: Very good value in the heart of the city.
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I had a great experience at the Whitcomb in San Francisco. The hotel lobby is amazing and the property is in a very good location in the city. Easy walk to the Union Square area. Or, you can catch the F line shuttle right in front of the hotel ($2 fare takes you down through Union Square, the Financial District, the Embarcadero, to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Not all rooms are equal at the Whitcomb
review.reviewText:
We've stayed at the Whitcomb before and enjoyed a well appointed room on a higher floor with a beautiful view over Market Street. This time the room was a disappointment (for the same price), it was a small inner facing room with a view of ducts and cigarette butts. The washroom and the doors had seen better days and were rickety. The cleaning staff were very friendly but kept leaving the window unlocked, considering that there was no safe in the room, this caused us some concern. The concierge staff do do their best to filter guests from non-guests but we did see street folk wander through the hotel unhindered when the staff were elsewhere... this particular room was consistent with a 2 star tops.
The location cannot be beat with BART and bus stops and probably the most efficient Starbucks we've ever encountered for our morning coffee (no coffeepot in the room) just out the door. You will encounter some of San Francisco's more colourful street folks by the BART station but we have never had an issue. Would recommend the hotel but see if you can request one of their better rooms and a safe.

review.title: Just okay...
review.reviewText: Mildew/old building smell. Love the historic building, but they need to do something about the smell. Not horrible, but not pleasant. We could deal with the small room because it is a beautiful historic hotel, but the restaurant was not very nice in comparison. Parking was an additional $40 per night, but that is the going rate. Nice metro stop right outside because, as many locals told us, this area is not very safe at night. Even during the day, the area from the hotel to city hall was pretty sketchy. It's a shame such a beautiful hotel is in that area. I would still stay there, just use common sense at night in that area.

review.title: Staff and Hotel excellent
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived it was like stepping back into old luxury. Every aspect was perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect for all our needs.

review.title: Not that nice
review.reviewText: Hotel is not in a good part of town staff was not very professional elevators were slow and rooms were loud.
review.locationRemarks: Not a good part of town

review.title: SF Hotel
review.reviewText:
Nice location near the City Hall and the library. Good free WiFi, the bath is Very small and the room need update.
Very expensive parking (45$/day), you can park in Rodeway Inn Downtown on Mission St (1 block) for 15$/day.
review.negativeRemarks: The small bath and the parking cost.

review.title: Not good for the price you pay.
review.reviewText: Our bathroom had mold & the sink was clogged. I asked for a roll a way bed and it was like sleeping on metal. The lobby was impressive but thàts it.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Busy downtown

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very pleasant and elegant. This is a terrific location for access to transit and the ability to get around. It is close to many arts venues. Some people might be concerned about the large homeless population in the area. We enjoyed our stay and I would stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Terrific and convenient location

review.title: Would not stay here again!
review.reviewText: Did not like this hotel at all! Room was small, bathroom was tiny, and sheets were dirty and not changed during our trip. Neighborhood was okay but I prefer to stay closer to 4th and mission or financial district. Plus this hotel was too expensive for what we got.

review.title: Old Hotel in San Francisco - close to Fed. Court
review.reviewText: I booked a room at this hotel because I wanted something within walking distance of the Ninth Circuit. It was within two blocks of the courthouse. As I entered the lobby, I could see that the hotel had at one time been very elegant, with dark, fancy woodwork, stained glass and crystal chandeliers. There was a waiting line to check in because one of the receptionists was being monopolized by a group. My room was old but comfortable. The heating unit worked well to remove the chill of a mid-May stay. It was in the fifties outside. The elevators were slooow, and the stairs were hidden and hard to negotiate. The employees were friendly but unobtrusive, just as I like them. The hotel was also a stone's throw from the BART and Metro station, which was nice when it came time to catch a plane home. I thought it interesting that there was a Starbucks just off the entrance, and another Starbucks a few blocks down the street. They're popping up like weeds. I walked north several blocks to catch the cable car, only to discover that it was south of the hotel. Dinner at Fisherman's Wharf was my San Francisco favorite - clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl and a glass of Anchor Steam. It would have been wonderful except that I was alone and had to prepare for court the next day. As I froze waiting in line for the cable car back to Market Street, I felt sorry for the banjo player playing for tips by the station near Ghiraderlli Square. His fingers must have been raw.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to what I needed - courthouse, BART & cable cars. Big, comfortable bed with lots of pillows. Good room heater. TV remote that worked.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators were extremely slow, and they all seemed to want to go to the basement.
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars, Market Street, public transportation of all kinds, lots of wharf activities a short ride from the hotel.

review.title: Offputting situation.
review.reviewText:
The size of bathroom hugely disappointing - more like a cupboard. Actually there was a useful walk-in cupboard but that really could have done with a light.

The street population off-putting. It was certainly fortunate that we did not want to go out in the evening. Staff friendly and helpful which made it sad that we would not go back to the Whitcomb. Surroundings of public areas impressive.

review.title: great location!
review.reviewText: we had one night in SF and made the most of it! great location!
review.locationRemarks: close to bart and public transportation. easy access to sf giants game

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: For the price I wasn't overly impressed with the hotel in general. Ok but wouldn't recommend.

review.title: A good efficient hotel.
review.reviewText:
I realise official check in time is 3pm. I arrived at 1pm and the front desk agent obviously wanted me to return at 3pm and store my luggage with the bell desk. He didn't check to see of there were any rooms cleaned and ready to go.
With such a large hotel and noticing that rooms were available at the minite in hotel discount sites for very little I was surprised that he didn't even check. The very abrupt nature of this first check in experience was not very welcoming.
But overall I had a good stay. BART right in front of hotel and many streetcars and buses on Market Street so easy to get around. Some homeless and sad souls around the hotel but that was pretty much all over downtown SF :-(
(Starbucks in lobby very busy but a little dirty.
review.positiveRemarks: Price on secret hotels was very good. The bed comfortable and sheets very good quality.
review.negativeRemarks: Very very slow elevators. If you need to be somewhere make sure you leave about 5-10 minutes for the elevator! Bathroom only had shower.
review.locationRemarks: Good location but a lot of homeless and beggars around.

review.title: Old hotel surrounded my homeless!
review.reviewText: More bums please? Lol this hotel has a great centrally located location but it's too bad the area is filthy and devoured with homeless. The hotel it self was in great need for upgrading and renovation.
review.positiveRemarks: The beautiful architecture inside the building
review.negativeRemarks: Service and cleanliness

review.title: Disapointed
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is a very beautiful hotel, that is located just a block away from the Civic center in San Francisco. Our queen size room was on the smaller side with loud air conditioners outside the window. The parking fee was seriously over priced running at 35$ per a night, plus an extra 5$ fee for using the parking service. The actual location is fairly close to many main attractions, but there were several shady individuals that hung out around the area. There were no other locations that I would have felt safe leaving my car near, or around this location. I was expecting a little more from this hotel and was rather disappointed.
review.positiveRemarks: it was a interesting historic site
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is overpriced at 35$ a night, with no alternative parking options in the area, and you get charged extra taxes for using the parking service
review.locationRemarks: The location is close by transit to many attractions, but it is located in a shady area that I did not feel comfortable walking around at night.

review.title: Decent Stay
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to a friend if they are budget conscience and based on the location (only a few blocks away from a great mall). The decor was outdated and there was a light fixture in the closet hanging from exposed wires. The hotel had a bit of a gloomy feel to it, the hallway reminded me of the movie, The Shinning. The room was a decent size and clean. The staff at the front desk were polite but could have been friendlier. The bellhop was very nice though. The rate was very reasonable.

review.title: one night stay
review.reviewText:
We arrived at 7:25 pm to check in. A line of more than 10 people were waiting for registration, and there were only two staff helping people. We almost missed our dinner after 45 min. to wait. The room we were given is too small. The fan in the bathroom is so noisy and there is no space for placing our cleaning stuff.

The public transit passes in front of the hotel. But the location is not good...those people looming around the hotel made me scared. The hotel is old fashion, and we were waiting for the elevator for 10 min. We were glad to book only one night to stay. We will not come back for our next visit.

review.title: Mixed feelings
review.reviewText: This hotel has some beautiful features, such as the high ceilings, ornate common areas and the stained glass. Our room was an inner courtyard meaning it had a view of concrete and other guest windows. That being said, we didn't spend a lot of time there. The only concern we had is the location: it is perfect for public transit along Market and the BART entrance is right there BUT the area is constantly swarmed with folks who are likely homeless or mentally ill, and maybe people get used to walking by so many downtrodden but it was rather disturbing especially at 8am walking to a meeting and dealing with catcalls and being shouted at. This is a strange and sad example of the lack of social services in the United States - no way to ignore the realities. Of course, if you are used to this type of scene, the hotel is great.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful, unique and classic common areas.
review.negativeRemarks: Crowds of homeless folks outside the door.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText:
If you are into historical buildings, then this is a great place to stay.
If not, then keep these things in mind:
- The hotel is old, it has that old musty smell to it.
- There are lots of homeless people around the hotel that ask for money.
- The rooms are not upgraded at all, our bathroom sink sprayed out water to us when we turned in on. However, they do have a good sized TV.
- The WiFi is free, but the connection boots you out often.

Other that that, the hotel is on Market Street, and has lots of means of transportation that go downtown.

Reception was okay...not rude but not helpful.

review.title: Comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcombe is in a good location and you can easily reach local attractions, the rooms are comfortable and only lacking a coffee machine or kettle in the room to make perfect. Although the hotel is a little dated it still retains an old world charm.
review.positiveRemarks: Big comfy beds and fluffy duvets
review.negativeRemarks: no coffee machine or kettle in the room
review.locationRemarks: Near to theatre district and Union Square

review.title: Nice hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great its close to all major areas, like pier 33 (alcatraz) pier 39, finical district, downtown, cable car and public transportation. the hotel overall is good, the parking is expensive. its recommended hotel

review.title: Stay Away!
review.reviewText:
Room: Noisy! I could hear my neighbors through the connecting door. Dark with no view & construction across the street. Phone dead and staff unreceptive to fixing it. Bathroom in serious need of updating. 1 outlet for charging phone/computer. Room smelled of old smoke.

Hotel: Think "The Shining" but shabbier.

Area: Methcity! I was harassed by meth heads and homeless coming and going from the hotel (even at 9am!). I ended up taking cabs because I was afraid to walk down the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Complete renovation & clean up the neighborhood.
review.locationRemarks: Bart station easily accessible.

review.title: Sketchy/Scary Neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is nice. However, I like to walk to different locations in cities, and it just wasn't a very safe place to walk. There were open drug deals and open drug use on the streets. The stench of urine (and often marijuana) permeated the area. It's a great value IF you plan to use public transportation to and from everything (even if it's just a few blocks away to the shopping district in one area or City Hall/symphony/etc. the other direction). The hotel is right off of the F line, which takes you downtown and to Fisherman's Wharf. Convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to F line. Starbucks on first floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Just don't plan on walking anywhere.
review.locationRemarks: See above: Dirty, drug use/deals, smelly streets surrounding the hotel. However, take the F line up or down Market St. and you'll find great things!

review.title: never again
review.reviewText: The biggest complaint was the elevators...lots of time waiting for them to show and then they stopped at every floor, parking price was not as advertised 28 on site 35 at hotel per day... superior room .... guess that meant better view of construction next door ...that started right at 7AM . very disappointed in this
