review.negativeRemarks: amentities
review.locationRemarks: real bad part of town

review.title: No Bed Bugs seen!
review.reviewText:
Hotel was sufficient...I was a little nervous once I heard they hav had a bed bug problem.
I did not see any on my stay.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location with Bart/muni/bus nearby. Easy access to all attractions. Clean. friendly staff. Great base to explore city.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Excelent

review.title: Nice end to our Chicago to San Francisco drive
review.reviewText: Made to feel welcome. Car parking ableit expensive 35/ day was useful as you don't need a car. Next time I might get rid of it a few days earlier and save money car parking and hire fee, Then you can walk to most places or get the F line tram. Great breakfast place Sams diner opposite. Also Burger king better for first coffee in the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Closeness and atmosphere. Great change from the motel experience and affordable.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking and difficult to get Expedia discount vouchers . I sent them to the managers personal email adress in the end.
review.locationRemarks: Good city centre

review.title: Good hotel - not great neighborhood
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with a terrific concierge service. Note that neighborhood isn't great. I didn't find that to be a problem, but would be careful after dark.
review.negativeRemarks: Neighborhood
review.locationRemarks: Quite a few down and out street people

review.title: An elderly but quite comfortable hotel, nice price
review.reviewText: An old, once great hotel, now a bit tattered but still quite comfortable. Steps from BART and Muni (Civic Center). Reasonably priced.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText: The hotel is full of character however much of it needs maintenance. There are many homeless people living on the streets outside the hotel. This is fine during the day however feels unsafe at night. Our floor was so noisey with parties going on until 4am.
review.positiveRemarks: Character and proximity to the train and other transport options
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Located 15 minutes walk from Union square

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: Most of the staff is very friendly. The hotel is clean and has a cool kitschy factor. The only thing that didn't work for us was that there was no bottled water in the entire hotel on a Saturday night. My husband went to every floor to every vending machine and everything was out of water. When he asked the door guy where he could find water, he was quite rude.
review.positiveRemarks: The diner across the street (Sam's) was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: NO bottled water anywhere!
review.locationRemarks: A little sketchy of a neighborhood.

review.title: Becker
review.reviewText: Quaint and Historic and the restaurant was wonderful. Great service. Friendly staff.

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel
review.reviewText: The room was not clean. There were gum wrappers on the floor and the guest chair was dusty and grimy. The bed was lumpy. There was no hotel directory in the room. It was hard to find where the valet parking was, Had to drive around the block three times, then finally called the front desk. It was not marked. Linens were beautiful and opulent. The carpet could have used a more thorough vacuuming, there was visable dust in the corners and near the edges. Door to hallway was not soundproofed. Could hear people walking and talking in the hallway. I was two or three doors down from the ice machine, heard people getting ice all night. Restaurant downstairs was excellent. Best clam chowder in the city. Very friendly and accommodating staff.
review.positiveRemarks: The restaurant, the beautiful lobby and Starbucks in lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: The room did not seem clean to me. I was afraid to go outside the hotel by myself.
review.locationRemarks: Difficult to access valet parking. Central location in the city. Neighborhood a bit scary for woman traveling alone.

review.title: Not horrible, but not great.
review.reviewText: There was no coffee in the room, and the heat/air conditioning did not work, which made it really uncomfortable. In addition, the parking rate for hotel guests was HIGHER than for non-guests on weekdays.

review.title: Historic grandeur.
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel with an impressive history a little tired around the edges !
review.negativeRemarks: No tea or coffee making facilities
review.locationRemarks: Great location to access all the,sights

review.title: Affordable.. Quality!
review.reviewText: Lovely vintage hotel.The location was great, and our room was very comfortable and quiet. All staff that we spoke to were perfectly helpful and friendly. The only small mark against would be the water pressure of the shower.. but we would still return in future!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Location of the Hotel is in Prime Location of City of San Francisco , CA. Its accessible to all available city transport system. The hotel room was well kept. The hotel was unusually unpleasant in supplying the toiletries.

review.title: Average hotel but good location.
review.reviewText: Internet did not work despite complaining. Not as good as it looks in pictures but affordable

review.title: Unsafe area
review.reviewText:
One of the beds was broken, when the maintenance person came to fix it he found socks and other things fom previous guests. He removed everything right away.
Very dangerous area, we saw a guy being robbed. There are plenty of alcoholics and drug addicts by the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very unsafe

review.title: Comfortable a little dim
review.reviewText: My only real complaint was I was in a room on a shaft and the window was shuttered so you could not tell if it was night or day.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttered window
review.locationRemarks: Center of city, cable cars and a short trip/medium walk to the Embarcadero

review.title: great hotel iğf chosen the superior room option
review.reviewText: It was far better than some of the reviews I'd read before. However, I deliberately chose a superior room which costed little more, but returned back very solid-- big and comfortable room and most probably a far better bed. I suggest to pick up the "superior room" option.
review.negativeRemarks: Taxi service, I think it isno' wise asking help from the the staff, on saturday midday without traffic, it fared 55 bucks to the airport!

review.title: wouldn't stay again
review.reviewText: The lobby is exquisite. I wish the rooms were half as nice. Wallpaper peeling off wall, cheap peel and stick tiles on bathroom floor, no small refrigerator in room, no room service, no continental bkfst included, had a window view of adjacent hotel wall, and the fan/light combo in the bathroom was so loud you couldn't hear the TV if someone was in the bathroom with door open. $215 (includes taxes) plus $38 overnight parking seemed steep for what we got.

review.title: Great hotel, noisy outside construction project
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff are wonderful....it is. The massive construction project next door that made our stay incredibly noisy with an adverse impact on my ability to sleep. Just check the status of that project before booking, otherwise, it's a gorgeous hotel in a great central location, very clean with a great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Outside noise
review.locationRemarks: Good central and accessible location

review.title: close to transportation
review.reviewText: lots of homeless people, small room, needs to be updated, staff very friendly and informative about sites
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to all types of transportation
review.negativeRemarks: Small room!!!

review.title: good place for travel
review.reviewText: The place is pretty good. There are a lot of food around.
review.negativeRemarks: no microwave

review.title: Excellent hotel at a very reasonable cost
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is an historic hotel on Market St. in the heart of San Francisco. We booked the Superior Queen rooms on the 7th floor. Very comfotable bed, flat screen TV, aircon and coffee maker from housekeeping if you wish. There is a Starbucks on the ground floor and a good restaurant. Concierge service excellent and a BART station right outside the front door. Remember this is an old hotel so bedroom and bathroom are small but nevertheless adequate. Room rate was very reasonable particularly when compared to other hotels around Union Square area. Would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable queen size bed, great restaurant, Starbucks on ground floor, BART station outside front door.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom somewhat dated but still perfectly functional.
review.locationRemarks: Market Street location near library, Civic Hall, etc. Not one of the more fancy San Francisco areas, but nevertheless safe.

review.title: Not so good for Family's
review.reviewText:
I was so excited to be taking our teen age daughter and our exchange student to a beautiful historical hotel. But when we arrived, 9pm at night, the streets were empty with the exception of a handful of street people. Canvasing the front area of the hotel. There was no door man, we had to walk into the hotel to find/ask for help. The reservation desk is located far away from the entrance, at night, you feel pretty vulnerable.
Having traveled all day, we were hungry and the restraunt was closed at 9pm of a Friday. The only place with in walking distance was a cafa across the street, which again hosted several colorful people at the door looking for freebe's. One gentleman desided to entertain us by smashing his half naked chest, face and LIPS us against the glass. It was not pleasant.
The large hallways are poorly lite, giving the feeling of walking into a rather seedy place. Something from a scary movie.
Our room was so tiny, that you could not get the luggage in the room, at the same time as the people without adjuting doors and persons. The bathroom was so small, you could sit on the toilet, wash your hands in the sink and your feet in the shower all at the same time.
I can see where they have tried to bring this old place up to today's standards of a "Historic Beauty". But it will serve best as a hostal for traveling students. Those over 21.....
We were scheduled to stay for three days, we checked out the very next morning.
review.negativeRemarks: THe gloominess of the enterior halls, and rooms. It just felt so heavy and sad.
review.locationRemarks: Make sure you have an escort

review.title: Hotel in the hood
review.reviewText: In the ghetto.... Pics online are deceiving as the rooms are old fashioned, water doesn't get very hot and poor lighting in the bathroom...
review.negativeRemarks: In the hood
review.locationRemarks: Ghetto but close to things

review.title: A Must Stay
review.reviewText: Wonderful location, beautiful historic building, very comfortable room. Truly made our stay more pleasant, and we can't wait to return.

review.title: Watch where you step
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is not the issue, but the neighborhood has much to be desired. Although it is only steps from the civic center and a few blocks from Union Square, this section of Market Street is quite undesirable. One must be on his guard if he is thinking of venturing out after dark. The location will make many people uncomfortable.

review.title: Fun Weekend
review.reviewText:
The rooms are comfortable, but are small. Bed was clean and I slept real well.

Had Breakfast in the place downstairs, it was really good. I love the history of the Hotel, and some of the sites of the City are nearby. Its an easy walk to union Square. It has some seedy looking things along the way, but what big sity doesn't.

Staff was great, helpful with directions and lobby is very impressive with the marble.

The building was once the state courthouse in the early 1900's.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms, especially the shower
review.locationRemarks: The walk to the sites are easy, no hills. Just keep an eye on each other.

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText:
Ice machine on the 7th floor broken.
No movies channels
The parking was too expensive 35 per night!
review.negativeRemarks: Ice machine broken

review.title: Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a fun historic hotel. The linens were new and crisp. The room was well kept. The WiFi was horrid, probably as good as it was when the hotel was built in 1916.
review.negativeRemarks: The WiFi
review.locationRemarks: Easy to catch the F tram.

review.title: Had character, but too many negatives to overlook.
review.reviewText: Read previous reviews and still decided to book hotel because of it's package price and it's Victorian decor seemed nice. It did have a strange musky smell that we could not quite make out (as the reviews stated) but if you turn on the fan before you leave it will be alot better when you return. Lots of homeless, drug addicts and general strange people around the 3 block circumerence of hotel but they really did not bother us, just a little uncomfortable. Positive- Beds were comfortable and there was a Starbucks connecting to hotel. Noise from room next door to us was bad no noise insulation as well as outside construction noise but hey it's an old hotel. I would probably not recommend it as well as stay here myself again. Too many other choices to try!
review.negativeRemarks: The strange smell in the room and noise from neighboring room and outside construction noise as well.
review.locationRemarks: Pretty easy to get to all sites from location.

review.title: Great old hotel
review.reviewText:
Everything was awesome, but don't sight where is the parking lot.
I love whole hotel( hallways, reception, lobby room).
The bed are so comfortable and l love it too many pillows

review.title: Farmer's Market
review.reviewText: The neighborhood was kind of sketchy. There were a lot of activities within walking distance including a farmers market Wednesday Friday Saturday
review.negativeRemarks: The water pressure in the shower and the cheap sheets.
review.locationRemarks: Not bad for the Tenderloin District

review.title: San Francisco detour
review.reviewText: Hotel experience was good. This is a very old hotel and feels like a historical place. The room in which I stayed needs a little touch up as paint was wearing off from some locations. Overall this hotel is a worth of what they are charging.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel location and easy acccess to public transport.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel room needs a little touch up.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in the heart of the city. It is one of the best places to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Central Location near Opera and Civic Center
review.reviewText:
Great central location - right near the Civic Center and all public transportation.

A grand hotel from another era that is showing its age. If they were to invest some money, it could be brought back to become a real showcase.

Front Desk and Bell staff are very pleasant, and try very hard to please.

I was disappointed to see that they have discontinued Room Service.

Full-service "Starbucks" location connected to lobby is a plus.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Central Location and Helpful Staff. Nicely furnished room.
review.negativeRemarks: No Room Service. Plumbing and Heating/Air Conditioning needs to be modernized.
review.locationRemarks:
Market Street location close to Civic Center, Opera House and all Public Transportion.

Like everywhere in San Francisco, large homeless population.

review.title: Great deal
review.reviewText: Great deal, disappointing staff, but overall a great experience

review.title: Good stay, ordinary area around hotel.
review.reviewText:
Way too many homeless in the area made an otherwise good trip unpleasant. Bathroom was too small. Beds were comfy.

Recommend munch cafe across the road for a good breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom size, homeless around area. Tenderloin area.
review.locationRemarks: Unsafe in Tenderloin. Near BART train station and F tram to piers.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location, right close to the theater. The staff was great and took care of all of our needs.

review.title: worth your money
review.reviewText: We like the location, the reasonable price, and the architecture. The hotel is right on the BART line. You get off Civic Center station and you are right in front of the hotel. We also like the the Museum of Asian Art, which is one short block away. The hotel amenities need updating, however. There is even no night light in the room. The carpet is old and stained, and the room is a little small. Interestingly, there is a big closet. If the hotel room layout is improved, it could have been a decently-sized room. On the whole, it's worth your money if you choose to stay there.

review.title: Old fashion is an under statement
review.reviewText:
The hotel must have been splendid back in the day but has not been updated in a very long time.
Very old fashion rooms, decor needs to be updated.
Bathroom sink was smaller than the airplane ones, no counter space . Very simple.
Heater didn t work and window wasn t closing properly.
Room was very noisy .
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was tiny
review.locationRemarks: Location is horrific. Drug addicts and homeless right outside

review.title: Great look at the past
review.reviewText: We had a good stay close to union station. There was no coffee in the room and we had to pay $20.00 per day for a fridge

review.title: Superb, however...
review.reviewText:
I've been to San Francisco way over 25 times and always like to check out different hotels and b&b's. I've seen this hotel many times and I recieved a great deal on a room.

Check in was fantastic and smooth,
My room is very nice, best night sleep I've had in a long time from a hotel or b&b.

I only have two issues with my room (239)

One: the water pressure was rather on the weak side.
Two: my major issue was the "free wifi" ...the Id for the wifi is wandering and it lives up to that name. The signal would wander in and out of the room. It's virtually impossible to get a stable signal (forget a strong or weak signal) .... If you do stay here and want to use their wifi I found the perfect sweetspot.

Cross the street and stand outside Burger King; facing the hotel... I have one stable signal!! Worked like a charm everytime.

Would I stay here again... YES, of course!

Would I recommend any one else to stay: YES!! This is a very nice hotel to stay in regardless of these minor issues which I'm hoping they'll fix in time of my next booking in 6 weeks time!!
review.negativeRemarks: Poor wifi
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of SF, amazing. Public transport right outside of hotel. Unfortunately it's where the homeless also live. But I always feel safe!!

review.title: San Francisco on Market Street
review.reviewText: It was a great place to stay.its location was perfect and near all kinds of public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Construction noise nearby very early in the morning
review.locationRemarks: Great proximity to public transportation

review.title: A great hotel for my bad experiences
review.reviewText: It was horrible, the first night at 4 a.m. my wife and I had to change rooms because of the noise in the room next door. The loby was 4 stars, but the rooms were only 2 stars. The rooms didn't have microwaves, refrigerator, and coffe maker, the hotel also didn't include a gym, pool, and NO PARKING, we had to pay for the parking, the maintance was poor, the toilet wasn't working properly.
review.negativeRemarks: not being able to sleep the first night due to noise
review.locationRemarks: HORRIBLE no free parking for the customer

review.title: Great hotel if going to Ballet or Symphony !
review.reviewText: Even though I read a lot of negative reviews on the Hotel Whitcomb, our stay here was great. The staff were friendly, the king bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. The eggs benedict we had for breakfast was delicious at the Market St. Grill and the Starbuck's next door was convenient for coffee/snacks. The room had a large flat screen TV and even though the furniture was old, it was all antique and had a lot of charm. My wife and I went to the ballet on Sunday afternoon and walked over from the hotel in just 10 minutes! Even though we checked out at noon, we could leave the car in the hotel valet parking lot until 6 pm. We would definitely stay here again to see a ballet or go to the Symphony(within walking distance). Sure, there are seedy characters that hang out outside and a lot of homeless folks. This is the city, folks. This hotel is great for under $100. and the the parking is $ 35. And the lobby is perhaps one of the most ornate that you could find anywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: The character, the charm, the service, the price, the parking.
review.negativeRemarks: No refrigerator in room, no room service.
review.locationRemarks: Market St. location is not the best location in San Francisco, but it is near the best cultural events.

review.title: This place is OK if you don't need to sleep.
review.reviewText: There are really only a couple of things that I need when I stay at a hotel in this country: a good night's sleep; a safe place to stay. This place seemed safe enough but my sleep was interrupted more than once by noise from the outside. At one point I thought someone was playing soccer with the trash bins outside. Maybe if you have a room on Market Street, you might be ok.
review.negativeRemarks: Little sound proofing around the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of several attractions.

review.title: Don't expect too much and you'll be happy.
review.reviewText:
It is a 3.5 star hotel and that's what you get; SF is expensive, so don't expect anything more. It looks nice when you walk in, but the rooms are simply 'old' and small. But then again, it is a 3.5 star hotel, and it certainly isn't worth more than that.

The restaurant is terrible; breakfast was aweful and the weither was rather rude; maybe he had had a bad awakening that morning. The Starbucks next door is much better.
review.negativeRemarks: the room - narrow, tight, small, hard to even walk around
review.locationRemarks: location is convenient, on Market street; and taxis are always ready.

review.title: Orpheum
review.reviewText: If you are going to a show at the Orpheum, it's perfect!

review.title: Historic hotel doesn't do well
review.reviewText: Well, I only took this hotel becasue I was looking for somewhere less than a mile from the conference center and in reasonable cost. It's old, it's not up to modern standards, but it's historic, so, I guess it's all a manner of preference

review.title: Not a modern hotel
review.reviewText: The water flow in the shower was weak and the bathroom fan, which comes on when the light is turned on, was very noisy (probably dysfunctional). There was a lack of electrical outlets making it difficult to charge electronic devices. Free wi-fi and presence of a Starbucks and adequate restaurant were positives. Overnight parking is expensive but there are in and out privileges.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wi-fi and presence of a Starbucks and adequate restaurant were positives.
review.negativeRemarks: The water flow in the shower was weak and the bathroom fan, which comes on when the light is turned on, was very noisy. Lack of electrical outlets.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to Government Center. A bit of a walk to other activities (restaurants, shopping.)

review.title: Pleasant surprise!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Old but good taste. My room was very cofortable. Bathroom as clea. As at home. Towels bright white! And food of the restaurant was also good. I'll be back for sure!
review.negativeRemarks: No valet parkingl
review.locationRemarks: Exelent. Right in the main strategic avenue of San Francisco

review.title: Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is a little old and dated. Parking is on your own for $35. Little steep.
review.negativeRemarks: Couldn't say the hotel was not clean and neat but it had an old worn feeling to it.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Civic Center but more on the lower end of Market Street

review.title: Great orpheum access; otherwise not worth it
review.reviewText: I asked twice for a non smoking room and was assured the hotel was non smoking. However, the smell of smoke in our room was overwhelming. We actually left the bathroom fan on continuously trying to clear it some, and purposefully tried to avoid being in the bathroom where it was strongest. The hotel was very crowded so we just dealt with it since we stayed only one night. I recommend this hotel ONLY of you are going to the theater. The Orpheum is literally steps away. For that, it's great. Otherwise, not worth it.
review.positiveRemarks: Starbucks in the lobby; close to Orpheum
review.negativeRemarks: Loud; smell of smoke

review.title: Faded swank
review.reviewText:
The Whitcomb shows what happens to fine hotels when they don't get regular, substantial investment. The lobby has been truly spectacular in its day, now it's a bit tatty round the edges, and often smells suspiciously of bleach.

It's marooned at the entrance to the subway at the Civic Center, at the stretch of Market Street that is ground zero for the homeless panhandler community. They aren't allowed past the door, of course, but somehow their sad, slightly aggressive homelessness seeps in anyway.

You can tell the hotel is making an effort. The fittings are mostly past their prime, but rooms are clean, the linen quite good. Lots of towels, little soaps etc - they tick all the AAA boxes. In my room there was a flat screen TV so new that it wasn't plugged in - not least because it had a three pin plug and the wall, not so much. A quick visit from maintenance and an adapter meant vision on.

I wish the front desk staff were better - it's not that they're rude. It's just that you always feel they would be doing something more interesting if only they could get away.

So, for the (secret) price, it's really not bad, as long as you don't get freaked out by the neighborhood.
review.locationRemarks: Gnarly

review.title: [CHIRP!]
review.reviewText:
O.K. I will start by saying that when I got to the hotel and entered my room I noticed a smell. I had to attend a meeting and so I decided not to ask for a new room. By the time I got back and got ready for bed I noticed the smell was still there. Well it's only one night, in the morning I'll be gone. The time was now 12:45 am and I was almost asleep. It was at this point that the battery in my smoke detector decided to retire. [CHIRP!]. And so for the next five hours I had to endure the [CHIRP!] and the smell.

As they say "stuff happens", so don't go by this review. I'm sure you will have better luck than I did.

review.title: classic
review.reviewText: Hotel was super cool but the parking fee is such a scam! $35 plus tax per night?! Nuts if u ask me
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee. $35?! U gotta be kidding me!
review.locationRemarks: Lotta lotta lotta homeless people screaming outside all through the night

review.title: Fairly decent room for a good price
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a pretty good (not ideal, but not bad) location on the edge of the Tenderloin district. The price is very good and there are no real problems. My room was clean and the linens and towels were fresh. The towels were, however, noticably worn. Housekeeping was quite good. The staff at the front desk were kind of oddly unfriendly, but not hostile. There is an excellent diner across the street called "Sam's". Although the 7th floor where I stayed is said to be haunted, I did not notice anything supernatural. The hotel has free WiFi. I would stay in the hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Slow elevators

review.title: SFtrip
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and the staff was amazing. The hotel is true to the historical period of which it was built which adds to the ambiance. The only small drawback was the restaurant was not open as often as I would like. When I did dine there it was delicious.

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText: Very old hotel with unprofessional front desk staff. Low water pressure in bathroom and dirty bed sheets, with blood stain on pillows and blankets. If you stay in this hotel, you should expect loud noises from hallway and other rooms as some guests come back drunk from clubs at 3am and dont care other people may be at sleep. It is a cheap hotel, but trust me you wish you paid more money and never entered this place.
review.locationRemarks: Surrounded by homeless and drunk people. It is scary to walk in the street in this location!

review.title: Difficult time registering in SanFran
review.reviewText: Parking was a nightmare - too small of spaces & no help when they posted sign that valet was present. One computer at the desk wouldn't accept any of my credit cards - when another machine was tried it was fine. No coffee pot in the room. On the other hand, the consierge (sp?) at the desk (Angel) was a doll!!!

review.title: Night out in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful, historic hotel with amazing architecture and beautiful wood and metal accents everywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: The classic architecture and wood paneling and fixtures throughout.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom and plumbing was a bit dated.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located in the heart of the Tenderloin district in San Francisco. We walked to the Orpheum theater and around downtown.

review.title: My stay at historic Whitcomb
review.reviewText: The hotel room was conveniently located on market street right off the bart which was easy and inexpensive access from hotel and opposite a tram trolley and bus line. The hotels lobby was beautiful 19thc high ceiling, chandeliers and wooden decor. The rooms were clean beautifully furnished but bathrooms do require an update. Even though i was taken aback by the number of homeless people and beggars around the hotel i must admit that they were the politest and nicest. All the staff at the hotel were impeccable but i must admit that the three people i talked to at concierge were the most knowledgable i have met anywhere in the world. Thank you for a wonderful stay. KB Sydney Australia

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel is somewaht rundown. We were on the second floor which was quite noisy, especially when the streetcars started at 6 a.m. There was also a streetlight directly outside our window and the curtains did not block it.
review.negativeRemarks: Loud street noises and bright street lights with poor curtains
review.locationRemarks: The hotel didn't seem to be close to anything

review.title: Great location, but thats about it.
review.reviewText: The toilet bowl was broken. Window handles were missing, meaning you could not shut close the window. Bathroom probably has not been vacuumed for longest time as evidenced by hair everywhere. But the staff was super nice and responsive. The fixed the window and the toilet quickly and I was happy to keep the room for the 2nd night.

review.title: Nice hotel, slightly rough part of town
review.reviewText: It's a nice hotel, but in a slightly rough part of town.

review.title: my place!
review.reviewText: This is the 5th time I've stayed here - need I say more!

review.title: Uncomfortable stay
review.reviewText: the beds were very uncomfortable. windows would not lock. one employee had to change rooms 3 times mostly because of the beds.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds
review.locationRemarks: New York

review.title: A beautiful centrally located piece of history
review.reviewText: This is a very beautiful old hotel. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The room was adequate in size for the age of the hotel. It has an interesting history. It is in a very convenient location. A little more attention to routine wear and tear would be the only suggestion.
review.positiveRemarks: It was in a convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: Temperature a little hard to control (too warm)
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for the attractions in the Market/Van Ness neighborhood

review.title: Great for pot smokers...not great value otherwise
review.reviewText: The hotel is close the the BART train, however is in a rough part of town. My room was very small, had inadequate heating and the whole hotel smelt of marijuana.
review.negativeRemarks: Smoke smell of marijuana

review.title: Classy old school charm in shabby neighborhood
review.reviewText: Very classy old style look but shabby neighborhoods. Car parking is costly but, hey, it's SF!
review.positiveRemarks: The look, free wifi, proximity to city center
review.negativeRemarks: neighborhood

review.title: A makeover and a deepcleaning
review.reviewText:
It was sad to see the condition of our room. It needs a makeover. The staff was good. I hope this beautiful architecture gets what she deserves...a makeover and a deep cleaning.
Conceirge was wonderful!!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: not clean and dark
review.locationRemarks: Next to subway. Scary folks outside. If you leave during daylight and perhaps use taxi, it could be good. Staff works hard to make up for it but this.

review.title: Historic services! do not book!!
review.reviewText: This Hotel feeds on the fact the it is historic! that's a lame excuse to not bring up the standards, at best i have seen better services in a 2 star hotel!

review.title: Good historiaca; hotel
review.reviewText:
If you are looking for a historical hotel, this is a good one. It's clean and good overall but the cost of the parking is excessive ($35 / night), although most of San Francisco hotels have that issue.
Be aware of the area after hours, lots of liquor stores and - sadly- lots of homeless hang out around there as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking - excessive
review.locationRemarks: Convenient but shady after hours

review.title: Center of the sities,but in the street many poore
review.reviewText: Near hotel many crazy people, hotel very old and dirty !

review.title: Date Night at the Orpheum Theater
review.reviewText: My husband and i where pleased that the hotel was across the street from the Orpheum Theater, where we sall the Lion King Play. Their was alot of homeless people outside the hotel and we did not feel safe to walk outside after 10:00.... Overal experience was good. No complaints....
review.negativeRemarks: Stains on carpet
review.locationRemarks: ok

review.title: Historic, well located hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in middle of city. Pretty walkable in any direction to city attractions. Friendly staff. Hotel hallways an building in general a little dated but it is a historic gem. Right off the civic center BART station so super easy access to and from SFO Airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Dated hallway carpets...
review.locationRemarks: Excellent!

review.title: The Nutcracker
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience. We were in San Francisco the see the ballet, The Nutcracker for the first time. Everything went so well the Opera house was walking distance from the hotel which made the experience even greater.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was just beautiful and very cozy the staff was helpful and pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: I found the restoom in our room very small
review.locationRemarks: The location was just perfect. Next to shopping, restrauants, trolley, and opera houses

review.title: Historic hotel near the Orpheum
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby has character, it has a beautiful, historic look. The bed however is long overdue from having the mattress replaced.
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurant was good, hotel has character
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel bed was poor
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect if you are going ot the Orpheum Theater

review.title: Comfortable, but Water's an Issue
review.reviewText:
A comfortable place with friendly staff, albeit in a not-so-great part of town. Our only complaint, however, has to do with water:

1) The water was not near hot enough, and took a very long time to warm up at all.
2) The water pressure was far too low, causing the shower stream to be little more than a trickle.

review.title: Location, location, location.
review.reviewText: Location is excellent. Muni and Bart right out the front. Easy to access many locations

review.title: Not the best part of town
review.reviewText:
The Whitcomb is a very neat old building, but it's on a shady block, and not in the best of condition. Our room was freezing cold, the heater barely worked (had to leave it running all day to warm room up!) and the curtains didn't shut. With all the noise from the Orpheum theatre across the street, we could barely sleep one night.

Still, it was well located, with respect to trains/bus/etc, and easily walkable to downtown. If they'd add a few more touches to the rooms, this might be a great deal of a hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel for a great price from Expedia
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. I would love to have a small fridge and coffee machine though. I really enjoyed Expedia special price, marble decorations in the lobby and Starbucks near the front door.

review.title: Disappointed with Expedia.
review.reviewText: Very disappointed with this Expedia experience. Historic hotel with very dirty rooms. Next time I will book directly with a hotel where I know the quality will be guaranteed.
review.positiveRemarks: Starbucks is attached to the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was dirty.
review.locationRemarks: Convienent

review.title: Pleasant Hotel Stay
review.reviewText: The only negative about my stay was that the bathroom fixtures were a little loud. The staff were friendly and helpful and I was able to easily walk to my conference at the Moscone Center.
review.positiveRemarks: It had an old-fashioned feel to it.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Location was convenient for walking to many places in San Francisco.

review.title: Ok in a pinch
review.reviewText: It was not as bad as I had feared from reading other reviews, but yes, if you don't *need* to be in this neighborhood, you don't want to be. The saving grace is the Starbucks in the lobby, and (if you are on east coast time) the fact that it opens at 5 a.m. That's the only time the hotel wireless is any good, too.

review.title: Cheap is Cheap
review.reviewText: It would be nice to enter a room where the light switch actually turned on a light, and have an alarm clock that worked
review.negativeRemarks: Amenities scarce
review.locationRemarks: Great access to BART

review.title: theater location
review.reviewText: the room was OK but the location in the Tenderloin was not the best experience. Although, we had no problems on Market Street. The bathroom had NO waste basket. Starbucks was handy though. I thought the $35.00 garage parking fee was high.
review.positiveRemarks: located across from the Orpheum Theater (Lion King)
review.negativeRemarks: tenderloin neighborhood
review.locationRemarks: seedy

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText:
I'll overlook the fact that this hotel is in a slightly scary part of town. The staff was friendly and accomodating, and the price was decent, relative to other nearby hotels. Very convenient for BART (20 ft from the right stairway to the hotel's front door).

City noises were loud at night. The wifi was slow and very weak (1 bar at best). The bathroom was awkward. I was cold at night (thin blanket and no in-room thermostat).
review.locationRemarks: I would not want to take my family on a walk around the neighborhood.

review.title: Great hotel for experiencing the city
review.reviewText: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and I've had a good experience everytime. Rooms are kept clean and staff was always friendly. The location of this hotel is perfect for seeing many areas of the City.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was excellent. The BART station was at the end of the block and the F train(trolley) picked you up right in front of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls are thin. You can hear people talking out in the hallways.
review.locationRemarks: Located on Market Street with easy access to transportation.

review.title: Comfortable historic hotel.
review.reviewText:
From check-in to dearture everyone was friendly and helpful
For an older hotel the room was very spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator was a little slow.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to theater & shopping.

review.title: Very nice for the price.
review.reviewText: This is a fine hotel if you want cleanliness, quiet and simplicity. The room I had was large and quiet, and the bed was very comfortable. I don't care that the TV was not plasma. It was fine all the same. The furniture in the room was a bit minimal. This includes the bathroom which was large and yet did not have a very big area for me to spread the various toilet items. The bathroom could have used a bit more hangers for towels. The fan was very noisy and had to be on if the lights were on in the bathroom. Also, in these days of electronics and all the plugs you need for that stuff, the number of outlets was minimal and hard to reach, even for just one computer. This stated, these are all fairly minor quibbles that bring the rating to a 3.5 or 4. The price was making it all right in the end. A good hotel for a moderate price and in a great location if you had a business downtown or wanted proximity to the Barth and metro.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable bed and very quiet room at least for me.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom with noisy fan and small area to spread towels and personal items.
review.locationRemarks: Being used to this area of town in San Francisco I felt safe in spite of the strange people that might be in the area.

review.title: not good hotel
review.reviewText: loud music, facility is old. The environment is not that good. room carpet is very old.

review.title: Odd, old hotel
review.reviewText: Odd, old hotel with small bathrooms and smoky hallways. Not near the main tourist attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Smoky hallways, weird stairways arrangements, small bathrooms.

review.title: My view
review.reviewText: It is central but just beside a dodgy area. It was really good value for a San Fran central hotel. It was fine but not amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: It is a nice historic building
review.negativeRemarks: It was a little chilly in my room
review.locationRemarks: Central. In a good area but right beside a not so good one.

review.title: good priced hotel for business trip

review.positiveRemarks: easy to reach from airport, close enough to Union Square
