review.title: Historic But In Need of a Makeover
review.reviewText: Historic it is but dated and ill kept is more like it. Bed was uncomfortable. Bathroom barely acceptable not to mention the 10 minute wait for lukewarm water. Staff were barely competent. Suffice it to say I cannot recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Great rates and lots of character
review.reviewText:
Great location with tremendous potential but needs the following areas upgraded:

1. Quality and cleanliness of the bathrooms
2. Coffee pot and cup were never cleaned
3. Bath mats were often missing
4. Cracks in the bathroom tiles and mold around the tub boundary
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of attention to the detail of the housekeeping staff

review.title: Cheap stay & good locale; cruddy customer service
review.reviewText: Stayed here after reserving through Expedia without knowing the name of the hotel. Got the room for very cheap and was excited when I learned of the hotel's historical quality and location. When we arrived their parking lot was full so we had to park a few blocks away in overflow parking and then shuttle back. It was raining so the management said they would put us on their VIP list to receive a free breakfast in the morning; when we went to check out in the morning, they said they saw no note of the promise to comp us breakfast, and said we could wait up to 15 minutes to see a manager. So we passed. Not happy with that at all. Expected to get a less extravagant room given the discount; however, we were literally stuck in a nearly-outside room in the corner of the hotel next to the drafty stairwell. Very basic accommodations, which was fine given we were only staying one night. Still, it was stinky and cold and while the hotel lobby looks promising, I will likely not be returning.
review.negativeRemarks: Smelly, cold room; rude experience at checkout.

review.title: this hotel sucks
review.reviewText: The toilet in room 415 was leaking badly. the smell of the hotel is bad. the television wasnt working properly. It was blurry not real clear. also i couldnt change chanels without it going off. finally i realized i could change the channels directly on the tv. i guess the remote was broken. i will never go back to this hotel

review.title: "Elegant, historical hotel"
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice. Bathroom not as roomy as newer hotels. There was a very bad area of town several blocks from the hotel that we had to walk through at night to get from the cable car drop to the hotel. If we had known, we would have not walked down that section of Market Street. The area on Market right in front of the hotel was not bad.
review.positiveRemarks: Old charm. The concierge was very informative & helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: Bad area of town between the hotel and the visitors' center on Market Street.

review.title: A wonderful weekend in the City.
review.reviewText: The staff were very helpful in answering various questions and responding to our needs. The service in the restaurant was outstanding and the atmosphere while dining there was charming. The location was very convenient in relation to getting to our planned events without a car. We especially appreciated the decor of this older hotel. The size and quality of our room was very satisfactory. Overall, we recommend this hotel without reservations and plan to stay at the Whitcomb again.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located.

review.title: Horrible experience.
review.reviewText:
Faded glory from a distant past.

Microscopic room. Aircondition did not function. Extremely noisy and poor bathroom fan.
Water not hot enough.

The worst was the noise from neighbour rooms. A crying baby and shouting parents -
louds so high it felt like we shared the same room. Disturbing noise from other rooms toilets. Slamming doors.

No minibar. Hotel bar closed early.

In total a horrible experience and a night wothout sleep. Shy this hotell.
review.negativeRemarks: Disturbance from neighbour rooms
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: don't go
review.reviewText: The layout in the bathroom was awkward and creepy. It seemed like the closet could have been made smaller to give the room more space. Could hear everything that was happening outside the room both inside the hotel and out.

review.title: Time to Update!
review.reviewText: A step back in time-old world charm but needs updating. Rooms were clean but a bit drab and dreary. Bed was comfortable but modernization is sorely needed to brighten up the rooms and hallways. More like a 3 star hotel. Location is OK but not in best area of Market street and parking is expensive- $50.00 with taxes. All-in-all acceptable but would not return.
review.negativeRemarks: dreary and drab
review.locationRemarks: Not best spot on Market street

review.title: Not for you if you are a light-sleeper!
review.reviewText:
We were only there for 1 night and the 2 most frustrating parts were the terribly thin walls and horrible free internet which was terribly slow!
We waited in line way too long to watch one employee just ignore us as she worked on her computer. She never even looked up and told us she'd be right with us. The line behind us increased and this employee never helped anyone. We just waited for the other one while he finished with the person in front of us. Then no one offered us the code for the free internet, so we had to come back to the front desk and wait in line again to ask for it ourselves once we realized we needed it.
We were 2 rooms down from the ice machine and it kept me awake all night. They really need a door in front of this room to try to keep the noise in. There were also many obnoxious guests walking the halls from 11:30pm-1:30am and we could hear their entire conversations off an on about every 10 minutes....I realize this is not the hotel's fault, but the walls were SUPER THIN! I've never had this happen at any other hotel.
Lastly, there were no usable drapes in front of the window. They were only there for decoration, so we couldn't keep the morning light out!
review.negativeRemarks: Slow internet, paper thin walls, no usable drapes.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to BART!"

review.title: Hobo's Galore!
review.reviewText:
I liked the solid magohony woodwork in the main lobby and corridors. Old charm.

Unfortunately the room needed some basic fixing up - (eg. the bathroom door did not close). I found the room with two double beds to be very small and the view of the back parking lot was certainly dismal. The room had no coffee or microwave so I had to wait for Starbucks to open up at 7 am. Since I am an early riser this was very disturbing - hey I need my morning coffee.

I hazarred an early morning walk outside on Market Street but sure was not impressed with the hobo's sleeping on the sidewalks. This is reeally a downcast area and Ido not recommend that anyone but the brave and adventurous stay in this so called Historic Hotel of America. It's way overpriced for what services are available.

review.title: Not enjoyable.
review.reviewText: Bed is uncomfortable, hotel is old and dirty. Staff are pleasant, but definitely not customer service oriented. The gym room isn't a gym, is a relic from a war. There is no room service, and the hotel decided to do service on the elevator at 4am. There is no "sound proofing" in the rooms, so you hear everything from the hallway.
review.positiveRemarks: I don't have anything nice to say
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy, dirty, unenjoyable
review.locationRemarks: In a bad part of town

review.title: UNSAFE HOTEL
review.reviewText: woke up in the middle of the night as the couple from next door were fighting/screaming/swearing. had to call security twice to quiet them down. disappointed to learn the next morning manager on shift didn't know nor had a record from security of what had happened as we wanted to be transferred into a different room. i also lost my wrist watch in the room. i will not recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: having starbucks beside the hotel and ORPHEUM Theatre is closeby if you are into theatres.
review.locationRemarks: it is not a safe location

review.title: Old Hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms are small and bathrooms way out of date. We could hear a couple arguing next door so walls are not very sound proof. Don't bother with a superior room because it doesn't have a view unless you are in the very front. Parking has to be done at the hotel in this ridicules city because meter parking is $4 an hr. and cheaper parking is too far away. You will shell out an additional almost $30 per day for your car with tax. While it wasn't awful, we would not stay here again.

review.title: Good Value - Okay stay
review.reviewText: Good value, especially for the area. However we had a room on the south corner closest to the parking lots and garbage cans so we were not-so-pleasantly wakened by car alarms and early morning trash pick-ups. I feel this is in part due to the SINGLE-PANE window we had in our room, it didn't do much to keep noise out.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise is a problem
review.locationRemarks: Central to all city transportation. Great spot to grab a bus, cable car, BART to the airport etc.

review.title: Old, not well maintained, terrible,terrible staff!
review.reviewText:
Staff was really unprofessional, hotel smelled bad and was not super clean. You could probably get a better hotel at the same rate if you are willing to go outside this area and drive to downtown.
I will NOT recommend this hotel.

review.title: Don't Recommend
review.reviewText: The hotel was packed full the night I was there. That could be why I received the room in the fire escape stairway. Either way it was awful and scary!

review.title: Business guy looking for a bargain
review.reviewText:
Older hotel with nice lobby. Hasn't been maintained at all. Room design was poor. Bathroom was shabby. No light fixture in closet. Not enough power outlets; evidenced by only clock on top of TV versus by the bed. TV was lame.
Location is borderline sketchy part of Market but OK considering the real value price.
Lobby bar was good and the Starbucks attached to lobby worked out nicely.

Just a little too shabby for most business travellers. In my effort to be very frugal I got what I paid for but I left wanting a little more.
review.negativeRemarks: room maintenance, past out guy in stairwell caused concern
review.locationRemarks: borderline sketchy, close to Union Square and BART

review.title: "A very old Hotel"
review.reviewText: The staff are very nice and provide great service. However, the hotel is very old and it wasn't very comfortable to stay in. the name say's it all, " a historic american hotel" translates into a very old hotel. Looks nice from the outside, aswell as the main lobby. The rooms are not satisfying at all.
review.negativeRemarks: The room itself.
review.locationRemarks: Good location. Not far from tourist attractions.

review.title: Useful Hotel for a quick Opera Visit
review.reviewText:
I use this hotel because it is immediately adjacent to BART Civic Center and within 4-7 blocks of the War Memorial Opera House and Max's at the Opera restaurant. I come to the city from Seattle for the opera exclusively. When I'm unable to schedule a Sunday matinee at the opera which allows to attend the opera and return home in one day, I use the Hotel Whitcomb. I would ONLY recommend it to friends who had the similar desire for BART accessibility & proximity to either the opera or symphony. It IS NOT a destination hotel nor is it in an area for comfortable tourist activities.
My room facing Market Street was more pleasant than those I have had in back halls BUT the overhead fan in the bathroom was so loud and obnoxious that I did not turn on the bathroom light but used what came from the bedroom. Such a noise is NOT ACCEPTABLE. I wrote the same on the Comment Card left in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to BART and the Opera/Symphony complex
review.negativeRemarks: Age and clientele, mostly young Asian students or budget conscious Europeans
review.locationRemarks: Acceptable only because of why I am in San Francisco

review.title: Stay away
review.reviewText:
The hotel is old, and not in a good way. Very poor room sound insulation means you hear everyone in the hallway and the downtown traffic. The hotel is in a sketchy neighborhood (even though Market is busy.)

There was a mouse in the hallway and blood on the shower curtain.

review.title: Overpriced, overrated, with serious shortcomings.
review.reviewText:
Fancy public areas, but cramped rooms in disrepair and far too high a price.

The bedrooms are cramped to the point that there wasn't room to climb out of bed next to the wall, I had to crawl to the foot of the bed to avoid waking my wife. My feet also kept accidentally kicking the air conditioner, which, by the way, was so loud it easily drowned out any traffic, honking or sirens from the street (even the 2012 Giants world series "celebration" riots).

The bathroom had a industrial style toilet that sometimes took 30s to flush, and sometimes took nearly 5min (literally) for no apparent reason. There was no towel hook for a hand towel next to the sink. The towel hook on the door had half broken off. The shower head only came up to my chin, so I had to do the limbo to wash my hair.

Half of the dresser was unusably broken, and the desk chair had a large prominently visible rip in the upholstery. It was only an aesthetic problem, but it was part of the long list of things they didn't seem to care about fixing.

The valet was impossible to find, I looped the block 5 times before discovering the unmarked alley I was supposed to use.

But worst of all, the neighborhood was just terrifying. It's overrun with junkies and homeless in dire need of mental care. A few times I felt I was about to be literally assaulted by people I wasn't even sure were aware of my presence.
review.negativeRemarks: Cramped, uncomfortable, broken,
review.locationRemarks: *Very* sketchy, sometimes scary, neighborhood. Also: really confusing traffic patterns & signage (mostly regarding bus/taxi lanes).

review.title: Full of Charm
review.reviewText:
We booked here for two nights on a secret saver deal and we were somewhat worried as we had read some mixed reviews about this hotel, however we were very pleased. The room was very clean and although it might have been smaller than an average modern American hotel room, compared to an historic hotel in Europe it was vast with room for a small desk and a couple of easy chairs.
After visiting and looking back at what others said I can only think that other reviewers were dissapointed that they hadn't got a modern chain hotel which it certainly isn't; instead it's a classic hotel full of character. Indeed many people pay a premium for this type of hotel in a European city. I agree that it's not in the nicest of areas and a bit off the tourist route but the hotel was there long before the homeless 'moved in' to this neighbourhood and I felt safe in the hotel and we walked everywhere quite comfortably although as the bus and tram stop right outside there's no need to. One complaint I do have is that you can hear some noise from the corridor and there seemed to be a group of young people having a party in one room while we were there! I would also like to add that the concierge staff were extremely helpful in explaining transport and airport shuttle options.

review.title: Suggestions, not Condemnation! Nice Hotel.
review.reviewText: Bed very comfortable, staff helpful but not over friendly. Breakfast very good, but slow to open area to accommodate surge of guests at peak breakfast time. Many guests waited far to long to be seated. Valet parking seemed completely unorganized and the wait for car return was too long. The location is not the best in the city, but easy to find and easy to depart from. Overall the hotel could use renovating, but it is Historical. The rates are high for the accommodations, but mild for San Francisco. I will return to the Hotel Whitcomb.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Very near the Tenderloin, not the best in the city.

review.title: Beautiful hotel and craftsmanship.....
review.reviewText: It worked for what we needed it for, however the bed was pretty hard and uncomfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful hotel, craftsmanship, friendly staff, excellent restaurant, reasonably priced.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was very firm and uncomfortable and it smelled like pot all through the halls.
review.locationRemarks: I think that the location was very optimal. Puts you right in the middle of town.

review.title: Overpriced and Poorly Staffed
review.reviewText: We reserved an upgraded room on the 5th floor and were swapped out for a 7th floor room. The bathroom had less than 18 inches of clearance between the toilet and the sink. It was OUTRAGEOUSLY overpriced for a 3 star (maximum) hotel. The concierge stand was completely understaffed with only two people; it took 15 minutes to drop off and pick up luggage from their courtesy storage. The reception and departure experience (both access and attitude) was more suitable to the subway than to a hotel. If your looking for the San Francisco experience, steer away from this overpriced, poorly staffed, and unattractive "travel hotel".
review.locationRemarks: Lots of street people and druggies - not the "curious" ones but the "real deal" ones, especially after 10 PM.

review.title: Good historic hotel in the city
review.reviewText: It was a nice, historic hotel to stay in while we were in San Francisco. I was a little disappointed with accommodations in the room like the cable wasn't superb, no coffee maker, and our heater was not working properly. However, the staff was very nice and gave you great insight on sightseeing around the area. Be careful though because you are near the Tenderloin district. There are quite a few people around there that are a little less fortunate, but as long as you say no once, they will leave you alone.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite thing is there was a Starbucks attached to the lobby. Also, the restaurant there in the hotel had excellent food.
review.negativeRemarks: There wasn't a coffee maker in your room, or a little fridge. I guess I'm used to both of those in most hotels I stay at.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect for the person who plans to tour San Francisco. The public transportation is very close, but be cautious of all the homeless.

review.title: "Unpleasant experience"
review.reviewText: I expected the hotel to be in a better location, but it was located in a very rough area. The historical aspect was welcoming,but the receptionist was not friendly. The rooms needed some upcoming especially the tiles in the bathroom; loose tiles and others that needed regrouting. The noise level from outdoors could not let us sleep well. But the final dissappointment was when I left my luggage with the counsier before I left to the airport, they ended up louding up my luggage and sending it with a large group to another hotel. Luckily the bus boy knew the taxi driver and was able to contact him so he could return and bring back my luggage. We were lucky and appreciate the bus boys effort to get it back, but prefer not to stay there again!
review.negativeRemarks: loosing my luggage and receptionist
review.locationRemarks: rough area

review.title: For the price not worth it
review.reviewText: The are no local decent restaurants or bars close to the hotel. The hotel should have a lunch and bar open to provode people snacks and drinks. Need something more than a Starbucks in the lobby. Restaurant and bar never open on times stated. The elevator service was terrible, forced to take stairs because you had to wait more than 10 minutes to go to lobby. The staff was using the elevators for everything which did not help
review.negativeRemarks: limited services
review.locationRemarks: located near SF sites but in a very bad part of the city

review.title: It felt like we were staying on the Titanic.
review.reviewText: Ornate ceilings, classic 1900's materials, lots of rich wood. Small doors and bathrooms.
review.positiveRemarks: The classic architecture, materials, and feel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking - $35 a night.
review.locationRemarks: Located next to the Civic Center is nice but bussle of Mission street can be overwhelming.

review.title: Not a great place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is in the tenderloin of San Francisco. Not a safe and comfortable area to walk around. Would not recommend hotel to others. Bell hop said it was quite safe but would disagree for anyone wanting to walk the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Safety
review.locationRemarks: Surrounded by homeless

review.title: economical but not well maintained
review.reviewText: decent location,mattresses old and you sunk to the middle

review.title: Bad stay
review.reviewText: This is a very old hotel and should not be rated higher than a 2 1/2 star property.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms and odors throughout the property.
review.locationRemarks: Ok, not the greatest.

review.title: Great for a couple on a short break
review.reviewText: Great old Hotel with a wonderful history. Superb location for Union Square, BART & F Line trolley buses. Straight onto Market Street a main thoroughfare. Some have commented on the area it is in. We didn't have a problem with this. Sadly most of San Francisco has a lot of "Street People"
review.negativeRemarks: We had a small problem in the Bar & restaurant as they seemd to want cash payment from me all the time despite the hotel having my card details
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to all transport links & just a couple of blocks from Union Square

review.title: old
review.reviewText: old style, over soft bed, high ceiling, tiny bathroom, unsafe environment, free wifi but not fast, dark inside. it is ok to stay, but I don't like it.
review.negativeRemarks: unsafe around
review.locationRemarks: civic center

review.title: Good location, bad condition
review.reviewText: noisy, dirty. All stuff are older than my grandfather.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: good. very close to civic center station.

review.title: Great for the price.
review.reviewText: There was a "girlie" magazine under the bed not happy. Thought the valet was slow. The bathrooms need to be updated.

review.title: Edwardian Charmer
review.reviewText:
This is a historic hotel - if you're looking for large, shiny, modern rooms, this is not your place. But if you like quaint, cozy rooms with a lot of character and Edwardian charm, Hotel Whitcomb is it.

Beautiful lobby, friendly and helpful staff. Thoroughly enjoyable stay.

review.title: Great, classic hotel...lousy neighborhood
review.reviewText:
Stayed at this particular hotel because of its proximity to The Bill Graham Civic where I had a concert to attend. Classic hotel but unfortunately it is in such a terrible area of town that there is nothing within walking distance such as restaurants. Plus, the homeless have become so aggressive and dangerous that it is not a good idea to be out on this end of Market St. at almost any time of day or night. The City seems to not ever address this problem.

There is a lobby bar and restaurant but is open only a few short hours so once one returns from an evening on the town there nowhere to hang out unlike some of the other hotels over at Union Square.

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: Room was small and dated. There was no coffee in the room. Very noisy banging outside each nite at 3-4am. Tub/shower drained slowly.

review.title: Maree and Philip
review.reviewText: The hotel is a beautiful historic hotel. But it needs to upgrade their TV to LCD models, have tea/coffee making facilities in room. Staff are friendly and helpful. Had a relaxing 5 nights stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable beds, good wardrobe space and excellent service
review.negativeRemarks: Old TV
review.locationRemarks: Area had a number of homeless people around it which was a bit frightening at night.

review.title: YUK!
review.reviewText:
It smelt like pee! I wouldn't take a bath in the bathtub if my life depended upon it.
Very dissapointing.
review.negativeRemarks: the room

review.title: DON'T STAY HERE
review.reviewText:
Stayed here over the weekend for one night. I should have known things were going to go bad when we should up after 3PM and our room wasn't cleaned yet. I told the person checking me in that I had to be somewhere by 3:30PM, and somehow magically then there was a room ready. We got on the elevator (tiny, cramped, and slow) and when we got off the elevator to our floor all of the housekeeping staff was just hanging out, sitting on the floor. So my room wasn't ready because the staff didn't feel like working? Super off putting. We finally got to our room and the bed was horrible. Lumpy, hard, not good.

Thankfully we were then able to leave the hotel (which took a while with the extremely slow elevator). When we returned that evening I wanted to heat up my dinner, and called the front desk to see if I could use their microwave since our room didn't have one. I was told there was not a single microwave in the entire hotel, so I had to eat my dinner cold.

When it was time to go to bed we found that the curtains didn't actually close on our windows, so we had to sleep with the lights shining in from other buildings. When I tried to turn on the AC, it made this horrible turning noise over and over again and didn't actually cool the room down at all so I ended up shutting it off. Overall, a horrible experience. I would never stay here again.

review.title: Lost a bit of it's former glory
review.reviewText: Used to be grand but looking a bit shabby round the edges. Room was good, bathroom small. Good, central location. Free decent wifi,
review.negativeRemarks: Needs repainting

review.title: Sketchy Neighborhood is Not for Me (or You!)
review.reviewText:
As a world traveller and having some expectations for a hotel...

1. Area is super sketchy, and either way you try and get back to the hotel from Union Square you're walking through areas which are not good for travellers. Know there are lots of homeless in San Francisco, but I'm pretty sure majority live on Market Street where the hotel is located. Beware!! No bellhop, or security at front of building, and no card activating elevators so really anyone can enter the hotel and jump in the elevator with you.

2. Room is super small (I called it closet size) and not very clean. Was on the 6th floor with extremely dusty drapes (might not have been cleaned since the earthquake in 1906. Hair of all sorts in the bathroom when I arrived (not mine), wallpaper peeling in areas, possible mold in the bathroom, and an older tv..

3. Halllway is a little creepy with being dark and having big (or should I say HUGE) mirrors at the ends!
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness/size/old hotel with little modernization besides the wallpaper in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Extremely dark at night, homeless everywhere - so NOT San Francisco... and believe there is most likely urine on the bottom of my shoes..

review.title: Not real happy
review.reviewText:
Shower assembly was missing parts.
When they changed towels they missed wash towels.
A little painting was needed in the room.
Area around the hotel would not be suitable for families especially children.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall condition, beds to soft
review.locationRemarks: Out side the hotel not suitable for kids.

review.title: Bring a mouse trap
review.reviewText:
In general the staff was friendly. The lobby gives a good impression. My room was on the third floor which looked like Hotel Transilvania. The mattress was hard and very uncomfortable and so were the pillows. There was a MOUSE in my room and the only offer I got was to switch rooms but I had to wait due to the fact they were sold out.

My friends room was totally different- from design to comfort. The bed and pillows were decent After the mouse incident I slept in her room. I would not come back to this hotel ever again.

When I booked the room I selected "Superior Two Double - _On Superior Floor. I got jipped!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Larry the Doorman!! He wears a permanent and genuine smile and is very pleasant!

review.title: creates feelings of nostalgia
review.reviewText: Parking is a challenge and confusing your first time there.
review.negativeRemarks: Unloading and loading luggage
review.locationRemarks: Convenient and central

review.title: Historic handy hotel.
review.reviewText:
Its a little rough round the edges but it's a charming hotel. We would stay there again. It's very handily placed for the muni and Bart.
Other reviews have mentioned the amount of homeless people in the area, yes there are homeless folk around but it is one of the biggest cities in the states so you kind of expect it.

review.title: not good for family, ok for others.
review.reviewText:
more 'dump' than 'nicely restored', they probably have an hourly rate option. works well for tour buses where you move from bus to room, then bus again without seeing any of the surrounding area (it's essentially tenderloin with many of the late night yelling folks around)
the yelling wouldn't matter except the windows are poor.
not for kids,
for other travellers, probably ok because of location, but really the rooms are seriously one star caliber. poor beds, bath and sinks, no outlets, crummy tv and no lighting.
review.userLocation: Portland International Airport (PDX), NE Airport Way, Portland, OR 97218, USA

review.title: An OK stay!
review.reviewText:
Relatively clean if you don't look too hard for dirt! Comfortable and reasonably priced. Don't rely on the internet - it drops out frequently. Would definitely benefit from new towels. The Valet parking is over-priced as $35 per night. Has a starbucks right downstairs which was handy.
Overall, would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Being harassed by many homeless people the minute you step out the front door
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union square, but you have to walk through 'Homeless row' to get there.

review.title: Historic
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and my room was very comfortable. Love the feel of being in a historical place. However, the desk staff and concerge/bell captain were not terrible nice. I called with a question and the desk put the call on hold and never got back. The bell captain was getting conceirge questions when I was there and was completely unfriendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Historical building with a glorious lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Desk staff.
review.locationRemarks: Worked well, but it was hard to tell where it really was from the on line information on Expedia.

review.title: Nice hotel but inconvenient location for tourists
review.reviewText: This hotel is a beautiful historic hotel in the civic center district. The exterior was nice, though the neighborhood was not great. The interior lobby and common areas were gorgeous. Of others in the area, and for the price we paid, it was great. The room was clean, but the beds were doubles, not queens, and so two in a bed was a little too cozy. The bathroom was what really could have used some upkeep -- the toilet ran, the faucet on the sink was wobbly and loose, and the shower pressure was pretty poor. The handheld shower head was on a device that was broken, and it would sink down to waist level rather than remaining at a normal height for a shower. All in all, I would stay here again if traveling on a budget. However, seeing more of the options and the sites of interest, I think I would opt for a newer hotel in the wharf area if money were not a consideration.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful, classic looking common areas and lovely exterior.
review.negativeRemarks: Location was not particularly close to any sites of interest for us. Not a great neighborhood
review.locationRemarks: Civic center -- on the F-line but not close to anything 'touristy'. Lots of unsavory seeming people milling around in the general area

review.title: Nice, historic hotel but very bad neighborhood
review.reviewText: Very bad location. Many homeless people and drug addicts around the hotel

review.title: An old hotel, but located in a good position
review.reviewText: Old furniture and a light smell in the room. too expensive the parking rate. An old hotel which need a rfreshmente

review.title: HORRIBLE Parking
review.reviewText:
It's an old hotel and in need of renovation. Great location for the event we attended. Lot's of things in walking distance.
TERRIBLE parking!!

review.title: Just awful!
review.reviewText:
The bed was comfortable, but that was about it. This hotel was awful! The shower was unbelievably dirty. There was a rodent in my room. We received a coffee maker that didn't work and tried, unsuccessfully, for two days to get another one.

Just awful!

review.title: NIce
review.reviewText:
The bellboy at the front door let us get all our bags out of the car before telling us the valet was around the corner. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The bed was very soft. Room was clean. Restaraunt was tasty but pricy.
Take advantage of the public transportation, we didn't and spent the evening making 3 rights to go left.

review.title: SF Experience
review.reviewText:
Nice older hotel but rooms a bit small, like the fact it was on Market Street and close for transport
Staff good and friendly and Market Grill was good
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room
review.locationRemarks: Nice old hotel with original features

review.title: It must have been a noble zone in the past...
review.reviewText: Terrible neighborhood! It is a beautiful place, at least it must have been a noble part of the city, but unfortunately nowadays it has become a dreadful neighborhood, with lots of weird people on the streets and some criminality. It is not safe to walk around at night, although there are beautiful buildings around, most of them closed or damaged, but anyway. It is very sad to see such a beautiful hotel, such a nice building, in a place like this!
review.negativeRemarks: location
review.locationRemarks: Unsafe and dirty

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel veryold 100 years loketed in downtown sf so there is a lot of homeless
review.negativeRemarks: Parking 40$

review.title: Older hotel in shady part of town
review.reviewText: A historic hotel. Small rooms. In a smelly part of town -- all the streets smell like urine. Old TV that made an annoying buzzing sound. WiFi worked great.

review.title: whitcomb
review.reviewText: common areas nice but rooms need an upgrade - very old

review.title: Just so
review.reviewText:
Went for a conference at the Moscone conf center.
The condition of the hotel room was marginally adequate, nothing more, especially given the price range. Old small tube TV with poor picture.
Bathroom fairly run down with cracked mirror and grime in the corners.
The hotel is in a fairly run down part of Market street- have to walk through a gauntlet of homeless people to get there. A lot of them sleeping in doorways nearby.
The BART station is right outside the door of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Scraping the bottom of the barrel here, but suppose it is close to the BART station
review.negativeRemarks: Condition of the room (especially at this price range), ancient TV
review.locationRemarks: Not a nice location, about a 20 minutes brisk walk to the Moscone center. A lot of homeless in the area- made for an interesting walk in the morning

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was really beautiful and the hotel staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was a bit soft and lumpy but I still slept well.
review.locationRemarks: Not the best area to walk around alone at night, but not too bad.

review.title: Faded glory in a sketchy location
review.reviewText: The lobby was dark and crowded; the room was also dark. The entire hotel could use to have decades of paint stripped off and one new, unchipped coat applied. The granite in the shower was nice, but the grout was stained. The pedestal sink was small with no counter space. And downtown San Francisco is smelly, noisy, and full of pan handlers.

review.title: Frisco Homeless
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb was a nice historic hotel, however, not in a desirable location with lots of homeless people hanging around that location. We felt uncomfortable going out at night.
review.locationRemarks: The location is within walking distance of Powell Street but you have to walk past a lot of homeless people which is offputting.

review.title: Good price for having a great location.
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. We only stayed for one night but I go to the city all the time and stay at a lot of hotels. The location is good. It was beautiful and but the rooms were a little small because it was a historical hotel. We didn't mind at all though. The staff was friendly too!

review.title: Good Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: This hotel was ok and security a night was important considering the area of the city it was in. The homeless people are a bit of putting though. Rooms where always cleaned and the staff where ok overall. Dining facilities good.
review.positiveRemarks: Having a clean and comfortable room
review.negativeRemarks: Area
review.locationRemarks: Not Great

review.title: Terrible location, but relatively clean/comfortabl
review.reviewText:
Terrible location. Nothing within safe walking distance. Near Civic Center and heavy homeless population. People sleeping all over street out front and in Subway restaurant across the street.

Bar closed early so we asked for a nearby bar. Nothing. We were advised by the staff to take a cab elsewhere.

AC didn't work properly, so room was very hot and stuffy. When it did work, it was disturbingly loud and kept us awake, but room was too hot even with window open to leave AC off.

Room 872. Seemed clean overall. Comfortable bed.

Parking was $40, which is totally unneccesary-- there is a safe lot with 24 hr surveilance not too far away for 17 with online reservation or 20 at the gate, but wouldn't walk to/from after dark.
review.negativeRemarks: Location and homeless people. Expensive parking.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing in safe walking distance.

review.title: Good hotel - will stay there again.
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. The staff was helpful and accommodating. The location was superb - close to transport facilities and good shops! The room was okay - clean and comfortable, although no fridge. The fridge wasn't necessary as it was very cold outside. The only negatives were that my room was at the back of the hotel, with no view. The people collecting the hotel's trash also had the irritating habit of doing that at 6 in the morning and making a lot of noise at the dumpster at the back of the hotel and waking everyone in the process. All in all I would definitely stay at this hotel again!
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff, good location, the price
review.negativeRemarks: Rubbish collectors making noise
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is close to transportation hubs, shops and tourist attractions. Lot of homeless people, but that seemed to be widespread throughout SanFran.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: convenient location and very good price. location is convenient to many areas including Casto area. Homeless is area is widespread issue and prevalent there. Bathroom was antiuqe but functional.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText:
Hotel Whitcomb is a wonderful historic hotel with FREE Internet. Starbucks is in the lobby of the hotel, which makes it convenient for early business travelers. The downside is parking, $35 a day without taxes and fees. It's roughly $40 a day when all is said and done. A three day trip (which was how long I stayed) was an extra $120 to park your car....OUCH..!!!!!
There were no problems with security or staff with the hotel.. Just parking might make you angry or frustrated..

D.Drake
review.negativeRemarks: Parking your car at Hotel Whitcomb
review.locationRemarks: Heart of downtown San Francisco, very busy foot and vehicle traffic.

review.title: Ok hotel to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok I have nothing more to say sorry I am not sure sure what else I need to say just do not have anything more to say
review.negativeRemarks: the mattress was too sink in need new mattress

review.title: My opinion
review.reviewText: When we arrived, we ordered blankets, and were broken, also had to order a machine and coffee order coffee daily, he never left us, also had to ask for face towels daily, and someone took the card that hangs on the door of the room where it is requested not bother, so the person in charge of daily cleaning, we woke early, certainly the persinan that cleans the rooms were always angry or at least it seemed
review.positiveRemarks: No hotel itself but the place where it is located, we had, the truck, the truck trolley and cable to the doorstep
review.negativeRemarks: The service staff, both reception and the restaurant and housekeepers
review.locationRemarks: is that there are many beggars, drug addicts, drunks almost to the door of the hotel and the surrounding hinterland, making it seem very insecure

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText:
The staff was very nice and helpful. The location right next to bart (Civic Center) was really convenient. People complained about the area downstairs but its not bad... just don't wander around alone at three in the morning.

My only complaint is the loud vacuums they use.

review.title: Over priced
review.reviewText: The staff were pleasant and helpful, the lobby was clean and pretty but the room was in need of up grading. The towels were thin and stiff the shower curtain was ripped the sheets were scratchy and the window was so dirty we couldn't see out. Over all the hotel was way over priced for the location and the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was shabby. The windows were so dirty you could not see out.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was surrounded by homeless.

review.title: Try to overlook the front desk staff
review.reviewText:
There were some great things about this place--Larry the Door Man with the Top Hat overcame his co-worker's less-than-appropriate attitudes and was the best part about the place. Also, the lobby is beautiful and the cleaning staff did a great job.

Our arrival was a different story. Crisitina and Rondolfo (sp?) were working the front desk when we arrived and were exceedingly curt, rude and condescending. I'm not sure why they're in customer service if they dislike people as much as they seemed to on Saturday morning. Both were unfriendly from the first encounter and when I asked, (but absolutely did not expect) if they had any rooms ready before check-in ('cause some hotels do that if they have one), I received a lecture in scathing tones and recriminations just for asking. My boyfriend and I sat in the lobby for hours while we watched other couples go up (we asked one, and they got a king-sized for 2, like we were waiting for), but the front desk told us over and over they had nothing. When I asked if it was because we had booked with Expedia, rather than direct,he exploded and told me he was "a human being" and not to insult him in such a way--then gave us a key to our room. It was a bit surreal and annoying. We avoided them after that, and things were fine. Rooms are old and a bit threadbare, but very clean. Some noise, but it's the city, after all.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is stunning; the cleaning staff keeps a rapidly aging hotel very clean, good location and Larry is a burst of sunshine, every day.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk staff staggers beneath the weight of their enormous shoulder-chips. I get that customer service can be trying, but try to smile.
review.locationRemarks: Take BART from SFO, get off at Civic Cnt/UN and exit 8th st, the hotel is at top of stairs. 2 mi to Cstr/Dolores and Fincl dstrct. Stellar location!

review.title: Old doesn't have to be shabby.
review.reviewText:
For the price there has to be nicer places to stay. The hotel lobby is very cool as it is very old, but the rest of the hotel is just kind of shabby. The room was clean enough and comfortable, but all the common areas not so much. Little things like how clean the elevators are makes a difference and the doors and floors in the elevator were not so clean as well as all of the common areas if you paid a little attention.

I will try to find someplace else to stay the next time I'm there.

review.title: old and dirty
review.reviewText:
Hotel lobby - I was afraid to sit down on the sofa in the hotel lobby because it looked so dirty with lots of stains.
Room - did not have central AC, only a very old style window unit, so expect loud air conditioning if you are staying there.
Location - it was in the civic center area, not a very nice area but good access to BART and public transportation

review.title: Affordable luxury
review.reviewText: Wonderful, quaint hotel with very comfortable beds. No complaints at all with anything in the room. Neighborhood is very sketchy, though. Homeless people are pretty aggressive - we were getting panhandled INSIDE the Burger King across the street.
review.negativeRemarks: The neighborhood.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location in general, within walking distance of Little Saigon, etc., but rough neighborhood as mentioned before.

review.title: Nostalgic hotel on Market Street
review.reviewText: A nice older property with lots of personality. The history eminates from the place. It has great locale for ease in many neighborhoods within the city. The staff was exemplary.

review.title: Whitcomb whatever
review.reviewText: the workout area was useless. internet connection was spotty. comfortable beds.
review.locationRemarks: the the best after dark

review.title: I got what I paid for, next time I'll spend more
review.reviewText: Very loud in the room and somewhat dingy feeling. Would not take the kids out at night in that particular area
review.negativeRemarks: Way too loud in our room

review.title: OK Service
review.reviewText: I was disappointed with internet service. I only needed the maid one day.
review.negativeRemarks: WIFI advertised but not available.

review.title: Vintage hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed with my family for one night, while vacationing in San Francisco. The room was good, although not so big. Beds are very comfortable. The window has no drapes. Bathroom was fine. The hotel is conveniently located close to public transportation, which is good if you are visiting the city. However, it is a nightmare to find parking. Also, a bit uncomfortable to walk in the area at night, too many homeless people, although there is quite a lot of police as well.

review.title: Great hotel for fair price
review.reviewText: very nice hotel, only issue is elevators are small so you have to encounter some waiting times.
review.negativeRemarks: elevator size

review.title: You can have better choice elsewhere
review.reviewText: Old, expensive and noisy inside the room. No coffee machine.

review.title: Average experience for the price
review.reviewText: Disappointed in lack of room service and in-room refrigerator.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was quite pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: No amenities in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Central to shopping and theaters.

review.title: Expect old for being old
review.reviewText:
Its a very old hotel,but it would take 15 minutes to go down the elevator. Most of the elevators weren't operating. The bathroom is not updated, no mat for the shower.
Curtains were dirty. The rooms aren't so insulated as you heard every noise, every door close, etc. There were no parking options, except to pay 35 for valet.
review.negativeRemarks: Old bathrooms, elevators. Not sure where to park and you were forced to pay 35 to park at the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: A lot of homeless people around hotel.

review.title: Could be better.
review.reviewText: For the amount of money I spent on this hotel room, I thought I would get more for my money. There was no coffee pot, the bedside lamps were not working and the shades were torn on them. The bathroom toilets & tub were stained & not very clean. The room was small. I had to pay an extra hundred dollars just to park in the lot. The elevators were slow.I don't think this hotel should not be considered a 3.5 star hotel. I do however think you should have several of your employees stay at the hotels before you put them on your site as a 3.5 star hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The size of the room, non working lamps, out dated t.v, bathrooms weren't very clean, slow elevators, parking prices.
review.locationRemarks: It is very close to the Bart, & Muni stations, lots of transients, but down the street from a HUGE beautiful mall.

review.title: Hotel whitcombe
review.reviewText: It looks and feels like an aging beauty. For the same price there are several newer hotels in the vicinity.
review.positiveRemarks: very nice marble work in the foyer
review.negativeRemarks: room comforts leave a lot to be desired.
review.locationRemarks: a ston'e throw from the city hall

review.title: Nice hotel, but
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but the block is not really secured. The restaurant is expensive but te quality isn't good. For the rest it's fine

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We had the best experience at the Whitcomb, both accommodations and staff exceeded our expectations. Great location too!
review.positiveRemarks: We loved it all, our room, location, staff, and comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: NA
review.locationRemarks: The Bart, F-Train, and bus stop is literally outside the hotel entrance. Easy access to any part of the city.

review.title: Clean and cozy in a central location
review.reviewText: We had a long wait to check in - this is a busy place. The lobby is beautiful and would be a nice place to meet someone. We didn't know what to do with our car when we pulled up so one of us stayed with the car with hazard lights blinking. The room was small but cozy. It was clean. It was quiet despite being very full. The lamp on the bedside table was rickety but it worked. I would come back. The location is great; a short cab ride to where we needed to go.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room and rickety lamp
review.locationRemarks: Central location is great; cab-close to Financial District and Union Square.

review.title: Great Location!!
review.reviewText: Historic Hotel, Beautiful Lobby, Very comfortable beds with High quality Linens and more than Ample Pillows. Bathroom very dated but clean. Old 25 inch tube tv. Resturant nice, good food. You can walk into Starbucks thru the Lobby.Location CAN'T be beat. Civic center Bart stop.

review.title: Good location and adequate accomodation
review.reviewText:
(1) The first night the bedsheet was too short and didn't cover the whole matress. Was corrected the second night.
(2# Not enough towels and washcloths. Was corrected after contacting staff.
#3# Bathroom faucets leaked at base.
#4# Good location for exploring the city. Homeless people on Market Street are somewhat intimidating at nights.
#5) Would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need some updating
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Okay, will be a good choice for some.
review.reviewText:
Great grand old hotel. Great location for Leather... Not a great location if your a SF tourist as it can be a bad neighborhood. Clean but small room - I loved it but some will not. Staff was lacking and unhelpful - took over an hour to check in and plan on an hour wait for your car if using the hotel valet (not the valet's fault, the hotel has a very poor parking plan). Wifi did not have good signal in room (tried on three different laptops).

Overall I would consider staying here again because I loved the building and location (for my needs) and the price was reasonable considering...
review.negativeRemarks: Staff - and lack of them.
review.locationRemarks: Great for Leather...

review.title: Initial issues sorted and a good place to stay.
review.reviewText:
The Whitcombe was particularly busy during our stay. This in itself is probably good news other than a lack of staff on reception and the apparent requirement for most things to be organised thru reception. Net result there was always a que which on check in and check out times extended down the lobby so much so that they have installed a roped off queuing area.

On arrival they did not have a king room as booked some months before and we refused the alternative of a standard queen. Good move as the beds are rather on the small size in comparisson to other hotels. Give reception their due they handled a very tired and grumpy customer well and kept to their promise of sorting the situation in 20 minutes.

Once sorted I was impressed with the professionalism and pleasantness of all the staff and we all thought this hotel was a pleasure to stay in.

Being on Market Street you have the main trams readily available and there is a stop right outside the hotel so access to the city was excellent. Although very close to the tenderloin district and therefore a number of "less well off individuals" we always felt safe and we're happy to walk or take the tram to most locations regardless of the time of day or night.

In summary we loved San Fransisco and when we come back the Whitcombe will be one of our preferred choices to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Regular long que at reception
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to the city and room to park(just)

review.title: THOROUGH + UNBIAS REVIEW
review.reviewText:
I was very reluctant to stay here after sifting through DOZENS upon DOZENS of reviews across several sites. I will be as thorough as I can. This experience comes from me and my travel companion, another young man.
The location couldn't be more perfect. Walking distance to everything and LITERALLY on the same block corner as BART, trolley buses, and public transit of all sorts. At least during the summer, there are people EVERYwhere. I never felt like the area was even seedy during the day and during the night, it only dropped a notch. Plenty of homeless around, but never once felt threatened, endangered, and rarely even pan-handled.
The hotel lobby is exquisite. The employees are friendly, albeit a bit slow. The rest of the hotel could definitely use some updates, but the history is undeniably charming. Our room was small but clean and cozy. Biggest complaint was the bathroom being very small and needing renovation. We arrived at 1:30 and just as it says on the reservation, they did not let us check in until 3 PM but did hold our luggage. Also to note, after we checked out, they still held our luggage for half a day we still had left to the city.
At night, the area STILL has a lot of tourists, even in the early morning hours. I will admit, the riffraff is out in more force at night. As two young men, we were never bothered,, but I could see a single woman's reluctance.
Overall a pleasant enough experience and well worth the cost- offset.

review.title: backpackers
review.reviewText:
Great for backpackers, as the hotel was full of them.
Not so good for a business man trying to get some work done.

review.title: Fantastic staff in a historic gem
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful, historic Hotel with courteous, professional staff, a gorgeous lobby, and pleasant, well appointed rooms. The rooms are smaller than newer counterparts, but keep in mind this property is over 100 years old. The hotel dining was great, and the service was excellent. It is steps from public transit. There's not much within a short walking distance, and if you're bothered by homeless people, you would feel uncomfortable in this neighborhood. Personally, I didn't feel threatened at all. My only suggestion would be for the hotel to employ more valets, they are painfully disorganized and it takes forever to pickup the car. All in all, it is a great value, in a convenient location, if you don't mind a smaller room, and thin walls. I would stay here again in an instant.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful details, excellent service, great food.
review.negativeRemarks: Slow valet service, could use a power strip on the desk for cameras and computers
review.locationRemarks: Steps from public transit, opera house, city hall, orpheum theater

review.title: NOT a safe area to walk around-Drug Addicts nearby
review.reviewText: This is NOT a safe area to walk around, there are drug addicts living directly outside the door
review.negativeRemarks: Location is terrible

review.title: Cheap hotel in SF
review.reviewText:
Could use some refurbishing and updating.
Walking outside the hotel is a bit scary with all
The homeless people everywhere.
Comfortable beds, small rooms with no view.
It was the price that got me to stay here, so as far
as being in SF it's perfect, but for a nice
hotel in a great area, look at other options.
review.negativeRemarks: Area
review.locationRemarks: Top many homeless people

review.title: reasonably priced
review.reviewText: It was relatively inexpensive. The service was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: The service, particularly the concierges, was wonderful
review.negativeRemarks: It was hard to find and use electrical outlets
review.locationRemarks: The location seemed somewhat out of the way.

review.title: Ideal location to explore
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby and staff were excellent. The location was ideal for exploring San Francisco. However, the bathroom of our room needed renovating and the room heat/AC allowed noise from the street in.

review.title: good hotel w/ a great location
review.reviewText:
clean, cozy rooms. no microwave or mini fridge though. the room does have this old wood smell to it. it's like an old persons home. the shower head is too low. i'm 5'10" and i have to bend down for the water to hit the top of my head. the water pressure is also too low. the AC is old and really loud when on high. wi fi is slow (though i may be just used to my FIOS).

great location: bus, train in front of the hotel. very friendly/helpful staff. good restaurant in the lobby. really sad bar though (very small selection if liquors).

review.title: Worst experience ever
review.reviewText:
Staying at Hotel Whitcomb was a dreadful experience.

Our room was extremely small and everything there was old and in bad condition. Using the air conditioner was out of the question because of the thick layer of dust on it. The bathroom reminded me of the worst motel. There was no bath, even the shelf for the toothbrushes was tilted in a way that everything would just fall off it. 90% of the electric sockets didn't work. The mattresses were sagging and extremely uncomfortable. The hotel also featured the slowest internet ever.

Finally, we were charged 140$ fee (by mistake) for 4 days of parking which we didn't use . I am still fighting to get my money back. Reception is very unhelpful.

Overall, I would call this the worst hotel I have stayed in. I do not recommend it to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Absolutely none. Can't think of any
review.negativeRemarks: Non-working sockets, sagging mattresses, dust, slow internet, unhelpful staff, extra charges for parking
review.locationRemarks: located in downtown san francisco

review.title: Sadly I cannot recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: While the hotel itself was quite beautiful and the staff excellent, I must give an overall rating of "disappointing" due to the unacceptable parking conditions and the neighborhood in which it is located. I found the neighborhood seedy and honestly did not feel safe wandering about as I am accustomed to doing. The parking situation is, in a word, atrocious and enough to preclude future stays. You enter the valet area through an alley...there was a HUGE hole in the pavement which is unavoidable for tne unsuspecting. We first pulled in planning to check into tne hotel, unpack the car and later retrieve the car for dinner. The parking situation was so chaotic that we chose to not check in until later that night...leaving our bags in the car as we toured and dined. When we checked out, we waited about a half hour...calling ahead made no difference. To add insult to injury, there is a $35 valet charge/day...plus tax! While the attendants were courteous and hardworking, and blameless, the system is ridiculous and unworkable. Sadly, the quality of the hotel was overshadowed by these shortcomings
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful loby and comfortable rooms...though bathroom is dated
review.negativeRemarks: Neighborhood and parking
review.locationRemarks: Did not feel safe in this SF neighborhood

review.title: Great location for touring the city
review.reviewText:
Staid there for a 5 day vacation. Our first room (2nd floor) had only half the electrical outlets working and the mattress was awfully soft with a hole in the center. We complained after the first night and got a room on the 4th which was better. The waiting time for the elevators is ridiculous.
Other than that it worked great for us: the location gets you everywhere really quickly with public transportation, it is in walking distance to many restaurants (get a breakfast at a reasonable price!) and attractions yet far enough away from the considerable accumulations of homeless people who set up their quarters around downtown every night.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators

review.title: Tenth Wedding Anniversary
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in an area of great interest to us, because of the Asian Museum and the colorful Mission Street nearby. This is not a reflection on the hotel that the traffic on Market Street has been rerouted, which initially gave us some problems getting to the hotel. When we are in San Francisco, the Whitcomb is where we usually stay. It is an "old" hotel, which gives the hotel its charm. I like to think of Whitcomb as my private "time machine." It is a quaint hotel.

review.title: family getaway
review.reviewText: I would have been nice to have a fridge in the room
review.positiveRemarks: It was beautiful and had character
review.negativeRemarks: one of the mattresses was worn out, no refridgerator
review.locationRemarks: right at Civic Center, there was easy transportation everywhere

review.title: Not recommended
review.reviewText: Bad part of town, photos are misleading. Overpriced

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The staff was very curteous and quick to help. The room was in need of a serious update and smelled musty.
review.locationRemarks: Market St San Francisco CA

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText:
Room was large and comfortable, but with small window it was also dark.
Wireless internet was very very slow,
Hotel is in an area with many homeless people on the street.
Recommendation is therefore marginal.
review.locationRemarks: Surprised to see homeless people on the footpath.

review.title: Not the best spot for a business trip...
review.reviewText:
The hotel advertises itself as "historic", which it is, but it is also just plain old and is a bit shabby. The halls are quite dark and the furnishings very dated. My room was very small, and noisy, from the standpoint that I could hear the water running in the pipes every time someone near me ran water or flushed the toilet. The bathroom was a good size, but it was an outdated shower where the shower curtain is on a straight rod and with the type of fabric that clings to your body as you shower.

The first morning of my stay I waited (along with 3 other guests) for 7 minutes before an elevator arrived with enough space to accommodate us. The second morning there were roughly 10 people waiting for the elevator on my floor. After a few minutes several us decided the stairs would be a better way to go.

The hotel is about a mile and a half from the center of the financial district. A quick BART ride, but it is not an area that you want to be out in on foot late at night.
review.positiveRemarks: It was next to a BART station
review.negativeRemarks: The loation, the shower and the elevators.
review.locationRemarks: In a sketchy area of Market street, no quality restaurants nearby.

review.title: Good representation of historic San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel had a lot of character and was in a good location for accessing public transit. The front desk was a little slow, but the guest services desk was very helpful and useful.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located, easy access to public transit.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: EXCELLENT LOCATION. Right downtown, right on BART, easy access to entire city by car or foot or mass transit. Plenty of food places close by. Hotel is very old but well kept. Ornate lobby, crystal chandeliers, stained glass, tall ceilings, ornate and lovely. Rooms ok, bathrooms modern but SMALL. Windows open! Parking garage attached for extra cost, very nice valets, easy in/out. Stay here for the location and clean decent rooms.

review.title: Great Hotel for vacationing
review.reviewText:
My first impression of the Hotel Whitcomb was the location was bad, however I had arrived 1am in the morning and the streets were dark and barren except for homeless people. Once I entered the hotel I was pleased to see the clean and historical decor.

After waking up and venturing out for breakfast I soon found that this hotel was part of the pulse of the city. There were many restaurants and shops to visit within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking,
review.locationRemarks: The location is not the best, but because of being in a historic district I was able to overlook this

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the stay there. Alovely hsitoric hotel.

review.title: Nice location and good rooms
review.reviewText: Is a good option because is not that expensive and have a good location close to union squuare.

review.title: Think Again before staying here
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I were in SF for a wedding and decided to make a mini vacation out of the trip. We booked our hotel through one of Expedia's deals for 4 nights. When we arrived at 12pm there was no room ready (check in is at 3 but they didn't even try to accommodate us.) The man at the desk told us that he would need to put a $200 "hold" charge on my credit card for incidentals since I already prepaid the room. When we started asking questions about this charge and said we had never heard of this before, the man told us "well in America, many hotels do this" - we're from Philadelphia...

The hotel is VERY old and not particular clean. The tile in the bathroom was loose and the carpet was dirty. I wore my flip flops in the room all weekend.

Part of the reason I booked this hotel was that it was very central to everything I wanted to do. Although this hotel may be centrally located, it is in a TERRIBLE location. If you make a right out of the hotel, you will run into VERY aggressive homeless people and drug dealers. I tried to stay positive, but on one of our elevator rides up to our room, we had to share the elevator with an extremely sketchy, disillusion man who was looking for someone staying at the hotel. We followed him to a room directly next to ours and were totally freaked out. For the next hour, we kept hearing the door slam shut. It was scary and I did not feel safe.

I would not recommend staying here and it upsets me that Expedia supports hotels like these.

review.title: Just okay...
review.reviewText: This hotel was just okay... The customer service was mediocre at best, the elevators and other areas were in bad shape (cosmetically) needing touching up, and they charged $35 a night for parking!!! I was not impressed and don't think this place deserves its 3 1/2 star rating.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking cost and poor upkeep.
review.locationRemarks: Not in a very good part of San Francisco.

review.title: No Frills, Good Bar, Fair Price!
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a hotel with charm then you have found the right one. Although the rooms are small, the bathrooms and closets aren't. The A/C unit is attached to wall, but it's San Fran so in order not to hear the loud noise of the A/C just open the window. The staff is super friendly and the hotel is very very clean. If you are in town to see any of the Musicals or Art Production shows, you are in the perfect location. There are not many frills to speak of but there is a Starbuck and a nice bar/restuarant on site. For the value of this hotel, I shouldn't complain.
review.positiveRemarks: They history and the charm of such an old building
review.negativeRemarks: No Flat Screen TV and the bed.
review.locationRemarks: Great if you are there for the Arts

review.title: Historic, but not charming
review.reviewText:
Pros
- Near the metro
- Quiet

Cons
- Advertised wiifi cut out every couple of minutes
- Charged $35/day parking (non-guests get charged less?!)
- No view
- "Historic" equated to "Dilapidated" bathrooms

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: This was a great location. The hotel is older, but still very nice. Had everything we needed. Except we ran into a lot of electrical outlet problems. Since it is so old, the plugs kept slipping out causing a lot of headaches. They offer a vallet service which felt expensive, but convenient.

review.title: Utterly disgusting - don't stay there - ever
review.reviewText:
I paid 500$ for a night and it was a complete nightmare ... see below
No room service
No mini bars
Bathrooms horrible
Not even a vending machine.
Location is life-endangering after dark
Bar/restaurant closes at 10 30 PM
review.negativeRemarks: Read above
review.locationRemarks: terrible, dangerous part of the city

review.title: I would not recommend.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is an older building. While the lobby area is unique, the rooms are tight, older and needing an upgrade. I would classify this hotel more along the lines of 'Comfort Inn'.
The hallways were noisy with teenagers running around through the middle of the night keeping everyone awake. Additionally, the parking attendant did not help with any of our luggage and merely laughed at us while we struggled to get our bags into the car. The location is near Civic Center which we did not feel safe walking around in the evening and at night (I wouldn't recommend it). It's a good 15 minute walk to the central Union Square area. Place is OK to lay your head for a night. Definite NO for vacationing. Had I known, I would've paid extra to stay somewhere more comfortable and closer to Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: Bad location in the Civic Center area. Lots of activity right outside on Market street with the homeless.

review.title: Perfect for a weekend stay!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a wonderful location. You are close to everything and right on the BART line to and from the airport. The lobby is very nice and there is a Starbucks attached to the lobby. The room that I had was relatively small, but adequate for my needs. It reminded my of a European hotel room. Two full beds, a small desk and a television. The linens were good and the bed was relatively comfortable.

The restroom needed a major overhaul. While I enjoy staying in historic hotels, I prefer for them to be clean. I felt that the restroom was adequately cleaned, however the tub floor was stained and did not appear clean. Based upon the cleanliness of the rest of the room, I assume it was clean but stained. The toilet is very interesting and up 4 inches from the rest of the restroom. It was clearly originally and unique. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again based upon the price, the cleanliness and the location.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and access to mass transit is great!
review.negativeRemarks: The bathtub floor was stained and needed to be replaced or refinished.
review.locationRemarks: Market Street near a Mall, Union Station, and a short walk to the Castro.

review.title: Restaurant was great, Room was not.
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival we noticed some housekeeping issues with our room. We called the front desk to alert them we were leaving the room and asked them to correct the problems. We returned quite late that night only to find that the someone had been to our room, but the problems had not been addressed. We had to wait 30 minutes for housekeeping to come and take care of the problem before we could get ready for bed. It was inconvenient to say the least. Overall, the room was not as clean as we would have preferred it to be.
The next morning, I spoke to the manager who was very professional and considerate. He was very helpful and treated us to lunch in their very nice restaurant. We enjoyed the meal very much. This is why we give the hotel a 4 for quality of staff. The restaurant waitstaff and management was wonderful. Our only wish would have been that our room was better maintained and resonably clean, which it was not.

review.title: Great for Business travelers.
review.reviewText: Hotel is comfortable, beds are very good. No flat screen TV, and television is OK but nothing special. The bar and restaurant are pretty good, but slow. It is right across the street from the Orpheum Theatre, so great if you are going to a show. Park on the block behind the hotel (Mission Street) and you'll pay $10 for 24 hours, then $2 per hour until you reach $10, so basically $10 a day, which is nothing in San Francisco. The hotel charges $35 per day to park in their lot. The hotel is on Market Street, which is a noisy, busy street, but very good access to public transportation all around the city. Our room was quiet, no street noise.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful stained glass ceiling inserts. Comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: The bums on Market Street.

review.title: OK Hotel If Exercise Room Not Important
review.reviewText: Room was clean and roomier than I expected however the sheets were not changed when I requested. The exercise room was dreadful. I went to the exercise room three mornings and there were no towels, the same dirty towels had not been removed from who knows how long, two of the three aerobic machines did not work, the only working machine (the treadmill) was old and filthy and the weight machine only works on some settings. The woman at the concierge station was very helpful. The Internet cafe was clean and had lots of computers.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room, close to muni buses, Walgreens and cable cars
review.negativeRemarks: Exercise room
review.locationRemarks: Lots of homeless people however seemed safe enough. Close to a Walgreens for misc items and muni buses.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with comfy beds

The location was great with buses and trams right outside the hotel and only a 10 minute walk to the main shopping district.

Were given a room with 2 doubles there are very small for a couple to share one. I would recommend the nob hill area to stay

Gym is something. Literally, there is no gym, just tears... A small room for 3-4 people max, almost no equipment, no fresh towels... awful.

review.title: Beautiful hotel - good value
review.reviewText: Beautiful, historic hotel. Room a little small, but that is to be expected in a city like San Francisco. Handy location - I took the BART right from the airport to directly in front of the hotel, plus the buses and trolleys stop in front of the hotel. Within walking distance to the Civic Centre. The area is a little seedy, but no one bothered me during my stay and you need only walk a couple of blocks to a nicer area. It was convenient having a Starbucks just off the lobby, especially when leaving early for tours, etc. Good value with the deal I got through Expedia.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful lobby, halls and elevator outside panels
review.negativeRemarks: Room a little dated and small.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient.

review.title: book a superior room, you should be pleased.
review.reviewText: stayed in two rooms, superior room was very nice, thanks
review.positiveRemarks: its charm and most of its service,
review.negativeRemarks: concierge svcs were unpredictable, 1 day we waited 40 min she talked to ONE customer while 4 others waited. Next day, different one was OUTSTANDING
review.locationRemarks: not great after dark, nearby blocks were scary

review.title: Enter at own risk
review.reviewText: Well, If you are looking for historic, this is the place. The lobby was historically pretty, and the rest was historically aweful. All of the halls we walked down eminated with cigar smoke and tobacco. There are small signs everywhere noting this flaw, so if you don't mind the stench in a now non-smoking hotel...then it should be ok for you. The first room was so bad with this smell, that with my asthma, it made my eyes swell and breathing hard. So I was given another room. The second room was slightly larger, with a comfortable bed, but they could not get the toilet to work regardless of several attempts. We just had to deal with it after three requests as it was too late in the evening and we would be leaving the next morning. The bathroom itself had virtually no room and could be likened to a closet with plumbing. The restaurant was clean, with great food and service. The valet parking staff were very helpful. Some of the staff at the front desk were somewhat superior to deal with the room issues. We were told they had just remodeled some of the floors, one of which is where our second room was. The historical ambience of this hotel just cannot match a stay in a newer hotel that actually works and smells clean. We would not stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: restaurant, the bed, and checking out
review.negativeRemarks: the smell, the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: great little diner called Sams directly across the street.

review.title: Fair but not great
review.reviewText: Given previous reviews, I had hoped for a nicer room. I stayed in room #443 and it was a very basic, bare bones room. It was outdated and the bathroom needed updating and repair. The heater did not work well, the toilet ran all hours and the bathroom fan made a horrible whistling noise. Further, there weren't enough pillows or blankets so with the heat not working well, both my fiance and I were cold. The free internet was nice and the hotel held our bags after checking out but overall, I thought the room was only so-so.
review.negativeRemarks: The room
review.locationRemarks: Downtown on a busy street

review.title: Very Noisy from hallway and neighboring rooms
review.reviewText: The room was clean, the staff was friendly, but it was extremely noisy and we could hear through the walls from room to room and the hallway.

review.title: Classic SF Trip
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and a great change from the traditional chain hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were not up to date with an old TV
