The location is very good, right in the middle of "old" San Francisco.
For parking your rental car they charge 35 US$ per day....
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom

review.title: Unique San Francisco Experience
review.reviewText: This hotel is no doubt historic; grand marble lobby, carved wood beamed ceilings and antique light fixtures seem autthentic to the days when this hotel was in its prime. The furniture in the lobby, the carpets, the brass clad elevators seems a bit worn and the overall impression is that all surfaces could benefit from a general buffing. Walking down the halls you get overwhelmings sense of a bygone era and you almost expect to see a ghost in victorian dress at the end of the hallway. The age of the hotel is evident in the thick layers of paint on the moldings and the scent of the carpet. All of this adds to the charm of this hotel. The room decor is fitting to the style of the hotel. Nicely furnished with dark furniture and crisp, good quality bed linens with lots of soft plush pillows. I slept really well. The bathroom is small but adequate, with sufficient clean towels and bath supplies, good hot water and enough pressure. There is a good sized closet with iron and wood hangers. This hotel provided everything to make my stay pleasant and comfortable. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The location is a bit removed from most of the typical tourist activities but very accessible. Only one block away from City Hall, the Opera Hall, Asian Art Museum and close to some really cool off the beaten path neighborhoods with many ethnic restaurants. It is also on the major cable car and bus lines. The METRO (BART) to and from the airport stops right at the front door of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Historic and Charming, and accessibility to METRO
review.negativeRemarks: The antique smell; even though they were not visibly dirty because of the dark color the carpets could probably use a good shampoo
review.locationRemarks: A little off the beaten path but very accessible with the METRO from airport, and public transport to everywhere. Close to some cool neighborhoods

review.title: Gross
review.reviewText: We had to go to 3 different rooms to be given a room with a decent bathroom. The other 2 were disgusting and the toilets needed to be replaced and the bathtubs needed to be cleaned. Will never stay here ever again.
review.negativeRemarks: Room
review.locationRemarks: not bad location

review.title: Location!
review.reviewText:
The hotel room was minimalist. It did have an old smell to it, but I suppose you should expect it since it is "a historic hotel."
A bed and bathroom, but that's all you need if you are planning to spend your days out sightseeing and etc.
The best thing about the hotel was it's location.
Parking was expensive.
review.locationRemarks: perfect location, for a reasonable price.

review.title: Old San Franscisco Lives On
review.reviewText: Our second visit to this hotel, and not disappointing in the least. Exquisite old world charm, well maintained, very courteous and well dressed staff. Everything about this hotel was noteable and the rate I paid was well worth it. Only disappointing aspect is Market Street in front of the hotel. Not a pleasant place to stroll or walk to your destination. Instead, take a cab. They're plentiful, efficient, and the fares are reasonable.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Needs to be updated drastically, and better customer service. Food advertised for the hotel restaurant is not provided.

review.title: Rat in hotel room!
review.reviewText:
We stayed for 4 nights and had to move room on the second night due to a rat sharing our room. The staff were helpful and moved us to another room straight away, but it did spoil the rest of the stay as we were always looking at the floor!
Hotel wasn't the cleanest and the homeless people outside was a bit off putting.
If you are staying here for a few days I would recommend the city pass which lets you straight onto the subway outside the front door, you can then exit in the middle of union square at the next stop.
review.negativeRemarks: Rat in hotel room
review.locationRemarks: Good apart from homeless people outside.

review.title: Expedia/Whitcomb mismatch
review.reviewText: Room was great, but booked 2 doubles through expedia and only got 1 king when we checked in.

review.title: Sad
review.reviewText: The hotel over all is very cool. The historical building is beautiful. The walls are extremely thin. You can clearly hear the conversations of others in the room next to you giving you absolutely no privacy. The housekeeping staff is slamming doors throughout the entire day beginning at about 7:30 am
review.locationRemarks: Location is very good and central. Easy to catch a cab from.

review.title: Sales executive
review.reviewText: Great food, ok location? Rooms small but nice. Bed good.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size

review.title: Impressive hotel, non-impressive neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was nice and the staff courteous and helpful. The historic nature of this hotel was the most impressive attribute. Rooms were well maintained and the look was top notch. Access to the BART transit system was helpful to me, personally, because I had an event I attended in Oakland. Unfortunatly, this hotel is not in the more popular areas of San Francisco. So a 10min. walk east is needed to catch the famous trolly system of San Fran to it's more popular parts of town. The length of the walk wasn't bad, but the element in that part of town is somewhat questionable. As a male, I was not to intimitated, but I would not recommend this hotel to female guests who plan on taking the streets of San Fran on there own. The night time element in the neighborhood of this hotel can get abrupt after dark.
review.positiveRemarks: I did enjoy the historic look that they have kept up with the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: I felt the parking was a bit steep for the hotel. Though I do understand that they have 24/7 valet in a major city.
review.locationRemarks: The neighborhood of this hotel can get seedy after dark. I would not recommend females traveling alone to this particular hotel.

review.title: Great value and conveinent location
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb combines great location on Market St at a decent price. The rooms are comfortable and clean and a decent size, with older style decor giving the hotel a wonderful historic feel. The room was clean and comfortable and you have the option of moderating the temperature of the room. I found the staff to be pleasant and helpful. It is quite a busy hotel and we saw a lot of tour groups come and go during our stay, so the reception area and elevaors tended to get quite busy. There is a bus/streetcar stop and a BART station right next to the hotel so it is very easy to get around, whether you are travelling down Market St to shop at Union Square, or travelling to Fishermans Wharf on the F line streetcars, or catching a bus to Haight St and Golden Gate Park. This is the second time I have stayed at Hotel Whitcomb and I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cost, clean and comfortable room
review.negativeRemarks: Powerpoint not working by desk, slow elevators
review.locationRemarks: Conveinetly located close to public transport and shopping

review.title: Long Past Its Prime, Not for the Business Traveler
review.reviewText: Sadly, this may have at one time been a grand hotel, but that day is long past. It is on the absolutely worst stretch of Market Street in San Francisco. There is nothing along this stretch but boarded up storefronts and a couple strip-joints. Luckily there is a Starbucks adjoining the lobby as this is what you get! And, no coffee in rooms. No room-service. And, listening to the staff at the desk – this is a “groups” hotel. Yeah, groups from out-of-the-country, groups of teenagers, and groups of unknowing Midwesterners. The plumbing is from the 1930’s. The bed I tried to sleep in was actually lumpy! I have never had a hotel-bed be wrecked, and – it was on three legs. I thought it would fall over! And, smoking in the hallways! This is not a good place for a business traveler. It may be a place for a teen spring-break wild-vacation.
review.locationRemarks: It is on the absolutely worst stretch of Market Street in San Francisco.

review.title: 3 days in San Fran
review.reviewText: The downside is that the hotel is situated in a slightly dodgy area of the city. The upside is that it is a characterful hotel with great staff and very resonably priced
review.negativeRemarks: the location
review.locationRemarks: central but a bit of a dodgy area

review.title: Great Value but on the Edge
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for the value. Location is on the edge of seedy part of town with lots of homeless people adult entertainment etc. I had not issues with rough surroundings outside the hotel but would not place a young family in this environment. However, I would stay there if traveling alone or with my wife, provided she never ventured outside alone. BART station across the street is convenient for easy access to airport for one way fare of $8:10. Hotel is somewhat dated, but clean and great staff to assist in your comfort. 15 to 20 minutes walk to convention center on beautiful San Fran weather.
review.negativeRemarks: Homeless people and beggars

We had to pay 35 Dollars for parking even though there is another parking couple of feet away from the hotel for 10$. The picture of the bathroom showed a big and clean bath tub when I booked,, reality was I could hardly stand in the bathroom or the shower, and there was no bath tub, I would never ever stay in this hotel or recommend it to anyone.For the same amount of money I paid per night and parking I could have stayed in a better hotel, and paid my three meals in a good restaurant

Not what I was expecting from a 3.5+ star hotel.

review.title: Choose Union Square over this.
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb is a nice hotel but in a not so nice area of town and the staff is a little rude and not accomodating. It's easy to get on a muni train to any other part of the city you wish to go but as soon as you get back to hotel you feel you're not in the best area of town. Junkies all around the block, valet isn't friendly, staff is rude and not gracious. Nice hotel, old fashioned feel, but experience not good at all. I would not recommend at all. I had never been to San Francisco so didn't know if to choose this or something in Union Square. After having dinner and drinks at Union Square at night and it felt safe and looked really nice and pretty with people walking around enjoying themselves and having a good time I knew I made the wrong decision. Union Square is nice, Market St. not so much.
review.negativeRemarks: Location, furniture, ambience, i.e. junkies outside hotel, not very friendly staff or valet

review.title: Bad SFO nights
review.reviewText:
I 'assumed' since the hotel had a 3.5+ rating it would be a decent hotel. I felt like I was in a hostel. Degenerates running amuck in and out of the hotel.
I arrived at the hotel at 7:45pm. Concierge works 8am-8pm. I arrived at the concierge's desk at exactly 8pm. There is no room service at this 'establishment.' She explained that she had been working 12 hours and HAD to leave. Which makes the statement from her even more hurtful. The staff (front desk and housekeeping) is friendly. The staff in the onsite restaurant (that does not deliver to the rooms) is horrible. i felt like they war over compensating for something. We had pancakes that I had to send back twice because they felt and ate like rubber. The rooms are decent, the bathrooms are small. if you are with a significant other it is fine, but I happened to be traveling with my 12 year old son. How am I to dress in the bathroom when there is no room to dress in the bathroom. If you stood in front of the sink and closed the bathroom door you would be hit by it. :-( There are no food choices in the area. I had to change hotels, i just couldn't take it.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel's no room service policy
review.locationRemarks: a lot of homeless and degenerates

I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

review.title: It is good for students.

review.title: Not again, please!

Everything was old. The only benefit is the location in the city center. But there are nicer and better hotels arround. review.title: Charming HOtel
review.reviewText: The staff were kind and accomodating, went out of their way to make sure we were happy with our room and asked us to come back down to have complimentary drinks due to room change. The rooms were clean but definitely not updated at all, which certainly added to the charm of the hotel. The lobby is beautiful and very historic looking; gorgeous chandeliers and floors. Overall, the area is a little scary, saw a drug deal...but it's in the city, what can ya do.
review.locationRemarks: sketchy area, not going to lie

review.title: Hostel feel for cost of a hotel.
review.reviewText: It was like paying for a hotel for the experience of a hostel! The bathroom was probably the worst of all. It was gloomy, very old furnishing that was also dusty. The bathroom was stained everywhere, including the tub and sink. It needs MAJOR remodeling or at least some deep cleaning. From the pillow covers, tile, tub, sink, floor, walls and door...it needed cleaning!!! I don't think my friends and I would have minded the old feel of it, if it hadn't been so dirty and dusty.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was nice, gave us a free night of parking since we arrived pretty late at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else aside from the staff. Mainly how dirty it was.
review.locationRemarks: Ok location, kind of a walk to Union Square.

review.title: Just OK Stay
review.reviewText:
Have stayed at Hotel Whitcomb several times prior to latest visit so knew what to expect.

Unfortunately rather cold and rainy while in S.F. for 3 days so most disappointed in lack of thermostat in my room.

Only heat source from wall HVAC which was rather noisy. No heat at all in the bathroom. Don't think I will stay at this hotel again, prefer a more modern establishment.
review.negativeRemarks: Rather old furnishings.

review.title: Best kept secret
review.reviewText: This is a centrally located Hotel which was perfect for catching the muni or Bart right outside the Hotel. Diverse area with no problems whatsoever feeling unsafe. The staff was lovely especially Esmerelda at the front desk!! I would come back and recommend this Hotel to everyone especially since I had children with me.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough time
review.locationRemarks: Great. Superb access to public transportation or walking.

review.title: Good price, bad location
review.reviewText: Bad neighborhood! Would not recommend walking in the neighborhood at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Lots of street people right outside the hotel

review.title: Over priced and terrible bathroom
review.reviewText: The bathroom is smaller than the size of a bathtub. When you sit on the toilet the sink is on top of your knees. Always saw a long line at the front desk with only one staff member working and did not once see concierge.

review.title: NO BEDBUGS!
review.reviewText: We were worried after reading some other reviews that there were bed bugs at this hotel. That was NOT the case we had no problems at all and the stay was enjoyable!
review.positiveRemarks: Very convenient with the transit right out the front door. As well, loved the Starbucks in the lobby!

review.title: I HATED
review.reviewText: Room was very cold and had no heater, dirty bathroom, no windows, wifi didnt work, bad service, and an machine that was next to the my toilet made ​​noise all night. i hated.
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Old hotel.
review.reviewText: Old hotel. The area of the city is fine during the day, but a little unsafe at night. There are a number of bus stops and bart stations close by to minimize walking at night. The room was clean, but all of the furniture and appliancea are old. We got the room for fairly cheap.

review.title: Gold on the outside, cold from the inside
review.reviewText:
Negative: The room was freezing cold, there were loads of homeless people hanging in front of the hotel, too few staff taking in the bookings and the internet worked only occasionally.
Positive: Beautiful lobby and Starbucks right next door.

review.title: Wifi problems
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 4 nights. 2nd night wifi connectivity was atrocious. 3rd and 4th day, wifi went down and no connectivity. Absolutely unacceptable. Manager offered monetary compensation, but business meeting was compromised.

Elevators painfully slow. Check in could have been faster.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-fi was horrible / elevators were slow, no stair option
review.locationRemarks: a few blocks outside of high priced area

review.title: A good convenient place to stay, i reccomend it
review.reviewText: The location is perfect for public transportation, the F line, Bart, and other available transportation. Once you pass all the pan handlers, you'll be fine in either direction after 2 blocks. You don't need a car if you're staying here. Do yourself a favor, save your $ in car reantal, gas, parking, and that includes the parking just to stay at your hotel. It varies from $30 to $60 pernight depending where you stay. My guess is that I saved about $800 on my trip by not taking a car this time. But overall, I do reccommend this hotel. One thing I would not reccommend, is SAM's Diner across the street. Horrible food, at ripoff pricess
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure
review.locationRemarks: Aside from the pan handlers and psychos around the hotel. Everything else was fine. At times I was wondering if I had to look psycho myself

review.title: Not a good option
review.reviewText: Historic hotel but rooms haven't been well maintained and are showing their years. Not very clean - hairs on bathroom floor on arrival. And sketchy neighborhood (unless you want a hotel where you don't have to walk far to buy crack). I was there on my own for work because I booked last minute but worth the money to stay closer to Union Square.

review.title: way past its prime...
review.reviewText: I am sure in the past, this was once a very beautiful hotel. But, well past tired now. Stained carpets, old televisions. But worst of all, were the very strange people just outside the hotel. It just did not feel like a very safe area.
review.positiveRemarks: wondering how the hotel was in its prime. I can imagine, the beautiful wood work and stained glass made this a grand hotel once.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel was very tired. Very worn out
review.locationRemarks: Scary location. People smoking pot right outside the front door and very strange people around the corner. Looked like a homeless camp

review.title: Bad hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is the worst hotel in my life I have seen. The room is dirty, the servise is bad. So, I do not advise any one to take one night.

review.title: OK hotel but scary neighbourhood!
review.reviewText:
Hotel on its own is ok, but I was racially abused by the hobos in the street,
and while I was queuing to report that to the concierge, he was busy reporting
a theft from some other room to the police. Scary neighbourhood!
review.positiveRemarks: Historical look of corridors and rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: No safety deposit boxes in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Dreadful location--although close to a BART station, I was scared to walk the few meters to the door.

review.title: Short stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, lovely and helpful staff. Very comfortable room.
review.positiveRemarks: Bus, BART, trams right outside the door; cable car about 5 min walk up the road.
review.negativeRemarks: Not in the best area of town, lots of homeless around the area.

review.title: A pleasant stay but a seedy area.
review.reviewText: A pleasant stay but a seedy area. The hotel is beautiful on the inside and the staff is very helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for the Union Square area. However, when walking from the hotel to Union Square, you will have to dodge quite a few destitute people.

review.title: Great hotel but the area is not for everyone
review.reviewText: The hotel is great but the constant parade of mentally ill, drugged and homeless people in the surrounding area is a bummer. I was by myself so it was OK. I wouldn't want my mom, wife or daughter staying in that area unless they were in a group. The tram down to Union square is right outside the front door which is convenient, fast and inexpensive. The bed and room I had was excellent -- especially for the price.
review.locationRemarks: Sketchy bordering on scary

review.title: A faded beauty
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Whitcomb is a beautiful 100 year old hotel with lots of marble, mirror panelled doors and a maze of rooms. It also provides a solid breakfast, at additional cost, to kick off your day after which you are ushered out to the street by a doorman in a Top Hat. Pretty cool.
It is very functional and well maintained. Although a bit frayed around the edges and perhaps not in the best part of town, still everything seemed to work. The reception area reminded me a bit of the drop off area for school camp, so its definitely not cosy.
However, this grand old lady has perfect bone structure and would be truly stunning if it was given a 21st century makeover. That said, it was packed with new arrivals each day, large tour groups and canny travellers, so why bother I guess.
review.positiveRemarks: The doorman and the restaurant staff.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit too run down. Sad the hotel owners don't make more of its structural beauty.
review.locationRemarks: OK. A flat 3 block walk to the main city area.

review.title: For this price it should be better
review.reviewText: Very old hotel in a not very good area. For the price you va do much better
review.negativeRemarks: Location location
review.locationRemarks: Bad surrounding area. Homeless (more than normal for SF)

review.title: Could be a lot better.
review.reviewText: Shower tap head leaked, drain was uncovered, no lights were on in the room when I got in late in the evening after checking in.

review.title: Not worth your money!!
review.reviewText: My room was Not clean!! I found a sticky substance towards the bottem of the bed on my sheets. When I called and requested a different set of sheets they never sent them. The bed was badly bowed in the middle and very uncomfortable to try and sllep on! The parking was very expensive and not included with the room rate. The neighborhood around the hotel is ok during the day, but at night there was homeless people sleeping everywhere! I was very dissapointed with everything from my stay at this shabby hotel! Dont let the elegant looking loby fool you, this place is kind of a dump!!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!!
review.locationRemarks: Not a good neighborhood!

review.title: Positive stay at the Hotel Whitcomb.
review.reviewText: the hotel was beautiful, the room and bed very comfortable. We enjoyed the historic quality that has been well maintained. the only drawback was the proximity to the tenderloin district and having to be careful where we walked at night. On the other hand it is in walking distance of just about everything, and close to cable car and bus lines. It is also a very quick taxi ride to the airport. A very enjoyable experience. I would go back.
review.negativeRemarks: Neighborhood

review.title: Fine to stay at if all else is booked....
review.reviewText:
For an inexpensive hotel to stay at for business, this is an okay place. A little Sketchy, but acceptable.

The hotel has a ton of potential and if renovated would be amazing.

review.title: Not Too Bad
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was nice. It's not updated in anyway but for a weekend get away, it did the job. I read all the reviews on yelp and other web sites about the homeless people outside and that was no joke. But being from LA and now living in Las Vegas that really wasn't a big deal to us. It's in walking distance of Union Square, the escalator to the Bart is right outside the door, as well as the cable car and bus routes. Now with that being said, if we had our three young children with us I can't say I would of been as pleased. Not so much because of the hotel itself but because of its surroundings. If the price was right and without the kids, we wouldn't mind staying here again. One last note the toilet is loud!
review.positiveRemarks: The history and I love old buildings
review.negativeRemarks: The LOUD toilet
review.locationRemarks: The good: close to the cable cars and the F took us everywhere we wanted to go. the bad: take a guess

review.title: can do better
review.reviewText: The room was pretty dated. staff was fine. nicer hotels in the city

review.title: Historical, but not more than 2 stars
review.reviewText:
Other than the grander of the historical past, and the lobby, the rooms were basically small, bathroom looked like a Motel 6, mildew and wall paper falling off. Little things like no drawers to unpack, bad lighting, musty smell, cleanliness of hotel, lobby, elevators,,,,They need to gut it and make it nicer. Probably change of General Mgmt.

Sits in a rather bad 3 to 4 block stretch of Market Street. Not safe at night..Dealers and homeless all over.

Luckily the metro and tram stopped in front of hotel, so that was convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom
review.locationRemarks: not good. Crack dealers and homeless people everywhere. Better to have paid a bit more and stayed closer to Union Square/ 5th/ Market

review.title: Charming historic hotel in need of renovations
review.reviewText: Charming and clean, this hotel is old both in a historic sense and in a "why haven't you modernized your rooms" sense. Beds, carpeting, furniture, TV, lamps, and clock radio appear to be from the 1980s/early 90s. Time for a renovation. WiFi was free (bonus!) but slow... Location is conveniently near the BART Civic Center stop on Market St; easy to train to/from SFO.

photos.caption: bed (i should have taken this before sleeping in it)

review.title: Great place to stay :)
review.reviewText: this hotel was great! I was a little skeptical from the reviews I had read before going but they were great. A few blocks from Union Square and right by City Hall. The area looks sketchy because there are a lot of homeless and druggies in the area but nobody ever approached us or harassed us and we always saw police hanging around so it's pretty safe. Just be cautious like you would be in any other foreign city. But other than that, we had no worries with the hotel. :)
review.positiveRemarks: literally right by a BART station.
review.negativeRemarks: the people around the hotel location
review.locationRemarks: close to everything and streetcar stop right in front of the hotel

review.title: Nice place, fair price
review.reviewText:
It is a nice mature hotel. Being a technology person, an improvement in the wireless networking would be good.

I would prefer that the hotel updated their WLAN and the availability of plugs in the room.

Also, one thing that would make the bathroom experience a bit better, is using the arched shower curtain rod. the space in the shower is so limited, the curtain sticks to you as you shower. if they just changed the rod, it would make a significant improvement.

Other than a couple of small nits, I enjoyed my stay.
review.negativeRemarks: WLAN rarley worked
review.locationRemarks: not good if attending an event at the convention center

review.title: I would stay somewhere else next time.
review.reviewText: Lots of street noise, even though my room was at the back of the Hotel (away from Market St.) Room was not clean. Television gave trouble and it took 2 days for the staff to deal with it. Lights were not working and needed to be fixed. Location was convenient for me, but if I had to do it again I would choose somewhere else.

review.title: Very disapointed customer!
review.reviewText: My daughter and I was very disappointed! we changed rooms three times and was still not happy. the rooms were dusty the linen wasn't washed clean still had stains lip stick, blood,and the stains were very noticeable because the bedding was white. the bath and shower had mildew and rust the sink was backing up with water the toilet had rust inside and out the sinks tiny and the walls had spots and stains. the lobby furniture was old and run down with stains.don't be fooled by the pictures online they must be propped. One thing I must say the manager tried to help but all the rooms were the same.
review.negativeRemarks: everthing
review.locationRemarks: was in a bad spot bums begging and hustlers out to the side,to walk to any of the tourist attractions you had to go through the bums and the hustlers

review.title: NIce hotel - Thug life surrounding
review.reviewText: Great hotel, crappy area. I had fun but definitly got harrased by bum thugs in the area. My girl is cute and they would leave her alone, no shame or respect.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything but lots of homeless.

review.title: Great visit
review.reviewText: Hotel was charming, clean and comfortable. Staff was helpful and pleasant. Public transportation was readily accessible, clean and efficient. We were surprised at the number of homeless, street people outside, more than we're accustomed to seeing in NYC, and a bit more aggressive. Perhaps a larger police presence in the area would help.
review.negativeRemarks: condition of the neighborhood
review.locationRemarks: Great location in terms of geography, not a great neighborhood.

review.title: Nice Hotel - Too Many Homeless People Everywhere
review.reviewText: Booked three rooms with Expedia. Had a confirmed itinerary. Girl at the front desk said one of our rooms was cancelled the day we booked. I had also called the day before and the person on the phone confirmed our reservation for three rooms and said we were all set. The woman at the front desk then tried to call expedia and could not reach anyone. She finally gave us the third room key after a half hour of giving us the run around. Never heard anything about it again. I think someone at the hotel screwed up and they could have at least apologized for the inconvenience. Not a good way to start our vacation. Also, too many bums hanging around the front door. Kind of creepy.
review.negativeRemarks: Bad service at the front desk
review.locationRemarks: Too many bums everywhere

review.title: Overall Great Place
review.reviewText: This was a really great hotel but remember that it is a historic hotel. So if you are looking for all the greatest technology, and a ton of three pronged wall plugs this may not be it. It has an old feel but extremely regal and fun. If you want the longterm residence feel I would not think of coming here but again for a few nights I think it is a great place to be.

review.title: Enjoyed older hotel
review.reviewText: Over charged for parking. Didn't understand why restaurant was not open of evening meals.
review.negativeRemarks: No dinner restaurant open
review.locationRemarks: Okay - Near bus and trolley

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The bedroom was small, but luxurious. The bed was extremely comfortable and the sheets were high quality.

review.title: Victorian Hotel at it's Best
review.reviewText: It's has a very nice Victorian feel. The bathroom could use a little updating. The beds were very comfortable. The sheets and duvet were very clean. I think it's important to know that they only have vallet parking $ 39.00. I would recooment this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: I would have liked cheaper parking, I thought $ 40.00 was a bit much.
review.locationRemarks: Great! Right by the symphony.

review.title: Mediocre hotel hides behind "historic" title
review.reviewText:
The "historic charm" of this hotel is a cover for a crappy hotel. The WiFi doesn't really work. The massive old building doesn't allow cell phone coverage to penetrate into the building. I was in a communications black hole in my room.

Some rooms are half old and crappy with some parts new and modern for a muddled feel that doesn't make me feel happy and at ease. The electrical outlets are worn out and feel shoddy. The mattresses are worn and have divots.

And the location of the hotel means that you're going to be wading through homeless people and crackheads to get to your room. Then you need to show your room key to enter the hotel -- just like as if your mom was standing there checking in on you when you got home. And the elevators are slow, cramped and not all of them work. If you need to check out and are in a hurry, its best to carry your luggage down the badly designed stairs. Waiting for an elevator that you might fit into could take 20 minutes.

If you're retired and want to experience a "historic" hotel and don't care about modern amenities, then this hotel is fine. For anyone else, don't stay here! Find something else.
review.negativeRemarks: The decor, the useless WiFi, the dangerous outlets and the total communications black hole that was my room.
review.locationRemarks: Crack heads and homeless people will escort you to your hotel. Avoid Market street like the plague.

review.title: very decent hotel at a very decent price
review.reviewText:
Very pleasant hotel. The neighborhood is about 3 blooks into a more suspect one, but the hotel is very pleasant.

Positives are
Location..RIGHT next to BART. Downtown SF. Decent dinining
Price. Great value
beautiful lobby and well maintained.

Negatives are...TV and stations that it gets. lack of coffee maker

review.title: Outdated rooms.
review.reviewText: While the lobby and restaurant of this hotel are beautiful the rooms need updating.

review.title: Beautiful old hotel
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful old hotel, with a stunning lobby and reception area, as well as other areas for public use. There is lots of marble, and sparkly glass chandeliers - very impressive on entry. There is a Starbucks attached on one side, and a restaurant on the other. My room was spotless, although a little more tired that the reception areas. No sign of bed bugs. It was spacious, had lots of storage and wardrobe space, and had a good sized bathroom and plenty of hot water (although it takes a while to come through). The room was a fraction too cold at times, and I would've liked a spare blanket, but it was otherwise very comfortable. There is free wifi throughout the hotel (even up on the 7th floor where I was). The manager was very helpful with faxing some documents abroad for me, and the concierge was very helpful with local information, maps, and booking an airport shuttle. Although I didn't use it, the BART runs from the airport, and the Civic Centre stop is literally right outside the hotel. San Francisco is a wonderful city to explore, and this hotel was great. Although the local area itself is not too good, there are streetcars right outside the door to take you into town or wherever else you want to go. There are a lot of homeless people around the area at night, but it's fine during the day. I'm a single female traveller, and they weren't a problem at all, although I didn't go out late at night. It helped having the local transport so close. Recommended.
review.positiveRemarks: Good sized spotlessly clean bedroom and bathroom with plenty of storage, and free wifi throughout the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: No spare blanket in the room for slightly chillier nights
review.locationRemarks: Near the beautiful City Hall, Symphony building, & Opera House. A little rough at night but fine during the day. Close to streetcar & BART stops

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms seemed recently renovated and were quite nice. The bathroom had a granite walk in shower and great water pressure. I had a room with 2 double beds. The room had a deck and an addition sitting chair. There was also a small walk-in closet However, the room was very small. At most the room was 200sq ft. The bathroom was also very small and a very tall person may have trouble using the toilet as it is very close to the sink and the door. Also, they have not updated the rooms to flat screen televisions but the television was of a good size and had good reception and channels. WiFi was free at the hotel but it was so slow (probably too many users) that I was unable to use it on my laptop, Nook tablet and iphone. There is no coffee maker in the room but my room had shampo, conditioner, skin lotion and had and body bars of soap. In the lobby there is a real Starbucks and right outside the door are the stairs to the civic center BART. The halls were clean and the elevators never had a wait despite the hotel being quite busy. Based on the quality of the furnishings in the room (despite the TV) and the cleanliness this would have been a 4 star hotel if it had larger rooms. I was quite impressed with this hotel. I have staid in many hotels in San Francisco (omni, westin, w, hilton, palace, hyatt- just to name a few) and this hotel is quite a bit cheaper, in a very convenient location and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: wifi too slow and tv not flat screen
review.locationRemarks: the neighborhood has some homeless but its not unsafe at all. Great location for public transit.

review.title: You get what you pay for - nothing more
review.reviewText: Quite dated and the rooms are not the biggest - the bathroom was tiny and horribly designed. HOWEVER, for the location (aside from all the homeless people in the area) and the price it's perfectly decent. The staff were also very helpful and cheerful.

review.title: Charming SF hotel
review.reviewText: The day I went I was given a room without any view, since they were full, but they switched me to another room the next day which was very nice and overlooking Market St. The building is old, but they take reasonable care of it.
review.negativeRemarks: old building
review.locationRemarks: prime location - on Market St; 4 (though long) blocks from cable cars.

review.title: Great hotel - if you like camping and gangsters.
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel was dreadful - Right off market and 8th. I had several people tell me they would NEVER walk there at night - which I had to do for over a week.. Staying at the hotel was like "camping" .. I fortunately enjoy camping so it wasn't too bad. In fact, there were quite a few people camping outside the hotel as well! - all curled up in sleeping bags and news paper. They definitely didn't hesitate to ask me for my spare change. They had really funny cigarettes - often smelled the scent of burning leaves.

Oh - The internet didn't work - *at all* .. But they are proud to tell you that they have FREE WIRELESS!
review.positiveRemarks: I like the *idea* of the hotel, the execution was somewhat poor
review.negativeRemarks: The location - between two gentlemen's clubs - was kind of sketchy at best. Plus to get to any "civilization" you had to walk about 4 blocks
review.locationRemarks: If you like schizoid gang members and drunk people asking for your money, this is the place for you!

review.title: BAD LOCATION
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel is great except the location which has a lot of homeless people for 5 blocks both directions on the same street. Until San Francisco takes care of this situation we won't be staying on the street this hotel is on. This is too bad for the hotel when it has everything else going for it.
review.positiveRemarks: THE BEAUTY OF THIS OLD HOTEL.
review.negativeRemarks: LOCATION
review.locationRemarks: NOT JUST A FEW BUT A LOT OF HOMELESS PEOPLE IN FRONT OF THE HOTEL AND FOR ABOUT 5 BLOCKS.

review.title: We Loved It!
review.reviewText: We loved it! It's a historic hotel. The rooms are quaint, the bathroom is not huge. The bed was comfortable and everything was neat and tidy. The front desk and concierge staff was helpful. The restaurant/bar was convenient and had such good service we ate there twice! We will stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Historic and not your ordinary hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was chilly if the door was shut. Big whoop.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to public transporation.

review.title: review Whitcomb
review.reviewText:
Public areas are old but well kept and interesting woodwork etc. Standard rooms are not comfortable, vanity in bathroom not big enough for a shaving kit etc, hardly room to shower.
TV very old and small, couldn't read text on screen, very outdated. After complaining, I was moved to a bigger room which helped.
review.negativeRemarks: old room,
review.locationRemarks: location sketchy neighbourhood, wouldn't walk after dark.

review.title: It was ok.
review.reviewText:
It was scary to find throughout the hotel signs explaining the risks of cancer and possible birth defects from being exposed to substances within the hotel.
Because is an old hotel, you can hear EVERYTHING. You can hear the roms adjacent to yours, the people walking and talking in the hallways, even the elevator bells when it arrives to the floor.
Now, being a little bit picky, the pillows were not nice, the shower head was low and with poor water pressure and trying to get to the parking are is cumbersome when you first arrive.
review.locationRemarks: Nice central location.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb- filthy!!
review.reviewText: Filthy hotel room!! Switched hotel rooms after one night. The dirt & grime has been there for weeks or months. Kept telling my 2yo not to touch anything. Bathroom was probably the worst, but the carpet came in at close second to worse. Terrible experience.

review.title: I LEFT MY "DISGUST" IN SAN FRANSISCO!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a satisfactory place to stay, however, the overnight parking of $35 was outrageous. Although listed as an"historic" hotel, , nowhere can you find the Hotel Whitcomb on a city map handout. What was highly unsatisfactory is the area in which it is located! The main street shops are covered with bad graffiti. We were never warned about, and have never been accosted by so many beggars (even in 3rd world countries) as we have on Market Street in San Fransisco!The streets are hosed down every morning to get rid of the human spittle, excrement, and garbage. You may celebrate the differences in the people who live there, however, one has to wonder why the supposedly greatest country in the world cannot look after its poor. I suppose a city built on corruption deserves the dregs of society living on its streets, however, don't expect kind people from other countries to alleviate your problem with handouts! If I had my druthers, I would never visit San Fransisco again!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Sam's Diner across the street had meals that were tasty, and reasonably priced.
review.negativeRemarks: The outlandish prices for tasteless meals in the Market Street Grill- the hotel's restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: see above!

review.title: dirty room
review.reviewText: The room is small and dirty. Parking is expensive at 35$ a night (not for 24 hours).

review.title: Retreat, Retreat..
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in serious need of a make over. The plumbing was suspect with the tub not draining fast enough to handle the shower flow, and some leaking around the toilet handle.

The WIFI was terrible and was just unusable. The staff never asked me if I wanted a non-smoking room so I got stuck smelling smoke all night. The place seems to be falling apart everywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Network Connection
review.locationRemarks: On the edge of dodgy

review.title: SF trip
review.reviewText: Need to improve their internet connection which was very slow. Food was great especially the breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Slow internet connection
review.locationRemarks: The area is 10 mins walk from Union Square.

review.title: Great Hotel for the price
review.reviewText: The staff were very helpful. Lots of old world charm here. Location was great. We would definitely return.
review.negativeRemarks: toilet
review.locationRemarks: convenient to the Bart station

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: Poor hotel, very old, poorly maintained, sketchy people staying there
review.negativeRemarks: $40 parking per day

review.title: Great historic hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb was delightful, 100 years old last year, we had an enjoyable stay. The room and beds were extremely comfortable, pleasant decor and gorgeous old woodwork. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Great location-it was within walking distance of the main shopping district, cable car, BART, street cars, museums, opera house. We didn't eat in the restaurant so I can't comment on that.

review.title: Please don't stay here
review.reviewText: Run down, dirty, and in a terrible neighborhood. Lights in room didn't work. Bathroom was disgusting. Please don't stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: Jan at the gift shop was very good
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaniness
review.locationRemarks: Scary and depressing

review.title: uncomfortable stay
review.reviewText: the room is small with smell, the electricity plugs are lower placed on the wall, unaccessible, there is no space to put coffee maker, the restroom is small, no place to put toothbrush and cup, the ventilation does not work in the restroom. if you have a car, do not choose the downtown hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: small and bad smell
review.locationRemarks: downtown close to convention center

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: It is the best most friendliest, cleanist, proffesional hotel in San Francisco. The staff is very nice and take care of everyone. Security is friendly as well. The hotel overall is great i stay there at least 2 or 3 weeks through out the year.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Horrible Valet Service
review.reviewText: The valet was horrible. They left my headlights on so the car was dead by the next day. It then took them 30 minutes to jump-start my car. They were also very rude about the whole situation.

review.title: Unhappy stay!
review.reviewText: We had requested and prepaid for a Superior room, but upon check-in we were told by the unhelpful front desk agent that we were assigned a Standard room. NOT impressed as we were staying for 3 nights! The bed linens were stained, the window was too dirty to enjoy the view, and the bed itself sagged severely in the middle, making for a very uncomfortable, interrupted sleep. The internet center had been hacked the previous day and was not usable until our last day. Also there is no breakfast buffet as indicated. What is really sad is the building itself is beautiful and with some TLC and helpful staff, it could be a decent place to stay!
review.positiveRemarks: Gorgeous historical building with great proximity to Bill Graham Civic Center.
review.negativeRemarks: The condition of the room's bed and bedding.
review.locationRemarks: Bordering on the Tenderloin - expect to see groups of homeless people outside the hotel, especially at night.

review.title: okay for families
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful. The rooms were small, but nice. The people who worked there were polite, but not friendly or overly helpful. The only exception were the doormen who were so helpful and friendly. They both went out of their way to help us.
review.negativeRemarks: size of rooms/shower
review.locationRemarks: not within walking distance to many tou

review.title: Whitcomb Review
review.reviewText: Whether or not this hotel is infested with bedbugs is unclear. What is clear is that I woke up each morning with fresh bites on my body that appeared as large, red welts. Do not stay at this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: North Beach is a far superior neighborhood.

review.title: Nice hotel in a sketchy neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby area is nice however the rooms are not very up to date. In addition, the rooms are very small. We were given a complimentary upgrade to our room and I'm not sure what was upgraded about the room. I would have hated to seen a standard room. The area around the hotel is filled with a lot of sketchy people and a lot of bums hanging around. The hotel is convenient in that it is right in front of a train stop.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf or Union Square... Nicer areas and you're right in the middle of everything.

review.title: The worth hotel ever
review.reviewText: It is so old, dirty and even you do not dare to sit in the bath tub. It was on sale and I wanted to try it. They charge $35 per night for parking Excluding tax (Ridiculous). Downstairs and hallways seems luxury but the rooms are like an old prison. do not go there even if they offered it for free. You will be disappointed. The worst and dirtiest place ever I have seen in US. I am curious how come department of health does not go and check them!!!!

review.title: Bed bugs
review.reviewText: Bed bugs!

review.title: Old World Charm meets Street Smarts
review.reviewText:
Hotel Whitcomb is for people who enjoy old architecture, who want to be in a central spot transit-wise, and who have a tolerance for grit.

Situated in the Tenderloin region of San Fran, it is not for the faint of heart. Although the hotel itself served all the basic needs I required, as a solo female traveller, I had some difficulty feeling comfortable walking around the immediate area due to the large amounts of drunk/high vagrants on the street. I'm from a big city - I don't scare easily - but when I first surfaced onto Market St. from the underground train station and essentially walked right into a violent fight/chasing/screaming match between two homeless men, I was a little concerned that I'd made a bad choice. My first impression was rough - but the city was so great overall, I chose to forgive this experience....

After 4 days in the San Fran, my advice to any solo female travellers is simple: feel free to walk/take transit/streetcars/cable cars from your hotel during the day, and stick to cabs at night. The hotel is actually in a pretty great location for most things - I walked all the way to Haight-Ashbury, was right on the bus line for Mission District, and right on the streetcar line to head up to Alcatraz.

Just be smart at night - aware of your surroundings - and like I did, decline the offer for drugs at 6am from the dudes on the street when you're hitting the streets early to get back to the airport...... :)
review.locationRemarks:
I absolutely fell in love with the Mission District in San Fransisco. If you are in any way artistically bent, it is a neighbourhood you must experience. I walked around for 5 hours taking in the mind blowing murals, enjoying great food/pastries at the Mexican establishments, awesome iced coffee at a place called Philz Coffee, and super cool shops and boutiques along the way.

Creativity is in the air, coolness everywhere, and friendly people too. The kind of hood you could see yourself living in.......

review.title: Nice old hotel -- very comfortable
review.reviewText: The Hotel Whitcomb's lobby is pretty with nice Victorian decor. Our room was clean and comfortable (and there were no bed bugs). I liked it that we were just a short walk to Davies Symphony Hall and we got a good deal on the price. The neighborhood is a little rough but we had no problems at all.

review.title: Nice Lobby, 2nd rate rooms
review.reviewText:
Be repaired to research parking, it is not easy and the staff will not help you even if you call them. They only tell you, parking is in back, but it's the weird streets of San Francisco which make it a challenge. The Hotel's parking is $10 Dollars above the average for down town parking lots.

If you are planning on getting a web discount, they will make up the difference in charges, i.e., Wifi $10 per night, Parking $35 per night, hotel fees and taxes can total equal to your so called discounted reservation charges.

Don't plan on walking to a dinner, there are few around, but nothing worth going to and in the winter, it gets windy and cold out there.

The lobby is beautiful, but that is about all. The beds look like Hotel 6 and the room itself., well, it's a closet at most.

San Francisco is not Tourist friendly. Everything is over priced, especially if you are driving. Street parking meters through-out SF runs around .25 cents for 8 minutes up to $3 dollars per hour and don't over pay, it keeps your coins, no refund, no change, no meter credits either, you lose.

Do not park over night in the streets, THEY WILL TOW IT!! After the meter runs out, your car IS GONE!!

The hotel dinning is okay, only okay, and a little on the high side.

Now, to be fair, San Francisco has worse hotels and you could get one of those by chance. I did feel safe and slept well, no noises, no other complaints.
review.locationRemarks:
San Francisco Airport area because of parking. I have stayed in that area and had no problems finding the hotel and parking was abundant. Also, most Airport hotels provide free Wifi and you usually get breakfast included if you research.

They seem to be adequate for the traveler, clean fresh linen, coffee makers, irons, newspapers, swimming pool, gym and other amenities this hotel did not have available.

review.title: Great location for Symphony, Opera & Civic Center
review.reviewText: My wife and I have stayed at the Whitcomb a number of times when attending the Symphony & Opera. The location is ideal as the hotel is within walking distance of both locations. It is also close to Muni, BART, Asian Art Museum and theater district. We love the Whitcomb and will not hesitate to stay again

review.title: Great place for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb is an old hotel with old world San Francisco charm. The doorman was charming, the room was very comfortable. Civic Center BART station is conveniently located just steps from the entrance; a Starbucks in the lobby, and very reasonably priced. A little more attention to detail regarding cleanliness (some mold spotted in the rest room and the windows were filthy) would have made my stay all the nicer, but overall it's a great value and recommended.

review.title: Convenient location, not so great neighborhood.
review.reviewText: The room was clean. However, there seemed to be no place to hang the clothing.
review.locationRemarks: This area is good except for the very large population of homeless.

review.title: Will stay again
review.reviewText:
Hotel Whitcomb, San Francisco. Oct. 2011
Stayed here a few years ago and again due to convenience taking Bart from airport to literally the hotel door steps. Room this time was smaller burt clean linens and towel as before. Some renovations going on like a few years prior. Front desk cordial, stowed our luggage as we were early to check in until our room was available so we could roam around.

review.title: Get home by nightfall...
review.reviewText:
Our room was fine. It was large enough to be comfortable, but certainly could use some upgrading. The TV was small/dated, the tile in the bathroom was in need of repair and the window opened up to a building next door.

The surrounding neighborhood made my mom a bit squirmish, but the throngs of panhandlers and loiterers seemed harmelss enough.

review.title: ?? Business Friendliness
review.reviewText: The location was great for a weekend getaway. The hotel was not as equipped as other locations to handle my computer connections. I had to get an adapter from the front desk to allow my power-surge connections to work. They were very accommodating. The convenient BART connection was enviable and a great convenience.

review.title: Great for our stay
review.reviewText: Within walking distance to Union Square and great breakfast places. Lots of access to BART and cabs. Easy parking and freeway access too. Staff was friendly. Can't complain...

review.title: Bed bug infestation
review.reviewText:
I stayed here from Oct 23-26 2011. I woke up a few days later with itchy bed bug bites. Now I'm still waiting to see if I was unfortunate enough to bring any back with me.

Check the bed bug registry--there have been several recent reports of bed bugs and the hotel is apparently doing very little to address the issue or compensate travelers.

Stay elsewhere.

review.title: Great historic hotel - nice architecture
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the architecture of the hotel lobby and restaurant/bar area

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: Decent hotel in a convenient area, if you can get a good price.

review.title: November travelling
review.reviewText:
Hotel was great but the neighbourhood was a bit sketchy
Muni stop right out side hotel made getting around convenient, few restaurants in the area

review.title: Great location, not so great customer service
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Hotel Whitcomb the week of November 6th, 2011. The location was nice and centrally located. The hotel is 100 yrs old and I love staying in historic places. Upon arrival we waited 20 minutes in the valet area for help. There are no bellman to assist with luggage. At the front desk the 2 employees chatted in spanish for about 10 minutes while i stood alone in the line. Anxiously waiting to check in. His name was Harvey and he noticed me multiple times, even made eye contact but continued his conversation with the woman attendent that was personal about his social life. Finally, she looked up and was a bit surprised thay i was standing there.
Our room was clean and comfortable but I will always remember the lack of service and hospitality.

review.title: If you need a cheap place to stay
review.reviewText: We got this hotel through Expedia's unpublished offers. It was in a good location for us and it was right next to the BART station. Best place to hang out in the evening? Probably will be uncomfortable for some. The room we were in could have used some touching up. If they invested a bit more into upgrading the hotel and units, they'd have a gem on their hands. I wouldn't recommend this place if you're expecting something plush and charming. If you can get it cheap, then it's not a bad deal. There's a Starbucks downstairs and the staff is nice.

review.title: This was a last minute choice and except for the neighborhood the hotel was fine!
review.reviewText: Exceptional service, comfortable, clean room, very small bathroom, good restaurant for breakfast and a Starbucks in the hotel. Trolley car and bus stop right in front of hotel. Very convenient. BUT too many street people in area.
review.locationRemarks: I would recommend staying around Union Square or on lower Market Street.

review.title: small, clean, old
review.reviewText:
The hotel is In good condition, nice, friendly staff.. the rooms are small (as expected of a city hotel) and clean, they smell a bit at first, probably bc of the carpets (it goes away with the a/c) and old (dont expect a flat screen tv). The restrooms are tiny TINY. SF is full of homeless people, and they all seem to be in this particular street.
The best thing about the hotel? JAN, the concierge. Shes a nice lady that works in the store and as a concierge. Shes very busy, but knows EVERYTHING about SF, and will give you the best tips and book you the best tours.

review.title: Poor Quality and Service in the worst part of Market
review.reviewText: Rude staff, run down, and you walk out in to the few blocks of ghetto... go anywhere else! you feel plain unsafe in the neighborhood and dirty in your room.

review.title: GOOD LOCATION
review.reviewText: GOOD LOCATION. FAR FOR THE PRICE. ROOMS NOT BIG, BUT COMFORTABLE

review.title: Whitcomb may be Old but it's convenient, and affordable
review.reviewText: As a historic hotel you may not get all the modern conveniences how much do you need if you don't spend all your time in a hotel room. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the location is right at a BART/Muni station with access to all the city has to offer.
review.locationRemarks: If you are looking for more convenience for restaurants and entertainment try the Embarcardero.

review.title: Ok but not fabulous
review.reviewText:
Arrived late to not get the room we had booked with 2 doubles. Then waited for a long time for reception staff to finally give us a room with a king bed and then move to what we had booked the next day. The room had no window and was noisy. The next day we moved to a more acceptable room.
The hotel is old but the rooms are renovated to some extent. It was clean and did the job in the end. Just wished they had given us what we paid for in the first place.
review.locationRemarks: If your a tourist then stay a Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: absolutely great experience, outstanding service
review.reviewText: absolutely great experience, outstanding service

review.title: Good hotel and price, but questionable neighborhood
review.reviewText: The staff was fantastic and the price was great. It's super conveniently located off the BART and F line MUNI, but it doesn't feel like the safest neighborhood. I'd recommend staying there, but budgeting in cabs for returning home at night.

review.title: Not that Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was pretty, but what was around it was scary!!! Also it is really annoying that you have to pay to use the business center. Very pricey. The room was really clean.

review.title: Good value or money
review.reviewText:
"Historic" hotel needing some upgrading. Good restraunt and local diners.

Location excellent for central SF facilities. F tram stops just outside hotel.

Lot of homeless / street dwellers around neighborhood can be intimidating.

Generally large number of homelss people on most central city streets as compared to many other US cities.

review.title: Historical Whitcomb Hotel will work in a pinch
review.reviewText: Whitcomb Hotel (opened in 1916) retains much of its early luster, but could use some additional renovation. Rooms were clean, but the bathroom had minimal room for toiletries or other items. The door to the bathroom would not close due swelling in the jamb, electrical outlets were few and inconvenient for charging phones, cameras, etc….but these minor inconveniences are to be expected in an aged queen in the City. It is located on Market Street with stations for buses, trollies, and BART just outside the front door, and the “Hop-on, Hop-off” city tour buses will also pick you up just around the corner. You can take a brisk walk to Union Square, good restaurants, and historic bars…but recommend most people don’t spend any time walking in the Whitcomb area after sunset. All in all, it was well worth the attractive price since all Union Square hotels were booked for a large convention.
review.locationRemarks: I typically enjoy staying in one of the many hotels near Market Street in the Mason and Powell Street area. It is very close to Union Square, and provides quick access to all transportation options including the Mason Street Trolley to Fisherman’s Wharf. Many great restaurants are in the area, as well as historic bars such as The Gold Dust Lounge and Lefty O’Doul’s.

review.title: The location is good but the service is bad
review.reviewText: Very good location, very old building. When we checkin and when the lady at frontdesk know we are book the hotel from Expedia, she seems very unhappy, and the service is really not good.

review.title: location
review.reviewText: location is so so

review.title: Lovely decorated!
review.reviewText: My husband and I went their for our honeymoon. We got to check in very early, allowing us to hit Alcatraz without worrying about our luggage. Location was decent, only 6 or so blocks from Union Square...definitely within walking distance. The only real complaint I had was that the AC in the room was extremely noisy when it came on, which means that I woke up at least 2 or 3 times each night. Otherwise, it a great stay!

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: We were greeted adequately upon arrival. The room was very small. There was not enough room to put out our toothbrush and all by the sink. There was a drip from the sink. The shower needed some new caulking. Someone tried to re-grout the tile floor but ruined the tile in the process. Our TV remote did not work however they repaired that almost instantly. We did not encounter any bedbugs as stated on the internet by others. The room and hotel were clean. This is a historical building so it's just old. We left one day early. I also was not thrilled by the $40 a day parking fee additional to our room fee.

review.title: A very mixed bag
review.reviewText: Outstanding location, right up from the Civic Center Bart Station. Effortless trip to and from the airport. Friendly staff. The rooms are small but I was not in my room much. The bed was comfortable. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls. Elevators were pretty filthy. Nice to have a Starbucks attached to the hotel. This place needs a little TLC and it will be very nice. I was very startled by the number of homeless in the neighborhood. Wear headphones and they won't bother you. This problem has definitely increased since my last visit. I would stay there again.

review.title: Old but still good
review.reviewText:
The hotel is old, the carpet and walls seems like a hounted mansion.
But they try to keep a good service.
The location is very good, close to everywhere

review.title: Nice old hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very beautiful. You could tell it was built some time ago but we still enjoyed it. My wife loved it more then I did but we still had a good time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were within walking distance to things we wanted to see and to our tour bus stop.
I did have some trouble sleeping with a loud A/C unit and could hear everything in the hall but other then that the bedroom was nice and comfortable. When we go back we would consider this hotel again.

review.title: OOW visit
review.reviewText: Staff is good. But hotel looks very old and importantly none of the plug points really work in the room. I had to charge my cell phone in the conference as my plug adapter does not fit into any of the plug points. Hopefully they replace all those old plug points.

review.title: Great historic hotel
review.reviewText: Was initially scared to book here because of the other reviews but took a gamble on it anyway. I'm glad I did. My room was clean and the bed was very comfortable, no complaints. PERFECT location. Not super sketchy like others say. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: 3 Star On A Budget
review.reviewText: If you are not afraid of mass transit (get a Clipper Card at Walmart the second you roll in and add automatic refresh link to your credit card), centrally located in the very undesirable Civic Center neighborhood but close to everything else (3 blocks from Powell Cable Car/Bloomingdales, etc). Nice Asian restaurants in SOMA 3 to 4 blocks away.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
The pictures on expedia made the hotel appear much nicer than it actually was...

For a 3.5 star hotel it felt more like a 2. Funny odor, very small room..

The only thing that saved this hotel from being a complete disappointment was the service at the front desk and the guys handling the transportation.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb Review
review.reviewText: A pretty good hotel. Building was a little old, rooms a little small, and a little over priced. Service was good.

review.title: if you can get a good deal, it's fine
review.reviewText: if you can get a good deal, it's fine. we probably didn't get the best room, since we used a short-notice deal, but it seemed like a nice hotel. the bathroom was a bit cramped, and there was dust under the bed. internet was REALLY slow. it was fine for checking email, planning events, but it was impossible to stream video.

review.title: Definitely not 3.5 star
review.reviewText:
The Complimentary Internet is slower than 3G. Turn out we have to rely on our 3G service. The hotel is too old and not kept up with. The whole place smells old. The air-conditioner is super noisy when the cold air is selected. Not happy about it. Not want to stay longer than I need to. It doesn't deserve 3.5 star, I would think it's only 2 star.

Staff are nice. Nothing to complain about. They helped us whatever we needed.

review.title: Smack dab in crackville
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean but old, bathroom sucked and the shower was designed for midgets. Crackheads right outside the hotel always begging. Great access to public transportation is the big bonus of this hotel. If they could get rid of all the beggers from the front of the hotel this would be a decent location.

review.title: You are not alone....
review.reviewText: Decent public spaces, bad rooms.... was trying to stay positive but threw in the towel when 2... let's call them large mice... ran across my room

review.title: 40 dollars parking
review.reviewText: i like old hotel but not collapsing down

review.title: Historic most certainlly is old
review.reviewText: The hotel smells old. My room in particular smelled like there was a sewerage issue. The bed was very comfortable and the place was ultimately clean. Internet can get VERY slow. I was only on the second floor, I figured it would be good, but it wasnt. The location is great, unfortunately no where you go, can you get away from the homless problem. WHen I arrived at almost 3p, there was a LINE to check in and no one seemed to be bothered.

review.title: Abysmal
review.reviewText: No way we would have stayed here if the room hadn't been prepaid. Hallways were dark and musty. Between our room and the lobby we had to walk past little piles of towels, a stack of broken furniture, an old candy machine on a dolly - none of which moved during our stay. The room itself was poorly maintained - broken light switch, broken deadbolt - and though we asked that the light be fixed it never was. Staff treated us like walking workload. It took three waits in line, two phone calls, and an argument with a too-busy-for-you manager just to get a key that actually opened the door to our room! We spent as little time in this depressing place as possible.

review.title: Best Bed Ever
review.reviewText: The staff was always very helpful, super friendly and courteous, even when we arrived at about 12:30 am. They were very knowledgable about the area, even gave us a guide book of the surrounding San Francisco area. The hotel was gorgeous, the room was very nice, and the bed . . THE BEST bed I have ever slept in while traveling. I could have stayed in it all day. My only complaint is that the bottom of the tub could have been a little cleaner, but just probaly needs to be re-finished.

review.title: Historic, but outdated
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb states it's hostoric, and it is. But it needs to update its rooms and amenities. It's a reasonable price, but if your expecting a relaxing environment, don't stay here.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because it was within a short distance from the Theatre we were attending that night. The check in process took over an hour with short tempered check-in staff. The check-in line was very long with only 2 staff members checking them in. The lobby was full of luggage piled in and around the check-in line and we noticed several people tripping over them. The bell staff stood around talking and even though they saw the luggage they did nothing to move it out of the way. After attending the theater that evening we returned to the hotel and all of the hotel restaurants, bars, snack bars were closed. The front desk said if we wanted any refreshments we would have to purchase them from the vending machines on each floor. Since the hotel did not provide room service and the area around the hotel was scary for seniors we were unable to get even a bottle of water and the vending machines on all the floor were out of water. The room was okay but had a old, musty smell and the bathroom was very small.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText:
Stayed with my family (2 adults, 2 older kids) for 6 nights. Beautiful historic hotel, good location and easily accessible to almost any site of interest. Clean spacious room, though lacks some important accessories (coffee maker, small refrigerator). The staff at the front desk did their (difficult) job OK, but could be more outgoing. In contrast, the women at the little shop ("concierge") were extremely friendly and patient and provided us with invaluable sightseeing information, as well as help with printing some pages (the printing quality at the business computer room was terrible).
You do see many homeless people on the streets around the hotel, but we did not feel intimated.
Overall my family enjoyed the stay tremendously, and were happy with the choice of the hotel.

review.title: not worth the price
review.reviewText: not much of value scary area

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb San Francisco
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, amazing architecture in the lobby, very elegant. The room was nice (very soft bed linen) and the bathroom was quaint with the toilet on a pedestal in an alcove. The only negative is the hotel is located in a rather "rough" area but if you stick to the tram instead of walking down Market Street to Union Sq. and the Fisherman's Wharf it isn't such a big deal.

review.title: Great historic hotel - next to Muni and Bart !
review.reviewText: This is my second stay at this hotel. It has a restaurant and Starbucks within the building. Security is great... there is a security guard at night who verifies you are a real guest, and there are cameras in the elevators and a camera on each floor in the elevator bank. The housekeeping is extremely friendly and the beds are super comfy. My only complaint was that the air conditioner appears to have been through a fire and no one had fixed it. It was unplugged and the plug and wall socket were both black (from a fire).

review.title: Very quiet hotel but small bathroom
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the stay at the hotel overall, except for that (1) the hotel tried to give us a different room than what we reserved and paid extra for and (2) a bathroom was very tiny. But I liked the antique aspect of the hotel. And most imporatntly, despite of the huge size of the building and a large number of guests (the front desk was always busy), it was very quiet and I found the bed comortable.

review.title: worst hotel
review.reviewText: dirty, bad smell, old, poor service. you have no reason to stay in such a bad hotel.

review.title: good deal for the price
review.reviewText: Last minute booking and still have vacant room, thus, happy with the stay overall.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb at San Francisco, not impressed
review.reviewText: Only the location was convenient to transport and point of interests. Old building and furnishing inside. Dark at the corridor, really project historic feel...large mirrors for special effect! Small room with some old smell. Not worth the money. Many homeless in nearby streets and bad smell on the streets.

review.title: Historic means run down
review.reviewText: Smoking room, poor lighting, dumpy bathroom

review.title: Solid Value
review.reviewText: Most people would say the location, "Mid-Market" was not attractive. For the price, however, I would say Whitcombe was an excellent value. The marble, wood and stained glass lobby was beautiful. The concierge was very pleasant and informative. The service was minimal, and the room was kind of small, but I really just needed a place to rest at night. The bed was very comfortable, and the linens were new and fresh. Kind of dated in the halls, but they also took you back to another era, so it's a bit of a case of the best traits were the worst traits. I never tried the restaurant, but I loved the fact that there was a Starbucks in the hotel. Don't expect a deluxe hotel but look forward to an old world atmosphere at a very good value.

review.title: Only if this is the best you can afford....
review.reviewText:
My husband and I chose this hotel because it looked very impressive on the website and the reviews were mixed so we decided to chance it for our week-long stay in San Francisco. Since we were not renting a car but planning to tour the city on foot we needed a hotel that was central to public transportation...the hotel passed for this. All we had to do was walk across the street and pick up a cable car or a few blocks away and grab a bus. Huge plus for us.

Downfalls...this hotel is on the edge of the Tenderloin District and we were urged to be back to the hotel before the sun set to avoid the danger of being mugged by the homeless people who camp out along Market. Not saying that it should stop anyone from choosing this hotel, but it is something to remember when choosing.

The rooms were decent considering when we were researching, there were many hotel options with shared bathrooms. However, if you want a working ice machine, either request a room not on the third floor (until they get a new machine) or be prepared to travel a floor or two to get some ice. The elevators worked in a timely fashion half the time we were there but a big plus is the stairs are easy to find.

The hotel restaurant is not a place we would recommend eating at considering the many, many other options within just a few blocks of the hotel. Ask around and find out what else is good.

Overall...stay if its all you can afford, but make sure you have ruled out all of your other options!

review.title: A real value
review.reviewText: I found this beautifully restored hotel to be a real find. It's one BART stop further from the Union Square area, but the lower nightly charge reflects this minor inconvenience.

review.title: Old hotel - dodgy location
review.reviewText:
I can honestly say I won't be staying here again. The old is very old and the walls were like paper. Our room was next to the lift so we heard everybody passing in the morning & night. I even heard the guy next door getting sick.
The rooms were v basic and as clean as could be expected for an old hotel.
Neighbourhood was a bit dodgy too with lots of homeless people hanging around.
Staff were friendly and efficient though.

review.title: Paper thin walls
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for an executive at my company. When they returned I was told to NEVER use this hotel again. Exact words were "Walls are paper thin and I could hear every word of conversations in both rooms next to me. And anytime a toilet flushed the pipes were LOUD in my room. NEVER AGAIN."

review.title: Good , economical hotel in Ok neighborhood
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful, gracious old Hotel, impeccibly maintained. It's in a good location. Accessing parking is a challenge the first time, but once you figure it out, it's fine. Good, clean, inexpensive diners across the street. It's very near the City Center including the fabulous Asian Museum. BUT, the neighborhhod gets a little seedy at night, so limit night travel to hopping in and out of a cab.

review.title: It was beautiful and clean.
review.reviewText: A Starbucks inside the hotel. Great bed. Wonderful and helpful staff. A couple little restaurants near by. Cable car and other transportation readily available. You wont be sorry. It is a really nice hotel.

review.title: Not What You Think
