review.reviewText: Really disappointing. Room is too small and very crowding. It seems as if the staff doesn't care for you really. Bathroom drain was clogged and toilet seat was broken like. We missed our plane flight because the concierge was rushing to appoint us our shuttle to the airport to make a few bucks from postcards that the appointed time she set was our arrival time instead of departure time, and the whole time while setting it up she was rude. We heard police cars everyday. Overall I wouldn't book a room there again.

review.title: Awesome Stay!
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay here. Loved my room and the location of the hotel to the BART system was perfect. TOTALLY happy with my trip because of the hotel.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText:
Our room smelled like stale cigarette smoke. It seemed like our first room was rented to us and but not cleaned after the previous guests. The bathroom was disgusting with hair on the floor and the shower. We had to ask 2 different mangers before we were given another room.The first manager completely blew off our request to move. Only when we came back and spoke with a different manger were our requests heard.
The second room was everything we expected and was comfortable and most importantly...clean! It was an interesting experience but probably not one I would care to repeat.kkkk

review.title: Right in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were lucky enough to get this hotel as a special deal--we didn't know the name of the hotel or its exact location until we booked. It is downtown, so we didn't have far to go to see the sights we wanted to see. It is an older hotel with great woodwork and at least 12 foot ceilings in the rooms. The beds were extremely comfortable. The only thing lacking was restaurants (with the exception of the hotel's) within walking distance. We would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Very seedy neighborhood
review.reviewText: Although a historic hotel, the aging building has seen better days. The Market Street neighborhood is quite " down market " . A short walk to Powell Street cable car, I would not suggest single women or easily intimidated men from walking the streets after dark. Room was clean, bathroom and toilet surprisingly large. Water volume and hot water outstanding. Popular with foreign tour groups. Given the choice I would not stay there again.

review.title: A Fantastic Surprise
review.reviewText:
I found the Hotel Whitcomb via a "secret hotel" deal on Expedia. I'd lived in San Francisco for five years and was a touch nervous about a hotel near Civic Center. But I'm so glad I did it.

The hotel is right above BART, so it's a quick and cheap trip from the airport. The staff were very courteous during check-in. The room was great: big, clean, and comfortable. There was a nice tub for relaxing after a long trip. The WiFi was free but a bit patchy. Don't plan on an extensive workout, as the gym is pretty small with very few machines.

Overall, the Whitcomb is amazing value for a San Francisco hotel. You can go four blocks towards Union Square and pay double or triple the rate. The immediate neighborhood (Civic Center) is a bit tougher. But I didn't mind it. And you can alway just grab a cab or run straight down to the MUNI.

Enjoy!

review.title: Ok, moderate when in a pinch
review.reviewText: Comfortable beds, nice architecture, good location, pretty quiet. Yucky gym. Bathroom kind of dirty. Took 30 minutes to check in. Only one person at desk at check in time. Pipes need major overhaul. Pipes sounded like they were going to explode everytime someone was using water -- which was all the time.

review.title: room waaay toooo smalllll
review.reviewText: see above

review.title: So-so
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to SF capitol building and museums. Cable car was right in front. Otherwide, this hotel has seen it's best years many years ago. I am sure this was the it place long ago, but it is an aged property and location is really it's only main selling point. If you are looking for a short term 1-2 days it will suffice, otherwise, look for another hotel.

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText:
Its 1-block from City Hall Market St location makes the Hotel Whitcomb a good choice for those who want to explore the city. Buses and trolleys stop outside the front door; BART is across the street; cable cars 4 blocks away. We walked EVERYWHERE from here- Fisherman's Wharf to Golden Gate Park.
Rooms are a little old fashioned but spacious & clean. Free TV is limited; rooms facing Market St can be noisy. Staff [including concierge, bell hop, doorman] are efficient and courteous. Lobby is beautiful! Don't let the largish number of vagrant types on Market scare you- like the city, they're pretty mellow!
Best surprise- the in-hotel restaurant, Market St Grill, is EXCELLENT and deserves more business: fresh imaginative delicious food, less pricey than a highly recommended place just up the street, but just as good.

review.title: Beautiful lobby - rest of the hotel not so much
review.reviewText: Extremely small rooms. Uncomfortable beds. Downtown location means you get to hear sirens all night long. We turned on our air conditioner to drown out the noise of the sirens but the a/c unit made a horrible noise that was worse than the sirens. On the plus side, the staff was courteous and the rooms were clean.

review.title: Quinn
review.reviewText: Hotel is old. But still very quaint. Good location. Went to the warfield. My room was a former smoking room. Smelled of smoke.

review.title: Faded glory
review.reviewText:
We prefer to make reservations at bed & breakfast inns or small boutique hotels for our accommodations when we travel out of town. So, on a recent trip to San Francisco, we chose a Historic Hotel of America, the Hotel Whitcomb on Market Street. Having had excellent experiences at 6 other of their locations (including Charleston, SC, as well as Savannah & Jekyll Island, GA) this location fell somewhat short of our expectations. Although it provided us with adequate accommodations, our room was in need of up-grades (carpets & window coverings, but most especially bathroom fixtures and amenities.) On a positive note, the staff was very accommodating and polite, the room was very clean and the price was certainly very modest.

In its heyday this hotel must have been opulent, but now its glory has faded.

review.title: Great location for transportation
review.reviewText: Can be a great value if you get one of their special rates. Transportation access is fantastic. Nearby neighborhood is a little sketchy but OK. Internet access is too slow. Still, it can be a great value in an expensive city.

review.title: Whitcomb Hotel
review.reviewText: The carpets on hallway are painted with some paint which is kind of toxic. My eyes started suddenly to cry, as a reaction, coming in contact with the substance of the paint in the carpet. The ventilation on the hallway is very bad. The restaurant is kind of dirty. The hotel being so old, they haven't renovated it in a very long time.

review.title: Perfect Location!! Had a wonderful time.
review.reviewText: At first we were nervous about the area but as we got used to the transit system the area worked just fine. For touring the city, this was the perfect location. The staff was great. Had a problem with the room and they moved us to a better room. I recommend at least a king size bedroom because the others are really small. The rooms are old and need updating but the value of the stay was great. Breakfast no problem because there is a Starbucks connected to the hotel and a subway and burger king right across the street.

review.title: San Francisco short stay
review.reviewText:
Hotel was great, however, some may not like the area where the hotel is located. Not a problem if you are a city dweller, but for those coming from small towns may find the neighborhood to be a bit rough. Lots of street people, people sleeping in the Bart Station.
Otherwise, the hotel was great. Rooms were big, Starbucks in the lobby.
Not a lot of food places around, other than Burger King and a diner. About a 15 minute walk to Powell and the Cable Car
Easy to get to Golden Gate Park, Union Square, etc.

review.title: Not impressed at all!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was ok for location u can walk pretty much anywhere from here!! The hotel staff was pretty nice and helpful!! But once I got in the room it is sooooo small and the bathroom was even smaller. The bathroom was Soooo nasty me and my wife had walk to the store to buy some flip flops So we can take a shower in that shower, it was pretty nasty their was black stuff all around that shower specially on the shower floor!!! The walls are Soooo thin we can hear the people next door being intimate!! Also as soon as u walk out the hotel their is lots of homeless people all around!! I don't think I'll stay here again!!!

review.title: Totally disappointed
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were very nice and friendly. The concierge service was excellent.
However, the walls are very thin. The noise from the street and the noise from the
hallway were enough to keep you from sleeping. This hotel seems to be party central for kids who party up an down the hallway all night long. Security doesn't seem to be able to keep a grip on it, and as far as any manager taking care of the problems or complaints, we could never seem to find one. They were always expected in later in the day, so if we wanted to waste the rest of our vacation waiting for any manager, we wouldn't have seen S.F. at all. We didn't get any sleep for two out of the four nights we were there. The hotel is also located in an area of a large population of homeless people. If you do a lot of walking, you will be "hit up" quite often for handouts.

review.title: Good value!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very accommodating and very pleasant. When we asked for an extension cord and extra towels they responded quickly.
review.userLocation: Boise, ID, 2 other guests live in Alberta, Canada

review.title: declining but still decent hotel in an area not so safe after dark
review.reviewText:
At arrival, it felt as the classical American posh hotel, the lobby and corridors are maintained scrupulously in shining splendor (you can smell the chemistry, but it is not unpleasant, it rather suggests the high standard of maintenance), I thought I got great value for my money through "Expedia unpublished rates".
When someone tried to get very quietly into my room at about 4am, I realized that the area is indeed not quite safe after dark. Luckily, they abandoned the attempt as they saw light of my reading lamp (I was jet lagged and in total time zone disorder). Thereafter, I followed the management advise to bolt my door and was OK. After 9 or 10PM a janitor will strictly check your key card at entrance, so the hotel management is well aware of the dangers. The staff was rather helpful but not too inviting, as nearly all of them (especially the janitor) looked strained bordering to exhaustion. In contrast to the well maintained public corridors, the room was in decline, although clean and tidy. Not enough room for two queen size beds and the work table (it would be splendid with just one bed). The toilet flush needed assistance to work properly, power outlets were in a bad condition bordering to hazard, and one of the lights did not work..
Taking into account the rate and the area, it was OK, and most importantly walking distance from the office that I frequented daily. I would say the issues of the hotel are rather of the SF downtown law enforcement than the hotel mgmt.

review.title: Only positive is the location
review.reviewText: Yes, its a historic hotel, which was kind of cool, but the hotel could definitely benefit from some much needed renovations. The bathroom was definitely questionable. What was supposed to be a queen bed, couldn't possibly have been bigger than a double. For an inexpensive hotel in San Francisco, this is a good choice, but don't be surprised when you get there and it's not what you are accustomed to at other modern hotels. If you don't want to rent a car (which I wouldn't recommend) and plan to use the Muni to get around, this hotel is perfect for that. There's a bus/tram stop right outside the front door.

review.title: Good "home base" for business or pleasure travellers
review.reviewText: The hotel entrance, main floor and ballrooms (conference rooms now) were well done up and relaxing. the hotel is central enough for both business and pleasure visits - noisy on the street side but my room was quiet (away from the main street). The room I stayed in could certainly stand a serious make-over;the top swag of the curtains was incredibly dusty, the false ceiling in the bathroom had handprints all over the tiles where workmen had not been careful. But, regardless of that, the daily cleaning staff were terrific, the bed comfortable, the bathroom cleaned very well and the sheets clean and snow white. One piece of advice - do not eat in the Market Street Grill - over priced pathetic food - and little of it. There are some great restaurants in SF but this is definitely NOT one of them. Great Starbucks just off the lobby which I frequented every morning - great service even though they are exceedingly busy. If you want to lounge around a hotel, this may not be the place for you but if you want comfortable, slightly worn charm at a good price, stay here.

review.title: San Francisco in January
review.reviewText: There is a delicious vegetarian restaurant a few feet from the hotel: Ananda Fuara--the samosas are the best i've ever had!

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: The location was great and the room was roomy and clean. Parking was reasonable, it was even better than we expected. The bathroom was a little small but normal for downtown SFO. Would definitely stay there again for the price.

review.title: Economic
review.reviewText: Not so good and not so bad.

review.title: Could be much better!
review.reviewText: We were mostly disappointed with the staff at the hotel. We didn't get one smile or a "how are you?" The rooms are ok but the neighborhood is pretty ghetto. It's worth spending a little more in the North End or by the Pier!

review.title: Underwhelmed
review.reviewText: If you stay at this hotel, be prepared to walk a guantlet of beggars and drug dealers to get into the lobby. The good news is that in the evenings, security is set up to check room keys for all who enter. That security should be expanded to the day time since I ended up riding up the elevator with some homeless guy looking for a warm place to hide out. I would never stay here again.

review.title: Yes! But here's the thing.....
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb is a historical hotel from days gone by. The surrounding area is sketchy but not unsafe. The BART is right outside the door, and the staff are very helpful. There's a Starbucks right next to the lobby and you're only 3-4 blocks from Hayes Valley a street full of boutiques, cafes and restaurants. The down side is if you prefer luxury this hotel will not be for you. Our room was on the inside court so it was quiet until garbage day! The guest rooms are far enough apart to be quiet as well but when people are in the hallway it is noticeable. I chose this hotel because of the location but I am not sure it is for everyone. And the internet access is prehistoric.

review.title: This place was not bad at all.
review.reviewText: As I read the other reviews, the bad ones, i thought this place was going to be a little scary; but the hotel as well as my stay in it was great. Sure there were bums, but what large city doesn't have some. The location it perfect since there is a BART and muni station right out side the Hotel, about 40 feet at the most. and if you like to just walk there are great sights near by to can explore. the only off thing i found was that the parking area is a little tricky to find but the guys working at the parking structure were real nice and helpful.

review.title: Great service, poor location
review.reviewText: The staff were wonderful, accomodating and really bent over backwards to be helpful. The beds were very comfortable but the room smelled. The neighborhood is iffy as it borders the Tenderloin, a tough neighborhood. Despite some of the drawbacks I would definitly go back. Thanks for a great stay.

review.title: Not Impressed next time I will look for another hotel
review.reviewText: The people at the frent desk when we arrived were pretty gentle, but the room had a weird smell that was annoying.

review.title: Perfect for visitors and business people alike
review.reviewText: My wife and I were here for our anniversary. I recommend highly.

review.title: beautiful historic hotel
review.reviewText:
this hotel has a central although a bit rundown location with public
transportation very close. the main attraction is its historic charm
with high ceilings, mirrored elevator panels and wide walkways down
halls into rooms, it was extremely quiet, no car or other travellers
noises.
from looking at 2nd and 6 floor rooms i would say there is no view out
the windows but you really don't miss it beds and linens very
comfortable.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Nice lobby, clean and comfortable beds. Tiny bathroom however, and noticed mold on the walls in the bedroom. Guests at the hotel were interesting, to put it mildy. Many loud, youth groups running about, and a few folks that looked like drug addicts coming off the street. The staff were incredibly kind and helpful however. If you're a tolerant person on the go, this is a decent place to stay.

review.title: modest at best
review.reviewText: It was clean, but it should have been cheaper considering the fact that it was really old and probably needs to be remodeled.

review.title: "It's becoming a relic"
review.reviewText: The hotel may be historic, but it's turning into a relic for not catching up with the century. It offers just a bare room: no coffee maker, no microwave, nothing to warm up from the icy rain on a Christmas day, when everything around us was closed for the Holiday. We even asked the concierge to warm up a cup of coffee that we carried with us, and he said that he did not have one (they don't have a lunch room ro a break room for employees, either?). The room was clean, but smelly of mildew, like the hallways. The shower curtains are very short, and you leave a puddle of water in the rest of the bathroom after you shower. Next time, I will stick to more "main stream," hotels.

review.title: San Fran at a clip
review.reviewText: the hotel was beautiful, the staff pleasant, and the location literally less than a block from the BART station... on top of all that it was affordable, in the center of San Francisco. All in all, a wonderful place to stay

review.title: Neighborhood sketchy
review.reviewText:
Beautiful old historic hotel. A mere blocks away from lots of fun things to do, places to eat, etc....however....those few blocks are not advisable to be walked after dark. San Francisco is a relatively safe town, but this area is very heavily populated by transients.

My wife and I checked in, asked where we could get a good meal within walking distance and were told "Carl's Jr., or Subway were a couple blocks away". Really? Pathetic. San Francisco...noted internationally for its cuisine and Subway is what is offered up? We later learned that the recommendation was due to the unsavory nature of the neighborhood, and the hotel simply did not want its patrons subjegated to that environment.

The actual hotel itself is great with chandoliers, marble, ornate woodwork, a decent bar, and a glorious history (well documented).

If you are looking for a relatively inexpensive place to stay, I would not hesitate to recommend this place.....BUT TAKE A CAB AFTER DARK!!!!!

review.title: OK but there is better for the price.
review.reviewText: The Hotel Whitcomb has a lovely foyer and has a 24 hour reception - which is very useful when checking in late at night, as we did. The rooms are large but a bit tired and there are no in-room coffee making facilities. Having said that there is a Starbucks right off the foyer. There is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel, I just think it suffers a little from thin walls (which comes with the architecture) which means hotel noises carry dreadfully in the rooms. If you are a light sleeper, defintely not the one for you. However, if you don't mind a little bit of noise this budget hotel is very convenient to the MUNI and downtown.

review.title: Beautiful, but avoid outside rooms
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, great location. Room very clean. Comfortable bed, but pillows too big. Don't let them place you in a room with a window that opens to the building air-conditioning units! Too noisy all night. I'm sure there are rooms that don't have the building compressors outside the window.

review.title: Historic means old
review.reviewText: The hotel is next to BART station and not far from City Hall in downtown but the neigborhood is a slam is homeless drunks all round. The hotel is filthy, dirty, interior is old, elevators are slow, the paint in halls, rooms and doors is ugly. Okay for one night stay but don't expect much.

review.title: A nice hotel in a grubby part of town
review.reviewText:
The grand old hotel was very nice, but the location down Market Street has a lot of homeless people, run down stores and beggars. I didn't feel secure returning late at night on foot.
The room was well prepared, but the two double beds left very little room to move - would have suited a single king size bed. The staff were fine, quite helpful. We ate one meal in the restaurant - the food was excellent, and the wine superb.
The wireless internet worked well. The cleaning staff did a good job.

review.title: great historic hotel
review.reviewText: Only thing is update the bathroom!

review.title: Convienient location good price
review.reviewText:
When my niece heard where we we staying they were a little disturrbed, the wrong end of market street. However we found it pretty well positioned. yes there were a lot of homeless hanging around the bart station and the starbucks, but there are in other places. The street does deteriorate at this end, however its close to the city hall area and market street , from 5th down, provides great access to all the cable cars etc. Also the streetcars run along market street so getting anywhere in SF is easy from the hotel. Didn't have a car so no idea about parking.
Price was good and room was very adequate for the price and clean. Also free and pretty fast wi fi.

review.title: Beautiful Historic Hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was just beautiful historically. The lobby was magnificent. I couldn't believe all the orginal Tiffany glass work and the chadeleirs were spectacular. The history of this hotel is also very interesting. You are in the city center and public transportation is right outside the door. The Capitol is across the street as well as the Asian Museum. The Theatre is very close. Unions Square is 2 1/2 blocks away and about 10 minutes walk. I appreciated the urbaness of the area. To me it was like a movie set.

I wouldn't stay there again only because I preffer to be closer to Union Square but I don't regret staying there.

Not good to walk around at night. Star bucks located off the hotel lobby.

review.title: "Convenient, Clean and Cozy"
review.reviewText: It is a much older hotel, but it has this old charm elegance. It shows normal signs of wear, but my room was very clean! The Bart and Muni stop right in front of the hotel, and it made getting around very easy. I even took the Bart from the airport straight to the hotel. It was great. Will definitely stay again!

review.title: Nice Historic Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: The building is beautiful, the location couldn't be more convenient, and there's all sorts of public transportation literally steps outside the building. What's not to like? Okay, the rooms are small-ish and it certainly can't be called luxury accommodations, but it's secure, clean, and comfortable and the staff were friendly and attentive. I'd happily stay here again.

review.title: I will definitely stay there again!
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful experience to stay at the Whitcomb, and I look forward to my next visit. I will stay there again!

review.title: Seedy area so just be careful!
review.reviewText: Nice main hallway when you enter the hotel. The room was okay and hotel staff were fine. The area around the hotel is the pits though....not ideal or enjoyable to see homeless people release bodily fluids right in front of you. A little further from Union Square so would take a cab so you don't have to walk in seedy areas.

review.title: SF's Finest
review.reviewText: We had a great evening at the Hotel Whitcomb. Checking in and out of the hotel was a breeze and the service staff, especially at the downstairs restaurant, were lighthearted and fun. The building itself was antiquated, but beautifully renovated and restored. The location, apart from a somewhat less than desirable neighborhood a few blocks away is only minutes from downtown and highly convenient. To top it all off, we got a great deal through Expedia!!

review.title: Whitcomb in San Francisco
review.reviewText: A nice hotel with a good staff. However, the room was cramped and restroom really historic.

review.title: A century old grand hotel can still be grand
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb is conveniently located on Market Street within walking distance of fine restaurants, theaters, symphony hall and the opera house and has a BART and MUNI subway station, trolley and bus stops at the closest corner. The hotel has a very good restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner as well as a lounge open until 11 p.m. Hotel personnel were always pleasant and helpful, particularly the concierge desk. Old world and European charm is a nice change from glitzy, modern, chain hotels.

review.title: SF
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful, but old and a bit tired. Room was very small for two and the neighborhood was a bit marginal, but still, I enjoyed the hotel and experience.

review.title: Clean, convinient, beautiful, nice staff.
review.reviewText: The hotel is a Historic jewel, it has been very well cared for the amicable staff that works there. Is very clean, beds and rooms are very confortable. The convinience of a Starbuck in the main lobby is fantastic as well as a fine Restaurant at the same lavel. The sorrounding areas look scarry, but like everywere else, common sense and caution can prevent many bad experiences. Overall is a fine place to stay and close to many amenities one can enjoy.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautifully historic. The staff was exceptionally courteous and helpful. BART is right outside the front door. We were immersed in the real downtown San Francisco culture. West Side Story was playing across the street and many quality, unique restaurants were within walking distance.

review.title: What a Disappointment!
review.reviewText: The desk clerk did upgrade us from a queen bed to a king bed but on the 2nd floor overlooking the roof of the mezzanine level. We had only one sink in the bathroom with no vanity space, so we had to use the window sill to store our items. The floor in the bathroom had not had a good cleaning in months. This was probably our last trip to San Francisco and it was a sad farewell.

review.title: Slow Service
review.reviewText: Great rates, great location and comfortable stay. Very slow front desk service for check-in/out, needs great improvement in that area.

review.title: Will not go back
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby was gorgeous and the staff courteous but the room was dingy and not well kept. The bathroom was battered with scratched tile on the floor and build up and discoloration around the edges of marble and tile. I checked out after one night.

review.title: Mixed Review
review.reviewText: The electrical outlet in the bathroom looked like it had been on fire in the not to distant past. The outlet in the room was so loose that I had to use water glasses to keep my computer's plug from just falling out. The bartender, doormen, and one desk person were very courteous. The person manning the dest at about 3:45 am on 10/17/10 was not helpful. While I was waiting for my shuttle that morning, I saw another guest bring a bug to the front desk that she had found crawling across her pillow. The desk clerk assured her in a condescending tone that it was not a bedbug. She replied that she was a doctor and knew a bedbug when she saw one. (I saw no bugs during my stay) Free WIFI, and right on top of a BART station. Another plus - it really is a beautiful old building.

review.title: Very nice old hotel
review.reviewText: Older hotel in convienent location. Big city location but neighbood typical urban neighbors. Room was clean and well furnished. Building is a remnant of bygone era with real wood, plaster, and spacious corridors. A nice change from the tin can stud and drywall venues of most newer hotels.

review.title: Average and decent historic hotel.
review.reviewText: Solid 3 hotel. Location excellent for transportation but moderate amount of homelessness surrouding hotel at all times.

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText:
Hotel Whitcomb is a nice and clean hotel with a good bar and starbucks downstairs.Service on check in is average as it is a large hotel.

The hotel is right on the subway line and major bus lines so it is easy to get to and from the airport and other attractions.

There are however a few bums in the area (which seens to be common in San Fran) but as this hotel boarders the tenderloin district (not in it though) there are a few beggers around but we had no problems and were not approached even at night. The hotel has good security with a guy checking you have a room key to get in the elevator at night.

We got a good deal on the room so it was a much nicer hotel than we paid for.

I would highly reccomend if you get a good deal and are not to concearned with a few homeless people, as the hotel it'self is quite nice.

review.title: Walk away from the deal
review.reviewText:
I would give the hotel itself 1.5, maybe 2 stars. When I opened the door to the room, I saw somebody else's things! I think they might have made a mistake and gave me keys to an already occupied room! Gross.

I was there for business and was hoping to walk to the Moscone Center for the conference that I was attending. The 4-5 block walk to the convention center was terrible. The neighborhood is really bad and there were a couple of times (in the middle of the day) that I felt threatened. I got the room for a decent price, but I would have been willing to pay a few more dollars for a better location. (By the way, I travel by myself often and have never felt threatended in any big city. This was BAD!)

The staff was fairly friendly when they were around. The rooms were old and the beds felt dingy. It was unusually warm in San Francisco, so I turned the air-conditioner on. The AC rattled loudly all night long.

I'm not that picky when it comes to hotels, but this is probably one that I would not recommend. I bet a Holiday Inn down the street would have been 10x better.

review.title: Had a great time, can't wait to go back. Everything was as stated.
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 7 days Sept 23, 2010. Everybody connected with hotel was very helpful . We got in early, 1PM, and our room was not ready, front desk upgraded room for us at no extra cost.
Can't wait to go back next year.

review.title: Great NY Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. The accomodations were nice, the staff was great, the restaurants around were fantastic.....very positive overall.

review.title: "Old glamour"
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb has that old,glamourous charm...From the moment we stepped into the lobby,to the SUPER,comfortable bed( nice linens!!!)it just made every moment of our stay a true delight!!!The restaurant downstairs was great,as well as the bar next to it.The staff was both friendly & helpful,too.We lived in the Bay Area for 18 years,& staying in T H E C I T Y @ Hotel Whitcomb was like being somewhere else in Europe...LoveitLoveitLoveit!!!Thank you for all the beautiFUL memories,my San Francisco,& we'll DEFINETELY be back soon,Hotel Whitcomb!!!Ditto...

review.title: Not impressed, will not go back
review.reviewText:
I had issues at check in time, where they gave me a lesser room than I had explicitly paid for (see above), and then it took some wrangling to get them to fix it (they even tried to tell me they didn't have King bed rooms).

The hotel was a mix of ok appearance and disrepair. It seemed 2 out of 4 of their elevators weren't working the duration of my stay (5 days), which caused a lot of problems. I had wound up with a 2nd floor room, so I simply took the stairs every time, which was ok for me, but clearly for most others it meant long waits for elevators.

My room was pretty average. It was probably about right for a 3 star hotel, but it felt dingy and old.

The one saving item was that room service was actually far better than I expected. It comes from the restaurant downstairs, and while I'd have much rather been eating at the many great restaurants in SF, I had circumstances that had me eat dinner via room service, 3 times, and it was good.

The neighborhood it was in was not good, but was certainly super convenient for Muni, Bart, etc. (stop is right outside the hotel), but it was easy enough to walk to various things, or I took Muni to a lot of places, etc.

In the end, it wasn't a terrible hotel, but for me pesonally, I just need to focus more probably on 4 star and above hotels. For the deal I got this time around, it was quite good, I just prefer slightly nicer hotels.

review.title: Dusty Un-Clean Room, Dorm-Room Style Bathroom
review.reviewText: Check in process was fine, the men working as Bellhops were awesome, the lobby was amazing. The rooms, however, looked like they hadn't been properly cleaned in years. There was caked-on dust EVERYWHERE - under the desk, tv stand, in the bathroom, all along the wall sockets, around the perimeter of the room, the air conditioner/heater. It was pretty unacceptable. Bathroom too was not cleaned as well as it should have been. Also the pictures on their site of the rooms themselves were very mis-leading, the bathrooms looked like college dorm bathrooms, the carpet looked ancient and worn, furniture, etc not nearly as nice as pictured.

review.title: Nice hotel with character in a central location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is clean and a good deal for the price. An older hotel, with small imperfections, but overall well maintained. It is in a good central location, in a medium neighbourhood, I had NO safety concerns.

A nice vegetarian restaurant and other shops are in walking distance, a coffee shop is next door; The Civic Centre Bart station is across the street (goes to the airport), you won’t need a car to get around. The tourist tour busses stop nearby. Yes, I saw a few homeless people, but you will meet them all over the city and they don’t harm anyone.

Our room was nice, everything was clean, the beds are ok (mattress was ok). Small bathroom with shower. Our room had a window facing the back alley, it was quiet except when the garbage truck came twice every night (1am and 4am), as long as you keep the window closed you should be fine (normal city noise I assume). I liked that they provided environmentally friendly products in the bathroom.

I liked the hotel, it has character.

review.title: Great First Impression of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Love, love, love San Francisco!. This was my first time coming to San Fran with my girlfriends from work as our first annual work weekend getaway. The hotel is an old hotel that has been renovated. The beds were clean and comfortable. The washrooms were old but everything was functional. Staff at front desk were always readily available to answer concerns and were always courteous. It was nice to have the convenience of a coffee shop downstairs. The hotel is about 5-10 mins drive away from Fisherman's Warf/Pier 39 but there was always a cab outside and having the street car stop right outside didn't make traveling difficult. The hotel is situated in a not so great neighborhood but nothing to worry about if you practice safe travel tips. Tips like only travel by cab at night and travel in pairs. The homeless people on the streets were never a concern. The characters on the streets and in our neighborhood also made for great stories to bring home. This hotel is like any other fancy hotel in downtown that comes with poverty within the neighborhood but have the convenience of downtown living. I recommend this hotel to others and would definitely come back again.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Bad Neighbourhood
review.reviewText: This historic hotel was really beautiful and the restaurant was great. Basically everything inside the hotel was excellent. However the neighbourhood surrounding the hotel was scary. There were a lot of street people so we were scared to walk around outside after dark. Fortunately there is public transit right outside the hotel's door so we were able to avoid the neighbourhood pretty easily.

review.title: Clean rooms
review.reviewText: rooms were very comfortable and clean. I felt reception staff were very abrupt and quite rude at times when asking for help. in saying that the Porters and conceierge were fantastic very friendly and helpful so was a shame reception gave such a bad vibe.

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: We were very happy with the hotel service. Friendly staff. The room was adequate and comfortable. Good value!

review.title: Would stay here again.
review.reviewText: Room was clean bed was soft. Nice hotel for being on Market St.

review.title: Nice Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: While nothing special on the outside, this historic hotel is absolutely gorgeous as soon as you enter the lobby. The staff were all very friendly, and our room was a good size, and quite clean. The location is great for getting on the F line streetcar to head to Fisherman's Wharf, and it's not too much of a walk to get to the cable cars. There are a number of homeless people in the area, which may make some people uncomfortable, but the hotel itself was great!

review.title: Nice but....
review.reviewText:
I enjoyed the hotel with its huge hallways and high ceilings. The decor was beautiful and it was a nice trip into the past. However, there weren't enough people on duty for check-in so we had to wait about 30 minutes in line. Also, the concierge desk was always empty when we went to get information about the surrounding area. So, the idea of service was better in the past didn't pan out here. The room was nice, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the night was quiet. Most of the equipment in the exercise room didn't work.

The area around the hotel was a little uncomfortable at night. There were an abundance of homeless people and a lot of dark areas on the sidewalks. The park across the street was really pretty at night though.

Overall we enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Read before you go.
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to only singles or couples, not because of the hotel itself, which was good value for the money, but because of the surrounding neighbourhood. There were many homeless people and beggars, as others have mentioned. They were generally harmless (asking for spare change, cigarettes, etc.) but it is a bit unsettling when you are with children. The room itself was fine, the bed very comfortable, though the bathroom, as others have mentioned, needs to be redone. The great thing about this hotel is its close proximity to the BART if you are coming from the airport. However, it is a bit of a hike to the shopping area of Union Square and Westfield Centre. Again, good value for money, a fine place to stay for couples, but avoid it if you have younger children and plan to return at night.

review.title: Have already recommended and our friends were also impressed.
review.reviewText: We felt extremely safe and comfortable. We had a small Queen room, it is very tiny - VERY tiny bathroom, no where to really put anything in the room - but it was clean and had lovely linens on a very comfortable bed. The hotel is in a great area, right across the street is a little place called Sam's Diner - a little hole in the wall, but great food at a great price (and entertaining at times)

review.title: Nice Hotel, Not So Good Location
review.reviewText: Good Hotel, Its a older but everything was nice and clean, well maintained. No problems staying at htis nice hotel. Its location is ok if you plan to only use the muni metro everyday otherwise even though its only 3-4 block from union square/ nob hill you have to walk through some really sketchy areas to get there. Do yourself a favor and go stay in Union/Nob Hill, or stay out of San Francisco and commute in.

review.title: Convenient; great for SOMA and leather happenings
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb has a lovely old lobby and large (at least in our case) rooms with considerable character. location is perfect for anything like Folsom, Dore Alley, Mr. S, Stompers, etc, and also right on bus and trolley lines. Not near the trendiest restaurants but there is a nice little vegan Indian place on the corner. No fridge in the room (a big disadvantage--they should consider remedying this); a terrible, vastly overpriced hotel restaurant which no one should set foot in; and a rather busy, somewhat dismissive front desk. No fitness facility worth the name. We'd stay here again; the deal we got was excellent for a large, pleasant room (although the bathrooms appear to be extremely basic, lol) and the drawbacks were not so great as to ruin our stay. Yes, the neighborhood has winos, bums, and beggars; it's San Francisco, so unless you fork out $500 a night for the Mark Hopkins or Fairmont get used to that! The lobby has such quality--a selling point all by itself.

review.title: We'll definitely stay here again!
review.reviewText: The hotel is older but very well kept, the hotel staff is very courteous and accomodating.

review.title: OVERNIGHT BOLT HOLE
review.reviewText: HOTEL WHITCOMB offered good value on its promotional package mid week. The room was dated and tired in decor and the ensuite adequate if a little disappointing. It was however spacious,clean, accessible, and well sited. Some of the electrical fittings were old and looked a little dodgy.(No doubt 30's/40's originals) I'm not sure it would represent good value at full rates but did so on the discounted offer I obtained through Expedia.

review.title: Maybe the best of this hotel is its location (Market St.)
review.reviewText: If not the best location, Marklet St. is near the Orpheus Theater, a mall and the Powell Cable Station. The rooms are OK, but the bathrooms are very small.

review.title: Advisory: Seriously Hospitality-Challenged. Consider Other Hotels!
review.reviewText:
Pros: Great location; very accommodating HOUSEKEEPING staff.

Cons: I paid extra for a deluxe KING as I was staying 11 days...when I arrived on Thursday I was advised NO KINGS were available until Monday "MAYBE." What? I said, "Why did you take my money for a King room, then?" No logical response. Monday -- after much persistence -- I was given a King room -- probably not a 'deluxe', but I accepted. No offer to reimburse the difference between a Queen and King for four days...not even an offer for a drink at the bar.

Bad experience #2: On Sunday Morning 8/1/10 around 8:30 there's a knock at my door (Room 680), and there's a POLICEMAN! So I open the door and, very accusatorily, Mr. Policeman (hotel security standing behind) advises: "We have a report there was a party in this room all night, and people running up and down the halls, and there was alot of noise!" Sorry, I advised, "I got in at 2:00a.m., alone, and if there was a parrty I slept through it." The OFFICER asked to come in, which I obliged, he looked around, HE apologized, and left. Q1: If there was some objectionable activity going on, why did the hotel wait until the next morning to 'investigate'? Q2: Why did hotel security wait for a police escort to wake up a sleeping guest? Q3: WHY NO EXPLANATION OR APOLOGY forthcoming when the police confirmed the report was in error? Well, to be fair, the word "HOSPITALITY" isn't in their name.

BTW, the notes by other guests of paper-thin walls: All true.

review.title: Charming Historic Hotel
review.reviewText:
I love old, historic buildings, and wasn't disappointed in this hotel. It's beautifully maintained, if a bit worn around some edges. Heck-it was the first hotel built after the 1906 earthquake, so you've got to cut it a little slack!
The room was small, but neat and clean. It would be nice if they could update their heating/cooling system to one that was less noisy, but again, it's an old, old building, and for the reasonable price, I'll live with it!
The service was great, all the staff were very friendly. Registration and check-in was easy, and the staff very accommodating. From the Doorman in tails and top hat to the bell hops in full-on bell-hop regalia to the concierge, everyone was friendly and delightful.
The food in the restaurant associated with the hotel was very good--my first day there I was frozen after walking around the city, so on a summer's day I ordered the Osso Bucco to warm up, and it did the trick! They need to update the room service menus in the rooms, however they were very quick to bring me a new one so I could order that toe-warming dinner. There are a couple of less pricey diners across the street, and a vegan restaurant on the corner, so there are alternatives if you're on a tighter budget.
The neighborhood is all right, although a few blocks up Market heading towards Powell it's pretty dicey. But the Bart/Muni stop is right in front of the hotel, so if you don't feel like running the gauntlet, you can be transported safely to the front doorstep.

review.title: Little rough around the edges
review.reviewText:
You should expect this from such an old property - a little frayed carpeting in the room and some signs of aging in the bathroom. The rooms were VERY comfortable and clean and the lobby is quite elegant. We received excellent service from everyone we encountered.

The surrounding neighborhood will feel a little dodgy to some folks - especially if you are walking down Market towards Powell and the main shopping areas. The Orpheum Theatre is right across the street and access to both BART and the MUNI is within a block or two.

review.title: Ron's Review
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Lot's of gorgeous archetecture. Rooms extremely large and comfortable.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText:
the hotel itself was absolutely beautiful, majority of staff were really friendly and helpful but a couple of the front desk staff need to learn what hospitality means and that when a guest is asking a question they could at least look at you whilst basically dismissing you. outside of this though it was really good, the starbucks in the lobby was really handy too, would definitely return. really handy to transport as it is directly outside the hotel doors and close enough to union square to walk.

neighborhood may not appeal to some but we were 2 females traveling and we at no stage felt uncomfortable

review.title: Whitcomb is HISTORIC but convenient
review.reviewText: IT's an old hotel. The bathrooms are small and may not have soap trays at the tub or a counter to put your toiletries but for an overnight business trip you can't beat the conveience of rolling out the front door and down the steps to BART.

review.title: Not that great compare to the price.
review.reviewText:
The room is very small and the carpet is full of dust. I sneeze the whole time because I am allergic to dust. The bath room is also very small. My friend who is quite big cannot even turn around. The neighborhood is not so great, a lot of homeless.

However, the location is very good. It close to bus stop and civic center. Also, it has the star buck at the main entrance. Also, you get the wireless internet which is good.

review.title: A dissatisfied customer
review.reviewText:
The front desk informed us that they would put us in a quiet room - there was one other room next to hours down the hall. Unfortunately, it had a locked adjoining door three feet from the bed where we could hear everything going in the other room. At 2AM, there were protesters outside (no fault of the hotel), and the person in the adjoining room deciding to turn on this TV on loudly to drown out the outside protesters for 20-25 minutes.

In the morning, I took a shower, and for the first 30 seconds the shower curtain wasn't arranged correctly resulting in the floor being flooded. It required speaking with three of the hotel staff and 20+ minutes until maintenance came up and cleaned the bathroom floor - the bucket had dirty water, so the bathroom stunk.

This was not a good experience.

review.title: Easy access to everything and economical
review.reviewText:
The BART, bus and trolley stop is literally outside the main door making access to the airport, wharf area, and cultural attractions very easy. (You do have to cross the street to reach the Orpheum Theater.) The walk to Union Square takes you through a couple blocks of empty store fronts which isn't scenic, but it wasn't threatening even at night.

This is not a marble bathroom, terry-robe and mini-bar hotel, nor is it a plastic, soul-less, cookie-cutter chain property. It is a century old hotel that has nicely maintained its quaint charm. It is a pleasant resting spot with rates low enough to leave you funds for splurging at dinner. The room was small but nicely furnished including historic photos on the walls; it was more than adequate for our needs.

Because the lobby Starbucks was loud and busy we found two "Ma and Pa" restaurants for breakfast within a block. (Sam's, across the street, looked shabby but the service was friendly and the egg/potato/meat platter, the French toast, and fresh fruit cup were so good we went back the next day. The Italian coffee shop up the street had incredible pastries.)

A good place for energetic independent travelers on a budget.

review.title: Hidden Jewel
review.reviewText: The Hotel Whitcomb was an absolutely gorgeous hotel, but the surrounding area was not the best. Being from Long Beach, we are used to rougher neighborhoods and loved that the Orpheum Theatre was practically right across the street and Union Square was in walking distance! The hotel staff was very helpful and the room itself was beautiful. If you are looking for a modern hotel with outrageous furniture that is uncomfortable to sit on, this probably isn't the place for you. But if you can appreciate the architecture of past decades and like a historical feel, you will absolutely LOVE this cute hotel!

review.title: See you next Pride!
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for Pride weekend. I'd give the convenience of hotel location a 10!
I really appreciate the doorman making sure only hotel guests were allowed in. I can imagine how insane it could get with so many people trying to use the loo, (over the disgusting port-o-pottys they have on the street.)
Perfectly located, so whenever our friends would get lost, we had a comfortable rendezvous place to rally.
The housekeeping staff was incredibly friendly and generous.
We live just in Oakland, but will definitely return to the Whitcomb for next year's Pride.

review.title: Lousy neighborohood!
review.reviewText:
Quite bad neighborhood: we did not get any 'aggression', but the pleace was full of homeless with their ware and occasionally begging.
Nothing really worrysome, other than causing concern when walking with wiife and daughter: we did not dare doing it after the first (aborted) walk, so we took taxi from / to hotel entrance alla the times.

review.title: Great choice for a hotel on a budget
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is very convenient-right next to the BART station, and 10-minute walk (one stop on BART) from all the major tourist areas (Union Sq, etc.) The building itself is worth seeing, the lobby is spectacular - reminds you of the grand past. The surrounding area is okay - you see some evidence of hard life in the city: no gloss and glamour, yet nothing uncomfortable. It is within a block from UN Sq, a site of the farmer's market which offers lots of discoveries, fabulous foods, colorful people, and also great produce at great prices. Definitely, a joy. The room was on a smaller side, but adequate. It was clean and well maintained. In my opinion you can stay there for a longer haul. Overall, a great choice of an inexpensive hotel in the expensive city. The location alone lets you experience and appreciate life at SF a bit more than if you stayed at the tourist-filled Union Sq. I'll stay there again.

review.title: Not impressed.
review.reviewText:
Hotel was O.K. definitely not great ,location is fine except lots of homeless around the area.
Had to request room maintainence to replace a light-bulb, repairman somehow broke the burnt bulb into pieces, took off without cleaning up the mess until the following day regular room service.
Will return to San Francisco,but not Hotel Whitcomb.

review.title: A review of Hotel Whitcombe.
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel for my purposes was very good. Public transit is right out the front door with the F line streetcar, the Muni (subway) station along with the BART station is about a 2 minute walk which was very convenient. I recommend taking the BART from the airport instead of a cab (25 minutes for $8.75).

The hotel is old, my room was not a great location as I was put in a room that had a view of airhandlers right out my window, and in a back corner. Since I wasn't in the room a lot it didnt matter a ton.

review.title: Not impressed with the location, hotel is not bad
review.reviewText: The Check in Time was 3:00 pm. We arrived aftyer almost 6 hour travel from DC very early in the morning and asked the administrator to let us check in at least an hour earlier, but the management did not take our request into consideration. The location is listed on expedia as very close to Union Square, which is not accurate, as it takes at least 15 minutes fast walk to get to the Union Square. But The hotel room was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText:
The hotel is nice, parking is handy, location is convenient and the restaurant was very good.

The drinks from the bar were not done well. The mix did not taste right.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText:
I choose the Hotel Whitcomb primarily because it is very close to the BART station thus very convenient for getting to and from the airport. The hotel lobby was immaculate and the concierge in top hat and tails was a nice touch.

The room was larger than expected which was nice but the view was non-existant. The tub and shower stall could have used some work with stains on the tub floor and on the tiles. The bathroon sink also showed it's age.

The hall outside our room had a curious odor unpon arrival. The cleaning staff had taken care of it by the second day.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. The neighbourhood has definitely seen better days with a number of homeless congregated around UN Square but I never for one second felt that my safety was in jeopardy.

I would definitely recommend this hotel and plan to stay there again on my next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Hotel nice - area bad.
review.reviewText: The Hotel was very nice. The surrounding area was terrible, a lot of homeless people (they did keep to themselves and didn't bother anyone) and abandoned buildings not very plesant. Took the F tram for $2 a couple of blocks to Union Square and totally different atmosphere. The hotel is close to theatres if that is what you are going for. Secure parking for the one day we needed it. Lots of people staying at the hotel which made it feel safer.

review.title: hotel whitcomb
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine. The staff was excellent in all aspect of customer service. The rooms were nice and well maintained. Never had a problem with anything. I would stay again possibly. The only thing is the location is a bit away from places I wanted to go.

review.title: Needs renovation
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is nicely decorated but the staff need to pay more attention to their guests when at reception. The bathrooms need renovating, there were cracks in the bath and the tiles were cracked too. The hotel is 3 train stops from the ferry wharf, quite handy but the hotel is not in a nice area, there are a lot of homeless people and I didn't feel very safe after dark. A hotel right on the wharf would be best.

review.title: Ok for the price
review.reviewText: the Gym was weak but the price was good for the quality - a little close to the rough part of town but nothing too bad

review.title: Great value hotel
review.reviewText: Great value hotel within walking distance from Union Square. Although the service was average, it was nice to see that the doorman would check if people entering the building at night are actually guests. Many SF hotels have paper thin walls, not this hotel. Other then some noise that crept under the door our nights were nice and quiet. Our room and linens were clean, the bed comfortable and the fact that it has a BART station right in front is a big bonus too. We would stay here again.

review.title: Excellent Quality Hotel
review.reviewText: Bottom line is that this was an unexpected pleasure. A grand historic well kept hotel with good service and a fine restaurant. A much better experience than the standard chain hotels. The bathroom was small, but not inconveniently so. And there's no free coffee in the room, but there's a Starbucks right down on the lobby level. A very good experience.

review.title: No frills with great location
review.reviewText: Older hotel. Lobby is spectacular, rooms are small with no frills. Great location on Market Street, BART station, F Line streetcars and buses all right outside the front door.

review.title: Reasonable I suppose for cost.
review.reviewText: Hotel was nostalgic and quite quaint. Rooms were small and washroom extremely small. Staff were courteous and responsive. Restaurant was disappointing to say the least as very limited menu. Not having a pool or spa was my fault but was sorely missed.

review.title: So-so
review.reviewText: OK hotel, much better inside than out. Surrounding area pretty dodgy - definitely would not walk around alone after dark. But easy access to downtown, metro and trams. Restaurant and bar look stuffy and dull but fish was delicious. Some rooms very noisy as overlooking bins which seemed to be emptied several times a night! Easy to get there on public transport. Take warm clothes - SF is freezing.

review.title: Whitcomb Hotel SF
review.reviewText: Hotel is convenient to Bart and Metro service. It is highly recommended that you use these instead of bringing a car. We were returning to San Francisco with a car and had no choice but to use the valet parking service which was very slow and disorganized. Otherwise, everything was great, and I will definitely return.

review.title: Qualty accommodation at excellent price
review.reviewText:
The negative reviews about this hotel did not match my experience, and leads me to think that some people will complain about anything. Hotel Whitcomb tries hard to provide an enjoyable stay at an excellent price. Yes, the presence of homeless people in the immediate vicinity might be confronting for some, but is not uncommon in the downtown area of many major American cities, and is outside the hotel's control. In any case, it was not near as pervasive or confronting as some reviewers had indicated and at no time did I feel in danger.

Our room was large and clean, with well maintained bathroom and large walk-in wardrobe. The curtain furnishings were totally adequate to blockout the light, and noise was only an issue with the window open. The hotel itself has a grand feeling, with impressive foyer, bar and restaraunt. My only suggestion would be to introduce a buffet breakfast. The existing a la carte offering was not expensive but a bit formalistic in these times, and a bit limiting in the choice of breakfast style.

In summary, this was a perfect location for my needs,right on top of the BART station , a stylish and well serviced establishment, friendly staff and exceptional value. Plan to stay there again when next visiting San Francisco.

review.title: A great surprise
review.reviewText: The staff at the Hotel Whitcomb were welcoming and helpful. We loved the room, high ceilings and spacious. The room smelled fresh and clean, the shower was great. The location is so convenient. All and all a great place to stay. Judy and Tom

review.title: Recommending purely for it's locaton.
review.reviewText: Doorman was very nice, front desk people could have been friendlier. My room was very small. The open bathroom door prevented the entry door from fully opening to let me in. Television was older and the remote had dead batteries. Other than that, the hotel was in an ideal location for everywhere I needed to go. The BART Station was right there which made transportation easy. I would stay at this hotel again for the easy price and great location.

review.title: Decent hotel for a good price
review.reviewText:
People who complain about the neighborhood must not have walked around the rest of the city - it's no different anywhere around downtown/SoMa/etc. There is one check-cashing place on the corner that's kind of seedy, but we didn't haven't any unpleasant encounter over a 4 day period.

The hotel itself was pretty nice, and the room was clean.

review.title: Nice bargain hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Based on the age of the hotel and location, many people might overlook this place. It is not the Ritz, but the room was clean, the bed comfortable and the ability to jump on the Muni right outside the front door was great. If you plan on being out in the city nearly all day, then the Whitcomb is worth a look for a simple place to rest at night.

review.title: Worst hotel I ever stayed in.
review.reviewText: The hotel was dirty and the service was bad.

review.title: Great location, good hotel
review.reviewText: After reading reviews I was not surprised by the following: slow internet, no heat in my room, and lots of panhandlers. But the hotel is beautiful, the staff friendly and the location was perfect if you're using public transportation and I never felt unsafe in the neighborhood.

review.title: I'm very satisfied.
review.reviewText: My overall experience at Hotel Whitcomb was very satisfactory. With the exception of having "thin walls" which allows a lot of noises in the room, such as hardworking housekeepers talking, pushing and pulling cart out in the hallway and the constant struggle with the Wi-Fi signal in certain areas, Hotel Whitcomb exceeded my expectations.

review.title: Great Old Time SF Hotel
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed our stay at the Whitcomb very much. An easy Bart ride from airport to the front door and the trolley and buses right out front. Great launching pad for exploring Golden Gate park, Fisherman's wharf, China Town and other attractions. The Orpheum Theatre is across the street so we took in a play as well. The neighborhood is not the very best but we three women (myself and daughters) felt safe walking the 5 or so blocks from the cable car at night.

The old SF style elegance was what we wanted even though rooms are smaller. Walls are a bit thin so request a room at the ned of a hallway and you will sleep very well.

review.title: Convenient Location in Market Street
review.reviewText: Hotel is well located on Market Street, with easy walk to Union Square. Great location for public transport and just across the road from the Orpheum Theater. Just don't go the wrong way down Market Street on a dark night!

review.title: Exceeded expectations
review.reviewText:
I took a chance on this hotel because of the great rate for an SF hotel despite some chilling reviews. Our family like historic hotels and we know SF well and discounted the reviews that dissed the neighborhood (anyone who thinks the presence of homeless people is a problem shouldn't visit SF.) But taking 5 pre-teens to a new hotel was a bit of a leap, especially because they are used to 4 star accommodations.

That said, the Whitcomb was a pleasant surprise. The halls and decor are tired, but hardly problematic. The rooms were smallish, but comfortable, they found two adjoining without problem and the other guests were bargain hunters like us of all ages and backgrounds, including a fair number of international tourists.

The location next to BART on Market is ideal for using public transit which remains clean, convenient and affordable in SF. We drove so we had to pay $28 per night to park the car, but, again, it is SF.

We had a wonderful four day stay and wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel to any but the snootiest guests. The staff were helpful, but knowing the town as well as we do, we didn't ask anything of the concierge, so I can't vouch for them.

review.title: Easy, comfortable, and convenient.
review.reviewText: San Francisco has great pubilc transportation systems, and this hotel was perfect for anyone who needs a convenient location to those systems. This was my first time in SF but staying here made it so easy to get around without hassle. Also, the staff was wonderful. I had a late check in, and asked to switch rooms (due to TV issues), and they great. They sent some one up immediately to give me a new room key. Also, they helped me schedule a taxi cab to the airport so I wouldn't miss my flight. Apparently SF taxi's are not in operation from about 4-5:30 due to extreme traffic, so having a scheduled cab was absolutely necessary.

review.title: If visiting the Orpheum Theatre, this hotel can't be beat.
review.reviewText:
We loved staying in a historic hotel (that was once city hall). Be sure to visit the mezzanine level for old photos and memorabilia from earlier days. The old time feeling was wonderful. Our room and bathroom were small but comfortable. The bell staff was very helpful. We enjoyed the tiffany glass, chandeliers, and ball room. All the decor keeps to a historic theme as best they can while still creating comfort. My son said the hotel looked like "The tower of terror hotel, before it got hit by lightning". He loved it!

It's an easy ride from the airport on the BART and the Orpheum Theatre is directly across the street (our main destination). MUNI is available right outside the hotel.

We didn't use room service or the hotel restaurant. There are a few dining options withing walking distance but I felt it was limited. We rode MUNI to various restaurants around the city. The area surrounding the hotel is not the best (run down, graffiti, etc.) and I did have concerns about going out but we didn't have any problems.

I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again, especially if I was planning another weekend trip and visit to the Orpheum.

review.title: Cheap place to stay on Market Street
review.reviewText: OK I was not looking for a palace, and that's exactly what I didn't get. My room obviously had not been renovated in a long time. No luxury here, but the bed was good and comfortable and the room was clean. I chose this hotel to be close to things, not to spend the day in my room. So it was perfect.

review.title: Love San Francisco
review.reviewText: Beautiful historic hotel. The location could be better, but easy public transportation is right at your door step. Would recommend to upgrade your room if you want more space to move around.

review.title: Not too bad, an okay place
review.reviewText: The place definitely had character, the hallways reminded me of 'Old Hollywood Horror'. The starbucks in the lobby was a plus. I didn't mind staying there, it wasn't terrible but it wasn't amazing. The bathroom was super tiny, but the room and bed linens were clean. There were a lot of homeless people around the area, but I gathered that it was the norm in San Francisco. The hotel was across the street from the theater where 'Wicked' was playing, but you had to walk a little ways to get to the main touristy-resturanty areas. I was there for a conference so I had a good 20 minute walk to and from the convention center each day.

review.title: Great Hotel/Grand Feel/Marginal Neighborhood
review.reviewText: My wife & I stayed at the Whitcomb for only one night and enjoyed it thoroughly. It's a few blocks walk from the Powell-Market cable car line to Fisherman's Wharf and directly across the street from Orpheum Theatre where Wicked was playing. When we checked in, we received a warm greeting from the Desk Man. Later we dealt with someone at the desk who seemed a bit stuffy, but c'est la vie. Other staff was generally responsive and helpful. As we'd been warned, the rooms are small by today's standards, but were nevertheless clean & comfortable. Definitely has the feel of a grand old historic hotel. The Whitcomb is located in a marginal neighborhood on Market St. During the day, there was nothing to be apprehensive about; but I'd recommend the buddy system when going out at night.

review.title: Great Value - Not for the Hilton and Hyatt crowd
review.reviewText:
The hotel was clean, the staff courteous, and the neighborhood a little dicey, but central and I encountered no problems during my stay. My room was nicely furnished, and I would definitely stay there again.

If you want spit and polish in a pasteurized neighborhood, don't stay here, go to a chain hotel in the central business district. If you want a fairly elegant place to stay for a very reasonable rate and don't mind a little gritty neighborhood that is central, this is your place.

review.title: will definitely return.
review.reviewText:
Great location and convenient to all local
transportation including airport. The neighborhood could use some help eliminating panhandling but that is a city
responsibility not the hotels. The hotel is well maintained and the staff is courteous and friendly.

review.title: Very good location. Very run down.
review.reviewText:
Rooms are noicy. Rooms are small... very small. Very outdated bathrooms.

TERRIBLE towels! Old TV.

It once was a grand hotel... too bad they don't fix it up.

review.title: Classy and comfy!
review.reviewText: Amazing beds, very comfy. This was a classy and elegant hotel. Enjoyed this very much.

review.title: Great value for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and comfortable. With BART and MUNI at the front door, it made it very easy to travel within the city as well as other cities in the Bay Area and San Francisco Airport.

review.title: Historic Whitcomb - Key word historic
review.reviewText: For a one night business stay it's fine. Don't count on finding a convenient power outlet or even a desk in some rooms.

review.title: Nice Hotel in a nad neighborhood
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is a fairly nice hotel. Being built in the 1800s you come to expect that rooms will be a bit on the small side and that was fine for the two of us. I have no real complaints about the hotel, but it is in a bad neighborhood. I picked it because it was just down the street from the Orpheum Theatre, so it was great in that respect, but the neighborhood is very run down and there are lots of pan handlers about. Of course, that was true for most of the city!

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText:
I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

The positives were price, convenience of hotel location, well maintained and kept for the price.

The only drawbacks were that the bathroom did not have adequate lighting, and the room was small but adequate for the price.

review.title: Comfortable and reasonable
review.reviewText: A very pleasant mid-range hotel with friendly and helpful staff. I thought it was good value. I was staying for a couple of days with my son prior to a motor tour of California. Our room was comfortable and clean. and a good size with two double beds. Starbucks is just off the lobby, and there's a restaurant on the other side (but we didn't use that). Sam's Diner across the road was good for breakfast and dinner with good food and excellent service, but otherwise the choice locally is very limited. My only criticism of this hotel is the location. It is a good walk back to the main shops along a wide sidewalk but where not everybody would feel 100% comfortable - not that bad but it was certainly noticeable that there were more destitute people on the streets than when I was in SF two years ago. So you may prefer to get a taxi to the bigger shops or for the better restaurants, but there were always taxis outside the hotel and during the day you can easily walk to the Nordstrom shopping centre, Macey*s and everywhere else if you like walking (and shopping). As an example of the hotel's attention to guests I'd say this: I emailed them beforehand to check the reservation and mentioned we were arriving on my son's 20th birthday, they put balloons, a sign and a delicious little pudding in the room for our arrival. He was cross with me of course for saying anything, but also rather chuffed; thanks to Tim, the reservations manager, for that.

review.title: "Awful Hotel that is not needed"
review.reviewText: This Hotel needs a definite upgrade. The room was so small my own house room was bigger than this. Furthermore, the rug stunk that I had to call them in to dry clean everything.

review.title: Decent Night's Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb was a fine stay. Thanks to Expedia we paid 50% off the going rate for our room and I would say that was about what it was truly worth. The room was clean, bedding acceptable and hotel kept up. I did notice dust on the drapes (quite a bit) and the room itself was rather small compared to standard hotel room sizes. We were going to a show at the Orpheum Theatre and this was AWESOME as far as location. We were able to eat downstairs and then walk to the show in 5 min. Security at night making sure only hotel customers entered the upper floors was a welcome sight upon arriving back after the show, the neighborhood as a whole is not my personal cup of tea. All hotel staff was helpful and curtious and all in all if I recieved the discounted rate as I did with this stay I'd stay there again.

review.title: Pefect Location for Orpheum Theatre Visitors
review.reviewText:
My sister and I recently stayed at Hotel Whitcomb while in San Francisco to see the musical Wicked at the Orpheum Theatre. This hotel worked out very nicely for us because the theatre was directly across the street from the hotel. So even though the neighborhood may come across as a little sketchy in the evening to some people, it was not a problem because we were only walking across the street. (I would not let the interesting people you see down in this area keep you from staying here. It is just a part of San Francisco and in no way did I ever feel like I was in danger or scared.) In addition, the bus and trolly systems were just outside the front door of the hotel, which made it very easy for us to shop at Union Square and Pier 39 while we were in SF.

The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful to us. The hotel is clearly older with a great deal of charm and character. It was a refreashing change from your regular, averagely decorated hotels. There is valet parking available at the hotel. There is a small fee for that service but it was well worth it for us not to have to worry about parking down in San Francisco.

Overall, I would definetly stay at this hotel again. Especially if I return to see another show at any of the theatres in this area.

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful, but our room was quite small. The pictures on the web site made it look bigger. But it was comfortable. The hallways did have a musty smell and the room had a distinct smell like mothballs. But you didn't notice it after a few minutes. After all we didn't come to San Francisco to spend it in a hotel room. We found the location to be great. Near lots of things we wanted to see. Mass Transit was conveniently nearby. You have to pay for parking, but it's great to have you car available when you want it. I would consider returning for another visit.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText:
THE ROOM WAS VERY SMALL.THEY WERE VERY CHEAP WITH SHAMPOOS ANS SOAPS. THEY DIDN'T HAVE 24 HOUR ROOM SERVICE.THEY HAVE ONLY
ONE RESTAURANT THAT IS OPEN TILL 10 P.M/
THE BELLBOY WAS VERY LAZY TOO. OVERALL THEIR SERVICE WAS SO POOR THAT I DIDN'T WANT TO GIVE ANYONE EVENT A SMALL TIP. THEIR PARKING WAS ANOTHER PAIN TOO.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location, free internet, clean, great service and good price

review.title: I'd like choose another hotel near downtown to live if I go San Francisco again
review.reviewText: The location is far from downtown, it takes 15~20 mins walking to downtown. Rooms are clean, but the first non-smoking room I lived in has smoke smell, so I changed to another one on second day. The surcharge internet is expensive, it'd better to bring your laptop to access the internet. The gym is good, some nice equipments inside.

review.title: i would like to go again for the easy location with the bart and transportation...but I WILL TELL MY
review.reviewText: need urgent a remodeling special the bathroom...:)!!!!

review.title: Very nice stay
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb was very nice. It was clean and well maintained. The only problem I had with it was its location. During the day the neighborhood was ok, but after dark it was very scary walking anywhere. This is no fault of the hotel however. I understand that the city is trying to clean up the neighborhood. The resturant located inside the hotel was pretty expensive though, and we chose not to eat there.

review.title: I Love This Hotel
review.reviewText: I love this Hotel because of it's beautiful character. The central location is so easy to get around with the public transportation. Off season rates are terrific, but parking is expensive.

review.title: Amazing Experience
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel and would happily stay there again. I had only two small complaints. 1. It was tough to heat my room up quickly, so most of the day, the room was quite chilly. 2. The free internet sometimes had log on issues through the 3rd party company that the hotel uses: Wandering Wifi. Other than that, it was a comfortable sized room, comfortable, and clean furniture, and a great overall experience.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel has an excellent location. It's near of the most attractive neighborhoods and shopping malls.

review.title: Great hotel for downtown
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable and the service was great. It was a little noisy at night but then it is downtown San Francisco.

review.title: "The Whitcomb Worked Well"
