review.reviewText: The Whitcomb provided very nice accommodations for our first-time visit to our son's new hometown. The Whitcomb has elegence and staffing providing safe, pleasant and quiet privacy and its location next to a BART stop gave easy access from San Francisco Airport (SFO) and being downtown had nearby walk-to sightseeing points, as well as public transportation via bus, streetcar, and cable-car at and along Market Street. Our son's apartment was 1 BART stop away and he readily got together with us for touring, and enjoying excellent meals, whether from a pleasant and inexpensive diner (Sam's Diner) across from the Whitcomb, to delicious seafood and ethnic meals at Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, the Mission District, and event a bit north in Muir Beach during our 1/2-day rental car trip up to Muir Woods (redwood trees!). That was thrilling, cheap, and avoided overnight parking @ big $$$. Some interruption to the Whitcomb's recently upgraded wi-fi system was annoying, but management had corrective responses underway, and there is a Starbuck's next door. Excellent overall value.

review.title: Great Stay in Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and had character, which you don't get in the big chains. While the facilities showed thier age, all worked well but did take some getting used to -- showers were not intended for someone 6'4". The restaurant was reasonably priced for SF and the menu varied enough that everyone in my group was able to get what they wanted. We liked the location in downtown SF, but were a little surprised by the lack of a free hotel parking garage. We would return to this hotel.

review.title: over all would consider it again.
review.reviewText: Fabulous location for theaters and symphony, ballet and opera. Great resturant and room service. Nice Internet Cafe. Responsible Valet service.

review.title: Whitcomb
review.reviewText: The rooms could use upgraded plumbing.

review.title: So close to being very run down
review.reviewText:
This hotel is about to become very run down if a lot of money isn't poured into renovations. However, it is quite charming and in a very central location. The price is right if you are on a budget and want to avoid the rat motels.

Be warned, the walls and doors are extremely thin. Expect to hear your neighbours and people in the hallways.

review.title: Good hotel; surroundings less good
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Hotel Whitcomb because it is just a few blocks from Symphony Hall. It is an interesting old building which was one of the few to survive the 1906 earthquake. The trolley bus on the “F-line” stops right outside the hotel - very convenient because it takes you directly to Fisherman’s Wharf. However, the immediate area on Market Street has a lot of street people, and it is somewhat unsettling for walking after dark. I would stay at the Whitcomb again if I was in San Francisco for another concert, but if I was there purely as a tourist I would stay in the Fisherman’s Wharf area because that is where there is so much to see, it seems very safe, and there are lots of great restaurants.
The hotel itself is very well run and the bellboy staff in particular were really helpful. It has an adjacent Starbucks with an entrance directly from the lobby so that one does not need to go outside for one’s morning coffee. (My room had no coffee machine.) There are a couple of diners across the street so meals during daytime present no difficulty. Dinner is more problematical. There is a restaurant, again accessible from the hotel lobby, which could perhaps be best described as a “would-be upscale Chinese restaurant.” I ate there the first night but did not like it much; my waiter seemed snobby and I found it quite expensive. After the first night, I had dinner at the restaurants at Fisherman’s Wharf and returned to the hotel on the F-line trolley bus.

review.title: A Wonderful Surprise!
review.reviewText:
I selected the hotel for its location, read the other reviews. Since it was one of the lower-priced offers, right downtown and a historic building, my expectations were pretty low (I live in Seattle and understand downtown!).

What a wonderful surprise! This place is gorgeous! I loved the very comfortable, nicely decorated rooms with their high ceilings and marble bath floors! The lobby is the most elegant I've ever seen and I can only imagine the scene 100 years ago when all the society folk stayed here, dancing in the ball rooms to live music every weekend!

The food at the on-site restaurant was terrific and the staff pleasant, attending to all our needs.

The BART station is literally right outside the door, but if you like the antique trolleys SF is known for, you can board them, too. We were just blocks from the Embarcadero and trolleys to Fisherman's Wharf, blocks from the high-end shopping district, and the trolley up Market Street was fun. Chase had a branch on one corner and Walgreen's was on the other, for all the convenience we needed.

You don't need a car for this hotel but there is a parking garage in back with typical downtown fees. My family kept warning me about SF driving but it wasn't bad at all once you understand which streets are one way.

I don't plan to go to SF often, it's too much like Seattle but when I do I will definitely stay at Hotel Whitcomb, and I've been recommending it to everyone as well.

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: It was really nice, the Starbucks at the lobby was truly amazing

review.title: Great Value. Good Location.
review.reviewText: The rooms are kind of small but the ceilings are extremely high and give you a sense of roominess. The bathrooms are nice and the closet space is great. The beds are comfortable. The view is nice. You are about a 2 minute walk away from one of the best diners I've ever eaten at.

review.title: Looking a bit shabby
review.reviewText: Maintenance was lacking. The drape tiebacks on the windows were broken, there was no plug in the bathroom sink, chipped paint, etc. Just a bit shabby. the section of town is not the best. Only a few blocks from the hotel are many homeless, beggars and alcoholics. I would not recommend it for single women.

review.title: It was really nice!! I liked!
review.reviewText: The room was great, the same with the cleaning. Very good location, close to everything. I recommend.

review.title: I liked it...
review.reviewText:
My mother, brother and I stayed here for a weekend after seeing a show at the Orpheum. It served as a great launch pad for all the touristy stuff we wanted to do in the city. The hotel was pretty, well kept and quiet. Knowing its location people should be prepared for the trade-off of easy (walking) access to downtown, union square, the mission etc for typical city streets kind of folk and happenings. It's hardly dangerous.

The room was a bit small, and the bathroom was rather tight. Beds were comfortable and staff was super attentive (though I wasn't impressed with the concierge after she told me that all breakfast places served the same type of food). We'd go back!

review.title: History & Location
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Whitcomb was a great experience for us. My wife and I like history and this is the oldest hotel in San Francisco. It is quite a grand building with all the marble, stone and wood work. No one could afford to build a place like this today. The service was very good as well. They had everything we needed and helped cheerfully where they could.

The location was terrific. It is located on Market Street and all the public transport stops in front of the hotel. It is also a short walk to City hall and a lot of history. $11 and you get a day pass on all and every type of public transportion in San Francisco for the day! The hotel is the last stop for the Super Shuttle, which worked great for us as we had an early flight out on our last day there.

One other advantage to the Hotel Whitcomb is the Munch Haven restaurant across the street, which serves a huge and delicious breakfast for about $10 with the friendliest folks in town. Our impression of San Francisco is that it is friendly, clean and beautiful place full of history. And we thought the Hotel Whitcomb is a first class place in every way

review.title: Everything that could be bad, was bad
review.reviewText:
This hotel had really rude customer service at the check in, really bad rooms, bad neighborhood, and they did not even seem to care at all about the guests.
When we got there, the bottom floor was jam packed with people attending some sort of show and the employees seemed more concerned about the show that the guests' comfort.
This was the condition of the room- it was right next to the air conditioning unit, the view outside the window was of the air conditioning unit right outside the window, and that is all that could be seen, the room was dark and not clean at all, seemed more like a motel 6 than a Historic hotel as they claim it to be.
When I asked them to see if I could cancel my reservation, expedia was willing to talk to the hotel management to discuss this matter. But the hotel folks told me and to the expedia agent on the phone that they did not have any one available to talk to. It would take over half an hour to find someone to talk to, yet they were more than happy to help people check in. They did not want to hear our concerns at all, were only concerned with checking people in.
We did not even stay at the hotel even though we had paid for it. We eventually stayed at another place. When I went to check out the next morning, once again the folks at the check in counter were extremely rude and did not care about their customers' satisfaction.
I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

review.title: Loved Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText:
After doing a LOT of research on where to stay in San Fran, we settled on the Hotel Whitcomb. We absolutely loved it. The price was right, the room was very clean. I loved having a Starbucks in the lobby. The location was perfect for us - walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, Mission District and a short bus ride (up hill) to Haight Ashbury!
We will definitely stay here again!

review.title: Don't go there
review.reviewText:
This hotel, while obviously once a grand hotel, now has run-down rooms that smell of mould, with bathrooms that are very uncomforable and poorly maintained. Some of the front desk people are surly, if not downright rude. On the bright side, the cleaning staff were all very pleasant.

However, the chief reason not to go this hotel is that to get to anywhere you would actually like to go, you have to run a gauntlet of panhandlers, homeless people, crack addicts and wretches that belong in mental hospitals. Heaven help you if you want to go out on foot after dark.

So, if you have never been to San Francisco, do your research, check out the neighbourhood where your hotel is. It could make the difference between a beautiful vacation and a spoiled one. Staying at the Whitcomb definitely spoiled our time in SF.

review.title: HMMM
review.reviewText: Every thing is good exept my room is outside of the fire escape door to the stair well.

review.title: Cozy Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel Whitcomb is not the top of the line, but cozy all the same. It's central to everything you want to see and you have the Bart and trolly/bus station right outside for easy transportation. The staff is friendly and helpful and the room is clean. The only negative is a stale smell in the halls, when you exit the elevator.

review.title: Okay if you are on a budget!
review.reviewText: This hotel was not the cleanest, nor the friendliest of staff, but for the price i would recommend it. Really easy to get to right off the BART and within walking distance to the big shops and malls (~1 mile). Note, it is in a seedier part of downtown San Francisco, ie not the safest to walk around at night, but very affordable compared to other options closer to Union Square. If you have the money and want to be closer to the shopping/ touristy area there are better options. If you are low on cash and can hold your own in a night fight, this place is for you.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText:
I really enjoyed staying at the Hotel Whitcomb. It is an historic hotel in the heart of downtown San Francisco. It seems to me that through the years, the hotel has been maintained without losing the integrity of its original look and feel. When I walked into the lobby I felt like I was walking straight into the San Francisco of the early 1900s.

Thanks for the experience.! I will definitely stay here again when I visit San Francisco again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: You can't beat the location! Right near BART and on Market Street! Very nice hotel, very comfy bed, historic. For the price, is was exactly what we wanted. Very clean, nice people, has a restaurant and lounge attached that are very nice!

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb- Historic, but not clean
review.reviewText:
Upon entering the Hotel Whitcomb, travelers are greeted by magestic marble and granite floors, columbs, counters, grand chandeliers, a helpful security guard and a concierge. First impression was "WOW!" The service was acceptable, but not overwhelming. When we arrived at our room it was typical of old hotels, high ceilings, decorative moldings, out of date wall paper.
Then it took a turn for the worse. The bed lines were stained, the carpet was soiled and the shower / bathroom was moldy. It was not a comfortable nights sleep and we will not be back to the Hotel Whitcomb until a complete renovation (and possible change of ownership) has taken place. A once beautiful and grand hotel that need a "redo"

Gentleman Jack

review.title: Beautiful Hotel!
review.reviewText: The public areas of this hotel were beautifully maintained and I'm sure my room was discounted because it needed some serious work, cracked tiles in the bathroom, the cabinet front on the sink was so soft from water damage that you could leave a dent in it with your fingers - gross. However the room itself was very nice. It was small the the high ceilings made it feel much bigger and the overall character, beauty, historicity and charm of the hotel made up for the condition of the bathroom. It is located downtown (parking is around 20-30 dollars a day - no way around it.) I appreciated it's proximity to every kind of public transportation available in the downtown area: trolley, BART, bus stops right outside the front door and a nice theater showing high quality plays/shows right across the street. I highly recommend this beautiful hotel.

review.title: On the cable car line
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel and was easy to get places from. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Expedia gave us an excellent rate on the hotel and we would definately stay there again.

review.title: Very good stay
review.reviewText: Worth what I paid, conveniently located

review.title: Historic Whitcomb - Key word historic
review.reviewText: Convenience over comfort - after all one night is just a bed and a shower. Adjacent to BART and affordable compared to the rip-offs of most hotels in the City.

review.title: Can't Be Picky....
review.reviewText:
So, this isn't a BAD hotel by any means....it's just a little outdated. Hence the headline "a Historical Hotel".
PROS:
Clean
Good desk service
Great door men!

CONS:
Rooms are tiny
Walls are PAPER THIN!!!
Right in the middle of the city but close to the BART

We weren't looking to spend a lot of time in the hotel, so if you're not picky, it's okay. But if you're looking for new, modern and such...not the hotel for you.

review.title: A true surprise...
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is a real surprise! On the edge of a shady neighborhood, it is also very close to City Hall, theatre, symphony and opera and one of the best restaurants in San Francisco. The staff is very helpful and the rooms, while small, are comfortable. A BART station is right in front, so travel throughout the Bay Area is a breeze. The Tiffany ceilings in the registration area and bar are such a rare find. And, there really are jail cells in the basement from the hotel's days as a stand-in city hall after the 1906 eathquake.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: This was a good location from the standpoint of being near the Orpheum and Golden Gate Theatre. It was also near a BART and MUNI station so no problem there; however it's also close enough to walk to Union Square, Chinatown, the Wharf, etc. The only problem we had was actually getting to the hotel in our car rental (eventually returned the car back to the airport and caught the BART to Civic Center; cost was $8.10/person) as I couldn't find the hotel parking. I thought the signage was inadequate. We had to circle back and I made the mistake of driving up the ramp to park and unload (the attendant wasn't there) and the garage was simply nasty (dirty and the smell of urine). Found out I was supposed to drive up to the small "lobby" and the garage is off-limits. Thankfully, the condition of the hotel/room was OK in terms of sleeping and showering. Nothing fancy but at least the bed (King) was comfortable. TV was old. Room had a noticeable smoke smell but nothing major. The outlets were old (loose). No bugs.

review.title: FYI
review.reviewText:
The hotel was old but nice. The room was small, but what else do you need for a quick getaway? The bed was top quality. You can walk to just about anywhere and the public transportation is second to none.

The hotel itself sits near an area where there are a lot of homeless, deralics and just plain lazy people looking for handouts. I would not give them a dime or you will be overwhelmed by them thinking you are rich. We did see drug deals in the neighborhood, but those occurred after the sun went down. What would you expect since you are surrounded by a number of topless bars? We never felt unsafe; just use your common sense.

review.title: The usual
review.reviewText: I like this hotel. It's position is great and it has a great restaurant and reasonable parking

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: It was easy to get everywhere from this hotel. Public transportation was right outside the hotel. The neighborhood was a little shady after dark, but never felt unsafe. I would stay here again!

review.title: This Hotel Was Excellent
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay in the Hotel Whitcomb very much. The property was beautiful and the staff very helpful. Also its location by the BART station made it very easy to get to the hotel from the airport and to get around the city. I will definitely stay at the Hotel Whitcomb again.

review.title: A good place to sleep
review.reviewText: The hotel has a pretty lobby and is in a great location, but is bare bones when it comes to amenities and comfort. It's a good, inexpensive place to sleep if you plan to spend most of your time exploring the city.

review.title: Market Street San Francisco
review.reviewText: It is a 460 room hotel with well lit hallways and a well designed fitness room. There is a computer room (about 4 stations) but it costs $5.00 for 20 minutes. The only negative is that the beverage vending machine was empty so I asked for a fridge. The desk clerk wanted $20 a day. I straightened this out with the night manager. Location wise,it is the most convenient location in all of SF for transportation to all parts of the city, even the BART to the airport.

review.title: Always the best
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Whitcomb (formally the Ramada) for years. It's always great, the staff is top notch and the service is next to none. The location is central to everything and even if you drive into the city, you can park your car at the hotel and take cabs.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Easy access to public transportation, Union Square, trolly lines and city hall.We would especially like to commend the hotels concierge ( Janet ) who handled all of our questions and requests with enthusiasm and intimate knowledge.

review.title: Good for a Business Trip
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and comfortable with wireless access...nice to have.

review.title: A beautiful hotel at a good price
review.reviewText: This hotel is stunning on the inside. The front desk personnel were very nice and helpful, even when they couldn't find the reservation. We had a beautiful room that was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in the center of all the touristy things in San Fransisco. A few blocks away from the hotel is a not so nice area, but we were not at all bothered by anyone or anything from there. I would recommend this place, and I would certainly take my family back there.

review.title: Nice Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: Aside from the musty smell in the room, it was nice. You do not visit SF and stay in your hotel room. It was just right.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb - Convenient and clean
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located on Market Street in San Francisco and is across the road from a BART station so very convenient for those coming from the airport and staying a couple of nights. It is not the most salubrious of locations but it is very close to SoMa, the Castro, the Mission and the nearby galleries, shopping and restaurants all within a few blocks. The rooms are clean and spacious, the shower is powerful and the beds are comfortable. The restaurant serves a good breakfast and there is also a Starbucks on site with free Wifi. The hotel also has a room with computers for paid internet access. There are vending machines and ice machines on each floor.

review.title: A grand old hotel
review.reviewText: The lobby and mezzanine were particularly appealing, however the rooms were quite small just as we expected of a hotel of this era. Small size aside, the rooms were clean and comfortable and worked very well for us.

review.title: Its ok but rooms need updating
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel in June The hotel is in a good location 15 mins walk from union square area. The BART station entrance is right outside the hotel and trams run past too. The hotel's reception area is really nice and its handy having a starbucks in the lobby. All the staff were really friendly and helpful. Make use of the safety deposit box at reception too.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb Review
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located right at BART stop so you do not need to rent a car to get from the airport to the hotel if you don't want to. San Francisco has a good transit system making a car unneccessary. Becasue the hotel is right downtown you do get some street people hanging around but the hotel staff control that and I felt safe. The lobby of the hotel is stunning.

review.title: Prefer a dirty hostel in eastern Europe.
review.reviewText: Historic really just means falling apart and old. The bedroom was tiny with dingy carpet, an odd smell and an uncomfortable bed. The bathroom had a toilet right out of Bates Motel and mold and rust painted and wall papered over. The best part of our one night stay before leaving early a night and not being refunded due hotel management and the day of runaround phonecalls had to be our 5 am staff wake up call of hotel employees carrying on outside our window obnoxiously loud particularly when there is no real barrier between you and the outside. Worst hotel experience ever and I'm not one to normally care; heed my words photos etc are misleading. Beware.

review.title: bad service
review.reviewText: an old hotel, very small room i got. bed is right there when i opened the door. bad service @ counter, he nevered looked at me when i checked in, and poker face. maybe it is around 12 at the night, orz

review.title: Good for the $
review.reviewText: The beds are good. The rooms are updated and clean. The first time I stayed there I had a great sized bath. The 2 other times since the bathroom has been tiny.. you have squeeze past the sink to get to the toilet. But overall I'm happy and have not had any trouble getting a room even when booking 2 days ahead. This is where I stay when I am in SF and I LIKE IT!

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is a beautiful old hotel right on Market St, smack dab in the middle of everything. You can walk to the arts district and Chinatown easily. The hotel rooms are a bit small, but have great oldfashion charm. And really, how much time are you going to spend sitting in your room in a great city like SF. Very comfortable beds too. Lots of good places to eat nearby. The staff were helpful and polite. This is a great hotel for tourists as it is right on the main Muni route. The station is right outside the front door. You can catch the BART from the SF airport and it will take you right to your hotel. Much cheaper than a cab. Make sure you take in "Wicked" at the beautiful Orpheum Theater across the street. You will be glad you did.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was easy to locate and the front desk people were very helpful. The only thing you have to remember is that it is a historic hotel. The hallway carpets are dirty and the decor is historic. The bedding and bed are super comfortable and clean. Outside at night there is a lot of homeless people, but there is restaurant and starbucks within the hotel.

review.title: mayhem on market
review.reviewText: The building is lovely! The reviews said it was about 6 blocks to Union Square. They forgot to mention that 4 of the blocks are veeerrryyy long We got a bus pass the next day. We were on the 5th floor that faced out onto market st. We didnt sleep much for 5 nights. Between the trolleys, buses, people, sirens and STREET CLEANERS it was noisy. We looked into moving but would have had to give up about 1/3 of our space and because the room was smaller would have had to turn the air conditioning on which would have made it noisy once again! The room was nice but the bathrooms definately need some work. No counter space or a place to put anything. There is no t.v. unless you pay, you have to ask for a coffeee maker. . The maids never emptied the coffee maker or gave us clean cups. They rinsed them in the bathroom sink I think. If you want a fridge it'll cost you $20.oo a day. we said no and I just "borrowed a little milk from Starbucks downstairs each day! One or two of the four elevators broke down one day (right when there was a huge German tour bus in), so we used the stairs. The front staff were all nice and helpful with the exception of a short mustachioed man who was a grump. The hotel is in a great location for using san frans excellent transit system, BART is right out the door for easy airport access as well. For the price I would recommend it for not more than 2 people in a romm and not a room on Market st unless you have good ear plugs or are a very sound sleeper.

review.title: Great Location, so-so hotel
review.reviewText: I'm a sucker for boutique hotels... I love the grandeur of 'oldness', so I tend to try and find more historic hotels than stay with the chains if I can help it. Honestly, I would have rated this place higher if the service was better and the room wasn't right next to the lift -- where I could hear the lift ding every 10 minutes. Location-wise, it's great -- right next to a BART station and walking distance to quite a bit. (Though that may just be the design of San Fransisco.) Cheap enough, but I'd say that you were getting what you paid for. As a caveat, I may be a little spoiled as I've stayed in some pretty good boutique hotels, so I'm reviewing this in contrast.

review.title: Memorable and Affordable
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb has style and affordability. The lobby is a showpiece with beautiful Tiffany stained glass arching over the check-in desk. The rooms are clean, the beds very comfortable. And all at a reasonable price for San Fran. We will definately be repeaters.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Our trip to San Francisco included two nights in the Theater District. From the hotel it was an easy walk to to both events. The Orpheum Theater was across the street and the Symphony Hall was a 10 minute walk (if you walked slow). A BART station and access to public transportation is right outside the hotel. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. As renovated hotels go, Hotel Whitcomb was clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Whitcomb.

review.title: Great! Historic!
review.reviewText: It's a historic hotel, and very charming, but be kind and remember it is old. So, if you're looking for a boutique-type minimalist/sterile experience, you won't find it at the Whitcomb. You will be impressed by the old carved wood accents, marble columns and the grandeur of the lobby. Staff are unobtrusive and helpful. We had a big queen room with a small "shower only" bathroom. It was very comfortable. Location-wise, we heard it was in a sketchy area but had no problems and felt safe walking around both morning and night. Market St. is extremely convenient and there's an excellent Farmer's Mkt a block away on Wed. mornings in the nearby United Nations Plaza. The BART station entrance is on the same block as the hotel, making it easy to get to the airport!

review.title: Good, central, if a bit noisy
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is what Europeans would call a 2 or 3 star hotel. Character? Sure. Staff? Very helpful, if a bit understaffed. Rooms? Big, pleasant if not the most modern. The room I had, facing right onto Market Street, was large & decently appointed, but Market Street is not exactly quiet: sirens in the middle of the night, that sort of thing. Still, straight shot to the airport (SFO) on the BART, 2 minutes walk to the Civic Center, and in the daytime having Market Street right there is nothing to sniff at. I didn't try the restaurant in the hotel; there was a good vegetarian place run by the Sri Chinmoy folks just across the street, which tempted me more.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Quaint room, good location to BART, nice to have Starbucks so close!

review.title: Location not my favorite.
review.reviewText: Although the Whitcomb is a nice hotel, you may not like it because Market St. is on the rough side in San Francisco. Lot's of street people and on the depressing side, a little scary to walk down Market St. As cities go, there are many other better choices of places to stay that are also centrally located and a lot more upbeat.

review.title: Not impressed with location of hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel is good, but location isn't. Because of bad location, I wouldn't came back to this hotel. All around that area are homeless people.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The BART and MUNI systems are less than 30 yards outside The Whitcomb's front doors. We got to see everything we wanted without having to rent a car thanks to both transit systems being so close. The rooms are small but well kept. The bathrooms are pretty outdated but serve their purpose. All and all it's a great place to stay if you don't plan on spending much time in your room

review.title: Boston
review.reviewText: I came to this hotel expecting internet service to to my dismay there was no internet servie I was told to go to use the intetnet in the lobby and that useless. I found that the staff wavery helpful in helping with the service. But if you stay6 don't expect internet service in your room. Otherwise everything was average. I wish I could say something more positive. Located in a very central part of San Francisco.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Great Price for very nice hotel. Excellent service at front desk. Great location for access to airport and public transportation. Heavy homeless population just outside front door.

review.title: Could Improve on front desk staff training and relevant local transportation info from concierge
review.reviewText: I was hoping the hotel service and comfort would accomodate for the bad neighborhood that it was in. But the hotel staff was indifferent to requests and sometimes condescending. Relevant info about the room such as turning on the bathroom lights before using the hairdryer outlet was not mentioned therefore wasting guest time.

review.title: Enjoyable Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel (and price) were better than we had expected. The only slpi-up by the hotel was in brining us a fridge setting it to the coldest setting possible and freezing all of our food. Other than that we had little contact with the staff. Very well located. Right next to Civic Center BART stop - so convenient to the airport. Very comfortable. Only a little noise coming in from the hallway at night.

review.title: Hmmmmmm No power for desk lamp??????
review.reviewText: OK This is a Historic Hotel built by our GRandfathers and before, but there is no electrical access to plug in the desk lamp, no plugs available for plugging in your laptop. We had to buy an extension cord from Wal-greens (which there's one every 1/2 block, I swear) to power things in our room. Other than that the room is in the heart of the city for sight seeing & shopping. Good food served inside hotel and plenty of other places to eat as well, Sam's across the entrance is pretty good. Have a great stay and enjoy this city, be sure to bring warm clothes as it is always cool even in the summer. Rooms heater and A/C worked well. Being that hotel is on Market St it's access to everywhere is perfectly located, with a BART/NUNI station right on the corner and a F_Train out front too.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with drawbacks
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful historic hotel but the room had no coffee/tea making facilities - a major feature for me. Also unfortunately the surrounding area is full of homeless people who are normally quite harmless but we were accosted by one who was very aggressive, demanding money and pushing us around. Not a very nice experience!

review.title: Great Location & Price, very helpful staff
review.reviewText: Impressed with the decor very 20's remodeled,4 blocks from Union Square, F Train right outside front door.Don't eat at Diner across the street unless you want to wait an hour or your food.

review.title: Remember, it's historic
review.reviewText: The lobby and restaurant are wonderful. We selected the hotel because it was historic. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the restaurant. The rooms were pretty old-fashioned and presented better on the website than in person, but they were clean. Gorgeous architecture. Didn't know about the little mini-museum on the mess until our last night. Cute and interesting. Great price and convenient for transportation.

review.title: Wonderful experience!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable boutique hotel. Service was outstanding and the concierge staff were extremely helful.

review.title: Whitcomb Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed here 6 years ago and it was great! Over the past six years new ownership has taken over and the best part of the hotel is the lobby, it is beautiful! The rooms used to match the quality of the lobby but now they are held together by caulking and are somewhat nasty to be quite honest. The Main Street Grill attached to the hotel used to be great also but the portions have gotten smaller and the quality has gone from a 4 star to a 2 star.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: On our latest trip we were in town to see La Traviata at the War Memorial Opera House. In the past we have stayed at the Whitcomb when visiting Davies Symphony Hall. The hotel is ideally situated for these venues and many others. We also love the historic nature of the bldg itself. We love the Whitcomb and hope to return many times.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, so so location
review.reviewText: The Hotel was a beautiful classic style hotel, service was faultless. Its location, while within easy walking distance to most of San Fran's tourist attractions, is not the best with beggers nearby and not far from 'The Tenderloin' which is a seedy part of town. Apart from that, I felt safe and the Hotel, due to its age, was not at fault for the changing society around it.

review.title: One of the best
review.reviewText: I have stayed at many hotels nationwide and I have to say the Whitcomb was by far the best. The hotel itself is beautiful in design. The room was very clean and comfortable I had one issue upon check-in but it was resolved by the time I made it to my room. The concierge is more than willing to give directions recommend restaurants they even checked me in for my flight and printed boarding passes. The bus, tram, and Bart lines have stations directly in front of the hotel it's really convenient to get where you want. There is a great little restaurant across the street that has great service and food.

review.title: Classic
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is an old hotel with lots of character. Speaking of character(s), there are some around the hotel --- quite interesting and harmless. My sons were quite intrigued. We flew into SFO and took the BART literally to the door of the hotel. Very convenient. With a MUNI pass, we could get everywhere we wanted to go with ease. The hotel staff was very friendly. The bathroom was quite small with no counter space. The shower was nice. The room was a little small but very comfortable for sleeping. Because of the convenience, I would stay again.

review.title: Not bad neighborhood. Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: We were told about the neighborhood being not the best, but we (including our 4 year old) had a fun time exploring and getting around San Francisco with ease. The hotel is big with long halls (if you are down the hall, you'll get lots of exercise. Tried the restaurant in the hotel where the staff were all great but the prices too high. We ate at the little greasy spoon across the street from the hotel which was good for breakfast (or the Starbucks) also in the lobby is fine. San Francisco is a cool place, with some of the most interesting folks you could meet, and you'll have a good stay here. Tip: Walk a block to the left of the hotel's entrance for a large convenience store (Walgreens I think) for all those things you forgot (or to buy that last minute Giuradelli treat)

review.title: Historic Hotel which was adequate for the price
review.reviewText: We were comfortable and the hotel was priced about right. Many tours stay here and it is on the edge of the business district. We took the tram down to Pier 39. It stops outside the door. My husband had business meetings right around the corner and we ate great vegetarian food about a block away. We checked out and toured the city a little more and then got charged by the valet for an extra day since we left around 4:00 p.m. that evening. All in all it was a nice trip with in-laws in a room next door.

review.title: Best Buy in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful experience, old world charm at a affordable price. The staff is willing to go to extremes to get you what you need and make sure your stay is comfortable.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A very busy hotel - seemed very well organised to take conferences as well as casuals. The hotel is old but in good shape. Friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, but room was just adequate
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is a beautiful hotel. The lobby is gorgeous, but the room we stayed in didn't match the splendor of the lobby area. The hotel is conveniently located by the BART station, The Orpheum Theater, and SF City Hall. The surrounding neighborhood isn't the nicest that SF has to offer, but it was fine by us. Overall, I'd say we were happy with our stay!

review.title: Right on Market Street
review.reviewText: If you plan on being in the heart of things, this is a good choice for the money. It's definitely an "older" Hotel. So do not expect the usual perks. Rooms were kind of small, but not bad. Beds were comfortable. We're glad we got a chance to experience our stay there =}.

review.title: Great hotel, but be aware of the location.
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the money, full of interesting history, very convenient Starbucks, and excellent restaurant and bar. However, be aware of the location which is undesirable -- a lot of homeless in the area including outside the front door of the hotel.

review.title: It was nice
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice inside. Very late check in times that did not mesh with our trip.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: Older grand hotel. Rooms comfortable, but a bit small. Convenient location.

review.title: The Whitcomb has had its day!
review.reviewText: The hotel is not in the best area in San Francisco, in fact for four ladies who are quite well travelled we found it rather depressing.However the transport is excellent and you can get about very easy. Where the hotel is situated an awful lot of homeless are begging and there are a few characters around that you have to give a wide berth.We were out a lot of the time but even when you came back in the evening you couldn't sit around in a lounge and have a chat because there is not the facilities to do this.

review.title: Nice location, close to BART.
review.reviewText: Farmer's market a few steps away (on Wednesday's). The main library within a block.

review.title: Good location, miniscule bathroom
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and the staff friendly. Also, there is a trolley stop out the front door and bus stops nearby for easy access to everything San Fran. However, the bathroom was so small that I couldn't change clothes in it! The beds were not very comfortable, either.

review.title: The Whitecomb: a Hotel that is too historic
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is very beautiful. The lobby was very vintage and there was a surplus in gold shiny things. More importantly, my room was tiny! I understand the importance of maximizing the throughput of your rooms, but I got a queen bed room, and the bed was half the room! I wouldn't say this was a negative but it was still surprising. I couldn't find an outlet that was usable for charging a laptop. I had to get behind the dresser and use the socket the TV was plugged into. The bathroom (specifically the toilet) was a little uncomfortable. There was no water tank, meaning the water source pipe was in the way of the seat so I had to hold the seat up with my hand while it was in use. Overall I did enjoy my stay: the room had a nice view, it was always kept clean, and it's proximity to downtown is pretty close. Just don't bring your family.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is good. I s close to union square and the subway. but the hotel itself its average

review.title: Lovely charm, nice stay, convenient location.
review.reviewText: The staff was very cortious and professional. The hotel is obviously very old, but has a cared for historic feel rather than run down like many others I've stayed at. My only frustration was that the wi-fi was totally saturated. From after work until around 11pm it was touch and go getting a consistent connection.

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel service was excellent! The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was perfect for use of public transportation for shopping and sight-seeing. Planning a return trip to this hotel.

review.title: Mixed review
review.reviewText: The Hotel Whitcomb is a lovely old hotel in the heart of downtown San Francisco. Upon arrival, our room was not ready, and we had to wait several hours beyond the check in time to actually get into our room. The room was relatively clean, although housekeeping made no efforts to keep it that way. We had to call and ask for toilet paper one day even. The room was also much smaller than what the pictures show. Our view was also unpleasant, as it overlooked into the courtyard of the hotel. We also found there were many tour groups staying there, and several wedding parties (it was Memorial Day weekend). However, it was in a great location, and the BART is literally right outside the hotel entrance. If you are going to see the site, and don't care as much about comfort of your hotel, or having a luxurious room, then you will be satisfied.

review.title: A gem in the city of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb has a convenientm central location downtown, and near the UN, but it was also in an area with a lot of homeless people, which made me feel slightly less comfortable, despite being fairly well travelled. Staff at the hotel were amazingly friendly and helpful, each treated me as though I were truly a welcome guest. My room was clean, comfortable and easy to relax in. I highly recommend this beautiful, historic hotel with lots of character. A gem in the city of San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel, In the heart of downtown SF. Enjoyed our stay at the Whitcomb Hotel.
review.reviewText: Let me start off by saying San Francisco is absolutely beautiful! My husband and I highly recommend putting this city on your list of places to go! Which brings me to the next point... we were too busy touring the city and taking it all in that although the hotel wasn't the greatest we would still go back if we ever went to SF again. Our time spent in the hotel was only for sleeping. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom needed some renovations and unfortunately our bathroom fan wasn't working. The rooms could have been cleaner (I saw dust bunnies behind the night table, TV and chair...gross). Oh, and our phone wasn't working either- kind of a pain. However, the hotel is located in a very convient location. We couldn't have asked for more when it came to convience and for us that's all that mattered. Watch out for the homeless people that sit outside of the hotel, they're harmless but kinda creepy. Other than that it was all good. If you're picky stay at a 5 star hotel. By the way don't bother going to Sam's Diner across the street... I found a hair in my dinner and to be honest I should have expected it considering the place looks old and dirty. Overall I give it a 4 out of 5. We were satisfied. Enjoy!

review.title: Great location, Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is gorgeous, just footsteps away from Bart and Muni and as comfortable as any five star hotel in San Francisco. The beds were a real delight! Big fluffy pillows and a soft bed with down comforters.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Bad neighborhood. Uncomfortable bed and sheets, mildew on wall paper in shower, thin walls.

review.title: DO NOT STAY HERE
review.reviewText: The hotel staff members were kind but seemed confused about every question asked. The room itself was a joke. It was in the stairwell first of all. The chain lock on the door was broken. Half the ceiling in the bathroom was missing and many of the buttons on the phone didn't work. You probably shouldn't stay here.

review.title: Great place to stay, very comfy bed
review.reviewText: Beautiful old hotel and a credit to the cleaning staff to keep it so nice. Charming decore friendly, helpful staff. Ideal location near the BART train and with trolleys at the door, it was very convenient. (20 min to Fishermans Wharf on the trolley) My first visit to San Fran and I easily negotiated my way from SF int airport to the hotel on the BART train (cost $5.35) and came up from the subway to see my hotel right there. (Civic Centre stop) The room was quaint and cosy yet spacious. The bed was very comfy and pillows were very good.(hard to find in some hotels) The trolleys, buses and cable cars were easy to work out and cheap (3 day pass $18) Travel desk at the hotel was extremely helpful.

review.title: not bad for the price
review.reviewText: Beautiful building and it could be a much better and more expensive hotel. Unfortunetely they try to be a four star hotel but not hard enough to actually be one. In the process they seem to miss some of the basics you'd expect from a two or three star. An example would be, when we arrived the room only had the one partial roll of tp that was on the dispenser, with no extra. When we requested extra they brought one roll. Next day after housekeeping still just the one roll on the dispenser. Expedia reservation was for a king room we were given the last queen they had otherwise would have gotten a double. Disappointed with the bar staff and beverage selection so we didn't try the restaurant. Location is in a slightly sketchy area however it's very close to everything and the BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit) line is just outside the hotel front door. Overall not a bad place for the price.

review.title: Great Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was really beautiful with old woodwork and chandaliers everywhere. Plus there is a Starbucks connected to the lobby! What is there not to love about that! I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

review.title: Ok if you are on a budget
review.reviewText: PROS:easy access to public transportation, very affordable, cheap eats and tourist attractions within walking distance, spacious sleeping quarters, friendly staff, atm next door, starbucks in the building CONS:seedy location, a lot of questionable characters roam the area, bathroom too small, hotel very outdated in decor, carpet very dirty. Overall, i would stay in this hotel again only because it was cheaper compared to other hotels in this general area and also because the bart and muni stations are just steps from the hotel. My family and i needed something accessible since we were not gonna be driving around so this was a practical choice for us. I'm not so picky when it comes to lodging. I wouldn't recommend it to people with high expectations coz you will be very disappointed for sure. The carpeting and general appearance of the hotel looks old and dirty. But if you are like us who just needs a place to sleep, this is a good bet for you.

review.title: The Whitcomb - San Francisco
review.reviewText: Me and my friends stayed at the Whitcomb for a week in May 09. It was our first time in San Francisco so we were unsure of what to expect. The Whitcomb had come hightly recommended to us by friends and it did not disappoint. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, the lobby very well kept and decorated and the staff were excellent. The streets of San Francisco can sometimes be quite intimidating to a tourist (especially 4 young girls) but the security at the hotel were great, they kept an eye on us at all times, made sure we got into cabs safetly and chased off any unsavouring characters. The consierge was also fantastic, one of my friends was in extreme dental pain at one point during our holiday and the consierge could not have been more sympathetic and helpful. She was also extremely helpful when asked for advice on nightlife, good places to eat and visit etc... Overall i would recommend the Whitcomb to anyone, it definitely made our trip to San Francisco that much more enjoyable!

review.title: Highly recommended hotel!
review.reviewText: My parents and I stayed at The Whitcomb for 6 nights, from May 5-11, 09. The location of The Whitcomb made our life much easier while we're visiting SF. My parents couldn't speak English; but they were able to go out, took bus/train (MUNI) by themselves, and came back to the hotel safely. Room is clean and bed are comfortable. We will stay at the Whitcomb if we come back to SF next time.

review.title: Very Unique & Well Maintained
review.reviewText: Arriving to our Hotel prior to Check-in time, was a very accommadating. The Bell Hop (s) were very informative in guiding us to where we can start our expedition of eating out and sightseeing San Francisco. They kept our luggage until check-in and the hotel rooms were fresh and comfortble! Room service was great, and the Concierge was the awesome with directions and he knew his city!!! I would return to this hotel it is well located in the middle of all attractions, museums and other: Little Italy and China Town, Mission. For being a very old hotel, it still offers the price and quality of hospitality.

review.title: Needs a Renovation
review.reviewText: I chose the Whitcomb because it is across the street from the Orpheum Theatre, and it was extremely convenient. The common areas of the hotel are ornate, but the hotel is in need of a serious renovation. A few of the tiles in the shower in our room were broken, the toilet looked like it belonged in a locker room (the kind of handle that you kick to flush), and the TV was at least 15 years old. It could be a very beautiful hotel if they renovated it.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Hotel was really nice and beautiful inside. The poeple were very helpful. It was easy to get everywhere around the city with public transportation near the hotel. My only complant is the area right around the hotel isn't the best. Otherwise, I really liked it and would recommend it for people who want to see everything in San Francisco!

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. Nice people and nice room. Very clean and comfortable. Great restaurant and bar.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at The Whitcomb when we took a vacation to San Francisco. Great location! A BART stop is right outside of the hotel, making transportation from SFO airport super easy. The hotel is on the F-Line, which makes it very easy to get to the Wharf (end), or the other direction to get to the Castro area (beginning). The bed was super comfy! A pillow top with a fluffy duvet, and plenty of comfy pillows! While the room was small, it was comfortable. No refrigerator or room safe.

review.title: Whitcomb hotel, San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel.. Very antique and nostalgic ambience.. Small but clean rooms. Too crowded and busy and have to wait in lines for almost anything.

review.title: Great stay in The City.
review.reviewText: The beds were very comfortable and plush. The staff were friendly and courteous. Never had a problem with "bums" as noted in other reviews. Felt very safe.

review.title: Older, but Classic
review.reviewText: This is an older, classic hotel. It is in a great location with a lot of eateries and shoping options. You can easily go to China Town and take the trolley cable car. Lot's of transportation options. You can shop til you drop if inclined.

review.title: San Francisco jewel
review.reviewText: We recently stayed five nights at the Whitcomb Hotel on Market Street in San Francisco. We found it charming, full of history, and quite comfortable. It's location was convenient, on a major trolley line, right at the entrance to the Civic Center BART station, and across from the Orpheum theatre. The surrounding neighborhood has pockets of poverty, but we felt safe at all times. We enjoyed the diner across the street as well as the Mediterranean place right around the corner, across from the friendly public library.

review.title: Older Hotel but Nice
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is a lovely old hotel which means small rooms and outdated bathrooms. BUT that doesn't mean shabby or dirty. The lobby was dark but pretty with lots of staff around to help. There is a bus stop (with the old trolleys) and subway just outside the front door and the famous cable car is within walking distance. There is also a large mall and lots of shops nearby. The public library is right across the street. The major drawback was there are a lot of homeless people in the area but the hotel does have security in the lobby at all times. Even with the homeless, I'd stay there anytime!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: If you are looking for luxury,it's not the right place for you,but if you are looking for a convinient hotel for transportation it's the best! My room was during my stay always clean. The only negative about it are the very thin walls,if you sleep light,bring over your ear-plugs.

review.title: Something good!
review.reviewText: Aircon isn't good!

review.title: Simple but Nice
review.reviewText: Its a very nice hotel. The rooms are clean and comforatable. While its not the best hotel i have stayed at it is up at the top of the list for reasonable and clean.

review.title: Whitcomb Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Good deal for the money. Rooms were clean and staff was friendly. Somewhat older, but the the price it was fine. And, the best thing was Muni/Bart was right outside the hotel, so everything was easy to get to.

review.title: Fine hotel
review.reviewText: Neighborhood is *not* a problem.

review.title: Historical Beatuy
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel steps from BART and close to museums, the library and city government buildings. The rooms are smaller but are very nice and comfortabe however there is no coffee/tea pot in the rooms. A great hotel to look at the architectural details and nuances of the time, quite pretty. Expect long lines at check in and the front desk as it is a big hotel with a lot of rooms. Most Europeans would feel right at home in this hotel but it is older and not modern enough for some for Americans. That said, I am an American and I thoroughly loved the hotel :-)

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The staff is kind and the rooms are very clean.

review.title: Really historical
review.reviewText: This hotel is a good choise to visit San Francisco as an tourist.

review.title: Not great
review.reviewText: The lobby is beautiful -- glamour of bygone era. But the rooms are old, small, not so clean. Old, uncomfortable furniture. Location is convenient to many attractions, BART, and buses.

review.title: It was ok...
review.reviewText: The hotel room itself was the smallest I've every stayed in; barely room to move. The view out the windows was of the wing across the alley, so it was imperative to keep curtains pulled, making the room feel even smaller. No in-room amenities whatsoever, such as coffee, refrigerator, etc. Clean and quaint, though room service trays & cleaning cart were left in the hallway for hours. Got a good rate for downtown SF.

review.title: Would highly recommend
review.reviewText: Exceptionally helpful, friendly staff; very convenient to public transit, rooms were attractive and comfortable

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is right at an entrance to the train from the airport - very convenient. ALSO it is right across the street from the Orpheis theater. We saw "Wicked". It was outstanding. The buses and cable cars also run right in front of the hotel, making it easy to get to fishermans wharf, Goldengate park, China town and everything. The kids in the next room were a little noisy, but overall it was an excellent place to stay.

review.title: great location!
review.reviewText: We took our children to San Francisco specifically to see Wicked and found this hotel was across the street from the theater. It just doesn't get any more convenient than that. Or so I thought: The bart station is in front of the hotel and so is the F line which takes you to fishermans wharf and the bus that goes to Golden Gate Park (science academay) is across the street. Although this was an old hotel it was clean and the service was great.

review.title: I love San Francisco
review.reviewText: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Whitcomb. The staff were gracious and exceptionally accommodating. Although check-in isn't until 3:00 p.m., we arrived in town at 11:00 a.m. and asked to check our bags. The clerk offered to see if a room was available, and we were able to check in several hours early. The evening security officer also walked my young daughter and I to our room when we arrived back at the hotel, ahead of my husband and son. Charming hotel, excellent service, and great access to public transportation (MUNI and BART) but the physical area leaves a lot to be desired--especially at night.

review.title: Well Worth the Money Spent
review.reviewText: Although the check in process on the day that I went took a really long time, the stay was nice. The rooms are small but more spacious than other ones I've stayed in before in San Francisco. The beds were comfortable and clean. I had a nice view of Union Square. The staff was really friendly. The rate for the room was definitely affordable and worth it based on the friendly staff, the close location to Union Square, and comfortable beds.

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful historic hotel, however, our room was very small and the bathroom was also very small. There is a transit station right next to the hotel which is great if you are using public transportation, which I would highly recommend. Very nice restaurant located in the hotel.

review.title: Nice place but I wouldn't stay there again
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms were small, the front desk person I dealt with had a less than pleasing demeanor and just the general area had lots to be desired. Most attractions were further than I expected. Overall, I wouldn't stay at this hotel again. Thanks, JP

review.title: I have stayed here twice and will again.
review.reviewText: OK, I wish they had a swimming pool. That's it, that's the only bad thing that I can say. I am transgendered. The hotel staff down to the last person were so nice as I stayed their three nights this year and two last year. Smiles and helpful was the rule and it in every case seemed genuine. It is a beautiful hotel well kept up with comfortable but good security. The neighborhood is not the best, but still I was not afraid even at night, but you might not be so brave. I have eaten in the hotel twice. It is expensive, with small portions, but you don't feel ripped off. Good quality and probably the nicest dining in the area. I might forgo that next time though. Lot's of other dining in easy walking or transit distance too.

review.title: Very convenient place to stay +
review.reviewText: We picked the Hotel Whitcomb for our 5 day stay in San Francisco because of the the advertised special rate and the fact there was a Bart/Muni station next door. We found the hotel had a lot of character - old, but well maintained. There are several places within 2 blocks for good, fast,less expensive meals. Also, I recommend going down to Pier 40 to try the adobo at Carmen's.

review.title: Friendly, helpful staff.
review.reviewText: This was a terrific location for getting around San Fransisco. It was so easy to use the Public transportation because the BART was in front of the hotel. The lobby staff were very helpful in giving directions and offering to procure cabs. There were good,restaurants of all prices within walking distance. The rooms were equivalent in size and nature of old hotels. We did not need lots of space as we were rarely in the room. Closet was large and the bath acceptable. The bed was comfortable with nice linens and plenty of blankets. Housekeeping was ammenable to requests that we made. It was a very pleasant four day stay!

review.title: Love San Fran Can't Stand The Whitcomb
review.reviewText: Listen i am all for a deal. However i feel that the $28 per night that the Whitcomb charges per night to park your car is a joke. Also there is no pool not even a hot tub, the plumbling is old the toliet backed up 3 times finally we moved rooms on our last night. The Whitcombs response well this is not a four star hotel. Give me a break!!! The only thing nice about the hotel : The beds are very comfortable and the maid staff is fantastic. Everything else is a upset. Pay $20 more bucks a night and stay at a four star hotel....

review.title: Overall a great experience
review.reviewText: Very easy to get to from the airport and on all public modes of transportation, and the location is right across the street from a library and a block from city hall and a off-Broadway shows. So great reviews on ease of moving around. However, you do get a little of hte homeless crowed from the Tenderloin district, so walking alone late at night is not suggested (at least alone). THe concierge was terrific and the amenities surprising considering the rate we were paying. Highly recommended.

review.title: It was very nice..!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very good and my experience was amazing

review.title: It's Historic alright
review.reviewText: Location convenient if a little sketchy, close to Civic Center, BART and shopping. Starbucks in the lobby is a plus, panhandlers outside a minus. One senses that "A Historic Hotel of America" means one that has been made-over numerous times. The layers of paint and age of the plumbing fixtures are proof.

review.title: Looks better than it actually is.
review.reviewText: My room was very run down. Wall paper peeling and ceiling cracked. Ironing board was broken. Bathroom corners were dirty. Toliet needed repair. Bedding accessories were dirty. The hotel could stand to start renovating some of it's rooms. Very disappointed.

review.title: Great service !!!
review.reviewText: The service and the room was very nice, our only problem was with the people next door...some young kids that were very noisy.

review.title: Hotel was nice.
review.reviewText: Hotel was good, but just one point i pick up, the last day, we cannot get receipt. but its small problem. If you will go to this hotel by car, be careful with Vallet parking. there are not enough staff, so everyday, it took so long time to get our car. too slow. you should have an extra time to go somewhere by car when you go out from Hotel.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Good Value, Convenient Transportation
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is a nice hotel at a good price. True, the rooms are small but in my opinion staying at this historic location made the experience of visiting an old city like San Francisco all the more authentic. When I first booked this hotel I was about to change the reservation from the negative reviews on here regarding the quality of the neighborhood. Yes, there are some homeless in the area, but they are no more noticeable than any other major American city. At no time did I feel threatened by these individuals or unsafe. The hotel is incredibly convenient for transportation. A BART/MUNI station is at the entrance of the hotel and the F-Line street cars that run past such tourist attractions as Castro Street, Downtown, Powell Street, and Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf is right outside the doorway. If you want a convenient and historical experience in San Francisco stay here and you will not be disappointed!

review.title: typical historical hotel
review.reviewText: nice location, near close to BART station, beautyful lounge, the room was nice. The bathroom was not so new, and very low lights. I ask for a fridge in the room, but in 2 days they forgot to deliver one in my room. By the way a nice hotel , with a good quality/cost

review.title: Lovely Older Hotel
review.reviewText: Back to vintage days. Staff was polite and helpful. Some rooms not recommended for light sleepers. Great location for theater goers. Reasonable rates for S.F.

review.title: nice hotel but staff needs to get better
review.reviewText: The hotel is a nice place and very central! Everything was pretty clean and nice. However they do not have the most friendliest staff and I guess the really need to improve their costumer service skills a lot!!! For example every time we went to the front desk they gave the guest the impression as if we would disturb them and they do not really want to help us! The concierge at the other hand was very helpful and polite. If you just want to stay their and want a clean room, this is where you want to go but if you want that someone is taking really good care of you while you are away, you probably want to look for a different hotel.

review.title: Decent price but that's it
review.reviewText: The price I got for a last minute vacation was great for being so near downtown San Fran. However, the neighborhood was run down, the walls are paper thin and parking was ridiculously expensive (but necessary). My visit to the city will definitely be spent elsewhere.

review.title: Located in very bad area!!!!
review.reviewText: The lobby and other pictures that are on The Whitcomb's website are the only nice parts of the hotel. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are outdated in a bad way! The worst part of it was the location...the streets near and around the hotel are filled with STREET POEPLE and HOMELESS!!

review.title: Great spot to stay.
review.reviewText: I wanted a place where I could spend a few days site-seeing before a business meeting, and the Whitcomb was great! I took the BART from the airport & crossed the street to the hotel. The streetcar line stop was in front of the hotel, and the cable car line 4 blocks away. The Asian Museum a block away was great, and I even went across the street to the Orpheum Theatre to watch "Wicked." The room was small but the bed was comfy and the room was very clean, and the price was good. The consierges were helpful. I would stay here again, and it was nice not to have to worry about driving or parking. I felt safe even walking alone at night.

review.title: Antique hotel
review.reviewText: Decent hotel for the money. Very classic and antique.

review.title: Doctor
review.reviewText: I had a great room the hotel services were just wounderful. My room was always clean and when I did want to be brother no-one borther me. I would use this hotel again.

review.title: Pretty Good Experience
review.reviewText: We went to San Francisco for a business trip. The hotel was really very nice and in a relatively good location. There were really only 2 real set backs. First, our room's entry was in the stairwell. It is very strange to walk down the hall looking for your room and realize the door is not in the hallway. We had to leave the hallway and enter into the stairwell to find our door. WEIRD! The last is the homeless population is outrageous in SF. There were homeless people urinating on the windows of the hotel, etc. YUCK!

review.title: Nice hotel near a questionable neighborhood
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 3 nights while at a conference. The hotel is a beautiful old building across the street from the Orpheum theater, the SF public library, and a block or two from City Hall. Nice lobby and classic old brass elevators. The room is in very nice condition, except for some cracked tiles in the bathroom--while the rest of the hotel is well kept, the bathrooms are in need of updating. The bathroom is large, but spartan--no towel hooks or racks, no shelves, and no trash can. Beds were very comfortable. We were awoken twice at 3AM by two different groups of folks in the hallway on a weekend night, but it was very quiet the remaining time. And there's a Starbucks attached to the main lobby. Website noted "free wireless" but I got no reception of any wireless in my room. The walk from the Convention Center or from Union Square is through the Tenderloin. VERY sketchy after dark, but there is a BART stop at the hotel, so it's easy to avoid the walk if you like. It's about a 10-15 minute walk during daytime to Union Square down Market St.

review.title: A true historic hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great historic look and feel. There is a metro stop outside the door of the hotel and I would suggest the use of this stop both during the day and at night as the hotel is on the edge of a rather rough area. The rooms are nice size but remember the hotel is historic so don't expect up to date bathrooms - but they are very well maintained

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent service. Our double bedded room was cramped, but in good condition.

review.title: not impressed.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a rather seedy area and we did not feel safe walking there at night. One of the double rooms had only one arm chair and the other had only one bedside cabinet.

review.title: not a nice area
review.reviewText: the pictures do not show what the rooms really look like and they tell you your close to everything when your really not. when i walked outside for the first time i was afraid i was going to be mugged.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Excellent 4 stars

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Girlfrien and I stayed 3 nights there. Beautiful hotel, very ornate. Room was a bit small but nicely displayed. So convienent for Bart, city transportation, Starbucks in the lobby. I would definitely stay there again. Eat at Sam's Diner across the street for breakfast, awesome.

review.title: needs updating and staff training
review.reviewText: The Lighting on the rooms is dismal, the electrical needs to be updated and the staff need to be trained on how to provide at least decent customer service. Other then that I enjoyed the hotel.

review.title: The pictures on the web site and the actual place were two different things.
review.reviewText: The hotel had a good location. The place was old and historic. The room was simple and small. It would be a fine place if your not going to be in the hotel much.

review.title: Not Bad...
review.reviewText: Pretty sweet hotel, not the best area in the city but the price is good, the hotel is quite nice in side, the lobby is beautiful, rooms are comfortable if fairly cozy but the beds are good. bathrooms small, but they work. over all a good hotel.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb is nice place and suits my needs.
review.reviewText: The staff is exceptionally polite an helful. For me the location is perfect and offers a nice variety of transportation just outside the door!

review.title: Great for the Orpheam/ seeing a show
review.reviewText: The Hotel is great for walking accros the street to see a show. It's in a not so nice area and the rooms were a little loud and it's an older hotel but the staff was VERY helpful, professional and friendly. The high ceilings made for a roomy feel and the beds were comfortable.

review.title: Awesome hotel shady outside
review.reviewText: We stayed Friday and Sat night. The Bart/Muni is literally outside, so taking the subway is the best thing to get to somewhere neutral. The first day we walked the four-five blocks to the Powell Station and we passed a lot of homeless people. around the hotel, and esp if you go behind the Orpheum theatre. Wow. They offer drugs and all. It was very uncomfortable. But, once we learned the MUNI can take us to the Powell station, thats exactly what we used to get out of there. The nice thing about that is if you're going to the mall you don't even need to get out, there is an exit directly inside the mall. The hotel itself is really historical looking and its really nice. There were a lot of people there and to our surprise their restaurant was packed on both nights! Esp a couple hours before the Wicked show starts across the street. I recommend the hotel, if you take the MUNI/Bart.

review.title: Will be back.
review.reviewText: Great old Hotel. Quiet: clean: Economical but small room and bath.

review.title: Fabulous City
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is a lovely historic hotel and the staff are happy to accommodate the most demanding traveller. The location is a little far out but there is a BART outside and a bus stop very close by.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Keep in mind this Hotel is old. But it works. Heater worked. Hot water works. Beds are very comfortable. What else do you need? Location is excellent. Stairs to MUNI right outside. Great food at restaurant in Hotel, maybe a little pricey. Starbucks in the lobby...subway & burger king across the street. Walgreens on the corner for convinience items.

review.title: An elegant hotel
review.reviewText: WOW. The hotel really is beautiful. The concierge was very helpful. The restaurant in the hotel is expensive but very nice and the bartender there was great. The one unfortunate thing is that the hotel is on the edge of a not so great area of downtown San Fran. We ended up taking public transportation to the Warf and when we decided to go out at night we ended up taking cabs and not walking as we expected to. I live and work in a very urban area and I am used to the city life so it didn't bother me much. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: This hotel is an exceptional value for the price. It is a beautiful and elegant historic hotel. I especially enjoyed the Starbucks adjoining the hotel lobby. The hotel's gourmet restaurant was fabulous and reasonably priced. I travelled alone from the east coast and felt completely safe and well taken care of.

review.title: Pluses and Minuses with Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText: Being a historic hotel, I expected a couple of inconveniences. The room was small, but functional. It was well-decorated and the bed comfortable. My room backed onto a common area for the service areas. I was NOT pleased with people yelling at each other down below, at 7:30 in the morning. The housekeeping crew was very polite and efficient, the front desk were less pleasant. Very cold. Location is VERY convenient for public transportation. The BART is at the front door.

review.title: Neat place to stay
review.reviewText: We thought the Whitcomb was a neat place to stay. Despite being a very old hotel, you feel like you are staying somewhere very elegant. The only complaint we would have is the parking. It is very limited and costly at $28 a day.

review.title: Great location for theater/Union Square access
review.reviewText: Excellent restaurant, a walk across the street to the Orpheum Theater, small rooms but adequate. Walking access to Union Square.

review.title: The Whitcomb is an historic hotel, it is beautifully maintained and very clean.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very convienient to the subway/bart as well as being in the theater district, you are never too far from anything. The resturant and bar are great, and you also have Starbucks coffee ajoining the hotel, and it opens very early.

review.title: very impressive
review.reviewText: for those of you who want a hotel where you can feel secure this is your hotel. it was also very clean and the sheets looked brand new. a great staff on hand too!

review.title: 32$ parking + Hotel
review.reviewText: Very Old , No Parking, Parking Cost 32$ extra

review.title: Whitcomb New Years Eve
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, older, updated and for the "most part" and exceptional staff truely interested in your comfort. There's a Starbucks, and you like them or you don't on the premise. It's close to several small but quality diners and sandwich places and it's a mere half block from the BART. What's not to like.

review.title: A terrific find in San Francisco
review.reviewText: On a trip to the Northwest my daughter and I stopped overnight in San Francisco. We stayed at the Whitcomb and found it to be a "hidden" gem. A little off the beaten track but still on a bustling part of Market a BART station is located almost right outside the front door. We found the hotel to be very well appointed and immaculate, from the lobby to our room. The staff was gracious and helpful. Right off the lobby there is not only a very nice bar but also a Starbucks. I'd recommend it to anyone planning to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Great place to stay for the Orpheum Theater
