review.reviewText: This hotel is just kitty-corner from the Orpheum Theater, so it was very convenient for our last trip to SF to see Phantom. It is a beautiful old hotel, especially the lobby. Our room was clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was nicer than I expected. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant and they were great about getting us out in time for the theater. We will definitely come back!

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: execellent location to see a show a the Bill Graham Civic Auditirium...easy access to transporation to other locations, as well

review.title: Disliked the location
review.reviewText: Hotel was ok, staff helpful, but the location was very bad due to been located in such a shady area.

review.title: Nice historic hotel
review.reviewText: Lots of character. Staff were friendly and helpful. Probably not the best location on Market Street (lots of homeless and panhandlers in a several block radius). Lots of noisy teenagers in the hallways at 2 AM every night (was the week over 2009 New Years so maybe should have been expected?).

review.title: Comfortable, classy hotal with easy access to most points within San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Good hotel.

review.title: We had a wonderfully romantic getaway.
review.reviewText: We had just gotten engaged the night before, so this weekend's Christmas present became an engagement celebration too. I truly enjoyed our stay at the Whitcomb. It was a lovely, beautiful building. The room was comfortable and clean. The bed (king size) was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. I'd say the bathroom floor was a little cold in the middle of the night, but otherwise we found it quite romantic and a welcome surprise for our Christmas/engagement.

review.title: satisfied
review.reviewText: Great location, Starbucks in Lobby

review.title: Recommended with reservation
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel but with certain reservations. Its location is excellent for getting about San Francisco with access to trams and buses outside the front door and a BART station just down the road and the trams and buses are THE way to get around the city. However, although on Market Street it is right in the centre of a rather run down section and there are a lot of homeless people living on the surrounding streets. We had no trouble at all and we walked to the hotel late at night on several occasions without feeling threatened. If however, you are of a more nervous disposition you might feel uneasy staying at this location. The area is being redeveloped and I would guess that in a couple of years this hotel because of its quality will be able to command much higher prices.

review.title: The Whitcomb
review.reviewText: Nice place. Friendly staff. Close to the War Auditorium and the Orpheum, walking distance to cable cars and downtown shopping. Lots of homeless but that is a City problem nothing to do with the hotel. Burger King across the street for a late night snack and Starbucks in the lobby for the early morning wake-up, A++++

review.title: Convenience is Key!
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel since we were going to the theater and I couldn't have picked a better location. The theater was literally right across the street and with a full restaurant and bar in the hotel this place couldn't have been any more convenient.

review.title: Historic means OLD
review.reviewText: This is a historic hotel in the center of crack alley, but convenient to BART and MUNI for business needs.

review.title: old hotel but still a good choice
review.reviewText: Not a good location... Again a very old building but with a sui generis taste, and a great service. Definitely a good deal for its cost.

review.title: I'll definitely return
review.reviewText: This hotel has much to offer. I found the Guest Relations Manager who helped me to be particularly accommodating. The hotel lobby is elegant and is adjoined on one side by Starbucks and on the other by a nice restaurant that offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner at reasonable prices. A wonderful vegetarian restaurant, Ananda Fuara,is across the street on the other end of the block. This hotel is across the street from the Orpheum Theatre and within walking distance of Davies Symphony Hall, the Opera house and City Hall. Union Square and the other major San Francisco theatres are a few more blocks away with other attractions easily accessible with public transpoartation. The rooms are pleasant. The bathrooms are tiny, but adequate. This is a hotel to which I will return.

review.title: I was impressed
review.reviewText: I would stay in this hotel again, Excellent downtown location!

review.title: Nice but nothing to write home about
review.reviewText: Nice older hotel, clean, small rooms extremely small bathroom with a door that did not close very well. Decent if you will be out a lot and just need a place to sleep. The bed was comfortable.

review.title: Small rooms, but convient location
review.reviewText: The rooms are small, but clean and nice. The location is perfect in terms of transportation, but close to a rough neighbor hood.

review.title: Not the greatest area, slow service but really beautiful!
review.reviewText: The check in and check out process was horridly slow- be prepared to wait in line for a bit (even if you want to check in early). The area is not the greatest- a lot of strange people, probably some drugs and homelessness in there too. Despite the shady characters around, I believe that it is probably still safe to walk around at night. Good value for the room though. The hotel is so beautiful and the rooms are very nicely decorated and above all clean. I would definately stay here again!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful historic hotel located in San Fransico, with helpful staff. Reasonable prices and parking avaible, (for a fee). Subway entrance is right outside the door, for easy access across the city.

review.title: Good, convenient, not great
review.reviewText: Lovely interior. Seedy area of town, but close to concert halls and civic center. Parking outrageously expensive, with a tax on top of the fee itself! Hotel restaurant OK, but meagre portions. Three cheeses were offered as one of the appetizers. Our waiter told us they were goat cheese, blue cheese, and cow cheese. Not too helpful.

review.title: i would go back again
review.reviewText: everyone in the hotel was very friendly and helpful.great food in the resturant.room was small but clean.

review.title: Great deal for the price
review.reviewText: We booked the trip last minute and honestly the pictures of the hotel and the star rating helped in making our decision. We booked the cheapest room and although it was very tight it was fine. We were never in the room and our housekeeper kept our room clean neat and tidy. I would stay there again for the price and location. Close to everything. As for the evenings it was ok to walk Market street up until 10-11pm after a show but no later. Why take any chances? We were never approached or hasseled by any of those that lived on the streets but it can make you uncomfortable.I highly recommend the Whitcomb. The hotel restaurant was great, limited menu but everything was delicious and David he worked the morning shift was always attentive.The concierge was always available to help you especially Carley and Jan as well as the others. One problem... the 6th floor did not have an ice machine.

review.title: Great Decor
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely, had a really good feel to it and the staff were very nice. The neighbourhood though wasn't the best. There were a lot of quite scary and demanding homeless people. We felt comforatable enough walking about during the day but not at night. Public transport was fantastic and accessible. The room was probably too small for 4 of us and the beds are tiny for doubles. All in all good value and really beautiful, the valet was a bit Mickey Mouse though!

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: I love this hotel. The reservations employee bent over backwards to accomodate my needs. The staff were helpful and extremely friendly, especially the concierge. Although it's 2 short blocks from the nicer part of downtown, it's right in front of a bus stop and cable car stop which came in handy every day. The bathroom is a bit small but so what, it's a bathroom! Will definitely stay there again, especially considering the price.

review.title: I thought it was great!
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is very convenient to the local transportation. Right outside is the trolley or the BART. A few blocks away is a mall and lots of outside stores that you can walk to. If you're going to a 49ers game like we did, the public transportation has shuttles that run right near the hotel for $7 round trip. I thought that was pretty awesome. The rooms were a little small but very clean. I don't spend much time in the hotel room so it didn't bother me. Overall this hotel is great, everyone there was helpful, and I would definately stay there again if I ever go back to San Fran.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, iffy neighborhood
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is a lovely old hotel; well kept; reasonably priced and close (enough) to all San Francisco's downtown attractions. While San Francisco has way too many "homeless" people, read as "bums" in other cities, Market Street in fron of the Whitcomb is especially seedy after dark.

review.title: Not nearly as nice as the website looks
review.reviewText: It is a little out of the center of things not in the best area. There were cob webs in the bathroom and corroding grout around the sink. The bellman service was extremely slow. Again the decor, ambiance and quality not nearly as beautiful as the website shows.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay there. Easy access to bart and the sights of San Francisco.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Excellent place to stay on Market Street in San Francisco

review.title: Gem in the rough
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was quite nice inside, elaborate wood and marble work lined the reception area and registration. My room was quite small, but adequate for my purpose (single occupancy). One issue that I had was that the wireless internet signal was extremely weak on my floor, and the front desk staff were relatively apathetic to the situation when I brought it up. Internet was available in the lobby, which was PACKED with people unable to access the internet in their rooms. Outside the hotel- the neighborhood was quite rough, lots of adult stores and more aggressive-than-average homeless people than I expected. Travel to-from the hotel was VERY easy, as the Civic Center BART stop entrance was literally feet from the hotel front door.

review.title: Love it!
review.reviewText: Conveniently located, from the time we arrived we felt welcomed!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: This was the 2nd time we stayed here. The hotel itself is great, though not the best neighborhood. It's right above the Civic Center BART station, and places like Moscone Center, Union Square, cable cars, etc. are just a few stops away by BART, bus or street car.

review.title: In San Fran for a loss of a family member
review.reviewText: While in San Fran under really very bad and sad circumstances, this hotel's staff really helped us to get through what could have been just a nightmare. The staff was superb and helped in many ways! This is a gem in San Francisco and we recommend it to all!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: It's not the best quality hotel, but you can't beat its location on Market Street. The F-Line stop is right at the front which will connect you to all the main sites of the city. It's location close to the train line made it really easy to get to from the Airport too. Service is great, it's just an old style hotel as the name suggests.

review.title: Nice people
review.reviewText: The place was old and that was a given. Staff at the front desk was cordial. I think the staff at night are much nicer. Their concierge were very helpfull and really friendly. The location of the hotel was great, just watch out for some homeless outside especially on 7th St. or Ave. The public transportation was conviniently located by the hotel so it's much better to see places with that than driving your car. I recommend the hotel.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel Whitcomb may not be the flashest place to stay in San Francisco but it is excellent value for money and is very well located only metres from a BART station and right on numerous bus and trolley car routes. There are two huge department stores within walking distance and the Starbucks cafe in the foyer is a huge plus. Our room was old, but was very comfortable and we appreciated free wireles internet access in our room. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our three nights at The Whitcomb.

review.title: Great Location for Orpheum Theatre!
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel the evening of a show I attended at the Orpheum Theatre. Right across the street from the theatre! Perfect location for an overnight after seeing a show. Clean, pleasant room. Very quiet for being on Market Street.

review.title: would stay again
review.reviewText: a very historic experience. Close to everything. Bathroom had some mold and tub did not drain well. Restaurant food was excellent. Would've liked room service to be available later in the evening. I love historic hotels lots of character. I would stay again.

review.title: does the job
review.reviewText: I was hesitant about booking at the whitcomb after the mixed reviews but i couldn't resist the price (in comparison to the other sf hotels.) We got a queen size bed room and it was quite large and clean. we did get a room facing away from market street so maybe our room was quieter than other rooms. overall, i enjoyed our stay, despite having to go to the lobby twice to get our keys re-activiated. would book here again if the price was right.

review.title: well located for walking
review.reviewText: While not the nicest hotel we have stayed in, the Whitcomb was well located for our interests. We were able to walk to dinner and the symphony. The history of the hotel is interesting and the lobby is a beautiful representation of its era but the upkeep of the rooms could be better. However...all said it is well priced for San Francisco and I would stay again if I were to be occupied in the immediate area. Breakfast in the restaurant was well served and enjoyable.

review.title: There was no water pressure and the faucets were all starting to get rusty
review.reviewText: I think they need to start up dating the rooms. They are old and they look old and the bathrooms are rusty and leaky and they need to get better water pressure. I tried to take a bath and had to wait about 45 minutes to get about 1/3 full.

review.title: Would not go back
review.reviewText: Pros: Within walking distance to the cable car pickup, and the heart of all the great shopping. We didn't have to use our car at all - not even once. SF has an excellent transit system. Cons: The rooms are small. The hotel is old. The bathoom was the size of a small closet, and smelled like mildew. Walking the 4 blocks to the shopping district means you will have to navigate through a lot of homeless.

review.title: A beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great service. Wish there was a breakfast service...other than that, overall stay was great.

review.title: Practical solution -- certainly would return
review.reviewText: Downside -- small room, front desk a bit slow at times. Upside -- for the price, it's an excellent practical solution. Rooms were clean, comfortable. BART/Muni right outside (don't rent a car). Starbucks in lobby. Yes, there are homeless folk outside asking for money -- but for those who understand the realities of downtown SF and today's underclass -- and are not "creeped out" it's absolutely fine. Again, can't beat the price, particluarly if BART/Muni meet your travel needs.

review.title: Right Downtown if that's where you want to be
review.reviewText: If you are not going to be in your romm much, this is a perfect place to stay. It was a decent hotel, but if you are one of those that like to hang out in the room alot, I probably wouldn't stay here. But, if you want a place right downtown and really are just sleeping, it was great. The staff was very friendly and it was reasonably priced. If you are just hanging out downtown you probably don't need a rental car and you can save on the daily valet required expense. Decent hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Good: Softest bed I've had in a hotel. Very clean and nice looking. Bart entrance/exit almost outside hotel. Bad: Even though I had a reservation I had to wait for a room to be cleaned. Parking is a bit expensive, $28 a day.

review.title: Pictures are Deceiving
review.reviewText: The hotel room was not nice at all. For a historic place the it was disgusting. I was upgraded upon arrival to a larger bed room and was informed that this was a non smoking room. Not quite. Walked in and you can smell old musty smoking room. Went to open the window and found a cigar butt still in the window pane. For a historic hotel they should still be keeping things up such as bath tub surfaces which were worn down to just metal needed a new tub or surfacing done. The last night in the room and we found a cock roach in the bed. Now for the money you spend you would think of getting a better quality for a hotel especially one of that calls itself the History Hotel of America!!!

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: With both Bart and Muni stops directly in front of the hotel we were able to enjoy our trip without bothering with a rental car. The trip in from the airport cost $5.35. We were within walking distance of Union Square, the Civic Center and all of the activities South of Market. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel has been beautifully restored. Our room, and bathroom, were spacious and attractively decorated. Even though the room faced out to Market Street we were not bothered by street sounds. We appreciated the air conditioning in the room as the weather was unseasonally warm during our stay. We will stay at the Hotel Whitcomb the next time our travels take us to San Francisco and will recommend the hotel to our friends who may be headed there.

review.title: Very convenient to see the city
review.reviewText: The main problem at this hotel is the plumbing though the staff was eager to be of assistance whenever problems arose.

review.title: Whitcomb property great, ignore location
review.reviewText: This remodeled hotel is very reasonable in price for the elegance, service and condition of a 100 year old building. The stained glass, woodwork, and shine of chandeliers is a pleasing atmosphere. Unfortunately, the area is home to many of the homeless who provide constant turmoil in the neighborhood. Police monitor 24 hours a day, security within the hotel is no problem and a streetcar stop within a half block will take you almost any where and provides site seeing options the BART can't. We visited the United Nations Square almost right across the street every day for fresh fruit, baked goods, and bargain souveniers. Also just one block from the Orpheum. Great room service breakfast costs a bit but arrives on time and hot. A Starbucks creates a wonderful coffee smell in the lobby every day. I would go back.

review.title: Nice Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: My room did not have a closet or a wardrobe. Bathroom had no vanity tops or anywhere to place items like toothbrush, make-up, etc. Parking, as with most downtown hotels, was VERY costly and there seemed to be no alternative. In-house restaurant was excellent- at least for breakfast.

review.title: Nice and confy
review.reviewText: The hotel is huge and you can get lost in the hallways, but it is a nice hotel. The starbucks at the lobby is great when you have to get up early.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText: This was a wonderfully central hotel to stay at in San Francisco. Right on Market St with the cable cars, muni, and BART right outside the hotel- ease of transportation was fantastic. Hotel rooms are small but functional- no view in the back alley, but no noise either. We just sleep, so location and comfort is most importnt to us! Concierge was very helpful. They will gladly print out your barding passes (no charge!) instead of using the business office that charges you~ ugh. Didn't use their restaurant, but their hours run late- and there is a Starbucks essentially in their lobby- very convenient to late night hot chocolate! Booked at a friend's suggestion, and will recommend it to others, too!

review.title: Never back to WITHCOMB
review.reviewText: In his price of ripping off! At least a water kettle in the room for making tee or coffee as American coffee is like used laundry water. At the front desk not enough staff always.

review.title: Whitcomb
review.reviewText: The neighbourhood gets unpleasant in the night so try to come in early or take a taxi. My room had a strange smell when I first got in so I kept the window open all night - might be an issue in the winter. Other than that, hotel staff is friendly, location is good, rooms are clean and price is reasonable.

review.title: Nice Historical Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful carvings in the lobby, the whole place was quite elegant. Bathrooms are a bit cramped, but it is historical after all. Overall, I was very happy, with 2 caveats: the parking (which was a bit scary, not to mention expensive), and the traffic noise in the room was pretty loud. If your main concern is pure comfort, it may not be for you, but if you like to experience a bit of Old San Franscisco, it is very nice.

review.title: Be carefull with the Internet Wireless!!!
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel room. Be carefull because the internet wireless does not work, only the reception area is accesible to wireless, a lot of people with laptops in payamas at 11pm. An extra large bathroom and comfortable room. Caution with the area at night.

review.title: Haunted Mansion!
review.reviewText: This hotel reminded me of a haunted mansion, even the guard at the door. It's located in a little bit of a shady section, though it is very close to the MUNI and BART. Overall, it was a fun experience. Very convenient.

review.title: Easy to get to from airport
review.reviewText: But, the rooms are small, no coffe maker in room, no fridge, the view was of a contruction and the valet parking lot. No room service after 10pm. Menu is not so inviting. The bed was not very comfortable, not enough pillows. The bathroom was very very minimal. But its easy to get to from the airport. No car needed, good public transportation-right on the Bart and cable cars. Starbucks in the lobby. Room was freshly painted so it smelled like paint.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: The hotel has a certain charm to it. The rooms weren't big by american standards, but were more than adequate for those accustomed to Europe. The price of the hotel was very good value.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb was in a great spot - very easy to get to by public transit. The historic room was great, although a little old and not in the greatest condition. It seems to be frequented by lots of young group travelers, and we had 2 early morning fire alarms during our 5 days there - not so funny. Overall though, a decent place to stay at an affordable price.

review.title: Nice hotel, bad restaurant
review.reviewText: The hotel looked good, and the room was comfortable. It was very quiet. It is right next to the convention center and the Warfield. There is also a starbucks in the building. It is in walking distance to the mall, but it was shady area and we made sure to get back well before dark. The real problem I had with the hotel was the restaurant. It was borderline unfriendly. We ordered two cheeseburgers, one medium and one well done, and they were cooked exactly the same except mine didn't have any cheese on it.

review.title: Room Size
review.reviewText: Hotel lobby was very elegant, resturant food was excellent. The room was alot smaller than the website picture.

review.title: Location is perfect.
review.reviewText: The bathroom needs to be upgraded. It will be nice if a whirlpool is added.

review.title: Reasonable value - a little in decline
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb has an impressive lobby and is a reasonably good value. Once you exit the elevator on your floor, though, you will realize that the hotel is in decline a bit...arriving late at night, I found the large, dim hallways brought to mind "The Shining." The room was comfortable though, service was satisfactory and the location is good (with a Starbucks connected to the lobby).

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised at everything about this hotel--price, cleanliness, friendliness of the staff. Overall, would easily come back here again.

review.title: Great Spot to Stay
review.reviewText: the hotel is really nice. i liked the look. its been taken care of very well. the room was nice and the bed was very comfortable. the only thing i didnt like was the paint smell in the room. it seems they had been painted recently. over all the service there was good. i know some ppl had problems but we didnt. we even forgot something there and they offered to mail it to us. that was nice of them. i would personally stay there again. great location in the city, i really recomend it.

review.title: Comfortable and quiet.
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable and quiet but the "Double/Double" room was a bit too small for two people. Housekeeping and room service were exceptional and exceeded my expectations! For the most part, my stay was worth the price. My only disappointment was that although the bathroom had a good size shower, there was no bathtub and the noisy bathroom fan was on the same switch as the light.

review.title: Pleasant and conveniently located.
review.reviewText: Excellent location - the entrance to the BART and MUNI Station is right outside the hotel so you can get there directly from the airport in half an hour. It is also on the historic streetcar line and several bus routes so you can travel directly to Fisherman's Wharf, the Zoo and many other places of interest. The area is fine if you stick to the main streets at night; we travelled everywhere by public transport and had no problems. The hotel is clean and the staff helpful. Our only slight quibble is that the lighting in the rooms could be a lot brighter.

review.title: it was not bad
review.reviewText: the only bad thing about it at the hotel is that they make you pay for a parking...about 28 dollars per night...they didn't said that to me when when i buy the ticket...but everything else is good though

review.title: Great Location.
review.reviewText: Vintage-style, old-world charm. Room was decent & very clean. Free access to a small gym with cardio & weight-lifting equipment.

review.title: Quaint, but small
review.reviewText: The lobby was beautiful, with chandeliers, and stained glass behind the front desk. The rooms were small, but comfortable, nice high ceilings. The bathroom was TINY. From the toilet I could hit my head on the sink in front of me. Room service was decent, valet parking only. The Starbucks in the lobby was convenient. In this area of town there were quite a few homeless people around. A BART stop and F-Line stop are right in front of the hotel, making tansportation pretty accessible.

review.title: It was cool! I will consider staying on the same place again.
review.reviewText: The place is really good and so as the location. If you want to explore san francisco, its just a few steps away coz public transpo is available the moment you stepped out of the hotel. The only thing i dont like is that me and my friend was put in a 'disabled room"! I wasnt expecting that I just thought the hotel was probably full at that time but the front desk could have told us that so we know what to expect. But overall all it was good.

review.title: Want just a one night stay...this is the place.
review.reviewText: Staff was kind and helpful. Room a bit small for our family of four, but the cleanliness made up for it.

review.title: O.K. hotel
review.reviewText: I could hear people in the hallway outside too well. Also, not enough electric outlets; one of the electric outlets seemed ripped from the wall. Otherwise, good quality.

review.title: Good value, good location
review.reviewText: I would recommend the Whitcomb-it is a good value in a good location. I found the staff friendly and helpful. The standard rooms could be bigger but it's not like I spent much time in my room. Wireless worked well, a Starbucks in the lobby,a small but decent fitness room, MUNI and BART at your door. You can walk to downtown in minutes. All and all highly recommended.

review.title: Small things
review.reviewText: I found the hotel to be nice and a good value for the city. The front desk staff were professional when not over taxed, a little surly when busy. The room was clean and comfortable, wireless signal a little week, but my main complaint is the lack of a coffee maker in the room - even if there is a Starbucks in the lobby, it would be nice to make a cup of tea at night.

review.title: If you like bad service then this is the hotel for you
review.reviewText: I stayed there for my 40th birthday, a present from my boyfriend. If you like bad service then hotel staff there will certainly meet you needs. If you have a problem then I would not bother speaking to the desk staff: better speaking to the manager who was very helpful. We were quite lucky with our room as some were absolutely awful, although the bathroom resembled a public convenience (albeit a clean one) and had a shower that could only be used by a dwarf. A wall in the room seem to have a coca cola spirts up the paper (not sure how long it had been there). The sound proofing between rooms was poor but luckily our neighbours were very quiet. The location is good for links to the airport/down town but a walk into town is a precarious and not particularly pleasant one, through the various homeless,prostitutes and beggars.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: My bed had torn sheets on them. I had to call to get them exchanged. The bathroom was extremely small, was a closet at one point. There was no doorman to get my luggage when I arrived. I had to go in and ask for help.

review.title: Excellent and friendly service
review.reviewText: My stay was everything I hoped for, and much better than I dreaded from having read some of the reviews. Expedia wasn't exactly up to date on hotel policies (the premises had been smokeless since the first of the year, but I was "given" a smoking room when bookibg on line), but the fact that I had booked with Expedia seemed to make no difference to the hotel; I was treated cordially and professionally. Check-in and check-out were efficient,and the housekeeping staff was extremely pleasant and cooperative. For one traveling to San Francisco without a car, the fact that several major buslines and a BART station are just outside the main lobby is a definite plus. (Hotel parking was $28/night during my stay.) The neighborhood is what it is; this is San Francisco after all, and I had no fears negotiating anywhere with my eight year old child.

review.title: Very nice and historical building
review.reviewText: Employees were very cooperative and helpful, specially providing additional services we requested, as well as accurate information in regards to places we wanted to visit and convenient transportation.

review.title: Read the Reviews of your hotel choice!!!!!!
review.reviewText: I regret staying here. If you like an old building then by all means look away. But for a couple on a honeymoon, your better off at a Motel-6. If you have money to blow then you wont mine the crazy 28.00 to pay every night you park your rental/car. Your stuck paying the fee due to there are hardly any other parking options, and you wouldnt want to park on the street with all of the homeless in the area. The staff treated us with respect and were professional, but for bang for your buck? There are better options. I wish I read this remarks before I booked my trip. I would of picked another hotel before being surprised with fees, an expensive restrauant, etc. I stayed at a few Motel-6, and Best Westerns that made this place look like a neg star hotel. Good Luck and plan your trip. Good luck. I will not stay there again. They need to include the parking fees in their advertisement!!!

review.title: Whitcomb a great value
review.reviewText: very reasonable rate for a comfortable no frills hotel. Beautiful old world charm in lobby. rooms very comfortable, nice high ceilings, if a bit small overall, especially the bathroom. Front desk staff somewhat surly but everyone else nice. BART, MUNI, F line right outside front door. central location in city. homeless abound in neighborhood but never felt uncomfortable. would highly recommend to those who know the city and are comfortable in that area and just want good value for room price.

review.title: Nice hotel close to subway
review.reviewText: Overall, I really liked this hotel. It was clean except for a couple of stains on the blanket. The room was very comfortable. The bath products where great. I loved that there was a Starbucks in the lobby. The area isn't the greatest, but the BART/Muni entrance is so close to the front door that you can get anywhere in the city fairly quickly. To those who complained about the homeless, this is San Francisco, so homeless and panhandlers are pretty inescapable. I loved the charm of this hotel. It's been maintained very well over its lifetime. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice on the outside...
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located right by a subway stop, and has a beautiful lobby, but other than that, it really isn't worth it. The room was super small, the bathroom door doesn't latch closed. The sink is in your lap when sitting on the toilet. Heater did not work and you have to call front desk for t.v. remote. We found mold in the bathroom and the blanket was "stained" with mystery stain.

review.title: The Whitcombe, Gorgeous old hotel with character and friendly staff
review.reviewText: I have just returned from San Francisco and an enjoyable 6 night stay in The Whitcomb Hotel, I was a little worried at first having read the reviews on here and other sites, however my fears were unfounded, I was checked in by a Russian lady called Olga who not only was friendly but was funny too and instantly put me at ease, she explained about the Hotels services and what was happening in and around the Hotel in the time I was staying, My only prolem was the parking as is a little steep but Parking is San Francisco's 3rd Industry after banking and tourism!! My room not only was clean it was fully modernised and well equipped the cable TV was a god send! Big comfortable bed and even though I was on the front with traffic noise I still slept well. Joined to the hotel is the Florida Garden Restaurant the food was excellent and good value too (Clam Chouder was fantastic) also there is a Starbucks attatched. The local area is suffering a little but I only saw 2 or 3 homeless people my entire stay! Maybe because Hilary Clinton was speaking across the road one night! All in all a good hotel full of history and comfortable and I would gladly stop again and take my family!

review.title: EXCELLENT STAY!!!
review.reviewText: Everyone was very nice at this historic hotel conveniently located on Market street. BART stop right outside the door, all other Muni transportation also outside the front doors. Can't say enough about how great this location and overall stay were.

review.title: good nights sleep...
review.reviewText: it was near everything or close to everywhere in sf,sweet service,and clean.room didnt smell of ciggarettes even tho it was a smoking room.great sleep.handy wifi internet.this is my new spot in sf if i need to stay the night!

review.title: Located in a bad area
review.reviewText: The hotel wasn't so bad, as where it's located. Yeah, there is the BART stop and the F-Train right outside, but it is also south of Tenderloin and you can't walk two blocks without being afraid for your life!

review.title: Good Hotel reasonable price
review.reviewText: nice clean hotel

review.title: Parking fee?
review.reviewText: I didn't know that there is a parking fee. If I have known about that, I would have choosen another hotel. Also it is too expensive.

review.title: Hotel Whitcomb
review.reviewText: The hotel was really nice. Our room was very clean and we got lots of help with directions around the city. The only thing we didn't like was the room service. It was horrible! We ordered french toast and bacon for breakfast and it was cold when we got it. I arrived on time but it was disgusting. Other then that, we loved to hotel and would stay there again!

review.title: Nice for the price
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel before a few times and enjoy the location to the BART station and other points of interest. The Lobby and main building has been upkept nice, but would like to have a bit more better linens (my comfortable had an ink stain on it) and higher quality.

review.title: Booked 3 nights but only stayed 1
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is a fine building but it isn't a comfortable hotel. Our room was dark, cold and noisy. The Whitcomb is quite centrally located but the area is depressing, with a lot of homeless people and drunks on the streets. We had booked three nights but after one we cut our losses and moved to a motel.

review.title: Great Service, but low on location
review.reviewText: The front desk & service guys were great: very courteous & helpful. The rooms are nicely decorated, with very comfortable beds & amenities (recently renovated?). Good access to public transport. However, rooms are small & location not ideal for families with young kids. Not much choices for eating places.

review.title: Good value in a good location
review.reviewText: Great location -- immediately adjacent to a BART Stop, a Muni underground stop and streetcar stop. Easy walking distance to main shopping area and great restaurants. Only downside, many homeless people loitering along Market Street and Civic Center area.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Bathrooms were filthy. The hotel is old and needs a lot of improvements

review.title: Will be Back for sure
review.reviewText: It was very clean and classy. its near all the action downtown. the parking garage is very convenient and the valet service was great. treated me with respect and kindness, i most definitely will be staying here again.

review.title: Old Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: If you like OLD hotels and don't mind paying $30 each night to park your car, it's a nice place.

review.title: A must stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This piece of property is just an eye candy for historical buffs like me. The lobbys ceiling will just take your breathe away with its luxurious original crystal chandeliers, intricate moldings of the pillars, and the classic singing doorman to top it all up. We were warmly welcomed by a very delightful front desk manager, Tj. He made our check-in so smoothly, making us feel very well taken care of and pampered. Everyone that we encountered was just very courteous and pleasant. Our night out in the city truly became a memorable one. I will definitely go back to this hotel and experience once again staying in a classic grand hotel.

review.title: will go back again
review.reviewText: very happy with the hotel and food very nice

review.title: Good value, safe and friendly
review.reviewText: You don't need to read the hotel's history to sense it was once the City's Town Hall. It has a good, plain, honest feel to it and helpful friendly staff. The location is very convenient, about 20 metres from a bus/tram/metro station. As others report there are people living in poverty in the streets nearby as in many other parts of the City. There are also some extremely wealthy people. On the whole the former are no danger to you.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Attractive lobby, rooms are a bit old and in need of paint/refurbishing. Very near BART station & bus/trolley stops on Market.

review.title: A Fine Find
review.reviewText: Although located in a rather seedy part of town (lot's of street beggars), we were very pleased with this hotel. Yes, it's old and quaint but the staff are very helpful and pleasant, the rooms are very small but adequate and the in-house restaurant was a highlight of our vacation. We did complain about the noisey bathroom fan (so loud but part of the light switch so you couldn't avoid it) but there wasn't anything that they could do. Parking at $28/24hours is probably the going rate but a discount for guests is a must. Public transport is close, fun and inexpensive. We would definitely stay here again when we are in SF.

review.title: Good place for the price
review.reviewText: Beautiful historic hotel, but location off the beaten track. Easy access to BART, bus lines to get you to the fashion district, cable cars or the F line directly to Fisherman's Wharf. Room and bathroom was small but cute and clean.

review.title: It was a let down
review.reviewText: My overall impression from the hotels website, was wow, this looks great, I like historic hotels. From the looks of the lobby, I thought, great this is going to be nice. I get off the elevator on my floor and immediately turn offed by stained carpet. That's one of my pet peves...and then we go into the room, and the curtains, and the comforter we dirty and stained....I pulled back the sheets and hair, I called down and they immediately changed the sheets....I felt really icky in the room. It had a stinch as well...in fact I called down for air freshner! The concierge was very nice and the very friendly staff but oh, just not that clean in my book for a three star. Don't recommend it!

review.title: Not the safest Area!!!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very nice and the room was always clean. The room is EXTREMELY small and is not in the safest district of downtown san francisco. It would be a better idea to stay in a hotel in a better area if you plan on walking to your destinations at night.

review.title: Convenient and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: The Whitcomb is an old historic hotel which doesn't mean it doesn/t have the required amenities. While many 5 star hotels in San Francisco charge for wireless internet, the Whitcomb offers it free of charge, which is great.Room was clean (minor problem with the duvet on the bed), comfortable although the hotel doesn't boast any city views, but is conveniently located on Market street.All in all, the best value for the money and a comfortable stay in a cozy hotel!

review.title: Charming and quaint
review.reviewText: The hotel is much like a bed and breakfast hotel, very charming and feels like home. However, you need to be careful of the area of town. Several homeless and unsavory types in the area. If you have kids, not a good idea, but adults should be fine. The small restaurant across the street served a great hot breakfast, we ate there twice!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel was ok, but I expected more. It is definitely historic, you can tell the age of the hotel when you walk in. The hallway to get to our room did not smell very fresh. The carpets were not very clean, I didnt want to walk on them bare foot. As soon as I got out the shower I would put socks on so that my feet wouldnt touch not only the bathroom floor but also the carpet. The hotel staff was great in helping with directions and giving recommendations though, very friendly people. Overall we had a great time in Frisco but we wouldnt stay at this hotel the next trip.

review.title: Staying at the Whitcomb
review.reviewText: The hotel was just right for what we wanted. The reception and concierge were fiendly and helpful and the rooms were fine. The restaurant was a bit of a let down however and lacked atmosphere. The food flattered to deceive. I liked the on site Starbucks. The situation of the hotel in the mission area meant that there are a lot of homeless people about which is upsetting if you are not used to it.The trams and buses do run often however so you can avoid them if you wish to.

review.title: Cheap and Dirty
review.reviewText: The lobby looks glamorous enough, the building is historic, and the staff is gracious and friendly, all of which make me feel guilty that the rest of this review will dissuade most travelers from staying there. Hair on the pillow, questionable marks on the sheets. Bugs in the shower. No water pressure, which I didn't think would be an issue until I tried to wash my hair. I was barely in my room, and to be honest I didn't ask the front desk to correct any of these things during my stay, so who knows? Maybe the bugs and dirt were just a fluke. The wifi absolutely didn't work on the seventh floor. Sketchy block - I didn't exactly feel unsafe, but I don't love the smell of urine on the street in the morning, courtesy of the numerous homeless who hang out near the convenient BART stop. The hotel really is convenient to all the bus lines you need to get around the city, and that BART stop puts you just 30 minutes from SFO.

review.title: great value
review.reviewText: a good deal for the price and convience. easy access to the Bart System as well as the electric busses.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: It's centrally located, the rooms are good enough, the lobby is beautiful, the restaurant is excellent, there's good champagne by the glass in the bar, room service was quick, and the prices are reasonable all around. The water pressure could be better, but it's an old hotel. I plan on staying there whenever I'm in town on business, which is often.

review.title: Classic charm
review.reviewText: This hotel made me feel like I was in a Humphrey Bogart movie. I felt as though I should be wearing an old fashioned suit and smoking a pack of cigarettes. Ok, enough with my metaphor. This place is great and very nicely and cleanly decorated. The staff and concierge were very helpful and kind. Great location to the BART and streetcars. 1-1.5 miles from Union Square and probably 2 miles from Fisherman's Wharf. Great place to stay!

review.title: A touch of character
review.reviewText: The 1910 decor and high ceilings give this place a nice feel. Unfortunately the stretch from the cable car to the hotel along Market St is through a seedy area. However, the F-line, Muni and BART all stop right in front of the hotel so you can avoid the street if you want. The food and service in the restaurant were good.

review.title: Don't Waste Your Money
review.reviewText: Stay else where, and you'll enjoy your time

review.title: popular established hotel in business area of city.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay in this 'old style ' hotel which was well equipped and staffed by very helpful people.Room was well proportioned, but did not have coffee making facilities as standard, and the shower controls were in need of some minor adjustments, but neither detracted from our enjoymant of stay.Situated in business part of city, but shops and restaurants are within walking distance, and a trolley car stop is outside the door for easy reach to Waterfront where there is an abundance of places to shop and reat.Overall, a well priced good place to stay.

review.title: Good Value, Great Location
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel. The interior was in great shape and the rooms looked nice but they were a bit small. If your like my wife and I we spend all day in the city and only sleep in the hotel so the size isnt bad for our traveling needs. The only drawback to the room was the poor wifi connection. As far as the hotels location goes it was great. You are within 50 feet of a BART station which takes you pretty much were ever you need to go.

review.title: Diamond in the Rough
review.reviewText: Very clean and well maintained hotel. Rooms a tad small if you a bigger person but other wise very comfortable. Security guards in lobby at night time so very safe feeling. Down side was when you walked out of the hotel to be confronted with the loads of homeless people which we harmless but would not recommend travelling alone at night. Other then that it was very close to all the main attractions and the BART was just out the door... awesome time!!!!

review.title: Economical hotel....
review.reviewText: I loved that the hotel was situated close to Nordstrom's, Fisherman's Wharf and some really great eateries! You can take the bus, trolley car or a taxi anywhere in the city for little money! The one drawback to the hotel is the water pressure in the shower...leaves a little to be desired. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Decent hotel, not the greatest 'hood though!
review.reviewText: We don't have any complaints about the hotel itself, and we enjoyed the fact that Starbucks was right downstairs and all public transportation was right outside the front door. The only thing we didn't like so much was walking around in that immediate neighborhood, especially at night. But if you don't have a problem with street people, then you should be just fine! The location did cause us to get out to some areas that we might not have otherwise visited, like Hayes Valley (very hip) and the Mission District

review.title: it fit the bill
review.reviewText: was reasonable and comfortable, and well located for transport

review.title: Definately will recommend!
review.reviewText: I did't quite know what to expect b/c there weren't a lot of pics, but it exceeded expectations. Lobby was very Old world beauty, service was warm and friendly, room was spacious and clean, and location, location, location. The train/buses were right outside. We were so glad we didn't need a car to explore San Fran b/c parking is $26/night (ouch!)

review.title: Not good hotel
review.reviewText: I was dispointed by the reception welcome! bad The room was very small and dark The only good aspect is that the hotel is close to BART station

review.title: Very happy
review.reviewText: I am very happy with the outcome of my honeymoon stay at this hotel. It was one of the main reasons we had such a great time. One thing I would change if I could was that we weren't allowed to check in after our arrival at 8:45am in morning with nowhere to go or without knowing where and what to do. We had to walk in neighborhoods that were ridded with homeless people and crime. We just arrived into the city and had no idea where the safe places were. I believe the hotel should have given us a little more leinancey in the fact of us being so far away from home and leaving us out on the streets where we knew nothing. Other than that everything else was wonderful.

review.title: Close to BART
review.reviewText: Nice lobby, close to BART, people were very friendly. Stayed on a Friday night... nothing was open in the immediate area. Restaurant closes at 10p

review.title: recommendable
review.reviewText: Avarage size room, comfortable. The staff was all friendly and helpful except for the night guard. Close to the Union Square, though you have to walk a few smelly blocks. If you are not too demanding and need a place to sleep for the night, their comfortable beds will be enough for you.

review.title: City Central Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is convenienty located on Market Street in down town San Francisco, with the tram and Bart (San Francisco underground subway) just outside the door. Hotel is well maintained and rooms are very clean. The only major reservations with this hotel is the limited space in the bathroom and the check-in staff tended to be cold and distance.

review.title: highly enjoyable
review.reviewText: everything was at it should be - better than expected even...

review.title: So so...
review.reviewText: Considering high rates in San Francisco, the room was spacious and clean. The hardest problem was thirsty. No refig. was in the room, and no coffe maker. So, whenever I wanted to drink something, I should go down to buy. Except that, staying in the hotel was quite convenient.

review.title: Historic
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the ambience. The restaurant was excellent-both the food and the service. We would return. The only complaint was the comfort of the bed.

review.title: Nice, but...
review.reviewText: The area isn't bad, but all the homeless people around is RIDICULOUS. They're everywhere and at all times. I don't recommend walking around at night because of this.

review.title: Clean, Affordable, Great BART access, & Roomy for a family
review.reviewText: Whitcomb is near San Francisco's center. It has great access to BART if you don't plan to drive yourself. Besides, the best way to enjoy San Francisco is not to drive yourself. You'll miss a lot scenary plus added headache trying to find a parking. The hotel is not perfect, but it is clean and affordable. I don't know whether it is a all suite hotel or not, but the room they gave me is a very large suite, it can easily sleep a family of six if they would allow. The only thing I'd comment is the bathroom. It is accessed only from the bedroom so it would be a bit inconvenience for family stay. There is not enough counter top to spread your bathroon accessories. The sink and the tub is small. But that's something I won't care too much for traveling by myself.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: We shared the hotel room with 2 double beds. Very spacious with high ceilings. The bathroom was surprisingly spacious. Beds were very comfortable. The room itself was quite big. Great value for the price.

review.title: Seedy Area
review.reviewText: Lots of vagrants between this hotel and Union Square ..take the numerous buses outside hotel if offended.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: The good part was we were close to everything. The bad part is $28 per night for parking the rental car and hard to maneuver all the one way streets and "no left turn allowed" streets.

review.title: impressed by the condition not by the lobby staff
review.reviewText: Waiting in line is usual and personal at lobby was not very helpful: no internet access card available for 2 days and no information to help solve a tire issue when requested. Fortunatelly the place is very nice and rooms clean.

review.title: Very Nice Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: After reading all the previous reviews, I didn't know quite what to expect as some reviews were pretty negative. The Market street area around the hotel isn't what you would call Rodeo Drive but we felt completely safe walking around both during the day and the evening. The lobby is beautiful and the check-in process went smoothly. We actually had a very spacious corner room that was extremely quiet. We didn't eat in the adjoining restaurant but it was extremely convenient to have Starbucks next door. Bathroom was clean and the room was very comfortable. Very centrally located right on the Civic Center Metro. Enjoyed the free wireless internet access. As one reviewer said, you really feel like your are stepping back in time in historic SF.

review.title: Will surely go back to this hotel!
review.reviewText: Very friendly personnel. Hotel was very clean and beautifuly decorated. Stragetically, in an excellent area.

review.title: The Bay's Best Kept Secret
review.reviewText: I was concerned at first of this hotel's location, not being an SF native. The outside of the hotel left something to be desired but indoors, I found the decor to be quite eclectic. Hotels in San Francisco are very expensive along with parking. Though there is a seperate charge for parking, a bit pricey, it is understood that there is limited room in the hills San Francisco. We did not opt for the "suite" but our room was very spacious and our bed quite comfortable. We got a nice view of the rooms adjacent to us as opposed to the Bay but that view also comes with an extra cost. We were very surprised with the overall service, highly recommended!

review.title: Great spot
review.reviewText: I read some previous reviews and not all were good. I had none of the issues others had. There is space to park your car up front to unload, the concierge told me where to park, the room was great, staff helpful. Old world look to it and easy to walk lots of places. We enjoyed every bit of it.

review.title: Slightly shabby
review.reviewText: Long lines to check in and to leave bags with bellman. Hotel room and bathroom was small, but beds were comfortable. Location was marginal -- we weren't comfortable walking in the neighborhood after dark.

review.title: Can't Wait to Return - City Pass is a Must
review.reviewText: Hotel Staff are kind and generous giving excellent service. I did not have much faith in the room being nice due to other reviews but the room was great, just what you need after a long day at the wharf. The beautiful charm and architecture follows through to the rooms not just the lobby. Staff greets you safely on late night returns. The dinner across the street is fast and delicious. Hop on the public transportation right away to avoid bothersome city dwellers mentioned in other tourist reviews.

review.title: So So
review.reviewText: Hotel is a good place to crash. The area its in is a little scary at times. A very key item was the BART stop right in front of the Hotel, i used it a bunch. Its in a good location but could have been less expensive for a "good" location. Staff was under staffed and at times abrasive. there were no accounting errors, which is always good. Television was old and liked to change colors when watching. Stayed 3 nights 4 days in single king bed room. There was still hair from someone else all over the bathroom floor. Shower curtain didn't fit and i almost tripped on it and the shower was for shorter people. I'm 5'11". Bell hops seem on top of it and really nice.

review.title: A good value for my cash
review.reviewText: Located midway between the Castro and downtown with excellent public transit connections. The baseboards could stand a good scrubbing but overall the room & shower were clean as were the hotel's public areas. Hotel security is good. This is my 2nd stay here.

review.title: Would not recommend
review.reviewText: On arrival, only one elavator was in service, leaving 20-30 people waiting. Staff offered no apology, rather "you'll just have to take the stairs or wait". They did at least have more than one in service the following morning. The room was small, but clean. However, the door knob to the bathroom was broken so door couldn't be opened from the inside of the bathroom if shut. This would have been obvious to cleaning staff, so would have expected this to be fixed. The location is convenient to a BART stop, but other than that I didn't feel comfortable with the area. There was some nice aspects to the hotel building itself (high ceilings, beautiful woodwork), but it has a ways to go to compete with other hotels in the same price range with slightly better locations.

review.title: Not a good location
review.reviewText: I would like to see cleaner rooms nicer workers and cleaner area. Also you should change the shampoos and soaps everyday not after every costumer.

review.title: Whitcomb, San Fran
review.reviewText: Not the best neighborhood.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Poor service.

review.title: Very Scary Neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was ok at best- very, very old with small rooms and not the cleanest looking place either. The worst part about it is the location. It is not safe at all to walk around so even a trip of 4-5 blocks requires a taxi. Market Street turns bad very quickly and Hotel Whitcomb is definitely in the bad section of town.

review.title: History, Comfort and Delightful Dining
review.reviewText: Traveling for pleasure to see San Francisco, the Whitcomb was in just the right spot. We parked the car and utilized the public transport right outside the front door. (Next time-no car, you can even BART from the airport). The entry of the hotel is striking in marble and crystal-a National Historic Hotel, the staff is welcoming and very accomodating and the wide hallways lead to comfortable well appointed rooms. And then we had dinner. Beautiful presentations, great flavor and more than enough value for the price-more than usually found in a hotel restaurant. The perfect place for singles or couples traveling to San Francisco. Also, just a couple of blocks from the Civic Center.

review.title: Conveniently located in Down Town
review.reviewText: This Hotel is located next to the Bart station. Very Convenient for those who are traveling without a vehicle.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, but don't expect it to be updated with all amenities.
review.reviewText: Dissappointed there was no tub in our room. Also smelled like there was a smoker who stayed before us. Hotel staff could have been more inviting and less "business".

review.title: Average. In a seedy part of San Francisco, be careful.
review.reviewText: Lots of homeless people. Most seemed harmless but there were a couple of crazy and loud people! Again, be careful.

review.title: You get what you paid for
review.reviewText: The hotel wasn't excellent but not horrible either. It was in a great location. The rooms weren't the best but not unbearable either. It's not easy to sneak ppl into a room, though.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The bathroom in the hotel was about 2 feet wide and 7 feet long. In this space, there was a shower, a wash basin and the toilet. There was not enough space to even dry up after taking a shower. In the room itself, many electrical outlets did not function properly unless one jiggled the adapter into a specific position- one night my cell phone failed to charge as a result. In the evening, right outside the main door on the Market Street side, there were several drunk street people who accosted us on two different occasions.

review.title: Nice Hotel in central zone
review.reviewText: I stay here for 4 nights with my family. The room was not too big but clean and quiet; the location is great for most of the actraction.

review.title: Mediocre, has good and bad points. Will not return.
review.reviewText: Access great to the BART. Most staff were polite. Price was right. Lobby is beautiful. Our room was a larger double outside the hallway in the fire escape area, behind the fire door. Very creepy. Someone tried to get into our room at 4:30am. Bath tub did not drain. There are homeless outside, but they were not a bother.

review.title: impressive
review.reviewText: impressive, quality service

review.title: Underserviced for the price
review.reviewText: From a slow check-in of one hour because only two clerks were manning the desk to being given a room with the central air blowers outside the window and being told there were no other rooms available, the service was not what I had expected from this calibre of hotel. San Francisco offers many more options which I will consider next time.

review.title: clean and tidy
review.reviewText: found the hotel to be clean and rooms comfortable streetcar stop outside hotel which was ideal when visiting fishermans wharf would stop there again

review.title: Unique San Francisco Experience
review.reviewText: My wife and I took a mini-vacation to San Francisco. We had lived there before, but wanted to go back and experience the restaurants and shopping. We decided to try the Hotel Whitcomb based on its historic premise. We had stayed at historic hotels previously and thought it might be a fun addition to our stay. The Hotel Whitcomb delivered what it promised. We wanted a memorable experience while visiting San Francisco, and that is what we got! The entrance and lobby overwhelmed us as my wife and I entered the hotel--it was breath-taking. It truly was not what we were expecting. The period details really made us feel like we were stepping back in time. We were able to relax and enjoy our stay. The doorman and front desk staff greeted us with smiles and were very nice. Everyone seemed to enjoy themselves. The hallways in the hotel even made us feel like we had gone back in time. It was vert relaxing. Our room faced Market Street, and we had an amazing view of the city. This hotel left a positive impression with us. Overall, we liked the hotel and would recommend it to others. It is not a new property, but it offers great service and a relaxing experience. I am sure we will stay there again on a future trip.

review.title: Surly staff
review.reviewText: Once elegant hotel now faded and located in what has become a very rough part of the city. Room was clean and room and restaurant staff pleasant but reception staff were surly verging on rude. Had a car for 4 days of our 10 day stay. Asked reception about parking and was told $25 per night plus tax, just drive the car round to the back. Asked again the day I picked up the car and was advised same. On checking out I was charged for 8 nights for the car and told it was my responsibility to inform the garage that I no longer required parking after 4 nights, despite never being advised of this nor entering any agreement. Was refunded the overcharge but this was done with irritation, disinterest and several miscalculations. It was made clear it was entirely my fault while a queue developed behind me.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely. It is no longer in the nicest place, but its historical beauty outweighs its current location. One of the rooms that we stayed in was very small, but it was still in very good condition. There is an additional fee for parking your car, even as a guest. That was quite a surprise due to the fee of $25 a night, but I guess it's par for the course in San Fran. Overall, I loved it!

review.title: Insulation please!
review.reviewText: Small rooms with seemingly cardboard walls. Do not choose this hotel if you value silence. Book now if you are interested in your neighbours' private conversations (you WILL be able to catch every word)!

review.title: Dirty
review.reviewText: The receptionist gave us the key to a room, that was already assigned to another person. So we entered the room and were suprised to see luggage inside, the TV on etc. And I think this usually happens there as they were not suprised at all by this. They changed it (the correct room was so close, the receptionist said!). Besides this, the bathroom was very dirty. Looked like somebody started cleaning it 20 years ago, but never finished.

review.title: Mold Spores...
review.reviewText: Everything was great except for the room. There was a huge mold spot just inside the door which seemed to grow in the few days that we were there.

review.title: Didn't like the location....
review.reviewText: When we arrived, we were checked in by a very pleasant girl who answered all our questions very well, and gave a great impression... but then we never saw her again. The rest of the service was poor. I asked abour using the internet, they charged, fair enough, some hotels still do. They had 2 cards, a $10 1 hour card, or a $5 20 minute card. When I asked for the 1 hour, they said that they had none. So I asked for 3 20 minute cards for the $10, they practically laughed at me! The hotel does have an old odour, and can seem very dark... the location is close to the civic centre, but is also close to many of San Francisco's homeless which is depressing. I stayed in 3 hotels in San Fran... this was the worst.

review.title: Great for the Symphony
review.reviewText: The proximity of both Davies Symphony Hall and the Civic Center BART station were a perfect combo for our recent trip. The room was reasonably priced, clean, and ample in size. Though the surrounding neighborhood is not the best, we were able to catch the "F" line directly in front of the hotel to go to to Fisherman's Warf so we had no problems.

review.title: Good location for accessing San Fran sites and activities.
review.reviewText: The doorman was especially helpful and friendly. The architecture, woodwork and brass are stunning.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Close to Cable cars, good value

review.title: A bit troublesome
review.reviewText: The bathtub had no plug. Had to use a washcloth. The closet had not light. Maintenance came up and moved a lamp from the room in there. Hot water better in the AM than PM. Beautiful lobby, very convenient to downtown attractions.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. The Bart station is in front of it and it's withing walking distance from the Civic Center. Also Market St. can take you to many places like Embarcadero, the Mission, and Powell St. From there Union Square, China Town and North Beach are very close by. It has close access to freeways 101 and 280. I didn't have any meal in the hotel. My room was very comfortable; blocks very well both light and noise if you want to sleep.

review.title: Given a choice, I'd stay at another hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is over 90 years old, and at first glance, has quite a bit of charm. The charm quickly dissapears once one gets off the elevator to the room floors. While our room was comfortable, the stench of stale cigarettes in the hallway outside was almost too much to tolerate. The room was very clean, but did not include a coffee maker. The concierge and front door service were terrific, but the front desk personnel seemed indifferent to the needs of guests. The hotel is, however, within walking distance to the civic center, art museum, symphony, etc., and public transportation stops right outside the front door.

review.title: ***Please Do Not Stay Here!***
review.reviewText: Extremely run down (Think Bates Motelish). Ratty area did not feel safe & decided to check out the next day. Dirty Bathroom yuck!! Hotel staff warned us not to park on street because our car may get broken into so forked over $25 for 1 nights parking. Also "billing error" charged me for dinner in the hotels resturant!?!?!? Do not stay here!

review.title: Well located and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located if you are travelling for leisure. Easy access to public transport. The staff is helpful and the rooms are comfortable.

review.title: Great location! Bart and Muni are right i front of hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed here many times and was a little disappointed with a 2nd floor room, as we've always been higher with a nice view and a larger room. But we spent very little time in the room, so not terribly disappointed. All else was great.

review.title: impressed
review.reviewText: the design of the hotel itself is historic. there's always a concierge at the entrance to assit in anyway. very friendly and helpful. the location is perfect. the bart system is right infront of the hotel. the rooms may be small but the beds are very comfortable.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Gorgeous lobby, room good enough, very clean, great shower, mattress kind of flabby. Very nice staff, but housekeeping erratic. Location very convenient; the people who hang out in the neighborhood at night may not look promising, but they don't seem to bother anybody.

review.title: Quite decent a hotel
review.reviewText: For the price in SF, this hotel is quite decent. And it is quite convenient, too. The Bart station is right in front of the hotel. Though sometimes, too many homeless wandering around makes the street a bit unsafe.

review.title: Good hotel in a bad place!
review.reviewText: The hotel is good, the price is great, but the location is very bad. The BART location at the door of the hotel is a great asset if you are not comfortable with walking in the area.

review.title: Majestic older Hotel has lots of character
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay. Beautiful architecture. Nice restaurant. Restaurant bar makes great drinks. Also has a Starbucks. Very limited expensive parking $25 a night. Windows in room opened for fresh air. Only negatives. Odd, difficult to use faucet in bathroom. Stain on carpet in room. poor water pressure in shower.

review.title: Very beautiful, great service downstairs, awesome location,
review.reviewText: Amazing to be there, chandeliers, location, marble, high ceilings, history, across from Sam's Diner (WOW) and stores, bus line, Civic Auditorium just there. The price and service is right, will come back soon!

review.title: location, location, location
review.reviewText: Great location. BART stop right outside the door, UN and cable cars only blocks away. Great atmosphere. Hotel is older but can only see it in certain spots, if youre looking closely. Would definitely stay there again and will recommend to others. Starbucks in the lobby was definitely convenient. Staff very friendly and helpful.

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: i recommend this hotel to everyone. i plan on staying at this hotel the next time i go to the city. the room was clean and the hotel atmosphere was impressive.

review.title: Excellent location for Budget Business Travelers
review.reviewText: This is the only hotel I stay at when in the SF area. It's a fabulous mix of a building which is over 100 years old (and was used as a City Hall at one point after the 1906 quake) yet which has modern amenities such as free Wi-Fi access and brand-new bathhrooms. The MUNI stop outside the front door can't be beat either, since it enables you to reach the hotel from SFO for approximately $5.15.

review.title: Good Hotel; beware the locality
review.reviewText: This hotel has some lovely features throughout its lobby and communal areas. Our room was very nice, decent size, good maintenance. Staff were very friendly and helpful. This hotel is only four blocks from Powel (start of the cable car - Bloomingdales) and one block from the outstanding City Hall. The F line stops outside and the Central BART station entrance is also just outside the door. It is such a pity that when walking to any of these I felt very uncomfortable and wary of the locals. Last time that I felt like this was walking, at around 10.30pm, down a back street to a car park in Blackpool. Taxi quite cheap from Powel - best to use one.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: It has a very good location, my friend and I were able to access great shopping, with just a quick walk. There is also easy access to public transportation!

review.title: Centrally located but...
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel being centrally located, right by a train station, walking distance to shopping areas, price is affordable, however, the places you walk through is a bit scary because of drug activities along the way. We had to take the bus 2 blocks back to the hotel to avoid these areas. Our room was street-side and the window insulation is not good because you could hear all the noise of the traffic outside. Hardly slept though room was fine.

review.title: Convenient, good price
review.reviewText: More than adequate, convenient location. Helpful staff.

review.title: Don't stay here
review.reviewText: Bad neighorbood (8th and 9th Market Street - gets seedy around 6th and you have to pass that and seventh to get to the hotel). Says wireless Internet but there's a cafe in the lobby for $5 per 20 minutes. Only high speed is the RJ45 telephone jack attached to the room telephone.

review.title: Downtown SF cheap
review.reviewText: Older place, but not shabby. Only problem was lack of water pressure for shower.

review.title: Very good Hotel.
review.reviewText: If I go back to SF definitely I'll stay in Ramada Hotel again, very convenient and comfortable.

review.title: SF Civic Center Area Hotel
review.reviewText: The Ramada Plaza Hotel has a lovely lobby. The rooms are not fancy, but they are very comfortable and clean. The beds are also good. The one drawback is that there is street noise audible from many rooms. On the positive side, though, the hotel is in an excellent location, right above a BART station and within walking distance of many attractions, including the opera house, cable cars, shopping malls and Union Square.

review.title: Decent for the money & location.
review.reviewText: The Hotel first shafted my girlfriend and I with the room at the very end of the hall way. The floor of the room had a stain mark on it. Plus the bathroom was small & had no tub. After requesting a room with a tub, we had to wait close to an hour to get keys for that room. Mostly due to the fact that the maids had not entered in the database the rooms which were cleaned. Anyway after all that we finally got our other Queen size room, much bigger & with a tub. Really after that hassle the service was decent.

review.title: It was a cool downtown place to stay
review.reviewText: Market street ent that hot but the location where the hotel is ideal..public transport is right outside..the financial district is about six blocks away also union square.

review.title: Would like to recommend but just can't
review.reviewText: Positives: Lobby looked good, room looked good. Quaint old hotel feel. Free Wireless worked well. Negatives: Location. Stray off Market at you own risk. Too Many homeless/panhandler types nearby. Day one: Drain in shower didn't work. they tried to fix and created a backup in the room. Still not fixed by 5pm. Due to smell got a new room. New room. Day two: They were doing full scale water work in hotel thus no water when I went to take shower. They forgot to tell me and apologized. Hard to attend business meeting without shower. Day three: Finally water pressure, but no hot water.

review.title: Bad Neighborhood
review.reviewText: A good hotel located in the wrong place. Bad Neighborhood. It's was scary to walk across street.

review.title: not in a safe place and quite poor conditions
review.reviewText: hotel is quite close to the center but in a quite unsafe area. The hotel rooms are quite clean but the overall confort is quite poor.

review.title: Historic Gem Near Everything
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Ramada Plaza Downtown 4 time now. We love this gem of a hotel that was built in 1912 and served as temporary San Francisco City Hall for 3 years after the big earthquake of 1906. It is away from the main tourist areas, but only a short ride by public transit or taxi to most everything. Our average stay is about 5 nights for both business and pleasure. This hotel suits our needs perfectly. The price is right and the rooms are a little small, but quiet and comfortable. The staff is polite and accomodating. The hotel is literally steps from the underground MUNI and BART transportation systems. The historic trolley F-Line runs directly in front of the hotel on Market Street and will take you to the wharf area or the Castro district. We never rent a car! City Hall, the public library, and the opera house all surround Civic Center Park which is across the street.
