San Francisco does have a homeless problem, so if seeing these people on the street bothers you, stay closer to Union Square. They have never bothered us.

review.title: excellent location for access to public transportation
review.reviewText: hotel is OK

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: not clean loud noise poor heating

review.title: Decent Price, nice accomodations, central locations
review.reviewText: Hotel service was good and effecient. The central location of the hotel made accss to the tourist areas very convenient. Also very convenient to the Castro district. Lobby is pretty and rooms are adequate and modernized. Older hotel, so just remember it was built in 1905 not 2005. I liked it.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was not always responsive to requests, and in some cases they did not speak English. The room service is not recommended at all. If you need food order in or run across the street.

review.title: Good budget hotel near BART
review.reviewText: The room was a bit dirty but I was really impressed with the lobby. The food was decent (I don't recommend the clam chowder) my BLTA sandwich and chocolate decadence cake were good. I think the hotel is going through a name change from Ramada to something else so I don't know how much longer the hotel is going to be affiliated with Ramada. Free internet access via wifi was clutch. I found a great rate so I recommend this hotel.

review.title: It was an awesome time in San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel was centrally located and convenient to the Streetcar and Bart.

review.title: Great Place for the money !!!!
review.reviewText: I was a first time visitor to SF. Ramada proved to be a good choice, granted parts of the immediate area surrounding the hotel were questionable however I did not feel un safe. The facilities and staff were great. The building is old and is maintianed well. Room service was prompt and the food acceptable. Front desk staff very friendly and professional. Bart and Muni within 40 feet of front entrance.

review.title: Great deal
review.reviewText: Good location, nice hotel.

review.title: Decent hotel, Terrible Internet Access
review.reviewText: The Ramada Plaza is a decent hotel- especially for the price I got. Everything is older, but in decent shape. The comforter in our room had the rips sewn up (from the wrong side) so there were ridges of stitching along some parts. The amenities as the same/standard as low/medium priced hotels. The outlet in the bathroom was broken, so the staff brought in an extension cord. The service was pretty good in general, however, their wireless access was abysmal. The service they use was down 90% of the time and the helpdesk would state "at least 24 hrs" whenever we called. For a place like San Francisco, this was an unexpected and unwelcome surprise. As a side note- I didn't mind staying at the Ramada (wireless aside), since I had lived in SF and know the area, but if you are unfamiliar with San Francisco, this hotel is not in the best area. They do have security inside the door and there is a BART (subway) enterance just outside the front door, which was nice. Rumor has it, the hotel has been acquired and is somehow turning into a boutique hotel in the spring, with the same rates as 5 star hotels. We will see what happens, but due to the location and state of rooms/amenities, they will have a hard time getting guests with high rates.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Hotel is not in very good area, but I guess downtown is a bit not safe. Good thing that subway station is right in front of hotel. Hallways stink!!!!!! smell of cigarette smoke. When complained NO action taken. response was .. oh!! other side of hallway has smoking rooms??? Room was clean and price is good.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Good throughout and centrrally located. Nice staff.

review.title: Kind of scary...
review.reviewText: We stayed in two different rooms, both of which had stains on the walls, sheets and carpets. Other than that, the bed was comfortable and the location is great!

review.title: A Gem in the Civic Center District
review.reviewText: The Civic Center area of San Francisco is not one of the best neighborhoods, but this hotel was a nice surprise. It is conveniently located to Bart, and Muni offers bus and street car service right outside the front door along Market Street. The lobby was gorgeous, and the rooms were clean with nice high ceilings. When it came to a recommendation for breakfast, the concierge sent us to a perfect place to experience a slice of San Francisco life. The only problem I encountered was with the Wi-fi service. While I was receiving a nice strong signal in the room the connection wasn't very fast.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I was not very happy with my hotel room that I was given. The lights flickered and did not work evey time. The toilet took a couple of time to flush. The room was to small for two to enjoy themselves comfortably. I am hoping for a better experiance next time I stay at a Ramada.

review.title: A different world...
review.reviewText: The hotel has a very european feel to it. I felt as though I'd stepped into a different country, it was very cozy and felt tucked away. The room was very small but comfortable and met all of my needs. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful when needed. The location is good but not great, but, public transportation is practically at the doorstep. I don't recommend walking by yourself at night around the hotel but like all metro areas use your own discretion.

review.title: Just Bad !!!!
review.reviewText: A lot of things happened since our arrival... the front desk people were not "customer service" oriented at all. They said they didn't have any parking available, and after raising my voice all of a sudden there are more than 5 spots... People smoking in the "Non-Smoking" rooms and smoke coming into my room... the front desk says they can't do anything about it... oh well, I could go on and on and on... it was just bad. I will never go back again.

review.title: good balance in this price.
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to shopping and China town. Bart/Muni and Bus station and coffee shop right under the Hotel. Hotel has a good security team, they will cheak the hall way every couple hour.

review.title: Not a good experience.
review.reviewText: When I first booked this hotel I was looking for a conveniently located hotel with "PARKING" and "INTERNET ACCESS". After driving all the way from San Diego, I parked in front of the hotel just to find out they did not have any available parking as they mention in the description, and there was no one to help us get our luggage out of the car.... after rasing my voce at the front desk I was able to get someone to help and a parking space. By the way, the wireless internet service is soooo slow.... it is almost like dialup.

review.title: Mediocre at best
review.reviewText: clean towels are the best feature of a blaise hotel room and cavernously outdated hotel -- oh, I take that back -- the presence of a Starbucks in the lobby that opens at 5 am is perhaps the best reason to stay here. Dark, small, dingy rooms, slightly surly service and hallways that are bigger and better lit than the rooms themselves make this a place I'm not keen on visiting again.

review.title: Excellent location- great deal
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location very close to the subway. So you can get to virtually all places in Sanfransisco from here. It is located in downtown so there are quite a few attractions in a walkable distance from the hotel. Good price. The hotel staff was corteous and were quite fast in servicing requests. Wireless internet access is an added advantage.

review.title: Nice hotel, but not the greatest location
review.reviewText: The Ramada was nice and the staff was very freindly. But the location was not exactly where we thought it was going to be. We thought we were staying in Union Square near all the stores. It's a little off from the heart of Union Square, so we had to take the bus to get there. And it's not really safe to walk back to at night because some spots are sketchy. And good luck finding a taxi in Union Square to get back to the hotel! I will definitely spend more $$ next time and actually stay IN Union Square.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel Central Location
review.reviewText: Although it is an older hotel, it has beautiful features. A wonderful doorman service ( a wealth of information) and a Starbucks right in the lobby! We were right across the street for the trolley, bus aka MUNI and Bart Light rail. The mall is within walking distance. The room was clean, updated and maintained. We would definitely stay again.

review.title: Good Breakfast but the rooms need some work
review.reviewText: I realize that this hotel is in an old historic building but there are upgrades to the bathroom they could do that would make it a much nicer stay. The showers were small and didn't have good lighting at all. The rooms were spacious enough. The room service breakfast was fantastic. The dinner on the other hand was overpriced and was just average.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: This hotel wsa located literally feet from the civic center bart station and the Muni station....making it perfect to get anywhere you would want to go in the city...There was also a starbucks and a walgreens right by the hotel....the hotel it self has a lot of character to it...while still being well maintained....the service was also excelent.

review.title: Location Location
review.reviewText: The Ramada Plaza Downtown is located right on busy Market Street and steps away from all Public Transportation (BART, MUNI, Streetcars). It is a great location if you are looking to stay 'not' right in Union Square but in-between shopping (Union Square) and nightlife in SOMA or Castro Districts etc. It also has a Starbucks off the lobby which is nice. I think the upside of this hotel is the location and sensible price/amenities. However, I would not recommend staying here if you have 4-5 Star Hotel expectations. The rooms are good size with high ceilings but some of the modern conveniences like large sink vanities and modern baths it does not offer.

review.title: Very Good!!
review.reviewText: After reading some of the reviews here I got a little afraid that the hotel would be in either a bad neighbourhood or in bad condition. Neither was the case. I have no idea what all of the people talking about so many homeless people (Before I went I thought we were gonna be run over by them) but none of this was the case. Yes there are homeless people, but it is a big city so what do you expect. The Neighbourhood was good, and the fact that the BART stop is indeed right infront of the hotel makes it a big plus especcialy for travelers without a car. The room (double bed) was big enough for 3 girls with a lot of luggage. The bathroom was good, don't forget the special massage shower!! We had a great time here, and probably come back next time!!

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: The hotel was exactly like the photographs. The lobby was really pretty. The thing I liked about the hotel was that it was well kept and professional. We almost went with one of those small, independantly owned places, but having walked by them during our trip we realized they would have been really small, simple, and run down. This place was great for the money and really nice inside.

review.title: just a place to sleep!
review.reviewText: looks like tower of terror(disneyland ride). -Renovated from 30's to 50's. Furniture is o.k. -Parking costs $28! Yes, you have to pay for parking even though you have a room paid for! +BART is right in front. +STARBUCKS in lobby. -if you are just looking for a place to sleep then this is it. -if you would like to enjoy your hotel, look elsewhere.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: I just got back from my trip to San Francisco and it was definitely a good experience. The hotel is conveniently located right next to the subway system and the buses, so there's no concerns with regards to transportation. The hotel was very well maintained and clean. The interior is kindof a throwback in that there's a lot of dark woods and rich colors in the overall decor. If you're looking for a modern day hotel with all the fancy bells and whistles, then look somewhere else. This hotel is going to give you a classic setting with a clean place to stay. It has a Starbucks and restaurant connected to the lobby, also, there is internet access that you can pay for in the lobby as well. The one thing that might be a black mark on the hotel is the surrounding neighborhood. It's not horrible or dangerous, but there are a good deal of homeless people in the area. But, never did I feel threatened or intimidated by the surroundings and it wouldn't change my decision to stay here again in the future.

review.title: not impressed with location
review.reviewText: Had to wait in line for longer than I wanted to get service at the front desk. Three employees behind desk but only one was helping customers and the other two were too busy talking to each other. One of the employees at the front desk had such dirty fingernails. To walk from the hotel to Union Square you had to go through some rough areas in town and we did not always feel safe walking back and forth.

review.title: A decent hotel in an unpleasant neighborhood
review.reviewText: Wonderful old building with high ceilings. Wireless Internet in room (free, but you have to register). Super easy access to BART.

review.title: close to castro
review.reviewText: nicer than i expected for a two and a half star hotel

review.title: good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: but dont walk around this area at night time, its a little like walking through crackville, but in the daytime, the bus or tram stop is right out front, a starbucks downstairs and plenty of taxi's in front of the hotel, so for the price and the awesome pillows and a great bed, this was quite a deal!!!!

review.title: Would stay here again.
review.reviewText: This was our second time staying here and, both times,we had a room with two double beds.Despite small bathrooms,these rooms were fine for two people for our four night stays. The the line was long and the desk understaffed when we checked in this time but otherwise the service was very good.The bed was very comfortable and the room was in good condition. Very conveniently located on Market St near public transportation;we were able to take the BART from the airport. This hotel is not in the best part of town and some people might be uncomfortable being alone on the street at night but we did not have a problem. I would definitely consider staying here again on future trips to San Francisco.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Cannot beat the location. Take BART train from SFO airport and as you come out the Civic Center station the hotel is right there. 20 min walk to Union Sq. where you can get travellers info.You will see people talking to themselves and homeless sleeping in the street like in any big city. Across the street is a Burger King and Subway. Starbucks is at the entrance of the hotel and Walgreens at the next light. Several cafe's and resturants as you walk to the Union Sq. Farmers Market opposite city hall one day. Reena

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: Not your typical Ramada- very pretty, great location (right near Union Square), and clean.

review.title: Don't listen to negative reviews
review.reviewText: Yes, this is an older hotel with smaller than usual rooms; and yes, it is in an area of town with several homeless individuals outside but there is a trolly/bus stop right outside the door and it is only a couple of minutes ride to the nice, shopping district of the city. It was worth staying at this hotel for the price and location.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Selected the hotel due to its location to my business needs. The lobby was the only nice thing about the hotel. The room had a stench of smoke and the staff at checkout seemed to care less about my stay never even saying thank you for staying there. Could never recommend this hotel. Will never stay there again.

review.title: Charming older hotel convenient to everything!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is charming, with a low price and convenient to everything.

review.title: condition
review.reviewText: the hotel is old and vintage which is fine but the bathroom is very small. plumbing of toilet flow is not very good. shower fixture is not well maintained. example: water sprayed in different direction. found roaches in the room. ventilation is not good. my last day I my key card was not working on and off. I had to get hotel mainetance to open my room. location is downtown not a good location. there were lots of transients around asking for money. they need to secure the front of the hotel. the public restroom has some graffitis and not well maintained / no toiletries available. overall, it was not a relaxing atmosphere for someone who is there for business. wireless internet was great that's all. not impressed. with that kind of location, it would be pleasant to stay at the hotel if the hotel being a vintage or historical can make the atmosphere cozy,safe and be a get away from the outside world. the customer service people were nice but always in a rush.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Thought this would be a very nice hotel...because the cost was pretty high. Not! Old, clunky doors, hairs left in the bathroom (on the floors, in the tub, in the sink!), and A LOT of street noice coming through the walls! The room service people were great, the hotel staff only so-so. Will not stay there again.

review.title: Can't beat the location
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this property several times and overall it's one of my faves when in SF because it's right next to the MUNI light rail stop and its free Wi-Fi. However, the staff varies greatly in terms of friendliness and the homeless outside are becoming a bit of a problem. For business travelers and young people these shouldn't be issues, but I wouldn't recommend it for families traveling with children.

review.title: Not the best but definitely convenient
review.reviewText: This is our second stay in two years. The primary reason we returned is the location. It is very centrally located to our areas of interest and the fact that there is a Bart/Muni entrance/exit approximately 15 feet from the front door in what is not the best (nor the worst) part of Market Street had a huge impact on our decision. The (2 connecting) rooms were adequate for our needs, however, the mattresses definitely need replacement and the bathrooms had mold behind the doors and along the ceiling from unvented moisture. Front desk staff, bellman and cleaning staff were polite and pleasant at all times although it was a bit disconcerting to have to wait for an available elevator each day at mid-morning because apparently all four were being used by hotel staff at the same time. Final verdict: I would go back for short stays given the convenience, price point and the limited time we actually spend in the room but given the number of available alternatives it may be time to try something new.

review.title: Beautiful Antique Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful, with its antique wood paneling and elegant chandeliers. Its a very welcoming place and the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. The rooms are small (and so is the bathroom) but it is very clean and the beds are very comfortable with warm blankets and fluffy pillows. The Room decor is elegant and crisp and even though it is an older building, it is well maintained. I loved staying here and the location, right on market street makes it easy to walk to many of the sights of San Francisco. In particular one of my favorite things about this hotel was the convenient location of a Starbucks right in the lobby! Overall I had a wonderful experience at this hotel and would recommend it for any future travelers.

review.title: Good hotel for the price, but...
review.reviewText: My husband & I stayed here for our anniversary and I chose it because of all the great reviews it received. It was pretty much what we had expected...a lot of beautiful character...a little run down...great location...but, we were not quite prepared for the nighborhood. Being from a small Montana town, it took us a day or 2 to get used to running the gauntlet of homeless people, beggers, & sex shops, all of which were totally harmless and just your typical city thing (we just weren't quite prepared). All-in-all, we enjoyed our stay & would stay here again. The hotel was surprisingly quiet for as old as it is and was quite charming.

review.title: Run away fast!
review.reviewText: Look for any other place. This one can be missed!

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Easy to get to Bart and MUNI, right outside the front door. Easy walk to Union Square and Chinatown. The hotel is almost 100 yrs old. It is nice but could use an interior face lift but was comfortable and secure.

review.title: Good value if you don't mind the neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel is fine and a good value for the money considering the price of other hotels in San Francisco. It's just that it borders on a very unsavory neighborhood - if you're taking along your family in any case. If you are willing to take a cab going and coming, it's certainly a good value. If you are coming with your family from a little town in the middle of nowhere, be ready for some "reality".

review.title: I am not recommend this hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in bad location, a lots of random people on the street. And the hotel is very old, the room is small, special there is huge noise from bathroom fan and water tap, not happy stay.

review.title: Not customer friendly
review.reviewText: The staff the Ramada Plaza SF was not customer friendly. They were rude to my wife. They did not seem to care if we enjoy our stay at their hotel.

review.title: The man at the registration desk must have been new as he said thay didn't have a king size bed.
review.reviewText: We had to wait till someone else helped him to get the room we had requested. People were polite & friendly. The restaurant was very well staffed & nice. Would consider staying there again.

review.title: the hotel was ok but San Francisco was cool
review.reviewText: Everything is geting old at the hotel and the room we got was pretty small... but we enjoyed our stay there..

review.title: Old World Charm
review.reviewText: This hotel building is about 100 years old, which means it has a beautiful lobby with marble and real wood paneling. However, the rooms are equally as old, and the amenities ( scarce electrical outlets, a closet light operated by a pull-chain, an ancient toilet, etc.) are very disappointing. The staff is wonderful, but they only have so much to work with. Get a great price, or look elsewhere. Also, this section of Market Street is populated by homeless people sleeping on the street and begging at the corners. I never felt in danger, but it definitely detracted from the experience.

review.title: Ramada plaza
review.reviewText: Very clean with nice victorian feel. Room needed new carpet, but very nice drapes and furniture. Bathroom was small, but clean and lovely, with a nice marble shower.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Old building in need of renovation. Prices for room service were five star. Car parking in torn down poorly kept garage. Hotel located in a scary part of town.

review.title: A Small Comfort
review.reviewText: The location may not be in the best location, but the overall experience is a very comfy, traditional feel of a hotel. The service is superb. No problems. The hotel is very conveniently located near San Francisco transportation and to some museums. Very easy to find your way to and back considering it is on a "main" street. The best part of the hotel stay I would have to say is the "FREE" wireless.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Room was great...clean, nice view. At/close to all public transportaion. Attractions and good restaurants within a few blocks. Staff helpful and friendly. Allowed us to check in early with our 4-year-old. Starbuck's in the lobby is a plus. Some people might be put off by neighborhood at night, but we never felt threatened when we were out after dark. The hotel and parking lot had visible security,

review.title: is nice and centric i liked
review.reviewText: my only concern was the parking is hard to find parking and the beds are small the rest is very good.

review.title: This is the Hotel to stay at when I go shopping
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel to attend a concert and to do some shopping. I was very impressed by the staff and how helpful they all were. Staying this close to the concert was very convienent, we just had to walk across the street and we were there. Shopping is just a few blocks away. It was great! I plan on staying at this hotel in the near future to do some holiday shopping.

review.title: Great hotel, shame about the location
review.reviewText: The Ramada International SF is a great place to stay when travelling on a budget. The staff were extremely helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable (although a tad small). While the location of the hotel makes it easy to travel around SF, the actual area (on Market, near 9th Street) leaves a lot to be desired. There are numerous agressive beggers and walking around the front of the hotel is no easy feat.

review.title: bad location
review.reviewText: Great hotel, but it is in a bad part of town. I was nervous leaving the hotel after dark. Public transportation is literally right outside the door, which saved us. We scuttled onto a bus or BART train as quickly as possible to avoid standing around or walking on Market St. Stay closer to Union Square or further towards the wharf for what seemed like safer parts of town.

review.title: A bargain in San Francisco
review.reviewText: An obviously once great hotel, the building could use some renovation though its age lends character. The rooms are certainly adequate for the price, however there are many homeless on the street at night.

review.title: Worth it if you're looking for something cheap
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a rundown part of Market Street. Expect plenty of homeless people asking you for money. The towels are not always clean. The double beds are quite small for two average sized adults.

review.title: A great bargain and experience.
review.reviewText: This is a classic and historic hotel. It has charm and atmosphere. It has a first class restaurant and a quaint piano bar.The BART station just outside the front door is a bonus.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: There's a bus stop and a MUNI / BART stop right in front of the hotel. The rooms are a little small, but not uncomfortable. If you plan on using public transportation (I highly recommend it) then this is the hotel for you.

review.title: would go back someday
review.reviewText: very enjoyable nice hotel door man was a nice touch good location

review.title: okay for business
review.reviewText: I visited this hotel while on an overnight for business. My room was dark and samll, but it didn't matter all that much to me because I was not there on vacation and I was alone (without my spouse or kids). If I had been there with my family I would have liked a better room. OVerall, the place was a typical big hotel - nothing special - but if I had to, I would stay there again on business. Free internet and allowing me to stay one night without a big hassle was great too.

review.title: Bad neighborhood
review.reviewText: We loved the old building and rooms, but the neighborhood wasn't very nice. There were lots of homeless people around. The hotel smelled like cigarette smoke too.

review.title: Colorful location
review.reviewText: Older hotel. Clean and quiet. The service was friendly, helpful. Centrally located to many sights by multiple forms of transportation. I felt that I was able to see and experience the real city and not just the tourist areas.

review.title: Bad Location
review.reviewText: Our room was small and the blankets on our beds were old with holes and felt like rubber. That was not the worst part, the location was in a bad part of town. We were traveling with our children and we witnessed people fighting on the street, drug addicts and several times we were harassed by homeless people.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Nice

review.title: Good hotel in general, but.....
review.reviewText: This hotel was good in many respects. Its location was good. The Staff was generally friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and generally clean. The price was reasonable for San Francisco. A security officer was posted in the lobby. The block it was located in was safe enough. A couple of blocks down the street, however, was questionable. You basically needed to take taxis or public transportation (or a car) when you went anywhere. It would not be advisable to walk too far, however, especially on a weekend, because of possible safety concerns. We stayed on the second floor, and emergency vehicles screamed up and down the street all night on a Sunday. It might have been less noisy had we been on a higher floor, but those sirens were pretty loud. Knowing what I know now, I might possibly stay there again, however.

review.title: beautiful and historic but...
review.reviewText: I had hoped for more for the price. Like a bath tub and a non-smoking room and parking.

review.title: Not terribly impressed
review.reviewText: This was just an okay hotel experience. Service wasn't great - had some trouble communicating with the front desk (couldn't understand each other due to a heavy accent) and we had to ask for things like enough towels and toilet paper, and parking wasn't available at the hotel. But the location was good (which was why we chose it in the first place) with easy access to transportation. Having a good restaurant and Starbucks in the hotel was a good thing for us.

review.title: Convenient hotel
review.reviewText: I like the hotel, the location is very convenient cause there is easy access to everywhere, however the neighbourhood seems to be no quite safe especially during the night.

review.title: Near of all
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. The concergie with big interest to help in tourist matter. The lobbys'bar should be open.

review.title: Scary Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in rough part of town. It was scary to walk at night. The hotel was decent and reasonably priced, but I would never stay there again due to location. The F-line is right in front of the hotel which did make it easy to get around town and Union Square is just a few blocks away.

review.title: Location was the best characteristic of the Ramada
review.reviewText: Negatives- Rooms are very small. We received a smokers room when a non smokers was requested. Did not try very hard to correct the situation. Positives- The architecture was beautiful in the hotel and the Starbucks attached was a wonderful convenience.

review.title: Not overly impressed, very old with small rooms
review.reviewText: The staff of the hotel is very friendly and helpful but the property was built in the early 1900's. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are out of date with small showers. Also, the front sidewalk is full of street people sleeping and begging for handouts right outide the door, I wouldn't feel comfortable for my wife or my daughters to go outside without a mle escort.

review.title: Marginal Neighborhood
review.reviewText: The only reason I would not recommend this hotel is because it is so close to the Tenderloin District. Lots of homeless and pan handling going on. It was close to Union Square which is nice, but we were a little worried walking there and felt the need to take a cab after dark.

review.title: Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice but not in a really great neighborhood. However, you would not really know this from the hotel.

review.title: Good Stay in SF
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay at the Ramada Plaza. All the hotel staff from the front desk to the maids were friendly and welcoming. We had a quiet and comfortable room and were tickled with the granduer of the lobby and halls. The neighborhood is a bit distressing at first, but the unfortunate street folks didn't seem to be agressive - most are polite. I was glad to have a place to park my car - even at the additional charge. With a Muni/BART station right outside the front door, public transportation was very handy. If you want a clean, quiet hotel in the heart of SF, the Ramada Plaza is good place to stay.

review.title: Not Happy with Two Rooms
review.reviewText: Hotel is in need of major renovation. Room was very small, peeling paint in the bathrooms and very worn bedspreads. Bathroom was not clean, called for housekeeping to take care of which they did. Asked for connecting or adjoining rooms but I was told they were not available. I was assured my rooms were only an elevator apart. Turned out my 2nd room was down the hall, around the corner. Not good for parents with children. Expensive limited self parking.

review.title: Walking distance to China Town & Trolley
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, very comfortable and clean. It was great to be within walking distance of China Town and the Trolley and very close driving distance to Golden Gate Bridge and Fisherman's Warf/Pier 39. This hotel also had excellent freeway access. The parking situation is okay, hotel parking was full, but outside parking within a block was adequate. Breakfast at the hotel was excellent but quite expensive. It was nice to have a Starbuck's next door and fast food across the street.

review.title: elderly hotel - not a good location
review.reviewText: The hotel has a beautiful lobby and gorgeous fixtures throughout, but the rooms are not "updated". Unless you need to be almost directly in front of the Civic Center, I wouldn't recommend this hotel in terms of neighborhood. Even if you do need to be at the civic center, you can get a nicer hotel for about the same amount of money (this was pretty pricey for having numerous panhandlers out front and questionable bathrooms within) and take a taxi or bus to where you need to be. I don't recommend this hotel for the first time visitor to SF - it gave me a bad inital impression of the city which I found difficult to overcome. And having paid for our stay in advance, there was no moving, only dealing.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: About three blocks away from trolley/tram station. Neighborhood a bit daunting after dark, but hotel was excellent.

review.title: Adequate accomodations
review.reviewText: The room was fine but the bathroom was in just adequate conditions. The hotel was not in the best of areas but if you don't plan on doing a lot of walking in the immediate area there is no problem. The one thing that I really had a problem with was the fee for the parking. It was quite expensive and I was unaware of the additional fee until I checked in (possibly I just didn't notice it when I made the reservation). I probably could have gotten a nicer, more expensive hotel with free parking when you consider the amount I ended up paying after the parking fee.

review.title: Convenient location, mediocre room
review.reviewText: Let me start off by saying the hotel is staffed by friendly and attentive employees. It is located a few block off of the Union Square area but directly adjacent to a BART/MUNI station so if you plan on taking public transportation, it doesn't get any easier. The parking rates are also lower than many of the other hotels in the area if you're planning on renting a car. As for the room itself, I found it to be old and a bit dingy. The bathroom fixtures were second rate, showed some signs of rust and dilapidation, and just did not inspire a sense of cleanliness -- something that I consider to be very important. Ultimately, the room was serviceable, but I was expecting a bit more than that.

review.title: satisfactory hotel, comfortable beds and direct traffic connection
review.reviewText: Cleanliness of the room was okay, but I found hair of recent people in my bathroom. The toilet was too small and too low installed as well as the washing table. Therefor the interior style was pretty nice with some pictures of the city on the wall and bright and comfortable colors. The beds were also good!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great rates, great hotel overall. Staff and service was beyond what I expected.

review.title: Centrally located with excellent staff.
review.reviewText: Very well priced with an excellent staff. Located just a skip from the Civic Center. Accomodations are always clean and comfortable. Close to all forms of transpotation.

review.title: Great service, comfortable!
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, great service. Room was clean and comfortable. I was very surprised at the lack of parking and the parking fees!!!, but if I had preconsidered where I was, (down town SF,) and had preplanned, communicated with the desk beforehand re: a parking pass,.... , it would have been easier. Food was fantastic, bed was so comfortable, quiet room, felt relaxed and rested when I left. I would stay again!

review.title: Magnificent Lobby
review.reviewText: Very comfortable atmosphere. Terrific service. Very friendly and extremely helpful staff. (They made excellent recommendations all week long.) The hotel is located very close to public transportation. (Buy a Muni Pass.) A Starbucks and a restaurant are located in the hotel.

review.title: Could be better!
review.reviewText: three people were booked but they kept giving us two sets of towels everyday. There were no foot towels provided, daily supply of toilet paper was missing. Other than the aforementioned, the service was okay and staff were friendly.

review.title: It's good, but no excellent
review.reviewText: This hotel is good only if you have your itinerary full outside the hotel, because is good only for go to sleep. There are no amenities or activities in there. The rooms are clean and the overall decoration is fine.

review.title: Could have been better
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, and in a great location. The ice machines never had ice, the coke machines were empty by the 2nd day. Staff was great.

review.title: Over the Hill
review.reviewText: This hotel has seen better days. Tiny room, no closet, no minibar, very slow internet. Not again.

review.title: Historical bliss
review.reviewText: Beautiful historical hoter with exquisite marble and wood work. Easy walk to Moscone center

review.title: no good experience
review.reviewText: Rooms need total renovation. Mattress was old and needed to be replaced. Not in a very good area of Market street.

review.title: not a favorable location
review.reviewText: stayed at hotel for last- minute business trip...thought hotel was closer to Union Square...not a good location for walking after dark! service was good...no bath towels in room...had to request!

review.title: A budget-wise and pleasant experience!
review.reviewText: Read so many negative reviews, I was reluctant to use the Ramada Plaza. I would have missed a great experience. The hotel is a vintage elegant charmer, the staff is superb,and it's close to transportation. Public transportation is so easy to use, especially with a weekly pass. The Starbucks in the lobby was a great place for breakfast, lunch or snacks. Also, we ate many late night meals in the restaurant, they close at about 10:00 PM. Great food at a reasonable price with first-class wait staff. One complaint rooms cound use more lighting.

review.title: Comfortable in San Fran
review.reviewText: Very satisfactory for the money and convenient to BART right outside the door. Furnishings were a little tired but comfortable and clean.

review.title: Nice hotel, not so nice location
review.reviewText: The area the hotel is in is not the best place for a single girl on business. The room was clean, but right on Market, so I didn't get any sleep.

review.title: WonderLand
review.reviewText: I absolutely loved my stay at Ramada, I would inform anyone of the great service which I enjoyed: the staff was friendly and the rooms where very big and confortable.

review.title: Pay a few extra dollars..you will thank me
review.reviewText: I had to check out early because is was so bad.

review.title: Perfunctory, grudging service - seriously un-impressive
review.reviewText: They insisted to with-hold $40 from my debit card upon check-in re 'extras' - - and that was all they were interested in. That was not surely necessary after ID check etc - - and shows their money-grabbing attitude. They failed to stop/check me or anyone else entering the hotel late at night - - no security checks, yet located in a pretty seedy area. Just use it as a B&B and avoid the boring and low-grade food served in the restaurant.

review.title: great hotel, ok area
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the middle of downtown San Francisco...but although it isn't the best neighborhood, I felt very safe during my stay. The hotel service was wonderful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

review.title: Not the best location
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok but never said on the site that the parking was not included and charged me 25 a day to park my car. Besides, unfortunately the hotel location is not the best. During the day is ok but at night is not the best place to hang around. Even the people at the front desk suggested us not go outside for a walk but take our car.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel is right next to the Civic Center BART stop and the F Line picks up in front of the hotel. The area isn't so great but the mass transit makes it worth the bargain of staying at this hotel.

review.title: Just fine
review.reviewText: The hotel needs renovation. Although the room was clean and spacious. No privacy if the lights are on at night because the windows drapes are so thin and I could not close the thick ones because they were not designed to close. Convenience: Bart/Muni and other public transport right out of the hotel door. The parking at hotel pretty expensive. The staff was very helpfull. Overall it was not too bad but the quality of the hotel is not that great.

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: Nice lobby. Clean Hotel. Rooms very small. Showers in room only. Hotel does not have enough parking. Hotel is in a less than desirable area of the city. Ok if catching the street bus to attractions, but don't recommend walking from hotel. Too many street bumbs.

review.title: Nice but old and it shows
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel but it is also very old, and it shows in a few places. The hotel has been kept up very well. We had the most inexpensive room which is a little bit small, but it suited our needs. Beds where comfortable. Would stay here again as longs as the price is resonable.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: nice hotel with older charm. right in front of BART which was very convenient. we stayed during a prom night so it was a little noisy, but overall the room was clean and the staff was courteous.

review.title: No Thrills
review.reviewText: Great hotel for a great price. We found the hotel to be exactly what was advertised. Rooms were clean and modest. Staff was helpful. STARBUCKS in lobby!!

review.title: good hotel for price...bathroom was a little cramp
review.reviewText: The hotel has great charm and the room beds were very comfortable. The only downside to the double bedded room was the bathroom. It was really small and hard to move around.

review.title: Strategic Location
review.reviewText: Strategically located at the famous Market St. of San Francisco downtown with most of the public transportation station nearby. Value for money.

review.title: Old style and big rooms
review.reviewText: I really liked this hotel. It is quite an old building, but the rooms are spacious, nice big bathrooms, and they have everything you need. Wireless connection throughout the hotel was good, and though the gym is small, it is great having it. The hotel reception were pleasant allowing me to check-n an hour early. The biggest downside is it is in a bit of a sleazy area. Plenty of pan handlers in the streets, but some are quite entertaining. Being right beside the BART station is handy.

review.title: Ramada Downtown no again
review.reviewText: It smell very old and urine. The place is full with beggars. For the same price can get something better in more beatifull place.

review.title: Looked better in the photos than in real life
review.reviewText: they indicated they were close to union square which is where my 2 day conference was. however it was a 5 block walk to get there and the immediate area around the hotel wasnt in the nicest neighbourhood so i felt uncomfortable walking through it. the rooms are tiny. very cramped.

review.title: Ramada Plaza
review.reviewText: Not in a good area. Bed pillows and bed are extremely uncomfortable. Better spend a few more dollars for something worthwhile.

review.title: It was ok
review.reviewText: The front desk staff were really nice. The hotel was ok, but nothing to run home and tell friends about. The hotel smelled a little damp like it needed a dehumidifier. The room was clean but in the bathroom there was nose mucus between the cracks of the bathroom door. I feel the room and bathroom need to be thoroughly cleaned before the next guest stays in it.

review.title: Near BART train station, and downtown
review.reviewText: Easy to reach from the airport thru the BART train then you can use your BART ticket for local travels.

review.title: A little on the dumpy side
review.reviewText: The entrance and foyer were beautiful but it did not lead up to the expectations of a dumpy room. There were water pipes in the closet, loose toilet handles, smelly shower ( no bath tub), drab room. There might have been an upper end to the hotel but I did not see it. I would not stay there again. There were a lot of homeless people that I had to walk over to get to my hotel.

review.title: Will pass on this Hotel on my next trip to SF
review.reviewText: While the lobby of the hotel was pleasent enough the room had the smallest bathroom I have ever seen. It was so narrow that you actully had to open the door to create enough room to bend over and wash your face. The wirless internet worked well.

review.title: Avoid
review.reviewText: I'm sure back last century this was a fantastic hotel - it was used as the California State Capital building in the early 1900's. However, it's not been updated much since then - huge, souless rooms, creaky old bathrooms, and in a very dodgy area - this end of Market Street is fairly 'low-rent'. Also, a doorman who charges taxi drivers $5 for a pick up, and then extends his hand to you for a tip as well! I'd avoid -

review.title: good place for a weekend stay
review.reviewText: Room and service was great.

review.title: Better than I Thought
review.reviewText: Workers very friendly and helpfull. Rooms are a little small, but are clean. They have a funny smell, but it's a old building, but it has that vintage decor, which we like. Close to shopping . Area not to good, but again it's S.F.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The Ramada Plaza is a great hotel to stay when visiting San Francisco. Very clean, courteous staff, very easy to reach and comfortable for getting around the city, would highly recommend it to others.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful. The only downside is that it is not in a very good section of the city, so it wouldn't be good for people traveling alone .

review.title: Tiny little room ...
review.reviewText: Our "Queen size" room was so tiny my husband actually had to store his suitcase in the closet because it would not fit antwhere else so that we didn't have to step over it. I've stayed in many nicer Ramada's in the past. Only good thing - in-&-out parking in rear of hotel (for extra $25/night).

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Bad service, not well maintained. Pay a little more and stay in a decent hotel.

review.title: SF Hotel on Bart and Muni
review.reviewText: This was a decent hotel. NO pool which I always recommend when you are traveling with kids. The wireless in the rooms was touch and go which made catching up on work email difficult. The F Line muni stop was right there which took us all the way to fisherman's wharf one way and to a cute diner called Orphan Andy. The BART is ten feet from the front door and it even had a Starbucks.

review.title: Pretty good for the price
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly and helpful, which was a plus. The Starbucks right outside the lobby was also very convenient, and the station was located right outside the building. I didn't think the homeless people outside the hotel were too bothersome- though I must say as a whole the city of San Fran needs to do something to get these people off the streets. The room was neat but the tops of the curtains needed to be dusted, and the towels were clean but a little dingy. So overall it was okay and good for the price I paid.

review.title: Good but not the best...
review.reviewText: I went to San Francisco to the Ramada Downtown Hotel from April 13th to April 16th. I went there with my friend and we went only for vacations. The hotel was good, it has good location but the facilities were not the best. It has a Starbuck's at the lobby that was really good for us. It's located at the main street of SF but there are a lot of homeless and sometimes we were scared about it. They didn't attack us or something like that but it's not a good aspect for the hotel. In general it's a good hotel to go to sleep but if you are a picky person try something else.

review.title: Wouldn't choose it again
review.reviewText: The hotel was quite old, yet seemed fairly well maintained. The wireless worked only in the lobby area, and it wasn't free.

review.title: not good
review.reviewText: peoples are kind....that's all too expensive and around streets are dangerous.

review.title: A real gem
review.reviewText: The Ramada Plaza was well staffed and a pleasant suprise from some of the other reviews. Easy access to the Bart, F line trollies and muni buses. With a muni pass the whole city was easily traveled, mostly F-line and cable cars. The location was not as remote or unsavory as some reviewers felt. Even as a single parent traveling with three children I felt safe.

review.title: Not the greatest
review.reviewText: Good location (Bart access & Market St trolley) Service left much to be desired.

review.title: Just fine
review.reviewText: The hotel was right around the corner from an event we were going to, which was why we chose it. Otherwise, we probably would not have picked this area, but it worked out just fine, and for the price you can't do much better. If you're used to top notch this isn't your hotel, but if you're used to pretty good, it's pretty good.

review.title: Adequate but in need of a little TLC...
review.reviewText: Initial impressions of the entrance and public areas were impressive, although check-in was less inspiring... Our room was a good size, (although apparently not typical), clean and comfortable but let down by the bathroom, which was antiquated and badly lit. As was the walk-in closet, due to a lamp failure, (which was immediately replaced when we mentioned it to the very polite and helpful maid service, only to fail again the next day, presumably due to an electrical fault). Also, the curtains didn't close, so impossible to maintain privacy or block out daylight. But the location is excellent and although the neighbourhood is somewhat down at heel, it seemed safe enough. In all, an adequate hotel for the money in a central location with helpful staff, but in need of a little TLC.

review.title: Well kept older hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: BART at the door, Starbucks in the lobby, clean quite room, decent rate especially for downtown SF. Hotel restaurant is good, and you're a couple of blocks from many more good ones. Embardadero is two stops away on BART. Street people on Market occasionally, but have not been bothered.

review.title: Good Value...
review.reviewText: This hotel is good deal if you want a night on the town and a place to crash after. Nothing spectacular about the accommodations. The hallways reminded me of the movie "The Shining". Kinda creepy.

review.title: You'll Pay Too Much
review.reviewText: When I first went onto Expedia's website to check out a hotel for my latest stay, I was in awe of the beauty of the Ramada Plaza by the pictures and truthfully the price. I thought that it was a great deal for what I saw in the pictures. But I was sadly mistaken. The bathrooms were old and in need of repair or replacement. The beds were sorely uncomforable. My wife is pregnant and she didn't sleep the entire night. The next night we just went home because we knew at least we could get some good sleep. I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel, bad location
review.reviewText: If you stay here understand using bart to get there is a great choice, bart is right outside the hotel. One theater is across the street. Major recomendation is take a taxi if you want to go anywhere, you don't want to walk, its in a bad part of Market Street.

review.title: Weekend in SF & Monterey
review.reviewText: The hotel location was excellent for our weekend plans. Access to BART wasn't a problem. The hotel parking was full on the night of our arrival, but it wasn't a problem. Hotel staff directed us to a public parking area that was within walking distance of the hotel and cost less than the hotel parking. We used the transit system during our stay and left our rental car in the public parking area until our departure. The only compliant is the small hotel shower and the water pressure in the shower. We had no problems with the people on the street or the area. Would surely stay here again!! Thanks Expedia...

review.title: Lost a night's sleep...
review.reviewText: Was pointed to this location by my father-in-law. And after reading it I was a bit skeptical about booking here but did so anyway. And will not book there again. Wireless internet access is dial-up speeds at best within the rooms on an unsecure network that seems to like putting spyware on your desktop (two hours spent cleaning it off my system). Thin walls kept me up for most of Saturday night as the room next door decided to be rather noisy after a night out drinking. Hotel location is decent, not the greatest but within walking distance or Muni-access of most of downtown and Union Square.

review.title: Perfectly adequate for budget conscious stay
review.reviewText: Hotel seemed in reasonably good condition and was perfectly acceptable for budget conscious stay. Location is in a less salubrious part of Market Street, but this was reflected in the price. The location is however ideal for use of public transport (BART, trolley bus etc) and it was perfectly possible (and indeed safe) to walk to/from Union Square area although would probably not recommend this to people likely to be sensitive to some of the "establishments" in the area.

review.title: yeah.
review.reviewText: Good hotel, good price, and good city!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Air Cond running very noisy even after fixed. I only got hot tap water in the bathroom but after fixed it was fine. We'd four persons in a room but we only got 3 person's toiletry supply ( towels )even after requested. The corridor is gloomy and the icemaker was out of service for a week. I'm glad for their security and the location is good.

review.title: Disapointing
review.reviewText: Steps from the BART station and street car line. Staff was excellent. Lobby was outstanding. Room, although clean, was shabby at best, especially the bathroom. Rusted curtain rod without curtain, exposed pipes, no soap dish in tub although the holes were there. No towel rack within 6 feet of the sink and tub. Lighting was dingy in sleeping area. 2-7 people sleeping on street within 25 feet of hotel. 4 blocks from adult movies and book stores. Very scenic.

review.title: Quality
review.reviewText: The hotel was resonably priced and clean, however, I was not happy with it's location in downtown San Fran.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Room was small, restrooms EXTREMELY cold, walls thin, and the location isn't all that great. Market street can be pretty scary at night.

review.title: it was ok.
review.reviewText: the location is bad i think. this is because it's still not near the union square enough. u still have to walk quite a distance and the people on the street was kinna scary so better choose a hotel nearer to union square because i think it would be much safer for tourist like me

review.title: Good ubication
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, got a starbucks at the loby entrance wich it says it all. Masrket boulevard wich is the main one in san francisco.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Nothing to write home about.

review.title: Rooms are a little small but incredible location at bargain price!
review.reviewText: I always stay there when in SF. It's steps from the BART, the library, museums, incredible restaurants (try the amazing Turkish place across from the library called Gyro King - sweeeeet!), etc. The staff is nice. Some travelers may get sick of the bums loitering outside, but hey, that's modern life.

review.title: Been here 3x and will be here again if I have another chance!
review.reviewText: Though the area is not as impressive as others, it is quite tolerable. The plus factors outweighed the minuses. There are great transpo choices if you wouldn't bring your car. Try bart, train, buses, taxis, etc. For sightseeing purposes, the bus, bart can bring you to the famous sights (Fisherman's Wharf, etc) Great place to shop too, within walking distance from most shopping malls.

review.title: Will be going back in June.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were great! Very friendly. There were always willing to answer a question or help you with informtion. The Market Steet Grill located at this hotel was a little pricey and was okay. The service varied from one waiter to the other. Not impressed. Over all this location is not close to that many place to eat, especially sit down and enjoy yourself. Located right by the BART station is great. Can catch a trolley to go to Fishermans Wharf and other places in the city. Great location for ground transportation.

review.title: Needs to be remodeled
review.reviewText: the most uncomfortable part of the room was the bathroom, there was no space for the toiletries I travelled with. Everything is very old, wallpaper was peeling off the wals, but it served it's purpose.

review.title: Not a good bet
review.reviewText: The rooms were small and the bathrooms were tiny (smaller than the closet!). The walls were paper-thin; every person walking down the hall woke us up. There is limited on-site parking for an additional $25 per night-- it was sold out by the time we arrived mid-afternoon. The price was out of line for how skimpy the amenities were.

review.title: would love to go back
review.reviewText: very nice stay. the room was clean with plenty of towels. service was A+++++. everyone was so helpfull in whatever we needed. wish we didn't have to come home. thank you

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: The building was well kept, especially since its 95 years old. The room was clean and comfortable. I loved the high ceilings and the bathroom was spacious when compared to other hotel/motel bathrooms I've seen. The location was no problem and the area of town was really no worse than other areas. For the price, this was a really wonderful place to stay. I highly recommend it.

review.title: it was nice
review.reviewText: it was nice and clean. nothing luxury but enough for a trip to SF.

review.title: A very decent hotel
review.reviewText: Before I got there, I was worried about the conditions of the hotel based on the reviews read from here. To my surprise, it is very clean and spacious. I have no complaints for their services. The location is quite safe too. I feel quite comfortable during my stay.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: I was in awe when I walked into the lobby. The service and employees were excellent. Would stay there again.

review.title: Poor area...unfriendly staff
review.reviewText: This hotel just has too many unsavory people hanging around outside. The staff is agressive and unfriendly...never felt like a valued customer.

review.title: looking for another hotel
review.reviewText: convenience to public transport is all they have to offer. towels were rationed. there were 4 towels when my wife and i checked in and everyday thereafter, only 2 were provided. not enough for a guest who shower twice daily. shampoo bottles were not replenished and when my wife called housekeeping for new ones, it never came. she had to ask the housekeeper on the hallway to give her shampoo and extra towels. will check other hotels next time.

review.title: Classic hotel
review.reviewText: Classic hotel with great architecture, however the neighborhood has seen better days. The Hotel itself is secure but go through the neighborhood in a group or not at all. Although the neighborhood is shaky it is only 4 blocks from a dramatic change in venue with upscale shopping and the Moscone Center another 2 blocks away. Overall a very good value for San Francisco.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Hotel shows its age, and the neighborhood is a bit seedy, but the location is extemely convenient (a BART stop literally at the doorstep, and a few blocks away to easy access to the freeway), the service is friendly and helpful, the hotel has some yesteryear charm and the price is right

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText: This hotel was great for us;the 2nd floor room was large and kept very clean during our 4 night stay. Good beds. The bathroom was a little tight and showing its age but it was OK. Friendly staff. Convenient location with BART,MUNI Metro, F line & buses either right outside or very close by for easy access to the whole city. The hotel is not in the best part of town though-OK during the day but it's best not to be alone on the street after dark.

review.title: Slow and unhelpful at front desk
review.reviewText: They didn't have a copy of the second room on my reservation and made me solve it with Expedia - overall slow and not helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Do not get the single room because it's about as small as a shoebox. Go with the double rooms and you will have plenty of room. The Starbucks next door was the only saving grace. Also, Steven's Cafe right across the street had some pretty good breakfast. Not a great place to take your sweetheart but for a quick trip to San Fran on a budget this is a great bargain. The BART is only steps away.

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were extremely efficient with the exception of the service in the restraunt. Really slow, even tho there was only 3 of us in the dining room! The security guards at the front door, also served as wonderful tour guides. Very helpful, comfortable place to stay, close to all public transportation.

review.title: Overall - not to bad, but....
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was very nice and clean. Room was good and comfortable. Not enought TV channel selection though. Hotel was not located in the best area of town. A lot of homeless and panhandlers in area. Not very clean area either. It is a good walk to cable cars (about 4 large blocks). Hardly any resturants in area...a long walk to find any. Would give it a grade of B overall. Would not stay here again and would not recommend to otehrs.

review.title: Dirty Room
review.reviewText: There is a Starbucks in the lobby. Thats the only good thing I can say. Our bed stunk. the room was filthy.The water wouldn't stay warm. I would not stay here again.

review.title: Excellent--will definitely return
review.reviewText: we loved our room, hotel was nicely appointed; perfectly located; very helpful staff. Will recommend it and definitely plan to return!!!

review.title: Reasonable for the Price
review.reviewText: There's a reason it is priced so competitively. If you don't have to be in a prime location and are too concerned with aesthetics, this is not a bad choice. Front desk staff were efficient and polite.

review.title: Not my first choice - but we would stay again!
review.reviewText: Compared to similar hotels in the area, the Ramada wouldn't be my first choice next time but I wouldn't count it out. It is a little further down Market than I like to be & walking back at night was a little shady, but the hotel staff were very friendly and the room was comfortable. I loved Starbucks being in the lobby!

review.title: Very poor hotel
review.reviewText: If this place is your last resort fine.. otherwise stay away.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location close to most of what the city has to offer. Great place if you like using public transportation. Rooms could be a bit better organizes, especially the bathroom.

review.title: What a GEM!!!
review.reviewText: I hesitated to stay here based on the poor reviews but it was the best value so I thought I could tolerate bad service to save $30.00 a night. I was pleasantly surprised the moment I stepped in the door. The lobby was beautiful, security was obvious, and service was great! There was a shop, a great restaurant, reasonable room service, cozy sitting area and a Starbucks bistro in the lobby. Another plus was that there were always cabs available each time I walked out the door. As a business woman traveling alone I felt quite secure and at home here. I wholeheartedly recommend the Ramada Plaza.

review.title: Not near anything
review.reviewText: Although this Ramada property is a very nice hotel, it is not near the usual tourist attractions. It is right on Market and public transportation is literally right out the front door. The area seems to have an usually high amount of homeless (or so it seemed).

review.title: Don't even think about it!
review.reviewText: Shabby hotel in the worst area of town.

review.title: Great location to explore SF
review.reviewText: This hotel has a very convenient location on Market Street and is easy to get to from either Oakland or SF aiports with a BART stop right out the front door. Enjoy an F-line trip down Market to the Ferry Terminal and on to Fisherman's Wharf. We enjoyed our three-day stay as the rooms were very clean with high ceilings with a nice view of the Civic Center. All of the staff were polite, helpful, and informative regarding any of our requests. We enjoyed having a Starbucks in the confines of the hotel and breakfast in the dining room afforded a nice view of the street.

review.title: Okay for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel was extremely economical, but it's about 30 years past its prime. The room was very small and the bathroom had no counter space, but the staff was pleasant, the food was good, and the price was right.

review.title: Not great, but not bad either.
review.reviewText: The place is average, a bit old, but clean. A little far out on Market, so you get some of the riff-raff near the hotel.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: I thought this hotel was great and I really appreciated the free wireless Internet in my room. The only bad thing about it was the neighborhood. I can't say that it was unsafe but definately unpleasant.

review.title: Don't do it
review.reviewText: The rooms were small, the temp was uncontrollable in the rooms...I say "rooms" because in my 3 night stay I was in 3 rooms. The first one the toilet didn't work, and the people at the desk....really RUDE. The manager was helpful, but he didn't make up for the rest of the staff. The only good thing about it was there was a Starbucks and the BART was just outside the door. Would not stay there again. Lots of street people sleeping outside.

review.title: Will not return
review.reviewText: Have used this hotel several times. They never have any parking. This time, we weren't even allowed to unload our luggage before we were sent to a parking garage across the street. We were quite the sight wheeling our luggage down Market street. Guest services were more concerned with the upcoming football season than giving directions.

review.title: Need new mattresses!
review.reviewText: This hotel has a lovely lobby but needs a lot of updating.

review.title: horrible
review.reviewText: absolutely terrible location. the lobby was nice but that was it. the room was really inexcusable. a sink with no vanity or cabinet, just the plumbing open for all to see underneath? come on. terrible

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Overall I think this hotel is very nice. The lobby is beautiful, the location is perfect, the street cars, the buses and the BART are right outside the front door. The cable cars are only three blocks away. The rooms are a little on the small side, but I think that encourages you to stay out on the town. You only sleep and take a shower there right? The only thing I would complain about would be; they don't have enough help at the front desk. For a buisy hotel they only had two people working and a very long line. The thing to be aware of also, are the pan-handlers in the area. Use your street smarts and you'll be fine.

review.title: A good value mid-range hotel
review.reviewText: Although not in the most salubrious part of town, this attractive old hotel has some architectural interest and is reasonably comfortable and well-appointed. We were not very happy with the quality of customer service - an ongoing problem with the key to our room was dealt with in an offhand manner and less than promptly. But as a place to rest one's head, it was perfectly fine. We didn't use the restaurant, but there is a Starbucks on the premises, and the location is very central and well-served by public transport. In short, you won't want to linger there, but you'll probably be quite satisfied with the amenities . . .

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: THe hotel in general is good just the cleaning of the rooms was not complete the towels were small and thin light problems ice bucket had water in when arrived and was never emptied for most of the week stay

review.title: Only this hotel again
review.reviewText: The staff in the hotel was helpful,the hotel is clean

review.title: Definite Repeat Visitor
review.reviewText: I was there during Memorial Day weekend, and the place was busy! The staff was great, considerate, professional and very quick despite the crowds. The room was nice, clean and equipped with everything. I've stayed here two times in 4 months and have nothing but good things to say about it.

review.title: Economical and convenient
review.reviewText: Centrally located, This hotel served temporarily as SF's City Hall from 1912-1917. Downstairs is the BART/MUNI Metro, the Orpheum theatre is across the street and the SF Main library is catty corner on Grove St., great Mediterranean(Gyro King) food. In addition there is a all-you-can-eat seafood across (Moonstar) from the Orpheum.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is situated in a very convenient location, steps from a BART subway stop, along a route with many bus stops, right in the heart of the theater district and civic center, and blocks from the Zuni Cafe. Getting to hotel from airport and back was a cinch by BART. The room and bathroom are clean but European size, i.e., tiny.

review.title: Would definitely stay again...
review.reviewText: Nice interior and not located in a tourist area which means cheap local restaurants are close by. Also, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There are public transportation stops right outside the hotel which makes it easy to get around. They also offer come and go parking for $25 a day. I would absolutly book this hotel for my next trip to San Fran.

review.title: Bad Area Of Town
review.reviewText: The hotel was only "ok." It was in a not so great part of town which means little walking could be done. You have no choice but to get on the BART or Muni, which are close.

review.title: Okay for the price.
review.reviewText: The hotel is located right next to the BART train stations which is a huge plus. Instead of paying $35 for a cab I paid $5 for the BART train. Okay for the price. However, there are no good decent places to eat close to the hotel.

review.title: Clean and comfortable for reasonable price
review.reviewText: The Ramada Plaza Downtown is a modestly priced hotel that provides clean and comfortable lodging. The check in service was friendly and efficient. This hotel is by no means a luxury hotel. It is located on a section of Market Street that is somewhat depressed. It is not conveniently located to the major tourist attractions of the city.

review.title: Great value for the price
review.reviewText: Really good hotel where you can get a good deal for fair money. It is not located in the best area, but otherwise the Ramada Plaza is a very good address for the budget oriented traveller.

review.title: Old hotel, not too well taken care of
review.reviewText: Service OK.. lots of bums in area. we felt very uncomfertable leaving at night and there wasn't very much security.

review.title: Where unhelpfulness is raised to a science
review.reviewText: The front desk staff and those people at the information desk are in the wrong line of work.

review.title: The Hotel's Restaurant
review.reviewText: The food at the hotel's restaurant was very overpriced and the quality of the food was poor. When we complained, we had to pay for it regardless and eventually was given a voucher for complimentary breakfast for the next 2 days. The wait staff service was poor.

review.title: very good but not the safest area
review.reviewText: very good but not the safest area

review.title: close to theatres
review.reviewText: Was very close to playhouse. Also catch the trolley or Bart right ourside the front door. Older hotel and room was small for the money, no room service or bath tub. For overnite, was fine, but would not enjoy it for a week vacation.

review.title: Nice Ambience
review.reviewText: Beautiful lobby and appointments. Room a bit small but satisfactory

review.title: Not bad at all
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but houskeepers dont knock before they enter..

review.title: i very much enjoyed the hotel and the trip
review.reviewText: ramada plaza hotel downtown san francisco,ca. was one of the nicest hotels ,we have stayed in in awhile.

review.title: was ok
review.reviewText: the rooms were a little smaller than i liked

review.title: Location, location, location for the best price!
review.reviewText: The Ramada is directly downtown a block away from their famous City Hall (take the tour by the way). This hotel does not deserve the bad press for nightime walking. People, it is a city hotel!!! Three women over 50 stayed here for eight nights. Quite, clean and a Starbucks in the lobby made it very convenient. A great "hometown" breakfast place Steven's Cafe is located across the street. We actually felt like locals at the end of the week. The Muni/Bart and trolley located right out the front door of the hotel gave you access to any points in this beautiful city. We walked and took transportation without any problems. I would suggest purchasing a 7 day city pass for $25.00 to get on any mode of transportation. A block away is the Urban Market and Cafe a beautiful clean health food market in a major city. For the location and price this place is a bargain. Don't be afraid to stay here. Many families were here enjoying the city. As far as the complaints about the towels, I did not have any problems, there were a million clean ones located in the gym if people bothered to look. Expedia gave us the best price in town.

review.title: Hotel is nice, but be careful walking around at night
review.reviewText: Hotel staff, rooms, and service are pretty good. Bathrooms are kind of small, so if you like big bathrooms, I would not recommend this hotel. I got the room I requested (King, Smoking) and my boyfriend and I dined at the restaurant which was good and priced decently. During the day, the area is full of people (lots of government buildings nearby) but at night, I would use caution when out on the streets, especially when crossing over Sixth Street. I would recommend taking a cab back from your day destination.

review.title: Good hotel in the heart of downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Ramada Downtown is a nice hotel. It carries an older architecture; it can be charming. It has a StarBucks downstairs, and local transportation right in front. The Washington Mutual ATM right in front has no transaction fee. In addition to limited hotel parking, there is a convenient parking lot next door. If you are not planning to take the car in and out of the parking lot, park next door. It is cheaper and they charge per hour, not a full day. There is no wireless service in the rooms.

review.title: Not Good hotel to stay for business or pleasure
review.reviewText: The hotel is located at a not very safe area. Sure it is close to the Union Square (only 3-4 blocks away) but these 3-4 blocks are one of the unsafe area in San Francisco and I was advised not to walk alone by the hotel manager. The hotel itself was not too terribly bad, but I think there should be as reasonable hotel as this hotel is that will give you much more pleasure and sense of security staying in San Francisco.

review.title: Okay, nothing great.
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel in pretty good depending on what
you are in San Francisco to do.  It is a great location for
the MUNI system as a bus stop is right outside the front door. We purchased a MUNI pass for $20 for seven days and that worked great for the cable cars and the MUNI system.  
If you are mostly spending time on Fisherman's Wharf, I would not recommend this hotel.  The rooms are really small but clean. The bathroom is as wide as a stand up shower. Not recommended for a larger size person.  Beds are comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful with directions. Noise level was high due to contruction work outside the hotel until midnight.  If you are not going to spend much time in a room and are looking for a value....
okay but nothing great about this hotel.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: I beleive I got the worst room in the hotel. Tucked in a corner with no view and they charged me almost $30/ night for parking.

review.title: Not very impressive for a 3 star listing
review.reviewText: The hotel looked much nicer on the internet than in person.
