The rooms were very small and the bathroom was so tiny it didn't even have a countertop or anywhere to place your toothbrush. Room service was timely but the food wasn't very good. The parking is very limited and we had to park around the corner and across the street at another lot. The hotel isn't in a good location (taking a cab is a must to go to Union Square at night). Overall it just didn't live up to the three star rating.

review.title: Good Value - tough location
review.reviewText: The overall condition of the hotel is very good; old world charm yet up to date amenities.  The price was an excellent value.  The location is in a transition area of San Fracisco so best to use cabs or public transportation to and from the hotel.

review.title: This hotel DOES NOT deserve a 3 star rating!!!
review.reviewText: I was very disappointed with this hotel. Our room was small, dirty, old, shabby, and just plain unpleasant.  The showerhead had a hole in the tiles that we stuffed with a towel b/c it was just plain scary and the sink was about the size of a soup bowl.  We stayed for 3 nights and on our last day at the hotel - it ran out of towels!!! How is that possible?  I would never stay here again!

review.title: Comfort on a dime
review.reviewText: Right at City Hall, here's a comfortable room with few frills. Starbucks (with the only high-speed internet) and a good restaurant in the lobby. Friendly staff. Kicking back in the lobby, you can imagine it's the 1930s. Market Street could SO easily be cleaned up (a lot of XXX stuff around) if only SF would get its act together.

review.title: Would not return
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a somewhat "bad" part of town.  Would not want to walk outside of the hotel at night.  Elevators broke during stay, no in-room high speed internet service however there is a low-cost internet cafe in the hotel lobby. While the rooms were very small they were clean with good maid and room service.  Hotel food was on the plus side and there is a Starbucks in the hotel lobby. Not a long walk to the financial and shopping districts.

review.title: OK, but not great.
review.reviewText: Bed spread was dirty, but room was nice. Maintenance staff was helpful and friendly, front desk could use some personality (a smile would have been nice). Location isn't really so good, it is a long and unsafe (at night) walk to Moscone Center or Union Station. Parking is expensive was $30 per night when I stayed in Jan. 2005.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Photos on Expedia suggested a classy hotel, but in reality, the Ramada Plaza Downtown was a rundown hotel that used to be nice.  Also not in the best neighborhood, but very convenient to public transportation with BART stop just in front of the hotel.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText:
I had a conference at the Moscone center, and it was just 15 mins walk away.  We had a problem with the room the first night because we were right next to a remodeling area, and work started at 8am.  We asked to change a room, and we got upgraded to a better suite at a higher floor.

I really liked this hotel, and I am planning to go back.  Great interior.

review.title: A Wonderful Surprise!
review.reviewText:
I was very pleasantly surprised when I stayed at the Ramada Plaza downtown. There were mixed reviews on the Expedia site, but I was really pleased with the courteous staff, the beautiful lobby area and the room. The room was very clean, and although i didn't have much of a view (the other side of the hotel...!), it was very comfortable and the rate was very, very reasonable. Now I will admit as a leisure traveller I don't hang out in my room much, and my expectations are pretty reasonable - I like a clean room, a good location and helpful staff if i have questions about the city or surroundings etc.  PLUS, the fact that there was a Muni/BART station entrance right outside the front of the hotel made getting around so easy - I was basically in the heart of downtown, it made getting to the Castro, SOMA, Civic Center area and other points of interest so easy to get to!  (PS It rained all weekend so the MUNI/BART station entrance outside the hotel was a GREAT convenience!) 

I go to San Francisco once or twice a year and have stayed at some of the boutique hotels which were very nice.  However, for the rate, location, cleanliness of the room and service, I would highly recommend the hotel and plan to stay there again.

review.title: Quietest Clean Hotel For All Your Needs!
review.reviewText:
This is a really large hotel - but - without a doubt the quietest place I've stayed in a very long time! The prices were very low for a hotel that is 3 long blocks from the great shopping of the Union Square area - or one BART stop!
The Bart station is directly out the door of the hotel! There is also a Starbucks with an entrance in the hotel lobby! Easy to use business center, with internet access for a fee. Friendly staff, large rooms! The bathrooms are small - and you should make sure the heat works before you unpack! All in all a great value!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and the bonus of a Starbucks almost makes it perfect.  It is centrally located to the theatres and within walking distance to Union Square.  Room service was delicious.

Although the room was pleasant, the heat didn't work that well and the bathroom was very, very small.  There was no counter to the sink and it was nearly impossible to just wash your face.  Also I had to wipe up some residual mildew from the shower.

review.title: Small Room
review.reviewText: Rooms very old and small, bathroom very small

review.title: Room had high ceilings yet was small and narrow
review.reviewText:
Room had high ceilings yet was small and narrow... It seemed odd. And bathroom was not very clean and seemed more "utilitarian" as someone else put it.

Not really that nice in my opinion.

review.title: Ok for the price
review.reviewText: Even though we were given a non-smoking room, it reeked of smoke. The location was convenient, though not an attractive or quiet neighborhood (watch out for the agressive panhandling), and very few places to get a meal nearby. Still, not a bad place if you're looking for a downtown hotel at a low price.

review.title: Nice Hotel -- Bad Neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was very nice.  Staff very helpful.  However, it was not in a good neighborhood.  Its just south of Tenderloin.  Not a safe or convienent location.

review.title: So so...
review.reviewText:
Only 2 things to rave about...
The BART (underground train) located just outside the hotel's maindoor which you can get a direct route to the airport, and almost 24 hours Starbucks next to the hotel. Too bad there are too many homeless loitering on the streets near the hotel.

review.title: Scared in San Fransico
review.reviewText: I am a women that traveled by herself and this hotel is in a very bad part of San Fransico, I felt like I couldn't even walk across the street for a cup of coffee safely, trash, bum's, and panhandlers right in front of hotel.  I am so disappointed in expedia for even offering this as one of there hotel choices.  I will not be using expedia in the future for travel booking if I can't trust that the hotels listed are safe, as well as clean nice rooms.  This hotel had a 3 star rating and doesn't deserve more than a 1 star. Stay away if you value your safety!

review.title: Ramada plaza, San Fransisco
review.reviewText: During my mothers stay at this hotel,the manager was very rude, the staff was very obnnoxious. I requested two beds and the room only had one. The staff switched them rooms rather than clean to their expectations. They were there four days and the room only got cleaned one other time besides when they switched rooms. And on top of all that, even though they stayed in the hotel, they still got charged $35.00 a day to park their rental car on their property..

review.title: Ramada Plaza Downtown/Market St., San Francisco
review.reviewText: The service was impeccable and it was great having parking available behind the hotel.  It was also such a convenience to have access to BART just outside the hotel and the bus a few blocks up the street to get to the 49er game.

review.title: Ramada Inn for Business Only Stay
review.reviewText: This was a business stay. Starbucks located in the lobby so easy access morning java! Only problem is there are a bunch of run down looking strip clubs just up the street so walking around at night may be a little scary for some. Had some problmes with the key card system for my door and had to get help and they still did not really fix the problem, had to swipe my card many times before getting into room. Room small but clean. Ok for quick trips.

review.title: Nice hotel, okay location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel, especially because there was a Starbucks Coffee located in the lobby. It's a bit of a walk to the cable cars, and the walk is a little sketchy at night. We took a cab the 6-7 blocks a couple of times. The hotel staff was very helpful and our room was pretty nice.

review.title: Great price, not the best location
review.reviewText: This hotels location on Market is close to Union Square and the major shopping areas. If you are looking for something close to Fisherman's Wharf or any other area, I would not reccomend this hotel. After dark there were a lot of homeless outside of, and around this property. It is a beautiful building with spacious rooms, but they are sparsely furnished. The bathrooms were very utilitarian, but the room did boast a huge, walk in closet. I would stay here again only if I was going to rent a car. Cab rides to virtually anywhere in town is $10+.

review.title: Don't forget the towels.
review.reviewText:
Although we liked out hotel, we had a major issue with the towels.  First their were not enough and when we asked for more we received predominately hand towels.  Second the towels looked very well used.  Several had holes in them.  

Otherwise, the hotel itself has a nice old time charm.

review.title: Ramada Plaza Hotel Market Street San Francisco, CA
review.reviewText: A/C worked when it wanted too.  Room was small and did not represent a good value for the money.  Best thing about this Hotel was the location but there are plenty of others within blocks.  I would not ever stay here again.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, excellent price
review.reviewText: The lobby is gorgeous with marble and dark wood.  The rooms are very pretty, with embroidered bedspreads and curtains and leather bound lamps.  I plan to stay there every time I visit SF.  There's also a good restaurant and a Starbucks in the lobby, and the hotel is in front of a BART station so you don't have to take a shuttle from the airport.
